Doc: The definition of the Abnormality of body height is that Deviation from the norm of height with respect to that which is expected according to age and gender norms.

The definition of the Multicystic kidney dysplasia is that Multicystic dysplasia of the kidney is characterized by multiple cysts of varying size in the kidney and the absence of a normal pelvicaliceal system. The condition is associated with ureteral or ureteropelvic atresia, and the affected kidney is nonfunctional.
The definition of the Abnormality of female internal genitalia is that An abnormality of the female internal genitalia.
The definition of the Functional abnormality of the bladder is that Dysfunction of the urinary bladder.
The definition of the Recurrent urinary tract infections is that Repeated infections of the urinary tract.

The definition of the Neurogenic bladder is that A type of bladder dysfunction caused by neurologic damage. Neurogenic bladder can be flaccid or spastic. Common manifestatios of neurogenic bladder are overflow incontinence, frequency, urgency, urge incontinence, and retention.
The definition of the Urinary urgency is that Urge incontinence is the strong, sudden need to urinate.
The definition of the Hypoplasia of the uterus is that Underdevelopment of the uterus.
The definition of the Abnormality of the bladder is that An abnormality of the urinary bladder.
The definition of the Bladder diverticulum is that Diverticulum (sac or pouch) in the wall of the urinary bladder.
The definition of the Urinary retention is that Inability to completely empty the urinary bladder during the process of urination.
The definition of the Nocturia is that Abnormally increased production of urine during the night leading to an unusually frequent need to urinate.
The definition of the Urinary hesitancy is that Difficulty in beginning the process of urination.
The definition of the Urinary incontinence is that Loss of the ability to control the urinary bladder leading to involuntary urination.
The definition of the Megacystis is that Dilatation of the bladder postnatally.
The definition of the Abnormality of male internal genitalia is that An abnormality of the male internal genitalia.
The definition of the Inguinal hernia is that Protrusion of the contents of the abdominal cavity through the inguinal canal.
The definition of the Prostatitis is that The presence of inflammation of the prostate.
The definition of the Male hypogonadism is that Decreased functionality of the male gonad, i.e., of the testis, with reduced spermatogenesis or testosterone synthesis.
The definition of the Azoospermia is that Absence of any measurable level of sperm,whereby spermatozoa cannot be observed even after centrifugation of the semen pellet.

The definition of the Cryptorchidism is that Testis in inguinal canal. That is, absence of one or both testes from the scrotum owing to failure of the testis or testes to descend through the inguinal canal to the scrotum.
The definition of the Testicular atrophy is that Wasting (atrophy) of the testicle (the male gonad) manifested by a decrease in size and potentially by a loss of fertility.
The definition of the Testicular gonadoblastoma is that The presence of a gonadoblastoma of the testis.
The definition of the Epididymitis is that The presence of inflammation of the epididymis.
The definition of the Abnormality of male external genitalia is that An abnormality of male external genitalia.
The definition of the Ambiguous genitalia, male is that Ambiguous genitalia in an individual with XY genetic gender.

The definition of the Hydrocele testis is that A type of hydrocele testis in which the processus vaginalis remains patent only around the testes, and, as fluid accumulates, it renders the testes impalpable. [PMID:32644551]
The definition of the Abnormality of the testis is that An anomaly of the testicle (the male gonad).

The definition of the Male pseudohermaphroditism is that Hermaphroditism refers to a discrepancy between the morphology of the gonads and that of the external genitalia. In male pseudohermaphroditism, the genotype is male (XY) and the external genitalia are imcompletely virilized, ambiguous, or complete female. If gonads are present, they are testes.

The definition of the Epispadias is that Epispadias is a urogenital malformation characterized by the failure of the urethral tube to tubularize on the dorsal aspect. Unlike in hypospadias, where the meatus is on the ventral aspect, children with epispadias have a wide-open urethral plate on the dorsum. It is commonly seen as a component in the spectrum of bladder exstrophy-epispadias-complex. Isolated epispadias constitutes less than 10 percent of the total cases of epispadias.
The definition of the Chordee is that Ventral, lateral, or ventrolateral bowing of the shaft and glans penis of more than 30 degrees.
The definition of the Absent external genitalia is that Lack of external genitalia in a male or female individual.

The definition of the Hypogonadotrophic hypogonadism is that Hypogonadotropic hypogonadism is characterized by reduced function of the gonads (testes in males or ovaries in females) and results from the absence of the gonadal stimulating pituitary hormones: follicle stimulating hormone (FSH) and luteinizing hormone (LH).

The definition of the Hypospadias is that Abnormal position of urethral meatus on the ventral penile shaft (underside) characterized by displacement of the urethral meatus from the tip of the glans penis to the ventral surface of the penis, scrotum, or perineum.
The definition of the Bifid scrotum is that Midline indentation or cleft of the scrotum.
The definition of the Shawl scrotum is that Superior margin of the scrotum superior to the base of the penis.
The definition of the Hypoplastic male external genitalia is that Underdevelopment of part or all of the male external reproductive organs (which include the penis, the scrotum and the urethra).
The definition of the Perineal hypospadias is that Hypospadias with location of the urethral meatus in the perineal region.
The definition of the Urethral atresia, male is that Congenital anomaly characterized by closure or failure to develop an opening in the urethra in males.
The definition of the Macroorchidism is that The presence of abnormally large testes.
The definition of the Micropenis is that Abnormally small penis. At birth, the normal penis is about 3 cm (stretched length from pubic tubercle to tip of penis) with micropenis less than 2.0-2.5 cm.
The definition of the Abnormality of female external genitalia is that An abnormality of the female external genitalia.
The definition of the Abnormality of the clitoris is that An abnormality of the clitoris.
The definition of the Abnormality of the labia is that An anomaly of the labia, the externally visible portions of the vulva.
The definition of the Hypoplastic labia majora is that Undergrowth of the outer labia.
The definition of the Clitoral hypoplasia is that Developmental hypoplasia of the clitoris.
The definition of the Ambiguous genitalia, female is that Ambiguous genitalia in an individual with XX genetic gender.

The definition of the Ambiguous genitalia is that A genital phenotype that is not clearly assignable to a single gender. Ambiguous genitalia can be evaluated using the Prader scale: Prader 0: Normal female external genitalia. Prader 1: Female external genitalia with clitoromegaly. Prader 2: Clitoromegaly with partial labial fusion forming a funnel-shaped urogenital sinus. Prader 3: Increased phallic enlargement. Complete labioscrotal fusion forming a urogenital sinus with a single opening. Prader 4: Complete scrotal fusion with urogenital opening at the base or on the shaft of the phallus. Prader 5: Normal male external genitalia. The diagnosis of ambiguous genitalia is made for Prader 1-4.
The definition of the Fused labia minora is that Fusion of the labia minora as a result of labial adhesions resulting in vaginal obstruction.
The definition of the Urethral atresia, female is that Congenital anomaly characterized by closure or failure to develop an opening in the urethra in females.
The definition of the Urethral atresia is that Congenital anomaly characterized by closure or failure to develop an opening in the urethra.
The definition of the Abnormality of the ureter is that An abnormality of the ureter. The ureter is the duct by which urine passes from the kidney to the bladder.
The definition of the Ureterocele is that A ureterocele is a congenital saccular dilatation of the distal segment of the ureter. [eMedicine:453993]
The definition of the Ureteral stenosis is that The presence of a stenotic, i.e., constricted ureter.
The definition of the Hydroureter is that The distention of the ureter with urine.
The definition of the Ureteral duplication is that A developmental anomaly characterized by the presence of two, instead of one, ureter connecting a kidney to the bladder.
The definition of the Ureteropelvic junction obstruction is that Blockage of urine flow from the renal pelvis to the proximal ureter. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:Eurenomics_ewuehl]
The definition of the Renal duplication is that A congenital anomaly of the urinary tract, in which the kidney is duplicated and is drained via two separate renal pelves and ureters.

The definition of the Vesicoureteral reflux is that Abnormal (retrograde) movement of urine from the bladder into ureters or kidneys related to inadequacy of the valvular mechanism at the ureterovesicular junction or other causes.
The definition of the Abnormality of the kidney is that An abnormality of the kidney.
The definition of the Abnormality of the genital system is that An abnormality of the genital system.
The definition of the Abnormality of the urinary system is that An abnormality of the urinary system.
The definition of the Abnormality of genital physiology is that An abnormal functionality of the genital system.

The definition of the Duplicated collecting system is that A duplication of the collecting system of the kidney, defined as a kidney with two (instead of, normally, one) pyelocaliceal systems. The pyelocaliceal system is comprised of the renal pelvis and calices. The duplicated renal collecting system can be associated with a single ureter or with double ureters. In the latter case, the two ureters empty separately into the bladder or fuse to form a single ureteral orifice.

The definition of the Renal insufficiency is that A reduction in the level of performance of the kidneys in areas of function comprising the concentration of urine, removal of wastes, the maintenance of electrolyte balance, homeostasis of blood pressure, and calcium metabolism.
The definition of the Horseshoe kidney is that A connection of the right and left kidney by an isthmus of functioning renal parenchyma or fibrous tissue that crosses the midline.
The definition of the Ectopic kidney is that A developmental defect in which a kidney is located in an abnormal anatomic position.
The definition of the Renal hypoplasia is that Hypoplasia of the kidney.
The definition of the Nephronophthisis is that The presence of many cysts in the medulla of the kidney. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:Eurenomics_ewuehl]
The definition of the Abnormality of the renal tubule is that An abnormality of the renal tubules.

The definition of the Tubular atrophy is that The presence of renal tubules with thick redundant basement membranes, or a reduction of greater than 50% in tubular diameter compared to surrounding non-atrophic tubules.
The definition of the Proteinuria is that Increased levels of protein in the urine.
The definition of the Abnormality of the glomerulus is that A structural anomaly of the glomerulus. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:Eurenomics_ewuehl, PMID:18184729]
The definition of the Glomerulosclerosis is that Accumulation of scar tissue within the glomerulus. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:Eurenomics_fschaefer]
The definition of the Focal segmental glomerulosclerosis is that Segmental accumulation of scar tissue in individual (but not all) glomeruli. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:Eurenomics_fschaefer, PMID:16164633]
The definition of the Tall stature is that A height above that which is expected according to age and gender norms.
The definition of the Glomerulonephritis is that Inflammation of the renal glomeruli.

The definition of the Nephrotic syndrome is that Nephrotic syndrome is a collection of findings resulting from glomerular dysfunction with an increase in glomerular capillary wall permeability associated with pronounced proteinuria. Nephrotic syndrome refers to the constellation of clinical findings that result from severe renal loss of protein, with Proteinuria and hypoalbuminemia, edema, and hyperlipidemia.
The definition of the Polyuria is that An increased rate of urine production.
The definition of the Renal agenesis is that Agenesis, that is, failure of the kidney to develop during embryogenesis and development.
The definition of the Enlarged kidneys is that An abnormal increase in the size of the kidney.
The definition of the Renal cyst is that A fluid filled sac in the kidney. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:Eurenomics_fschaefer]
The definition of the Renal corticomedullary cysts is that The presence of multiple cysts at the border between the renal cortex and medulla.
The definition of the Renal dysplasia is that The presence of developmental dysplasia of the kidney.
The definition of the Renal juxtaglomerular cell hypertrophy/hyperplasia is that Increased number and size of the juxtaglomerular cells. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:Eurenomics_ewuehl]
The definition of the Nephropathy is that A nonspecific term referring to disease or damage of the kidneys.
The definition of the Polycystic kidney dysplasia is that The presence of multiple cysts in both kidneys.

The definition of the Proximal tubulopathy is that Dysfunction of the proximal tubule, which is the portion of the duct system of the nephron of the kidney which leads from Bowman's capsule to the loop of Henle.
The definition of the Renal phosphate wasting is that High urine phosphate in the presence of hypophosphatemia.
The definition of the Abnormality of the genitourinary system is that The presence of any abnormality of the genitourinary system.
The definition of the Nephrocalcinosis is that Nephrocalcinosis is the deposition of calcium salts in renal parenchyma.
The definition of the Unilateral renal agenesis is that A unilateral form of agenesis of the kidney.
The definition of the Nephritis is that The presence of inflammation affecting the kidney.
The definition of the Pelvic kidney is that A developmental defect in which a kidney is located in an abnormal anatomic position within the pelvis.
The definition of the Hydronephrosis is that Severe distention of the kidney with dilation of the renal pelvis and calices.

The definition of the Renal salt wasting is that A high concentration of one or more electrolytes in the urine in the presence of low serum concentrations of the electrolyte(s). [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:Eurenomics_fschaefer]
The definition of the Renal potassium wasting is that High urine potassium in the presence of hypokalemia.
The definition of the Abnormality of the uterus is that An abnormality of the uterus.
The definition of the Uterine leiomyoma is that The presence of a leiomyoma of the uterus.
The definition of the Menorrhagia is that Prolonged and excessive menses at regular intervals in excess of 80 mL or lasting longer than 7 days.
The definition of the Female hypogonadism is that Decreased functionality of the female gonads, i.e., of the ovary.
The definition of the Hypogonadism is that A decreased functionality of the gonad.
The definition of the Bifid uterus is that The presence of a bifid uterus.
The definition of the Abnormality of the ovary is that An abnormality of the ovary.
The definition of the Ovarian cyst is that The presence of one or more cysts of the ovary.
The definition of the Uterine prolapse is that The presence of prolapse of the uterus.
The definition of the Abnormality of the menstrual cycle is that An abnormality of the ovulation cycle.
The definition of the Abnormality of the vagina is that Any structural abnormality of the vagina.
The definition of the Rectovaginal fistula is that The presence of a fistula between the vagina and the rectum.
The definition of the Vaginal atresia is that Aplasia of the vagina.
The definition of the Ovarian gonadoblastoma is that The presence of a gonadoblastoma of the ovary. [eMedicine:986581, https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199]
The definition of the Gonadoblastoma is that The presence of a gonadoblastoma, a neoplasm of a gonad that consists of aggregates of germ cells and sex cord elements.
The definition of the aplasia of the uterus is that Aplasia of the uterus.
The definition of the Abnormality of head and neck is that An abnormality of head and neck.
The definition of the Abnormality of the mouth is that An abnormality of the mouth.

The definition of the Wide mouth is that Distance between the oral commissures more than 2 SD above the mean. Alternatively, an apparently increased width of the oral aperture (subjective). [PMID:19125428]
The definition of the Oral ulcer is that Erosion of the mucous mebrane of the mouth with local excavation of the surface, resulting from the sloughing of inflammatory necrotic tissue.
The definition of the Abnormality of the tongue is that Any abnormality of the tongue.
The definition of the Macroglossia is that Increased length and width of the tongue. [PMID:19125428]
The definition of the Abnormality of the lip is that An abnormality of the lip.

The definition of the Narrow mouth is that Distance between the commissures of the mouth more than 2 SD below the mean. Alternatively, an apparently decreased width of the oral aperture (subjective). [PMID:19125428]
The definition of the Median cleft lip is that A type of cleft lip presenting as a midline (median) gap in the upper lip.
The definition of the Glossoptosis is that Posterior displacement of the tongue into the pharynx, i.e., a tongue that is mislocalised posteriorly.
The definition of the Abnormality of the oral cavity is that Abnormality of the oral cavity, i.e., the opening or hollow part of the mouth.
The definition of the Abnormality of the teeth is that Any abnormality of the teeth.
The definition of the Severe periodontitis is that A severe form of periodontitis.
The definition of the Abnormality of the gingiva is that Any abnormality of the gingiva (also known as gums).
The definition of the Gingival fibromatosis is that The presence of fibrosis of the gingiva.
The definition of the Microglossia is that Decreased length and width of the tongue. [PMID:19125428]
The definition of the Abnormality of the uvula is that Abnormality of the uvula, the conic projection from the posterior edge of the middle of the soft palate.
The definition of the Abnormality of the palate is that Any abnormality of the palate, i.e., of roof of the mouth.

The definition of the Cleft palate is that Cleft palate is a developmental defect of the palate resulting from a failure of fusion of the palatine processes and manifesting as a separation of the roof of the mouth (soft and hard palate).

The definition of the Submucous cleft hard palate is that Hard-palate submucous clefts are characterized by bony defects in the midline of the bony palate that are covered by the mucous membrane of the roof of the mouth. It may be possible to detect a submucous cleft hard palate upon palpation as a notch in the bony palate.
The definition of the Abnormality of upper lip is that An abnormality of the upper lip.
The definition of the Abnormality of lower lip is that An abnormality of the lower lip.

The definition of the Thick lower lip vermilion is that Increased thickness of the lower lip, leading to a prominent appearance of the lower lip. The height of the vermilion of the lower lip in the midline is more than 2 SD above the mean. Alternatively, an apparently increased height of the vermilion of the lower lip in the frontal view (subjective).
The definition of the Lobulated tongue is that Multiple indentations and/or elevations on the edge and/or surface of the tongue producing an irregular surface contour. [PMID:19125428]

The definition of the Cleft soft palate is that Cleft of the soft palate (also known as the velum, or muscular palate) as a result of a developmental defect occurring between the 7th and 12th week of pregnancy. Cleft soft palate can cause functional abnormalities of the Eustachian tube with resulting middle ear anomalies and hearing difficulties, as well as speech problems associated with hypernasal speech due to velopharyngeal insufficiency.
The definition of the Short upper lip is that Decreased width of the upper lip.
The definition of the Narrow palate is that Width of the palate more than 2 SD below the mean (objective) or apparently decreased palatal width (subjective). [PMID:19125428]

The definition of the Abnormality of oral frenula is that An abnormality of the lingual frenulum, that is of the small fold of mucous membrane that attaches the tongue to the floor of the mouth, or the presence of accessory frenula in the oral cavity.
The definition of the Accessory oral frenulum is that Extra fold of tissue extending from the alveolar ridge to the inner surface of the upper or lower lip. [PMID:19125428]
The definition of the Bifid uvula is that Uvula separated into two parts most easily seen at the tip. [PMID:19125428]
The definition of the Lower lip pit is that Depression located on the vermilion of the lower lip, usually paramedian.

The definition of the Abnormality of parotid gland is that Any abnormality of the parotid glands, which are the salivary glands that are located in the subcutaneous tissues of the face overlying the mandibular ramus and anterior and inferior to the external ear.
The definition of the Short lingual frenulum is that The presence of an abnormally short lingual frenulum.

The definition of the Pierre-Robin sequence is that Pierre Robin malformation is a sequence of developmental malformations characterized by micrognathia (mandibular hypoplasia), glossoptosis and cleft palate.

The definition of the Oral cleft is that The presence of a cleft in the oral cavity, the two main types of which are cleft lip and cleft palate. In cleft lip, there is the congenital failure of the maxillary and median nasal processes to fuse, forming a groove or fissure in the lip. In cleft palate, there is a congenital failure of the palate to fuse properly, forming a grooved depression or fissure in the roof of the mouth. Clefts of the lip and palate can occur individually or together. It is preferable to code each defect separately.
The definition of the Cleft upper lip is that A gap in the upper lip. This is a congenital defect resulting from nonfusion of tissues of the lip during embryonal development.
The definition of the Pursed lips is that An abnormality of the appearance of the face caused by constant contraction of the lips leading to a puckered or pursed appearance.
The definition of the Glossitis is that Inflammation of the tongue.
The definition of the Triangular mouth is that The presence of a triangular form of the mouth.
The definition of the Trismus is that Limitation in the ability to open the mouth.

The definition of the Gingival overgrowth is that Hyperplasia of the gingiva (that is, a thickening of the soft tissue overlying the alveolar ridge. The degree of thickening ranges from involvement of the interdental papillae alone to gingival overgrowth covering the entire tooth crown. [PMID:19125428]
The definition of the Lip telangiectasia is that Telangiectasia (that is, the presence of small dilated superficial blood vessels) of the lips.

The definition of the Thick upper lip vermilion is that Height of the vermilion of the upper lip in the midline more than 2 SD above the mean. Alternatively, an apparently increased height of the vermilion of the upper lip in the frontal view (subjective). [PMID:19125428]
The definition of the Xerostomia is that Dryness of the mouth due to salivary gland dysfunction.

The definition of the High palate is that Height of the palate more than 2 SD above the mean (objective) or palatal height at the level of the first permanent molar more than twice the height of the teeth (subjective). [PMID:19125428]

The definition of the Thin upper lip vermilion is that Height of the vermilion of the upper lip in the midline more than 2 SD below the mean. Alternatively, an apparently reduced height of the vermilion of the upper lip in the frontal view (subjective). [PMID:19125428]

The definition of the Velopharyngeal insufficiency is that Inability of velopharyngeal sphincter to sufficiently separate the nasal cavity from the oral cavity during speech. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_jhurst]
The definition of the Furrowed tongue is that Accentuation of the grooves on the dorsal surface of the tongue. [PMID:19125428]
The definition of the Gingival hyperkeratosis is that Hyperkeratosis of the gingiva.
The definition of the Decreased taste sensation is that A decreased ability to perceive flavor. []
The definition of the Gingival bleeding is that Hemorrhage affecting the gingiva.
The definition of the Tongue telangiectasia is that Telangiectasia (that is, the presence of small dilated superficial blood vessels) of the tongue.
The definition of the Oral cavity teleangiectasia is that Presence of telangiectases in the oral cavity.
The definition of the Gingivitis is that Inflammation of the gingiva.

The definition of the Everted lower lip vermilion is that An abnormal configuration of the lower lip such that it is turned outward i.e., everted, with the Inner aspect of the lower lip vermilion (normally opposing the teeth) being visible in a frontal view. [PMID:19125428]

The definition of the Thin vermilion border is that Height of the vermilion of the medial part of the lip more than 2 SD below the mean, or apparently reduced height of the vermilion of the lip in the frontal view. The vermilion is the red part of the lips (and confusingly, the vermilion itself is also often referred to as being equivalent the lips).
The definition of the Abnormality of the head is that An abnormality of the head.

The definition of the Abnormality of the fontanelles and cranial sutures is that Any abnormality of the fontanelles (the regions covered by a thick membrane that normally ossify in the first two years of life) or the cranial sutures (the fibrous joints in which the articulating bones or cartilages of the skull are connected by sutural ligaments).

The definition of the Abnormality of the anterior fontanelle is that An abnormality of the anterior fontanelle, i.e., the cranial fontanelle that is located at the intersection of the coronal and sagittal sutures.

The definition of the Hydrocephalus is that Hydrocephalus is an active distension of the ventricular system of the brain resulting from inadequate passage of CSF from its point of production within the cerebral ventricles to its point of absorption into the systemic circulation.

The definition of the Large fontanelles is that In newborns, the two frontal bones, two parietal bones, and one occipital bone are joined by fibrous sutures, which form a small posterior fontanelle, and a larger, diamond-shaped anterior fontanelle. These regions allow for the skull to pass the birth canal and for later growth. The fontanelles gradually ossify, whereby the posterior fontanelle usually closes by eight weeks and the anterior fontanelle by the 9th to 16th month of age. Large fontanelles are diagnosed if the fontanelles are larger than age-dependent norms.
The definition of the Abnormality of skull size is that Any abnormality of the size of the skull.
The definition of the Parietal bossing is that Parietal bossing is a marked prominence in the parietal region.

The definition of the Trigonocephaly is that Wedge-shaped, or triangular head, with the apex of the triangle at the midline of the forehead and the base of the triangle at the occiput. [PMID:19125436]

The definition of the Brachyturricephaly is that Abnormal vertical height of the skull and a shortening of its anterior-posterior length, frequently combined with malformations of the occipital region. [PMID:8460563]

The definition of the Abnormality of the sinuses is that Abnormality of the paranasal (cranial) sinuses, which are air-filled spaces that are located within the bones of the skull and face and communicate with the nasal cavity. They comprise the maxillary sinuses, the frontal sinuses, the ethmoid sinuses, and the sphenoid sinuses.
The definition of the Sinusitis is that Inflammation of the paranasal sinuses owing to a viral, bacterial, or fungal infection, allergy, or an autoimmune reaction.

The definition of the Brachycephaly is that An abnormality of skull shape characterized by a decreased anterior-posterior diameter. That is, a cephalic index greater than 81%. Alternatively, an apparently shortened anteroposterior dimension (length) of the head compared to width.
The definition of the Dense calvaria is that An abnormal increase of density of the bones making up the calvaria.
The definition of the Microcephaly is that Head circumference below 2 standard deviations below the mean for age and gender. [PMID:15806441, PMID:19125436, PMID:25465325, PMID:9683597]
The definition of the Progressive microcephaly is that Progressive microcephaly is diagnosed when the head circumference falls progressively behind age- and gender-dependent norms.
The definition of the Acute sinusitis is that An acute form of sinusitis.

The definition of the Macrocephaly is that Occipitofrontal (head) circumference greater than 97th centile compared to appropriate, age matched, sex-matched normal standards. Alternatively, a apparently increased size of the cranium. [PMID:19125436]
The definition of the Wide anterior fontanel is that Enlargement of the anterior fontanelle with respect to age-dependent norms.
The definition of the Turricephaly is that Tall head relative to width and length. [PMID:19125436]
The definition of the Oxycephaly is that Oxycephaly (from Greek oxus, sharp, and kephalos, head) refers to a conical or pointed shape of the skull.

The definition of the Abnormality of the mastoid is that An abnormality of the mastoid process, which is the conical prominence projecting from the undersurface of the mastoid portion of the temporal bone.

The definition of the Dolichocephaly is that An abnormality of skull shape characterized by a increased anterior-posterior diameter, i.e., an increased antero-posterior dimension of the skull. Cephalic index less than 76%. Alternatively, an apparently increased antero-posterior length of the head compared to width. Often due to premature closure of the sagittal suture.
The definition of the Prominent occiput is that Increased convexity of the occiput (posterior part of the skull). [PMID:19125436]

The definition of the Delayed cranial suture closure is that Infants normally have two fontanels at birth, the diamond-shaped anterior fontanelle at the junction of the coronal and sagittal sutures, and the posterior fontanelle at the intersection of the occipital and parietal bones. The posterior fontanelle usually closes by the 8th week of life, and the anterior fontanel closes by the 18th month of life on average. This term applies if there is delay of closure of the fontanelles beyond the normal age.
The definition of the Abnormality of the face is that An abnormality of the face.
The definition of the Malar flattening is that Underdevelopment of the malar prominence of the jugal bone (zygomatic bone in mammals), appreciated in profile, frontal view, and/or by palpation.
The definition of the Small face is that A face that is short and narrow.

The definition of the Narrow face is that Bizygomatic (upper face) and bigonial (lower face) width are both more than 2 standard deviations below the mean (objective); or, an apparent reduction in the width of the upper and lower face (subjective). [PMID:19125436]

The definition of the Long face is that Facial height (length) is more than 2 standard deviations above the mean (objective); or, an apparent increase in the height (length) of the face (subjective). [PMID:19125436]
The definition of the Abnormality of the mandible is that Any abnormality of the mandible, the bone of the lower jaw.
The definition of the Retrognathia is that An abnormality in which the mandible is mislocalised posteriorly.

The definition of the Coarse facial features is that Absence of fine and sharp appearance of brows, nose, lips, mouth, and chin, usually because of rounded and heavy features or thickened skin with or without thickening of subcutaneous and bony tissues. [PMID:19125436]

The definition of the Broad face is that Bizygomatic (upper face) and bigonial (lower face) width greater than 2 standard deviations above the mean (objective); or an apparent increase in the width of the face (subjective). [PMID:19125436]
The definition of the Epicanthus is that A fold of skin starting above the medial aspect of the upper eyelid and arching downward to cover, pass in front of and lateral to the medial canthus.
The definition of the Increased facial adipose tissue is that An increased amount of subcutaneous fat tissue in the face.
The definition of the Abnormality of the philtrum is that An abnormality of the philtrum.

The definition of the Broad philtrum is that Distance between the philtral ridges, measured just above the vermilion border, more than 2 standard deviations above the mean, or alternatively, an apparently increased distance between the ridges of the philtrum. [PMID:19152422]
The definition of the Abnormality of the forehead is that An anomaly of the forehead.
The definition of the Loss of facial adipose tissue is that Loss of normal subcutaneous fat tissue in the face.
The definition of the Full cheeks is that Increased prominence or roundness of soft tissues between zygomata and mandible.

The definition of the Low anterior hairline is that Distance between the hairline (trichion) and the glabella (the most prominent point on the frontal bone above the root of the nose), in the midline, more than two SD below the mean. Alternatively, an apparently decreased distance between the hairline and the glabella. [PMID:19125436]
The definition of the Doll-like facies is that A characteristic facial appearance with a round facial form, full cheeks, a short nose, and a relatively small chin.
The definition of the Facial hypotonia is that Reduced muscle tone of a muscle that is innervated by the facial nerve (the seventh cranial nerve).
The definition of the Mask-like facies is that A lack of facial expression often with staring eyes and a slightly open mouth.
The definition of the Oval face is that A face with a rounded and slightly elongated outline.
The definition of the Abnormality of facial musculature is that An anomaly of a muscle that is innervated by the facial nerve (the seventh cranial nerve).
The definition of the Mandibular prognathia is that Abnormal prominence of the chin related to increased length of the mandible.

The definition of the Abnormality of the chin is that An abnormality of the chin, i.e., of the inferior portion of the face lying inferior to the lower lip and including the central prominence of the lower jaw.
The definition of the Pointed chin is that A marked tapering of the lower face to the chin. [PMID:19125436]
The definition of the Microretrognathia is that A form of developmental hypoplasia of the mandible in which the mandible is mislocalised posteriorly.

The definition of the Abnormality of the midface is that An anomaly of the midface, which is a region and not an anatomical term. It extends, superiorly, from the inferior orbital margin to, inferiorly, the level of nasal base. It is formed by the maxilla (upper jaw) and zygoma and cheeks and malar region. Traditionally, the nose and premaxilla are not included in the midface.
The definition of the Round face is that The facial appearance is more circular than usual as viewed from the front. [PMID:19125436]

The definition of the Hypertelorism is that Interpupillary distance more than 2 SD above the mean (alternatively, the appearance of an increased interpupillary distance or widely spaced eyes). [PMID:19125427]
The definition of the Facial myokymia is that Facial myokymia is a fine fibrillary activity of one or more muscles innervated by the facial nerve (the seventh cranial nerve).
The definition of the Smooth philtrum is that Flat skin surface, with no ridge formation in the central region of the upper lip between the nasal base and upper vermilion border. [PMID:19152422]
The definition of the Square face is that Facial contours, as viewed from the front, show a broad upper face/cranium and lower face/mandible, creating a square appearance. [PMID:19125436]

The definition of the Short philtrum is that Distance between nasal base and midline upper lip vermilion border more than 2 SD below the mean. Alternatively, an apparently decreased distance between nasal base and midline upper lip vermilion border. [PMID:19152422]
The definition of the Facial asymmetry is that An abnormal difference between the left and right sides of the face.
The definition of the Triangular face is that Facial contour, as viewed from the front, triangular in shape, with breadth at the temples and tapering to a narrow chin.
The definition of the Abnormality of the maxilla is that An abnormality of the Maxilla (upper jaw bone).

The definition of the Hypoplasia of the maxilla is that Abnormally small dimension of the Maxilla. Usually creating a malocclusion or malalignment between the upper and lower teeth or resulting in a deficient amount of projection of the base of the nose and lower midface region.
The definition of the Facial hemangioma is that Hemangioma, a benign tumor of the vascular endothelial cells, occurring in the face.
The definition of the Short chin is that Decreased vertical distance from the vermilion border of the lower lip to the inferior-most point of the chin.
The definition of the Prominent supraorbital ridges is that Greater than average forward and/or lateral protrusion of the supraorbital portion of the frontal bones. [PMID:19125436]

The definition of the Broad forehead is that Width of the forehead or distance between the frontotemporales is more than two standard deviations above the mean (objective); or apparently increased distance between the two sides of the forehead. [PMID:19125436]
The definition of the Hypomimic face is that A reduced degree of motion of the muscles beneath the skin of the face, often associated with reduced facial crease formation.
The definition of the Pugilistic facies is that Coarse facial features reminiscent of those of a boxer.

The definition of the Sloping forehead is that Inclination of the anterior surface of the forehead from the vertical more than two standard deviations above the mean (objective); or apparently excessive posterior sloping of the forehead in a lateral view. [PMID:19125436]

The definition of the Narrow forehead is that Width of the forehead or distance between the frontotemporales is more than two standard deviations below the mean (objective); or apparently narrow intertemporal region (subjective). [PMID:19125436]

The definition of the Long philtrum is that Distance between nasal base and midline upper lip vermilion border more than 2 SD above the mean. Alternatively, an apparently increased distance between nasal base and midline upper lip vermilion border. [PMID:19152422]
The definition of the Whistling appearance is that An abnormality of facial morphology characterized by a small mouth opening and constant contraction of the lips as if the patient were whistling.
The definition of the Micrognathia is that Developmental hypoplasia of the mandible.
The definition of the High forehead is that An abnormally increased height of the forehead.
The definition of the Widow's peak is that Frontal hairline with bilateral arcs to a low point in the midline of the forehead. [PMID:19125436]
The definition of the Small forehead is that The presence of a forehead that is abnormally small.
The definition of the Abnormality of the outer ear is that A malformation of the auricle of the ear.
The definition of the Abnormal location of ears is that Abnormal location of the ear.

The definition of the Posteriorly rotated ears is that A type of abnormal location of the ears in which the position of the ears is characterized by posterior rotation (the superior part of the ears is rotated towards the back of the head, and the inferior part of the ears towards the front).
The definition of the Abnormality of the inner ear is that An abnormality of the inner ear.

The definition of the Tinnitus is that Tinnitus is an auditory perception that can be described as the experience of sound, in the ear or in the head, in the absence of external acoustic stimulation. []

The definition of the Otosclerosis is that In otosclerosis, a callus of bone accumulates on the stapes creating a partial fixation. This limits the movement of the stapes bone, which results in hearing loss.
The definition of the Abnormality of earlobe is that An abnormality of the lobule of pinna.
The definition of the Hearing abnormality is that An abnormality of the sensory perception of sound.
The definition of the Hearing impairment is that A decreased magnitude of the sensory perception of sound.
The definition of the Abnormality of the nose is that An abnormality of the nose.
The definition of the Low-set, posteriorly rotated ears is that Ears that are low-set and posteriorly rotated.
The definition of the Low-set ears is that Upper insertion of the ear to the scalp below an imaginary horizontal line drawn between the inner canthi of the eye and extending posteriorly to the ear.
The definition of the Abnormality of the middle ear is that An abnormality of the middle ear.
The definition of the Acute otitis media is that Acute otitis media is a short and generally painful infection of the middle ear.
The definition of the Abnormality of the auditory canal is that An abnormality of the External acoustic tube (also known as the auditory canal).
The definition of the Abnormality of cochlea is that An abnormality of the cochlea.

The definition of the Incomplete partition of the cochlea type II is that With incomplete partition II, the cochlea consists of 1.5 turns; the apical and middle cochlea turns are undifferentiated and form a cystic apex. The vestibule is normal while the vestibular aqueduct is always enlarged. Developmental arrest occurs at the seventh week of gestation.
The definition of the Abnormality of the pinna is that An abnormality of the pinna, which is also referred to as the auricle or external ear.
The definition of the Cupped ear is that Laterally protruding ear that lacks antihelical folding (including absence of inferior and superior crura).

The definition of the Stapes ankylosis is that Stapes ankylosis refers to congenital or acquired fixation of the stapes (the stirrup-shaped small bone or ossicle in the middle ear), which is associated with conductive hearing resulting from impairment of the sound-conduction mechanism (the external auditory canal, tympanic membrane, and/or middle-ear ossicles).

The definition of the Preauricular skin tag is that A rudimentary tag of skin often containing ear tissue including a core of cartilage and located just anterior to the auricle (outer part of the ear).
The definition of the Small earlobe is that Reduced volume of the earlobe.
The definition of the Absent earlobe is that Absence of fleshy non-cartilaginous tissue inferior to the tragus and incisura.
The definition of the Otitis media is that Inflammation or infection of the middle ear.
The definition of the Chronic otitis media is that Chronic otitis media refers to fluid, swelling, or infection of the middle ear that does not heal and may cause permanent damage to the ear.
The definition of the Thickened helices is that Increased thickness of the helix of the ear.
The definition of the Lop ear is that Anterior and inferior folding of the upper portion of the ear that obliterates triangular fossa and scapha.
The definition of the Prominent antihelix is that The presence of an abnormally prominent antihelix.

The definition of the Overfolded helix is that A condition in which the helix is folded over to a greater degree than normal. That is, excessive curling of the helix edge, whereby the free edge is parallel to the plane of the ear.
The definition of the Prelingual sensorineural hearing impairment is that A form of sensorineural deafness with either congenital onset or infantile onset, i.e., before the acquisition of speech.

The definition of the Macrotia is that Median longitudinal ear length greater than two standard deviations above the mean and median ear width greater than two standard deviations above the mean (objective); or, apparent increase in length and width of the pinna (subjective). [PMID:19152421]
The definition of the Stenosis of the external auditory canal is that An abnormal narrowing of the external auditory canal.
The definition of the Recurrent otitis media is that Increased susceptibility to otitis media, as manifested by recurrent episodes of otitis media.
The definition of the Conductive hearing impairment is that An abnormality of vibrational conductance of sound to the inner ear leading to impairment of sensory perception of sound.
The definition of the Sensorineural hearing impairment is that A type of hearing impairment in one or both ears related to an abnormal functionality of the cochlear nerve.
The definition of the Progressive sensorineural hearing impairment is that A progressive form of sensorineural hearing impairment.
The definition of the Mixed hearing impairment is that A type of hearing loss resulting from a combination of conductive hearing impairment and sensorineural hearing impairment.

The definition of the Protruding ear is that Angle formed by the plane of the ear and the mastoid bone greater than the 97th centile for age (objective); or, outer edge of the helix more than 2 cm from the mastoid at the point of maximum distance (objective). [PMID:19152421]
The definition of the Atresia of the external auditory canal is that Absence or failure to form of the external auditory canal.
The definition of the Bulbous nose is that Increased volume and globular shape of the anteroinferior aspect of the nose. [PMID:19152422]
The definition of the Abnormality of the choanae is that Abnormality of the choanae (the posterior nasal apertures).
The definition of the Narrow nasal ridge is that Decreased width of the nasal ridge. [PMID:19152422]
The definition of the Abnormality of the nasal septum is that An abnormality of the nasal septum.
The definition of the Short nasal septum is that Reduced superior to inferior length of the nasal septum.
The definition of the Epistaxis is that Epistaxis, or nosebleed, refers to a hemorrhage localized in the nose.

The definition of the Abnormality of the nasal bridge is that Abnormality of the nasal bridge, which is the saddle-shaped area that includes the nasal root and the lateral aspects of the nose. It lies between the glabella and the inferior boundary of the nasal bone, and extends laterally to the inner canthi.
The definition of the Prominent nasal bridge is that Anterior positioning of the nasal root in comparison to the usual positioning for age. [PMID:19152422]
The definition of the Abnormality of the nasal alae is that An abnormality of the Ala of nose.
The definition of the Underdeveloped nasal alae is that Thinned, deficient, or excessively arched ala nasi. [PMID:19152422]
The definition of the Wide nasal bridge is that Increased breadth of the nasal bridge (and with it, the nasal root).
The definition of the Nasal mucosa telangiectasia is that Telangiectasia of the nasal mucosa.
The definition of the Abnormality of the nasal tip is that An abnormality of the nasal tip.
The definition of the Depressed nasal tip is that Decreased distance from the nasal tip to the nasal base. [PMID:19152422]

The definition of the Convex nasal ridge is that Nasal ridge curving anteriorly to an imaginary line that connects the nasal root and tip. The nose appears often also prominent, and the columella low. [PMID:19152422]
The definition of the Wide nose is that Interalar distance more than two standard deviations above the mean for age, i.e., an apparently increased width of the nasal base and alae. [PMID:19152422]
The definition of the Narrow nasal bridge is that Decreased width of the bony bridge of the nose. [PMID:19152422]

The definition of the Prominent nose is that Distance between subnasale and pronasale more than two standard deviations above the mean, or alternatively, an apparently increased anterior protrusion of the nasal tip. [PMID:19152422]
The definition of the Choanal stenosis is that Abnormal narrowing of the choana (the posterior nasal aperture).

The definition of the Choanal atresia is that Absence or abnormal closure of the choana (the posterior nasal aperture). Most embryologists believe that posterior choanal atresia results from a failure of rupture between the 35th and 38th day of fetal life of the partition which separates the bucconasal or buccopharyngeal membranes. The resultant choanal atresia may be unilateral or bilateral, bony or membranous, complete or incomplete. In over 90 per cent of cases the obstruction is bony, while in the remainder it is membranous. The bony type of atresia is commonly located 1-2 mm. anterior to the posterior edge of the hard palate, and the osseous septum varies in thickness from 1 to 10 mm. In the membranous form of choanal atresia the obstruction usually occurs further posteriorly. In approximately one third of cases the atresia is bilateral.
The definition of the Broad nasal tip is that Increase in width of the nasal tip.
The definition of the Bifid nasal tip is that A splitting of the nasal tip. Visually assessable vertical indentation, cleft, or depression of the nasal tip.
The definition of the Depressed nasal ridge is that Lack of prominence of the nose resulting from a posteriorly-placed nasal ridge.

The definition of the Anosmia is that An inability to perceive odors. This is a general term describing inability to smell arising in any part of the process of smelling from absorption of odorants into the nasal mucous overlying the olfactory epithelium, diffusion to the cilia, binding to olfactory receptor sites, generation of action potentials in olfactory neurons, and perception of a smell.
The definition of the Narrow nose is that Interalar distance more than 2 SD below the mean for age, or alternatively, an apparently decreased width of the nasal base and alae. [PMID:19152422]

The definition of the Anteverted nares is that Anteriorly-facing nostrils viewed with the head in the Frankfurt horizontal and the eyes of the observer level with the eyes of the subject. This gives the appearance of an upturned nose (upturned nasal tip). [PMID:19152422]
The definition of the Abnormality of the neck is that An abnormality of the neck.

The definition of the Webbed neck is that Pterygium colli is a congenital skin fold that runs along the sides of the neck down to the shoulders. It involves an ectopic fibrotic facial band superficial to the trapezius muscle. Excess hair-bearing skin is also present and extends down the cervical region well beyond the normal hairline.
The definition of the Neck muscle weakness is that Decreased strength of the neck musculature.
The definition of the Increased adipose tissue around the neck is that An increased amount of subcutaneous fat tissue around the neck.
The definition of the Short neck is that Diminished length of the neck.
The definition of the Gastrointestinal angiodysplasia is that Dysplasia affecting the vasculature of the gastrointestinal tract.
The definition of the Long neck is that Increased inferior-superior length of the neck.
The definition of the Torticollis is that Involuntary contractions of the neck musculature resulting in an abnormal posture of or abnormal movements of the head.

The definition of the Thickened nuchal skin fold is that A thickening of the skin thickness in the posterior aspect of the fetal neck. A nuchal fold (NF) measurement is obtained in a transverse section of the fetal head at the level of the cavum septum pellucidum and thalami, angled posteriorly to include the cerebellum. The measurement is taken from the outer edge of the occiput bone to the outer skin limit directly in the midline. An NF measurement greater than 5 mm at 14 to 17+6 weeks of gestation, or 6 mm at 18 to 28 weeks has been associated with a markedly increased risk for Down syndrome.
The definition of the Broad neck is that Increased side-to-side width of the neck.
The definition of the Cystic hygroma is that A cystic lymphatic lesion of the neck.
The definition of the Abnormality of the eye is that Any abnormality of the eye, including location, spacing, and intraocular abnormalities.
The definition of the Abnormality of the retina is that A structural abnormality of the retina.
The definition of the Retinal coloboma is that A notch or cleft of the retina.

The definition of the Microcornea is that A congenital abnormality of the cornea in which the cornea and the anterior segment of the eye are smaller than normal. The horizontal diameter of the cornea does not reach 10 mm even in adulthood.

The definition of the Astigmatism is that A type of astigmatism associated with abnormal curvatures on the anterior and/or posterior surface of the cornea. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_ncarter, https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199, https://orcid.org/0000-0003-0986-4123]
The definition of the Hyperopic astigmatism is that A form of astigmatism in which one meridian is hyperopic while the one at a right angle to it has no refractive error.

The definition of the Megalocornea is that An enlargement of the cornea with normal clarity and function. Megalocornea is diagnosed with a horizontal corneal diameter of 12 mm or more at birth or 13 mm or more after two years of age.

The definition of the Strabismus is that A misalignment of the eyes so that the visual axes deviate from bifoveal fixation. The classification of strabismus may be based on a number of features including the relative position of the eyes, whether the deviation is latent or manifest, intermittent or constant, concomitant or otherwise and according to the age of onset and the relevance of any associated refractive error.
The definition of the Retinopathy is that A structural abnormality of the retina.
The definition of the Deeply set eye is that An eye that is more deeply recessed into the plane of the face than is typical. [PMID:19125427]
The definition of the Keratitis is that Inflammation of the cornea.
The definition of the Abnormality of the eyelid is that An abnormality of the eyelids.

The definition of the Abnormality of the fovea is that An abnormality of the fovea centralis, the central area of the macula that mediates central, high resolution vision and contains the largest concentration of cone cells in the retina.
The definition of the Downslanted palpebral fissures is that The palpebral fissure inclination is more than two standard deviations below the mean. [PMID:19125427]

The definition of the Recurrent corneal erosions is that The presence of recurrent corneal epithelial erosions. Although most corneal epithelial defects heal quickly, some may show recurrent ulcerations.
The definition of the Abnormality of eye movement is that An abnormality in voluntary or involuntary eye movements or their control.
The definition of the Blepharitis is that Inflammation of the eyelids.
The definition of the Abnormality of the eyelashes is that An abnormality of the eyelashes.
The definition of the Glaucoma is that Glaucoma refers loss of retinal ganglion cells in a characteristic pattern of optic neuropathy usually associated with increased intraocular pressure.
The definition of the Abnormality of the conjunctiva is that An abnormality of the conjunctiva.
The definition of the Tortuosity of conjunctival vessels is that The presence of an increased number of twists and turns of the conjunctival blood vessels.
The definition of the Abnormality of vision is that Abnormality of eyesight (visual perception).

The definition of the Visual impairment is that Visual impairment (or vision impairment) is vision loss (of a person) to such a degree as to qualify as an additional support need through a significant limitation of visual capability resulting from either disease, trauma, or congenital or degenerative conditions that cannot be corrected by conventional means, such as refractive correction, medication, or surgery.
The definition of the Telecanthus is that Distance between the inner canthi more than two standard deviations above the mean (objective); or, apparently increased distance between the inner canthi.

The definition of the Ptosis is that The upper eyelid margin is positioned 3 mm or more lower than usual and covers the superior portion of the iris (objective); or, the upper lid margin obscures at least part of the pupil (subjective). [PMID:19125427]
The definition of the Conjunctivitis is that Inflammation of the conjunctiva.

The definition of the Retinitis pigmentosa is that An inherited retinal disease subtype in which the rod photoreceptors appear to be more severely affected than the cone photoreceptors. Typical presentation is with nyctalopia (due to rod dysfunction) followed by loss of mid-peripheral field of vision, which gradually extends and leaves many patients with a small central island of vision due to the preservation of macular cones.

The definition of the Vertical supranuclear gaze palsy is that A supranuclear gaze palsy is an inability to look in a vertical direction as a result of cerebral impairment. There is a loss of the voluntary aspect of eye movements, but, as the brainstem is still intact, all the reflex conjugate eye movements are normal.
The definition of the Abnormal electroretinogram is that Any abnormality of the electrical responses of various cell types in the retina as measured by electroretinography.
The definition of the Slow saccadic eye movements is that An abnormally slow velocity of the saccadic eye movements.
The definition of the Abnormality of the lens is that An abnormality of the lens.
The definition of the Cataract is that A cataract is an opacity or clouding that develops in the crystalline lens of the eye or in its capsule.

The definition of the Congenital cataract is that A cataract that occurs congenitally as the result of a developmental defect, in contrast to the majority of cataracts that occur in adulthood as the result of degenerative changes of the lens.
The definition of the Proptosis is that An eye that is protruding anterior to the plane of the face to a greater extent than is typical.
The definition of the Alacrima is that Absence of tear secretion.
The definition of the Conjunctival telangiectasia is that The presence of small (ca. 0.5-1.0 mm) dilated blood vessels near the surface of the mucous membranes of the conjunctiva.

The definition of the Abnormality of the iris is that An abnormality of the iris, which is the pigmented muscular tissue between the cornea and the lens, that is perforated by an opening called the pupil.

The definition of the Aniridia is that Abnormality of the iris characterized by, typically bilateral, complete or partial iris hypoplasia. The phenotype ranges from mild defects of anterior iris stroma only to almost complete absence of the iris.
The definition of the Long eyelashes is that Mid upper eyelash length >10 mm or increased length of the eyelashes (subjective). [PMID:19125427, PMID:26288407]
The definition of the Anophthalmia is that Absence of the globe or eyeball. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_ncarter]
The definition of the Progressive visual loss is that A reduction of previously attained ability to see.
The definition of the Chorioretinal abnormality is that An abnormality of the choroid and retina.
The definition of the Chorioretinal atrophy is that Atrophy of the choroid and retinal layers of the fundus.
The definition of the Abnormality of the eyebrow is that An abnormality of the eyebrow.

The definition of the Epicanthus inversus is that A fold of skin starting at or just below the medial aspect of the lower lid and arching upward to cover, extend in front of and lateral to the medial canthus. [PMID:19125427]
The definition of the Abnormality of refraction is that An abnormality in the process of focusing of light by the eye in order to produce a sharp image on the retina.
The definition of the Hypermetropia is that An abnormality of refraction characterized by the ability to see objects in the distance clearly, while objects nearby appear blurry.
The definition of the Retinal detachment is that Separation of the inner layers of the retina (neural retina) from the pigment epithelium.
The definition of the Impaired ocular adduction is that Reduced ability to move the eye in the direction of the nose.

The definition of the Optic disc pallor is that A pale yellow discoloration of the optic disk (the area of the optic nerve head in the retina). The optic disc normally has a pinkish hue with a central yellowish depression.
The definition of the External ophthalmoplegia is that Paralysis of the external ocular muscles.
The definition of the Myopia is that An abnormality of refraction characterized by the ability to see objects nearby clearly, while objects in the distance appear blurry.
The definition of the Retinal degeneration is that A nonspecific term denoting degeneration of the retinal pigment epithelium and/or retinal photoreceptor cells.
The definition of the Abnormal conjugate eye movement is that Any deviation from the normal motor coordination of the eyes that allows for bilateral fixation on a single object.
The definition of the Abolished electroretinogram (ERG) is that Lack of any response to stimulation upon electroretinography.
The definition of the Abnormality of color vision is that An anomaly in the ability to discriminate between or recognize colors.
The definition of the Tritanomaly is that Difficulty distinguishing between yellow and blue, possible related to dysfunction of the S photopigment.
The definition of the Uveitis is that Inflammation of one or all portions of the uveal tract.

The definition of the Retinal dystrophy is that Retinal dystrophy is an abnormality of the retina associated with a hereditary process. Retinal dystrophies are defined by their predominantly monogenic inheritance and they are frequently associated with loss or dysfunction of photoreceptor cells as a primary or secondary event.

The definition of the Rieger anomaly is that A congenital malformation of the anterior segment characterized by iridicorneal malformation, glaucoma, iris stroma hypoplasia, posterior embryotoxon, and corneal opacities.
The definition of the Absent eyelashes is that Lack of eyelashes.
The definition of the Keratoconus is that A cone-shaped deformity of the cornea characterized by the presence of corneal distortion secondary to thinning of the apex.

The definition of the Lacrimal duct atresia is that A developmental disorder of the lacrimal drainage system that most often affects the lacrimal ostium and resulting in non-opening of the nasolacrimal duct. It usually results from a non-canalization of the nasolacrimal duct.
The definition of the Esotropia is that A form of strabismus with one or both eyes turned inward ('crossed') to a relatively severe degree, usually defined as 10 diopters or more.
The definition of the Chorioretinal coloboma is that Absence of a region of the retina, retinal pigment epithelium, and choroid.
The definition of the Microphthalmos is that A developmental anomaly characterized by abnormal smallness of one or both eyes.
The definition of the Abnormality of saccadic eye movements is that An abnormality of eye movement characterized by impairment of fast (saccadic) eye movements.
The definition of the Hypometric saccades is that Saccadic undershoot, i.e., a saccadic eye movement that has less than the magnitude that would be required to gain fixation of the object.

The definition of the Visual loss is that Loss of visual acuity (implying that vision was better at a certain time point in life). Otherwise the term reduced visual acuity should be used (or a subclass of that).
The definition of the Retinal hemorrhage is that Hemorrhage occurring within the retina. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:gcarletti]
The definition of the Thick eyebrow is that Increased density/number and/or increased diameter of eyebrow hairs. [PMID:19125427]

The definition of the Scotoma is that A regional and pathological increase of the light detection threshold in any region of the visual field surrounded by a field of normal or relatively well-preserved vision.

The definition of the Centrocecal scotoma is that A scotoma (area of diminished vision within the visual field) located between the central point of fixation and the blind spot with a roughly horizontal oval shape.
The definition of the Exotropia is that A form of strabismus with one or both eyes deviated outward.
The definition of the Nasolacrimal duct obstruction is that Blockage of the lacrimal duct.

The definition of the Pigmentary retinopathy is that An abnormality of the retina characterized by pigment deposition. It is typically associated with migration and proliferation of macrophages or retinal pigment epithelial cells into the retina; melanin from these cells causes the pigmentary changes. Pigmentary retinopathy is a common final pathway of many retinal conditions and is often associated with visual loss.
The definition of the Blepharophimosis is that A fixed reduction in the vertical distance between the upper and lower eyelids with short palpebral fissures. [PMID:19125427]

The definition of the Upslanted palpebral fissure is that The palpebral fissure inclination is more than two standard deviations above the mean for age (objective); or, the inclination of the palpebral fissure is greater than typical for age. [PMID:19125427]

The definition of the Band keratopathy is that An abnormality of the cornea characterized by the deposition of calcium in a band across the central cornea, leading to decreased vision, foreign body sensation, and ocular irritation.
The definition of the Shallow orbits is that Reduced depth of the orbits associated with prominent-appearing ocular globes.
The definition of the Abnormality of the optic nerve is that Abnormality of the optic nerve.
The definition of the Optic nerve coloboma is that A cleft of the optic nerve that extends inferiorly.
The definition of the Coloboma is that A developmental defect characterized by a cleft of some portion of the eye or ocular adnexa.
The definition of the Progressive external ophthalmoplegia is that Paralysis of the external ocular muscles.
The definition of the Abnormality of the sclera is that An abnormality of the sclera.
The definition of the Blue sclerae is that An abnormal bluish coloration of the sclera.
The definition of the Abnormality of the anterior chamber is that Abnormality of the anterior chamber, which is the space in the eye that is behind the cornea and in front of the iris.
The definition of the Shallow anterior chamber is that Reduced depth of the anterior chamber, i.e., the anteroposterior distance between the cornea and the iris is decreased.
The definition of the Ophthalmoparesis is that Ophthalmoplegia is a paralysis or weakness of one or more of the muscles that control eye movement.
The definition of the Abnormality of the ear is that An abnormality of the external ear.
The definition of the Hypotelorism is that Interpupillary distance less than 2 SD below the mean (alternatively, the appearance of an decreased interpupillary distance or closely spaced eyes).
The definition of the Ophthalmoplegia is that Paralysis of one or more extraocular muscles that are responsible for eye movements.
The definition of the Central scotoma is that An area of depressed vision located at the point of fixation and that interferes with central vision.

The definition of the Supranuclear gaze palsy is that A supranuclear gaze palsy is an inability to look in a particular direction as a result of cerebral impairment. There is a loss of the voluntary aspect of eye movements, but, as the brainstem is still intact, all the reflex conjugate eye movements are normal.
The definition of the Abnormality of the periorbital region is that An abnormality of the region situated around the orbit of the eye.
The definition of the Macular degeneration is that A nonspecific term denoting degeneration of the retinal pigment epithelium and/or retinal photoreceptor cells of the macula lutea.
The definition of the Optic nerve hypoplasia is that Underdevelopment of the optic nerve.
The definition of the Abnormality of the choroid is that Any structural abnormality of the choroid.
The definition of the Iris coloboma is that A coloboma of the iris.
The definition of the Photophobia is that Excessive sensitivity to light with the sensation of discomfort or pain in the eyes due to exposure to bright light. []

The definition of the Abnormality of the nasolacrimal system is that An abnormality of the nasolacrimal drainage system, which serves as a conduit for tear flow from the external eye to the nasal cavity. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_ncarter]
The definition of the Abnormality of the pupil is that An abnormality of the pupil.
The definition of the Miosis is that Abnormal (non-physiological) constriction of the pupil.
The definition of the Abnormality of ocular smooth pursuit is that An abnormality of eye movement characterized by impaired smooth-pursuit eye movements.

The definition of the Blindness is that Blindness is the condition of lacking visual perception defined as visual perception below 3/60 and/or a visual field of no greater than 10 degrees in radius around central fixation.
The definition of the Impaired convergence is that Reduced ability to turn the eyes inward in order to focus on a nearby object.
The definition of the Dacrocystitis is that Inflammation of the nasolacrimal sac.

The definition of the Entropion is that An abnormal inversion (turning inward) of the eyelid (usually the lower) towards the globe. Entropion is usually acquired as a result of involutional or cicatricial processes but may occasionally be congenital.
The definition of the Blurred vision is that Lack of sharpness of vision resulting in the inability to see fine detail.
The definition of the Supranuclear ophthalmoplegia is that A vertical gaze palsy with inability to direct the gaze of the eyes downwards.
The definition of the Cleft eyelid is that A short discontinuity of the margin of the lower or upper eyelid. [PMID:19125427]
The definition of the Posterior embryotoxon is that A posterior embryotoxon is the presence of a prominent and anteriorly displaced line of Schwalbe.
The definition of the Periorbital fullness is that Increase in periorbital soft tissue.
The definition of the Retinal arterial tortuosity is that The presence of an increased number of twists and turns of the retinal artery.
The definition of the Lacrimation abnormality is that Abnormality of tear production.
The definition of the Decreased lacrimation is that Abnormally decreased lacrimation, that is, reduced ability to produce tears.
The definition of the Impaired ocular abduction is that An impaired ability of the eye to move in the outward direction (towards the side of the head).
The definition of the Blue irides is that A markedly blue coloration of the iris.
The definition of the Upper eyelid coloboma is that A short discontinuity of the margin of the upper eyelid.

The definition of the Long palpebral fissure is that Distance between medial and lateral canthi is more than two standard deviations above the mean for age (objective); or, apparently increased length of the palpebral fissures. [PMID:19125427]
The definition of the Nystagmus is that Rhythmic, involuntary oscillations of one or both eyes related to abnormality in fixation, conjugate gaze, or vestibular mechanisms.
The definition of the Gaze-evoked nystagmus is that Nystagmus made apparent by looking to the right or to the left.

The definition of the Dysmetric saccades is that The controller signal for saccadic eye movements has two components: the pulse that moves the eye rapidly from one point to the next, and the step that holds the eye in the new position. When both the pulse and the step are not the correct size, a dysmetric refixation eye movement results.
The definition of the Red-green dyschromatopsia is that Difficulty with discriminating red and green hues.
The definition of the Blepharospasm is that A focal dystonia that affects the muscles of the eyelids and brow, associated with involuntary recurrent spasm of both eyelids.
The definition of the Amblyopia is that Reduced visual acuity that is uncorrectable by lenses in the absence of detectable anatomic defects in the eye or visual pathways.
The definition of the Sclerocornea is that A congenital anomaly in which a part or the whole of the cornea acquires the characteristics of sclera, resulting in clouding of the cornea.

The definition of the Optic atrophy is that Atrophy of the optic nerve. Optic atrophy results from the death of the retinal ganglion cell axons that comprise the optic nerve and manifesting as a pale optic nerve on fundoscopy.

The definition of the Abnormality of vision evoked potentials is that An anomaly of visually evoked potentials (VEP), which are electrical potentials, initiated by brief visual stimuli, which are recorded from the scalp overlying the visual cortex.
The definition of the Diplopia is that Diplopia is a condition in which a single object is perceived as two images, it is also known as double vision.
The definition of the Lower eyelid coloboma is that A short discontinuity of the margin of the lower eyelid.
The definition of the Sparse eyelashes is that Decreased density/number of eyelashes. [PMID:19125427]
The definition of the Decreased electroretinogram (ERG) amplitude is that Descreased amplitude of eletrical response upon electroretinography.
The definition of the Ectropion is that An outward turning (eversion) or rotation of the eyelid margin. [PMID:19125427]

The definition of the Oculomotor apraxia is that Ocular motor apraxia is a deficiency in voluntary, horizontal, lateral, fast eye movements (saccades) with retention of slow pursuit movements. The inability to follow objects visually is often compensated by head movements. There may be decreased smooth pursuit, and cancellation of the vestibulo-ocular reflex.

The definition of the Peters anomaly is that A form of anterior segment dysgenesis in which abnormal cleavage of the anterior chamber occurs. Peters anomaly is characterized by central, paracentral, or complete corneal opacity.

The definition of the Lipemia retinalis is that A creamy appearance of the retinal blood vessels that occurs when the concentration of lipids in the blood are extremely increased, with pale pink to milky white retinal vessels and altered pale reflexes from choroidal vasculature. [PMID:10379021, PMID:16120862]
The definition of the Night blindness is that Inability to see well at night or in poor light.
The definition of the Synophrys is that Meeting of the medial eyebrows in the midline. [PMID:19125427]
The definition of the Horizontal nystagmus is that Nystagmus consisting of horizontal to-and-fro eye movements.
The definition of the Phthisis bulbi is that Atrophy of the eyeball with blindness and decreased intraocular pressure due to end-stage intraocular disease.
The definition of the Hypodontia is that The absence of five or less teeth from the normal series by a failure to develop.

The definition of the Carious teeth is that Caries is a multifactorial bacterial infection affecting the structure of the tooth. This term has been used to describe the presence of more than expected dental caries.
The definition of the Anodontia is that The absence of all teeth from the normal series by a failure to develop.
The definition of the Macrodontia of permanent maxillary central incisor is that Increased size of the maxillary central secondary incisor tooth.
The definition of the Abnormality of the incisor is that An abnormality of the Incisor tooth.
The definition of the Oligodontia is that The absence of six or more teeth from the normal series by a failure to develop. [PMID:19125428, PMID:31468724]
The definition of the Dental crowding is that Changes in alignment of teeth in the dental arch [PMID:19125428, PMID:31468724]

The definition of the Taurodontia is that Increased volume of dental pulp of permanent molar characterized by a crown body-root ratio equal or larger than 1:1 or an elongated pulp chambers and apical displacement of the bifurcation or trifurcation of the roots.
The definition of the Delayed eruption of primary teeth is that Delayed tooth eruption affecting the primary dentition.
The definition of the Abnormality of dental enamel is that An abnormality of the dental enamel.
The definition of the Grayish enamel is that A grey discoloration of the dental enamel.
The definition of the Delayed eruption of teeth is that Delayed tooth eruption, which can be defined as tooth eruption more than 2 SD beyond the mean eruption age.

The definition of the Hypoplasia of teeth is that Decreased size of the teeth, which can be defined as a mesiodistal tooth diameter (width) more than 2 SD below mean. Alternatively, an apparently decreased maximum width of tooth.
The definition of the Widely spaced teeth is that Increased spaces (diastemata) between most of the teeth in the same dental arch. [PMID:19125428]

The definition of the Dental malocclusion is that Dental malocclusion refers to an abnormality of the occlusion, or alignment, of the teeth and the way the upper and lower teeth fit together, resulting in overcrowding of teeth or in abnormal bite patterns. [PMID:31468724]

The definition of the Agenesis of maxillary lateral incisor is that Agenesis of one or more maxillary lateral incisor, comprising the maxillary lateral primary incisor and maxillary lateral secondary incisor.

The definition of the Microdontia is that Decreased size of the teeth, which can be defined as a mesiodistal tooth diameter (width) more than 2 SD below mean. Alternatively, an apparently decreased maximum width of tooth.
The definition of the Misalignment of teeth is that Abnormal alignment, positioning, or spacing of the teeth, i.e., misaligned teeth.

The definition of the Shell teeth is that The diagnosis odontodysplasia requires clinical and radiological exams, in which unusually large pulp chambers and large pulp room chambers with thin enamel and dentin are visible. It may affect either a single tooth or several teeth. The term regional odontodysplasia is used if several teeth are affected. It affects the deciduous and permanent dentitions in the maxilla, the mandible or both, although the maxilla is more frequently involved. A type of dental dysplasia occurring in dentinogenesis imperfecta in which the pulp chambers are enlarged and there is a reduced amount of coronal dentin.
The definition of the Natal tooth is that A tooth present at birth or erupting within the first month of life. [PMID:19125428, PMID:31468724]
