The definition of the aplasia/Hypoplasia involving the shoulder musculature is that Absence or underdevelopment of the muscles of the shoulder.
The definition of the aplasia/Hypoplasia involving the musculature of the upper limbs is that Absence or underdevelopment of the musculature of the upper limbs.
The definition of the aplasia/Hypoplasia involving the musculature of the upper arm is that Absence or underdevelopment of the muscles of the upper arm.
The definition of the Metatarsal osteolysis is that Osteolysis involving metatarsal bones.
The definition of the Sclerotic scapulae is that Increased density of the bony tissue of the scapula.
The definition of the Delayed closure of the anterior fontanelle is that A delay in closure (ossification) of the anterior fontanelle, which generally undergoes closure around the 18th month of life.
The definition of the Compensatory chin elevation is that A tendency to hold the chin elevated by about 20 to 30 degrees to compensate for a limitation of eye movement.
The definition of the Subcutaneous nodule is that Slightly elevated lesions on or in the skin with a diameter of over 5 mm.
The definition of the Eye poking is that Repetitive pressing, poking, and/or rubbing in the eyes. [PMID:8157154]
The definition of the Vitreous detachment is that Separation of the vitreous humor from the retina.

The definition of the Congenital fibrosis of extraocular muscles is that Congenital non-progressive ophthalmoplegia with multiple extraocular muscle restrictions. Typically, there is ptosis and variable degrees of restriction of horizontal and vertical eye movements.

The definition of the Axenfeld anomaly is that Axenfeld's anomaly is a bilateral disorder characterized by a prominent, anteriorly displaced Schwalbe's line (posterior embryotoxon) and peripheral iris strands which span the anterior chamber angle to attach to Schwalbe's line.

The definition of the Falciform retinal fold is that An area of the retina that is buckled so that a sector-shaped sheet of retina lies in front of the normal retina. This feature is of congenital onset.
The definition of the Carpal osteolysis is that Osteolysis affecting carpal bones.
The definition of the Carpal bone hypoplasia is that Underdevelopment of one or more carpal bones.
The definition of the Broad finger is that Increased width of a non-thumb digit of the hand. [PMID:19125433]
The definition of the Failure to thrive is that Failure to thrive (FTT) refers to a child whose physical growth is substantially below the norm.
The definition of the Growth delay is that A deficiency or slowing down of growth pre- and postnatally.
The definition of the Intrauterine growth retardation is that An abnormal restriction of fetal growth with fetal weight below the tenth percentile for gestational age.
The definition of the Obesity is that Accumulation of substantial excess body fat. []

The definition of the Small for gestational age is that Smaller than normal size according to sex and gestational age related norms, defined as a weight below the 10th percentile for the gestational age.

The definition of the Disproportionate tall stature is that A tall and slim body build with increased arm span to height ratio (>1.05) and a reduced upper-to-lower segment ratio (<0.85), i.e., unusually long arms and legs. The extremities as well as the hands and feet are unusually slim.

The definition of the Large for gestational age is that The term large for gestational age applies to babies whose birth weight lies above the 90th percentile for that gestational age. [eMedicine:262679, https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199]
The definition of the Hemihypertrophy is that Overgrowth of only one side of the body.
The definition of the Mild postnatal growth retardation is that A mild degree of slow or limited growth after birth, being between two and three standard deviations below age- and sex-related norms.
The definition of the Slender build is that Asthenic habitus refers to a slender build with long limbs, an angular profile, and prominent muscles or bones.

The definition of the Umbilical hernia is that Protrusion of abdominal contents through a defect in the abdominal wall musculature around the umbilicus. Skin and subcutaneous tissue overlie the defect.
The definition of the Omphalocele is that A midline anterior incomplete closure of the abdominal wall in which there is herniation of the abdominal viscera into the base of the abdominal cord.
The definition of the Diastasis recti is that A separation of the rectus abdominis muscle into right and left halves (which are normally joined at the midline at the linea alba).
The definition of the Ascites is that Accumulation of fluid in the peritoneal cavity.

The definition of the Gastroschisis is that A type of congenital ventral incomplete closure of the abdominal wall in which the intestines and sometimes other organs extend freely into the amniotic fluid space through a small opening in the abdomen, usually to the right of the umbilicus.
The definition of the Anteriorly placed anus is that Anterior malposition of the anus.
The definition of the Abnormality of the rib cage is that A morphological anomaly of the rib cage.
The definition of the Overgrowth is that Excessive postnatal growth which may comprise increased weight, increased length, and/or increased head circumference.
The definition of the Abnormality of the umbilicus is that An abnormality of the structure or appearance of the umbilicus.

The definition of the Barrel-shaped chest is that A rounded, bulging chest that resembles the shape of a barrel. That is, there is an increased anteroposterior diameter and usually some degree of kyphosis.
The definition of the Asymmetry of the thorax is that Lack of symmetry between the left and right halves of the thorax.
The definition of the Prenatal movement abnormality is that An abnormality of fetal movement.
The definition of the Decreased fetal movement is that An abnormal reduction in quantity or strength of fetal movements.
The definition of the Abnormality of the amniotic fluid is that Abnormality of the amniotic fluid, which is the fluid contained in the amniotic sac surrounding the developing fetus.
The definition of the Polyhydramnios is that The presence of excess amniotic fluid in the uterus during pregnancy.
The definition of the Oligohydramnios is that Diminished amniotic fluid volume in pregnancy.
The definition of the Fetal polyuria is that Abnormally increased production of urine by the fetus resulting in polyhydramnios.
The definition of the Widely-spaced maxillary central incisors is that Increased distance between the maxillary central permanent incisor tooth.
The definition of the Multiple impacted teeth is that The presence of multiple impacted teeth.

The definition of the Macrodontia is that Increased size of the teeth, which can be defined as a mesiodistal tooth diameter (width) more than 2 SD above mean for age. Alternatively, an apparently increased maximum width of the tooth.
The definition of the Abnormality of the integument is that An abnormality of the integument, which consists of the skin and the superficial fascia.
The definition of the Primary hypercorticolism is that Hypercortisolemia associated with a primary defect of the adrenal gland leading to overproduction of cortisol.
The definition of the Recurrent skin infections is that Infections of the skin that happen multiple times.
The definition of the Redundant skin is that Loose and sagging skin often associated with loss of skin elasticity.
The definition of the Rotary nystagmus is that A form of nystagmus in which the eyeball makes rotary motions around the axis.
The definition of the Vesicovaginal fistula is that The presence of a fistula connecting the urinary bladder to the vagina.

The definition of the Bell-shaped thorax is that The rib cage has the shape of a wide mouthed bell. That is, the superior portion of the rib cage is constricted, followed by a convex region, and the inferior portion of the rib cage expands again to have a large diameter.
The definition of the Selective tooth agenesis is that Agenesis specifically affecting one of the classes incisor, premolar, or molar.
The definition of the Maxillary lateral incisor microdontia is that Decreased size of the maxillary permanent incisor.
The definition of the Abnormality of the hair is that An abnormality of the hair.
The definition of the Alopecia is that A noncongenital process of hair loss, which may progress to partial or complete baldness. [PMID:14676077]
The definition of the Abnormality of the nail is that Abnormality of the nail.
The definition of the Concave nail is that The natural longitudinal (posterodistal) convex arch is not present or is inverted. [PMID:19125433]
The definition of the Abnormality of the larynx is that An abnormality of the larynx.
The definition of the Laryngomalacia is that Laryngomalacia is a congenital abnormality of the laryngeal cartilage in which the cartilage is floppy and prolapses over the larynx during inspiration.
The definition of the Laryngeal stenosis is that Stricture or narrowing of the larynx that may be associated with symptoms of respiratory difficulty depending on the degree of laryngeal narrowing.
The definition of the Vocal cord paresis is that Decreased strength of the vocal folds.
The definition of the Vocal cord paralysis is that A loss of the ability to move the vocal folds.
The definition of the Hoarse voice is that Hoarseness refers to a change in the pitch or quality of the voice, with the voice sounding weak, very breathy, scratchy, or husky.

The definition of the Nasal speech is that A type of speech characterized by the presence of an abnormally increased nasal airflow during speech associated with structural abnormality of the nasal passages. []
The definition of the Dysphonia is that Difficulty in speaking due to a physical disorder of the mouth, tongue, throat, or vocal cords. Associated with a known physical or neurological cause. []
The definition of the High pitched voice is that An abnormal increase in the pitch (frequency) of the voice. []
The definition of the Weak voice is that Reduced intensity (volume) of speech.
The definition of the Premature birth is that The birth of a baby of less than 37 weeks of gestational age.
The definition of the Breech presentation is that A position of the fetus at delivery in which the fetus enters the birth canal with the buttocks or feet first.
The definition of the Abnormality of the cardiovascular system is that Any abnormality of the cardiovascular system.
The definition of the Abnormality of cardiac morphology is that Any structural anomaly of the heart.

The definition of the Ventricular septal defect is that A hole between the two bottom chambers (ventricles) of the heart. The defect is centered around the most superior aspect of the ventricular septum.

The definition of the Defect in the atrial septum is that Atrial septal defect (ASD) is a congenital abnormality of the interatrial septum that enables blood flow between the left and right atria via the interatrial septum. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown, https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199]
The definition of the Abnormality of the mitral valve is that Any structural anomaly of the mitral valve.
The definition of the Mitral valve prolapse is that One or both of the leaflets (cusps) of the mitral valve bulges back into the left atrium upon contraction of the left ventricle.

The definition of the Congestive heart failure is that The presence of an abnormality of cardiac function that is responsible for the failure of the heart to pump blood at a rate that is commensurate with the needs of the tissues or a state in which abnormally elevated filling pressures are required for the heart to do so. Heart failure is frequently related to a defect in myocardial contraction.

The definition of the Tetralogy of Fallot is that A congenital cardiac malformation comprising pulmonary stenosis, overriding aorta, ventricular septum defect, and right ventricular hypertrophy. The diagnosis of TOF is made if at least three of the four above mentioned features are present.
The definition of the Abnormality of the myocardium is that A structural anomaly of the muscle layer of the heart wall. []

The definition of the Cardiomyopathy is that A myocardial disorder in which the heart muscle is structurally and functionally abnormal, in the absence of coronary artery disease, hypertension, valvular disease and congenital heart disease sufficient to cause the observed myocardial abnormality.

The definition of the Hypertrophic cardiomyopathy is that Hypertrophic cardiomyopathy (HCM) is defined by the presence of increased ventricular wall thickness or mass in the absence of loading conditions (hypertension, valve disease) sufficient to cause the observed abnormality. [PMID:17916581]

The definition of the Cardiomegaly is that Increased size of the heart, clinically defined as an increased transverse diameter of the cardiac silhouette that is greater than or equal to 50% of the transverse diameter of the chest (increased cardiothoracic ratio) on a posterior-anterior projection of a chest radiograph or a computed tomography.
The definition of the Abnormality of the pulmonary valve is that Any structural abnormality of the pulmonary valve.

The definition of the Pulmonic stenosis is that A narrowing of the right ventricular outflow tract that can occur at the pulmonary valve (valvular stenosis), below the pulmonary valve (infundibular stenosis), or above the pulmonary valve (supravalvar stenosis).

The definition of the Patent ductus arteriosus is that In utero, the ductus arteriosus (DA) serves to divert ventricular output away from the lungs and toward the placenta by connecting the main pulmonary artery to the descending aorta. A patent ductus arteriosus (PDA) in the first 3 days of life is a physiologic shunt in healthy term and preterm newborn infants, and normally is substantially closed within about 24 hours after bith and completely closed after about three weeks. Failure of physiologcal closure is referred to a persistent or patent ductus arteriosus (PDA). Depending on the degree of left-to-right shunting, PDA can have clinical consequences.

The definition of the Dilated cardiomyopathy is that Dilated cardiomyopathy (DCM) is defined by the presence of left ventricular dilatation and left ventricular systolic dysfunction in the absence of abnormal loading conditions (hypertension, valve disease) or coronary artery disease sufficient to cause global systolic impairment. Right ventricular dilation and dysfunction may be present but are not necessary for the diagnosis. [PMID:17916581]
The definition of the Sudden cardiac death is that The heart suddenly and unexpectedly stops beating resulting in death within a short time period (generally within 1 h of symptom onset).
The definition of the Abnormality of the aortic valve is that Any abnormality of the aortic valve.

The definition of the Bicuspid aortic valve is that The presence of an aortic valve with two instead of the normal three cusps (flaps). Bicuspid aortic valvue is a malformation of a commissure (small space between the attachment of each cusp to the aortic wall) and the adjacent parts of the two corresponding cusps forming a raphe (the fused area of the two underdeveloped cusps turning into a malformed commissure between both cusps; the raphe is a fibrous ridge that extends from the commissure to the free edge of the two underdeveloped, conjoint cusps).
The definition of the Cor pulmonale is that Right-sided heart failure resulting from chronic hypertension in the pulmonary arteries and right ventricle.
The definition of the Tachycardia is that A rapid heartrate that exceeds the range of the normal resting heartrate for age.
The definition of the Aortic valve stenosis is that The presence of a stenosis (narrowing) of the aortic valve.

The definition of the Dextrocardia is that The heart is located in the right hand sided hemithorax. That is, there is a left-right reversal (or mirror reflection") of the anatomical location of the heart in which the heart is locate on the right side instead of the left." [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown, https://orcid.org/0009-0006-4530-3154]

The definition of the Mitral regurgitation is that An abnormality of the mitral valve characterized by insufficiency or incompetence of the mitral valve resulting in retrograde leaking of blood through the mitral valve upon ventricular contraction.
The definition of the Abnormality of the heart valves is that Any structural abnormality of a cardiac valve.

The definition of the Patent foramen ovale is that Failure of the foramen ovale to seal postnatally, leaving a potential conduit between the left and right cardiac atria. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown, https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199]
The definition of the Prolonged QT interval is that Increased time between the start of the Q wave and the end of the T wave as measured by the electrocardiogram (EKG).

The definition of the Myocardial infarction is that Necrosis of the myocardium caused by an obstruction of the blood supply to the heart and often associated with chest pain, shortness of breath, palpitations, and anxiety as well as characteristic EKG findings and elevation of serum markers including creatine kinase-MB fraction and troponin.
The definition of the Aortic regurgitation is that An insufficiency of the aortic valve, leading to regurgitation (backward flow) of blood from the aorta into the left ventricle.

The definition of the Truncus arteriosus is that A single arterial trunk arises from the cardiac mass. The pulmonary arteries, aorta and coronary arteries arise from this single trunk with no evidence of another outflow tract. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown, https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199]
The definition of the Bradycardia is that A slower than normal heart rate (in adults, slower than 60 beats per minute).

The definition of the Ventricular fibrillation is that Uncontrolled contractions of muscles fibers in the left ventricle not producing contraction of the left ventricle. Ventricular fibrillation usually begins with a ventricular premature contraction and a short run of rapid ventricular tachycardia degenerating into uncoordinating ventricular fibrillations.

The definition of the Torsade de pointes is that A type of ventricular tachycardia characterized by polymorphioc QRS complexes that change in amplitue and cycle length, and thus have the appearance of oscillating around the baseline in the EKG.

The definition of the Right ventricular hypertrophy is that In this case the right ventricle is more muscular than normal, causing a characteristic boot-shaped (coeur-en-sabot) appearance as seen on anterior- posterior chest x-rays. Right ventricular hypertrophy is commonly associated with any form of right ventricular outflow obstruction or pulmonary hypertension, which may in turn owe its origin to left-sided disease. The echocardiographic signs are thickening of the anterior right ventricular wall and the septum. Cavity size is usually normal, or slightly enlarged. In many cases there is associated volume overload present due to tricuspid regurgitation, in the absence of this, septal motion is normal.

The definition of the Transposition of the great arteries is that A complex congenital heart defect in which the aorta arises from the morphologic right ventricle and the pulmonary artery arises from the morphologic left ventricle. [eMedicine:900574, https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199, PMID:10798431]

The definition of the Asymmetric septal hypertrophy is that Hypertrophic cardiomyopathy with an asymmetrical pattern of hypertrophy, with a predilection for the interventricular septum and myocyte disarray.
The definition of the Abnormality of the cardiac septa is that An anomaly of the intra-atrial or intraventricular septum.

The definition of the Complete atrioventricular canal defect is that A congenital heart defect characterized by a specific combination of heart defects with a common atrioventricular valve, primum atrial septal defect and inlet ventricular septal defect. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown, https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199, PMID:16722604]

The definition of the Coronary artery disease is that Reduction of the diameter of the coronary arteries as the result of an accumulation of atheromatous plaques within the walls of the coronary arteries, which increases the risk of myocardial ischemia.
The definition of the Atrioventricular block is that Delayed or lack of conduction of atrial depolarizations through the atrioventricular node to the ventricles.
The definition of the Abnormality of the aorta is that An abnormality of the aorta.
The definition of the Coarctation of aorta is that Coarctation of the aorta is a narrowing or constriction of a segment of the aorta.
The definition of the Angina pectoris is that Paroxysmal chest pain that occurs with exertion or stress and is related to myocardial ischemia.

The definition of the Subaortic stenosis is that A fixed form of obstruction to blood flow across the left-ventricular outflow tract related to stenosis (narrowing) below the level of the aortic valve.

The definition of the Ectopia cordis is that Congenital malformation of the ventral wall with partial or total evisceration of the heart outside the thoracic cavity and through the defect in the ventral wall. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown]

The definition of the Secundum atrial septal defect is that A kind of atrial septum defect arising from an enlarged foramen ovale, inadequate growth of the septum secundum, or excessive absorption of the septum primum. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown, https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199]

The definition of the Myocardial fibrosis is that Myocardial fibrosis is characterized by dysregulated collagen turnover (increased synthesis predominates over unchanged or decreased degradation) and excessive diffuse collagen accumulation in the interstitial and perivascular spaces as well as by phenotypically transformed fibroblasts, termed myofibroblasts. [PMID:28157267]
The definition of the Sinus bradycardia is that Bradycardia related to a mean resting sinus rate of less than 50 beats per minute.

The definition of the Muscular subvalvular aortic stenosis is that A type of subvalvular aortic stenosis resulting from thickening of the musculature of the interventricular septum, which results in obstruction to blood flow through the left-ventricular outflow tract.

The definition of the Primary atrial arrhythmia is that A type of supraventricular tachycardia in which the atria are the principal site of electrophysiologic disturbance. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown]
The definition of the Cardiac shunt is that Pattern of blood flow in the heart that deviates from the normal circuit of the circulatory system.
The definition of the Right-to-left shunt is that Pattern of blood flow in the heart that deviates from the normal circuit of the circulatory system from the right side of the heart to the left.
The definition of the Cardiac arrest is that An abrupt loss of heart function. []

The definition of the Situs inversus totalis is that A left-right reversal (or mirror reflection") of the anatomical location of the major thoracic and abdominal organs." [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown, https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199]

The definition of the Abnormality of the pericardium is that An abnormality of the pericardium, i.e., of the fluid filled sac that surrounds the heart and the proximal ends of the aorta, vena cava, and the pulmonary artery.
The definition of the Pericardial effusion is that Accumulation of fluid within the pericardium.
The definition of the Myocardial necrosis is that Irreversible damage to heart tissue (myocardium) due to lack of oxygen after a heart attack (myocardial infarction). [PMID:20405318]
The definition of the Pericarditis is that Inflammation of the sac-like covering around the heart (pericardium).
The definition of the Abnormality of the tricuspid valve is that Any structural anomaly of the tricuspid valve.
The definition of the Tricuspid valve prolapse is that One or more of the leaflets (cusps) of the tricuspid valve bulges back into the right atrium upon contraction of the right ventricle.
The definition of the Right ventricular outlet obstruction is that An obstruction to the forward flow of blood in the outflow tract of the right ventricle. [PMID:30038501]
The definition of the Endocardial fibroelastosis is that Diffuse thickening of the ventricular endocardium and by associated myocardial dysfunction [PMID:23109776]
The definition of the Abnormality of the right ventricle is that An abnormality of the right ventricle of the heart.

The definition of the Right ventricular failure is that Reduced ability of the right ventricle to perform its function (to receive blood from the right atrium and to eject blood into the pulmonary artery), often leading to pitting peripheral edema, ascites, and hepatomegaly.

The definition of the Third degree atrioventricular block is that Third-degree atrioventricular (AV) block (also referred to as complete heart block) is the complete dissociation of the atria and the ventricles. Third-degree AV block exists when more P waves than QRS complexes exist and no relationship (no conduction) exists between them. [PMID:21841933]

The definition of the Conotruncal defect is that A congenital malformation of the outflow tract of the heart. Conotruncal defects are thought to result from a disturbance of the outflow tract of the embryonic heart, and comprise truncus arteriosus, tetralogy of Fallot, interrupted aortic arch, transposition of the great arteries, and double outlet right ventricle.
The definition of the Abnormality of the left ventricle is that Any structural abnormality of the left ventricle of the heart.
The definition of the Left ventricular hypertrophy is that Enlargement or increased size of the heart left ventricle. [MP:0002625]
The definition of the Abnormality of cardiac ventricle is that An abnormality of a cardiac ventricle.

The definition of the Ventricular hypertrophy is that Enlargement of the cardiac ventricular muscle tissue with increase in the width of the wall of the ventricle and loss of elasticity. Ventricular hypertrophy is clinically differentiated into left and right ventricular hypertrophy.

The definition of the Wolff-Parkinson-White syndrome is that A disorder of the cardiac conduction system of the heart characterized by ventricular preexcitation due to the presence of an abnormal accessory atrioventricular electrical conduction pathway.

The definition of the Coronary artery calcification is that An accumulation of calcium and phosphate in arteries with mineral deposits in the intimal or medial layer of the vessel wall in a coronary artery.
The definition of the Mitral stenosis is that An abnormal narrowing of the orifice of the mitral valve. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown]

The definition of the Double outlet right ventricle is that Double outlet right ventricle (DORV) is a type of ventriculoarterial connection in which both great vessels arise entirely or predominantly from the right ventricle.

The definition of the High-output congestive heart failure is that A form of heart failure characterized by elevated cardiac output. This may be seen in patients with heart failure and hyperthyroidism, anemia, pregnancy, arteriovenous fistulae, and others.

The definition of the Restrictive cardiomyopathy is that Restrictive left ventricular physiology is characterized by a pattern of ventricular filling in which increased stiffness of the myocardium causes ventricular pressure to rise precipitously with only small increases in volume, defined as restrictive ventricular physiology in the presence of normal or reduced diastolic volumes (of one or both ventricles), normal or reduced systolic volumes, and normal ventricular wall thickness.
The definition of the Thromboembolic stroke is that A cerebrovascular accident (stroke) that occurs because of thromboembolism.
The definition of the Progressive hearing impairment is that A progressive form of hearing impairment.
The definition of the Abnormality of the pancreas is that An abnormality of the pancreas.
The definition of the Pancreatitis is that The presence of inflammation in the pancreas.

The definition of the Annular pancreas is that A congenital anomaly in which the pancreas completely (or sometimes incompletely) encircles the second portion of duodenum and occasionally obstructs the more proximal duodenum.
The definition of the Acute pancreatitis is that A acute form of pancreatitis.
The definition of the Pancreatic cysts is that A cyst of the pancreas that possess a lining of mucous epithelium.
The definition of the Phimosis is that The male foreskin cannot be fully retracted from the head of the penis.
The definition of the Nasal obstruction is that Reduced ability to pass air through the nasal cavity often leading to mouth breathing.
The definition of the Abnormality of the spleen is that An abnormality of the spleen.
The definition of the Splenomegaly is that Abnormal increased size of the spleen.
The definition of the Asplenia is that Absence (aplasia) of the spleen.

The definition of the Accessory spleen is that An accessory spleen is a round, iso-echogenic, homogenic and smooth structure and is seen as a normal variant mostly on the medial contour of the spleen, near the hilus or around the lower pole. This has no pathogenic relevance.
The definition of the Polysplenia is that Polysplenia is a congenital disease manifested by multiple small accessory spleens.

The definition of the Single ventricle is that The presence of only one working lower chamber in the heart, usually with a virtual absence of the ventricular septum and usually present in conjunction with double inlet left or right ventricle. [MP:0010432]
The definition of the Vestibular dysfunction is that An abnormality of the functioning of the vestibular apparatus.

The definition of the Vestibular hypofunction is that A general descriptive term that describes impaired functioning of the vestibular apparatus that leads to manifestations such as dizziness or postural imbalance
The definition of the High-frequency sensorineural hearing impairment is that A form of sensorineural hearing impairment that affects primarily the higher frequencies.
The definition of the Abnormality of the foot is that An abnormality of the skeleton of foot.

The definition of the Pes cavus is that An increase in height of the medial longitudinal arch of the foot that does not flatten on weight bearing (i.e., a distinctly hollow form of the sole of the foot when it is bearing weight).

The definition of the Talipes equinovarus is that Talipes equinovarus (also called clubfoot) typically has four main components: inversion and adduction of the forefoot; inversion of the heel and hindfoot; equinus (limitation of extension) of the ankle and subtalar joint; and internal rotation of the leg.

The definition of the Pes planus is that A foot where the longitudinal arch of the foot is in contact with the ground or floor when the individual is standing; or, in a patient lying supine, a foot where the arch is in contact with the surface of a flat board pressed against the sole of the foot by the examiner with a pressure similar to that expected from weight bearing; or, the height of the arch is reduced.
The definition of the Hammertoe is that Hyperextension of the metatarsal-phalangeal joint with hyperflexion of the proximal interphalangeal (PIP) joint. [PMID:19125433]
The definition of the Broad foot is that A foot for which the measured width is above the 95th centile for age; or, a foot that appears disproportionately wide for its length. [PMID:19125433]

The definition of the Toe syndactyly is that Webbing or fusion of the toes, involving soft parts only or including bone structure. Bony fusions are referred to as bony" Syndactyly if the fusion occurs in a radio-ulnar axis. Fusions of bones of the toes in a proximo-distal axis are referred to as "Symphalangism"."
The definition of the Achilles tendon contracture is that A contracture of the Achilles tendon.
The definition of the Talipes equinovalgus is that A deformity of foot and ankle in which the foot is bent down and outwards.

The definition of the Short foot is that A measured foot length that is more than 2 SD below the mean for a newborn of 27 - 41 weeks gestation, or foot that is less than the 3rd centile for individuals from birth to 16 years of age (objective). Alternatively, a foot that appears disproportionately short (subjective).
The definition of the Bilateral talipes equinovarus is that Bilateral clubfoot deformity.
The definition of the Abnormality of toe is that An anomaly of a toe.
The definition of the Bulbous tips of toes is that An abnormality of the morphology of the toes, such that the tips of the toes are prominent and bulbous.
The definition of the Broad metatarsal is that Increased side-to-side width of a metatarsal bone.
The definition of the Narrow foot is that A foot for which the measured width is below the 5th centile for age; or, a foot that appears disproportionately narrow for its length. [PMID:19125433]
The definition of the Abnormal delivery is that An abnormality of the birth process.

The definition of the Premature rupture of membranes is that Premature rupture of membranes (PROM) is a condition which occurs in pregnancy when the amniotic sac ruptures more than an hour before the onset of labor.
The definition of the Hydrops fetalis is that The abnormal accumulation of fluid in two or more fetal compartments, including ascites, pleural effusion, pericardial effusion, and skin edema.
The definition of the Nonimmune hydrops fetalis is that A type of hydrops fetalis in which there is no identifiable circulating antibody to red blood cell antigens .
The definition of the Fetal ascites is that Accumulation of fluid in the peritoneal cavity during the fetal period.
The definition of the Small nail is that A nail that is diminished in length and width, i.e., underdeveloped nail.
The definition of the Hyperconvex nail is that When viewed on end (with the digit tip pointing toward the examiner's eye) the curve of the nail forms a tighter curve of convexity.
The definition of the Anonychia is that Aplasia of the nail.
The definition of the Short nail is that Decreased length of nail. [PMID:19125433]
The definition of the Hypoplastic toenails is that Underdevelopment of the toenail.
The definition of the Absent toenail is that Congenital absence of the toenail.
The definition of the Nail pits is that Small (typically about 1 mm or less in size) depressions on the dorsal nail surface. [PMID:19125433]
The definition of the Hypoplastic fingernail is that Underdevelopment of a fingernail.
The definition of the Thick nail is that Nail that appears thick when viewed on end. [PMID:19125433]
The definition of the Onycholysis is that Detachment of the nail from the nail bed.
The definition of the Ridged nail is that Longitudinal, linear prominences in the nail plate. [PMID:19125433]
The definition of the Fragile nails is that Nails that easily break.
The definition of the Split nail is that A nail plate that has a longitudinal separation and the two sections of the nail share the same lateral radius of curvature. [PMID:19125433]

The definition of the Dystrophic toenail is that Toenail changes apart from changes of the color of the toenail (nail dyschromia) that involve partial or complete disruption of the various keratinous layers of the nail plate.
The definition of the Hyperconvex fingernails is that When viewed on end (with the finger tip pointing toward the examiner's eye) the curve of the fingernail forms a tighter curve of convexity.
The definition of the Deep-set nails is that Deeply placed nails.
The definition of the Thin nail is that Nail that appears thin when viewed on end.
The definition of the Absent fingernail is that Absence of a fingernail.

The definition of the Paronychia is that The nail disease paronychia is an often-tender bacterial or fungal hand infection or foot infection where the nail and skin meet at the side or the base of a finger or toenail. The infection can start suddenly (acute paronychia) or gradually (chronic paronychia).
The definition of the Leukonychia is that White discoloration of the nails.
The definition of the Broad nail is that Increased width of nail.
The definition of the Hallux valgus is that Lateral deviation of the great toe (i.e., in the direction of the little toe).
The definition of the Weight loss is that Reduction of total body weight.
The definition of the Genital tract atresia is that Congenital occlusion of a tube in the genital tract.
The definition of the Foot polydactyly is that A kind of polydactyly characterized by the presence of a supernumerary toe or toes.

The definition of the Postaxial foot polydactyly is that Polydactyly of the foot most commonly refers to the presence of six toes on one foot. Postaxial polydactyly affects the lateral ray and the duplication may range from a well-formed articulated digit to a rudimentary digit.
The definition of the Short toe is that A toe that appears disproportionately short compared to the foot.

The definition of the Abnormality of the metatarsal bones is that Abnormalities of the metatarsal bones (i.e. of five tubular bones located between the tarsal bones of the hind- and mid-foot and the phalanges of the toes).
The definition of the Long foot is that Increased back to front length of the foot.

The definition of the Camptodactyly of toe is that Camptodactyly is a painless flexion contracture of the proximal interphalangeal (PIP) joint that is usually gradually progressive. This term refers to camptodactyly of one or more toes.
The definition of the Broad toe is that Visible increase in width of the non-hallux digit without an increase in the dorso-ventral dimension. [PMID:19125433]
The definition of the Rocker bottom foot is that The presence of both a prominent heel and a convex contour of the sole.

The definition of the Split foot is that A condition in which middle parts of the foot (toes and metatarsals) are missing giving a cleft appearance. The severity is very variable ranging from slightly hypoplastic 3rd toe over absent 2nd or 3rd toes as far as oligo- or monodactyl feet.
The definition of the Metatarsus adductus is that The metatarsals are deviated medially (tibially), that is, the bones in the front half of the foot bend or turn in toward the body.
The definition of the Preaxial foot polydactyly is that Duplication of all or part of the first ray.
The definition of the Abnormality of the hallux is that This term applies for all abnormalities of the big toe, also called hallux.

The definition of the Overlapping toe is that Describes a foot digit resting on the dorsal surface of an adjacent digit when the foot is at rest. Initially clawing may be dynamic and only noticeable on walking. Over time the plantar plate tears, subluxation occurs at the metatarsophalangeal joint (MTPJ), and the deformity becomes permanent.
The definition of the Long hallux is that Increased length of the big toe.

The definition of the Calcaneovalgus deformity is that This is a postural deformity in which the foot is positioned up against the tibia. The heel (calcaneus) is positioned downward (that is, the ankle is flexed upward), and the heel is turned outward (valgus).
The definition of the Oligodactyly (feet) is that A developmental defect resulting in the presence of fewer than the normal number of toes.

The definition of the Abnormality of the tarsal bones is that An abnormality of the tarsus are the cluster of seven bones in the foot between the tibia and fibula and the metatarsus, including the calcaneus (heel) bone and the talus (ankle) bone.
The definition of the Sandal gap is that A widely spaced gap between the first toe (the great toe) and the second toe.
The definition of the Gout (feet) is that Gout affecting the Metatarsophalangeal joint of big toe.

The definition of the Short distal phalanx of toe is that Short distance from the end of the toe to the most distal interphalangeal crease or distal interphalangeal joint flexion point, i.e., abnormally short distal phalanx of toe. [PMID:19125433]
The definition of the Toe clinodactyly is that Bending or curvature of a toe in the tibial direction (i.e., towards the big toe).
The definition of the Fifth toe clinodactyly is that Bending or curvature of a fifth toe in the tibial direction (i.e., towards the big toe).
The definition of the Deep plantar creases is that The presence of unusually deep creases (ridges/wrinkles) on the skin of sole of foot.
The definition of the Abnormality of blood and blood-forming tissues is that An abnormality of the hematopoietic system.
The definition of the Abnormality of thrombocytes is that An abnormality of platelets.
The definition of the Thrombocytopenia is that A reduction in the number of circulating thrombocytes.
The definition of the Abnormality of neutrophils is that A neutrophil abnormality.
The definition of the Neutropenia is that An abnormally low number of neutrophils in the peripheral blood.
The definition of the Pancytopenia is that An abnormal reduction in numbers of all blood cell types (red blood cells, white blood cells, and platelets).
The definition of the Abnormality of erythrocytes is that Any structural abnormality of erythrocytes (red-blood cells).
The definition of the Hemolytic anemia is that A type of anemia caused by premature destruction of red blood cells (hemolysis).
The definition of the Abnormality of eosinophils is that An abnormal count or structure of eosinophils.
The definition of the Eosinophilia is that Increased count of eosinophils in the blood.
The definition of the Abnormality of leukocytes is that An abnormality of leukocytes.
The definition of the Leukopenia is that An abnormal decreased number of leukocytes in the blood.
The definition of the Talipes is that A deformity of foot and ankle that has different subtypes that are talipes equinovarus, talipes equinovalgus, talipes calcaneovarus and talipes calcaneovalgus.

The definition of the Talipes calcaneovalgus is that Talipes calcaneovalgus is a flexible foot deformity (as opposed to a rigid congenital vertical talus foot deformity) that can either present as a positional or structural foot deformity depending on severity and/or causality. The axis of calcaneovalgus deformity is in the tibiotalar joint, where the foot is positioned in extreme hyperextension. On inspection, the foot has an up and out" appearance, with the dorsal forefoot practically touching the anterior aspect of the ankle and lower leg."
The definition of the Short 2nd toe is that Underdevelopment (hypoplasia) of the second toe.
The definition of the Lymphopenia is that A reduced number of lymphocytes in the blood.
The definition of the Megaloblastic anemia is that Anemia characterized by the presence of erythroblasts that are larger than normal (megaloblasts).
The definition of the Autoimmune hemolytic anemia is that An autoimmune form of hemolytic anemia.

The definition of the Abnormal bleeding is that An abnormal susceptibility to bleeding, often referred to as a bleeding diathesis. A bleeding diathesis may be related to vascular, platelet and coagulation defects.
The definition of the Thrombocytosis is that Increased numbers of platelets in the peripheral blood.
The definition of the Reticulocytopenia is that A reduced number of reticulocytes in the peripheral blood.
The definition of the Normocytic anemia is that A kind of anemia in which the volume of the red blood cells is normal.
The definition of the Increased red blood cell mass is that The presence of an increased mass of red blood cells in the circulation.
The definition of the Increased hematocrit is that An elevation above the normal ratio of the volume of red blood cells to the total volume of blood.
The definition of the Polycythemia is that Polycythemia is diagnosed if the red blood cell count, the hemoglobin level, and the red blood cell volume all exceed the upper limits of normal.

The definition of the Giant platelets is that Giant platelets are larger than 7 micrometers and usually 10 to 20 micrometers. The term giant platelet is used when the platelet is larger than the size of the average red cell in the field. (Description adapted from College of American Pathologists, Hematology Manual, 1998).
The definition of the Anemia is that A reduction in erythrocytes volume or hemoglobin concentration.
The definition of the Autoimmune neutropenia is that A type of neutropenia that is observed in the presence of granulocyte-specific antibodies.
The definition of the Congenital thrombocytopenia is that Thrombocytopenia with congenital onset.

The definition of the Thromboembolism is that The formation of a blood clot inside a blood vessel that subsequently travels through the blood stream from the site where it formed to another location in the body, generally leading to vascular occlusion at the distant site.
The definition of the Hypoplastic anemia is that Decreased count of erythroid precursor cells, that is, erythroid lineage cells in the bone marrow.
The definition of the Leukemia is that A cancer of the blood and bone marrow characterized by an abnormal proliferation of leukocytes.
The definition of the Abnormality of granulocytes is that Any structural abnormality or abnormal count of granulocytes.
The definition of the Abnormality of basophils is that Any structural abnormality or abnormal count of basophils.
The definition of the Granulocytopenia is that An abnormally reduced number of granulocytes in the blood.
The definition of the aplastic anemia is that Aplastic anemia is defined as pancytopenia with a hypocellular marrow.

The definition of the Renal amyloidosis is that A form of amyloidosis that affects the kidney. On hematoxylin and eosin stain, amyloid is identified as extracellular amorphous material that is lightly eosinophilic. These deposits often stain weakly for periodic acid Schiff (PAS), demonstrate a blue-to-gray hue on the trichrome stain and are typically negative on the Jones methenamine silver (JMS) stain. These tinctorial properties contrast with the histologic appearance of collagen, a major component of basement membranes, mesangial matrix and areas of sclerosis, which demonstrates strong positivity for PAS and JMS (See Figure 1 of PMID:25852856).

The definition of the Acute kidney injury is that Sudden loss of renal function, as manifested by decreased urine production, and a rise in serum creatinine or blood urea nitrogen concentration (azotemia).
The definition of the Renal artery stenosis is that The presence of stenosis of the renal artery.
The definition of the Vacuolated lymphocytes is that The presence of clear, sharply defined vacuoles in the lymphocyte cytoplasm.
The definition of the Reticulocytosis is that An elevation in the number of reticulocytes (immature erythrocytes) in the peripheral blood circulation.

The definition of the Sideroblastic anemia is that Sideroblastic anemia results from a defect in the incorporation of iron into the heme molecule. A sideroblast is an erythroblast that has stainable deposits of iron in cytoplasm (this can be demonstrated by Prussian blue staining).

The definition of the Acanthocytosis is that Acanthocytosis is a type of poikilocytosis characterized by the presence of spikes on the cell surface. The cells have an irregular shape resembling many-pointed stars.
The definition of the Abnormality of coagulation is that An abnormality of the process of blood coagulation. That is, altered ability or inability of the blood to clot.

The definition of the Reduced factor XI activity is that Decreased activity of coagulation factor XI. Factor XI, also known as plasma thromboplastin antecedent, is a serine proteinase that activates factor IX.
The definition of the Hypochromic anemia is that A type of anemia characterized by an abnormally low concentration of hemoglobin in the erythrocytes.
The definition of the Subcutaneous hemorrhage is that This term refers to an abnormally increased susceptibility to bruising (purpura, petechiae, or ecchymoses).
The definition of the Microcytic anemia is that A kind of anemia in which the volume of the red blood cells is reduced.
The definition of the Acidosis is that Abnormal acid accumulation or depletion of base.
The definition of the Hypoglycemia is that A decreased concentration of glucose in the blood.
The definition of the Fever is that Body temperature elevated above the normal range.
The definition of the Ketosis is that Presence of elevated levels of ketone bodies in the body.

The definition of the Renal tubular acidosis is that Acidosis owing to malfunction of the kidney tubules with accumulation of metabolic acids and hyperchloremia, potentially leading to complications including hypokalemia, hypercalcinuria, nephrolithiasis and nephrocalcinosis.
The definition of the Alkalosis is that Depletion of acid or accumulation base in the body fluids.
The definition of the Diabetic ketoacidosis is that A type of diabetic metabolic abnormality with an accumulation of ketone bodies.
The definition of the Episodic fever is that Periodic (episodic or recurrent) bouts of fever.
The definition of the Truncal obesity is that Obesity located preferentially in the trunk of the body as opposed to the extremities.
The definition of the Palpitations is that A sensation that the heart is pounding or racing, which is a non-specific sign but may be a manifestation of arrhythmia.

The definition of the Abnormal speech discrimination is that A type of hearing impairment prominently characterized by a difficulty in understanding speech, rather than an inability to hear speech. Poor speech discrimination is a very common symptom of high frequency hearing loss.
The definition of the aplasia/Hypoplasia of metatarsal bones is that Absence or underdevelopment of the metatarsal bones.
The definition of the Abnormality of the scalp is that Any anomaly of the scalp, the skin an subcutaneous tissue of the head on which head hair grows.
The definition of the Mesangial abnormality is that An abnormality of the mesangium, i.e., of the central part of the renal glomerulus between capillaries.
The definition of the Diffuse mesangial sclerosis is that Diffuse sclerosis of the mesangium, as manifestated by diffuse mesangial matrix expansion.
The definition of the Tubulointerstitial abnormality is that An abnormality that involves the tubules and interstitial tissue of the kidney.
The definition of the Tubulointerstitial nephritis is that An abnormality that involves the tubules and interstitial tissue of the kidney.
The definition of the Hypersplenism is that A malfunctioning of the spleen in which it prematurely destroys red blood cells.

The definition of the Macrocytic anemia is that A type of anemia characterized by increased size of erythrocytes with increased mean corpuscular volume (MCV) and increased mean corpuscular hemoglobin (MCH).
The definition of the Autoimmune thrombocytopenia is that The presence of thrombocytopenia in combination with detection of antiplatelet antibodies.
The definition of the Leukocytosis is that An abnormal increase in the number of leukocytes in the blood.
The definition of the Decreased platelet glycoprotein IIb-IIIa is that Decreased cell membrane concentration of glycoprotein IIb-IIIa.
The definition of the Reduced antithrombin III activity is that An abnormality of coagulation related to a decreased concentration of antithrombin-III.

The definition of the Abnormal thrombosis is that Venous or arterial thrombosis (formation of blood clots) of spontaneous nature and which cannot be fully explained by acquired risk (e.g. atherosclerosis).
The definition of the Extramedullary hematopoiesis is that The process of hematopoiesis occurring outside of the bone marrow (in the liver, thymus, and spleen) in the postnatal organisms.
The definition of the Megaloblastic bone marrow is that Abnormal increased number of megaloblasts in the bone marrow.
The definition of the Schistocytosis is that The presence of an abnormal number of fragmented red blood cells (schistocytes) in the blood.

The definition of the Sea-blue histiocytosis is that An abnormality of histiocytes, in which the cells take on a sea blue appearance due to abnormally increased lipid content. Histiocytes are a type of macrophage. Sea-blue histiocytes are typically large macrophages from 20 to 60 micrometers in diameter with a single eccentric nucleus whose cytoplasm if packed with sea-blue or blue-green granules when stained with Wright-Giemsa.
The definition of the Hypoketotic hypoglycemia is that A decreased concentration of glucose in the blood associated with a reduced concentration of ketone bodies.
The definition of the Hyperammonemia is that An increased concentration of ammonia in the blood. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:gcarletti]
The definition of the Recurrent hypoglycemia is that Recurrent episodes of decreased concentration of glucose in the blood. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:gcarletti]

The definition of the Fetal akinesia sequence is that Decreased fetal activity associated with multiple joint contractures, facial anomalies and pulmonary hypoplasia. Ultrasound examination may reveal polyhydramnios, ankylosis, scalp edema, and decreased chest movements (reflecting pulmonary hypoplasia).
The definition of the aplasia/Hypoplasia of toe is that Absence or hypoplasia of toes.

The definition of the Renal Fanconi syndrome is that An inability of the tubules in the kidney to reabsorb small molecules, causing increased urinary loss of electrolytes (sodium, potassium, bicarbonate), minerals, glucose, amino acids, and water.
The definition of the Chronic metabolic acidosis is that Longstanding metabolic acidosis.

The definition of the Gout is that Recurrent attacks of acute inflammatory arthritis of a joint or set of joints caused by elevated levels of uric acid in the blood which crystallize and are deposited in joints, tendons, and surrounding tissues.
The definition of the Abnormal facial shape is that An abnormality of the face.
The definition of the Short columella is that Reduced distance from the anterior border of the naris to the subnasale. [PMID:19152422]

The definition of the Deep philtrum is that Accentuated, prominent philtral ridges giving rise to an exaggerated groove in the midline between the nasal base and upper vermillion border. [PMID:19152422]
The definition of the Facial cleft is that A congenital malformation with a cleft (gap or opening) in the face.
The definition of the Frontal bossing is that Bilateral bulging of the lateral frontal bone prominences with relative sparing of the midline. [PMID:19125436]

The definition of the Potter facies is that A facial appearance characteristic of a fetus or neonate due to oligohydramnios experienced in the womb, comprising ocular hypertelorism, low-set ears, receding chin, and flattening of the nose.
The definition of the Morphological abnormality of the central nervous system is that A structural abnormality of the central nervous system.
The definition of the Abnormality of the abdominal organs is that An abnormality of the viscera of the abdomen.
The definition of the Vomiting is that Forceful ejection of the contents of the stomach through the mouth by means of a series of involuntary spasmic contractions.
The definition of the Dysphagia is that Difficulty in swallowing.
The definition of the Nausea is that A sensation of unease in the stomach together with an urge to vomit.
The definition of the Constipation is that Infrequent or difficult evacuation of feces.
The definition of the Gastroesophageal reflux is that A condition in which the stomach contents leak backwards from the stomach into the esophagus through the lower esophageal sphincter.

The definition of the Pyloric stenosis is that Pyloric stenosis, also known as infantile hypertrophic pyloric stenosis, is an uncommon condition in infants characterized by abnormal thickening of the pylorus muscles in the stomach leading to gastric outlet obstruction. Clinically infants are well at birth. Then, at 3 to 6 weeks of age, the infants present with projectile vomiting, potentially leading to dehydration and weight loss.
The definition of the Anal atresia is that Congenital absence of the anus, i.e., the opening at the bottom end of the intestinal tract.
The definition of the Malabsorption is that Impaired ability to absorb one or more nutrients from the intestine.
The definition of the Anal stenosis is that Abnormal narrowing of the anal opening.
The definition of the Abdominal pain is that An unpleasant sensation characterized by physical discomfort (such as pricking, throbbing, or aching) and perceived to originate in the abdomen.
The definition of the Chronic diarrhea is that The presence of chronic diarrhea, which is usually taken to mean diarrhea that has persisted for over 4 weeks.
The definition of the Abnormality of the esophagus is that A structural abnormality of the esophagus.

The definition of the Esophageal atresia is that A developmental defect resulting in complete obliteration of the lumen of the esophagus such that the esophagus ends in a blind pouch rather than connecting to the stomach.
The definition of the Poor suck is that An inadequate sucking reflex, resulting in the difficult of newborns to be breast-fed.
The definition of the Abnormality of the rectum is that An abnormaltiy of the rectum, the final segment of the large intestine that stores solid waste until it passes through the anus.
The definition of the Rectal prolapse is that Protrusion of the rectal mucous membrane through the anus.
The definition of the Hiatus hernia is that The presence of a hernia in which the upper part of the stomach, i.e., mainly the gastric cardia protrudes through the diaphragmatic esophageal hiatus.
The definition of the Anorexia is that Anorexia, or the loss of appetite for food, is a medical condition. []
The definition of the Esophageal varix is that Extreme dilation of the submucusoal veins in the lower portion of the esophagus.
The definition of the Esophageal stricture is that A pathological narrowing of the esophagus that is caused by the development of a ring of scar tissue that constricts the esophageal lumen.

The definition of the Zollinger-Ellison syndrome is that A condition in which there is increased production of gastrin by a gastrin-secreting tumor (usually located in the pancreas, duodenum, or abdominal lymph nodes) that stimulates the gastric mucosa to maximal activity, with consequent gastrointestinal mucosal ulceration.
The definition of the Heat intolerance is that The inability to maintain a comfortable body temperature in warm or hot weather.

The definition of the Malignant hyperthermia is that Malignant hyperthermia is characterized by a rapid increase in temperature to 39-42 degrees C. Malignant hyperthermia may occur in response to either inhalational anesthetics such as halothane, to muscle relaxants such as succinylcholine, or to exercise.
The definition of the Renal cortical atrophy is that Atrophy of the cortex of the kidney.

The definition of the Proximal renal tubular acidosis is that A type of renal tubular acidosis characterized by a failure of the proximal tubular cells to reabsorb bicarbonate, leading to urinary bicarbonate wasting and subsequent acidemia.
The definition of the Abnormality of the glabella is that An abnormality of the glabella.
The definition of the Prominent glabella is that Forward protrusion of the glabella.

The definition of the Myopathic facies is that A facial appearance characteristic of myopathic conditions. The face appears expressionless with sunken cheeks, bilateral ptosis, and inability to elevate the corners of the mouth, due to muscle weakness.
The definition of the Cerebral atrophy is that Atrophy (wasting, decrease in size of cells or tissue) affecting the cerebrum.
The definition of the Abnormality of the cerebrum is that Any structural abnormality of the telencephalon, which is also known as the cerebrum.

The definition of the Lower limb spasticity is that Spasticity (velocity-dependent increase in tonic stretch reflexes with increased muscle tone and hyperexcitable tendon reflexes) in the muscles of the lower limbs, hips, and pelvis [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:UKT_rschuele, https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199]

The definition of the Morphological abnormality of the pyramidal tract is that Any structural abnormality of the pyramidal tract, whose chief element, the corticospinal tract, is the only direct connection between the brain and the spinal cord. In addition to the corticospinal tract, the pyramidal system includes the corticobulbar, corticomesencephalic, and corticopontine tracts.

The definition of the Rigidity is that Continuous involuntary sustained muscle contraction. When an affected muscle is passively stretched, the degree of resistance remains constant regardless of the rate at which the muscle is stretched. This feature helps to distinguish rigidity from muscle spasticity.

The definition of the Gait ataxia is that A type of ataxia characterized by the impairment of the ability to coordinate the movements required for normal walking. Gait ataxia is characteirzed by a wide-based staggering gait with a tendency to fall. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:UKT_rschuele, https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199]

The definition of the Bradykinesia is that Bradykinesia literally means slow movement, and is used clinically to denote a slowness in the execution of movement (in contrast to hypokinesia, which is used to refer to slowness in the initiation of movement).

The definition of the Generalized tonic-clonic seizures is that A bilateral tonic-clonic seizure is a seizure defined by a tonic (bilateral increased tone, lasting seconds to minutes) and then a clonic (bilateral sustained rhythmic jerking) phase.
The definition of the Limb ataxia is that A kind of ataxia that affects movements of the extremities.

The definition of the Abnormality of extrapyramidal motor function is that A neurological condition related to lesions of the basal ganglia leading to typical abnormalities including akinesia (inability to initiate changes in activity and perform volitional movements rapidly and easily), muscular rigidity (continuous contraction of muscles with constant resistance to passive movement), chorea (widespread arrhythmic movements of a forcible, rapid, jerky, and restless nature), athetosis (inability to sustain the muscles of the fingers, toes, or other group of muscles in a fixed position), and akathisia (inability to remain motionless).

The definition of the Chorea is that Chorea (Greek for 'dance') refers to widespread arrhythmic involuntary movements of a forcible, jerky and restless fashion. It is a random-appearing sequence of one or more discrete involuntary movements or movement fragments. Movements appear random because of variability in timing, duration or location. Each movement may have a distinct start and end. However, movements may be strung together and thus may appear to flow randomly from one muscle group to another. Chorea can involve the trunk, neck, face, tongue, and extremities.

The definition of the Increased neuronal autofluorescent lipopigment is that Lipofuscin, a generic term applied to autofluorescent lipopigment, is a mixture of protein and lipid that accumulates in most aging cells, particularly those involved in high lipid turnover (e.g., the adrenal medulla) or phagocytosis of other cell types (e g., the retinal pigment epithelium or RPE; macrophage). This term pertains if there is an increase in the neuronal accumulation of lipofuscin (also known as autofluorescent lipoprotein) more than expected for the age of the patient.

The definition of the Dysdiadochokinesis is that A type of ataxia characterized by the impairment of the ability to perform rapidly alternating movements, such as pronating and supinating his or her hand on the dorsum of the other hand as rapidly as possible. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:UKB_tklockgether, HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:zaferyueksel, https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199]
The definition of the Migraine is that Migraine is a chronic neurological disorder characterized by episodic attacks of headache and associated symptoms.

The definition of the Migraine with aura is that A type of migraine in which there is an aura characterized by focal neurological phenomena that usually proceed, but may accompany or occur in the absence of, the headache. The symptoms of an aura may include fully reversible visual, sensory, and speech symptoms but not motor weakness. Visual symptoms may include flickering lights, spots and lines and/or loss of vision and/or unilateral sensory symptoms such as paresthesias or numbness. At least one of the symptoms of an aura develops gradually over 5 or more minutes and/or different symptoms occur in succession.

The definition of the Truncal ataxia is that Truncal ataxia is a sign of ataxia characterized by instability of the trunk. It usually occurs during sitting. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:UKT_rschuele, https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199]
The definition of the Hypoplasia of the corpus callosum is that Underdevelopment of the corpus callosum.

The definition of the Intention tremor is that A type of kinetic tremor that occurs during target directed movement is called intention tremor. That is, an oscillatory cerebellar ataxia that tends to be absent when the limbs are inactive and during the first part of voluntary movement but worsening as the movement continues and greater precision is required (e.g., in touching a target such as the patient's nose or a physician's finger).

The definition of the Migraine without aura is that Repeated headache attacks lasting 4-72 h fulfilling at least two of the following criteria: 1) unilateral location, 2) pulsating quality, 3) moderate or severe pain intensity, and 4) aggravation by or causing avoidance of routine physical activity such as climbing stairs. Headache attacks are commonly accompanied by nausea, vomiting, photophobia, or phonophobia.
The definition of the Encephalocele is that A neural tube defect characterized by sac-like protrusions of the brain and the membranes that cover it through openings in the skull.

The definition of the Occipital encephalocele is that A type of encephalocele (that is, a a protrusion of part of the cranial contents including brain tissue through a congenital opening in the cranium, typically covered with skin or mucous membrane) in the occipital region of the skull. Occipital encephalocele presents as a midline swelling over the occipital bone. It is usually covered with normal full-thickness scalp.
The definition of the Abnormality of the respiratory system is that An abnormality of the respiratory system, which include the airways, lungs, and the respiratory muscles.
The definition of the Abnormality of the upper respiratory tract is that An abnormality of the upper respiratory tract.
The definition of the Abnormality of the lung is that Any structural anomaly of the lung.
The definition of the Pneumonia is that Inflammation of any part of the lung parenchyma.

The definition of the Pulmonary hypertension is that Pulmonary hypertension is defined mean pulmonary artery pressure of 25mmHg or more and pulmonary capillary wedge pressure of 15mmHg or less when measured by right heart catheterisation at rest and in a supine position.
The definition of the Dyspnea is that Difficult or labored breathing. Dyspnea is a subjective feeling only the patient can rate, e.g., on a Borg scale.

The definition of the Asthma is that Asthma is characterized by increased responsiveness of the tracheobronchial tree to multiple stimuli, leading to narrowing of the air passages with resultant dyspnea, cough, and wheezing.

The definition of the Recurrent aspiration pneumonia is that Increased susceptibility to aspiration pneumonia, defined as pneumonia due to breathing in foreign material, as manifested by a medical history of repeated episodes of aspiration pneumonia.
The definition of the Abnormal lung lobation is that A developmental defect in the formation of pulmonary lobes.
The definition of the Pleuritis is that Inflammation of the pleura.
The definition of the Abnormality of the pleura is that An abnormality of the pulmonary pleura, the thin, transparent membrane which covers the lungs and lines the inside of the chest walls.

The definition of the Apnea is that Lack of breathing with no movement of the respiratory muscles and no exchange of air in the lungs. This term refers to a disposition to have recurrent episodes of apnea rather than to a single event.
The definition of the Hemoptysis is that Coughing up (expectoration) of blood or blood-streaked sputum from the larynx, trachea, bronchi, or lungs.
The definition of the Pneumothorax is that Accumulation of air in the pleural cavity leading to a partially or completely collapsed lung.
The definition of the Spontaneous pneumothorax is that Pneumothorax occurring without traumatic injury to the chest or lung.
The definition of the Bronchiectasis is that Persistent abnormal dilatation of the bronchi owing to localized and irreversible destruction and widening of the large airways.
The definition of the Abnormality of the cerebral ventricles is that Any structural abnormality of the cerebral ventricles.
The definition of the Ventriculomegaly is that An increase in size of the ventricular system of the brain.
The definition of the Cerebral cortical atrophy is that Atrophy of the cortex of the cerebrum.

The definition of the Absence seizures is that A generalized non-motor (absence) seizure is a type of a type of dialeptic seizure that is of electrographically generalized onset. It is a generalized seizure characterised by an interruption of activities, a blank stare, and usually the person will be unresponsive when spoken to. Any ictal motor phenomena are minor in comparison to these non-motor features.

The definition of the Generalized myoclonic seizures is that A generalized myoclonic seizure is a type of generalized motor seizure characterised by bilateral, sudden, brief (<100 ms) involuntary single or multiple contraction of muscles or muscle groups of variable topography (axial, proximal limb, distal). Myoclonus is less regularly repetitive and less sustained than is clonus. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:jalbers, PMID:28276060, PMID:28276064]

The definition of the Polymicrogyria is that Polymicrogyria is a congenital malformation of the cerebral cortex characterized by abnormal cortical layering (lamination) and an excessive number of small gyri (folds).
The definition of the Episodic ataxia is that Periodic spells of incoordination and imbalance, that is, episodes of ataxia typically lasting from 10 minutes to several hours or days.
The definition of the Porencephaly is that A cavity within the cerebral hemisphere, filled with cerebrospinal fluid, that communicates directly with the ventricular system.

The definition of the Status epilepticus is that Status epilepticus is a type of prolonged seizure resulting either from the failure of the mechanisms responsible for seizure termination or from the initiation of mechanisms which lead to abnormally prolonged seizures (after time point t1). It is a condition that can have long-term consequences (after time point t2), including neuronal death, neuronal injury, and alteration of neuronal networks, depending on the type and duration of seizures. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:jalbers, https://orcid.org/0000-0002-1735-8178, PMID:26336950, PMID:28276060]
The definition of the Abnormality of the basal ganglia is that Abnormality of the basal ganglia.
The definition of the Basal ganglia calcification is that The presence of calcium deposition affecting one or more structures of the basal ganglia.
The definition of the Broad-based gait is that An abnormal gait pattern in which persons stand and walk with their feet spaced widely apart. This is often a component of cerebellar ataxia.
The definition of the Subarachnoid hemorrhage is that Hemorrhage occurring between the arachnoid mater and the pia mater.

The definition of the Ischemic stroke is that Acute ischemic stroke (AIS) is defined by the sudden loss of blood flow to an area of the brain with the resulting loss of neurologic function. It is caused by thrombosis or embolism that occludes a cerebral vessel supplying a specific area of the brain. During a vessel occlusion, there is a core area where damage to the brain is irreversible and an area of penumbra where the brain has lost function owing to decreased blood flow but is not irreversibly injured. [PMID:32054610]
The definition of the Abnormality of the spinal cord is that A structural abnormality of the spinal cord (myelon).

The definition of the Tethered cord is that During normal embryological development, the spinal cord first occupies the entire length of the vertebral column but goes on to assume a position at the level of L1 due to differential growth of the conus medullaris and the vertebral column. The filum terminale is a slender, threadlike structure that remains after the normal regression of the distal embryonic spinal cord and attaches the spinal cord to the coccyx. A tethered cord results if there is a thickened rope-like filum terminale which anchors the cord at the level of L2 or below, potentially causing neurologic signs owing to abnormal tension on the spinal cord.

The definition of the Frontotemporal dementia is that A dementia associated with degeneration of the frontotemporal lobe and clinically associated with personality and behavioral changes such as disinhibition, apathy, and lack of insight. The hallmark feature of frontotemporal dementia is the presentation with focal syndromes such as progressive language dysfunction, or aphasia, or behavioral changes characteristic of frontal lobe disorders.
The definition of the Hypophosphatemia is that An abnormally decreased phosphate concentration in the blood. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:gcarletti]
The definition of the Hyperuricemia is that An abnormally high level of uric acid in the blood.

The definition of the Increased serum lactate is that Abnormally increased level of blood lactate (2-hydroxypropanoic acid). Lactate is produced from pyruvate by lactate dehydrogenase during normal metabolism. The terms lactate and lactic acid are often used interchangeably but lactate (the component measured in blood) is strictly a weak base whereas lactic acid is the corresponding acid. Lactic acidosis is often used clinically to describe elevated lactate but should be reserved for cases where there is a corresponding acidosis (pH below 7.35).
The definition of the Hyperproteinemia is that An increased concentration of proteins in the blood. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:gcarletti]
The definition of the Hyperkalemia is that An abnormally increased potassium concentration in the blood.
The definition of the Hypertriglyceridemia is that An abnormal increase in the level of triglycerides in the blood.
The definition of the Azotemia is that An increased concentration of nitrogen compounds in the blood. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:gcarletti]
The definition of the Hyperlysinemia is that An increased concentration of lysine in the blood. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:gcarletti, PMID:4696900]
The definition of the Low posterior hairline is that Hair on the neck extends more inferiorly than usual. [PMID:19125436]
The definition of the Nail dysplasia is that The presence of developmental dysplasia of the nail.
The definition of the Impaired vibration sensation in the lower limbs is that A decrease in the ability to perceive vibration in the legs.
The definition of the Clonus is that A series of rhythmic and involuntary muscle contractions (at a frequency of about 5 to 7 Hz) that occur in response to an abruptly applied and sustained stretch.
The definition of the Intracranial hemorrhage is that Hemorrhage occurring within the skull. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:gcarletti]
The definition of the Gliosis is that Gliosis is the focal proliferation of glial cells in the central nervous system.

The definition of the Postural instability is that A tendency to fall or the inability to keep oneself from falling; imbalance. The retropulsion test is widely regarded as the gold standard to evaluate postural instability, Use of the retropulsion test includes a rapid balance perturbation in the backward direction, and the number of balance correcting steps (or total absence thereof) is used to rate the degree of postural instability. Healthy subjects correct such perturbations with either one or two large steps, or without taking any steps, hinging rapidly at the hips while swinging the arms forward as a counterweight. In patients with balance impairment, balance correcting steps are often too small, forcing patients to take more than two steps. Taking three or more steps is generally considered to be abnormal, and taking more than five steps is regarded as being clearly abnormal. Markedly affected patients continue to step backward without ever regaining their balance and must be caught by the examiner (this would be called true retropulsion). Even more severely affected patients fail to correct entirely, and fall backward like a pushed toy soldier, without taking any corrective steps. [PMID:25613349]
The definition of the Postural tremor is that A type of tremors that is triggered by holding a limb in a fixed position.
The definition of the Spinal cord compression is that External mechanical compression of the spinal cord.
The definition of the Neurodegeneration is that Progressive loss of neural cells and tissue.
The definition of the Cerebral edema is that Abnormal accumulation of fluid in the brain.
The definition of the Phonophobia is that An abnormally heightened sensitivity to loud sounds. []

The definition of the Neurofibrillary tangles is that Pathological protein aggregates formed by hyperphosphorylation of a microtubule-associated protein known as tau, causing it to aggregate in an insoluble form.

The definition of the Apraxia is that A defect in the understanding of complex motor commands and in the execution of certain learned movements, i.e., deficits in the cognitive components of learned movements. []
The definition of the Intellectual disability, profound is that Profound mental retardation is defined as an intelligence quotient (IQ) below 20.
The definition of the Delayed CNS myelination is that Delayed myelination in the central nervous system.
The definition of the Choroid plexus cyst is that A cyst occurring within the choroid plexus within a cerebral ventricle.
The definition of the Progressive spasticity is that Spasticity that increases in degree with time.

The definition of the Pseudobulbar behavioral symptoms is that Individuals with Pseudobulbar signs often also demonstrate abnormal behavioral symptoms such as inappropriate emotional outbursts of uncontrolled laughter or weeping etc.

The definition of the Delayed gross motor development is that A type of motor delay characterized by a delay in acquiring the ability to control the large muscles of the body for walking, running, sitting, and crawling.
The definition of the Dysgenesis of the cerebellar vermis is that Defective development of the vermis of cerebellum.
