The definition of the Generalized seizures is that A generalized-onset seizure is a type of seizure originating at some point within, and rapidly engaging, bilaterally distributed networks. The networks may include cortical and subcortical structures but not necessarily the entire cortex.
The definition of the Dilated fourth ventricle is that An abnormal dilatation of the fourth cerebral ventricle.

The definition of the Pseudobulbar signs is that Pseudobulbar signs result from injury to an upper motor neuron lesion to the corticobulbar pathways in the pyramidal tract. Patients have difficulty chewing, swallowing and demonstrate slurred speech (often initial presentation) as well as abnormal behavioral symptoms such as inappropriate emotional outbursts of uncontrolled laughter or weeping etc.
The definition of the Respiratory paralysis is that Inability to move the muscles of respiration.

The definition of the Pulmonary embolism is that An embolus (that is, an abnormal particle circulating in the blood) located in the pulmonary artery and thereby blocking blood circulation to the lung. Usually the embolus is a blood clot that has developed in an extremity (for instance, a deep venous thrombosis), detached, and traveled through the circulation before becoming trapped in the pulmonary artery. []
The definition of the Recurrent respiratory infections is that An increased susceptibility to respiratory infections as manifested by a history of recurrent respiratory infections.
The definition of the Pulmonary fibrosis is that Replacement of normal lung tissues by fibroblasts and collagen. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_tkuijpers, https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199]
The definition of the Coarse hair is that Hair shafts are rough in texture.
The definition of the Sparse scalp hair is that Decreased number of hairs per unit area of skin of the scalp. [PMID:19125436, PMID:28061825]
The definition of the White forelock is that A triangular depigmented region of white hairs located in the anterior midline of the scalp.
The definition of the Fine hair is that Hair that is fine or thin to the touch.
The definition of the Sparse axillary hair is that Reduced number or density of axillary hair.
The definition of the Premature graying of hair is that Development of gray hair at a younger than normal age.
The definition of the Slow-growing hair is that Hair whose growth is slower than normal.
The definition of the Silver-gray hair is that Hypopigmented hair that appears silver-gray.
The definition of the Absent axillary hair is that Absence of axillary hair.
The definition of the Absent eyebrow is that Absence of the eyebrow.
The definition of the Sparse pubic hair is that Reduced number or density of pubic hair.
The definition of the White eyebrow is that White color (lack of pigmentation) of the eyebrow.
The definition of the White eyelashes is that White color (lack of pigmentation) of the eyelashes.
The definition of the Generalized hirsutism is that Abnormally increased hair growth over much of the entire body.
The definition of the Sparse body hair is that Sparseness of the body hair.
The definition of the Early balding is that Loss of scalp hair at an earlier than normal age.

The definition of the Pili canaliculi is that A characteristic triangular, kidney- or heat-shaped diameter of hair shafts with typical longitudinal canalicular deformation as observable by scanning electron microscopy.
The definition of the Frontal upsweep of hair is that Upward and/or sideward growth of anterior hair. [PMID:19125436]
The definition of the Gastrointestinal hemorrhage is that Hemorrhage affecting the gastrointestinal tract.
The definition of the Hepatomegaly is that Abnormally increased size of the liver.
The definition of the Abnormality of the intestine is that An abnormality of the intestine. The closely related term enteropathy is used to refer to any disease of the intestine.

The definition of the Protein-losing enteropathy is that Abnormal loss of protein from the digestive tract related to excessive leakage of plasma proteins into the lumen of the gastrointestinal tract.
The definition of the Abnormality of the small intestine is that A structural abnormality of the small intestine.
The definition of the Meckel diverticulum is that Meckel's diverticulum is a congenital diverticulum located in the distal ileum.
The definition of the Abnormality of the duodenum is that An abnormality of the duodenum, i.e., the first section of the small intestine.
The definition of the Duodenal atresia is that A developmental defect resulting in complete obliteration of the duodenal lumen, that is, an abnormal closure of the duodenum.
The definition of the Hematemesis is that The vomiting of blood.

The definition of the Melena is that The passage of blackish, tarry feces associated with gastrointestinal hemorrhage. Melena occurs if the blood remains in the colon long enough for it to be broken down by colonic bacteria. One degradation product, hematin, imbues the stool with a blackish color. Thus, melena generally occurs with bleeding from the upper gastrointestinal tract (e.g., stomach ulcers or duodenal ulcers), since the blood usually remains in the gut for a longer period of time than with lower gastrointestinal bleeding.
The definition of the Abnormality of the large intestine is that Any abnormality of the large intestine.

The definition of the Aganglionic megacolon is that An abnormality resulting from a lack of intestinal ganglion cells (i.e., an aganglionic section of bowel) that results in bowel obstruction with enlargement of the colon.
The definition of the Colonic diverticulosis is that The presence of multiple diverticula of the colon.
The definition of the Chronic rhinitis is that Chronic inflammation of the nasal mucosa.
The definition of the Exaggerated cupid's bow is that More pronounced paramedian peaks and median notch of the Cupid's bow. [PMID:19125428]
The definition of the Exaggerated startle response is that An exaggerated startle reaction in response to a sudden unexpected visual or acoustic stimulus, or a quick movement near the face.

The definition of the Paroxysmal dystonia is that A form of dystonia characterized by episodes of dystonia (often hemidystonia or generalized) lasting from minutes to hours. There are no dystonic symptoms between episodes.

The definition of the Abnormality of neuronal migration is that An abnormality resulting from an anomaly of neuronal migration, i.e., of the process by which neurons travel from their origin to their final position in the brain.
The definition of the Abnormality of the autonomic nervous system is that An abnormality of the autonomic nervous system.
The definition of the Tetraparesis is that Weakness of all four limbs.

The definition of the Horner syndrome is that An abnormality resulting from a lesion of the sympathetic nervous system characterized by a combination of unilateral ptosis, miosis, and often ipsilateral hypohidrosis and conjunctival injection.

The definition of the Enlarged cisterna magna is that Increase in size of the cisterna magna, one of three principal openings in the subarachnoid space between the arachnoid and pia mater, located between the cerebellum and the dorsal surface of the medulla oblongata.
The definition of the Global brain atrophy is that Unlocalized atrophy of the brain with decreased total brain matter volume and increased ventricular size.
The definition of the Fair hair is that A lesser degree of hair pigmentation than would otherwise be expected.
The definition of the Progressive alopecia is that Progressive loss of hair.
The definition of the Alopecia universalis is that Loss of all hair on the entire body.
The definition of the Poliosis is that Circumscribed depigmentation of the hair of the head or the eyelashes.
The definition of the Frontal balding is that Absence of hair in the anterior midline and/or parietal areas. [PMID:19125436]
The definition of the Progressive hypotrichosis is that Progressively reduced or lacking hair growth.
The definition of the Brittle hair is that Fragile, easily breakable hair, i.e., with reduced tensile strength.
The definition of the Hemiplegia is that Paralysis (complete loss of muscle function) in the arm, leg, and in some cases the face on one side of the body.
The definition of the Akinesia is that Inability to initiate changes in activity or movement and to perform ordinary volitional movements rapidly and easily.

The definition of the Athetosis is that A slow, continuous, involuntary writhing movement that prevents maintenance of a stable posture. Athetosis involves continuous smooth movements that appear random and are not composed of recognizable sub-movements or movement fragments. In contrast to chorea, in athetosis, the same regions of the body are repeatedly involved. Athetosis may worsen with attempts at movement of posture, but athetosis can also occur at rest.
The definition of the Drooling is that Excessive production of saliva.

The definition of the Arnold-Chiari malformation is that Chiari malformation consists of a downward displacement of the cerebellar tonsils and the medulla through the foramen magnum, sometimes causing hydrocephalus as a result of obstruction of CSF outflow.
The definition of the Clumsiness is that Lack of physical coordination resulting in an abnormal tendency to drop items or bump into objects.
The definition of the Degeneration of the lateral corticospinal tracts is that Deterioration of the tissues of the lateral corticospinal tracts.
The definition of the Headache is that Cephalgia, or pain sensed in various parts of the head, not confined to the area of distribution of any nerve.
The definition of the Vertigo is that An abnormal sensation of spinning while the body is actually stationary.

The definition of the Resting tremor is that A resting tremor occurs when muscles are at rest and becomes less noticeable or disappears when the affected muscles are moved. Resting tremors are often slow and coarse.

The definition of the Hydranencephaly is that A defect of development of the brain characterized by replacement of greater portions of the cerebral hemispheres and the corpus striatum by cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) and glial tissue.
The definition of the Drowsiness is that Abnormal feeling of sleepiness or difficulty staying awake. [PMID:34589772]
The definition of the Paroxysmal drowsiness is that A neurological disorder marked by a sudden recurrent uncontrollable compulsion to sleep []
The definition of the Motor deterioration is that Loss of previously present motor (i.e., movement) abilities.
The definition of the Abnormality of the cerebellar vermis is that An anomaly of the vermis of cerebellum.
The definition of the Agenesis of cerebellar vermis is that Congenital absence of the vermis of cerebellum.
The definition of the Abnormality of the caudate nucleus is that Any structural abnormality of the caudate nucleus.

The definition of the Cervical cord compression is that Compression of the spinal cord in the cervical region, generally manifested by paresthesias and numbness, weakness, difficulty walking, abnormalities of coordination, and neck pain or stiffness.
The definition of the Intellectual disability, moderate is that Moderate mental retardation is defined as an intelligence quotient (IQ) in the range of 35-49.

The definition of the Normal pressure hydrocephalus is that A form of hydrocephalus characterized by enlarged cerebral ventricles and normal cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) pressure upon lumbar puncture. [eMedicine:1135286, https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199]
The definition of the Action tremor is that A tremor present when the limbs are active, either when outstretched in a certain position or throughout a voluntary movement.
The definition of the Head tremor is that An unintentional, oscillating to-and-fro muscle movement affecting head movement.

The definition of the Focal seizures without impairment of consciousness or awareness is that A type of focal-onset seizure in which awareness is preserved. Awareness during a seizure is defined as the patient being fully aware of themself and their environment throughout the seizure, even if immobile.
The definition of the Leukoencephalopathy is that This term describes abnormality of the white matter of the cerebrum resulting from damage to the myelin sheaths of nerve cells.

The definition of the EEG abnormality is that Abnormality observed by electroencephalogram (EEG), which is used to record of the brain's spontaneous electrical activity from multiple electrodes placed on the scalp.
The definition of the Memory impairment is that An impairment of memory as manifested by a reduced ability to remember things such as dates and names, and increased forgetfulness.
The definition of the Difficulty walking is that Reduced ability to walk (ambulate).

The definition of the Writer's cramp is that A focal dystonia of the fingers, hand, and/or forearm that appears when the affected person attempts to do a task that requires fine motor movements such as writing or playing a musical instrument.
The definition of the Sleep disturbance is that An abnormal pattern in the quality, quantity, or characteristics of sleep. [PMID:32809555]
The definition of the Psychomotor deterioration is that Loss of previously present mental and motor abilities.
The definition of the Shuffling gait is that A type of gait (walking) characterized by by dragging one's feet along or without lifting the feet fully from the ground. []
The definition of the Abnormality of brainstem morphology is that An anomaly of the brainstem.
The definition of the Hypoplasia of the brainstem is that Underdevelopment of the brainstem.
The definition of the Abnormality of the lower motor neuron is that Any structural anomaly of the lower motor neuron.
The definition of the Visual hallucinations is that Visual perception in the absence of a visual stimulus. []

The definition of the Febrile seizures is that A febrile seizure is any type of seizure (most often a generalized tonic-clonic seizure) occurring with fever (at least 38 degrees Celsius) but in the absence of central nervous system infection, severe metabolic disturbance or other alternative precipitant in children between the ages of 3 months and 6 years.

The definition of the Hypokinesia is that Abnormally diminished motor activity. In contrast to paralysis, hypokinesia is not characterized by a lack of motor strength, but rather by a poverty of movement. The typical habitual movements (e.g., folding the arms, crossing the legs) are reduced in frequency.
The definition of the Developmental regression is that Loss of developmental skills, as manifested by loss of developmental milestones.

The definition of the Fasciculations is that Fasciculations are observed as small, local, involuntary muscle contractions (twitching) visible under the skin. Fasciculations result from increased irritability of an axon (which in turn is often a manifestation of disease of a motor neuron). This leads to sporadic discharges of all the muscle fibers controlled by the axon in isolation from other motor units.

The definition of the Focal seizures with impairment of consciousness or awareness is that Focal impaired awareness seizure (or focal seizure with impaired or lost awareness) is a type of focal-onset seizure characterized by some degree (which may be partial) of impairment of the person's awareness of themselves or their surroundings at any point during the seizure.
The definition of the Paraparesis is that Weakness or partial paralysis in the lower limbs.

The definition of the Cavum septum pellucidum is that If the two laminae of the septum pellucidum are not fused then a fluid-filled space or cavum is present. The cavum septum pellucidum is present at birth but usually obliterates by the age of 3 to 6 months. It is up to 1cm in width and the walls are parallel. It is an enclosed space and is not part of the ventricular system or connected with the subarachnoid space.
The definition of the EEG with polyspike wave complexes is that The presence of complexes of repetitive spikes and waves in EEG. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:jalbers]

The definition of the Positive Romberg sign is that The patient stands with the feet placed together and balance and is asked to close his or her eyes. A loss of balance upon eye closure is a positive Romberg sign and is interpreted as indicating a deficit in proprioception.
The definition of the Thickened superior cerebellar peduncle is that Increased width of the superior cerebellar peduncle.
The definition of the Limb dysmetria is that A type of dysmetria involving the limbs.

The definition of the Cerebral arteriovenous malformation is that An anomalous configuration of blood vessels that shunts arterial blood directly into veins without passing through the capillaries and that is located in the brain. []

The definition of the Aqueductal stenosis is that Stenosis of the cerebral aqueduct (also known as the mesencephalic duct, aqueductus mesencephali, or aqueduct of Sylvius), which connects the third cerebral ventricle in the diencephalon to the fourth ventricle, which is between the pons and cerebellum.
The definition of the Myokymia is that Myokymia consists of involuntary, fine, continuous, undulating contractions that spread across the affected striated muscle. [PMID:21501741]
The definition of the Spina bifida is that A heterogeneous group of congenital spinal anomalies that result from defective closure of the neural tube early in fetal life.

The definition of the Leukodystrophy is that Leukodystrophy refers to deterioration of white matter of the brain resulting from degeneration of myelin sheaths in the CNS. Their basic defect is directly related to the synthesis and maintenance of myelin membranes. Symmetric white matter involvement at MRI is a typical finding in patients with leukodystrophies.
The definition of the Abnormality of midbrain morphology is that An abnormality of the midbrain, which has as its parts the tectum, cerebral peduncle, midbrain tegmentum and cerebral aqueduct.

The definition of the Molar tooth sign on MRI is that An abnormal appearance of the midbrain in axial magnetic resonance imaging in which the elongated superior cerebellar peduncles give the midbrain an appearance reminiscent of a molar or wisdom tooth.
The definition of the Poor head control is that Difficulty to maintain correct position of the head while standing or sitting.
The definition of the Anarthria is that A defect in the motor ability that enables speech.

The definition of the Motor aphasia is that Impairment of expressive language and relative preservation of receptive language abilities. That is, the patient understands language (speech, writing) but cannot express it.
The definition of the Meningocele is that Protrusion of the meninges through a defect of the skull or vertebral column.
The definition of the Dyscalculia is that A specific learning disability involving mathematics and arithmetic.
The definition of the Hypothalamic hamartoma is that The presence of a hamartoma of the hypothalamus.

The definition of the Tetraplegia is that Paralysis of all four limbs, and trunk of the body below the level of an associated injury to the spinal cord. The etiology of quadriplegia is similar to that of paraplegia except that the lesion is in the cervical spinal cord rather than in the thoracic or lumbar segments of the spinal cord.
The definition of the Astrocytosis is that Proliferation of astrocytes in the area of a lesion of the central nervous system.
The definition of the Limb dystonia is that A type of dystonia (abnormally increased muscular tone causing fixed abnormal postures) that affects muscles of the limbs.
The definition of the Abnormality of the globus pallidus is that An abnormality of the globus pallidus.

The definition of the Eye of the tiger anomaly of globus pallidus is that The presence, on T2-weighted magnetic resonance imaging, of markedly low signal intensity of the globus pallidus that surrounds a central region of high signal intensity in the anteromedial globus pallidus, producing an eye-of-the-tiger appearance. The sign is thought to represent iron accumulation in the globus pallidus.
The definition of the Distal muscle weakness is that Reduced strength of the musculature of the distal extremities.

The definition of the Spastic dysarthria is that A type of dysarthria related to bilateral damage of the upper motor neuron tracts of the pyramidal and extra- pyramidal tracts. Speech of affected individuals is slow, effortful, and has a harsh vocal quality.
The definition of the Small cerebral cortex is that Reduced size of the cerebral cortex.
The definition of the Expressive language delay is that A delay in the acquisition of the ability to use language to communicate needs, wishes, or thoughts.
The definition of the Myelomeningocele is that Protrusion of the meninges and portions of the spinal cord through a defect of the vertebral column.

The definition of the Hepatic encephalopathy is that Central nervous system dysfunction in association with liver failure and characterized clinically (depending on degree of severity) by lethargy, confusion, nystagmus, decorticate posturing, spasticity, and bilateral Babinski reflexes.
The definition of the Myotonia is that An involuntary and painless delay in the relaxation of skeletal muscle following contraction or electrical stimulation.
The definition of the Hyperkinesis is that Motor hyperactivity with excessive movement of muscles of the body as a whole.
The definition of the Increased CSF lactate is that Increased concentration of lactate in the cerebrospinal fluid.
The definition of the Spasticity of facial muscles is that Spasticity of one or more muscles innervated by the facial nerve. []

The definition of the Abnormality of the corticospinal tract is that Abnormality of the corticospinal tract, which is the chief element of the pyramidal system (the principle motor tract) and is the only direct connection between the cerebrum and the spinal cord.

The definition of the Corticospinal tract dysfunction is that A functional anomaly of the upper motor neuron. The upper motor neurons are neurons of the primary motor cortex which project to the brainstem and spinal chord via the corticonuclear, corticobulbar and corticospinal (pyramidal) tracts. They are involved in control of voluntary movements. Dysfunction leads to weakness, impairment of fine motor movements, spasticity, hyperreflexia and abnormal pyramidal signs.

The definition of the Abnormal rapid eye movement (REM) sleep is that Abnormality of REM Sleep are phases of REM sleep are characterized by desynchronized EEG patterns, increases in heart rate and blood pressure, sympathetic activation, and a profound loss of muscle tone except for the eye and middle-ear muscles. There are also phases of rapid eye movements. [PMID:31910377,PMID:32179430]

The definition of the Impaired vibratory sensation is that A decrease in the ability to perceive vibration. Clinically, this is usually tested with a tuning fork which vibrates at 128 Hz and is applied to bony prominences such as the malleoli at the ankles or the metacarpal-phalangeal joints. There is a slow decay of vibration from the tuning fork. The degree of vibratory sense loss can be crudely estimated by counting the number of seconds that the examiner can perceive the vibration longer than the patient.
The definition of the Abnormality of the cerebral white matter is that An abnormality of the cerebral white matter.
The definition of the Calcification of the small brain vessels is that Deposition of calcium salts within small blood vessels of the brain.
The definition of the Diffuse cerebral atrophy is that Diffuse unlocalised atrophy affecting the cerebrum.

The definition of the Semilobar holoprosencephaly is that A type of holoprosencephaly in which the left and right frontal and parietal lobes are fused and the interhemispheric fissure is only present posteriorly. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:GC_HPE]

The definition of the Brainstem dysplasia is that A developmental structural anomaly of the stalk-like part of the brain that comprises the midbrain (aka mesencephalon), the pons (aka pons Varolii), and the medulla oblongata, and connects the cerebral hemispheres with the cervical spinal cord.
The definition of the Spastic tetraplegia is that Spastic paralysis affecting all four limbs.

The definition of the Alzheimer disease is that A degenerative disease of the brain characterized by the insidious onset of dementia. Impairment of memory, judgment, attention span, and problem solving skills are followed by severe apraxia and a global loss of cognitive abilities. The condition primarily occurs after age 60, and is marked pathologically by severe cortical atrophy and the triad of senile plaques, neurofibrillary tangles, and neuropil threads.
The definition of the Cerebral calcification is that The presence of calcium deposition within brain structures.
The definition of the Increased intracranial pressure is that An increase of the pressure inside the cranium (skull) and thereby in the brain tissue and cerebrospinal fluid.

The definition of the Hypsarrhythmia is that Hypsarrhythmia is abnormal interictal high amplitude waves and a background of irregular spikes. There is continuous (during wakefulness), high-amplitude (>200 Hz), generalized polymorphic slowing with no organized background and multifocal spikes demonstrated by electroencephalography (EEG).
The definition of the Areflexia of lower limbs is that Inability to elicit tendon reflexes in the lower limbs.
The definition of the Cataplexy is that A sudden and transient episode of bilateral loss of muscle tone, often triggered by emotions.
The definition of the Deficit in nonword repetition is that Impaired ability to repeat non-word sounds. Nonword repetition (NWR) is a measure of short-term phonological memory.
The definition of the Axial dystonia is that A type of dystonia that affects the midline muscles, i.e., the chest, abdominal, and back muscles.
The definition of the Abnormal posturing is that Involuntary flexion or extension of the arms and legs.
The definition of the Abnormal cortical gyration is that An abnormality of the gyri (i.e., the ridges) of the cerebral cortex of the brain.
The definition of the Abnormality of the cerebral cortex is that Any structural abnormality of the cerebral cortex.
The definition of the Cortical dysplasia is that The presence of developmental dysplasia of the cerebral cortex.
The definition of the Inability to walk is that Incapability to ambulate.
The definition of the Olivopontocerebellar atrophy is that Neuronal degeneration in the cerebellum, pontine nuclei, and inferior olivary nucleus.
The definition of the Retrocollis is that A form of torticollis in which the head is drawn back, either due to a permanent contractures of neck extensor muscles, or to a spasmodic contracture.
The definition of the Patchy demyelination of subcortical white matter is that Patchy loss of myelin from nerve fibers in the central nervous system.
The definition of the Absent facial hair is that Absence of facial hair.
The definition of the Trichodysplasia is that Developmental dysplasia of the hair.
The definition of the Highly arched eyebrow is that Increased height of the central portion of the eyebrow, forming a crescent, semicircular, or inverted U shape. [PMID:19125427]
The definition of the Absent pubic hair is that Absence of pubic hair.
The definition of the Hypoplastic nipples is that Underdevelopment of the nipple.
The definition of the Supernumerary nipples is that Presence of more than two nipples.
The definition of the Low-set nipples is that Placement of the nipples at a lower than normal location.

The definition of the Constrictive pericarditis is that Presence of a thickened, fibrotic pericardium that forms a non-compliant shell around the heart, and resulting from chronic inflammation of the pericardium.

The definition of the Intestinal malrotation is that An abnormality of the intestinal rotation and fixation that normally occurs during the development of the gut. This can lead to volvulus, or twisting of the intestine that causes obstruction and necrosis.

The definition of the Steatorrhea is that Greater than normal amounts of fat in the feces. This is a result of malabsorption of lipids in the small intestine and results in frothy foul-smelling fecal matter that floats.

The definition of the Achalasia is that A disorder of esophageal motility characterized by the inability of the lower esophageal sphincter to relax during swallowing and by inadequate or lacking peristalsis in the lower half of the body of the esophagus.
The definition of the Episodic vomiting is that Paroxysmal, recurrent episodes of vomiting.
The definition of the Hematochezia is that The passage of fresh (red) blood per anus, usually in or with stools. Most rectal bleeding comes from the colon, rectum, or anus.
The definition of the Episodic abdominal pain is that An intermittent form of abdominal pain.
The definition of the Tracheoesophageal fistula is that An abnormal connection (fistula) between the esophagus and the trachea.
The definition of the Intussusception is that An abnormality of the intestine in which part of the intestine invaginates (telescopes) into another part of the intestine.
The definition of the Abnormality of the stomach is that An abnormality of the stomach.

The definition of the Gastroparesis is that Decreased strength of the muscle layer of stomach, which leads to a decreased ability to empty the contents of the stomach despite the absence of obstruction.

The definition of the Gastrointestinal dysmotility is that Abnormal intestinal contractions, such as spasms and intestinal paralysis, related to the loss of the ability of the gut to coordinate muscular activity because of endogenous or exogenous causes.
The definition of the Volvulus is that Abnormal twisting of a portion of intestine around itself or around a stalk of mesentery tissue.

The definition of the Chronic atrophic gastritis is that Atrophic gastritis (AG) is a histopathological entity that is characterized by chronic inflammation of the gastric mucosa with loss of gastric glandular cells and replacement by intestinal-type epithelium, pyloric-type glands, and fibrous tissue.

The definition of the Colitis is that Colitis refers to an inflammation of the colon and is often used to describe an inflammation of the large intestine (colon, cecum and rectum). Colitides may be acute and self-limited or chronic, and broadly fit into the category of digestive diseases.
The definition of the Intestinal bleeding is that Bleeding from the intestines.
The definition of the Abnormality of the peritoneum is that An abnormality of the peritoneum.
The definition of the Peritonitis is that Inflammation of the peritoneum.
The definition of the Projectile vomiting is that Vomiting that ejects the gastric contents with great force.
The definition of the Duodenal ulcer is that An erosion of the mucous membrane in a portion of the duodenum.
The definition of the Polyphagia is that A neurological anomaly with gross overeating associated with an abnormally strong desire or need to eat.
The definition of the Gastric ulcer is that An ulcer, that is, an erosion of an area of the gastric mucous membrane.
The definition of the Intestinal lymphangiectasia is that Angiectasia of lymph vessels (i.e., dilatation of lymphatic vessels) in the intestines.
The definition of the Pancreatic hypoplasia is that Hypoplasia of the pancreas.
The definition of the Ileus is that Acute obstruction of the intestines preventing passage of the contents of the intestines.
The definition of the Abnormality of the vasculature is that An abnormality of the vasculature.
The definition of the Head titubation is that A head tremor of moderate speed (3 to 4 Hz) in the anterior-posterior direction.
The definition of the Hyporeflexia of lower limbs is that Reduced intensity of muscle tendon reflexes in the lower limbs. Reflexes are elicited by stretching the tendon of a muscle, e.g., by tapping.
The definition of the Gastrointestinal telangiectasia is that Telangiectasia affecting the gastrointestinal tract.
The definition of the Hepatic necrosis is that The presence of cell death (necrosis) affecting the liver.
The definition of the Bowel incontinence is that Involuntary fecal soiling in adults and children who have usually already been toilet trained.
The definition of the Congenital hepatic fibrosis is that The presence of fibrosis of that part of the liver with congenital onset.

The definition of the Biliary cirrhosis is that Progressive destruction of the small-to-medium bile ducts of the intrahepatic biliary tree, which leads to progressive cholestasis and often end-stage liver disease.
The definition of the Hepatic periportal necrosis is that A type of hepatic necrosis that is concentrated around the necrosis of hepatocytes localized around the intrahepatic branch of portal vein.
The definition of the Hypotension is that Low Blood Pressure, vascular hypotension.
The definition of the Aortic root dilation is that An abnormal localized widening (dilatation) of the aortic root. []
The definition of the Aneurysm is that Abnormal outpouching or sac-like dilatation in the wall of an atery, vein or the heart.
The definition of the Varicose veins is that Enlarged and tortuous veins.

The definition of the Atherosclerosis is that In type IV atherosclerotic lesions a dense accumulation of extracellular lipid occupies an extensive but well-defined region of the intima. This type of extracellular lipid accumulation is known as the lipid core. A fibrous tissue increase is not a feature, and complications such as defects of the lesion surface and thrombosis are not present. The type IV lesion is also known as atheroma. Type IV is the first lesion considered advanced in this classification because of the severe intimal disorganization caused by the lipid core. The characteristic core appears to develop from an increase and the consequent confluence of the small isolated pools of extracellular lipid that characterize type III lesions. The increase in lipid is believed to result from continued insudation from the plasma. Type IV lesions, when they first appear in younger people, are found in the same locations as adaptive intimal thickenings of the eccentric type. Thus, atheroma is, at least initially, an eccentric lesion. [PMID:7648691]

The definition of the Overriding aorta is that An overriding aorta is a congenital heart defect where the aorta is positioned directly over a ventricular septal defect, instead of over the left ventricle. The result is that the aorta receives some blood from the right ventricle, which reduces the amount of oxygen in the blood. It is one of the four conditions of the Tetralogy of Fallot. The aortic root can be displaced toward the front (anteriorly) or directly above the septal defect, but it is always abnormally located to the right of the root of the pulmonary artery. The degree of override is quite variable, with 5-95% of the valve being connected to the right ventricle.
The definition of the Venous abnormality is that An anomaly of vein.

The definition of the Deep venous thrombosis is that Formation of a blot clot in a deep vein. The clot often blocks blood flow, causing swelling and pain. The deep veins of the leg are most often affected.

The definition of the Venous varicosities of celiac and mesenteric vessels is that Elongated and tortuous mesenteric veins, which comprise the inferior mesenteric vein and the superior mesenteric vein.

The definition of the Right aortic arch with mirror image branching is that The aortic arch crosses the right mainstem bronchus and not the left mainstem bronchus, but does not result in the creation of a vascular ring. The first branch is the left brachiocephalic artery which divides into the left carotid artery and left subclavian artery, the second branch is the right carotid artery, the third branch is the right subclavian artery. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown, https://orcid.org/0009-0006-4530-3154]
The definition of the Fat malabsorption is that Abnormality of the absorption of fat from the gastrointestinal tract.
The definition of the Vasculitis is that Inflammation of blood vessel.
The definition of the Arteriosclerosis is that Sclerosis (hardening) of the arteries with increased thickness of the wall of arteries as well as increased stiffness and a loss of elasticity.

The definition of the Atheromatosis is that In type IV atherosclerotic lesions a dense accumulation of extracellular lipid occupies an extensive but well-defined region of the intima. This type of extracellular lipid accumulation is known as the lipid core. A fibrous tissue increase is not a feature, and complications such as defects of the lesion surface and thrombosis are not present. The type IV lesion is also known as atheroma. Type IV is the first lesion considered advanced in this classification because of the severe intimal disorganization caused by the lipid core. The characteristic core appears to develop from an increase and the consequent confluence of the small isolated pools of extracellular lipid that characterize type III lesions. The increase in lipid is believed to result from continued insudation from the plasma. Type IV lesions, when they first appear in younger people, are found in the same locations as adaptive intimal thickenings of the eccentric type. Thus, atheroma is, at least initially, an eccentric lesion. [PMID:7648691]
The definition of the Aneurysm of an abdominal artery is that Abnormal outpouching or sac-like dilatation in an artery that originates from the abdominal aorta.
The definition of the Cerebral ischemia is that Restriction of arterial blood supply to the brain associated with insufficient oxygenation to support the metabolic requirements of the tissue. []
The definition of the Superficial thrombophlebitis is that Inflammation of a superficial vein associated with venous thrombosis (blood clot formation within the vein).

The definition of the Budd-Chiari syndrome is that Budd-Chiari syndrome (BCS) is caused by obstruction of hepatic venous outflow at any level from the small hepatic veins to the junction of the inferior vena cava (IVC) with the right atrium, 1 and occurs in 1/100,000 of the general population worldwide. The most common presentation is with ascites, but can range from fulminant hepatic failure (FHF) to asymptomatic forms. Obstruction of hepatic venous outflow is mainly caused by primary intravascular thrombosis, which can occur suddenly or be repeated over time, accompanied by some revascularization, accounting for the variable parenchymal hepatic damage and histologic presentation. Budd-Chiari syndrome is thus a disease, but since it occurs as a manifestation of several other diseases, this term is kept for the present for convenience.
The definition of the Hypertension associated with pheochromocytoma is that A type of hypertension associated with pheochromocytoma.
The definition of the Neonatal respiratory distress is that Respiratory difficulty as newborn.
The definition of the Abnormality of pelvic girdle bone morphology is that An abnormality of the bony pelvic girdle, which is a ring of bones connecting the vertebral column to the femurs.

The definition of the Wormian bones is that The presence of extra bones within a cranial suture. Wormian bones are irregular isolated bones which appear in addition to the usual centers of ossification of the cranium.
The definition of the Aortic dissection is that Aortic dissection refers to a tear in the intimal layer of the aorta causing a separation between the intima and the medial layers of the aorta.
The definition of the Scoliosis is that The presence of an abnormal lateral curvature of the spine.
The definition of the Skeletal dysplasia is that A general term describing features characterized by abnormal development of bones and connective tissues.
The definition of the Bone pain is that An unpleasant sensation characterized by physical discomfort (such as pricking, throbbing, or aching) localized to bone. []
The definition of the Spondyloepiphyseal dysplasia is that A disorder of bone growth affecting the vertebrae and the ends of the long bones (epiphyses).

The definition of the Increased susceptibility to fractures is that An abnormally increased tendency to fractures of bones caused by an abnormal reduction in bone strength that is generally associated with an increased risk of fracture.
The definition of the Painless fractures due to injury is that An increased tendency to fractures following trauma, with fractures occurring without pain.

The definition of the Neoplasm is that An organ or organ-system abnormality that consists of uncontrolled autonomous cell-proliferation which can occur in any part of the body as a benign or malignant neoplasm (tumor).
The definition of the Lymphoma is that A cancer originating in lymphocytes and presenting as a solid tumor of lymhpoid cells.

The definition of the Pheochromocytoma is that Pheochromocytomas (also known as chromaffin tumors) produce, store, and secrete catecholamines. Pheochromocytomas usually originate from the adrenal medulla but may also develop from chromaffin cells in or about sympathetic ganglia. A common symptom of pheochromocytoma is hypertension owing to release of catecholamines.
The definition of the Nephroblastoma (Wilms tumor) is that The presence of a nephroblastoma, which is a neoplasm of the kidney that primarily affects children.

The definition of the Paraganglioma is that A carotid body tumor (also called paraganglionoma or chemodectoma) is a tumor found in the upper neck at the branching of the carotid artery. They arise from the chemoreceptor organ (paraganglion) located in the adventitia of the carotid artery bifurcation.

The definition of the Osteosarcoma is that A malignant bone tumor that usually develops during adolescence and usually affects the long bones including the tibia, femur, and humerus. The typical symptoms of osteosarcoma comprise bone pain, fracture, limitation of motion, and tenderness or swelling at the site of the tumor.
The definition of the Basal cell carcinoma is that The presence of a basal cell carcinoma of the skin.

The definition of the Coxa valga is that Coxa valga is a deformity of the hip in which the angle between the femoral shaft and the femoral neck is increased compared to age-adjusted values (about 150 degrees in newborns gradually reducing to 120-130 degrees in adults).
The definition of the Cloverleaf skull is that Trilobar skull configuration when viewed from the front or behind. [PMID:19125436, PMID:29089832]
The definition of the Small foramen magnum is that An abnormal narrowing of the foramen magnum.
The definition of the Abnormality of the sella turcica is that Abnormality of the sella turcica, a saddle-shaped depression in the sphenoid bone at the base of the human skull.

The definition of the J-shaped sella turcica is that A deformity of the sella turcica whereby the sella extends further anterior than normal such that the anterior clinoid process appears to overhang it, giving the appearance of the letter J on imaging of the skull.
The definition of the Broad skull is that Increased width of the skull.

The definition of the Abnormality of the calvaria is that Abnormality of the morphology (structure) of the calvaria (skullcap), that is, of that part of the skull that is made up of the superior portions of the frontal bone, occipital bone, and parietal bones and covers the cranial cavity that contains the brain.
The definition of the Thickened calvaria is that The presence of an abnormally thick calvaria.

The definition of the Abnormality of the frontal sinuses is that An abnormality of the frontal sinus, one of the mucosa-lined, normally air-filled paranasal sinuses of the bones of the skull. The frontal sinus is located within the frontal bone.
The definition of the Large sella turcica is that An abnormal enlargement of the sella turcica.

The definition of the Platybasia is that A developmental malformation of the occipital bone and upper end of the cervical spine, in which the latter appears to have pushed the floor of the occipital bone upward such that there is an abnormal flattening of the skull base.

The definition of the Abnormality of the skull base is that An abnormality of the base of the skull, which forms the floor of the cranial cavity and separates the brain from other facial structures. The skull base is made up of five bones: the ethmoid, sphenoid, occipital, paired frontal, and paired parietal bones, and is subdivided into 3 regions: the anterior, middle, and posterior cranial fossae. The petro-occipital fissure subdivides the middle cranial fossa into 1 central component and 2 lateral components.
The definition of the Sclerosis of skull base is that Increased bone density of the skull base without significant changes in bony contour.
The definition of the Abnormality of the parietal bone is that Any abnormality of the parietal bone of the skull.
The definition of the Parietal foramina is that The presence of symmetrical and circular openings (foramina) in the parietal bone ranging in size from a few millimeters to several centimeters wide.
The definition of the Abnormality of the foramen magnum is that Any abnormality of the foramen magnum.
The definition of the Large foramen magnum is that An abnormal increase in the size of the foramen magnum.
The definition of the Abnormality of skull ossification is that An abnormality of the process of ossification of the skull.
The definition of the High, narrow palate is that The presence of a high and narrow palate.
The definition of the Palate telangiectasia is that The presence of small (ca. 0.5-1.0 mm) dilated blood vessels near the surface of the mucous membranes of the palate.

The definition of the Prominent median palatal raphe is that Unusual prominence of the median palatal raphe, which is the ridge formed by the fusion of the two plates of the skull that form the hard palate.
The definition of the Commissural lip pit is that A depression located at an oral commissure.
The definition of the Exaggerated median tongue furrow is that Increased depth of the median tongue furrow.

The definition of the Downturned corners of mouth is that A morphological abnormality of the mouth in which the angle of the mouth is downturned. The oral commissures are positioned inferior to the midline labial fissure.
The definition of the Abnormality of the immune system is that An abnormality of the immune system.
The definition of the Lymphadenopathy is that Enlargment (swelling) of a lymph node.
The definition of the Recurrent bacterial infections is that Increased susceptibility to bacterial infections, as manifested by recurrent episodes of bacterial infection.
The definition of the Recurrent infections is that Increased susceptibility to infections.
The definition of the IgA deficiency is that Decreased levels of immunoglobulin A (IgA).
The definition of the Recurrent abscess formation is that An increased susceptibility to abscess formation, as manifested by a medical history of recurrent abscesses.
The definition of the Recurrent Aspergillus infections is that An increased susceptibility to Aspergillus infections, as manifested by a history of recurrent episodes of Aspergillus infections.

The definition of the Systemic lupus erythematosus is that A chronic, relapsing, inflammatory, and often febrile multisystemic disorder of connective tissue, characterized principally by involvement of the skin, joints, kidneys, and serosal membranes.

The definition of the Recurrent Staphylococcus aureus infections is that Increased susceptibility to Staphylococcus aureus infections, as manifested by recurrent episodes of Staphylococcus aureus infection.
The definition of the Chronic mucocutaneous candidiasis is that Recurrent or persistent superficial Candida infections of the skin, mucous membranes, and nails.
The definition of the Chronic noninfectious lymphadenopathy is that A chronic form of lymphadenopathy that is not related to infection.
The definition of the Defective lymphocyte apoptosis is that A reduction in the rate of apoptosis in lymphocytes.
The definition of the Lymph node hypoplasia is that Underdevelopment of the lymph nodes.
The definition of the Abnormality of the lymph nodes is that A structural lymph node abnormality.
The definition of the Hypoplastic frontal sinuses is that Underdevelopment of frontal sinus.
The definition of the Recurrent E. coli infections is that Increased susceptibility to infections with Escherichia coli, as manifested by recurrent episodes of infection with this agent.

The definition of the Recurrent Serratia marcescens infections is that Increased susceptibility to Serratia marcescens infections, as manifested by recurrent episodes of Serratia marcescens infection.
The definition of the Recurrent Klebsiella infections is that Increased susceptibility to Klebsiella infections, as manifested by recurrent episodes of Klebsiella infection.
The definition of the Recurrent enteroviral infections is that Increased susceptibility to enteroviral infections, as manifested by recurrent episodes of enteroviral infection.
The definition of the Bilateral cleft lip and palate is that Cleft lip and cleft palate affecting both sides of the face.
The definition of the Oral leukoplakia is that A thickened white patch on the oral mucosa that cannot be rubbed off.

The definition of the Rickets is that Rickets is divided into two major categories including calcipenic and phosphopenic. Hypophosphatemia is described as a common manifestation of both categories. Hypophosphatemic rickets is the most common type of rickets that is characterized by low levels of serum phosphate, resistance to ultraviolet radiation or vitamin D intake. There are several issues involved in hypophosphatemic rickets such as calcium, vitamin D, phosphorus deficiencies. Moreover, other disorder can be associated with its occurrence such as absorption defects due to pancreatic, intestinal, gastric, and renal disorders and hepatobiliary disease. Symptoms are usually seen in childhood and can be varied in severity. Severe forms may be linked to bowing of the legs, poor bone growth, and short stature as well as joint and bone pain. Hypophosphatemic rickets are associated with renal excretion of phosphate, hypophosphatemia, and mineral defects in bones. The familial type of the disease is the most common type of rickets. [GARD:0005700]

The definition of the Osteomalacia is that Osteomalacia is a general term for bone weakness owing to a defect in mineralization of the protein framework known as osteoid. This defective mineralization is mainly caused by lack in vitamin D. Osteomalacia in children is known as rickets.
The definition of the Kyphoscoliosis is that An abnormal curvature of the spine in both a coronal (lateral) and sagittal (back-to-front) plane.
The definition of the Thin bony cortex is that Abnormal thinning of the cortical region of bones.
The definition of the Osteomyelitis is that Osteomyelitis is an inflammatory process accompanied by bone destruction and caused by an infecting microorganism.

The definition of the Pathologic fracture is that A pathologic fracture occurs when a bone breaks in an area that is weakened secondarily to another disease process such as tumor, infection, and certain inherited bone disorders. A pathologic fracture can occur without a degree of trauma required to cause fracture in healthy bone.
The definition of the Recurrent fractures is that The repeated occurrence of bone fractures (implying an abnormally increased tendency for fracture).

The definition of the Osteoarthritis is that Degeneration (wear and tear) of articular cartilage, i.e., of the joint surface. Joint degeneration may be accompanied by osteophytes (bone overgrowth), narrowing of the joint space, regions of sclerosis at the joint surface, or joint deformity. []
The definition of the Generalized joint laxity is that Joint hypermobility (ability of a joint to move beyond its normal range of motion) affecting many or all joints of the body.

The definition of the Multiple exostoses is that Presence of more than one exostosis. An exostosis is a benign growth the projects outward from the bone surface. It is capped by cartilage, and arises from a bone that develops from cartilage.
The definition of the Abnormal cartilage morphology is that Any morphological abnormality of cartilage.
The definition of the Stippled chondral calcification is that Punctate (speckled, dot-like) deposition of calcium of calcium salts in the articular cartilage (cartilage located in joints).
The definition of the Abnormality of the trachea is that A structural anomaly of the trachea.
The definition of the Upper airway obstruction is that Increased resistance to the passage of air in the upper airway.

The definition of the Recurrent lower respiratory tract infections is that An increased susceptibility to lower respiratory tract infections as manifested by a history of recurrent lower respiratory tract infections.

The definition of the Tracheobronchomalacia is that Weakness of the cartilage in the trachea and the bronchi, resulting in a floppy (non-rigid) airway. Affected persons may have difficulties to maintain patency of the airways.
The definition of the Tracheal calcification is that Calcification (abnormal deposits of calcium) in the tracheal tissues.

The definition of the Recurrent upper respiratory tract infections is that An increased susceptibility to upper respiratory tract infections as manifested by a history of recurrent upper respiratory tract infections (running ears - otitis, sinusitis, pharyngitis, tonsillitis).
The definition of the Tachypnea is that Very rapid breathing.

The definition of the Hypoventilation is that A reduction in the amount of air transported into the pulmonary alveoli by breathing, leading to hypercapnia (increase in the partial pressure of carbon dioxide).

The definition of the Reduced vital capacity is that An abnormal reduction on the vital capacity, which is defined as the total lung capacity (volume of air in the lungs at maximal inflation) less the residual volume (i.e., volume of air in the lungs following maximal exhalation) of the lung.
The definition of the Abnormal pattern of respiration is that An anomaly of the rhythm or depth of breathing.
The definition of the Osteolysis is that Osteolysis refers to the destruction of bone through bone resorption with removal or loss of calcium.
The definition of the Congenital contracture is that One or more flexion contractures (a bent joint that cannot be straightened actively or passively) that are present at birth.
The definition of the Arthrogryposis multiplex congenita is that Multiple congenital contractures in different body areas.
The definition of the Kyphosis is that Exaggerated anterior convexity of the thoracic vertebral column.
The definition of the Coxa vara is that Coxa vara includes all forms of decrease of the femoral neck shaft angle (the angle between the neck and the shaft of the femur) to less than 120 degrees.
The definition of the Abnormality of limb bone morphology is that Any abnormality of bones of the arms or legs.
The definition of the Abnormality of the lower limb is that An abnormality of the leg.
The definition of the Abnormality of the knees is that An abnormality of the knee joint or surrounding structures.
The definition of the Abnormality of the upper limb is that An abnormality of the arm.
The definition of the Abnormality of the radius is that An abnormality of the radius.
The definition of the Abnormality of the femur is that Any anomaly of the structure of the femur.

The definition of the Halberd-shaped pelvis is that An anomalous radiographic appearance of the developing pelvis, in which the greater ischiadic noth (incisura ischiadica major) is shallow and the pelvis takes on the appearance said to resemble a halberd (a weapon especially of the 15th and 16th centuries consisting typically of a battle-ax and pike mounted on a handle).
The definition of the Hip dislocation is that Displacement of the femur from its normal location in the hip joint.
The definition of the Arthralgia is that Joint pain.

The definition of the Cystic angiomatosis of bone is that Disseminated multifocal hemangiomatous or lymphangiomatous lesions of the skeleton. The lesions are lytic, well-defined, round or oval lesions within the medullary cavity, and they have an intact cortex, and manifest variable peripheral sclerosis and may exhibit endosteal scalloping.
The definition of the Aspiration is that Inspiration of a foreign object into the airway.
The definition of the Bladder exstrophy is that Eversion of the posterior bladder wall through the congenitally absent lower anterior abdominal wall and anterior bladder wall.
The definition of the Recurrent bronchitis is that An increased susceptibility to bronchitis as manifested by a history of recurrent bronchitis.
The definition of the Urinary bladder sphincter dysfunction is that Abnormal function of a sphincter of the urinary bladder.
The definition of the Lymphadenitis is that Inflammation of a lymph node.
The definition of the Recurrent fungal infections is that Increased susceptibility to fungal infections, as manifested by multiple episodes of fungal infection.

The definition of the Recurrent Burkholderia cepacia infections is that Increased susceptibility to infections with Burkholderia cepacia, as manifested by recurrent episodes of infection with this agent.
The definition of the Abnormality of T cells is that An abnormality of T cells.
The definition of the Abnormality of B cells is that A structural abnormality of B cells.

The definition of the Impaired memory B-cell generation is that Impaired production of memory cells, the B cells that persist for years or an entire lifetime and which confer rapid and enhanced response to secondary challenge.

The definition of the Specific anti-polysaccharide antibody deficiency is that The presence of normal overall immunoglobulin levels with deficiency of specific immunoglobulins directed against bacterial polysaccharides.

The definition of the Absence of lymph node germinal center is that Absence of germinal centers in lymph nodes. Germinal centers are the parts of lymph nodes in which B lymphocytes proliferate, differentiate, mutate through somatic hypermutation and class switch during antibody responses.
The definition of the IgM deficiency is that An abnormally decreased level of immunoglobulin M (IgM) in blood.
The definition of the Genu valgum is that The legs angle inward, such that the knees are close together and the ankles far apart.
The definition of the Meningioma is that The presence of a meningioma, i.e., a benign tumor originating from the dura mater or arachnoid mater.
The definition of the Squamous cell carcinoma is that The presence of squamous cell carcinoma of the skin.

The definition of the Melanoma is that The presence of a melanoma, a malignant cancer originating from pigment producing melanocytes. Melanoma can originate from the skin or the pigmented layers of the eye (the uvea).
The definition of the Bladder carcinoma is that The presence of a carcinoma of the urinary bladder.

The definition of the Myelodysplasia is that Clonal hematopoietic stem cell disorders characterized by dysplasia (ineffective production) in one or more hematopoietic cell lineages, leading to anemia and cytopenia.
The definition of the Medullary thyroid carcinoma is that The presence of a medullary carcinoma of the thyroid gland.
The definition of the Abnormality of the ilium is that An abnormality of the ilium, the largest and uppermost bone of the pelvis.
The definition of the Flared iliac wings is that Widening of the ilium ala, that is of the wing of the ilium, combined with external rotation, leading to a flared appearance of the iliac wing.

The definition of the Obstructive sleep apnea is that Obstructive Sleep Apnea is a condition characterized by the obstruction of the airway and pauses in breathing during sleep, which occur multiple times throughout the night. It is related to the relaxation of muscle tone that typically happens during sleep, leading to a partial collapse of the soft tissues in the airway and causing airflow obstruction. [PMID:35609941]

The definition of the Central apnea is that Apnea resulting from depression of the respiratory centers in the medulla oblongata. There is a lack of respiratory effort rather than obstruction of airflow.
The definition of the Apneic episodes precipitated by illness, fatigue, stress is that Recurrent episodes of apnea that are precipitated by factors such as illness, fatigue, or stress.
The definition of the Episodic tachypnea is that Episodes of very rapid breathing.

The definition of the Respiratory failure is that A severe form of respiratory insufficiency characterized by inadequate gas exchange such that the levels of oxygen or carbon dioxide cannot be maintained within normal limits.
The definition of the Sudden episodic apnea is that Recurrent bouts of sudden, severe apnea that may be life-threatening.

The definition of the Hyperventilation is that Hyperventilation refers to an increased pulmonary ventilation rate that is faster than necessary for the exchange of gases. Hyperventilation can result from increased frequency of breathing, an increased tidal volume, or both, and leads to an excess intake of oxygen and the blowing off of carbon dioxide.

The definition of the Hepatoblastoma is that A kind of neoplasm of the liver that originates from immature liver precursor cells and macroscopically is composed of tissue resembling fetal or mature liver cells or bile ducts. [eMedicine:986802, https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199]

The definition of the Medulloblastoma is that A rapidly growing embryonic tumor arising in the posterior part of the cerebellar vermis and neuroepithelial roof of the fourth ventricle in children. More rarely, medulloblastoma arises in the cerebellum in adults.
The definition of the Ependymoma is that The presence of an ependymoma of the central nervous system.
The definition of the Thyroid carcinoma is that The presence of a carcinoma of the thyroid gland.
The definition of the Uterine leiomyosarcoma is that The presence of a leiomyosarcoma of the uterus.
The definition of the Pituitary adenoma is that A benign epithelial tumor derived from intrinsic cells of the adenohypophysis (anterior pituitary).
The definition of the Neoplasm of the pancreas is that A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the pancreas.
The definition of the Papillary thyroid carcinoma is that The presence of a papillary adenocarcinoma of the thyroid gland.
The definition of the Neoplasm of the liver is that A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the liver.
The definition of the Parathyroid adenoma is that A benign tumor of the parathyroid gland that can cause hyperparathyroidism.
The definition of the Hypokalemia is that An abnormally decreased potassium concentration in the blood.
The definition of the Hyponatremia is that An abnormally decreased sodium concentration in the blood.
The definition of the Hyperbilirubinemia is that An increased amount of bilirubin in the blood.
The definition of the Microscopic hematuria is that Microscopic hematuria detected by dipstick or microscopic examination of the urine.
The definition of the Generalized aminoaciduria is that An increased concentration of all types of amino acid in the urine.

The definition of the Elevated hepatic transaminases is that Elevations of the levels of SGOT and SGPT in the serum. SGOT (serum glutamic oxaloacetic transaminase) and SGPT (serum glutamic pyruvic transaminase) are transaminases primarily found in the liver and heart and are released into the bloodstream as the result of liver or heart damage. SGOT and SGPT are used clinically mainly as markers of liver damage.
The definition of the Myoglobinuria is that Presence of myoglobin in the urine.
The definition of the Abnormality of chromosome segregation is that An abnormality of chromosome segregation.
The definition of the Hypermagnesemia is that An abnormally increased magnesium concentration in the blood.

The definition of the Ketonuria is that High levels of ketone bodies (acetoacetic acid, beta-hydroxybutyric acid, and acetone) in the urine. Ketone bodies are insignificant in the blood and urine of normal individuals in the postprandial or overnight-fasted state.

The definition of the Decreased circulating ACTH level is that The concentration of corticotropin, also known as adrenocorticotropic hormone (ACTH), is below the lower limit of normal in the blood circulation.
The definition of the Abnormality of the cerebrospinal fluid is that An abnormality of the cerebrospinal fluid (CSF).
The definition of the Increased CSF protein is that Increased concentration of protein in the cerebrospinal fluid. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:KI_phemming, PMID:29114301]
The definition of the Rheumatoid factor positive is that The presence in the serum of an autoantibody directed against the Fc portion of IgG.
The definition of the Thyroid-stimulating hormone excess is that Increased concentration of thyroid-stimulating hormone (TSH) in the blood circulation.
The definition of the Abnormality of thyroid physiology is that An abnormal functionality of the thyroid gland.
The definition of the Histidinuria is that An increased concentration of histidine in the urine.

The definition of the Thyroid hormone receptor defect is that Reduced sensitivity of end organs to thyroid hormone characterized by elevated serum levels of free thyroid hormone with nonsuppressed thyroid stimulating hormone.
The definition of the Aldehyde oxidase deficiency is that A reduction in aldehyde oxidase level.
The definition of the Ventral hernia is that Ventral hernia refers to a condition in which abdominal contents protrude through a weakened portion of the abdominal wall.
The definition of the Distal sensory impairment is that An abnormal reduction in sensation in the distal portions of the extremities.
The definition of the Hemivertebrae is that Absence of one half of the vertebral body.
The definition of the Lumbar hyperlordosis is that An abnormal accentuation of the inward curvature of the spine in the lumbar region.
The definition of the Thoracic kyphosis is that Over curvature of the thoracic region, leading to a round back or if sever to a hump.
The definition of the Intervertebral space narrowing is that Decreased height of the intervertebral disk.
The definition of the Cervical kyphosis is that Exaggerated convexity of the cervical vertebral column, causing the cervical spine to bow outwards and take on a rounded appearance.
The definition of the Vertebral fusion is that A developmental defect leading to the union of two adjacent vertebrae.
The definition of the Fused cervical vertebrae is that A congenital anomaly characterized by a joining (fusion) of two or more cervical vertebral bodies with one another. []
The definition of the Partial absence of cerebellar vermis is that Congenital absence of a part of the vermis of cerebellum.

The definition of the Granulomatosis is that A granulomatous inflammation leading to multiple granuloma formation, which is a specific type of inflammation. A granuloma is a focal compact collection of inflammatory cells, mononuclear cells predominating, usually as a result of the persistence of a non-degradable product and of active cell mediated hypersensitivity.
The definition of the Impaired Ig class switch recombination is that An impairment of the class-switch recombination process that normally leads B lymphocytes to produce IgG, IgA, or IgE.
The definition of the Autoimmunity is that The occurrence of an immune reaction against the organism's own cells or tissues.
The definition of the Dysgammaglobulinemia is that Selective deficiency of one or more, but not all, classes of immunoglobulins.

The definition of the Abnormal delayed hypersensitivity skin test is that Delay in cutaneous immune reaction to specific antigens mediated not by antibodies but by cells. The delayed hypersensitivity test is an immune function test measuring the presence of activated T cells that recognize a specific antigen and is performed by injecting a small amount of the antigen into the skin. The area of the injection is examined 48-72 hours thereafter.
The definition of the Cutaneous anergy is that Inability to react to a delayed hypersensitivity skin test.
The definition of the Cubitus valgus is that Abnormal positioning in which the elbows are turned out.
The definition of the Genu varum is that A positional abnormality marked by outward bowing of the legs in which the knees stay wide apart when a person stands with the feet and ankles together.
The definition of the Reduced delayed hypersensitivity is that Decreased ability to react to a delayed hypersensitivity skin test.
The definition of the Abnormality of the forearm is that An abnormality of the lower arm.
The definition of the Radioulnar synostosis is that An abnormal osseous union (fusion) between the radius and the ulna.
The definition of the aplasia/Hypoplasia involving the central nervous system is that Absence or underdevelopment of tissue in the central nervous system.
The definition of the Bowing of the legs is that A bending or abnormal curvature affecting a long bone of the leg.
The definition of the Femoral bowing is that Bowing (abnormal curvature) of the femur.
The definition of the Abnormality of the calf is that An abnormality of the calf, i.e. of the posterior part of the lower leg.
The definition of the Tibial bowing is that A bending or abnormal curvature of the tibia.
The definition of the Micromelia is that The presence of abnormally small extremities.
The definition of the Hypoplasia of the radius is that Underdevelopment of the radius.

The definition of the Elbow flexion contracture is that An elbow contracture that limits the ability of the elbow joint to be extended (straightened), meaning that the elbow is fixed in an flexed (bent) position.
The definition of the Fibular aplasia is that Absence of the fibula.
The definition of the Abnormality of the tibia is that Abnormality of the tibia (shinbone).

The definition of the Patellar dislocation is that The kneecap normally is located within the groove termed trochlea on the distal femur and can slide up and down in it. Patellar dislocation occurs if the patella fully dislocates out of the groove.
The definition of the Breast carcinoma is that The presence of a carcinoma of the breast.

The definition of the Ganglioneuroma is that A benign neoplasm that usually arises from the sympathetic trunk in the mediastinum, representing a tumor of the sympathetic nerve fibers arising from neural crest cells.

The definition of the Neuroblastoma is that Neuroblastoma is a solid tumor that originate in neural crest cells of the sympathetic nervous system. Most neuroblastomas originate in the abdomen, and most abdominal neuroblastomas originate in the adrenal gland. Neuroblastomas can also originate in the thorax, usually in the posterior mediastinum.
The definition of the Prolonged bleeding time is that Prolongation of the time taken for a standardized skin cut of fixed depth and length to stop bleeding.
The definition of the Abnormality of the musculature is that Abnormality originating in one or more muscles, i.e., of the set of muscles of body.
The definition of the Bulging epiphyses is that A morphological abnormality of epiphyses whereby they are abnormally outwardly curving (protuberant).
The definition of the Flared metaphyses is that The presence of a splayed (i.e.,flared) metaphyseal segment of one or more long bones.
The definition of the Metaphyseal widening is that Abnormal widening of the metaphyseal regions of long bones.
The definition of the Abnormality of the wrist is that Abnormality of the wrist, the structure connecting the hand and the forearm.
The definition of the Metaphyseal cupping is that Metaphyseal cupping refers to an inward bulging of the metaphyseal profile giving the metaphysis a cup-like appearance.
The definition of the Hypoplasia of the ulna is that Underdevelopment of the ulna.
The definition of the Bowing of limbs due to multiple fractures is that Curvature of the shafts of the long bones due to multiple fractures.
The definition of the Metaphyseal irregularity is that Irregularity of the normally smooth surface of the metaphyses.
The definition of the Short long bones is that One or more abnormally short long bone.
The definition of the Mesomelia is that Shortening of the middle parts of the limbs (forearm and lower leg) in relation to the upper and terminal segments.
The definition of the Ulnar bowing is that Bending of the diaphysis (shaft) of the ulna.
The definition of the Diaphyseal sclerosis is that An elevation in bone density in one or more diaphyses. Sclerosis is normally detected on a radiograph as an area of increased opacity.
The definition of the Enlarged joints is that Increase in size of one or more joints.
The definition of the Fibular hypoplasia is that Underdevelopment of the fibula.
The definition of the Arthropathy is that An abnormal structure or form of the joints, i.e., one or more of the articulations where two bones join.
The definition of the Humeroradial synostosis is that An abnormal osseous union (fusion) between the radius and the humerus.
The definition of the Elbow dislocation is that Dislocation of the distal humerus out of the elbow joint, where the radius, ulna, and humerus meet.
The definition of the Abnormality of the shoulder is that An abnormality of the shoulder, which is defined as the structures surrounding the shoulder joint where the humerus attaches to the scapula.

The definition of the Shoulder flexion contracture is that Chronic reduction in active and passive mobility of the shoulder joint due to structural changes in muscle, tendons, ligaments, or skin that prevents normal movement.
The definition of the Abnormality of the patella is that Abnormality of the patella (knee cap).
The definition of the Radial head subluxation is that Partial dislocation of the head of the radius.
The definition of the Enlarged metaphyses is that Abnormal increase in size of one or more metaphyses.
The definition of the Tetraamelia is that Amelia of all four limbs.
The definition of the Abnormality of the humerus is that An abnormality of the humerus (i.e., upper arm bone).
The definition of the Patellar hypoplasia is that Underdevelopment of the patella.
The definition of the Flattened epiphyses is that Abnormal flatness (decreased height) of epiphyses.
The definition of the Hypercalcemia is that An abnormally increased calcium concentration in the blood.
The definition of the Hypoalbuminemia is that Reduction in the concentration of albumin in the blood.
The definition of the Hypoproteinemia is that A decreased concentration of protein in the blood. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:gcarletti]
The definition of the Hyperlipidemia is that An elevated lipid concentration in the blood.
The definition of the Hydroxyprolinuria is that An increased concentration of 4-hydroxy-L-proline in the urine. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:gcarletti]
The definition of the Increased urinary potassium is that An increased concentration of potassium(1+) in the urine.
The definition of the Dislocated radial head is that A dislocation of the head of the radius from its socket in the elbow joint.
The definition of the Long fibula is that Disproportionately long fibulae.
The definition of the Hypoplasia of the capital femoral epiphysis is that Underdevelopment of the proximal epiphysis of the femur.
The definition of the Trophic limb changes is that Trophic changes occurring in a limb.

The definition of the Limited hip extension is that Limitation of the extension of the hip, i.e., decreased ability to straighten the hip joint and thereby increase the angle between torso and thigh; moving the thigh or top of the pelvis backward.
The definition of the Short femur is that An abnormal shortening of the femur.
The definition of the Fibular overgrowth is that Relatively increased growth of the fibula compared to that of the tibia.
The definition of the Slender long bone is that Reduced diameter of a long bone.

The definition of the Increased carrying angle is that An abnormal increase in the carrying angle, which is the angle he long axis of the extended forearm as it lies lateral to the long axis of the arm.
The definition of the Hyperphosphaturia is that An increased excretion of phosphates in the urine.
The definition of the Abnormality of urine homeostasis is that An abnormality of the composition of urine or the levels of its components.
The definition of the Abnormality of ion homeostasis is that Abnormality of the homeostasis (concentration) of a monoatomic ion.
The definition of the Abnormality of serum amino acid levels is that The presence of an abnormal decrease or increase of one or more amino acids in the blood circulation.
The definition of the Hypochloremia is that An abnormally decreased chloride concentration in the blood.
The definition of the Abnormal EKG is that Abnormal rhythm of the heart. []
The definition of the Abnormality of circulating hormone level is that Concentration of a hormone in the blood circulation outside of normal limits.

The definition of the Increased circulating cortisol level is that Overproduction of the hormone of cortisol by the adrenal cortex, resulting in a characteristic combination of clinical symptoms termed Cushing syndrome, with truncal obesity, a round, full face, striae atrophicae and acne, muscle weakness, and other features.
The definition of the Abnormality of lipid metabolism is that Any deviation from the normal concentration of a lipid in the blood circulation.

The definition of the Limb joint contracture is that A contracture (chronic loss of joint motion due to structural changes in muscle, tendons, ligaments, or skin) that prevent normal movement of one or more joints of the limbs.
The definition of the Low-molecular-weight proteinuria is that Excretion in urine of proteins of a size smaller than albumin (molecular weight 69 kD). [PMID:95574]

The definition of the Abnormal peripheral myelination is that An abnormality of the myelination of motor and sensory peripheral nerves. These are axons for motor nerves and dendrites for sensory nerves in the strict anatomic sense. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:jbaets, https://orcid.org/0000-0002-9102-5232]

The definition of the Abnormality of the spinocerebellar tracts is that An abnormality of the spinocerebellar tracts, a set of axonal fibers originating in the spinal cord and terminating in the ipsilateral cerebellum. The spinocerebellar tract convey information to the cerebellum about limb and joint position (proprioception). They comprise the ventral spinocerebellar tract, the anterior spinocerebellar tract, and the posterior spinocerebellar tract.

The definition of the Abnormality of peripheral nerve conduction is that An abnormality of the conduction of electrical impulses by peripheral (motor or sensory) nerves. This finding is elicited by a nerve conduction study (NCS).
The definition of the Increased blood urea nitrogen (BUN) is that An increased amount of nitrogen in the form of urea in the blood. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:gcarletti]
