The definition of the Increased serum serotonin is that A increased concentration of serotonin in the blood.
The definition of the Decreased adenosylcobalamin is that Decreased concentration of adenosylcobalamin. Adenosylcobalamin is one of the active forms of vitamin B12.
The definition of the Hypocholesterolemia is that An decreased concentration of cholesterol in the blood. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:gcarletti]
The definition of the Glutaric aciduria is that The concentration of glutaric acid in the urine, normalized for urine concentration, is above the upper limit of normal. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:gcarletti]
The definition of the Cystathioninuria is that An elevated urinary concentration of cystathionine.
The definition of the Increased circulating ACTH level is that An abnormal increased in the concentration of corticotropin, also known as adrenocorticotropic hormone (ACTH), in the blood.
The definition of the Elevated alkaline phosphatase is that Abnormally increased serum levels of alkaline phosphatase activity.
The definition of the Hyposthenuria is that An abnormally low urinary specific gravity, i.e., reduced concentration of solutes in the urine.
The definition of the Hyperoxaluria is that Increased excretion of oxalates in the urine.

The definition of the Abnormal isoelectric focusing of serum transferrin is that Glycosylated transferrin concentrations can be measured in serum as a marker of N-linked glycosylation fidelity. In the traditional nomenclature for congenital disorders of glycosylation, absence of entire glycans was designated type I, and loss of one or more monosaccharides as type II. These terms are retained for historical reasons but for new annotations the precise glycosylation defect should be recorded.
The definition of the 4-Hydroxyphenylpyruvic aciduria is that Increased relative concentration of 4-hydroxyphenylpyruvic acid in the urine.
The definition of the Elevated urinary delta-aminolevulinic acid is that An increased concentration of 5-aminolevulinic acid (CHEBI:17549) in the urine.
The definition of the Elevated circulating parathyroid hormone (PTH) level is that An abnormal increased concentration of parathyroid hormone.
The definition of the Increased urinary taurine is that Increased concentration of taurine in the urine.
The definition of the Carnosinuria is that An increased concentration of carnosine in the urine.
The definition of the Abnormality of the acetabulum is that An abnormality of the acetabulum, i.e., the Acetabular part of hip bone, which together with the head of the femur forms the hip joint.
The definition of the Abnormality of the ischium is that An anomaly of the ischium, which forms the lower and back part of the hip bone.
The definition of the Hypoplastic ischia is that Underdevelopment of the ischium, which forms the lower and back part of the hip bone.
The definition of the Squared iliac bones is that A shift from the normally round (convex) appearance of the iliac wing towards a square-like appearance.
The definition of the Protrusio acetabuli is that Intrapelvic bulging of the medial acetabular wall.

The definition of the Flat acetabular roof is that Flattening of the superior part of the acetabulum, which is a cup-shaped cavity at the base of the hipbone into which the ball-shaped head of the femur fits. The acetabular roof thereby appears horizontal rather than arched, as it normally does.
The definition of the Wide pubic symphysis is that Abnormally increased width of the pubic symphysis is the midline cartilaginous joint uniting the superior rami of the left and right pubic bones.
The definition of the Inverted nipples is that The presence of nipples that instead of pointing outward are retracted inwards.
The definition of the Breast hypoplasia is that Underdevelopment of the breast.

The definition of the Long nose is that Distance from nasion to subnasale more than two standard deviations above the mean, or alternatively, an apparently increased length from the nasal root to the nasal base. [PMID:19152422]
The definition of the Cleft ala nasi is that The presence of a notch in the margin of the ala nasi.

The definition of the Short nasal bridge is that Decreased superior-inferior length of the nasal bridge, which is the saddle-shaped area that includes the nasal root and the lateral aspects of the nose. []

The definition of the Short nose is that Distance from nasion to subnasale more than two standard deviations below the mean, or alternatively, an apparently decreased length from the nasal root to the nasal tip.
The definition of the Myopathy is that A disorder of muscle unrelated to impairment of innervation or neuromuscular junction.

The definition of the Ragged-red muscle fibers is that An abnormal appearance of muscle fibers observed on muscle biopsy. Ragged red fibers can be visualized with Gomori trichrome staining as irregular and intensely red subsarcolemmal zones, whereas the normal myofibrils are green. The margins of affect fibers appear red and ragged. The ragged-red is due to the accumulation of abnormal mitochondria below the plasma membrane of the muscle fiber, leading to the appearance of a red rim and speckled sarcoplasm.
The definition of the Rhabdomyolysis is that Breakdown of muscle fibers that leads to the release of muscle fiber contents (myoglobin) into the bloodstream.
The definition of the Amyotrophy is that The presence of skeletal muscular atrophy (which is also known as amyotrophy).

The definition of the Negative nitroblue tetrazolium (NBT) reduction test is that In the NBT test, neutrophils change the colorless compound NBT into a compound with a deep blue color. If this test is negative (i.e., no blue color is produced), then this indicates a defect in superoxide-generating NADPH oxidase activity with inability to efficiently kill phagocytized bacteria.
The definition of the Intracellular accumulation of autofluorescent lipopigment storage material is that The intracellular accumulation of autofluorescent storage material.

The definition of the Curvilinear intracellular accumulation of autofluorescent lipopigment storage material is that An intracellular accumulation of autofluorescent lipopigment storage material in a curved pattern.
The definition of the Arterial calcification is that Pathological deposition of calcium salts in one or more arteries.
The definition of the Decreased pyruvate carboxylase activity is that A decreased rate of pyruvate carboxylase activity.
The definition of the Decreased methylmalonyl-CoA mutase activity is that An abnormality of Krebs cycle metabolism that is characterized by a decreased rate of methylmalonyl-CoA mutase activity.
The definition of the Increased IgE level is that An abnormally increased overall level of immunoglobulin E in blood.
The definition of the Dicarboxylic aciduria is that An increased concentration of dicarboxylic acid in the urine. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:gcarletti]
The definition of the Generalized amyloid deposition is that A diffuse form of amyloidosis.
The definition of the Ethylmalonic aciduria is that The concentration of ethylmalonic acid in the urine, normalized for urine concentration, is above the upper limit of normal.
The definition of the Abnormality of chromosome stability is that A type of chromosomal aberration characterised by reduced resistance of chromosomes to change or deterioration.

The definition of the Chromosomal breakage induced by crosslinking agents is that Increased amount of chromosomal breaks in cultured blood lymphocytes or other cells induced by treatment with DNA cross-linking agents such as diepoxybutane and mitomycin C.
The definition of the Decreased methylcobalamin is that Decreased concentration of methylcobalamin. Methylcobalamin is a form of vitamin B12.

The definition of the Rectilinear intracellular accumulation of autofluorescent lipopigment storage material is that An intracellular accumulation of autofluorescent lipopigment storage material in a straight or rectilinear pattern.
The definition of the Hypernatremia is that An abnormally increased sodium concentration in the blood.
The definition of the Hypertyrosinemia is that An increased concentration of tyrosine in the blood.
The definition of the Decreased plasma carnitine is that Concentration of carnitine in the blood circulation below the lower limit of normal. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:gcarletti]

The definition of the Elevated serum creatine phosphokinase is that An elevation of the level of the enzyme creatine kinase (also known as creatine phosphokinase (CK; EC 2.7.3.2) in the blood. CK levels can be elevated in a number of clinical disorders such as myocardial infarction, rhabdomyolysis, and muscular dystrophy.
The definition of the Increased IgG level is that An abnormally increased level of immunoglobulin G in blood.
The definition of the External genital hypoplasia is that Underdevelopment of part or all of the external reproductive organs.
The definition of the Penile hypospadias is that Location of the urethral opening on the inferior aspect of the penis.
The definition of the Prominent scrotal raphe is that Increased size of the ridge of tissue that extends along the midline of the scrotum.
The definition of the aplasia of the vagina is that Aplasia of the vagina.
The definition of the Abnormality of DNA repair is that An abnormality of the process of DNA repair, that is, of the process of restoring DNA after damage.
The definition of the Abnormality of the coagulation cascade is that An abnormality of the process of blood coagulation. That is, altered ability or inability of the blood to clot.
The definition of the Elevated serum creatinine is that An increased amount of creatinine in the blood. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:gcarletti]
The definition of the Hydroxyprolinemia is that An increased concentration of hydroxyproline in the blood. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:gcarletti]
The definition of the Increased IgA level is that An abnormally increased level of immunoglobulin A in blood.
The definition of the Smooth muscle antibody positivity is that The presence in serum of antibodies against smooth muscle.
The definition of the Neonatal hyperbilirubinemia is that A type of hyperbilirubinemia with neonatal onset.
The definition of the Reduced orotidine 5-prime phosphate decarboxylase activity is that An abnormal decrease in orotidine 5'-phosphate decarboxylase level. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:gcarletti]
The definition of the Abdominal distention is that Distention of the abdomen.
The definition of the Visceromegaly is that Abnormal increased size of the viscera of the abdomen.
The definition of the Abnormality of the hip bone is that An abnormality of the hip bone.

The definition of the Hip contracture is that Lack of full passive range of motion (restrictions in flexion, extension, or other movements) of the hip joint resulting from structural changes of non-bony tissues, such as muscles, tendons, ligaments, joint capsules and/or skin. [PMID:16214063, PMID:24975760, PMID:31282072]
The definition of the Hypoplastic acetabulae is that Underdeveloped acetabulae.
The definition of the Narrow pelvis is that Reduced side to side width of the pelvis.

The definition of the Pelvic exostoses is that A benign growth the projects outward from the bone surface of the pelvis. Exostoses are capped by cartilage, and arise from a bone that develops from cartilage.
The definition of the Coxa magna is that Widening of the femoral head and neck.
The definition of the Increased serum ferritin is that Increased concentration of ferritin in the blood circulation.
The definition of the Cystathioninemia is that An increased concentration of cystathionine in the blood. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:gcarletti, PMID:16902722]
The definition of the Abnormality of mitochondrial metabolism is that A functional anomaly of mitochondria.
The definition of the Decreased serum leptin is that A decreased concentration of leptin in the blood.
The definition of the Hyperthreoninuria is that An increased concentration of threonine in the urine.
The definition of the Hyperlysinuria is that An increased concentration of lysine in the urine.
The definition of the Spina bifida occulta is that The closed form of spina bifida with incomplete closure of a vertebral body with intact overlying skin.

The definition of the Ovoid vertebral bodies is that When viewed in lateral radiographs, vertebral bodies have a roughly rectangular configuration. This term applies if the vertebral body appears rounded or oval.
The definition of the Irregular vertebral endplates is that An irregular surface of the vertebral end plates, which are normally relatively smooth.
The definition of the Spondylolisthesis is that Complete bilateral fractures of the pars interarticularis resulting in the anterior slippage of the vertebra.

The definition of the Spondylolysis is that Spondylolysis is an osseous defect of the pars interarticularis, thought to be a developmental or acquired stress fracture secondary to chronic low-grade trauma.
The definition of the Block vertebrae is that Congenital synostosis between two or more adjacent vertebrae (partial or complete fusion of adjacent vertabral bodies).

The definition of the Abnormality of the odontoid process is that Abnormal structure of the odontoid process, which is a part of the C2 or axis vertebra and forms pivot of the structures forming the craniovertebral junction. The odontoid process is also known as the dens of the axis.
The definition of the Hypoplasia of the odontoid process is that Developmental hypoplasia of the dens of the axis.
The definition of the Abnormal form of the vertebral bodies is that Abnormal morphology of vertebral body. []

The definition of the Butterfly vertebrae is that A butterfly vertebra (sagittal cleft vertebra or anterior rachischisis) is a sagittal defect in the vertebral body caused by failure of fusion of the two lateral chondrification centers during embryogenesis. The name is based on the appearance of the two hemivertebrae emerging as butterfly wings from the central cleft on x-ray.
The definition of the Abnormality of the cervical spine is that Any abnormality of the cervical vertebral column.
The definition of the C1-C2 subluxation is that A partial dislocation of the atlantoaxial joints.
The definition of the Generalized muscle weakness is that Generalized weakness or decreased strength of the muscles, affecting both distal and proximal musculature.

The definition of the Limb-girdle muscle weakness is that Weakness of the limb-girdle muscles (also known as the pelvic and shoulder girdles), that is, lack of strength of the muscles around the shoulders and the pelvis.
The definition of the Myalgia is that Pain in muscle.
The definition of the Axial muscle weakness is that Reduced strength of the axial musculature (i.e., of the muscles of the head and neck, spine, and ribs).
The definition of the Abnormal bone structure is that Any anomaly in the composite material or the layered arrangement of the bony skeleton.
The definition of the Elevated circulating catecholamine level is that An abnormal increase in catecholamine concentration in the blood.

The definition of the Abnormal enchondral ossification is that An abnormality of the process of endochondral ossification, which is a type of replacement ossification in which bone tissue replaces cartilage.

The definition of the Reduced prothrombin consumption is that The prothrombin consumption test measures the formation of intrinsic thromboplastin by determining the residual serum prothrombin after blood clotting is complete. If there is a defect in the process, less prothrombin will be converted to thrombin than normal (less prothrombin is consumed). This test may be abnormal with conditions including deficiency of factors VIII or IX, with circulating anticoagulants, thrombocytopenia.

The definition of the Pyrimidine-responsive megaloblastic anemia is that A type of megaloblastic anemia that improves upon administration of pyrimidine supplements such as uridylic acid and cytidylic acid.
The definition of the Junctional split is that The formation of bullae (blisters) with cleavage in the lamina lucida layer of the skin.
The definition of the Elevated urinary norepinephrine is that The concentration of noradrenaline in the urine, normalized for urine concentration, is above the upper limit of normal.

The definition of the Impaired lymphocyte transformation with phytohemagglutinin is that Normal peripheral blood lymphocytes, when stimulated by phytohemagglutinin (PHA) are cytotoxic for homologous and heterologous cells but not for autologous cells in monolayer culture. The cytotoxic effect is thought to be indicative of the immunological competence of the lymphocytes.
The definition of the Hyperalaninemia is that An increased concentration of alanine in the blood. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:gcarletti, PMID:16902722, PMID:4696900]
The definition of the Low cholesterol esterification rates is that A reduction in the rate of cholesterol esterification.
The definition of the Decreased circulating renin level is that An decreased level of renin in the blood.
The definition of the Endopolyploidy on chromosome studies of bone marrow is that An increase in the number of chromosome sets per cell in bone marrow cells.
The definition of the Hyperthreoninemia is that An increased concentration of threonine in the blood.
The definition of the Aminoaciduria is that An increased concentration of an amino acid in the urine.
The definition of the Elevated intracellular cystine is that An increased concentration of cystine within cells. This finding can be demonstrated on leukocytes, but is not specific to blood cells.
The definition of the Decreased urinary sulfate is that Decreased concentration of sulfate in the urine.
The definition of the Tryptophanuria is that An increased concentration of tryptophan in the urine. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:gcarletti, PMID:18901181]

The definition of the Abdominal situs inversus is that A left-right reversal (or mirror reflection") of the anatomical location of the major thoracic and abdominal organs." [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown, https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199]
The definition of the Arthralgia of the hip is that Joint pain affecting the hip.
The definition of the Abnormality of the femoral neck is that An abnormality of the femoral neck (which is the process of bone, connecting the femoral head with the femoral shaft).
The definition of the Abnormality of the femoral head is that An abnormality of the femoral head.
The definition of the Flat capital femoral epiphysis is that An abnormal flattening of the proximal epiphysis of the femur.
The definition of the Enlargement of the proximal femoral epiphysis is that An abnormal enlargement of the proximal epiphysis of the femur.

The definition of the Steppage gait is that An abnormal gait pattern that arises from weakness of the pretibial and peroneal muscles due to a lower motor neuron lesion. Affected patients have footdrop and are unable to dorsiflex and evert the foot. The leg is lifted high on walking so that the toes clear the ground, and there may be a slapping noise when the foot strikes the ground again.
The definition of the Axonal degeneration/regeneration is that A pattern of simultaneous degeneration and regeneration of axons (see comment).

The definition of the Decreased number of peripheral myelinated nerve fibers is that A loss of myelinated nerve fibers in the peripheral nervous system (in general, this finding can be observed on nerve biopsy).

The definition of the Onion bulb formation is that Repeated episodes of segmental demyelination and remyelination lead to the accumulation of supernumerary Schwann cells around axons, which is referred to as onion bulb formation. This finding affects peripheral nerves.
The definition of the Peripheral axonal atrophy is that Atrophic changes of axons of the peripheral nervous system.
The definition of the Decreased number of large peripheral myelinated nerve fibers is that A reduced number of large myelinated nerve fibers.
The definition of the Easy fatigability is that Increased susceptibility to fatigue.
The definition of the Sensory axonal neuropathy is that An axonal neuropathy of peripheral sensory nerves.
The definition of the Gowers sign is that A phenomenon whereby patients are not able to stand up without the use of the hands owing to weakness of the proximal muscles of the lower limbs.
The definition of the Muscle cramps is that Sudden and involuntary contractions of one or more muscles.

The definition of the Syringomyelia is that Dilated, glial-lined cavity in spinal cord. This cavity does not communicate with the central canal, and usually is between the dorsal columns unilaterally or bilaterally along the side of the cord.

The definition of the Abnormality of the neuromuscular junction is that Any abnormality of the neuromuscular junction, which is the synapse between the motor end plate of a motor neuron and the skeletal muscle fibers.
The definition of the Basal lamina 'onion bulb' formation is that A type of onion bulb formation prominently affecting the area of the basal lamina.
The definition of the Paresthesia is that Abnormal sensations such as tingling, pricking, or numbness of the skin with no apparent physical cause.

The definition of the Decreased miniature endplate potentials is that An abnormal reduction in the amplitude of the miniature endplate potentials, i.e. the postsynaptic response to transmitter released from an individual vesicle at the neuromuscular junction.

The definition of the EMG: decremental response of compound muscle action potential (CMAP) to repetitive nerve stimulation is that A compound muscle action potential (CMAP) is a type of electromyography (EMG). CMAP refers to a group of almost simultaneous action potentials from several muscle fibers in the same area evoked by stimulation of the supplying motor nerve and are recorded as one multipeaked summated action potential. This abnormality refers to a greater than normal decrease in the amplitude during the course of the investigation.
The definition of the Atlantoaxial dislocation is that Partial dislocation of the atlantoaxial joint.
The definition of the Spinal canal stenosis is that An abnormal narrowing of the spinal canal.
The definition of the CNS hypomyelination is that Reduced amount of myelin in the central nervous system resulting from defective myelinogenesis.
The definition of the Decreased motor nerve conduction velocity is that A type of decreased nerve conduction velocity that affects the motor neuron.

The definition of the Prolonged miniature endplate currents is that An abnormal prolongation of the miniature endplate potentials, i.e. the postsynaptic response to transmitter released from an individual vesicle at the neuromuscular junction.

The definition of the Absent Achilles reflex is that Absence of the Achilles reflex (also known as the ankle jerk reflex), which can normally be elicited by tapping the tendon is tapped while the foot is dorsiflexed.
The definition of the Decreased size of nerve terminals is that A reduction in the size of nerve terminals.
The definition of the EMG: chronic denervation signs is that Evidence of chronic denervation on electromyography.

The definition of the EMG: neuropathic changes is that The presence of characteristic findings of denervation on electromyography (fibrillations, positive sharp waves, and giant motor unit potentials).
The definition of the Axonal loss is that A reduction in the number of axons in the peripheral nervous system.
The definition of the Decreased sensory nerve conduction velocity is that Reduced speed of conduction of the action potential along a sensory nerve.
The definition of the Cold-induced muscle cramps is that Sudden and involuntary contractions of one or more muscles brought on by exposure to cold temperatures.
The definition of the Axonal regeneration is that The presence of axonal regeneration following a previous axonal lesion.
The definition of the Increased rate of premature chromosome condensation is that An increased rate of premature chromosome condensation.
The definition of the Antineutrophil antibody positivity is that The presence of autoantibodies in the serum that react against neutrophils.
The definition of the Platelet antibody positive is that The presence in the serum of autoantibodies directed against thrombocytes.
The definition of the Elevated long chain fatty acids is that Increased concentration of long-chain fatty acids in the blood circulation.
The definition of the EMG abnormality is that Abnormal results of investigations using electromyography (EMG).
The definition of the EMG: myopathic abnormalities is that The presence of abnormal electromyographic patterns indicative of myopathy, such as small-short polyphasic motor unit potentials.
The definition of the Total immunoglobulin A deficiency is that Undetectable serum immunoglobulin A level at a value < 5 mg/dL (0.05 g/L).
The definition of the Increased urinary O-linked sialopeptides is that Excretion of peptides conjugated to sialic acid in the urine.

The definition of the Increased extraneuronal autofluorescent lipopigment is that Lipofuscin, a generic term applied to autofluorescent lipopigment, is a mixture of protein and lipid that accumulates in most aging cells, particularly those involved in high lipid turnover (e.g., the adrenal medulla) or phagocytosis of other cell types (e g., the retinal pigment epithelium or RPE; macrophage). This term pertains if there is an increase in the extraneuronal accumulation of lipofuscin (also known as autofluorescent lipoprotein) more than expected for the age of the patient.
The definition of the Abnormality of the vertebrae is that An abnormality of one or more of the vertebrae.

The definition of the Peripheral dysmyelination is that Defective structure and function of myelin sheaths. Dysmyelination is distinguished from demyleination where there is destruction or damage of previously normal myelination.

The definition of the Paralysis is that Paralysis of voluntary muscles means loss of contraction due to interruption of one or more motor pathways from the brain to the muscle fibers. Although the word paralysis is often used interchangeably to mean either complete or partial loss of muscle strength, it is preferable to use paralysis or plegia for complete or severe loss of muscle strength, and paresis for partial or slight loss. Motor paralysis results from deficits of the upper motor neurons (corticospinal, corticobulbar, or subcorticospinal). Motor paralysis is often accompanied by an impairment in the facility of movement.
The definition of the Hypocalcemic tetany is that Hyperexcitability of the neuromuscular system related to abnormally low level of calcium in the blood, resulting in carpopedal or generalized spasms.

The definition of the Fatigable weakness is that A type of weakness that occurs after a muscle group is used and lessens if the muscle group has some rest. That is, there is diminution of strength with repetitive muscle actions.

The definition of the Sensory impairment is that An abnormality of the primary sensation that is mediated by peripheral nerves (pain, temperature, touch, vibration, joint position). The word hypoesthesia (or hypesthesia) refers to a reduction in cutaneous sensation to a specific type of testing.
The definition of the Peripheral axonal neuropathy is that An abnormality characterized by disruption of the normal functioning of peripheral axons.
The definition of the Segmental peripheral demyelination/remyelination is that A segmental pattern of demyelination and regeneration (remyelination) affecting peripheral nerves.

The definition of the EMG: axonal abnormality is that Electromyographic (EMG) findings characteristic of axonal neuropathy, with normal or slightly decreased nerve conduction velocities, normal or slightly prolonged distal latencies, but significantly reduced motor potentials and sensory amplitudes. There may be spontaneous activity upon needle EMG studies, such as increased insertional activity, positive sharp waves, and fibrillation potentials.
The definition of the Upper limb muscle weakness is that Weakness of the muscles of the arms.

The definition of the Babinski sign is that Upturning of the big toe (and sometimes fanning of the other toes) in response to stimulation of the sole of the foot. If the Babinski sign is present it can indicate damage to the corticospinal tract.

The definition of the Elevated urine pyrophosphate is that An abnormally increased diphosphate(4-) concentration in the urine. Diphosphate(4-), as ester with two phosphate groups, is also known as pyrophosphate.
The definition of the Antinuclear antibody positivity is that The presence of autoantibodies in the serum that react against nuclei or nuclear components.
The definition of the Increased IgM level is that An abnormally increased level of immunoglobulin M in blood.
The definition of the Disproportionate short stature is that A kind of short stature in which different regions of the body are shortened to differing extents.
The definition of the Mild short stature is that A mild degree of short stature, more than -2 SD but not more than -3 SD from mean corrected for age and sex.
The definition of the Proportionate short stature is that A kind of short stature in which different regions of the body are shortened to a comparable extent.
The definition of the Severe short stature is that A severe degree of short stature, more than -4 SD from the mean corrected for age and sex.
The definition of the Reduced ratio of renal calcium clearance to creatinine clearance is that A reduction of the ratio of renal calcium clearance to creatinine clearance to below 0.01.
The definition of the Disproportionate short-trunk short stature is that A type of disproportionate short stature characterized by a short trunk but a average-sized limbs.
The definition of the Decreased methionine synthase activity is that A reduction in methionine synthase activity.
The definition of the Hyperprostaglandinuria is that An increased concentration of prostaglandin in the urine.

The definition of the Parathormone-independent increased renal tubular calcium reabsorption is that An increase in the reabsorption of calcium by the renal tubulus that is not associated with increased parathormone levels.
The definition of the Ornithinuria is that Level of ornithine in the urine above the upper limit of normal.
The definition of the Reduced xanthine dehydrogenase activity is that An abnormal reduction in xanthine dehydrogenase level.
The definition of the Increased serum iduronate sulfatase activity is that An increased level of iduronate-2-sulfatase activity in the blood.

The definition of the Impaired platelet aggregation is that An impairment in the rate and degree to which platelets aggregate after the addition of an agonist that stimulates platelet clumping. Platelet aggregation is measured using aggregometer to measure the optical density of platelet-rich plasma, whereby platelet aggregation causes the plasma to become more transparent.

The definition of the Urinary glycosaminoglycan excretion is that Excretion of glycosaminoglycan in the urine. Glycosaminoglycans are long unbranched polysaccharides consisting of a repeating disaccharide unit.

The definition of the Shoulder girdle muscle weakness is that The shoulder, or pectoral, girdle is composed of the clavicles and the scapulae. Shoulder-girdle weakness refers to lack of strength of the muscles attaching to these bones, that is, lack of strength of the muscles around the shoulders.

The definition of the Subsarcolemmal accumulations of abnormally shaped mitochondria is that An abnormally increased number of mitochondria in the cytoplasma adjacent to the sarcolemma (muscle cell membrane), whereby the mitochondria also possess an abnormal morphology.
The definition of the Abnormality of connective tissue is that Any abnormality of the soft tissues, including both connective tissue (tendons, ligaments, fascia, fibrous tissues, and fat).
The definition of the Predominantly lower limb lymphedema is that Localized fluid retention and tissue swelling caused by a compromised lymphatic system, affecting mainly the legs.
The definition of the Difficulty climbing stairs is that Reduced ability to climb stairs.
The definition of the Muscle stiffness is that A condition in which muscles cannot be moved quickly without accompanying pain or spasm.
The definition of the Type 2 muscle fiber atrophy is that Atrophy (wasting) affecting primary type 2 muscle fibers. This feature in general can only be observed on muscle biopsy.

The definition of the Muscle fiber splitting is that Fiber splitting or branching is a common finding in human and rat skeletal muscle pathology. Fiber splitting refers to longitudinal halving of the complete fiber, while branching originates from a regenerating end of a necrotic fiber as invaginations of the sarcolemma. In fiber branching, one end of the fiber remains intact as a single entity, while the other end has several branches. [PMID:6123177]
The definition of the Increased variability in muscle fiber diameter is that An abnormally high degree of muscle fiber size variation. This phenotypic feature can be observed upon muscle biopsy.
The definition of the Viral infection-induced rhabdomyolysis is that Rhabdomyolysis induced by a viral infection.

The definition of the Muscular dystrophy is that The term dystrophy means abnormal growth. However, muscular dystrophy is used to describe primary myopathies with a genetic basis and a progressive course characterized by progressive skeletal muscle weakness and wasting, defects in muscle proteins, and histological features of muscle fiber degeneration (necrosis) and regeneration. If possible, it is preferred to use other HPO terms to describe the precise phenotypic abnormalities.
The definition of the Hypobetalipoproteinemia is that An decreased concentration of low-density lipoprotein cholesterol in the blood. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:gcarletti]
The definition of the Increased serum prostaglandin E2 is that An increased concentration of prostaglandin E2 in the blood.
The definition of the Low plasma citrulline is that A decreased concentration of citrulline in the blood. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:gcarletti]
The definition of the Increased total bilirubin is that Increased concentration of total (conjugated and unconjugated) bilirubin in the blood.

The definition of the Positive regitine blocking test is that A positive response to the regitine blocking test consisting of a substantial reduction in blood pressure following administration of regitine, indicative of the presence of increased levels of epinephrine and norepinephrine in the circulation, which is seen in pheochromocytoma-associated hypertension.
The definition of the Absent urinary urothione is that Lack of urothione (the urinary metabolite of molybdenum cofactor) in the urine.
The definition of the 4-Hydroxyphenylacetic aciduria is that Increased concentration of 4-hydroxyphenylacetic acid in the urine.
The definition of the Foam cells with lamellar inclusion bodies is that The presence of foam cells that contain lamellar inclusion bodies.
The definition of the Fibroblast metachromasia is that Increased cytoplasmic staining of fibroblasts with toluidine blue.
The definition of the Antiphospholipid antibody positivity is that The presence of circulating autoantibodies to phospholipids.
The definition of the Trimethylaminuria is that Increased concentration of trimethylamine in the urine.
The definition of the Generalized amyoplasia is that Congenital lack of development of the muscles, which are then replaced by a mixture of dense fat and fibrous tissue.

The definition of the Foam cells in visceral organs and CNS is that The presence of foam cells, a type of macrophage that localizes to fatty deposits on blood vessel walls, in the central nervous system. []
The definition of the Hemoglobinuria is that The presence of free hemoglobin in the urine.

The definition of the Type I transferrin isoform profile is that Abnormal transferrin isoform profile consistent with a type I congenital disorder of glycosylation. In the traditional nomenclature for congenital disorders of glycosylation, absence of entire glycans was designated type I, and loss of one or more monosaccharides as type II.

The definition of the Prolonged partial thromboplastin time is that Increased time to coagulation in the partial thromboplastin time (PTT) test, a measure of the intrinsic and common coagulation pathways. Phospholipid, and activator, and calcium are mixed into an anticoagulated plasma sample, and the time is measured until a thrombus forms.
The definition of the Bicarbonaturia is that Abnormally increased concentration of hydrogencarbonate in the urine.
The definition of the Lacticaciduria is that An increased concentration of lactic acid in the urine.
The definition of the Abnormality of glycoside metabolism is that Abnormality of glycoside metabolism.

The definition of the Foam cells is that The presence of foam cells, a type of macrophage that localizes to fatty deposits on blood vessel walls, where they ingest low-density lipoproteins and become laden with lipids, giving them a foamy appearance.

The definition of the Recurrent myoglobinuria is that Recurring episodes of myoglobinuria, i.e., of the presence of myoglobin in the urine. This is usually a consequence of rhabdomyolysis, i.e., of the destruction of muscle tissue.

The definition of the Cellular metachromasia is that Metachromasia (also known as metachromacy) is a characteristic color change which certain aniline dyes exhibit when bound to particular substances or when concentrated in solution. For example, the basic dye toluidine blue becomes distinctly pink when bound to cartilage matrix. In the sense used here, the metachromasia refers to a change in color not observed with normal tissues, anomalous staining with the cationic dyes toluidine blue O and Alcian blue resulting from excessive amounts of the polyanionic glycosaminoglycans.
The definition of the Reduced dihydropyrimidine dehydrogenase activity is that An abnormal reduction in dihydropyrimidine dehydrogenase (NADP+) level. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:gcarletti]
The definition of the Hypomethioninemia is that A decreased concentration of methionine in the blood. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:gcarletti]
The definition of the Amyotrophy of the musculature of the pelvis is that Muscular atrophy affecting the muscles of the pelvis.

The definition of the Centrally nucleated skeletal muscle fibers is that An abnormality in which the nuclei of sarcomeres take on an abnormally central localization (or in which this feature is found in an increased proportion of muscle cells).
The definition of the Decreased activity of cytochrome C oxidase in muscle tissue is that An abnormally reduced activity of the enzyme cytochrome C oxidase in muscle tissue.
The definition of the Multiple mitochondrial DNA deletions is that The presence of multiple deletions of mitochondrial DNA (mtDNA).
The definition of the Limb muscle weakness is that Reduced strength and weakness of the muscles of the arms and legs.
The definition of the Scapular winging is that Abnormal protrusion of the scapula away from the surface of the back.
The definition of the Distal amyotrophy is that Muscular atrophy affecting muscles in the distal portions of the extremities.
The definition of the Late-onset proximal muscle weakness is that Lack of strength of the proximal musculature occurring late in the clinical course.
The definition of the Absent epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 5th finger is that Absence of the epiphysis located at the proximal end of the distal phalanx of the 5th finger.
The definition of the Scapuloperoneal amyotrophy is that Muscular atrophy in the distribution of shoulder girdle and peroneal muscles.
The definition of the Generalized amyotrophy is that Generalized (diffuse, unlocalized) amyotrophy (muscle atrophy) affecting multiple muscles.
The definition of the Proximal muscle weakness is that A lack of strength of the proximal muscles.
The definition of the Calf muscle pseudohypertrophy is that Enlargement of the muscles of the calf due to their replacement by connective tissue or fat.
The definition of the Exercise-induced muscle cramps is that Sudden and involuntary contractions of one or more muscles brought on by physical exertion.
The definition of the Muscle hypertrophy is that Abnormal increase in muscle size and mass not due to training.

The definition of the Muscle fiber necrosis is that Abnormal cell death involving muscle fibers usually associated with break in, or absence of, muscle surface fiber membrane and resulting in irreversible damage to muscle fibers.
The definition of the Myofibrillar myopathy is that Myofibrillar structural changes characterized by abnormal intracellular accumulation of the intermediate filament desmin and other proteins.
The definition of the Generalized muscle hypertrophy is that Hypertrophy (increase in size) of muscle tissue in a generalized (not localized) distribution.
The definition of the Neck flexor weakness is that Weakness of the muscles involved in neck flexion (sternocleidomastoid, longus capitus, longus colli, and scalenus anterior).
The definition of the Shoulder girdle muscle atrophy is that Amyotrophy affecting the muscles of the shoulder girdle.
The definition of the EMG: myotonic runs is that Spontaneous, repetitive electrical activity demonstrated by electromyography (EMG).
The definition of the Quadriceps muscle weakness is that Weakness of the quadriceps muscle (that is, of the muscle fasciculus of quadriceps femoris).
The definition of the Thigh hypertrophy is that Muscle hypertrophy affecting the thighs.

The definition of the Autophagic vacuoles is that The lysosomal-vacuolar pathway has a role in the controlled intracellular digestion of macromolecules such as protein complexes and organelles. This feature refers to the presence of an abnormally increased number of autophagic vacuoles in muscle tissue.
The definition of the Mitochondrial myopathy is that A type of myopathy associated with mitochondrial disease and characterized by findings on biopsy such as ragged red muscle fibers.
The definition of the Exercise-induced myalgia is that The occurrence of an unusually high amount of muscle pain following exercise.
The definition of the Myotonia with warm-up phenomenon is that Myotonia that occurs after a period of rest and decreases with continuing exercise.
The definition of the Pelvic girdle muscle weakness is that Weakness of the muscles of the pelvic girdle (also known as the hip girdle), that is, lack of strength of the muscles around the pelvis.
The definition of the Increased muscle fatiguability is that An abnormal, increased fatiguability of the musculature.
The definition of the Episodic flaccid weakness is that Recurrent episodes of muscle flaccidity, a type of paralysis in which a muscle becomes soft and yields to passive stretching.
The definition of the Type 1 fibers relatively smaller than type 2 fibers is that The presence of abnormal muscle fiber size such that type 1 fibers are smaller than type 2 fibers.

The definition of the Reduced subcutaneous adipose tissue is that A reduced amount of fat tissue in the lowest layer of the integument. This feature can be appreciated by a reduced skinfold thickness. []
The definition of the Hypoplasia of lymphatic vessels is that Congenital underdevelopment of lymph vessels.
The definition of the Calcinosis is that Formation of calcium deposits in any soft tissue.

The definition of the Uterus didelphys is that A malformation of the uterus in which the uterus is present as a paired organ as a result of the failure of fusion of the mullerian ducts during embryogenesis.

The definition of the Bruxism is that Bruxism is characterized by the grinding of the teeth including the clenching of the jaw and typically occur during sleep, but also can occur while the affected individual is awake. [PMID:29926505]
The definition of the Nevus is that A nevus is a type of hamartoma that is a circumscribed stable malformation of the skin.
The definition of the Psoriasis is that A skin abnormality characterized by redness and irritation, with thick, red skin that displays flaky, silver-white patches (scales).
The definition of the Periodic paralysis is that Episodes of muscle weakness.

The definition of the Pulp stones is that Pulp calcifications may appear as punctate calcifications, irregular, roughly spherical mineralized masses in any part of the pulp. It may occur isolated or associated to calcifications elsewhere such as the carotid arteries and kidneys. The diagnosis pulp calcifications can be established using radiological studies.

The definition of the Stage 5 chronic kidney disease is that A degree of kidney failure severe enough to require dialysis or kidney transplantation for survival characterized by a severe reduction in glomerular filtration rate (less than 15 ml/min/1.73 m2) and other manifestations including increased serum creatinine.

The definition of the Pili torti is that Pili (from Latin pilus, hair) torti (from Latin tortus, twisted) refers to short and brittle hairs that appear flattened and twisted when viewed through a microscope.
The definition of the Eunuchoid habitus is that A body habitus that is tall, slim and underweight, with long legs and long arms (i.e., arm span exceeds height by 5 cm or more).

The definition of the Decreased CSF homovanillic acid (HVA) is that Decreased concentration of homovanillic acid (HVA) in the cerebrospinal fluid. HVA is a metabolite of dopamine. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:KI_phemming, PMID:12615172]

The definition of the Type 1 and type 2 muscle fiber minicore regions is that Multiple small zones of sarcomeric disorganization and lack of oxidative activity (known as minicores) in type 1 and type 2 muscle fibers.
The definition of the Minicore (multicore) myopathy is that Multiple small zones of sarcomeric disorganization and lack of oxidative activity (known as minicores) in muscle fibers.
The definition of the Short middle phalanx of toe is that Developmental hypoplasia (shortening) of middle phalanx of toe.
The definition of the Irregular iliac crest is that Irregularity of the iliac crest, which is the superior border of the wing of the ilium.
The definition of the Limb-girdle muscle atrophy is that Muscular atrophy affecting the muscles of the limb girdle.

The definition of the Nemaline bodies is that Nemaline rods are abnormal bodies that can occur in skeletal muscle fibers. The rods can be observed on histological analysis of muscle biopsy tissue or upon electron microscopy, where they appear either as extensions of sarcomeric Z-lines, in random array without obvious attachment to Z-lines (often in areas devoid of sarcomeres) or in large clusters localized at the sarcolemma or intermyofibrillar spaces.
The definition of the Type 1 muscle fiber predominance is that An abnormal predominance of type I muscle fibers (in general, this feature can only be observed on muscle biopsy).

The definition of the Rimmed vacuoles is that Presence of abnormal vacuoles (membrane-bound organelles) in the sarcolemma. On histological staining with hematoxylin and eosin, rimmed vacuoles are popcorn-like clear vacuoles with a densely blue rim. The vacuoles are often associated with cytoplasmic and occasionally intranuclear eosinophilic inclusions.
The definition of the Shoulder dislocation is that A displacement or misalignment of the humerus with respect to the other bones of the should joint. Note that a subluxation is a partial dislocation.
The definition of the Shoulder subluxation is that A partial dislocation of the shoulder joint.
The definition of the Soft-tissue ossification around the shoulders is that Formation of calcified tissue in the soft tissues surrounding the shoulder.
The definition of the Delayed upper limb epiphyseal ossification is that A delay in the process of formation and maturation of the epiphysis of one or more long bones of the upper limbs.
The definition of the Upper limb metaphyseal widening is that Increased width (breadth) of metaphyses of the arms.

The definition of the Diaphyseal sclerosis of the upper limbs is that An elevation in bone density in one or more diaphyses of the arms. Sclerosis is normally detected on a radiograph as an area of increased opacity.
The definition of the Absent humerus is that Missing humerus bone associated with congenital failure of development.
The definition of the Bifid humerus is that Clefting affecting the humerus.
The definition of the Bowed humerus is that A bending or abnormal curvature of the humerus.
The definition of the Slender humerus is that Reduction in diameter of the humerus.
The definition of the Abnormality of the humeral epiphysis is that An anomaly of the humeral epiphysis.
The definition of the Absent humeral epiphyseal ossification is that Lack of formation of bone in the epiphysis of the humerus.
The definition of the Advanced ossification of the humeral epiphysis is that Ossification of the humeral epiphysis at an earlier age than normal.
The definition of the Delayed humeral epiphyseal ossification is that A delay in the process of formation and maturation of the humeral epiphysis.
The definition of the Epiphyseal stippling of the humerus is that The presence of abnormal punctate (speckled, dot-like) calcifications in the humeral epiphysis.
The definition of the Broad humeral epiphyses is that Increased width of the humeral epiphysis.
The definition of the Broad humeral epiphyseal plate is that Increased width of the humeral epiphyseal growth plate.
The definition of the Flared humeral metaphysis is that Flaring (increase of width with a splayed appearance) of the humeral metaphysis.
The definition of the Abnormality of the humeral diaphysis is that An anomaly of the humeral diaphysis.
The definition of the Cortical irregularity of humeral diaphysis is that An abnormal irregularity of the cortical surface of the diaphysis (shaft) of the humerus.
The definition of the Wide humeral diaphysis is that Increased width of the humeral diaphysis.
The definition of the Humeroulnar synostosis is that An abnormal osseous union (fusion) between the ulna and the humerus.
The definition of the Delayed elbow epiphyseal ossification is that A delay in the process of formation and maturation of the epiphysis of one or more long bones that are part of the elbow.
The definition of the Absent forearm bone is that Absence of one or more forearm bones associated with congenital failure of development.
The definition of the Bowed forearm bones is that A bending or abnormal curvature affecting either the radius, the ulna, or both.
The definition of the Broad forearm bones is that Abnormally wide bone of the skeleton of forearm.
The definition of the Absent radius is that Missing radius bone associated with congenital failure of development.
The definition of the Broad radius is that Increased width of the radius.
The definition of the Absent ulna is that Missing ulna bone associated with congenital failure of development.
The definition of the Long ulna is that Increased length of the ulna.
The definition of the Osteosclerosis of the ulna is that Osteosclerosis (increased density related to increased bone mass) of the ulna.
The definition of the Slender ulna is that Reduction in diameter of the ulna.
The definition of the Broad ulna is that Increased width of the ulna.

The definition of the Premature fusion of the radial epiphyseal plates is that A premature fusion of the epiphyseal plates of the radius. Epiphyseal plates are located at the distal and proximal ends of the long bones, in this case of the radius and premature fusion will have an effect on the growh of the radial bone, inhibiting or at least disturbing the normal growth and development of the bone.
The definition of the Broad radial epiphyseal plate is that Abnormal increase in width of the epiphyseal growth plate of the radius.
The definition of the Broad radial metaphysis is that Increase in width (breadth) of the radial metaphysis.
The definition of the Abnormality of radial diaphysis is that An anomaly of the radial diaphysis.
The definition of the Broad radial diaphysis is that Increase in width of the diaphysis of radius.
The definition of the Sloping ulnar metaphysis is that A sloped configuration of the metaphysis (shaft) of the ulna.
The definition of the Wide ulnar metaphysis is that Increase in width (breadth) of the ulnar metaphysis.
The definition of the Absent hand is that The total absence of the hand, with no bony elements distal to the radius or ulna. [PMID:19125433]
The definition of the Advanced ossification of the hand bones is that Ossification of hand bones at an earlier age than normal.
The definition of the Delayed ossification of the hand bones is that Ossification of hand bones is less advanced than would be expected according to age-adjusted norms.
The definition of the Dysharmonic maturation of the hand bones is that Pattern of hand-wrist development does not fit the normal sequence of ossification of the individual bones of the hand.
The definition of the Sclerosis of hand bone is that Osteosclerosis affecting one or more bones of the hand.

The definition of the Mitten deformity is that Fusion of the hands and feet by a thin membrane of skin (scarring) seen in forms of dystrophic epidermolysis bullosa and leading to a mitten" hand deformity."

The definition of the Trident hand is that A hand in which the fingers are of nearly equal length and deflected at the first interphalangeal joint, so as to give a forklike shape consisting of separation of the first and second as well as the third and fourth digits.

The definition of the Deviation of finger is that Deviated fingers is a term that should be used if one or more fingers of the hand are deviated from their normal position, either to the radial or ulnar side. A deviation of a finger can be caused by an abnormal form of one or more of the phalanges of the affected finger, or by a deviation or displacement of one or more phalanges.

The definition of the Macrodactyly is that Significant increase in the length and girth of most or all of a digit compared to its contralateral digit (if unaffected) or compared to what would be expected for age/body build. The increased girth is accompanied by an increase in the dorso-ventral dimension AND the lateral dimension of the digit. [PMID:19125433]
The definition of the Abnormality of the 2nd finger is that An anomaly of the second finger, also known as the index finger.
The definition of the Midline nasal groove is that An abnormal groove on the midline of the nose that may extend to the nasal tip.

The definition of the Midline defect of the nose is that This term groups together three conditions that presumably represent different degrees of severity of a midline defect of the nose or nasal tip.
The definition of the Dimple on nasal tip is that An abnormal indentation of the skin in the region of the nasal tip.
The definition of the Abnormality of the 3rd finger is that An anomaly of the third finger.
The definition of the Short distal phalanx of the 3rd finger is that Hypoplasia (congenital reduction in size) of the distal phalanx of the third finger.
The definition of the Osteolytic defects of the phalanges of the 4th finger is that Osteolytic defects of the phalanges of the 4th (ring) finger.
The definition of the Symphalangism of the 4th finger is that Fusion of two or more bones of the 4th finger.
The definition of the Abnormality of the 5th finger is that An abnormality affecting one or both 5th fingers.
The definition of the Clinodactyly of the 5th finger is that Clinodactyly refers to a bending or curvature of the fifth finger in the radial direction (i.e., towards the 4th finger).
The definition of the Abnormality of the phalanges of the 5th finger is that Abnormality of the phalanges of the 5th (little) finger.
The definition of the Curved phalanges of the 5th finger is that Curved phalanges of the 5th (little) finger.
The definition of the Osteolytic defects of the phalanges of the 5th finger is that Dissolution or degeneration of bone tissue of the phalanges of the 5th finger.
The definition of the Symphalangism of the 5th finger is that Fusion of two or more bones of the 5th finger.
The definition of the Short middle phalanx of the 5th finger is that Hypoplastic/small middle phalanx of the fifth finger.

The definition of the Cone-shaped epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 5th finger is that A cone-shaped appearance of the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the little finger of the hand, producing a 'ball-in-a-socket' appearance. This epiphysis is located at the proximal end of the phalanx and is normally nearly flat. The related entity 'angel-shaped' epiphysis refers to a pronounced cone-shaped epiphysis in combination with a pseudoepiphysis at the distal end of the phalanx.

The definition of the Ivory epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 5th finger is that Sclerosis of the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the little finger, leading to an increased degree of radiopacity (white or ivory appearance) in X-rays.

The definition of the Abnormality of the epiphysis of the middle phalanx of the 5th finger is that Abnormality of the epiphysis of the middle phalanx of the fifth finger. This epiphysis is located on the proximal end of the phalanx.
The definition of the Abnormality of the distal phalanx of the 5th finger is that Abnormality of the distal phalanx of the 5th (little) finger.
The definition of the Curved distal phalanx of the 5th finger is that Curved appearance of the distal phalanx of the 5th (little) finger.
The definition of the Short distal phalanx of the 5th finger is that Hypoplastic/small distal phalanx of the fifth finger.
The definition of the Subluxation of the proximal interphalangeal joint of the little finger is that A partial dislocation of the proximal interphalangeal joint of the little finger.
The definition of the Carpal bone aplasia is that Congenital absence of a carpal bone.
The definition of the Accessory carpal bones is that The presence of more than the normal number of carpal bones.
The definition of the Advanced ossification of carpal bones is that Ossification of carpal bones at an abnormally early age.

The definition of the Bone-in-a-bone appearance of carpal bones is that The bone-in-bone sign is a radiographic finding produced by increased sclerosis (abnormally dense bone) occurring intermittently with zones of relatively normal bone density. This term should be used to describe such a finding in the carpal bones.
The definition of the Irregular carpal bones is that Carpal bones with irregular or fragmented margins.
The definition of the Large carpal bones is that Increased size of carpal bones.
The definition of the Stippled calcification in carpal bones is that Point-shaped (punctate) calcifications affecting the carpal bones.
The definition of the Delayed ossification of the scaphoid is that Formation of bone tissue of scaphoid is less than expected for age.
The definition of the Small scaphoid is that Underdevelopment of the scaphoid.
The definition of the Abnormality of the trapezium is that An anomaly of trapezium.
The definition of the Delayed ossification of the trapezium is that Formation of bone tissue of trapezium is less than expected for age.
The definition of the Small trapezium is that Underdevelopment of the trapezium.
The definition of the Delayed ossification of the trapezoid bone is that Formation of bone tissue of trapezoid is less than expected for age.
The definition of the Small trapezoid bone is that Underdevelopment of the trapezoid.
The definition of the Subluxation of the small joints of the hand is that A partial dislocation of some or all of the small joints of the hand.
The definition of the Exostoses of hand bones is that Abnormal formation of new bone on the surface of a bone of the hand.
The definition of the Synostosis involving bones of the hand is that An abnormal union between bones or parts of bones of the hand.
The definition of the Short palm is that Short palm.

The definition of the Narrow palm is that For children from birth to 4 years of age, the palm width is more than 2 SD below the mean; for children from 4 to 16 years of age the palm width is below the 5th centile; or, the width of the palm appears disproportionately narrow for its length. [PMID:19125433]
The definition of the Synostosis of second metacarpal-trapezoid is that Fusion of the second metacarpal-trapezoid.
The definition of the Subluxation of metacarpal phalangeal joints is that A partial dislocation affecting some or all of the metacarpophalangeal joints.
The definition of the Abnormality of the gastric mucosa is that An abnormality of the gastric mucous membrane.
The definition of the Abnormality of the biliary system is that An abnormality of the biliary system.
The definition of the Abnormality of the abdominal wall is that The presence of any abnormality affecting the abdominal wall.
The definition of the Hernia of the abdominal wall is that The presence of a hernia in the abdominal wall.

The definition of the Abnormality of muscle fibers is that Any abnormality of the skeletal muscle cell. Muscle fibers are subdivided into two types. Type I fibers are fatigue-resistant and rich in oxidative enzymes (they stain light with the myosin ATPase reaction), and type II fibers are fast-contracting, fatigue-prone, and rich in glycolytic enzymes (these fibers stain darkly). Normal muscle tissue has a random distribution of type I and type II fibers.
The definition of the Involuntary movements is that Involuntary contractions of muscle leading to involuntary movements of extremities, neck, trunk, or face.
The definition of the Abnormality of the endocardium is that An abnormality of the endocardium.
The definition of the Abnormal anatomic location of the heart is that Developmental defect characterized by an anomalous anatomic location of the heart. []

The definition of the Ventricular preexcitation is that An abnormality in which the cardiac ventricles depolarize too early as a result of an abnormality of cardiac conduction pathways such as an accessory pathway.
The definition of the Abnormality of macrophages is that An abnormality of macrophages.
The definition of the Abnormality of reticulocytes is that A reticulocyte abnormality.
The definition of the Hypogammaglobulinemia is that An abnormally decreased level of immunoglobulin in blood.
The definition of the IgG deficiency is that An abnormally decreased level of immunoglobulin G (IgG) in blood.
The definition of the Hypoaldosteronism is that Abnormally reduced levels of aldosterone.
The definition of the Vaginal fistula is that The presence of a fistula of the vagina.

The definition of the Bladder fistula is that The presence of a fistula connecting the urinary bladder to another organ or the skin. The fistula can involve the bowel, the vagina, or rarely, the skin.

The definition of the Short stature is that A height below that which is expected according to age and gender norms. Although there is no universally accepted definition of short stature, many refer to short stature" as height more than 2 standard deviations below the mean for age and gender (or below the 3rd percentile for age and gender dependent norms)."
The definition of the Abnormality of body weight is that An abnormal increase or decrease of weight or an abnormal distribution of mass in the body.
The definition of the Cachexia is that Severe weight loss, wasting of muscle, loss of appetite, and general debility related to a chronic disease.
The definition of the Abnormality of the vitreous humor is that Any structural anomaly of the vitreous body.

The definition of the Abnormality of the anterior segment of the eye is that An abnormality of the anterior segment of the eyeball (which comprises the structures in front of the vitreous humour: the cornea, iris, ciliary body, and lens).
The definition of the Increased skull ossification is that An increase in the magnitude or amount of ossification of the skull.
The definition of the Decreased skull ossification is that A reduction in the magnitude or amount of ossification of the skull.
The definition of the Abnormality of lymphocytes is that An abnormality of lymphocytes.

The definition of the Bone-marrow foam cells is that The presence of foam cells in the bone marrow, generally demonstrated by bone-marrow aspiration or biopsy. Foam cells have a vacuolated appearance due to the presence of complex lipid deposits, giving them a foamy or soap-suds appearance.
The definition of the Dermal atrophy is that Partial or complete wasting (atrophy) of the skin.
The definition of the Myelin outfoldings is that The presence of excessive redundant myelin in the peripheral nerve sheath.
The definition of the Abnormality of amino acid metabolism is that Abnormality of an amino acid metabolic process.
The definition of the Abnormality of aromatic amino acid family metabolism is that Any deviation from the normal concentration of a aromatic amino acid in the blood circulation.
The definition of the Abnormality of sulfur amino acid metabolism is that Any deviation from the normal concentration of a sulfur amino acid in the blood circulation. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:gcarletti]

The definition of the Abnormality of galactoside metabolism is that Abnormality of galactoside metabolism. A galactoside is a glycoside (a suger moiety bound to some other moiety) containing galactose. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:gcarletti]
The definition of the Abnormality of glycosphingolipid metabolism is that An abnormality of glycosphingolipid metabolism.

The definition of the Abnormality of ganglioside metabolism is that Defects in the lysosomal glycosidases or specific co-activators, result in accumulation of the substrates, such as glycosphingolipids, including gangliosides in GM1 gangliosidosis (Tay-Sachs disease) and GM2 gangliosidosis (Sandhoff disease).

The definition of the Weakness of muscles of respiration is that Reduced function of the muscles required to generate subatmospheric pressure in the thoracic cavity during breathing: the diaphragm, the external intercostal and the interchondral part of the internal intercostal muscles.

The definition of the Abnormality of bone mineral density is that This term applies to all changes in bone mineral density which (depending on severity) can be seen on x-rays as a change in density and or structure of the bone. Changes may affect all bones of the organism, just certain bones or only parts of bones and include decreased mineralisation as may be seen in osteoporosis or increased mineralisation and or ossification as in osteopetrosis, exostoses or any kind of atopic calicfications of different origin and distribution. The overall amount of mineralization of the bone-organ can be measured as the amount of matter per cubic centimeter of bones, usually measured by densitometry of the lumbar spine or hip. The measurements are usually reported as g/cm3 or as a Z-score (the number of standard deviations above or below the mean for the patient's age and sex). Note that measurement with this method does not reflect local changes in other bones, and as such might not be correct with regard the hole bone-organ.
The definition of the Reduced bone mineral density is that A reduction of bone mineral density, that is, of the amount of matter per cubic centimeter of bones.
The definition of the Abnormality of pyrimidine metabolism is that Any deviation from the normal concentration of a pyrimidine in the blood circulation.
The definition of the Abnormality of carboxylic acid metabolism is that Any deviation from the normal concentration of a carboxylic acid in the blood circulation. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:gcarletti]
The definition of the Abnormality of leucine metabolism is that Any deviation from the normal circulation of leucine in the blood circulation.
The definition of the Abnormality of fatty-acid metabolism is that A deviation from the normal concentration of a fatty acid in the blood circulation.
The definition of the Abnormality of acid-base homeostasis is that An abnormality of the balance or maintenance of the balance of acids and bases in bodily fluids, resulting in an abnormal pH.
The definition of the Abnormality of circulating leptin level is that An abnormal concentration of leptin in the blood.

The definition of the Abnormality of the enteric ganglia is that An abnormality of the enteric nervous system, which comprises two types of ganglia, the myenteric (Auerbach's) and submucosal (Meissner's) plexuses. The enteric nervous system functions to control gut movement, fluid exchange between the gut and its lumen, and local blood flow.
The definition of the Abnormality of calcium homeostasis is that Any deviation from the normal concentration of calcium in the blood circulation.
The definition of the Abnormality of nitrogen compound homeostasis is that Any deviation from the normal concentration of a nitrogen compound in the blood circulation. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:gcarletti]
The definition of the Abnormality of tryptophan metabolism is that Any deviation from the normal concentration of tryptophan in the blood circulation.
The definition of the Abnormality of glycolysis is that An abnormality of glycolysis.
The definition of the Abnormality of glycosaminoglycan metabolism is that Abnormality of glycosaminoglycan metabolism.
The definition of the Focal dystonia is that A type of dystonia that is localized to a specific part of the body.

The definition of the Hemiplegia/hemiparesis is that Loss of strength in the arm, leg, and sometimes face on one side of the body. Hemiplegia refers to a severe or complete loss of strength, whereas hemiparesis refers to a relatively mild loss of strength.
The definition of the Neoplasm of the nervous system is that A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the nervous system.
The definition of the Abnormality of the anus is that Abnormality of the anal canal.
The definition of the Abnormality of alkaline phosphatase activity is that An abnormality of alkaline phosphatase level.
The definition of the Aortic valve calcification is that Deposition of calcium salts in the aortic valve.
The definition of the Supravalvular aortic stenosis is that A pathological narrowing in the region above the aortic valve associated with restricted left ventricular outflow.
The definition of the Mitral valve calcification is that Abnormal calcification of the mitral valve.
The definition of the Hypoplastic left heart is that Underdevelopment of the left side of the heart. May include atresia of the aortic or mitral orifice and hypoplasia of the ascending aorta.

The definition of the Type I truncus arteriosus is that Truncus arteriosus (single great artery leaving the base of the heart, giving rise to the coronary, pulmonary, and systemic arteries) with a short pulmonary trunk arises from the truncus arteriosus, giving rise to both pulmonary arteries. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown, https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199]

The definition of the Enterocolitis is that An inflammation of the colon and small intestine. However, most conditions are either categorized as Enteritis (inflammation of the small intestine) or Colitis (inflammation of the large intestine).
The definition of the Microcolon is that A colon of abnormally small caliber. [PMID:3484569]

The definition of the Intestinal pseudo-obstruction is that A functional rather than mechanical obstruction of the intestines, associated with manifestations that resemble those caused by an intestinal obstruction, including distension, abdominal pain, nausea, vomiting, constipation or diarrhea, in an individual in whom a mechanical blockage has been excluded.

The definition of the Hamartomatous polyps is that Polyp-like protrusions which are histologically hamartomas. These can occur throughout the gastrointestinal tract. Hamartomatous polyps are composed of the normal cellular elements of the gastrointestinal tract, but have a markedly distorted architecture.

The definition of the Prune belly is that A kind of congenital defect of the anterior abdominal wall in which the intestines are evident through the thin, lax, and protruding abdominal wall in affected infants.
The definition of the Ectopic anus is that Abnormal displacement or malposition of the anus.

The definition of the Peptic ulcer is that The term peptic ulcer refers to acid peptic injury of the digestive tract, resulting in mucosal break reaching the submucosa. Peptic ulcers are usually located in the stomach or proximal duodenum, but they can also be found in the oesophagus or Meckel's diverticulum. Infection with Helicobacter pylori and the use of non steroidal antiinflammatory drugs (NSAIDs) or aspirin are the main risk factors of both gastric and duodenal peptic ulcers.
The definition of the Congenital pyloric atresia is that Congenital atresia of the pylorus.
The definition of the Abnormality of the pylorus is that An abnormality of the pylorus.
The definition of the Meconium ileus is that Obstruction of the intestine due to abnormally thick meconium.
The definition of the Abnormality of the nipple is that An abnormality of the nipple.
The definition of the Hyposmia is that A decreased sensitivity to odorants (that is, a decreased ability to perceive odors).
The definition of the Deviated nasal septum is that Positioning of the nasal septum to the right or left in contrast to the normal midline position of the nasal septum.
The definition of the Abnormality of the pulmonary artery is that An abnormality of the pulmonary artery.

The definition of the Pulmonary artery stenosis is that An abnormal narrowing or constriction of the pulmonary artery, in the main pulmonary artery and/or in the left or right pulmonary artery branches.

The definition of the Intermittent claudication is that Intermittent claudication is a symptom of peripheral arterial occlusive disease. After having walked over a distance which is individually characteristic, the patients experience pain or cramps in the calves, feet or thighs which typically subsides on standing still. [PMID:27770207]
The definition of the Thrombophlebitis is that Inflammation of a vein associated with venous thrombosis (blood clot formation within the vein).
The definition of the Recurrent thrombophlebitis is that Repeated episodes of inflammation of a vein associated with venous thrombosis (blood clot formation within the vein).
The definition of the Arterial thrombosis is that The formation of a blood clot inside an artery.
The definition of the Elevated systolic blood pressure is that Abnormal increase in systolic blood pressure.
The definition of the Biparietal narrowing is that A narrowing of the biparietal diameter (i.e., of the transverse distance between the protuberances of the two parietal bones of the skull).
The definition of the Flat forehead is that A forehead with abnormal flatness.

The definition of the Elfin facies is that This is a description previously used to describe a facial form characterized by a short, upturned nose, wide mouth, widely spaced eyes, and full cheeks. Because of the imprecision in this definition it is preferable to describe these features precisely. This term is retained because it was often used in the past, but it should not be used for new annotations.
The definition of the Recurrent viral infections is that Increased susceptibility to viral infections, as manifested by recurrent episodes of viral infection.
The definition of the Severe combined immunodeficiency is that A type of primary immune deficiency that is characterized by a more severe defect in both the T- and B-lymphocyte systems.
The definition of the Agammaglobulinemia is that A lasting absence of total IgG and total IgA and total IgM in the blood circulation, whereby at most trace quantities can be measured.

The definition of the Secretory IgA deficiency is that Deficiency of secretory IgA (polymers of 2-4 IgA monomers are linked by two additional chains) and is the primary antibody response at the mucosal level, where it forms immune complexes with pathogens and allergens.
The definition of the Cranial hyperostosis is that Excessive growth of the bones of cranium, i.e., of the skull.
The definition of the Hyperostosis frontalis interna is that Bony overgrowth of the internal (endosteal) surface of the frontal bone.
The definition of the Craniofacial dysostosis is that A characteristic appearance resulting from defective ossification of craniofacial bones.
The definition of the Coronal craniosynostosis is that Premature closure of the coronal suture of skull.
The definition of the Sagittal craniosynostosis is that A kind of craniosynostosis affecting the sagittal suture.
The definition of the Lambdoidal craniosynostosis is that A kind of craniosynostosis affecting the lambdoidal suture.
The definition of the Spherocytosis is that The presence of erythrocytes that are sphere-shaped.
The definition of the Elliptocytosis is that The presence of elliptical, cigar-shaped erythrocytes on peripheral blood smear.
The definition of the Stomatocytosis is that The presence of erythrocytes with a mouth-shaped (stoma) area of central pallor on peripheral blood smear.
The definition of the Poikilocytosis is that The presence of abnormally shaped erythrocytes.

The definition of the Fulminant hepatic failure is that Hepatic failure refers to the inability of the liver to perform its normal synthetic and metabolic functions, which can result in coagulopathy and alteration in the mental status of a previously healthy individual. Hepatic failure is defined as fulminant if there is onset of encephalopathy within 4 weeks of the onset of symptoms in a patient with a previously healthy liver.
The definition of the Preauricular skin furrow is that A groove of the skin immediately in front of the ear.
The definition of the Postauricular skin tag is that A rudimentary tag of ear tissue often containing a core of cartilage and located just in back of the auricle (outer part of the ear).

The definition of the Abnormality of the middle ear ossicles is that An abnormality of the middle-ear ossicles (three small bones called malleus, incus, and stapes) that are contained within the middle ear and serve to transmit sounds from the air to the fluid-filled labyrinth (cochlea).
The definition of the Overfolding of the superior helices is that A condition in which the superior portion of the helix is folded over to a greater degree than normal.
The definition of the Dilatated internal auditory canal is that The presence of a dilated inner part of external acoustic meatus.
The definition of the Exostosis of the external auditory canal is that A benign bony growth projecting outward from a bone surface within the external auditory canal.
The definition of the Absent brainstem auditory responses is that Lack of measurable response to stimulation of auditory evoked potentials.
The definition of the Postauricular pit is that Benign congenital lesion of the postauricular soft tissue consisting of a blind-ending narrow tube or pit.
The definition of the Preauricular pit is that Small indentation anterior to the insertion of the ear.
The definition of the Chronic bronchitis is that Chronic inflammation of the bronchi.
