The definition of the Atretic occipital cephalocele is that A congenital defect in the occipital region of the skull, covered by skin of the scalp and containing meninges or remnants of glial or neural tissues.
The definition of the aplasia cutis congenita over the scalp vertex is that A developmental defect resulting in the congenital absence of skin on the scalp vertex, often just lateral to the midline.
The definition of the Mandibular hyperostosis is that Hyperostosis (bony overgrowth) of the mandible.

The definition of the Persistent open anterior fontanelle is that The anterior fontanelle generally ossifies by around the 18th month of life. A persistent open anterior fontanelle is diagnosed if closure is delayed beyond this age.
The definition of the aplasia cutis congenita over parietal area is that A developmental defect resulting in the congenital absence of skin on the scalp in the parietal area.
The definition of the Progressive macrocephaly is that The progressive development of an abnormally large skull.

The definition of the Relative macrocephaly is that A relatively mild degree of macrocephaly in which the head circumference is not above two standard deviations from the mean, but appears dysproportionately large when other factors such as body stature are taken into account.
The definition of the Craniofacial asymmetry is that Asymmetry of the bones of the skull and the face.
The definition of the Cessation of head growth is that Stagnation of head growth seen as flattening of the head circumference curve.

The definition of the Acrobrachycephaly is that An abnormality of head shape characterized by the presence of a short, wide head as well as a pointy or conical form of the top of the head owing to premature closure of the coronal and lambdoid sutures.
The definition of the Macrocephaly at birth is that The presence of an abnormally large skull with onset at birth.
The definition of the Calvarial hyperostosis is that Excessive growth of the calvaria.
The definition of the Large posterior fontanelle is that An enlargement of the posterior fontanelle relative to age-dependent norms.
The definition of the Widely patent fontanelles and sutures is that An abnormally increased width of the cranial fontanelles and sutures.
The definition of the Craniofacial hyperostosis is that Excessive growth of the craniofacial bones.
The definition of the Bilateral choanal atresia is that Bilateral absence (atresia) of the posterior nasal aperture (choana).
The definition of the Pancreatic islet-cell hyperplasia is that Hyperplasia of the islets of Langerhans, i.e., of the regions of the pancreas that contain its endocrine cells.
The definition of the Long eyebrows is that Increased length of the hairs of the eyebrows.
The definition of the Temporal hypotrichosis is that Reduced or lacking hair growth in the temporal region (i.e., around the temples on the side of the skull).
The definition of the Generalized hypotrichosis is that Reduced or lacking hair growth in a generalized distribution.
The definition of the Sacral hypertrichosis is that Excessive, increased hair growth located in the sacral region.

The definition of the Anterior cervical hypertrichosis is that Anterior cervical hypertrichosis (ACH) or 'hairy throat' refers to the presence of a tuft of terminal hair on the anterior neck, just above the laryngeal prominence.
The definition of the Congenital, generalized hypertrichosis is that A confluent, generalized overgrowth of silvery blonde to gray lanugo hair at birth.
The definition of the Generalized hypertrichosis is that Generalized excessive, abnormal hairiness.
The definition of the Cervical platyspondyly is that A flattened vertebral body shape with reduced distance between the vertebral endplates affecting the cervical spine.
The definition of the increased spinal bone density is that Increased bone density affecting the bones of the spine (vertebral column).

The definition of the Pear-shaped vertebrae is that Bulbous appearance of the anterior vertebral bodies, such that the vertebral bodies have the greatest vertical height anteriorly as well as bulbous anterior superior-inferior contours.
The definition of the Beaking of vertebral bodies is that Anterior tongue-like protrusions of the vertebral bodies.
The definition of the Anterior wedging of  T11 is that An abnormality of the shape of the thoracic vertebra T11 such that it is wedge-shaped (narrow towards the front).
The definition of the Anterior scalloping of vertebral bodies is that An excessive concavity of the anterior surface of one or more vertebral bodies.

The definition of the Biconcave vertebral bodies is that Exaggerated concavity of the anterior or posterior surface of the vertebral body, i.e., the upper and lower vertebral endplates are hollowed inward.
The definition of the Thoracic platyspondyly is that A flattened vertebral body shape with reduced distance beween the vertebral endplates affecting the thoracic spine.

The definition of the Supernumerary vertebral ossification centers is that Three ossification sites are present in typical vertebral bodies (C3-L5): a single ossification center in the vertebral body, and one each in the two neural arches. This term applies if there are additional vertebral ossification centers present during the development and maturation of the spine.
The definition of the Spina bifida occulta at L5 is that The closed form of spina bifida with incomplete closure of the vertebra L5 with intact overlying skin.

The definition of the Cervical vertebral fusion (C2/C3) is that Fusion of cervical vertebrae at C2 and C3, caused by a failure in the normal segmentation or division of the cervical vertebrae during the early weeks of fetal development, leading to a short neck with a low hairline at the back of the head, and restricted mobility of the upper spine.
The definition of the Unossified vertebral bodies is that A lack of ossification of the vertebral bodies.
The definition of the Anterior beaking of lower thoracic vertebrae is that Anterior tongue-like protrusions of the lower thoracic vertebral bodies.
The definition of the Anteriorly placed odontoid process is that Anterior mislocalization of the dens of the axis.
The definition of the Lumbar spinal canal stenosis is that An abnormal narrowing of the lumbar spinal canal.
The definition of the Spina bifida occulta at S1 is that The closed form of spina bifida with incomplete closure of S1 with intact overlying skin.
The definition of the Cleft vertebral arch is that A discontinuity of the vertebral arch, i.e., of the posterior part of a vertebra.
The definition of the Butterfly vertebral arch is that Butterfly vertebrae have a cleft through the body of the vertebrae and a funnel shape at the ends.
The definition of the Enlarged vertebral pedicles is that Increased size of the vertebral pedicle.
The definition of the Progressive intervertebral space narrowing is that A progressive form of decreased height of the intervertebral disk.

The definition of the Biconvex vertebral bodies is that Presence of abnormal convexity of the upper and lower end plates of the vertebrae, i.e., an exaggerated bulging out of the upper and lower vertebral end plates.
The definition of the Small cervical vertebral bodies is that Reduced size of cervical vertebrae.
The definition of the Anterior beaking of thoracic vertebrae is that Anterior tongue-like protrusions of thoracic vertebral bodies.
The definition of the Lower thoracic kyphosis is that Over curvature of the lower thoracic region, leading to a round back or if sever to a hump.
The definition of the Cervical vertebrae fusion (C5/C6) is that Fusion of the C5 and C6 cervical vertebrae.
The definition of the Hypoplasia of the nasal bone is that Underdevelopment of the nasal bone.
The definition of the Frontalis muscle weakness is that Reduced strength of the frontalis muscle (which is located on the forehead).
The definition of the Facial midline hemangioma is that Hemangioma, a benign tumor of the vascular endothelial cells, occurring in the midline region of the face.
The definition of the Decreased facial expression is that A reduced degree of motion of the muscles beneath the skin of the face, often associated with reduced facial crease formation.
The definition of the Deep longitudinal plantar crease is that Narrow, paramedian longitudinal depressions in the plantar skin of the forefoot. [PMID:19125433]
The definition of the Talipes valgus is that Outward turning of the heel, resulting in clubfoot with the person walking on the inner part of the foot.
The definition of the Short third metatarsal is that Underdevelopment of the Third metatarsal bone leading to a short (hypoplastic) third metatarsal bone.
The definition of the Short fourth metatarsal is that Short fourth metatarsal bone.
The definition of the Thickened Achilles tendon is that An abnormal thickening of the Achilles tendon.
The definition of the 2-3 toe syndactyly is that Syndactyly with fusion of toes two and three.
The definition of the 4-5 toe syndactyly is that Syndactyly with fusion of toes four and five.
The definition of the Osteoporotic metatarsal is that Decrease in mass and density of the metatarsal bones.
The definition of the Short fifth metatarsal is that Short (hypoplastic) fifth metatarsal bone.
The definition of the Renal malrotation is that An abnormality of the normal developmental rotation of the kidney leading to an abnormal orientation of the kidney.
The definition of the Reversible renal failure is that Acute renal failure with resolution of manifestations.
The definition of the Axial malrotation of the kidney is that An abnormality of the normal developmental rotation of the kidney leading to an abnormal axial orientation of the kidney.
The definition of the Hyperechogenic kidneys is that An increase in amplitude of waves returned in ultrasonography of the kidney, which is generally displayed as increased brightness of the signal.

The definition of the Thickening of the glomerular basement membrane is that Prominent glomerular basement membrane (GBM), reflecting an increase in thickness (subjective estimate) of the basal lamina of the glomerulus of the kidney.
The definition of the Calcium nephrolithiasis is that The presence of calcium-containing calculi (stones) in the kidneys.
The definition of the Impaired renal concentrating ability is that A defect in the ability to concentrate the urine.
The definition of the Acute tubulointerstitial nephritis is that Acute inflammation of the kidney affecting the interstitium of the kidneys surrounding the tubules.
The definition of the Impaired renal uric acid clearance is that A reduction in the ability of the kidneys to remove uric acid from the serum.
The definition of the Renal cortical microcysts is that Cysts of microscopic size confined to the cortex of the kidney. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:Eurenomics_ewuehl]

The definition of the Crossed fused renal ectopia is that A developmental anomaly in which the kidneys are fused and localized on the same side of the midline. This anomaly is thought to result from disruption of the normal embryologic migration of the kidneys.

The definition of the Global glomerulosclerosis is that Obliteration of the glomerular capillary lumen by increased collagenous matrix, with or without hyalinosis or foam cells. Sclerosis involves 100% of the glomerular tuft. Relative to other patent glomeruli in the sample, glomerular size is preserved, or increased/decreased by no more than 50%. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:Eurenomics_ewuehl, https://orcid.org/0000-0003-2356-950X]
The definition of the Abnormality of the renal collecting system is that An abnormality of the renal collecting system.
The definition of the Chronic tubulointerstitial nephritis is that Chronic inflammation of the kidney affecting the interstitium of the kidneys surrounding the tubules.
The definition of the Dense deposit disease is that Electron dense deposits at the glomerular basement membrane, [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:Eurenomics_ewuehl, PMID:20301598, PMID:30085237]

The definition of the Atrial flutter is that A type of atrial arrhythmia characterized by atrial rates of between 240 and 400 beats per minute and some degree of atrioventricular node conduction block. Typically, the ventricular rate is half the atrial rate. In the EKG; atrial flutter waves are observed as sawtooth-like atrial activity. Pathophysiologically, atrial flutter is a form of atrial reentry in which there is a premature electrical impulse creates a self-propagating circuit.
The definition of the Paroxysmal ventricular tachycardia is that Episodes of ventricular tachycardia that have a sudden onset and ending. []

The definition of the Congenital atrioventricular dissociation is that A form of atrioventricular (AV) dissociation (i.e., the atria and the ventricles are under the control of two separate pacemakers) with congenital onset.

The definition of the Permanent atrial fibrillation is that Atrial fibrillation (AF) that cannot be successfully terminated by cardioversion, and longstanding (more than 1 year) AF, where cardioversion is not indicated or has not been attempted, is termed permanent.

The definition of the Supraventricular tachycardia is that Supraventricular tachycardia (SVT) is an abnormally increased heart rate (over 100 beats per minute at rest) with origin above the level of the ventricles. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown, https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199]

The definition of the Ventricular tachycardia is that A tachycardia originating in the ventricles characterized by rapid heart rate (over 100 beats per minute) and broad QRS complexes (over 120 ms). []
The definition of the Paroxysmal atrial fibrillation is that Episodes of atrial fibrillation that typically last for several hours up to one day and terminate spontaneously.

The definition of the Effort-induced polymorphic ventricular tachycardias is that Polymorphic ventricular arrhythmias of varying morphologythat do not exist under resting conditions but appear only upon physical exercise or catecholamine administration. [PMID:15913575]
The definition of the Hypoplasia of right ventricle is that Underdevelopment or reduced size of the heart right ventricle, often due to a reduced number of cells. [MP:0010422]
The definition of the Paroxysmal supraventricular tachycardia is that An episodic form of supraventricular tachycardia with abrupt onset and termination. [PMID:18025404]

The definition of the Myxomatous mitral valve degeneration is that Myxomatous mitral valve is defined as the presence of excess leaflet tissue and leaflet thickening greater than 5 mm, resulting in a prolapse greater than 2 mm into the left atrium on parasternal long axis view.
The definition of the Sparse anterior scalp hair is that Decreased number of head hairs per unit area on the anterior region of the scalp.
The definition of the Brittle scalp hair is that Fragile, easily breakable scalp hair.
The definition of the Elbow hypertrichosis is that Excessive, increased hair growth located in the elbow region.
The definition of the Duodenal polyposis is that Presence of multiple polyps in the duodenum.
The definition of the Malrotation of colon is that An anatomical anomaly that results from an abnormal rotation of the gut as it returns to the abdominal cavity during embryogenesis.
The definition of the Fulminant hepatitis is that Acute hepatitis complicated by acute liver failure with hepatic encephalopathy occurring less than 8 weeks after the onset of jaundice.
The definition of the Intestinal lymphedema is that Fluid retention and edema in the intestine caused by a compromised lymphatic system.
The definition of the Lactose intolerance is that An inability to digest lactose.
The definition of the Hypoplasia of the small intestine is that Underdevelopment of the small intestine.
The definition of the Esophageal ulceration is that Defect in the epithelium of the esophagus, essentially an open sore in the lining of the esophagus.
The definition of the Rectoperineal fistula is that The presence of a fistula between the perineum and the rectum.
The definition of the Malrotation of small bowel is that A deviation from the normal rotation of the midgut during embryologic development with mislocalization of the small bowel.
The definition of the Hamartomatous stomach polyps is that Polyp-like protrusions which are histologically hamartomas located in the stomach.
The definition of the Multiple small bowel atresias is that The presence of multiple areas of atresia affecting the small intestine.
The definition of the Recurrent infection of the gastrointestinal tract is that Recurrent infection of the gastrointestinal tract.
The definition of the Episodic hemolytic anemia is that A form of hemolytic anemia that occurs in repeated episodes.
The definition of the Congenital hemolytic anemia is that A form of hemolytic anemia with congenital onset.
The definition of the Acute myeloid leukemia is that A form of leukemia characterized by overproduction of an early myeloid cell.
The definition of the Neonatal alloimmune thrombocytopenia is that Low platelet count associated with maternal platelet-specific alloantibodies.
The definition of the Congenital hypoplastic anemia is that A type of hypoplastic anemia with congenital onset.

The definition of the Post-transfusion thrombocytopenia is that Sudden onset of thrombocytopenia (reduced platelet count) within 5-10 days of the transfusion of blood products. The clinical presentation is post-transfusion purpura (PTP), wigth severe thrmbocytopenia, epistaxis, and hemorrhages.
The definition of the Fava bean-induced hemolytic anemia is that A kind of hemolytic anemia that is induced by the ingestion of fava beans.
The definition of the Drug-sensitive hemolytic anemia is that A form of hemolytic anemia that is triggered by ingestion of certain drugs.
The definition of the Normocytic hypoplastic anemia is that A type of hypoplastic anemia in which the erythrocytes have a normal cell volume (the mean corpuscular volume is within normal limits).
The definition of the Acute myelomonocytic leukemia is that An acute leukemia characterized by the proliferation of both neutrophil and monocyte precursors. [NCIT:C7463]
The definition of the Hypersegmentation of neutrophil nuclei is that An excessive division of the lobes of the nucleus of a neutrophil.
The definition of the Anisopoikilocytosis is that A type of poikilocytosis characterized by the presence in the blood of erythrocytes of varying sizes and abnormal shapes.
The definition of the Increased hemoglobin oxygen affinity is that An abnormal increase in the binding affinity of hemoglobin for oxygen.

The definition of the Folate-unresponsive megaloblastic anemia is that A type of megaloblastic anemia that does not improve upon administration of folate. Since vitamin B12 acts by promoting recycling of folate, administration of vitamin B12 also does not improve this type of anemia.

The definition of the Refractory anemia with ringed sideroblasts is that A type of myelodysplastic syndrome characterized by less than 5% myeloblasts in the bone marrow, but with 15% or greater red cell precursors in the marrow being abnormal iron-stuffed cells called ringed sideroblasts.
The definition of the Microspherocytosis is that The presence of erythrocytes that are sphere-shaped and reduced in size.
The definition of the Acute promyelocytic leukemia is that A type of acute myeloid leukemia in which abnormal promyelocytes predominate.
The definition of the Pyropoikilocytosis is that A form of severe hemolytic anemia characterized by erythrocyte morphology reminiscent of that seen in patients after a thermal burn.

The definition of the Hypochromic microcytic anemia is that A type of anemia characterized by an abnormally low concentration of hemoglobin in the erythrocytes and lower than normal size of the erythrocytes.
The definition of the Coombs-positive hemolytic anemia is that A type of hemolytic anemia in which the Coombs test is positive.
The definition of the Prolonged bleeding after surgery is that Bleeding that persists longer than the normal time following a surgical procedure.
The definition of the Recurrent deep vein thrombosis is that Repeated episodes of the formation of a blot clot in a deep vein.

The definition of the Folate-responsive megaloblastic anemia is that A type of megaloblastic anemia (i.e., anemia characterized by the presence of erythroblasts that are larger than normal) that improves upon the administration of folate.
The definition of the Reduced leukocyte alkaline phosphatase is that Decreased alkaline phosphatase measured within leukocytes.
The definition of the Intermittent thrombocytopenia is that Reduced platelet count that occurs sporadically, i.e., it comes and goes.
The definition of the Reduced protein S activity is that An abnormality of coagulation related to a decreased concentration of vitamin K-dependent protein S. Protein S is a cofactor of protein C.

The definition of the Normochromic microcytic anemia is that A type of anemia characterized by an normal concentration of hemoglobin in the erythrocytes and lower than normal size of the erythrocytes.
The definition of the Amegakaryocytic thrombocytopenia is that Thrombocytopenia related to lack of or severe reduction in the count of megakaryocytes.

The definition of the Thiamine-responsive megaloblastic anemia is that A type of megaloblastic anemia (i.e., anemia characterized by the presence of erythroblasts that are larger than normal) that improves upon the administration of thiamine.
The definition of the Refractory sideroblastic anemia is that A type of sideroblastic anemia that is not responsive to treatment.
The definition of the Chronic hemolytic anemia is that An chronic form of hemolytic anemia.
The definition of the Perineal fistula is that The presence of a fistula between the bowel and the perineum.
The definition of the Incisional hernia is that An abdominal hernia that occurs at a site of weakness in the abdominal wall resulting from an incompletely-healed surgical wound.
The definition of the Spontaneous neonatal pneumothorax is that Pneumothorax occurring neonatally without traumatic injury to the chest or lung.
The definition of the Intercostal muscle weakness is that Lack of strength of the intercostal muscles, i.e., of the muscle groups running along the ribs that create and move the chest wall.
The definition of the intermittent hyperventilation is that Episodic hyperventilation.
The definition of the Elevated pulmonary artery pressure is that An abnormally elevated blood pressure in the circulation of the pulmonary artery.
The definition of the Severe lactic acidosis is that A severe form of lactic acidemia.
The definition of the Congenital lactic acidosis is that A form of lactic acidemia with congenital onset.

The definition of the Maturity-onset diabetes of the young is that The term Maturity-onset diabetes of the young (MODY) was initially used for patients diagnosed with fasting hyperglycemia that could be treated without insulin for more than two years, where the initial diagnosis was made at a young age (under 25 years). Thus, MODY combines characteristics of type 1 diabetes (young age at diagnosis) and type 2 diabetes (less insulin dependence than type 1 diabetes). The term MODY is now most often used to refer to a group of monogenic diseases with these characteristics. Here, the term is used to describe hyperglycemia diagnosed at a young age with no or minor insulin dependency, no evidence of insulin resistence, and lack of evidence of autoimmune destruction of the beta cells.
The definition of the Recurrent infantile hypoglycemia is that Recurrent episodes of decreased concentration of glucose in the blood occurring during the infantile period.
The definition of the Abnormality of magnesium homeostasis is that An abnormality of magnesium ion homeostasis.

The definition of the Abnormal oral glucose tolerance is that An abnormal resistance to glucose, i.e., a reduction in the ability to maintain glucose levels in the blood stream within normal limits following oral administration of glucose.
The definition of the Pulmonary artery dilatation is that An abnormal widening of the diameter of the pulmonary artery.
The definition of the Arteriosclerosis of small cerebral arteries is that Arteriosclerosis (increased thickness, increased stiffness, loss of elasticity) of the small arteries of the brain.

The definition of the Ascending aortic dissection is that A separation of the layers within the wall of the ascending aorta. Tears in the intimal layer result in the propagation of dissection (proximally or distally) secondary to blood entering the intima-media space.
The definition of the Vascular calcification is that Abnormal calcification of the vasculature.
The definition of the Pulmonary artery atresia is that A congenital anomaly with a narrowing or complete absence of the opening between the right ventricle and the pulmonary artery.
The definition of the Venous thrombosis is that Formation of a blood clot (thrombus) inside a vein, causing the obstruction of blood flow.
The definition of the Pulmonary artery aneurysm is that An aneurysm (severe localized balloon-like outward bulging) in the pulmonary artery.
The definition of the Tortuous cerebral arteries is that Excessive bending, twisting, and winding of a cerebral artery.
The definition of the Generalized arterial calcification is that Calcification, that is, pathological deposition of calcium salts, affecting arteries distributed throughout the body.
The definition of the Extrahepatic portal hypertension is that Increased pressure in the pre-hepatic portal vein.

The definition of the Aortic aneurysm is that Aortic dilatation refers to a dimension that is greater than the 95th percentile for the normal person age, sex and body size. In contrast, an aneurysm is defined as a localized dilation of the aorta that is more than 150 percent of predicted (ratio of observed to expected diameter 1.5 or more). Aneurysm should be distinguished from ectasia, which represents a diffuse dilation of the aorta less than 50 percent of normal aorta diameter. []

The definition of the Accelerated atherosclerosis is that Atherosclerosis which occurs in a person with certain risk factors (e.g., SLE, diabetes, smoking, hypertension, hypercholesterolaemia, family history of early heart disease) at an earlier age than would occur in another person without those risk factors. [PMID:29040156]
The definition of the Cerebral aneurysm is that The presence of a localized dilatation or ballooning of a cerebral artery.
The definition of the Extracranial internal carotid artery dissection is that A separation (dissection) of the layers of the extracranial portion of the internal carotid artery wall.
The definition of the Arteriovenous fistula is that An abnormal connection between an artery and vein.
The definition of the Vascular tortuosity is that Abnormal twisting of arteries or veins. [PMID:22433458]

The definition of the Peripheral arterial disease is that Narrowing of peripheral arteries with reduction of blood flow to the limbs. This feature may be quantified as an ankle-brachial index of less than 0.9, and may be manifested clinically as claudication. []

The definition of the Pulmonary arteriovenous fistulas is that A rare vascular anomaly with a direct communication between pulmonary artery and pulmonary vein without an intervening capillary bed. [PMID:27122941]
The definition of the Generalized arterial tortuosity is that Abnormal tortuous (i.e., twisted) form of arteries affecting most or all arteries.
The definition of the Dilatation of the descending thoracic aorta is that An abnormal localized widening (dilatation) of the descending thoracic aorta. []
The definition of the Absent pulmonary artery is that A congenital defect with aplasia (absence) of one of the right or left pulmonary artery.

The definition of the Pulmonary artery sling is that An anomalous origin of the left pulmonary artery, such that it arises from the posterior aspect of the right pulmonary artery and passes between the trachea and esophagus to reach the left hilum. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown, PMID:16549603, PMID:18458183]

The definition of the Thoracic aorta calcification is that An accumulation of calcium and phosphate in arteries with mineral deposits in the intimal or medial layer of the vessel wall in the thoracic aorta.
The definition of the Calcification of the aorta is that Calcification, that is, pathological deposition of calcium salts in the aorta.
The definition of the Pulmonary arterial medial hypertrophy is that Increase in mass of the tunica media of the arteries in the pulmonary circulation.
The definition of the Medial calcification of large arteries is that Calcification, that is, pathological deposition of calcium salts in the tunica media of large (conduit) arteries.
The definition of the Recurrent cerebral hemorrhage is that Recurrent bleeding into the parenchyma of the brain. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown]
The definition of the Peripheral pulmonary artery stenosis is that Stenosis of a peripheral branch of the pulmonary artery.
The definition of the Ascending aortic dilation is that An abnormal localized widening (dilatation) of the tubular part of the ascending aorta. []
The definition of the Pulmonary artery hypoplasia is that Underdevelopment of the pulmonary artery.
The definition of the Elevated mean arterial pressure is that An abnormal increase in the average blood pressure in an individual during a single cardiac cycle. [PMID:18451345]
The definition of the Coarctation of abdominal aorta is that Coarctation of the aorta is a narrowing or constriction of a segment of the abdominal aorta.
The definition of the Erlenmeyer flask deformity of the femurs is that Flaring of distal femur.
The definition of the Bilateral radial aplasia is that Missing radius bone on both sides associated with congenital failure of development.
The definition of the Metaphyseal sclerosis is that Abnormally increased density of metaphyseal bone.
The definition of the Metaphyseal rarefaction is that Reduction in density of metaphyseal bony tissue.
The definition of the Mesomelic leg shortening is that Shortening of the middle parts of the leg in relation to the upper and terminal segments.
The definition of the Rhizomelic arm shortening is that Disproportionate shortening of the proximal segment of the arm (i.e. the humerus).
The definition of the Slender long bones with narrow diaphyses is that Reduced diameter of a long bone with a more pronounced reduction of the diameter of the diaphysis of the long bones.
The definition of the Recurrent patellar dislocation is that Patellar dislocation occurring repeated times.
The definition of the aplasia/Hypoplasia of the capital femoral epiphysis is that Absence or underdevelopment of the proximal epiphysis of the femur.
The definition of the Flattened proximal radial epiphyses is that An abnormally flat form of the proximal epiphysis of the radius.
The definition of the Femoral bowing present at birth, straightening with time is that Congenital onset bending or abnormal curvature of the femur that normalizes with age.
The definition of the Dumbbell-shaped humerus is that The humerus is shortened and displays flaring (widening) of the metaphyses.
The definition of the Mesomelic arm shortening is that Shortening of the middle parts of the arm in relation to the upper and terminal segments.
The definition of the Dysplastic distal radial epiphyses is that Abnormally developed (dysplastic) distal epiphysis of the radius.
The definition of the Hypoplastic distal humeri is that Underdevelopment of the distal portion of the humerus.
The definition of the Distal ulnar hypoplasia is that Underdevelopment of the distal portion of the ulna.
The definition of the Shortening of all phalanges of the toes is that Developmental hypoplasia (shortening) of all phalanges of the foot.
The definition of the Unilateral ulnar hypoplasia is that Underdevelopment of the ulna on only one side.
The definition of the Proximal radio-ulnar synostosis is that An abnormal osseous union (fusion) between the proximal portions of the radius and the ulna.
The definition of the Multiple long-bone exostoses is that Multiple exostoses originating in long bones.
The definition of the Irregular capital femoral epiphysis is that Irregular surface of the normally relatively smooth capital femoral epiphysis.

The definition of the Diaphyseal cortical sclerosis is that An elevation in bone density of the cortex of one or more diaphyses. Sclerosis is normally detected on a radiograph as an area of increased opacity.
The definition of the Anterolateral radial head dislocation is that A dislocation of the head of the radius from its socket in the elbow joint in an anterolateral direction.
The definition of the Metaphyseal spurs is that Bony outgrowths that extend laterally from the margin of the metaphysis.
The definition of the Proximal fibular overgrowth is that Overgrowth of the proximal part of the fibula.
The definition of the Proximal radial head dislocation is that A dislocation of the head of the radius from its socket in the elbow joint in an proximal direction.
The definition of the Hyperextensibility at wrists is that The ability of the wrist joints to move beyond their normal range of motion.
The definition of the Anterior radial head dislocation is that A dislocation of the head of the radius from its socket in the elbow joint in an anterior direction.
The definition of the limited knee flexion/extension is that A limited ability of the knee joint to perform extension and flexion.
The definition of the Abnormal metaphyseal trabeculation is that An abnormality of the pattern of trabecula (small interconnecting rods of bone) in a metaphyseal region of bone.
The definition of the Lateral femoral bowing is that A lateral bending or abnormal curvature of the femur.
The definition of the Streaky metaphyseal sclerosis is that The presence of streaks (bands) of abnormally increased density of metaphyseal bone.
The definition of the Absent proximal radial epiphyses is that Absence of the proximal radial epiphysis.
The definition of the Distal femoral bowing is that A bending or abnormal curvature of the distal portion of the femur.
The definition of the High-frequency hearing impairment is that A type of hearing impairment affecting primarily the higher frequencies of sound (3,000 to 6,000 Hz).
The definition of the Cochlear degeneration is that Deterioration or loss of the tissues of the cochlea.
The definition of the Calcification of the auricular cartilage is that Ossification affecting the external ear cartilage.
The definition of the Hypoplastic nasal septum is that Underdevelopment of the nasal septum.

The definition of the Abnormality of the vertebral endplates is that Any abnormality of the vertebral end plates, which are the top and bottom portions of the vertebral bodies that interface with the vertebral discs.
The definition of the Abnormality of the sacrum is that An abnormality of the sacral bone.
The definition of the Abnormality of the intervertebral disk is that Any structural abnormality of the intervertebral disk.
The definition of the Abnormality of the Achilles tendon is that An abnormality of the Achilles tendon.

The definition of the Atrial fibrillation is that An atrial arrhythmia characterized by disorganized atrial activity without discrete P waves on the surface EKG, but instead by an undulating baseline or more sharply circumscribed atrial deflections of varying amplitude an frequency ranging from 350 to 600 per minute.
The definition of the Dilatation of the abdominal aorta is that An abnormal localized widening (dilatation) of the abdominal aorta. []
The definition of the Dilatation of the aortic arch is that An abnormal localized widening (dilatation) of the aortic arch. []

The definition of the Supraventricular arrhythmia is that A type of arrhythmia that originates above the ventricles, whereby the electrical impulse propagates down the normal His Purkinje system similar to normal sinus rhythm.
The definition of the Arterial tortuosity is that Abnormal tortuous (i.e., twisted) form of arteries affecting most or all arteries.
The definition of the Elevated diastolic blood pressure is that Abnormal increase in diastolic blood pressure.
The definition of the Abnormality of cardiac atrium is that Any structural abnormality of a cardiac atrium.
The definition of the Posterior scalloping of vertebral bodies is that An excessive concavity of the posterior surface of one or more vertebral bodies.
The definition of the Pericardial constriction is that Compression of the heart caused by rigid, thickened, or fused pericardial membranes. [PMID:14966039]
The definition of the Right ventricular dilatation is that Enlargement of the chamber of the right ventricle.

The definition of the Absence of the pulmonary valve is that Refers to the specific combination of defects with a severely dysplastic pulmonary valve and massively dilated branch pulmonary arteries. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown]
The definition of the EKG: T-wave abnormalities is that An abnormality of the T wave on the electrocardiogram, which mainly represents the repolarization of the ventricles.
The definition of the Premature calcification of mitral annulus is that Mitral annular calcification (MAC) results from progressive calcium deposition along and beneath the mitral valve annulus.

The definition of the Anomalous origin of right pulmonary artery from ascending aorta is that The right pulmonary artery originates from the ascending aorta in the presence of a pulmonary valve and main pulmonary artery. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown]
The definition of the Left ventricular septal hypertrophy is that The dividing wall between left and right sides of the heart, thickens and bulges into the left ventricle.
The definition of the Coronary artery stenosis is that Abnormal narrowing of the coronary artery. []
The definition of the Cardiac valve calcification is that Abnormal calcification of a cardiac valve.
The definition of the Pulmonary valve defects is that Any defect in the valve connecting the heart and the pulmonary artery. []
The definition of the Abnormal atrioventricular conduction is that An impairment of the electrical continuity between the atria and ventricles. [PMID:15372490]

The definition of the Preductal coarctation of the aorta is that Narrowing or constriction of the aorta localized proximal to the ductus arteriosus, i.e., to the preductal region of aortic arch. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown]
The definition of the Oncocytic cardiomyopathy is that A type of cardiomyopathy characterized pathologically by hamartomatous lesions of cardiac Purkinje cells. [PMID:21585276, PMID:28050600]

The definition of the Ventricular escape rhythms is that A ventricular escape rhythm occurs whenever higher-lever pacemakers in AV junction or sinus node fail to control ventricular activation. Escape rate is usually 20-40 bpm, often associated with broad QRS complexes (at least 120 ms). []
The definition of the Hypoplastic left atrium is that Underdeveloped, small left heart atrium []
The definition of the Concentric hypertrophic cardiomyopathy is that Hypertrophic cardiomyopathy with an symmetrical and concentric pattern of hypertrophy.

The definition of the Total anomalous pulmonary venous return is that Total anomalous pulmonary venous return refers to a congenital malformation in which all four pulmonary veins do not connect normally to the left atrium, but instead drain abnormally to the right atrium.

The definition of the Impaired left ventricular function is that Inability of the left ventricle to perform its normal physiologic function. Failure is either due to an inability to contract the left ventricle or the inability to relax completely and fill with blood during diastole.
The definition of the Dysplastic pulmonary valve is that A congenital malformation of the pulmonary valve characterized by leaflet deformation. [PMID:7704986]
The definition of the Shortened PR interval is that Reduced time for the PR interval (beginning of the P wave to the beginning of the QRS complex). In adults, normal values are 120 to 200 ms long.
The definition of the Elevated right atrial pressure is that An abnormal increase in magnitude of the pressure in the right atrium. [PMID:25211049]

The definition of the Complete heart block with broad RS complexes is that A type of third degree heart block in which the escape rhythm arises at a relatively low part of the conduction system (below the atrioventricular node), which produces a wide QRS complex. []
The definition of the Left posterior fascicular block is that Conduction block in the posterior division of the left bundle branch of the bundle of His.

The definition of the Membranous subvalvular aortic stenosis is that Subvalvular stenosis is caused by a diaphragm-like membrane. The stenosis is clinically manifested like any other form of aortic stenosis but is often associated with some aortic insufficiency.
The definition of the Dysplastic aortic valve is that A congenital malformation of the aortic valve characterized by leaflet deformation. [PMID:21349746]
The definition of the Premature arteriosclerosis is that Arteriosclerosis occurring at an age that is younger than usual.

The definition of the Complete heart block with narrow QRS complexes is that A type of third degree heart block in which the escape rhythm arises at the atrioventricular node, which produces a narrow QRS complex. []

The definition of the Tricuspid regurgitation is that Failure of the tricuspid valve to close sufficiently upon contraction of the right ventricle, causing blood to regurgitate (flow backward) into the right atrium.

The definition of the Premature coronary artery disease is that Reduction of the diameter of the coronary arteries as the result of an accumulation of atheromatous plaques within the walls of the coronary arteries before age of 45. [PMID:28070240]
The definition of the Bicuspid pulmonary valve is that The presence of a bicuspid pulmonary valve.
The definition of the Pericardial lymphangiectasia is that An abnormal dilatation of lymph vessels in the pericardium. [PMID:18391124]

The definition of the Prolonged QTc interval is that A longer than normal interval (corrected for heart rate) between the Q and T waves in the heart's cycle. Prolonged QTc can cause premature action potentials during late phase depolarizations thereby leading to ventricular arrhythmias and ventricular fibrillations. [PMID:24097136]

The definition of the Global systolic dysfunction is that A reduced ejection fraction and an enlarged left ventricle chamber, the latter by an increased resistance to filling with increased filling pressures. Systolic dysfunction is clinically associated with left ventricular failure in the presence of marked cardiomegaly. [PMID:24173273, PMID:7713107]
The definition of the Flattened metatarsal heads is that Abnormally flat shape of the heads of the metatarsal bones.
The definition of the Generalized morning stiffness is that A sensation of stiffness in the joints that occurs following waking up in the morning.

The definition of the Stiff interphalangeal joints is that Interphalangeal joint stiffness is a perceived sensation of tightness in the interphalangeal joints when attempting to move them after a period of inactivity.
The definition of the aplasia of the abdominal wall musculature is that Absence of the abdominal musculature.
The definition of the Spontaneous esophageal perforation is that The occurrence of the full-thickness tear (perforation) of the wall of the esophagus.
The definition of the Pancreatic pseudocyst is that Cyst-like space not lined by epithelium and contained within the pancreas. Pancreatic pseudocysts are often associated with pancreatitis.
The definition of the Gastric hypertrophy is that Hypertrophy of the stomach.
The definition of the Secretory diarrhea is that Watery voluminous diarrhea resulting from an imbalance between ion and water secretion and absorption.
The definition of the Intrahepatic bile duct cysts is that The presence of cyst of the intrahepatic bile duct.
The definition of the Hypoplastic colon is that Underdevelopment of the colon.

The definition of the Anal mucosal leukoplakia is that Leukoplakia is a precancerous dermatosis of mucous membranes analogous Leukoplakia is basically a chronic inflammatory hypertrophy in which anaplasia and malignant dyskeratosis may develop and subsequently advance to an invasive squamous cell cancer. The clinical diagnosis of primary anal leukoplakia is indicated by single or multiple slightly raised,irregular, marginated, grayish-white keratinized' patches in the anal canal. Tissue biopsy is necessary for confirmation.
The definition of the Pancreatic calcification is that The presence of abnormal calcium deposition lesions in the pancreas.
The definition of the Intestinal obstruction is that Blockage or impairment of the normal flow of the contents of the intestine towards the anal canal.

The definition of the Frequent Giardia lamblia infestation is that Increased susceptibility to Giardia lamblia infection of the intestine, as manifested by a medical history of multiple episodes of Giardia lamblia intestinal infection.
The definition of the Anoperineal fistula is that The presence of a fistula (abnormal tunnel) between the anal canal and the perineum.

The definition of the Absence of intrinsic factor is that Absence of gastric intrinsic factor, which is normally produced by the parietal cells of the stomach, and is required for the absorption of vitamin B12.
The definition of the Bowel diverticulosis is that The presence of multiple diverticula of the intestine.
The definition of the Rectal abscess is that A collection of pus in the area of the rectum.
The definition of the Intestinal edema is that Accumulation of cell free, noninflammatony fluid within the wall of the intestinal tract producing uniform thickening of the mucosal folds.
The definition of the Adenomatous colonic polyposis is that Presence of multiple adenomatous polyps in the colon.
The definition of the Biliary tract obstruction is that Obstruction affecting the biliary tree.
The definition of the Chronic gastritis is that A chronic form of gastritis.
The definition of the Pancreatic cysts is that The presence of developmental dysplasia of the pancreas.
The definition of the Hypoplasia of the gallbladder is that The presence of a hypoplastic gallbladder.
The definition of the Jejunal atresia is that A developmental defect resulting in abnormal closure, or atresia of the tubular structure of the jejunum.
The definition of the Chronic calcifying pancreatitis is that A form of chronic pancreatitis that is characterized by calcification.
The definition of the Degenerative liver disease is that The presence of degenerative changes of the liver.

The definition of the Total intestinal aganglionosis is that A congenital defect characterized by the lack of ganglion cells in the entire intestine, i.e., the aganglionic segment comprises the entire large and small bowel.
The definition of the Extrahepatic biliary duct atresia is that Atresia in the extrahepatic bile duct.
The definition of the Partial abdominal muscle agenesis is that Failure to form of portions of the abdominal musculature.
The definition of the Intestinal hypoplasia is that Developmental hypoplasia of the intestine.
The definition of the Giant hypertrophic gastritis is that A type of gastritis characterized by excessive proliferation of the gastric mucosa and diffuse thickening of the gastric mucosal folds.
The definition of the Hypoplasia of the abdominal wall musculature is that Underdevelopment of the abdominal musculature.
The definition of the Intrahepatic biliary atresia is that Atresia in the intrahepatic bile duct.
The definition of the Absence of pectoralis minor muscle is that Aplasia (congenital absence) of the pectoralis minor.
The definition of the Unilateral absence of pectoralis major muscle is that Aplasia (congenital absence) of the pectoralis minor on only one side of the chest.

The definition of the Abnormal facility in opposing the shoulders is that Increased range of shoulder movement related to aplasia or hypoplasia of the clavicles that results in the ability to approximate the shoulders in front of the chest. [PMID:23289840]
The definition of the Joint hemorrhage is that Hemorrhage occurring within a joint. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:gcarletti]
The definition of the Gastritis is that The presence of inflammation of the gastric mucous membrane.
The definition of the Abnormality of the gallbladder is that An abnormality of the gallbladder.
The definition of the Abnormality of the jejunum is that An abnormality of the jejunum, i.e., of the middle section of the small intestine.

The definition of the Intestinal polyp is that A discrete abnormal tissue mass that protrudes into the lumen of the intestine and is attached to the intestinal wall either by a stalk, pedunculus, or a broad base.

The definition of the Spontaneous abortion is that A pregnancy that ends at a stage in which the fetus is incapable of surviving on its own, defined as the spontaneous loss of a fetus before the 22th week of pregnancy.

The definition of the Prominent nasolabial fold is that Exaggerated bulkiness of the crease or fold of skin running from the lateral margin of the nose, where nasal base meets the skin of the face, to a point just lateral to the corner of the mouth (cheilion, or commissure). [PMID:19125428]
The definition of the Absent nasal septal cartilage is that Lack of the cartilage of the nasal septum.
The definition of the Depressed nasal bridge is that Posterior positioning of the nasal root in relation to the overall facial profile for age. [PMID:19152422]
The definition of the Abnormality of the nares is that Abnormality of the nostril.
The definition of the Arterial dissection is that A separation (dissection) of the layers of an artery.

The definition of the Pseudocoarctation of the aorta is that Pseudocoarctation is a congenital anomaly of kinking, or buckling, of the aorta without a pressure gradient across the lesion. It is characterized by elongation and kinking of the aorta at the level of the ligamentum arteriosum.
The definition of the Premature occlusive vascular disease is that Peripheral arterial stenosis with onset before the age of 50 years. []

The definition of the Persistent left superior vena cava is that A rare congenital vascular anomaly that results when the left superior cardinal vein caudal to the innominate vein fails to regress. [PMID:18847480]
The definition of the Carotid artery tortuosity is that Abnormal tortuous (i.e., twisted) form of the carotid arteries.
The definition of the Aortic arch calcification is that Calcification, that is, pathological deposition of calcium salts in the arch of aorta.
The definition of the Cerebral venous thrombosis is that Formation of a blood clot (thrombus) inside a cerebral vein, causing the obstruction of blood flow.
The definition of the Capillary hemangiomas is that The presence of a capillary hemangioma, which are hemangiomas with small endothelial spaces.
The definition of the Large vessel vasculitis is that A type of vasculitis (inflammation of blood vessel walls) affecting large arteries such as the aorta and branches of the aorta.
The definition of the Agenesis of pulmonary vessels is that A developmental defect characterized by the lack of formation of the pulmonary blood vessels. []
The definition of the Pulmonary arterial intimal fibrosis is that Formation of excess fibrous connective tissue in the tunica intima (innermost layer) of arteries in the pulmonary circulation.

The definition of the Arterial fibromuscular dysplasia is that An arterial lesion that is characterized by either intimal fibroplasia, with neointimal lesions of cells and matrix deposition, or medial fibroplasia, in which there is loss of smooth muscle cells and increased deposition of collagen and proteoglycans in the medial layer. [PMID:27939641]

The definition of the Increased pulmonary vascular resistance is that Pulmonary vascular resistance (PVR) more than 3 wood units, as defined by the current definition of pulmonary hypertension. 95% of individuals have a PVR of less than 2.4 wood units. []
The definition of the Cerebral vasculitis is that Inflammation of the blood vessels within the brain.

The definition of the Mandibulofacial dysostosis is that A type of craniofacial dysostosis associated with abnormalities of the external ears, mirognathia, macrostomia, coloboma of the lower eyelid, and cleft palate. This is a bundled term that is left in the HPO now for convenience with legacy annotations but should not be used for new annotations.
The definition of the Hemifacial hypertrophy is that Unilateral overgrowth of facial tissues, including muscles, bones and skin.

The definition of the Disturbance of facial expression is that An abnormality of the gestures or movements executed with the facial muscles with which emotions such as fear, joy, sadness, surprise, and disgust can be expressed.
The definition of the Extension of hair growth on temples to lateral eyebrow is that A pattern of hair growth in which there is hair extending from the temples to the lateral eyebrows.
The definition of the Hypoplastic philtrum is that Underdevelopment of the philtrum.
The definition of the Progeroid facial appearance is that A degree of wrinkling of the facial skin that is more than expected for the age of the individual, leading to a prematurely aged appearance.
The definition of the Recurrent mandibular subluxations is that Recurrent partial dislocations of the mandible.
The definition of the Sparse lateral eyebrow is that Decreased density/number and/or decreased diameter of lateral eyebrow hairs.
The definition of the Abnormality of complement system is that An abnormality of the complement system.

The definition of the Autonomic bladder dysfunction is that Abnormal bladder function (increased urge or frequency of urination or urge incontinence) resulting from abnormal functioning of the autonomic nervous system.
The definition of the Hypoplasia of the bladder is that Underdevelopment of the urinary bladder.
The definition of the Abnormality of the carotid arteries is that Any structural abnormality of the carotid arteries, including the common carotid artery and its' arterial branches. []

The definition of the Abnormality of the vena cava is that An abnormality of the structure of the veins that return deoxygenated blood from the body into the heart, i.e., the superior vena cava and the inferior vena cava. []
The definition of the Inspiratory stridor is that Inspiratory stridor is a high pitched sound upon inspiration that is generally related to laryngeal abnormalities.
The definition of the Hypoplasia of the epiglottis is that Hypoplasia of the epiglottis.
The definition of the aplasia of the thymus is that Absence of the thymus. This feature may be appreciated by the lack of a thymic shadow upon radiographic examination.
The definition of the Severe B lymphocytopenia is that A severe form of B lymphocytopenia in which the count of B cells is very low or absent.

The definition of the Recurrent streptococcus pneumoniae infections is that Increased susceptibility to streptococcus pneumoniae infections as manifested by a history of recurrent infections by streptococcus pneumoniae.
The definition of the Abnormality of humoral immunity is that An abnormality of the humoral immune system, which comprises antibodies produced by B cells as well as the complement system.
The definition of the Abnormality of B cell physiology is that An abnormality of the physiological functioning of B cells.

The definition of the Recurrent Haemophilus influenzae infections is that Increased susceptibility to Haemophilus influenzae infections as manifested by recurrent episodes of infection by Haemophilus influenzae.

The definition of the Recurrent meningococcal disease is that Recurrent infections by Neisseria meningitidis (one of the most common causes of bacterial meningitis), which is also known as meningococcus.
The definition of the Recurrent protozoan infections is that Increased susceptibility to protozoan infections, as manifested by recurrent episodes of protozoan infection.

The definition of the Recurrent opportunistic infections is that Increased susceptibility to opportunistic infections, as manifested by recurrent episodes of infection by opportunistic agents, i.e., by microorganisms that do not usually cause disease in a healthy host, but are able to infect a host with a compromised immune system.
The definition of the Reduction of neutrophil motility is that An abnormal reduction of the cell motility of neutrophils.
The definition of the Recurrent candida infections is that An increased susceptibility to candida infections, as manifested by a history of recurrent episodes of candida infections.
The definition of the T lymphocytopenia is that An abnormally low count of T cells.
The definition of the Increase in B cell number is that An abnormal increase from the normal count of B cells.
The definition of the Recurrent bacterial skin infections is that Increased susceptibility to bacterial infections of the skin, as manifested by recurrent episodes of infectious dermatitis.
The definition of the Decreased number of CD4+ T cells is that A decreased proportion of circulating CD4-positive helper T cells relative to total T cell count.
The definition of the Chronic intestinal candidiasis is that Persistent overgrowth of Candida albicans in the gastrointestinal tract.
The definition of the Decreased number of CD8+ T cells is that A decreased proportion of circulating CD8-positive, alpha-beta T cells relative to total number of T cells.

The definition of the Recurrent gram-negative bacterial infections is that Increased susceptibility to infection by gram-negative bacteria, as manifested by a medical history of repeated or frequent infections by these agents.

The definition of the Recurrent sinopulmonary infections is that An increased susceptibility to infections involving both the paranasal sinuses and the lungs, as manifested by a history of recurrent sinopulmonary infections.

The definition of the Recurrent Neisserial infections is that Recurrent infections by bacteria of the genus Neisseria, including N. meningitidis (one of the most common causes of bacterial meningitis).

The definition of the Transient hypogammaglobulinemia of infancy is that At birth, newborns are endowed with maternal antibodies. IgG production normally begins at the age of two months. A delay in recovery from this physiological hypogammaglobulinemia between the 3rd and the 6th month of life, and of recovery period between 18 and 36 months defines transient newborn hypogammaglobulinemia.
The definition of the Maxillozygomatic hypoplasia is that Hypoplasia of the maxillozygomatic complex.
The definition of the Sclerotic cranial sutures is that An increased density in the cranial sutures following obliteration.

The definition of the Widely patent coronal suture is that The presence of a coronal suture (the cranial suture that separates the frontal and parietal bones) that is not ossified but rather wide open at an age when it is normally closed.
The definition of the Widened posterior fossa is that Abnormal increased size of the posterior cranial fossa. [PMID:28295149]

The definition of the Obtuse angle of mandible is that Abnormally flat (obtuse) angle of the mandible. The angle of the mandibular, located at the junction between the body and the ramus of the mandible, is normally close to being a right angle. This terms describes an abnormal increase of this angle such that the mandible appears flatter than normal.
The definition of the Calvarial osteosclerosis is that An increase in bone density affecting the calvaria (roof of the skull).
The definition of the Absent/hypoplastic paranasal sinuses is that Aplasia or hypoplasia of the paranasal sinuses.

The definition of the Premature closure of fontanelles is that Normally, the posterior and lateral fontanelles are obliterated by about six months after birth, the anterior fontanelle closes by about the middle of the second year. This term refers to the situation in which the fontanelles close at an inappropriately early time point.
The definition of the Calcification of falx cerebri is that The presence of calcium deposition in the falx cerebri.
The definition of the Facial hyperostosis is that Excessive growth (overgrowth) of the facial bones, that is of the facial skeleton.
The definition of the Frontal bone hypoplasia is that Underdevelopment of the frontal bone.
The definition of the Flat occiput is that Reduced convexity of the occiput (posterior part of skull). [PMID:19125436]
The definition of the Fusion of middle ear ossicles is that Bony fusion of malleus, incus, and stapes.

The definition of the Decreased calvarial ossification is that Abnormal reduction in ossification of the calvaria (roof of the skull consisting of the frontal bone, parietal bones, temporal bones, and occipital bone).

The definition of the Widely patent sagittal suture is that The presence of a sagittal suture (the cranial suture that separates the left and right parietal bones) that is not ossified but rather wide open at an age when it is normally closed.
The definition of the IgE deficiency is that An abnormally decreased level of immunoglobulin E (IgE) in blood.
The definition of the Abnormality of the epiglottis is that An abnormality of the epiglottis.
The definition of the Postnatal microcephaly is that Head circumference which falls below 2 standard deviations below the mean for age and gender because of insufficient head growth after birth.
The definition of the Small fontanelle is that A fontanelle that is small for age.
The definition of the Prominent metopic ridge is that Vertical bony ridge positioned in the midline of the forehead.
The definition of the Postnatal macrocephaly is that The postnatal development of an abnormally large skull (macrocephaly).

The definition of the Metopic suture patent to nasal root is that The frontal suture divides the two halves of the frontal bone in infants and usually fuses by the age of six years. The suture runs from the bregma (the point on the skull at which the coronal suture is intersected perpendicularly by the sagittal suture) to the nasion or nasal root. This term applies if the suture is widely patent from bregma to nasal root.

The definition of the Chronic myelogenous leukemia is that A myeloproliferative disorder characterized by increased proliferation of the granulocytic cell line without the loss of their capacity to differentiate.

The definition of the Hemoglobin Barts is that Normal adult hemoglobin is composed of two chains each of alpha and beta globin. Hb Barts (Hemoglobin Barts) is a tetramer with four gamma globin chains, and is essentially pathognomonic for one or another form of alpha thalassemia. Hb Barts has an extremely high affinity for oxygen, resulting in almost no oxygen delivery to the tissues.
The definition of the Waldenstrom macroglobulinemia is that Presence of a monoclonal immunoglobulin M protein in the serum.
The definition of the Transient erythroblastopenia is that A transient reduction in the number of erythroblasts in the circulation.
The definition of the Heinz body anemia is that Anemia characterized by abnormal intracellular inclusions, composed of denatured hemoglobin, found on the membrane of red blood cells.
The definition of the Increased megakaryocyte count is that Increased megakaryocyte number, i.e., of platelet precursor cells, present in the bone marrow.
The definition of the T-cell lymphoma/leukemia is that A type of T-cell lymphoma in which cancerous T-cells may present in the blood (leukemia), lymph nodes (lymphoma), skin or in multiple areas.
The definition of the Erythrocyte macrocytosis is that Larger than normal size of erythrocytes.

The definition of the Chronic disseminated intravascular coagulation is that A chronic form of disseminated intravascular coagulation in which a persistent weak or intermittent activating stimulus is present and destruction and production of coagulation factors and platelets are balanced.

The definition of the Disseminated intravascular coagulation is that Disseminated intravascular coagulation is characterized by the widespread activation of coagulation, which results in the intravascular formation of fibrin and ultimately thrombotic occlusion of small and midsize vessels.
The definition of the Pyridoxine-responsive sideroblastic anemia is that A type of sideroblastic anemia that is alleviated by pyridoxine (vitamin B-6) treatment.

The definition of the Lymphoid leukemia is that A malignant lymphocytic neoplasm of B-cell or T-cell lineage involving primarily the bone marrow and the peripheral blood. This category includes precursor or acute lymphoblastic leukemias and chronic leukemias. [NCIT:C7539]
The definition of the Reduced kininogen activity is that Reduction in the amount of kininogen, which functions as a cofactor in the contact phase of the intrinsic blood coagulation cascade.
The definition of the Bone marrow hypocellularity is that A reduced number of hematopoietic cells present in the bone marrow relative to marrow fat.

The definition of the Biphenotypic acute leukaemia is that A type of actue leukemia with features characteristic of both the myeloid and lymphoid lineages. These leukemias are for this reason are designated mixed-lineage, hybrid or biphenotypic acute leukemias.
The definition of the Exercise-induced hemolysis is that A form of hemolytic anemia that can be triggered by exertion.
The definition of the Decreased mean platelet volume is that Average platelet volume below the lower limit of the normal reference interval.
The definition of the Red blood cell keratocytosis is that A form of poikilocytosis in which the abnormally shaped erythrocytes have notches that results in projections that look like horns.
The definition of the Congenital agranulocytosis is that Congenital onset of a marked decrease in the number of granulocytes.
The definition of the Prolonged whole-blood clotting time is that An abnormal prolongation (delay) in the time required by whole blood to produce a visible clot.

The definition of the Reduced protein C activity is that An abnormality of coagulation related to a decreased concentration of vitamin K-dependent protein C. Protein C is activated to protein Ca by thrombin bound to thrombomodulin. Activated protein C degrades factors VIIIa and Va.
The definition of the Myeloproliferative disorder is that Proliferation (excess production) of hemopoietically active tissue or of tissue which has embryonic hemopoietic potential.
The definition of the Megakaryocytopenia is that A reduced count of megakaryocytes.

The definition of the Chronic lymphatic leukemia is that A chronic lymphocytic/lymphatic/lymphoblastic leukemia (CLL) is a neoplastic disease characterized by proliferation and accumulation (blood, marrow and lymphoid organs) of morphologically mature but immunologically dysfunctional lymphocytes. A CLL is always a B-cell lymphocytic leukemia as there are no reports of cases of T-cell lymphocytic leukemias.

The definition of the Abnormality of the metopic suture is that The frontal suture divides the two halves of the frontal bone of the skull in infants and children and generally undergoes fusion by the age of six. A persistent frontal suture is referred to as a metopic suture"."
The definition of the Abnormality of the zygomatic arch is that An abnormality of the zygomatic arch, also known as the cheek bone.

The definition of the Imbalanced hemoglobin synthesis is that Normal hemoglobin synthesis is characterized by production of equal amounts of alpha and beta globins. This term refers to a deviation from this pattern and is the main characteristic of the various forms of thalassemia.
The definition of the Abnormality of bone marrow cell morphology is that An anomaly of the form or number of cells in the bone marrow.
The definition of the Multiple renal cysts is that The presence of many cysts in the kidney. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:Eurenomics_ewuehl]
The definition of the Decreased numbers of nephrons is that A reduction in the count of nephrons per kidney. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:Eurenomics_ewuehl]
The definition of the Absence of renal corticomedullary differentiation is that A lack of differentiation between renal cortex and medulla on diagnostic imaging.
The definition of the Reduced renal corticomedullary differentiation is that Reduced differentiation between renal cortex and medulla on diagnostic imaging.
The definition of the Renal magnesium wasting is that High urine magnesium in the presence of hypomagnesemia. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:Eurenomics_ewuehl]

The definition of the Non-acidotic proximal tubulopathy is that A type of proximal renal tubulopathy characterized by resorption defects leading to glycosuria, aminoaciduria, tubular proteinuria, renal hypophosphatemia, and urate tubular hyporeabsorption without bicarbonate loss.

The definition of the Tubulointerstitial fibrosis is that A progressive detrimental connective tissue deposition (fibrosis) on the kidney parenchyma involving the tubules and interstitial tissue of the kidney. Tubulointerstitial injury in the kidney is complex, involving a number of independent and overlapping cellular and molecular pathways, with renal interstitial fibrosis and tubular atrophy (IF/TA) as the final common pathway. However, IF and TA are separable, as shown by the profound TA in renal artery stenosis, which characteristically has little or no fibrosis (or inflammation). For new annotations it is preferable to annotate to the specific HPO terms for Renal interstitial lfibrosis and/or Renal tubular atrophy.
The definition of the Duplication of renal pelvis is that A duplication of the renal pelvis.
The definition of the Tubular basement membrane disintegration is that DIsruption and breaking up of the basement membrane of the tubules of the kidney.
The definition of the Renal cell carcinoma is that A type of carcinoma of the kidney with origin in the epithelium of the proximal convoluted renal tubule.
The definition of the Patchy palmoplantar keratoderma is that A focal type of palmoplantar keratoderma in which only certain areas of the palms and soles are affected.
The definition of the Giant melanosomes in melanocytes is that The presence of large spherical melanosomes (1 to 6 micrometer in diameter) in the cytoplasm of melanocytes.
The definition of the Congenital alopecia totalis is that Loss of all scalp hair with congenital onset.

The definition of the Facial telangiectasia in butterfly midface distribution is that Telangiectases (small dilated blood vessels) located near the surface of the skin in a butterfly midface distribution.

The definition of the Congenital giant melanocytic nevus is that The giant congenital nevus is greater than 8 cm in size, pigmented and often hairy. A giant congenital nevus is smaller in infants and children, but it usually continues to grow with the child.
The definition of the Large cafe-au-lait macules with irregular margins is that Large hypermelanotic macules with jagged borders.
The definition of the Bilobate gallbladder is that The presence of a bilobed gallbladder, related to a duplication of the gallbladder primordium.
The definition of the aplasia/hypoplasia of the femur is that Absence or underdevelopment of the femur.

The definition of the Accelerated skeletal maturation is that An abnormally increased rate of skeletal maturation. Accelerated skeletal maturation can be diagnosed on the basis of an estimation of the bone age from radiographs of specific bones in the human body.
The definition of the Thoracolumbar kyphosis is that Hyperconvexity of the thoracolumbar spine producing a rounded or humped appearance.
The definition of the Hypermobility of interphalangeal joints is that The ability of the interphalangeal joints to move beyond their normal range of motion.

The definition of the Broad long bones is that Increased cross-section (diameter) of the long bones. Note that widening may primarily affect specific regions of long bones (e.g., diaphysis or metaphysis), but this should be coded separately.
The definition of the Absent ossification of calvaria is that Absent ossification of the calvaria (vault of the skull).
The definition of the Osteoporosis of vertebrae is that Osteoporosis affecting predominantly the vertebrae.
The definition of the Type D brachydactyly is that This type of brachydactyly is characterized by short and broad terminal phalanges of the thumbs and big toes.
The definition of the Hyperextensible hand joints is that The ability of the joints of the hand to move beyond their normal range of motion.
The definition of the Short 3rd toe is that Underdevelopment (hypoplasia) of the third toe.
The definition of the Intervertebral disk calcification is that The presence of abnormal calcium deposition of the intervertebral disk.
The definition of the Bilateral ulnar hypoplasia is that Underdevelopment of the ulna on both sides.

The definition of the Cutaneous syndactyly between fingers 2 and 5 is that A soft tissue continuity in the anteroposterior axis between the second to the fifth fingers that extends distally to at least the level of the proximal interphalangeal joints.
The definition of the Cortical sclerosis is that Sclerosis (abnormal hardening) of cortical bone, characterized by increased radiodensity.
The definition of the Moderate generalized osteoporosis is that Moderate osteoporosis.
The definition of the Multiple digital exostoses is that Multiple exostoses originating in the fingers and toes.

The definition of the Positional foot deformity is that A foot deformity resulting due to an abnormality affecting the muscle and soft tissue. In contrast if the bones of the foot are affected the term structural foot deformity applies.
The definition of the Massively thickened long bone cortices is that Extreme thickening of the cortex of long bones.
The definition of the Os odontoideum is that Separation of the odontoid process from the body of the axis.
The definition of the Bilateral intracranial calcifications is that Deposition of calcium salts on both sides of the brain.

The definition of the Dupuytren contracture is that An abnormality of the hand resulting from contracture of the palmar fascia with a fixed flexion deformity of the metacarpophalangeal (MCP) joints and the proximal interphalangeal (PIP) joints.

The definition of the Distal arthrogryposis is that An inherited primary limb malformation disorder characterized by congenital contractures of two or more different body areas and without primary neurologic and/or muscle disease that affects limb function.
The definition of the Patchy osteosclerosis is that Patchy (irregular) increase in bone density. This can take on many forms depending on severity and distribution as can be seen on x-rays.
The definition of the Postaxial polydactyly type A is that Supernumerary digits located at the ulnar side of the hand with a complete extra finger and extra metacarpal.
The definition of the Bilateral triphalangeal thumbs is that A bilateral form of triphalangeal thumb.
The definition of the Shortening of all metacarpals is that Abnormal reduction in length of all metacarpal bones.
The definition of the Hyperextensible thumb is that The ability of the thumb joints to move beyond their normal range of motion.
The definition of the Nonopposable triphalangeal thumb is that A form of triphalangeal thumb that cannot be placed opposite the fingers of the same hand.
The definition of the Cortical irregularity is that An abnormal irregularity of cortical bone.

The definition of the Spinal stenosis with reduced interpedicular distance is that An abnormal narrowing of the spinal canal related to a reduction in the interpedicular distance (i.e., the distance measured between the pedicles on frontal [coronal] imaging).
The definition of the Short tibia is that Underdevelopment (reduced size) of the tibia.
The definition of the Posterior subluxation of radial head is that Partial dislocation of the head of the radius in the posterior direction.

The definition of the Avascular necrosis of the capital femoral epiphysis is that Avascular necrosis of the proximal epiphysis of the femur occurring in growing children and caused by an interruption of the blood supply to the head of the femur close to the hip joint. The necrosis is characteristically associated with flattening of the femoral head, for which reason the term coxa plana has been used to refer to this feature in the medical literature.
The definition of the Osteosclerosis of the base of the skull is that An increase in bone density affecting the basicranium (base of the skull).
The definition of the Neonatal epiphyseal stippling is that The presence of abnormal punctate (speckled, dot-like) calcifications in one or more epiphyses during the neonatal period.
The definition of the Basilar impression is that Abnormal elevation of the floor of the posterior fossa including occipital condyles and foramen magnum.
The definition of the Small flat posterior fossa is that An abnormally small and flat configuration of the posterior cranial fossa.
The definition of the 2-4 toe cutaneous syndactyly is that A soft tissue continuity in the anteroposterior axis between the toes 2, 3, and 4.
The definition of the Fifth finger distal phalanx clinodactyly is that Bending or curvature of the distal phalanx of little finger in the radial direction (i.e., towards the 4th finger).
The definition of the aplasia/Hypoplasia of the tibia is that Absence or underdevelopment of the tibia.
The definition of the Short forearm is that Underdevelopment of both forearm bones, the ulna and the radius, resulting in a shortened forearm.
The definition of the Absent fourth finger distal interphalangeal crease is that Absence of the distal interphalangeal flexion creases of the fourth finger.
The definition of the Lumbar platyspondyly is that A flattened vertebral body shape with reduced distance beween the vertebral endplates affecting the lumbar spine.
The definition of the Generalized osteosclerosis is that An abnormal increase of bone mineral density with generalized involvement of the skeleton.
The definition of the Cortical thickening of long bone diaphyses is that Abnormal thickening of the cortex of the diaphyseal region of long bones.
The definition of the Short humerus is that Underdevelopment of the humerus.
The definition of the Shortening of all distal phalanges of the toes is that Abnormally short distal phalanx of toe of all toes.
The definition of the Posterior radial head dislocation is that A dislocation of the head of the radius from its socket in the elbow joint in an posterior direction.
The definition of the Absent distal phalanges is that Aplasia (absence) of the distal phalanges.
The definition of the Supernumerary ribs is that The presence of more than 12 rib pairs.
The definition of the Postaxial polysyndactyly of foot is that Combined syndactyly and polydactyly of the foot on the lateral side (i.e., on the side of the little toe).
