The definition of the Short middle phalanx of finger is that Short (hypoplastic) middle phalanx of finger, affecting one or more fingers.
The definition of the Second toe clinodactyly is that Bending or curvature of a second toe in the tibial direction (i.e., towards the big toe).
The definition of the Flexion contracture of toe is that One or more bent (flexed) toe joints that cannot be straightened actively or passively.
The definition of the Dysharmonic delayed bone age is that A type of dysharmonic skeletal maturation in which there is a delay in skeletal maturation whose degree differs markedly in different bones.
The definition of the Rounded middle phalanx of finger is that An abnormally round shape of the middle phalanx of the finger.
The definition of the Diffuse cerebral calcification is that Generalized deposition of calcium salts within the brain.
The definition of the Multiple prenatal fractures is that The presence of bone fractures in the prenatal period that are diagnosed at birth or before.
The definition of the Ulnar radial head dislocation is that A dislocation of the head of the radius from its socket in the elbow joint in an ulnar direction.
The definition of the Type E brachydactyly is that In type E brachydactyly, shortening of the fingers is mainly in the metacarpals and metatarsals.

The definition of the Pseudoarthrosis is that A pathologic entity characterized by a developmental defect in a long bone leading to bending and pathologic fracture, with inability to form a normal bony callus with subsequent fibrous nonunion, leading to the pseudarthrosis (or false joint")."
The definition of the Opposable triphalangeal thumb is that A form of triphalangeal thumb that can be placed opposite the fingers of the same hand.

The definition of the Metaphyseal chondrodysplasia is that An abnormality of skeletal development characterized by a disturbance of the metaphysis and its histological structure with relatively normal epiphyses and vertebrae.
The definition of the Brachytelomesophalangy is that Disproportionately short middle and distal phalanges compared to the hand/foot.
The definition of the Polysyndactyly of hallux is that Combined syndactyly and polydactyly of the great toe.
The definition of the Progressive flexion contractures is that Progressively worsening joint contractures.
The definition of the Congenital finger flexion contractures is that Multiple bent (flexed) finger joints that cannot be straightened actively or passively.
The definition of the Metacarpophalangeal synostosis is that Fusion of a metacarpal bone with the proximal phalanx of the finger distal to it across the corresponding metacarpophalangeal joint.
The definition of the Absent ossification of cervical vertebral bodies is that A lack of bone mineralization of one or more body of cervical vertebra.
The definition of the Aphalangy of the hands is that Absence of a digit or of one or more phalanges of a finger.
The definition of the Hyperostosis cranialis interna is that Bony overgrowth of the internal (endosteal) surface of the calvaria and the base of skull.
The definition of the Progressive forearm bowing is that Progressive bending or abnormal curvature of the forearm skeleton.
The definition of the Double first metacarpals is that Duplication of the metacarpal I bones.
The definition of the Severe osteoporosis is that Severe degree of osteoporosis.

The definition of the Fifth metacarpal with ulnar notch is that Presence of an angular or V -shaped indentation on the ulnar side of the fifth metacarpal bone (i.e., on the sides towards the fifth finger).
The definition of the Abnormal cervical curvature is that The presence of an abnormal curvature of the cervical vertebral column.

The definition of the Delayed pneumatization of the mastoid process is that An abnormally reduced degree of pneumatization (i.e., formation of air cells) in the mastoid process with respect to age-dependent norms.
The definition of the Rhomboid or triangular shaped 5th finger middle phalanx is that Rhomboid or triangular shaped 5th (little) finger middle phalanx.
The definition of the Biliary atresia is that Atresia of the biliary tree.
The definition of the aplasia/Hypoplasia involving the metacarpal bones is that Aplasia or Hypoplasia affecting the metacarpal bones.
The definition of the Abnormal metacarpal morphology is that Any abnormal shape or structure of the metacarpal bones.
The definition of the Supernumerary metacarpal bones is that The presence of more than the normal number of metacarpal bones.
The definition of the Abnormality of phalanx of finger is that Abnormalities affecting the phalanx of finger.

The definition of the Abnormality of the epiphyses of the phalanges of the hand is that Abnormality of one or all of the epiphyses of the phalanges of the hand. Note that this includes the epiphysis of the 1st metacarpal. In contrast to the metacarpals 2-5, the first metacarpal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the digits 2-5 (whereas the proximal phalanx of the thumb is equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits).
The definition of the Abnormal hand morphology is that Any structural anomaly of the hand.
The definition of the Abnormality of the epiphyses of the hand is that Any abnormality of the epiphyses of the phalanges or metacarpal bones.
The definition of the Abnormalities of the cortex of hand bones is that An anomaly of the outer shell (cortex) of a hand bone. []
The definition of the aplasia/hypoplasia involving bones of the hand is that Absence (due to failure to form) or underdevelopment of the bones of the hand.

The definition of the Abnormality of the epiphyses is that An anomaly of epiphysis, which is the expanded articular end of a long bone that developes from a secondary ossification center, and which during the period of growth is either entirely cartilaginous or is separated from the shaft by a cartilaginous disk.

The definition of the Abnormal renal corticomedullary differentiation is that An abnormality of corticomedullary differentiation (CMD) on diagnostic imaging such as magnetic resonance imaging, computer tomography, or sonography. CMD is a difference in the visualization of cortex and medulla.
The definition of the Abnormal respiratory motile cilium morphology is that Abnormal arrangement of the structures of the motile cilium.
The definition of the Bilateral lung agenesis is that Bilateral lack of development of the lungs.
The definition of the Laryngeal obstruction is that Blockage of the upper airway at the level of the larynx often accompanied by respiratory distress.
The definition of the Decreased sensitivity to hypoxemia is that Reduced tendency to respond to a reduced concentration of oxygen in the blood by increasing respiration.
The definition of the Apneic episodes in infancy is that Recurrent episodes of apnea occurring during infancy.
The definition of the Laryngeal web is that A membrane-like structure that extends across the laryngeal lumen close to the level of the vocal cords.
The definition of the Anteroposteriorly shortened larynx is that Abnormal shortening of the larynx in the anteroposterior (front to back) axis.
The definition of the Respiratory acidosis is that Acidosis because of respiratory retention of carbon dioxide.
The definition of the Episodic ketoacidosis is that Intermittent episodes of ketoacidosis.

The definition of the Type II diabetes mellitus is that A type of diabetes mellitus initially characterized by insulin resistance and hyperinsulinemia and subsequently by glucose interolerance and hyperglycemia.
The definition of the Reduced phenylalanine hydroxylase activity is that A reduction in phenylalanine 4-monooxygenase level.
The definition of the Multinodular goiter is that Enlargement of the thyroid gland related to multiple nodules in the thyroid gland.

The definition of the Congenital muscular torticollis is that A congenital form of torticollis resulting from shortening of the sternocleidomastoid muscle and leading to a limited range of motion in both rotation and lateral bending.
The definition of the Redundant neck skin is that Excess skin around the neck, often lying in horizontal folds. [PMID:19125436]
The definition of the Thyroid hypoplasia is that Developmental hypoplasia of the thyroid gland.
The definition of the Nodular goiter is that Enlargement of the thyroid gland related to one or more nodules in the thyroid gland.
The definition of the Decreased adipose tissue around neck is that Reduced amount of adipose tissue in the region of the neck.
The definition of the Ureteral atresia is that A developmental defect defined by the failure of the formation of the lumen (tube) of the ureter.
The definition of the Ureteral obstruction is that Obstruction of the flow of urine through the ureter.
The definition of the Broad phalanx is that Increased side-to-side width of one or more phalanges of the fingers or toes.
The definition of the Cuboidal metacarpal is that Severely shortened metacarpal with a cuboidal appearance.
The definition of the Delayed phalangeal epiphyseal ossification is that Delay in the process of formation and maturation of the epiphysis of one or more phalanx.
The definition of the Metaphyseal cupping of metacarpals is that Metaphyseal cupping affecting the metacarpal bones.

The definition of the Y-shaped metacarpals is that Y-shaped metacarpals are the result of a partial fusion of two metacarpal bones, with the two arms of the Y pointing in the distal direction. Y-shaped metacarpals may be seen in combination with polydactyly.
The definition of the Distal widening of metacarpals is that Abnormal increase in width of the distal region of the metacarpal bones.

The definition of the Cone-shaped metacarpal epiphyses is that A cone-shaped appearance of the epiphyses of the metacarpal bones, producing a 'ball-in-a-socket' appearance. This epiphyses are located at the distal ends of the metacarpal bones.
The definition of the Multiple carpal ossification centers is that A delay in the process of formation and maturation of the epiphysis of one or more long bones.

The definition of the Metacarpophalangeal joint contracture is that A chronic loss of joint motion in metacarpophalangeal joints due to structural changes in muscle, tendons, ligaments, or skin that prevents normal movement.
The definition of the Absent proximal finger flexion creases is that Absence of the proximal interphalangeal flexion creases of the fingers.

The definition of the Malaligned carpal bone is that Malalignement of carpal bone angles either with respect to each other, to the corresponding metacarpals or with respect to the wrist (radius and ulna).
The definition of the 3-4 finger syndactyly is that Syndactyly with fusion of fingers three and four.
The definition of the Metacarpophalangeal joint hyperextensibility is that Increased mobility of one ore more metacarpophalangeal joint.

The definition of the Finger syndactyly is that Webbing or fusion of the fingers, involving soft parts only or including bone structure. Bony fusions are referred to as bony" Syndactyly if the fusion occurs in a radio-ulnar axis. Fusions of bones of the fingers in a proximo-distal axis are referred to as "Symphalangism"."
The definition of the Fingerpad telangiectases is that Telangiectasia (small dilated blood vessels) located in the fingerpads at the tips of the fingers.
The definition of the Tapered metacarpals is that Metacarpal that becomes thinner toward the distal end.
The definition of the Absent phalangeal crease is that Absence of one or more interphalangeal creases (i.e., of the transverse lines in the skin between the phalanges of the fingers).
The definition of the Shortening of all middle phalanges of the fingers is that Short, hypoplastic middle phalanx of finger, affecting all fingers.

The definition of the Multiple palmar creases is that The presence of multiple creases on the palm of the hand (more than the normal three major creases (distal transverse crease, proximal transverse crease, and thenar crease).
The definition of the Shortening of all distal phalanges of the fingers is that Hypoplasia of all of the distal phalanx of finger.
The definition of the Proximal tapering of metacarpals is that Some or all of the metacarpal bones (i.e., metacarpal II to V) have a pointed proximal appearance.
The definition of the Long proximal phalanx of finger is that Increased length of the proximal phalanx of finger.
The definition of the Drumstick terminal phalanges is that Rounding and broadening of the tufts of the distal phalanges.

The definition of the Enlarged metacarpal epiphyses is that Abnormally large size of one or more growth plates (epiphyses) of the metacarpal bones (i.e., the tubular bones of the hand between the carpus and the phalanges).
The definition of the Premature fusion of phalangeal epiphyses is that Fusion of the epiphysis and metaphysis of one or more phalanges prior to the normal age or stage of growth.
The definition of the Abnormal finger flexion creases is that Anomalous flexion crease (i.e., a transverse line that crosses the skin of a finger). []
The definition of the Shortening of all proximal phalanges of the fingers is that Congenital hypoplasia of proximal phalanx of finger or all fingers.

The definition of the Central Y-shaped metacarpal is that A central Y-shaped metacarpal is the result of a partial fusion of two central metacarpals (i.e., metacarpals 2-4) of the hand, with the two arms of the Y pointing in the distal direction. Central Y-shaped metacarpals may be seen as a result of a central polydactyly with partial fusion of the duplicated metacarpal.
The definition of the Broad metacarpal epiphyses is that Increased side-to-side width of the metacarpal epiphyses.

The definition of the Swan neck-like deformities of the fingers is that A swan neck deformity describes a finger with a hyperextended PIP joint and a flexed DIP joint. The most common cause for a swan neck-like deformity is a disruption of the end of the extensor tendon. Conditions that loosen the PIP joint and allow it to hyperextend, for example conditions that weaken the volar plate, can produce a swan neck deformity of the finger. One example is rheumatoid arthritis. Another cause are conditions that tighten up the small (intrinsic) muscles of the hand and fingers, for example hand trauma or nerve disorders, such as cerebral palsy, Parkinson's disease, or stroke.

The definition of the Proximal symphalangism (hands) is that The term proximal symphalangism refers to a bony fusion of the middle and proximal phalanges of the digits of the hand, in other words the proximal interphalangeal joint (PIJ) is missing which can be seen either on x-rays or as an absence of the proximal interphalangeal finger creases.
The definition of the Long phalanx of finger is that Increased length of multiple or a single phalanx of finger.
The definition of the Ulnar deviation of thumb is that Bending or curvature of a thumb towards the ulnar side (towards the ring finger).
The definition of the Mesoaxial hand polydactyly is that The presence of a supernumerary finger (not a thumb) involving the third or fourth metacarpal with associated osseous syndactyly.
The definition of the Irregular metacarpals is that Irregular morphology of one or more metacarpal bones.
The definition of the Chess-pawn distal phalanges is that A morphological abnormality of distal phalanges such that they have the appearance of chess pawns.
The definition of the Metacarpal diaphyseal endosteal sclerosis is that Increase in bone density in the diaphyseal (shaft) region of a metacarpal bone.
The definition of the Decreased palmar creases is that Poorly defined or shallow palmar creases. [PMID:19125433]
The definition of the Deep palmar crease is that Excessively deep creases of the palm. [PMID:19125433]
The definition of the Tapered phalanx of finger is that Phalanges of the fingers becoming thinner toward the distal end.

The definition of the Thimble-shaped middle phalanges of hand is that The middle phalanx of finger resembles a thimble, a small metal cap to protect the finger while sewing that has a broad (proximal) base and narrower top, whereby both base and top are flat.
The definition of the Irregular phalanges is that Alteration of the normally smooth radiographic contour of phalanges producing an irregular appearance.

The definition of the Hypersegmentation of proximal phalanx of second finger is that Presence of an additional phalanx-like bone, producing an extra, wedge-shaped bone at the base of the proximal phalanx of the second finger.
The definition of the Metaphyseal cupping of proximal phalanges is that Metaphyseal cupping affecting the proximal phalanges.
The definition of the Single interphalangeal crease of fifth finger is that Presence of only one (instead of two, as normal) interphalangeal crease of the fifth finger.

The definition of the Tapering pointed ends of distal finger phalanges is that A reduction in diameter of the distal phalanx of finger towards the distal end such that the tip of the phalanx comes to a point (this feature can be observed on radiograms).
The definition of the Osteolysis involving tarsal bones is that An increased resorption of bone matrix by osteoclasts leading to bony defects involving the tarsal bones.
The definition of the Slender metacarpals is that Decreased width of the metacarpal bones (that is, reduced diameter).
The definition of the Shortening of all middle phalanges of the toes is that Abnormal shortening of all middle phalanges of toes.
The definition of the Limited wrist movement is that An abnormal limitation of the mobility of the wrist.
The definition of the Elevated alpha-fetoprotein is that Concentration of alpha-fetoprotein in the blood circulation above the upper limit of normal. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:gcarletti]

The definition of the Abnormality of carpal bone ossification is that An abnormality of the formation and mineralization of any of the tarsal bones, seven bones of the foot comprising the calcaneus, talus, cuboid, navicular, and the cuneiform bones.
The definition of the Abnormality of the epiphyses of the 2nd finger is that Abnormality of one or all of the epiphyses of the proximal, middle, and distal phalanges of the 2nd finger.
The definition of the aplasia/Hypoplasia of the 2nd finger is that A small/hypoplastic or absent/aplastic 2nd finger.
The definition of the aplasia/Hypoplasia of fingers is that Small/hypoplastic or absent/aplastic fingers.
The definition of the Small placenta is that Reduced size of the placenta.
The definition of the Large placenta is that Increased size of the placenta.
The definition of the Fluctuating splenomegaly is that Intermittently increased size of the spleen.
The definition of the Hypoplastic spleen is that Underdevelopment of the spleen.
The definition of the Pancreatic lymphangiectasis is that The presence of lymphangiectasis in the pancreas.
The definition of the Reduced pancreatic beta cells is that Reduced number of beta cells in the pancreatic islets of Langerhans.
The definition of the Pancreatic hyperplasia is that Hyperplasia of the pancreas.
The definition of the Ectopic pancreatic tissue is that The presence of pancreatic tissue outside the normal pancreas, in many cases along the foregut and proximal midgut.
The definition of the Chronic pancreatitis is that A chronic form of pancreatitis.
The definition of the Generalized hypoplasia of dental enamel is that A generalized form of developmental hypoplasia of the dental enamel.
The definition of the Multiple unerupted teeth is that The presence of multiple embedded tooth germs which have failed to erupt.
The definition of the Hypomineralization of enamel is that A decreased amount of enamel mineralization. Hypomineralized enamel has a brown discoloration and brittle aspect.
The definition of the Advanced eruption of teeth is that Premature tooth eruption, which can be defined as tooth eruption more than 2 SD earlier than the mean eruption age.

The definition of the Agenesis of central incisor is that Agenesis of one or more central incisors, i.e., of lower secondary incisor, lower primary incisor, upper secondary incisor, or of upper central primary incisor.
The definition of the Discolored lateral incisors is that The presence of discolored lateral incisors.
The definition of the Abnormality of dental eruption is that An abnormality of tooth eruption.
The definition of the Agenesis of maxillary central incisor is that Agenesis of upper secondary incisor or of upper central primary incisor.
The definition of the Hypoplasia of dental enamel is that Developmental hypoplasia of the dental enamel.
The definition of the Prolonged bleeding after dental extraction is that Prolonged bleeding post dental extraction sufficient to require medical intervention.
The definition of the Dagger-shaped pulp calcifications is that Dagger-shaped calcifications in the dental pulp.
The definition of the Generalized microdontia is that A generalized form of microdontia.
The definition of the Widely spaced primary teeth is that Increased space between the primary teeth. Note this phenotype should be distinguished from increased space due purely to microdontia.

The definition of the Single median maxillary incisor is that A single maxillary central incisor positioned in the midline with morphological symmetry of the crown and bordered by lateral incisors. [PMID:19125428]
The definition of the Irregularly spaced teeth is that Irregular distribution of the teeth along the dental arch, i.e., and irregular spatial pattern of teeth.

The definition of the Premature loss of primary teeth is that Exfoliation of a tooth more than 2 SD earlier than the normal age for the deciduous teeth and not related to traume or neglect. Exfoliation of a permanent tooth is per se abnormal.
The definition of the Alveolar process hypoplasia is that Underdevelopment of the alveolar process (also known as alveolar bone).
The definition of the Supernumerary maxillary incisor is that The presence of a supernumerary, i.e., extra, maxillary incisor, either the primary maxillary incisor or the permanent maxillary incisor.
The definition of the Crowded maxillary incisors is that A type of dental misalignment with crowded central incisors, i.e., of maxillary secondary incisor, or of maxillary central primary incisor.
The definition of the Hypoplasia of the primary teeth is that Decreased size of the primary teeth.
The definition of the Persistence of primary teeth is that Persistence of the primary teeth beyond the age by which they normally are shed and replaced by the permanent teeth.
The definition of the Short dental roots is that Tooth root length more than 2 SD below mean, or subjectively apparently decreased tooth root length.
The definition of the Premature eruption of permanent teeth is that Premature tooth eruption of the permanent dentition.
The definition of the Malformation of mandibular premolar is that An abnormality of the morphology of secondary premolar tooth.
The definition of the Conical mandibular incisor is that An abnormal conical morphology of the primary or permanent mandibular incisors.

The definition of the Peg-shaped maxillary lateral incisors is that A tooth crown with its mesial and distal sides converging or tapering toward the incisal edge causing severe reduction of mesiodistal diameter
The definition of the Abnormality of primary molar morphology is that An abnormality of morphology of primary molar.
The definition of the Screwdriver-shaped incisors is that An abnormality of morphology of the incisor tooth in which the tooth is shaped like a screwdriver blade, i.e., having a rhomboid shape.
The definition of the Microdontia of primary teeth is that Decreased size of the primary teeth.

The definition of the Agenesis of permanent teeth is that A congenital defect characterized by the absence of one or more permanent teeth, including oligodontia, hypodontia, and adontia of the of permanent teeth.
The definition of the Obliteration of the pulp chamber is that Mineralized substance filling the entire dental pulp space. [PMID:162890, PMID:31468724]
The definition of the Failure of eruption of permanent teeth is that Lack of tooth eruption of the secondary dentition.
The definition of the Hypoplasia of the tooth germ is that Developmental hypoplasia of the tooth germ, i.e., of the structure that forms in odontogenesis that will develop into a tooth.
The definition of the Agenesis of mandibular central incisor is that Agenesis of lower secondary incisor or lower primary incisor.
The definition of the Premature loss of permanent teeth is that Premature loss of the permanent teeth.

The definition of the Shovel-shaped maxillary central incisors is that A tooth with a crown with marked lingual or palatal marginal ridges causing scooped lingual or palatal surfaces. [PMID:2212205, PMID:31468724]

The definition of the Crumpled long bones is that An crumpled radiographic appearance of the long bones, as if the long bone had been crushed together producing irregularities. This feature is the result of multiple fractures and repeated rounds of ineffective healing, as can be seen for instance in severe forms of osteogenesis imperfecta.
The definition of the Irregular patellae is that An alteration of the normally relatively smooth margins of the kneecap in radiographic images leading to an irregular contour.
The definition of the Distal ulnar epiphyseal stippling is that The presence of abnormal punctate (speckled, dot-like) calcifications in the distal epiphysis of the ulna.
The definition of the Broad long bone diaphyses is that Increased width of the diaphysis of long bones.
The definition of the Dumbbell-shaped femur is that The femur is shortened and displays flaring (widening) of the metaphyses.

The definition of the Knee flexion contracture is that A type of knee joint contracture in which the knee is in a fixed bent (flexed) configuration such that it cannot be straightened actively or passively.
The definition of the Progressive bowing of long bones is that Progressive bending or abnormal curvature of a long bone.
The definition of the Short lower limbs is that Shortening of the legs related to developmental hypoplasia of the bones of the leg.
The definition of the Hypoplastic distal radial epiphyses is that Underdevelopment of the distal epiphysis of the radius.
The definition of the Wide distal femoral metaphysis is that Increased width of the distal part of the shaft (metaphysis) of the femur.
The definition of the Anterior tibial bowing is that An abnormal anterior bending or curvature of the tibia.
The definition of the Overtubulated long bones is that Overconstriction, or narrowness of the diaphysis and metaphysis of long bones.
The definition of the Increased density of long bones is that An abnormal increase in the bone density of the long bones.

The definition of the Limited pronation/supination of forearm is that A limitation of the ability to place the forearm in a position such that the palm faces anteriorly (supination) and to place the forearm in a position such that the palm faces posteriorly (pronation).
The definition of the Flat distal femoral epiphysis is that An abnormal flattening of the distal epiphysis of femur.
The definition of the Irregular distal femoral epiphysis is that Anomaly of the contour of the Distal epiphysis of femur such that its normally smooth appearance is irregular.
The definition of the Progressive leg bowing is that Progressive bending or abnormal curvature of the leg.
The definition of the Distal tibial bowing is that A bending or abnormal curvature of the distal portion of the tibia.
The definition of the Cortically dense long tubular bones is that Increased density of the compact bone of long bone.
The definition of the Asymmetric radial dysplasia is that The presence of asymmetric developmental dysplasia of the radius.
The definition of the Elongated radius is that Increased length of the radius.
The definition of the Broad femoral neck is that An abnormally wide femoral neck (which is the process of bone, connecting the femoral head with the femoral shaft).
The definition of the Hypoplasia of proximal radius is that Proximal radial shortening owing to a congenital defect of development.
The definition of the Enlargement of the distal femoral epiphysis is that An abnormal enlargement of the distal epiphysis of the femur.
The definition of the Patellar aplasia is that Absence of the patella.
The definition of the Lateral displacement of the femoral head is that A developmental anomaly with lateral displacement of the femoral head.
The definition of the Delayed patellar ossification is that Formation of bone in the patella later than normal.
The definition of the Irregular proximal tibial epiphyses is that Anomaly of the contour of the proximal epiphysis of the tibia such that its normally smooth appearance is irregular.
The definition of the Dorsal subluxation of ulna is that Partial dislocation of the ulna in the dorsal direction.

The definition of the Proximal femoral epiphysiolysis is that Slipped capital femoral epiphysis is defined as a posterior and inferior slippage of the proximal epiphysis of the femur onto the metaphysis (femoral neck), occurring through the physeal plate during the early adolescent growth spurt.
The definition of the Generalized bone demineralization is that A generalized decrease in bone mineral density.
The definition of the Periosteal thickening of long tubular bones is that Thickening of the periosteum of long bone.
The definition of the Limited shoulder movement is that A limitation of the range of movement of the shoulder joint.
The definition of the Thin long bone diaphyses is that Decreased width of the diaphysis of long bones.
The definition of the Anterior bowing of long bones is that An abnormal anterior curvature of a long bone.

The definition of the Abnormality of the pancreatic islet cells is that An abnormality of the islet of Langerhans, i.e., of the regions of the pancreas that contain its endocrine cells. These are the alpha cells, which produce glucagon, the beta cells, which produce insulin and amylin, the delta cells, which produce somatostatin, the PP cells, which produce pancreatic polypeptide, and the epsilon cells, which produce ghrelin.
The definition of the Abnormality of the alveolar ridges is that Any abnormality of the alveolar ridges (on the upper or lower jaws). The alveolar ridges contain the sockets (alveoli) of the teeth.
The definition of the Abnormality of the dental pulp is that An abnormality of the dental pulp.

The definition of the Premature loss of teeth is that Exfoliation of a tooth more than 2 SD earlier than the normal age for the deciduous teeth and not related to traume or neglect. Exfoliation of a permanent tooth is per se abnormal.
The definition of the Abnormality of primary teeth is that Any abnormality of the primary tooth.
The definition of the Abnormality of dental morphology is that Any abnormality of the teeth.
The definition of the Abnormal number of teeth is that The presence of an altered number of of teeth.
The definition of the Agenesis of incisor is that Agenesis of incisor.
The definition of the Abnormality of the dental root is that An abnormality of the dental root.
The definition of the Bowing of the long bones is that A bending or abnormal curvature of a long bone.
The definition of the Bowing of the arm is that A bending or abnormal curvature affecting a long bone of the arm.
The definition of the Abnormality of the femoral metaphysis is that An anomaly of the femoral metaphysis.
The definition of the aplasia/Hypoplasia of the fibula is that Absence or underdevelopment of the fibula.
The definition of the aplasia/hypoplasia involving bones of the lower limbs is that Absence (due to failure to form) or underdevelopment of the bones of the lower limbs.
The definition of the aplasia/Hypoplasia of the ulna is that Absence or underdevelopment of the ulna.
The definition of the aplasia/hypoplasia involving bones of the upper limbs is that Absence (due to failure to form) or underdevelopment of the bones of the upper limbs.
The definition of the aplasia/Hypoplasia of the patella is that Absence or underdevelopment of the patella.
The definition of the Abnormality of femoral epiphyses is that An anomaly of a growth plate of a femur.
The definition of the Abnormality involving the epiphyses of the lower limbs is that An anomaly of one or more epiphyses of one or both legs. []
The definition of the aplasia/Hypoplasia of the radius is that A small/hypoplastic or absent/aplastic radius.
The definition of the aplasia/Hypoplasia involving the carpal bones is that Absence or underdevelopment of the carpal bones.
The definition of the aplasia/hypoplasia involving forearm bones is that Absence (due to failure to form) or underdevelopment of one or more forearm bones.
The definition of the Abnormality involving the epiphyses of the limbs is that An anomaly of one or more epiphyses of a limb. []
The definition of the aplasia/hypoplasia of the humerus is that Absence (due to failure to form) or underdevelopment of the humerus.
The definition of the Laryngeal stridor is that An abnormal high-pitched noisy sound, occurring during inhalation or exhalation caused by the incomplete obstruction in the throat.

The definition of the Alveolar proteinosis is that Accumulation of amorphous PAS-positive material in the space betweem alveolar macrophages, sometimes as condensed form (oval bodies) are typically found in alveolar proteinosis.
The definition of the Alveolar cell carcinoma is that Adenocarcinoma of the Bronchus.

The definition of the Pulmonary lymphangiectasia is that Abnormal dilatation of the pulmonary lymphatic vessels. Lymphatic fluid in the lung is derived from normal leakage of fluid out of the blood capillaries in the lung. In pulmonary lymphangiectasia, the pulmonary lymphatics are not properly connected and become dilated with fluid.

The definition of the Chronic lung disease is that According to the definitions of the American and British Thoracic Societies, including pulmonary functional tests, X-rays, and CT scans for items such as fibrosis, bronchiectasis, bullae, emphysema, nodular or lymphomatous abnormalities. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:IMM_tkuijpers]
The definition of the Abnormal pulmonary lymphatics is that An abnormality of the pulmonary lymphatic chain.
The definition of the Interstitial pulmonary disease is that Abnormality of the lung parenchyma extending to the pulmonary interstitium and leading to diffuse pulmonary fibrosis.
The definition of the Recurrent pneumonia is that An increased susceptibility to pneumonia as manifested by a history of recurrent episodes of pneumonia.
The definition of the Recurrent intrapulmonary hemorrhage is that A recurrent hemorrhage occurring within the lung. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:gcarletti]
The definition of the Obstructive lung disease is that Obstruction of conducting airways of the lung.
The definition of the Recurrent bronchopulmonary infections is that An increased susceptibility to bronchopulmonary infections as manifested by a history of recurrent bronchopulmonary infections.

The definition of the Extrapulmonary sequestrum is that A type of pulmonary sequestration that is completely enclosed in its own pleural sac, occurring above, within, or below the diaphragm, and without communication with the tracheobronchial tree.

The definition of the Pulmonary arteriovenous malformation is that Pulmonary arteriovenous malformation, a condition most commonly associated with hereditary hemorrhagic telangiectasia, is an abnormal communication between the pulmonary artery and pulmonary vein without an intervening capillary communication. HRCT images usually show a coarse spidery appearance of the peripheral vascular markings in the lungs. More specific findings are obtained in the pulmonary angiogram where the normally invisible capillary phase is replaced by irregular vascular channels bridging the peripheral branches of pulmonary arteries and veins. [PMID:30386957, PMID:788535]

The definition of the Acute hepatic failure is that Hepatic failure refers to the inability of the liver to perform its normal synthetic and metabolic functions, which can result in coagulopathy and alteration in the mental status of a previously healthy individual. Hepatic failure is defined as acute if there is onset of encephalopathy within 8 weeks of the onset of symptoms in a patient with a previously healthy liver.
The definition of the Diffuse hepatic steatosis is that A diffuse form of hepatic steatosis.
The definition of the Decreased mitochondrial complex III activity in liver tissue is that Decreased activity of complex III of the mitochondrion in the liver.
The definition of the Hepatic calcification is that The presence of abnormal calcium deposition in the liver.

The definition of the Biliary hyperplasia is that Hyperplasia of the biliary tree, as manifested by increased size of bile ducts, dilated lumen, and histologically by an increased number of epithelial cells or hyperplasia.
The definition of the Viral hepatitis is that Inflammation of the liver due to infection with a virus.
The definition of the Fluctuating hepatomegaly is that Intermittently increased size of the liver.
The definition of the Increased hepatocellular lipid droplets is that An abnormal increase in the amount of intracellular lipid droplets in hepatocytes.
The definition of the Increased hepatic glycogen content is that An increase in the amount of glycogen stored in hepatocytes compared to normal.
The definition of the Reduced number of intrahepatic bile ducts is that The presence of reduced numbers of intrahepatic bile duct than normal.
The definition of the Acute hepatic steatosis is that An acute form of hepatic steatosis.
The definition of the Macronodular cirrhosis is that A type of cirrhosis characterized by the presence of large regenerative nodules.

The definition of the Prolonged neonatal jaundice is that Neonatal jaundice refers to a yellowing of the skin and other tissues of a newborn infant as a result of increased concentrations of bilirubin in the blood. Neonatal jaundice affects over half of all newborns to some extent in the first week of life. Prolonged neonatal jaundice is said to be present if the jaundice persists for longer than 14 days in term infants and 21 days in preterm infants.
The definition of the Portal fibrosis is that Fibroblast proliferation and fiber expansion from the portal areas to the lobule.
The definition of the Depletion of mitochondrial DNA in liver is that An abnormal reduction in the number of mitochondria in hepatocytes.

The definition of the Congenital pseudarthrosis of the clavicle is that The two portions of the clavicle (corresponding to the two primary ossification centers of the clavicle) are connected by a fibrous bridge that is contiguous with the periosteum, and a synovial membrane develops, resulting in a clavicle with a bipartite appearance radiographically. Congenital pseudarthrosis of the clavicle generally presents as a painless mass or swelling over the clavicle.
The definition of the Straight clavicles is that An abnormally straight configuration of the clavicle, a tubular bone which normally is doubly curved .
The definition of the Premature sternal synostosis is that Prematurely closed sternal sutures.

The definition of the Absent glenoid fossa is that Lack of development of the glenoid fossa, also known as the glenoid cavity, which is the articular surface of the scapula that articulates with the head of the humerus.
The definition of the Scapulohumeral synostosis is that Bony fusion between the humerus and scapula, leading to an impairment in mobility of the affected shoulder joint.
The definition of the Diaphragmatic paralysis is that The presence of a paralyzed diaphragm.

The definition of the Irregular chondrocostal junctions is that Irregular surface of the normally relatively smooth border between the distal part of the ribs and the costal cartilages, which are bars of hyaline cartilage that connect the ribs to the sternum.

The definition of the Precocious costochondral ossification is that Early ossification of the costochondral junction, which is the joint between the ribs and costal cartilage in the front of the rib cage.
The definition of the Midclavicular hypoplasia is that Underdevelopment of the middle portion of the clavicle.
The definition of the Wide intermamillary distance is that A larger than usual distance between the left and right nipple.

The definition of the Decreased number of sternal ossification centers is that A less than normal number of sternal ossification centers. The sternum is initially formed from bilateral sternal plates that chondrify and begin to fuse with ribs at 10 weeks gestational age. Ossification starts in the manubrium and upper part of the sternal body at the 6th month, in the middle of the sternal body at the 7th month, in the lower part of the body during the 1st postnatal year and in the xiphoid process between years 5 and 18. The number of ossification centers vary up to six, and it is the ossification centers that are visualized by prenatal ultrasound. This term describes a reduction in the number of ossification centers compared with age-related norms.
The definition of the Absent in utero rib ossification is that Lack of formation and mineralization of the ribs in utero.
The definition of the Anterior rib punctate calcifications is that Deposition of calcium salts in point-like foci within the anterior portion of one or more ribs.
The definition of the Costochondral joint sclerosis is that Abnormal increase in density of the tissue at the costochondral junctions.
The definition of the Multifocal breast carcinoma is that Breast carcinoma that is bilateral or otherwise multifocal.
The definition of the Absent sternal ossification is that Lack of formation of mineralized bony tissue of the sternum.
The definition of the Glenoid fossa hypoplasia is that Underdevelopment of the glenoid fossa, which is the cavity in the lateral part of the scapula which articulates with the head of the humerus.
The definition of the Osteosclerosis of ribs is that Osteosclerosis of ribs (increased density related to increased bone mass).
The definition of the Midclavicular aplasia is that Developmental defect resulting in congenital absence of the middle portion of the clavicle.
The definition of the Multiple rib fractures is that More than one fracture of the ribs.
The definition of the Thin clavicles is that Abnormally reduced diameter (cross section) of the clavicles.

The definition of the Costal cartilage calcification is that Calcification of the costal cartilages, which are bars of hyaline cartilage found at the anterior ends of the ribs which serve to prolong the ribs forward and contribute to the elasticity of the walls of the thorax.
The definition of the Costochondral pain is that Chest wall pain in the area of the costochondral junctions.
The definition of the aplastic clavicles is that Absence of the clavicles as a developmental defect.

The definition of the Coat hanger sign of ribs is that An abnormal morphology of the ribs consisting of shorted, abnormally curved ribs. On posteroanterior chest radiography, the ribs show a curvature resembling that of a coat hanger (clothes hanger).

The definition of the Prolonged QRS complex is that Increased time for the complex comprised of the Q wave, R wave, and S wave as measured by the electrocardiogram (EKG).. In adults, normal values are 0.06 - 0.10 sec.

The definition of the Granulomatous coronary arteritis is that Inflammation of the coronary arteries involving a granulomatous response, i.e., a non-specific inflammatory response involving granulomas, defined as a compact organized collection of mature mononuclear phagocytes including epithelioid and giant cells.

The definition of the Ventricular extrasystoles is that Premature ventricular contractions (PVC) or ventricular extrasystoles are premature contractions of the heart that arise in response to an impulse in the ventricles rather than the normal impulse from the sinoatrial (SA) node.
The definition of the Abnormal ventricular filling is that An abnormality of filling of a ventricle with blood during diastole.
The definition of the Ventricular preexcitation with multiple accessory pathways is that A form of ventricular preexcitation due to the presence of multiple accessory pathways for cardiac conduction.
The definition of the Endocardial fibrosis is that The presence of excessive connective tissue in the endocardium.
The definition of the Aortic tortuosity is that Abnormal tortuous (i.e., twisted) form of the aorta.
The definition of the Bacterial endocarditis is that A bacterial infection of the endocardium, the inner layer of the heart, which usually involves the heart valves.
The definition of the Myocardial calcification is that Calcium deposition in the myocardium.
The definition of the Pulmonic valve myxoma is that A benign tumor of connective tissue containing mucous or gelatinous material (myxoma) localized in the pumonic valve. [PMID:35420369]
The definition of the Short chordae tendineae of the tricuspid valve is that Abnormally short chordae tendineae of the tricuspid valve.
The definition of the Myocardial steatosis is that Steatosis in the myocardium.
The definition of the Atrioventricular canal defect is that A defect of the atrioventricular septum of the heart.
The definition of the Ventricular aneurysm is that A localized outpouching of ventricular cavity that is generally associated with dyskinesia and paradoxical expansion during systole.
The definition of the Ectopic supraventricular rhythms is that A type of cardiac arrhythmia with premature atrial contractions or beats caused by signals originating from ectopic atrial sites. []
The definition of the Spontaneous coronary artery dissection is that Acute occurrence of a dissection (tear within the tunica intima and entry of blood into the tunica media) of a coronary artery.
The definition of the Abnormality of the coronary arteries is that Any structural abnormality of the coronary arteries.
The definition of the Abnormality of the atrioventricular valves is that An abnormality of an atrioventricular valve.
The definition of the Abnormality of the hepatic vasculature is that An abnormality of the hepatic vasculature.
The definition of the aplasia/Hypoplasia of the clavicles is that Absence or underdevelopment of the clavicles (collar bones).
The definition of the Acute lymphatic leukemia is that A form of acute leukemia characterized by excess lympoblasts.
The definition of the Pancreatic adenocarcinoma is that The presence of an adenocarcinoma of the pancreas.
The definition of the Follicular thyroid carcinoma is that The presence of an follicular adenocarcinoma of the thyroid gland.

The definition of the Papillary renal cell carcinoma type 2 is that A type of papillary renal cell carcinoma in which the papillae are covered by large eosinophilic cells with pleomorphic nuclei, prominent nucleoli, and nuclear pseudostratification.
The definition of the Renal cortical adenoma is that The presence of an adenoma in the cortex of the kidney.

The definition of the Extraadrenal pheochromocytoma is that Pheochromocytoma not originating from the adrenal medulla but from another source such as from chromaffin cells in or about sympathetic ganglia.
The definition of the Squamous cell carcinoma of the skin is that Squamous cell carcinoma of the skin is a malignant tumor of squamous epithelium.
The definition of the Transitional cell carcinoma of the bladder is that The presence of a carcinoma of the urinary bladder with origin in a transitional epithelial cell.
The definition of the Adrenocortical carcinoma is that A malignant neoplasm of the adrenal cortex that may produce hormones such as cortisol, aldosterone, estrogen, or testosterone.
The definition of the Adrenal pheochromocytoma is that Pheochromocytoma originating from the adrenal medulla.
The definition of the Neoplasm of the stomach is that A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the stomach.
The definition of the Cutaneous leiomyosarcoma is that The presence of leiomyosarcoma of the skin.
The definition of the Malignant genitourinary tract tumor is that The presence of a malignant neoplasm of the genital system.
The definition of the Renal pelvic carcinoma is that The presence of a carcinoma in the renal pelvis.
The definition of the Chondrosarcoma is that A slowly growing malignant neoplasm derived from cartilage cells.
The definition of the Papillary renal cell carcinoma is that The presence of renal cell carcinoma in the renal papilla.

The definition of the Pituitary prolactin cell adenoma is that A type of pituitary adenoma originating in prolactin secreting cells. This kind of adenoma is characterized by overproduction of prolactin, and may cause loss of menstrual periods and breast milk production in women.
The definition of the Clear cell renal cell carcinoma is that A subtype of renal cell carcinoma thought to originate from mature renal tubular cells in the proximal tubule of the nehpron.
The definition of the Renal angiomyolipoma is that A benign renal neoplasm composed of fat, vascular, and smooth muscle elements.
The definition of the Ovarian papillary adenocarcinoma is that The presence of a papillary adenocarcinoma of the ovary.
The definition of the Multiple myeloma is that A malignant plasma cell tumor growing within soft tissue or within the skeleton.
The definition of the Benign genitourinary tract neoplasm is that A non-malignant neoplasm of the genitourinary system.
The definition of the Parathyroid carcinoma is that A malignancy of the parathyroid glands. Parathyroid carcinoma usually secretes parathyroid hormone, leading to hyperparathyroidism.
The definition of the Hurthle cell thyroid adenoma is that A kind of thyroid adenoma characterized by the presence of oxyphil cells.
The definition of the Paranasal sinus hypoplasia is that Underdevelopment of the paranasal sinuses.
The definition of the Limb-girdle muscular dystrophy is that Muscular dystrophy affecting the muscles of the limb girdle (the hips and shoulders).
The definition of the Abnormality of the anterior horn cell is that Any anomaly of the anterior horn cell.
The definition of the Cerebral hypomyelination is that Reduced amount of myelin in the nervous system resulting from defective myelinogenesis in the white matter of the central nervous system.
The definition of the aplasia/Hypoplasia of the  cerebellar vermis is that Absence or underdevelopment of the vermis of cerebellum.

The definition of the Type I lissencephaly is that A form of lissencephaly in which the cortex is thickened and has four more or less disorganized layers rather than six normal layers resulting from incomplete neuronal migration during brain development. At neuropathological examination, a 4-layered cortex consists of an upper molecular layer, a second thin cellular layer containing pyramidal neurons usually observed in layer V, a third pale poorly cellular layer and a fourth thick deep layer made up of neurons which had failed to migrate. Radiologocally would manifest as agyria or pachygyria with cortical thickness greater than 10 mm.
The definition of the Severe muscular hypotonia is that A severe degree of muscular hypotonia characterized by markedly reduced muscle tone.

The definition of the Developmental stagnation at onset of seizures is that A cessation of the development of a child in the areas of motor skills, speech and language, cognitive skills, and social and/or emotional skills, following the onset of epilepsy.
The definition of the Congenital Horner syndrome is that A type of Horner syndrome with congenital onset.
The definition of the Hypoplasia of the ventral pons is that Underdevelopment of the ventral portion of the pons.
The definition of the Symmetric spinal nerve root neurofibromas is that Multiple neurofibromas of the spinal nerve roots with a symmetric distribution.
The definition of the Episodic generalized hypotonia is that The occurrence of repeated episodes of generalized muscular hypotonia.
The definition of the Cerebellar vermis atrophy is that Wasting (atrophy) of the vermis of cerebellum.
The definition of the Impaired distal proprioception is that A loss or impairment of the sensation of the relative position of parts of the body and joint position occuring at distal joints.
The definition of the Severe expressive language delay is that A severe delay in the acquisition of the ability to use language to communicate needs, wishes, or thoughts.

The definition of the Lobar holoprosencephaly is that A type of holoprosencephaly in which most of the right and left cerebral hemispheres and lateral ventricles are separated but the most rostral aspect of the telencephalon, the frontal lobes, are fused, especially ventrally. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:GC_HPE]
The definition of the Cerebral hypoplasia is that Underdevelopment of the cerebrum.

The definition of the Symmetrical progressive peripheral demyelination is that A symmetric and progressive loss of myelin from the internode regions along myelinated nerve fibers of the peripheral nervous system.
The definition of the Pontocerebellar atrophy is that Atrophy affecting the pons and the cerebellum.
The definition of the Cerebellar hemangioblastoma is that A hemangioblastoma of the cerebellum.
The definition of the Diffuse peripheral demyelination is that A diffuse loss of myelin from the internode regions along myelinated nerve fibers of the peripheral nervous system.
The definition of the Impaired distal vibration sensation is that A decrease in the ability to perceive vibration in the distal portions of the limbs.
The definition of the Intellectual disability, progressive is that The term progressive intellectual disability should be used if intelligence decreases/deteriorates over time.
The definition of the Intellectual disability, borderline is that Borderline intellectual disability is defined as an intelligence quotient (IQ) in the range of 70-85.
The definition of the Frontotemporal cerebral atrophy is that Atrophy (wasting, decrease in size of cells or tissue) affecting the frontotemporal cerebrum.
The definition of the Congenital intracerebral calcification is that The presence of calcium deposition within brain structures that is present already at the time of birth.
The definition of the Frontal cortical atrophy is that Atrophy of the frontal cortex.

The definition of the Intraaxonal accumulation of curvilinear autofluorescent lipopigment storage material is that Curvilinear intracellular accumulation of autofluorescent lipopigment storage material within axons.
The definition of the Axial muscle stiffness is that Stiffness (a condition in which muscles cannot be moved quickly without accompanying pain or spasm) of the axial musculature.
The definition of the Unilateral polymicrogyria is that Excessive number of small gyri (convolutions) on the surface of one side of the brain.

The definition of the Hypoglycemic encephalopathy is that Brain damage related to a lowering of blood glucose below a critical level (around 30 mg/dl), which may lead to confusion, lethargy and delirium followed by seizures and coma. Prolonged hypoglycemia may lead to irreversible brain damage.
The definition of the Frontoparietal cortical dysplasia is that The presence of developmental dysplasia of the cortex of frontal lobe and the cortex of parietal lobe.
The definition of the Congenital nystagmus is that Nystagmus dating from or present at birth.

The definition of the Impaired distal tactile sensation is that A reduced sense of touch (tactile sensation) on the skin of the distal limbs. This is usually tested with a wisp of cotton or a fine camel's hair brush, by asking patients to say 'now' each time they feel the stimulus.

The definition of the Impaired vibration sensation at ankles is that A decrease in the ability to perceive vibration at the ankles. Clinically, this is usually tested with a tuning fork which vibrates at 128 Hz and is applied to the malleoli of the ankles.
The definition of the Abolished vibration sense is that A complete loss of the ability to perceive vibration.
The definition of the Recurrent meningitis is that An increased susceptibility to meningitis as manifested by a medical history of recurrent episodes of meningitis.
The definition of the Olivopontocerebellar hypoplasia is that Hypoplasia of the cerebellum, pontine nuclei, and inferior olivary nucleus.

The definition of the Abnormal auditory evoked potentials is that An abnormality of the auditory evoked potentials, which are used to trace the signal generated by a sound, from the cochlear nerve, through the lateral lemniscus, to the medial geniculate nucleus, and to the cortex.

The definition of the Proximal spinal muscular atrophy is that Proximal spinal muscular atrophy, i.e., muscular weakness and atrophy related to loss of the motor neurons of the spinal cord and brainstem.
The definition of the Choroid plexus calcification is that The presence of calcium deposition in the choroid plexus.

The definition of the Necrotizing encephalopathy is that A type of encephalopathy (brain disease, damage, or malfunction accompanied by an altered mental state) that is characterized by evidence of necrosis of brain tissue. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:KI_phemming, PMID:23705127]
The definition of the Progressive leukoencephalopathy is that Leukoencephalopathy that gets more severe with time.

The definition of the Alobar holoprosencephaly is that A type of holoprosencephaly characterized by the presence of a single ventricle and no separation of the cerebral hemisphere. The single midline ventricle is often greatly enlarged. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:GC_HPE]

The definition of the Dysplastic corpus callosum is that Dysplasia and dysgenesis of the corpus callosum are nonspecific descriptions that imply defective development of the corpus callosum. The term dysplasia is applied when the morphology of the corpus callosum is altered as a congenital trait. For instance, the corpus callosum may be hump-shaped, kinked, or a striped corpus callosum that lacks an anatomically distinct genu and splenium.
The definition of the Myelin-dependent gliosis is that A type of gliosis that occurs in the vicinity of injured neurons.
The definition of the Basal ganglia gliosis is that Focal proliferation of glial cells in the basal ganglia.

The definition of the Motor axonal neuropathy is that Progressive impairment of function of motor axons with muscle weakness, atrophy, and cramps. The deficits are length-dependent, meaning that muscles innervated by the longest nerves are affected first, so that for instance the arms are affected at a later age than the onset of deficits involving the lower leg.
The definition of the Cavitation of the basal ganglia is that The formation of small cavities in the tissue of the basal ganglia.
The definition of the Fourth cranial nerve palsy is that Decreased strength of the superior oblique muscle. []

The definition of the Attention deficit hyperactivity disorder is that Hyperactivity is a condition characterized by constant and unusually high levels of activity, even in situations where it is deemed inappropriate. []
The definition of the Pain insensitivity is that Inability to perceive painful stimuli.
The definition of the Antenatal intracerebral hemorrhage is that Cerebral hemorrhage that occurs before birth.

The definition of the Pseudobulbar paralysis is that Bilateral impairment of the function of the cranial nerves 9-12, which control musculature involved in eating, swallowing, and speech. Pseudobulbar paralysis is characterized clinically by dysarthria, dysphonia, and dysphagia with bifacial paralysis, and may be accompanied by Pseudobulbar behavioral symptoms such as enforced crying and laughing.
The definition of the Poorly formed metencephalon is that A morphological abnormality of the metencephalon.
The definition of the Cerebral berry aneurysm is that A small, sac-like aneurysm (outpouching) of a cerebral blood vessel.

The definition of the Cerebellar dysplasia is that Cerebellar dysplasia (abnormal growth or development) is defined by abnormal cerebellar foliation, white matter arborization, and gray-white matter junction. Cerebellar dysplasia is a neuroimaging finding that describes abnormalities of both the cerebellar cortex and white matter and is associated with variable neurodevelopmental outcome. Dysplasia may globally involve the cerebellum or affect only one cerebellar hemisphere. In addition, cerebellar dysplasia may be associated with cortical/subcortical cysts.
The definition of the Large basal ganglia is that Increased size of the basal ganglia.
The definition of the Generalized cerebral atrophy/hypoplasia is that Generalized atrophy or hypoplasia of the cerebrum.
The definition of the Progressive language deterioration is that Progressive loss of previously present language abilities.
The definition of the Distal peripheral sensory neuropathy is that Peripheral sensory neuropathy affecting primarily distal sensation.
The definition of the Inferior vermis hypoplasia is that Underdevelopment of the inferior portion of the vermis of cerebellum.

The definition of the Thick corpus callosum is that Increased vertical dimension of the corpus callosum. This feature can be visualized by sagittal sections on magnetic resonance tomography imaging of the brain. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:KI_phemming, PMID:10029348]
The definition of the Extrapyramidal muscular rigidity is that Muscular rigidity (continuous contraction of muscles with constant resistance to passive movement).
The definition of the Decreased amplitude of sensory action potentials is that A reduction in the amplitude of sensory nerve action potential. This feature is measured by nerve conduction studies.
The definition of the DIlated third ventricle is that An increase in size of the third ventricle.
The definition of the Facial-lingual fasciculations is that Fasciculations affecting the tongue muscle and the musculature of the face.
The definition of the Paroxysmal choreoathetosis is that Episodes of choreoathetosis that can occur following triggers such as quick voluntary movements.

The definition of the Arnold-Chiari type I malformation is that Arnold-Chiari type I malformation refers to a relatively mild degree of herniation of the posteroinferior region of the cerebellum (the cerebellar tonsils) into the cervical canal with little or no displacement of the fourth ventricle. It is characterized by one or both pointed (not rounded) cerebellar tonsils that project 5 mm below the foramen magnum, measured by a line drawn from the basion to the opisthion (McRae Line)
The definition of the Hypointensity of cerebral white matter on MRI is that A darker than expected signal on magnetic resonance imaging emanating from the cerebral white matter.
The definition of the Infantile encephalopathy is that Encephalopathy with onset in the infantile period.
The definition of the Segmental peripheral demyelination is that A loss of myelin from the internode regions along myelinated nerve fibers from segments of the peripheral nervous system.

The definition of the Demyelinating peripheral neuropathy is that Demyelinating neuropathy is characterized by slow nerve conduction velocities with reduced amplitudes of sensory/motor nerve conduction and prolonged distal latencies.
The definition of the Temporal cortical atrophy is that Atrophy of the temporal cortex.

The definition of the Subcortical dementia is that A particular type of dementia characterized by a pattern of mental defects consisting prominently of forgetfulness, slowness of thought processes, and personality or mood change.
The definition of the Proximal amyotrophy is that Amyotrophy (muscular atrophy) affecting the proximal musculature.
The definition of the Acute demyelinating polyneuropathy is that Acute progressive areflexic weakness and mild sensory changes resulting from myelin breakdown and axonal degeneration.
The definition of the Pallidal degeneration is that Neurodegeneration involving the globus pallidus,a part of the basal ganglia that is involved in the regulation of voluntary movement.
The definition of the Distal upper limb amyotrophy is that Muscular atrophy of distal arm muscles.

The definition of the Asymmetric limb muscle stiffness is that Stiffness of the limbs (a condition in which muscles cannot be moved quickly without accompanying pain or spasm) occurring in an asymmetric pattern.
The definition of the Progressive extrapyramidal muscular rigidity is that A progressive degree of muscular rigidity (continuous contraction of muscles with constant resistance to passive movement).
The definition of the Diffuse demyelination of the cerebral white matter is that A diffuse loss of myelin from nerve fibers in the central nervous system.

The definition of the Periventricular gray matter heterotopia is that A form of gray matter heterotopia were the mislocalized gray matter is typically located periventricularly, also sometimes called subependymal heterotopia. Periventricular means beside the ventricles. This is by far the most common location for heterotopia. Subependymal heterotopia present in a wide array of variations. There can be a small single node or a large number of nodes, can exist on either or both sides of the brain at any point along the higher ventricle margins, can be small or large, single or multiple, and can form a small node or a large wavy or curved mass.

The definition of the Paroxysmal dyskinesia is that Episodic bouts of involuntary movements with dystonic, choreic, ballistic movements, or a combination thereof. There is no loss of consciousness during the attacks.

The definition of the Absent smooth pursuit is that A complete lack of the ability to track objects with the ocular smooth pursuit system, a class of rather slow eye movements that minimizes retinal target motion.

The definition of the Interosseus muscle atrophy is that Atrophy of the interosseus muscles (including the palmar interossei that lie on the anterior aspect of the metacarpals, the dorsal interosseus muscles of the hand, which lie between the intercarpals, the plantar interosseus muscles, which lie underneath the metatarsal bones, and the dorsal interossei, which are located between the metatarsal bones.
The definition of the Peripheral hypomyelination is that Reduced amount of myelin in the nervous system resulting from defective myelinogenesis in the peripheral nervous system.

The definition of the Focal T2 hyperintense basal ganglia lesion is that A lighter than expected T2 signal on magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) of the basal ganglia. This term refers to a localized hyperintensity affecting a particular region of the basal ganglia.

The definition of the Focal lissencephaly is that A congenital absence of the convolutions of the cerebral cortex and a poorly formed sylvian fissure that affects a particular part of the cortex. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:KI_phemming]
The definition of the Congenital facial diplegia is that Facial diplegia (that is, bilateral facial palsy) with congenital onset.

The definition of the Generalized tonic-clonic seizures on awakening is that Bilateral tonic-clonic seizure of either generalized or focal onset occurring on or soon after wakening (typically within 90 minutes of waking, regardless of the time of day).
The definition of the Cerebral artery atherosclerosis is that The formation of the formation of fibrofatty lesions in the wall of an artery located in the brain.
The definition of the Hemimegalencephaly is that Enlargement of all or parts of one cerebral hemisphere.
The definition of the Photosensitive tonic-clonic seizures is that Generalized-onset tonic-clonic seizures that are provoked by flashing or flickering light.
The definition of the Facial paralysis is that Complete loss of ability to move facial muscles innervated by the facial nerve (i.e., the seventh cranial nerve).
The definition of the Lower limb amyotrophy is that Muscular atrophy affecting the lower limb.
The definition of the Periodic hyperkalemic paralysis is that Episodes of muscle weakness associated with elevated levels of potassium in the blood.
The definition of the Demyelinating motor neuropathy is that Demyelination of peripheral motor nerves.

The definition of the Macrogyria is that Pachygyria is a malformation of cortical development with abnormally wide gyri with sulci 1,5-3 cm apart and abnormally thick cortex measuring more than 5 mm (radiological definition). See also neuropathological definitions for 2-, 3-, and 4-layered lissencephaly.
The definition of the Intracerebral periventricular calcifications is that The presence of calcium deposition in the cerebral white matter surrounding the cerebral ventricles.

The definition of the Decreased distal sensory nerve action potential is that A reduction in the amplitude of sensory nerve action potential in distal nerve segments. This feature is measured by nerve conduction studies.
The definition of the Progressive gait ataxia is that A type of gait ataxia displaying progression of clinical severity.
The definition of the Abnormality of pyramidal motor function is that Functional neurological abnormalities related to dysfunction of the pyramidal tract.
The definition of the Severe demyelination of the white matter is that A severe loss of myelin from nerve fibers in the central nervous system.

The definition of the Type II lissencephaly is that A form of lissencephaly characterized by an uneven cortical surface with a so called 'cobblestone' appearace. There are no distinguishable cortical layers.
The definition of the Symmetric peripheral demyelination is that A symmetric loss of myelin from the internode regions along myelinated nerve fibers of the peripheral nervous system.
The definition of the Spinocerebellar atrophy is that Atrophy affecting the cerebellum and the spinocerebellar tracts of the spinal cord.
The definition of the Absent mesencephalon is that Agenesis of the midbrain. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:KI_phemming]
The definition of the Cerebral dysmyelination is that Defective structure and function of myelin sheaths of the white matter of the brain.
The definition of the Chronic axonal neuropathy is that An abnormality characterized by chronic impairment of the normal functioning of the axons.
The definition of the Spinal muscular atrophy is that Muscular weakness and atrophy related to loss of the motor neurons of the spinal cord and brainstem.

The definition of the Atypical absence seizures is that An atypical absence seizure is a type of generalised non-motor (absence) seizure characterised by interruption of ongoing activities and reduced responsiveness. In comparison to a typical absence seizure, changes in tone may be more pronounced, onset and/or cessation may be less abrupt, and the duration of the ictus and post-ictal recovery may be longer. Although not always available, an EEG often demonstrates slow (<3 Hz), irregular, generalized spike-wave activity.
The definition of the Recurrent bacterial meningitis is that An increased susceptibility to bacterial meningitis as manifested by a medical history of recurrent episodes of bacterial meningitis.

The definition of the Developmental stagnation is that A cessation of the development of a child in the areas of motor skills, speech and language, cognitive skills, and social and/or emotional skills.

The definition of the Facial palsy secondary to cranial hyperostosis is that Paralysis of the facial nerves on the basis of overgrowth of the cranial bones causing impingement upon the seventh cranial nerve.
The definition of the Horizontal jerk nystagmus is that Nystagmus consisting of horizontal to-and-fro eye movements, in which the movement in one direction is faster than in the other.
The definition of the Limb fasciculations is that Fasciculations affecting the musculature of the arms and legs.
The definition of the Posterior fossa cyst is that A discrete posterior fossa cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) collection that does not communicate directly with the fourth ventricle.
The definition of the CNS demyelination is that A loss of myelin from nerve fibers in the central nervous system.
The definition of the Deep white matter hypodensities is that Multiple areas of darker than expected signal on magnetic resonance imaging emanating from the deep cerebral white matter.
The definition of the Generalized dystonia is that A type of dystonia that affects all or most of the body.
The definition of the Impaired pain sensation is that Reduced ability to perceive painful stimuli.
The definition of the Hemifacial seizures is that Focal seizure characterized at onset by clonic movements affecting half of the face. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:jalbers, PMID:28276060]
The definition of the Hypoplasia of the frontal lobes is that Underdevelopment of the frontal lobe of the cerebrum.
The definition of the Bilateral convulsive seizures is that A bilateral tonic-clonic seizure with focal onset is a focal-onset seizure which progresses into a bilateral tonic-clonic phase.
The definition of the Recurrent encephalopathy is that Recurrent episodes of brain dysfunction that may be triggered by factors such as metabolic disturbances or infections.
The definition of the Hypermetric saccades is that A saccade that overshoots the target with the dynamic saccade.
The definition of the Lower limb muscle weakness is that Weakness of the muscles of the legs.
The definition of the Upper limb postural tremor is that A type of tremors that is triggered by holding an arm in a fixed position.

The definition of the Focal seizures is that A focal-onset seizure is a type of seizure originating within networks limited to one hemisphere. They may be discretely localized or more widely distributed, and may originate in subcortical structures. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:jalbers, PMID:28276060, PMID:28276064]
The definition of the Abnormality of the pons is that A structural abnormality of the pons.

The definition of the Atrophy/Degeneration affecting the cerebrum is that The presence of atrophy (wasting) of the cerebrum, also known as the telencephalon, the largest and most highly developed part of the human brain.
The definition of the aplasia/Hypoplasia of the corpus callosum is that Absence or underdevelopment of the corpus callosum.
The definition of the Corpus callosum atrophy is that The presence of atrophy (wasting) of the corpus callosum.
The definition of the Atrophy/Degeneration involving motor neurons is that Wasting involving the motor neuron.

The definition of the Abnormality of the septum pellucidum is that An abnormality of the septum pellucidum, which is a thin, triangular, vertical membrane separating the lateral ventricles of the brain.

The definition of the Abnormality of the choroid plexus is that An abnormality of the choroid plexus, which is the area in the cerebral ventricles in which cerebrospinal fluid is produced by modified ependymal cells.

The definition of the Abnormality of somatosensory evoked potentials is that An abnormality of somatosensory evoked potentials (SSEP), i.e., of the electrical signals of sensation going from the body to the brain in response to a defined stimulus. Recording electrodes are placed over the scalp, spine, and peripheral nerves proximal to the stimulation site. Clinical studies generally use electrical stimulation of peripheral nerves to elicit potentials. SSEP testing determines whether peripheral sensory nerves are able to transmit sensory information like pain, temperature, and touch to the brain. Abnormal SSEPs can result from dysfunction at the level of the peripheral nerve, plexus, spinal root, spinal cord, brain stem, thalamocortical projections, or primary somatosensory cortex.
The definition of the Neoplasm of the gastrointestinal tract is that A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the gastrointestinal tract.
The definition of the Neoplasm of the genitourinary tract is that A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the genitourinary system.
The definition of the Facial telangiectasia is that Telangiectases (small dilated blood vessels) located near the surface of the skin of the face.
The definition of the aplasia cutis congenita of scalp is that A developmental defect resulting in the congenital absence of skin on the scalp.
The definition of the Hypoplastic sweat glands is that Underdevelopment of the sweat glands.
The definition of the Postnatal-onset ichthyosiform erythroderma is that A type of ichthyosiform erythroderma with postnatal onset.
The definition of the Early cutaneous photosensitivity is that Photosensitivity of the skin occurring early in life.
The definition of the Axillary apocrine gland hypoplasia is that Developmental hypoplasia of the apocrine sweat glands in the region of the axilla.
The definition of the Palmoplantar hyperhidrosis is that An abnormally increased perspiration on palms and soles.
The definition of the Nevus flammeus of the forehead is that Naevus flammeus localised in the skin of the forehead.
The definition of the Alopecia totalis is that Loss of all scalp hair.
The definition of the Spontaneous hematomas is that Spontaneous development of hematomas (hematoma) or bruises without significant trauma.
The definition of the Telangiectases of the cheeks is that Telangiectases (small dilated blood vessels) located near the surface of the skin of the cheeks.
The definition of the Telangiectasia of the oral mucosa is that Telangiectasia (that is, the presence of small dilated superficial blood vessels) of the oral mucosa.
The definition of the Few cafe-au-lait spots is that The presence of two to five cafe-au-lait macules.
The definition of the Generalized edema is that Generalized abnormal accumulation of fluid beneath the skin, or in one or more cavities of the body.
The definition of the Congenital ichthyosiform erythroderma is that An ichthyosiform abnormality of the skin with congenital onset.
The definition of the Plaque-like facial hemangioma is that Hemangioma is a benign tumor of the vascular endothelial cells. This term refers to facial hemangiomas that have a plaque-like morphology.
The definition of the Multiple cutaneous leiomyomas is that The presence of multiple leiomyomas of the skin.

The definition of the Partial albinism is that Absence of melanin pigment in various areas, which is found at birth and is permanent. The lesions are known as leucoderma and are often found on the face, trunk, or limbs.
The definition of the Palmoplantar blistering is that A type of blistering that affects the skin of the palms of the hands and the soles of the feet.
The definition of the Flexural lichenification is that Lichenification affecting primarily flexural areas of the skin.
The definition of the Prominent veins on trunk is that Prominent thoracic and abdominal veins.
The definition of the Bitot spots of the conjunctiva is that Keratinization of the bulbar conjunctiva near the limbus (corneoscleral junction), resulting in a raised spot.
The definition of the Sparse facial hair is that Reduced number or density of facial hair.
The definition of the Palmoplantar cutis gyrata is that Cutis gyrata of palms and soles.
The definition of the Periarticular subcutaneous nodules is that Subcutaneous nodules that are located in the vicinity of joints.
