The definition of the Congenital bullous ichthyosiform erythroderma is that An ichthyosiform abnormality of the skin that presents at birth or shortly thereafter with generalized erythema, blistering, erosions, and peeling. In the subsequent months, erythema and blistering improves but patients go on to develop hyperkeratotic scaling that is especially prominent along the joint flexures, neck, hands and feet.
The definition of the Abnormal dermatoglyphics is that An abnormality of dermatoglyphs (fingerprints), which are present on fingers, palms, toes, and soles.

The definition of the Congenital nonbullous ichthyosiform erythroderma is that The term collodion baby applies to newborns who appear to have an extra layer of skin (known as a collodion membrane) that has a collodion-like quality. It is a descriptive term, not a specific diagnosis or disorder (as such, it is a syndrome). Affected babies are born in a collodion membrane, a shiny waxy outer layer to the skin. This is shed 10-14 days after birth, revealing the main symptom of the disease, extensive scaling of the skin caused by hyperkeratosis. With increasing age, the scaling tends to be concentrated around joints in areas such as the groin, the armpits, the inside of the elbow and the neck. The scales often tile the skin and may resemble fish scales.
The definition of the Absence of subcutaneous fat is that Lack of subcutaneous adipose tissue.
The definition of the Diffuse telangiectasia is that Telangiectases (small dilated blood vessels) with a diffuse localization.
The definition of the Focal friction-related palmoplantar hyperkeratosis is that Hyperkeratosis affecting the palm of the hand and the sole of the foot in areas exposed to friction.
The definition of the Decreased number of sweat glands is that The presence of fewer than normal sweat glands.

The definition of the Follicular hyperkeratosis is that A skin condition characterized by excessive development of keratin in hair follicles, resulting in rough, cone-shaped, elevated papules resulting from closure of hair follicles with a white plug of sebum.
The definition of the Edema of the dorsum of hands is that An abnormal accumulation of fluid beneath the skin on the back of the hands.
The definition of the Redundant skin on fingers is that Loose and sagging skin of the fingers.
The definition of the Palmoplantar cutis laxa is that Loose, wrinkled skin of hands and feet.
The definition of the Congenital posterior occipital alopecia is that Loss of hair in the occipital region of the scalp with congenital onset.
The definition of the Severe photosensitivity is that A severe degree of photosensitivity of the skin.
The definition of the Frontal cutaneous lipoma is that Presence of a cutaneous lipoma on the forehead.
The definition of the Absent pigmentation of the ventral chest is that Lack of skin pigmentation (coloring) of the anterior chest.

The definition of the Piebaldism is that Piebaldism is characterized by stable and persistent, well-circumscribed depigmented patches present at birth affecting the skin of the face, trunk, and extremities in a symmetrical distribution.
The definition of the Plantar hyperkeratosis is that Hyperkeratosis affecting the sole of the foot.
The definition of the Multiple cafe-au-lait spots is that The presence of six or more cafe-au-lait spots.

The definition of the Hyperkeratosis lenticularis perstans is that Hyperkeratosis lenticularis perstans (HLP), also known as Flegel disease, is a keratinization abnormality characterized by small, asymptomatic erythematous papules that leave characteristic punctate bleeding when they become detached. The lesions generally occur symmetrically along the top of the foot and on the legs, appearing more rarely on the arms, forearms, palms, and soles, and even on the oral mucosa.
The definition of the Reticular hyperpigmentation is that Increased pigmentation of the skin with a netlike (reticular) pattern.
The definition of the aplasia cutis congenita on trunk or limbs is that A developmental defect resulting in the congenital absence of skin on the trunk or the limbs.
The definition of the aplasia/Hypoplastia of the eccrine sweat glands is that Absence or developmental hypoplasia of the eccrine sweat glands.
The definition of the Painful subcutaneous lipomas is that The presence of multiple subcutaneous lipoma that cause pain.
The definition of the Bilateral single transverse palmar creases is that The distal and proximal transverse palmar creases are merged into a single transverse palmar crease on both hands.

The definition of the Hypoproteinemic edema is that An abnormal accumulation of fluid beneath the skin, or in one or more cavities of the body because of decreased osmotic pressure of plasma (hypoproteinemia).
The definition of the Nevus flammeus nuchae is that Naevus flammeus localised in the skin of the neck. This is one of the most common birthmarks and present in approximately 25% of all newborns.
The definition of the Cutaneous leiomyoma is that The presence of leiomyoma of the skin.
The definition of the Bilateral microphthalmos is that A developmental anomaly characterized by abnormal smallness of both eyes.

The definition of the Dyschromatopsia is that A form of colorblindness in which only two of the three fundamental colors can be distinguished due to a lack of one of the retinal cone pigments. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_ncarter]
The definition of the Congenital stationary night blindness is that A nonprogressive (i.e., stationary) form of difficulties with night blindness with congenital onset.
The definition of the Peripheral traction retinal detachment is that Tractional retinal detachment at the periphery of the retina. []
The definition of the Absent lower eyelashes is that Lack of eyelashes on the lower lid.
The definition of the Congenital extraocular muscle anomaly is that Congenital abnormality of the extraocular muscles.
The definition of the Punctate cataract is that A type of cataract with punctate opacities of the lens.
The definition of the Congenital hypertrophy of retinal pigment epithelium is that Sharply demarcated, congenital hyperpigmentation of the retinal pigment epithelium. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_ncarter]
The definition of the Lacrimal gland aplasia is that A congenital defect of development characterized by absence of the lacrimal gland.
The definition of the Diffuse nuclear cataract is that Opacity of the entire lens nucleus.
The definition of the Curly eyelashes is that Abnormally curly or curved eyelashes.

The definition of the Cystic retinal degeneration is that Degenerative changes of the peripheral retina consisting of close-packed tiny cystic spaces at the outer plexiform/inner nuclear retinal level. The degeneration is very common in adult eyes and starts adjacent to the ora serrata and extends circumferentially and posteriorly.

The definition of the Abnormal vestibulo-ocular reflex is that An abnormality of the vestibulo-ocular reflex (VOR). The VOR attempts to keep the image stable on the retina. Ideally passive or active head movements in one direction are compensated for by eye movements of equal magnitude.
The definition of the Hypoplasia of the iris is that Congenital underdevelopment of the iris.

The definition of the Vitelliform maculopathy is that Vitelliform maculopathy is a sharply demarcated lesion caused by the accumulation of material, often lipofuscin in the subretinal space underlying the macula.
The definition of the Lacrimal duct stenosis is that Narrowing of a tear duct (lacrimal duct).
The definition of the Abnormal pupillary function is that A functional abnormality of the pupil.
The definition of the Unilateral ptosis is that A unilateral form of ptosis.
The definition of the Absent rod-and cone-mediated responses on ERG is that Absence of the combined rod-and-cone response on electroretinogram.

The definition of the Abnormal pupillary light reflex is that An abnormality of the reflex that controls the diameter of the pupil, in response to the intensity of light that falls on the retina of the eye.
The definition of the Hypoplasia of the lower eyelids is that Underdevelopment of the lower eyelid.

The definition of the Anterior segment dysgenesis is that Abnormal development (dysgenesis) of the anterior segment of the eye globe. These structures are mainly of mesenchymal origin. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_ncarter]
The definition of the Congenital primary aphakia is that Absence of the crystalline lens of the eye as a result of a developmental defect.

The definition of the Band-shaped corneal dystrophy is that An abnormality of the cornea characterized by the deposition of calcium in a band across the central cornea, leading to decreased vision, foreign body sensation, and ocular irritation.

The definition of the Intraocular melanoma is that A malignant melanoma originating within the eye. The tumor originates from the melanocytes in the uvea (which comprises the iris, ciliary body, and choroid).

The definition of the Chronic irritative conjunctivitis is that A chronic irritative conjunctivitis, which commonly presents with general irritation and redness of the eyes, with a burning, dry, or foreign-body sensation of the eyes.

The definition of the Flat cornea is that Cornea plana is an abnormally flat shape of the cornea such that the normal protrusion of the cornea from the sclera is missing. The reduced corneal curvature can lead to hyperopia, and a hazy corneal limbus and arcus lipoides may develop at an early age.
The definition of the Saccular conjunctival aneurysms is that Presence of multiple dilatations (sac-like outpouchings) in the blood vessels of the conjunctiva.
The definition of the Loss of retinal pigment epithelium is that Atrophy (loss or wasting) of the retinal pigment epithelium observed on fundoscopy or fundus imaging.
The definition of the Opacification of the corneal epithelium is that Lack of transparency of the corneal epithelium.
The definition of the Congenital miosis is that Abnormal (non-physiological) constriction of the pupil of congenital onset.
The definition of the Iris hypopigmentation is that An abnormal reduction in the amount of pigmentation of the iris.
The definition of the Chorioretinal dysplasia is that Abnormal development of the choroid and retina.
The definition of the Lacrimal gland hypoplasia is that Underdevelopment of the lacrimal gland.
The definition of the Enlarged lacrimal glands is that Abnormally big lacrimal glands.
The definition of the Bony spicule pigmentary retinopathy is that Pigment migration into the retina in a bone-spicule configuration (resembling the nucleated cells within the lacuna of bone).
The definition of the Hypoplasia of the fovea is that Underdevelopment of the fovea centralis.

The definition of the Macular dystrophy is that Macular dystrophy is a nonspecific term for premature retinal cell aging and cell death, generally confied to the macula in which no clear extrinsic cause is evident.
The definition of the Opacification of the corneal stroma is that Reduced transparency of the stroma of cornea.
The definition of the Pericentral scotoma is that A scotoma (area of diminished vision within the visual field) that surrounds the central fixation point.
The definition of the Retinal telangiectasia is that Dilatation of small blood vessels of the retina.
The definition of the Deep anterior chamber is that Increased depth of the anterior chamber, i.e., the anteroposterior distance between the cornea and the iris is increased.
The definition of the Optic disc hypoplasia is that Underdevelopment of the optic disc, that is of the optic nerve head, where ganglion cell axons exit the eye to form the optic nerve.
The definition of the Central retinal vessel vascular tortuosity is that The presence of an increased number of twists and turns of retinal blood vessels (arteries, arterioles, veins, venules).

The definition of the Impaired smooth pursuit is that An impairment of the ability to track objects with the ocular smooth pursuit system, a class of rather slow eye movements that minimizes retinal target motion.

The definition of the Vitreoretinal abnormalities is that Ocular abnormality characterised by premature degeneration of the vitreous and the retina that may be associated with increased risk of retinal detachment.
The definition of the Hypoplasia of the ciliary body is that Underdevelopment of the ciliary body.
The definition of the Chorioretinal scars is that Fibrous connective tissue resulting from incomplete healing of a wound (i.e., a scar) located in the choroid and retina or the eye. []
The definition of the Neovascularization of peripheral and posterior retina is that A type of retinal neovascularization that affects the posterior pole of the retina.
The definition of the Cortical pulverulent cataract is that A type of cataract characterized by punctate, dust-like opacities within the cortical region of the lens.
The definition of the Posterior subcapsular cataract is that A type of cataract affecting the posterior pole of lens immediately adjacent to ('beneath') the Lens capsule.
The definition of the Patchy atrophy of the retinal pigment epithelium is that Wasting (atrophy) of the retinal pigment epithelium present in small, isolated areas. []
The definition of the Macular retinal pigment epithelial mottling is that Mottled (spotted or blotched with different shades) pigmentary abnormality of the macula lutea.
The definition of the Anterior cortical cataract is that A cataract that affects the anterior part of the cortex of the lens.
The definition of the Conjunctival whitish salt-like deposits is that The presence of whitish deposits in the conjunctiva resembling salt. May be related to calcinosis.
The definition of the Increased axial globe length is that Abnormal largeness of the eye with an axial length > 2.5 standard deviations from population mean. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_ncarter]

The definition of the Granular corneal dystrophy is that The presence of central, fine, whitish granular lesions in the stroma of the cornea. This type of corneal dystrophy is usually asymptomatic and begins in childhood and shows a slow progression. Later in the course, the corneal epithelium and Bowman's layer may be affected. Histologically, the cornea shows a uniform deposition of hyaline material.
The definition of the Monochromacy is that Complete color blindness, a complete inability to distinguish colors. Affected persons cannot perceive colors, but only shades of gray.
The definition of the Horizontal pendular nystagmus is that Nystagmus consisting of horizontal to-and-fro eye movements of equal velocity.

The definition of the Herpetiform corneal ulceration is that The presence of one or more dendritic corneal epithelial ulcers characterized by a treelike branching linear pattern with feathery edges and terminal bulbs. Herpetiform corneal ulcers can be identified by fluorescein staining.

The definition of the Salt and pepper retinopathy is that Mottling (spots or blotches with different shades) of the retinal pigment epithelium, i.e., localized or generalized fundal pigment granularity associated with processes at the level of the retinal pigment epithelium.

The definition of the Horizontal supranuclear gaze palsy is that A supranuclear gaze palsy is an inability to look in a horizontal direction as a result of cerebral impairment. There is a loss of the voluntary aspect of eye movements, but, as the brainstem is still intact, all the reflex conjugate eye movements are normal.
The definition of the Central heterochromia is that The presence of distinct colors in the central (pupillary) zone of the iris than in the mid-peripheral (ciliary) zone.
The definition of the Presenile cataracts is that Presenile cataract is a kind of cataract that occurs in early adulthood, that is, at an age that is younger than usual.
The definition of the Atretic lacrimal punctum is that Congenital absence or closure of the opening of the lacrimal punctum.
The definition of the Total ophthalmoplegia is that Paralysis of both the extrinsic and intrinsic ocular muscles.
The definition of the Adult-onset night blindness is that Inability to see well at night or in poor light with onset in adulthood.

The definition of the Nonprogressive restrictive external ophthalmoplegia is that Nonprogressive restriction of movement of the external ocular muscles such that the eyes of affected individuals are partially or completely fixed in a strabismic position. Residual eye movements are significantly limited.
The definition of the Progressive cataract is that A kind of cataract that progresses with age.
The definition of the Progressive ptosis is that A progressive form of ptosis.
The definition of the Long upper eyelashes is that Increased length of the upper eyelashes.

The definition of the Amyloid deposition in the vitreous humor is that Deposition of hyaline extracellular material (amyloid) into the vitreous humor, which can manifest as vitreous opacities and reduced visual acuity.
The definition of the Punctate opacification of the cornea is that Punctate opacification (reduced transparency) of the corneal stroma.
The definition of the Chorioretinal lacunae is that Punched out lesions in the pigmented layer of the retina.
The definition of the Congenital horizontal nystagmus is that Horizontal nystagmus dating from or present at birth.
The definition of the Retinal calcification is that Deposition of calcium salts in the retina.

The definition of the Restrictive partial external ophthalmoplegia is that Fibrosis of only some of the external ocular muscles such that the eyes of affected individuals are partially or completely fixed in a strabismic position.

The definition of the Choroidal hemangiomata is that The presence of multiple hemangiomas in the choroid. These are generally reddish or orange or can have increased pigmentation maiking them difficult to distinguish from choroidal melanomas.

The definition of the Almond-shaped palpebral fissure is that A shape created by an acute downward arching of the upper eyelid and upward arching of the lower eyelid, toward the medial canthus, which gives the outline of the palpebral fissures the configuration of an almond. Thus, the maximum distance between the fissures is offset from, and medial to, the center point. [PMID:19125427]
The definition of the Congenital blindness is that Blindness with onset at birth.
The definition of the Allergic conjunctivitis is that Allergic Conjunctivitis is an allergic inflammation of the conjunctiva.
The definition of the Slowed horizontal saccades is that An abnormally slow velocity of horizontal saccadic eye movements.
The definition of the Absent extraocular muscles is that Congenital absence of the extraocular muscles.
The definition of the Iridescent posterior subcapsular cataract is that A type of posterior subcapsular cataract characterized by an iridescent color.
The definition of the Hypoplasia of the lacrimal puncta is that Underdevelopment of the lacrimal puncta.

The definition of the Hypopigmentation of the fundus is that Reduced pigmentation of the fundus, typically generalised. Fundoscopy may reveal a low level pigment in both RPE and choroid with clear visibility of choroidal vessels (pale/albinoid) or low pigment level in the RPE with deep pigment in choroid so that visible choroidal vessels are separated by deeply pigmented zones (tesselated/tigroid).
The definition of the Retinal nonattachment is that Failure of attachment of the retina during development.
The definition of the Vitreous hemorrhage is that Bleeding within the vitreous compartment of the eye.
The definition of the Pigmented paravenous chorioretinal atrophy is that Chorioretinal atrophy along the retinal veins.
The definition of the Increased intraocular pressure is that Intraocular pressure that is 2 standard deviations above the population mean. []
The definition of the Reticular retinal dystrophy is that A type of of patterned retinal dystrophy that shows a reticular pattern of pigmentation. []

The definition of the Polymorphous posterior corneal dystrophy is that This corneal dystrophy affects the posterior limiting membrane of the cornea and is characterized by polymorphous plaques of calcium deposits in the deep stromal layers of the cornea, and occasionally by vesicular lesions of the endothelium and edema of the deep corneal stroma.

The definition of the Tractional retinal detachment is that A type of retinal detachment arising due to a combination of contracting retinal membranes, abnormal vitreoretinal adhesions, and vitreous changes. It is usually seen in the context of diseases that induce a fibrovascular response, e.g. diabetes.
The definition of the Lacrimal duct aplasia is that A congenital defect resulting in absence of the lacrimal duct.

The definition of the Abnormal flash visual evoked potentials is that Anomaly of the visual evoked potentials elicited by a flash stimulus, generally a flash of light subtending an angle of at least 20 degrees of the visual field and presented in a dimly lit room.

The definition of the Peripheral retinal detachment is that Separation of the inner layers of the retina (neural retina) from the pigment epithelium occuring near the outer limit (periphery) of the retina. []
The definition of the Bilateral congenital mydriasis is that Congenital abnormal dilation of the pupil on both sides.
The definition of the Broad lateral eyebrow is that Regional increase in the width (height) of the lateral eyebrow.

The definition of the Restrictive external ophthalmoplegia is that Fibrosis of the external ocular muscles such that the eyes of affected individuals are partially or completely fixed in a strabismic position. Residual eye movements are significantly limited.

The definition of the Honeycomb retinal degeneration is that A type of retinal reticular pigmentation that forms a polygonal, netlike arrangement of hyperpigmented lines forming geometric patterns in the fundus. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:fprobst, PMID:28114409]
The definition of the Blue cone monochromacy is that A form of monochromacy in which vision is derived from the remaining preserved blue (S) cones and rod photoreceptors.
The definition of the Limited extraocular movements is that Limited mobility of the eye within its socket. []
The definition of the Internal ophthalmoplegia is that Paralysis of the iris and ciliary apparatus.
The definition of the Congenital stapes ankylosis is that A form of stapes ankylosis with congenital onset.
The definition of the Unilateral narrow palpebral fissure is that A fixed reduction in the vertical distance between the upper and lower eyelids with short palpebral fissures on one side only.

The definition of the Pericentral retinitis pigmentosa is that A subtype of retinitis pigmentosa in which, instead of the pathology starting in the mid-periphery like typical retinitis pigmentosa, the disease starts in the near periphery closer to the vascular arcades and tends to spare the far periphery.
The definition of the Dense posterior cortical cataract is that A type of posterior cortical cataract characterized by dense lenticular opacities.
The definition of the Peripapillary chorioretinal atrophy is that Chorioretinal atrophy concentrated around the optic papilla (i.e., the optic nerve head).
The definition of the Corneal opacity is that A reduction of corneal clarity.

The definition of the Macroreticular retinal dystrophy is that A spectrum of fundoscopic appearances characterized by the development of a variety of patterns of deposits predominantly in the macular area. The deposits are typically bilateral, relatively symmetrical, yellow/white and associated with changes at the level of the retinal pigment epithelium. With time, retinal atrophy may occur. A number of pattern dystrophy subtypes have been described including butterfly-shaped dystrophy, reticular dystrophy (net-like pattern) and fundus pulverulentus (granular, mottled pigmentation).

The definition of the Persistent hyperplastic primary vitreous is that Persistence of the hyaloid artery, which is the embryonic artery that runs from the optic disk to the posterior lens capsule may persist; the site of attachment may form an opacity. The hyaloid artery is a branch of the ophthalmic artery, and usually regresses completely before birth. This features results from a failure of regression of the hyaloid vessel, which supplies the primary vitreous during embryogenesis and normally regresses in the third trimester of pregnancy, leading to a particular form of posterior cataract.

The definition of the Lamellar cataract is that A congenital cataract in which opacity is limited to layers of the lens external to the nucleus (i.e., the perinuclear region), i.e., between the nuclear and cortical layers of the lens.
The definition of the Retinal dysplasia is that The presence of developmental dysplasia of the retina.

The definition of the Hypometric horizontal saccades is that Saccadic undershoot of horizontal saccadic eye movements, i.e., a horizontal saccadic eye movement that has less than the magnitude that would be required to gain fixation of the object.

The definition of the Cerulean cataract is that Cerulean cataracts are a kind of congenital cataract having peripheral bluish and white opacifications in concentric layers with occasional central lesions arranged radially. Although the opacities may be observed during fetal development and childhood, usually visual acuity is only mildly reduced until adulthood, when lens extraction is generally necessary.
The definition of the Gaze-evoked horizontal nystagmus is that Horizontal nystagmus made apparent by looking to the right or to the left.

The definition of the Reduced amplitude of b-wave (ERG) is that A dark-adapted bright flash electroretinogram in which the b-wave that is of markedly lower amplitude than the associated a-wave (source: Holder GE., Inherited Chorioretinal Dystrophies: A Textbook and Atlas; 2014; p.17; ISBN 978-3-540-69466-3).
The definition of the Retinal arteriolar occlusion is that Blockage of retinal arteriole, generally associated with interruption of blood flow and oxygen delivery to affected regions of the retina.
The definition of the Macular hypopigmentation is that Decreased amount of pigmentation in the macula lutea. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_ncarter]
The definition of the Intraretinal exudate is that Retinal exudate within the retinal tissue itself.
The definition of the Hypoplastic iris stroma is that Underdevelopment of the stroma of iris.
The definition of the Malformed lacrimal ducts is that Congenital malformation of the lacrimal duct associated with incomplete development of the bony nasolacrimal canal or craniofacial anomalies.
The definition of the Peripheral visual field loss is that Loss of peripheral vision with retention of central vision, resulting in a constricted circular tunnel-like field of vision.

The definition of the Decreased corneal reflex is that An abnormally reduced response to stimulation of the cornea (by touch, foreign body, blowing air). The corneal reflex (also known as the blink reflex, normally results in an involuntary blinking of the eyelids.
The definition of the Foveal hyperpigmentation is that Increased amount of pigmentation in the fovea centralis.
The definition of the Peripheral opacification of the cornea is that Reduced transparency of the peripheral region of the cornea.

The definition of the Central fundal arteriolar microaneurysms is that Microscopic aneurysms of the retinal arterioles near the central part of the fundus, visible as small round dark red dots on the retinal surface (not arising from visible vessels) that are by definition less than the diameter of the major optic veins as they cross the optic disc.
The definition of the Superior lens subluxation is that Partial dislocation of the lens in a superior direction.
The definition of the Progressive cone degeneration is that Inherited progressive cone degeneration. []
The definition of the Cystoid macular degeneration is that A form of macular degeneration characterized by the presence of multiple cysts in the macula.
The definition of the Abnormal iris pigmentation is that Abnormal pigmentation of the iris.

The definition of the Retinitis pigmentosa inversa is that Retinitis pigmentosa inversa is form of retinal degeneration characterized by areas of retinal/chorioretinal degeneration with pigment migration in the macular area (in contrast to retinitis pigmentosa which, at early disease stages, predominantly affects the retinal periphery).
The definition of the Absent anterior eye chamber is that Absence of the anterior chamber of the eye owing to a developmental defect. []
The definition of the aplastic/hypoplastic lacrimal glands is that Absence or underdevelopment of the lacrimal gland.
The definition of the Retinal arteriolar constriction is that Decreased retinal arteriolar diameters, which may decrease blood flow and slow oxygen delivery to regions of the retina.
The definition of the Abnormality of the retinal vasculature is that A structural abnormality of retinal vasculature.
The definition of the Abnormality of the line of Schwalbe is that An abnormality of the line of Schwalbe.
The definition of the Abnormality of the extraocular muscles is that An abnormality of an extraocular muscle.
The definition of the aplasia/Hypoplasia of the iris is that Absence or underdevelopment of the iris.
The definition of the Abnormality of the vasculature of the conjunctiva is that Any abnormality of the blood vessels of the conjunctiva.

The definition of the aplasia/Hypoplasia affecting the uvea is that Absence or underdevelopment of the uvea, the pigmented middle layer of the eye consisting of the iris and ciliary body together with the choroid.
The definition of the aplasia/Hypoplasia of the fovea is that Congenital absence or underdevelopment of the fovea centralis.
The definition of the aplasia/Hypoplasia affecting the anterior segment of the eye is that Absence or underdevelopment of the anterior segment of the eye.
The definition of the aplasia/Hypoplasia of the lens is that Absence or underdevelopment of the lens.
The definition of the Ichthyosis is that An abnormality of the skin characterized the presence of excessive amounts of dry surface scales on the skin resulting from an abnormality of keratinization.
The definition of the Abnormal blistering of the skin is that The presence of one or more bullae on the skin, defined as fluid-filled blisters more than 5 mm in diameter with thin walls.
The definition of the Neoplasm of the skin is that A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the skin.
The definition of the Sparse hair is that Reduced density of hairs.
The definition of the Maternal hypertension is that Increased blood pressure during a pregnancy.

The definition of the Maternal virilization in pregnancy is that Virilization (deepening of voice, facial hirsutism and scalp hair loss) with onset during pregnancy (usually towards the end of the first trimester) and regression several months post-partum.
The definition of the Low maternal serum estriol is that An abnormally low concentration of serum conjugated estriol as compared to normal values for gestational-age. [PMID:19038077]

The definition of the Osteoporotic tarsals is that Reduction in bone mineral density affecting any or all of the tarsal bones, seven bones of the foot comprising the calcaneus, talus, cuboid, navicular, and the cuneiform bones.
The definition of the Absent fifth metatarsal is that A developmental abnormality characterized by the absence of the fifth metatarsal bone.
The definition of the Hallux varus is that Medial deviation of the great toe owing to a deformity of the great toe joint causing the hallux to deviate medially.
The definition of the Nonossified fifth metatarsal is that The presence of a fifth metatarsal bone that has not undergone ossification at an age when ossification is usually visible.
The definition of the Abnormality of the fifth metatarsal bone is that An anomaly of the fifth metatarsal bone.
The definition of the Short 4th toe is that Underdevelopment (hypoplasia) of the fourth toe.
The definition of the Widely spaced toes is that An overall widening of the spaces between the digits.
The definition of the Osteolysis of talus is that Osteolysis affecting the talus.
The definition of the Medially deviated second toe is that Medial deviation of the second toe.

The definition of the Delayed tarsal ossification is that Delayed maturation and calcification of any of the tarsal bones, seven bones of the foot comprising the calcaneus, talus, cuboid, navicular, and the cuneiform bones.

The definition of the Plantar crease between first and second toes is that The presence of unusually deep creases (ridges/wrinkles) on the skin of sole of foot located between the first and second toe.

The definition of the Advanced tarsal ossification is that Precocious (accelerated) maturation and calcification of any of the tarsal bones, seven bones of the foot comprising the calcaneus, talus, cuboid, navicular, and the cuneiform bones.
The definition of the Metatarsal diaphyseal endosteal sclerosis is that Osteosclerosis of the endosteal surface of the diaphyses (shafts) of the metatarsal bones.
The definition of the Third toe clinodactyly is that Bending or curvature of a third toe in the tibial direction (i.e., towards the big toe).
The definition of the Flexion limitation of toes is that Limitation of the ability to bend the toes.
The definition of the Calcaneonavicular fusion is that Synostosis of the calcaneus with the navicular bone.
The definition of the Talipes calcaneovarus is that A congenital deformity characterized by a dorsiflexed, inverted, and adducted foot, i.e., a combination of talipes calcaneus and talipes varus.
The definition of the Bipartite calcaneus is that A two-part calcaneus, a finding that probably results from delayed coalescence of two primary calcaneal centers of ossification.
The definition of the Tarsal stippling is that The presence of abnormal punctate (speckled, dot-like) calcifications in one or more tarsal bones.

The definition of the Irregular tarsal ossification is that Defective ossification in an irregular pattern of the seven bones of the foot comprising the calcaneus, talus, cuboid, navicular, and the cuneiform bones.

The definition of the Equinus calcaneus is that Abnormal plantar flexion of the calcaneus relative to the longitudinal axis of the tibia. This results in the angle between the long axis of the tibia and the long axis of the heel bone (calcaneus) being greater than 90 degrees.
The definition of the Delayed calcaneal ossification is that Delayed maturation and calcification of the calcaneus.

The definition of the Impaired epinephrine-induced platelet aggregation is that Abnormal response to epinephrine as manifested by reduced or lacking aggregation of platelets upon addition of epinephrine.

The definition of the Elevated serum transaminases during infections is that Elevations of the levels of SGOT (serum glutamic oxaloacetic transaminase) and SGPT (serum glutamic pyruvic transaminase) that occur during infections.

The definition of the Prolonged prothrombin time is that Increased time to coagulation in the prothrombin time test, which is a measure of the extrinsic pathway of coagulation. The results of the prothrombin time test are often expressed in terms of the International normalized ratio (INR), which is calculated as a ratio of the patient's prothrombin time (PT) to a control PT standardized for the potency of the thromboplastin reagent developed by the World Health Organization (WHO) using the formula: INR is equal to Patient PT divided by Control PT.
The definition of the Periodic hypokalemic paresis is that Episodes of muscle weakness associated with reduced levels of potassium in the blood.
The definition of the Mucopolysacchariduria is that Excessive amounts of mucopolysaccharide in the urine.

The definition of the Hyperapobetalipoproteinemia is that Hyperapobetalipoproteinemia is defined as the combination of a normal low density lipoprotein (LDL) cholesterol in the face of an increased LDL apolipoprotein B (apoB) protein.
The definition of the Absent leukocyte alkaline phosphatase is that Alkaline phosphatase levels measured within leukocytes is below detectable levels.
The definition of the Asymptomatic hyperammonemia is that An increased concentration of ammonia in the blood not associated with symptoms such as encephalopathy.
The definition of the Decreased circulating cortisol level is that Abnormally reduced concentration of cortisol in the blood.
The definition of the Reduced circulating T-helper cells is that Reduced proportion of helper T cells relative to the total number of T cells.

The definition of the Decreased beta-galactosidase activity is that Abnormally decreased rate of beta-galactosidase activity. Beta-galactosidase activity can be measured in leukocyte, fibroblast, or plasma. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:gcarletti]

The definition of the Decreased electrooculogram (EOG) is that An abnormal reduction in the Arden ratio, which is the ratio between the light peak and the dark trough of the smoothed (physiologic) EOG record.
The definition of the Abetalipoproteinemia is that An absence of low-density lipoprotein cholesterol in the blood.
The definition of the Precocious puberty in males is that The onset of puberty before the age of 9 years in boys.
The definition of the Adrenocortical cytomegaly is that The presence of large polyhedral cells with eosinophilic granular cytoplasm and enlarged nuclei in the adrenal cortex.
The definition of the Absence of secondary sex characteristics is that No secondary sexual characteristics are present at puberty.
The definition of the Insulin insensitivity is that Decreased sensitivity toward insulin.
The definition of the Thyroid agenesis is that The congenital absence of the thyroid gland.
The definition of the Multiple pancreatic beta-cell adenomas is that The presence of multiple pancreatic islet cell adenomas.
The definition of the Congenital hypoparathyroidism is that Deficiency of parathyroid hormone with congenital onset.

The definition of the Primary hyperparathyroidism is that A type of hyperparathyroidism caused by a primary abnormality of the parathyroid glands (e.g., adenoma, carcinoma, hyperplasia). Primary hyperparathyroidism is associated with hyercalcemia.

The definition of the Prolactin deficiency is that A reduced level of prolactin in the blood circulation. Prolactin is a protein hormone that is secreted by lactotrophs in the anterior pituitary and that stimulates mammary gland development and milk production.

The definition of the Insulin-dependent but ketosis-resistant diabetes is that Ketosis-resistant diabetes is a synonym for type II diabetes. This term thus refers to a form of type II diabetes in which patients are dependent on insulin.

The definition of the Primary adrenal insufficiency is that Insufficient production of steroid hormones (primarily cortisol) by the adrenal glands as a result of a primary defect in the glands themselves.
The definition of the Parathyroid hyperplasia is that Hyperplasia of the parathyroid gland.

The definition of the Premature ovarian failure is that Amenorrhea due to loss of ovarian function before the age of 40. Primary ovarian inssuficiency (POI) is a state of female hypergonadotropic hypogonadism. It can manifest as primary amenorrhea with onset before menarche or secondary amenorrhea.
The definition of the Parathyroid agenesis is that Aplasia of the parathyroid gland.

The definition of the Gonadotropin deficiency is that A reduced ability to secrete gonadotropins, which are protein hormones secreted by gonadotrope cells of the anterior pituitary gland, including the hormones follitropin (FSH) and luteinizing hormone (LH).
The definition of the Adrenal gland dysgenesis is that Abnormal development of the adrenal gland.
The definition of the Adrenal hyperplasia is that Enlargement of the adrenal gland.
The definition of the Androgen insufficiency is that Insufficient amount of androgenic activity.

The definition of the Pituitary resistance to thyroid hormone is that A condition in which the pituitary gland is partially resistant to thyroid hormone, so that it continues to secrete thyroid-stimulating hormone (TSH) until the blood level of thyroid hormone rises higher than normal.
The definition of the Thyroid lymphangiectasia is that The presence of lymphangiectasis of the thyroid gland.
The definition of the Elevated follicle stimulating hormone is that An elevated concentration of follicle-stimulating hormone in the blood.
The definition of the Hypothalamic hypothyroidism is that A type of hypothyroidism that results from a defect in thyrotropin-releasing hormone activity.
The definition of the Adrenal medullary hypoplasia is that Developmental hypoplasia of the adrenal medulla.
The definition of the Pseudohypoaldosteronism is that A state of renal tubular unresponsiveness or resistance to the action of aldosterone.
The definition of the Congenital adrenal hypoplasia is that A type of adrenal hypoplasia with congenital onset.
The definition of the Pituitary hypothyroidism is that A type of hypothyroidism that results from a defect in thyroid-stimulating hormone secretion.
The definition of the Euthyroid hyperthyroxinemia is that Increased levels of thyroxine without evidence of clinical thyroid disease. [eMedicine:118562, https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199]
The definition of the Thyroid hyperplasia is that Hyperplasia of the thyroid gland.
The definition of the Congenital goiter is that An enlargement of the thyroid gland with congenital onset.
The definition of the Adrenocortical adenoma is that Adrenocortical adenomas are benign tumors of the adrenal cortex.
The definition of the Congenital adrenal hyperplasia is that A type of adrenal hyperplasia with congenital onset.
The definition of the Adrenocorticotropin (ACTH) receptor (ACTHR) defect is that Adrenal insufficiency secondary to a defect in the ACTH receptor.
The definition of the Pancreatic islet cell adenoma is that The presence of an adenoma of the pancreas with origin in a pancreatic B cell.

The definition of the Neutrophil inclusion bodies is that The presence of intracellular inclusion bodies (aggregates of stainable substances, usually proteins) in neutrophils. Cytoplasmic neutrophil inclusions (oval, basophilic) are also known as Doehle bodies.

The definition of the Abnormal cartilage collagen is that Abnormal morphology of collagen fibers in cartilage. In cartilage, collagen II, actually a collagen II:IX:XI heterofibril, is by far the most important type of collagen. A number of abnormalities may be appreciated by electron micrography or biochemical investigations, including sparse collagen fibers in the cartilage matrix.
The definition of the Abnormality of zinc homeostasis is that An abnormality of zinc ion homeostasis.
The definition of the Cerebellar cortical atrophy is that Atrophy (wasting) of the cerebellar cortex.
The definition of the Acute hyperammonemia is that An increased concentration of ammonia in the blood with sudden onset.
The definition of the Unconjugated hyperbilirubinemia is that An increased amount of unconjugated (indirect) bilurubin in the blood.
The definition of the Fasting hyperinsulinemia is that An increased concentration of insulin in the blood in the fasting state, i.e., not as the response to food intake.
The definition of the Pituitary corticotropic cell adenoma is that A type of pituitary adenoma that produces adrenocorticotropic hormone (ACTH).

The definition of the Transient hyperphenylalaninemia is that A condition of not having consistently high levels of phenylalanine in the blood but of experiencing temporary hyperphenylalaninemia following ingestion of large quantities of phenylalanine (for instance, following an oral loading test with phenylalanine).
The definition of the Dermatan sulfate excretion in urine is that An increased concentration of dermatan sulfate in the urine. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:gcarletti]
The definition of the Olivary degeneration is that Degeneration of the olivary bodies, prominent oval structures in the medulla oblongata.
The definition of the Exercise-induced myoglobinuria is that Presence of myoglobin in the urine following exercise.

The definition of the Decreased activity of mitochondrial complex II is that A reduction in the activity of the mitochondrial respiratory chain complex II, which is part of the electron transport chain in mitochondria.
The definition of the Decreased plasma free carnitine is that A decreased concentration of free (unbound) carnitine in the blood.
The definition of the Abnormal mitochondria in muscle tissue is that An abnormality of the mitochondria in muscle tissue.
The definition of the Elevated leukocyte alkaline phosphatase is that Increased alkaline phosphatase measured within leukocytes.

The definition of the Impaired collagen-induced platelet aggregation is that Abnormal response to collagen or collagen-mimetics as manifested by reduced or lacking aggregation of platelets upon addition collagen or collagen-mimetics.
The definition of the Abnormal mitochondrial morphology is that Any structural anomaly of the mitochondria.
The definition of the Abnormal rod and cone electroretinograms is that An abnormality of the combined rod-and-cone response on electroretinogram.
The definition of the Microscopic nephrocalcinosis is that The presence of microscopic crystalline calcium precipitates in the form of oxalate and/or phosphate in the renal parenchyma.

The definition of the Reduced von Willebrand factor activity is that Decreased activity of von Willebrand factor. Von Willebrand factor mediates the adhesion of platelets to the collagen exposed on endothelial cell surfaces.

The definition of the Distal renal tubular acidosis is that A type of renal tubular acidosis characterized by a failure of acid secretion by the alpha intercalated cells of the cortical collecting duct of the distal nephron. The urine cannot be acidified below a pH of 5.3, associated with acidemia and hypokalemia.
The definition of the Elevated plasma branched chain amino acids is that Concentration of a branched chain amino acid in the blood above the upper limit of normal. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:gcarletti]
The definition of the Hypoplasia of the iris dilator muscle is that Underdevelopment of the dilatator pupillae.

The definition of the Decreased activity of mitochondrial complex IV is that A reduction in the activity of the mitochondrial respiratory chain complex IV, which is part of the electron transport chain in mitochondria.
The definition of the Immunoglobulin IgG2 deficiency is that A reduction in immunoglobulin levels of the IgG2 subclass in the blood circulation.

The definition of the Impaired platelet adhesion is that An abnormality of adhesion of thrombocytes. Normally, platelets adhere to collagen in the vascular subendothelium within seconds of injury via a receptor made up of glycoprotein Ia and IIa and GPVI and to vWF via receptor GPIb/IX/V. The adherent platelets then release granules that lead to platelet activation and aggregation.
The definition of the Factor X activation deficiency is that Reduced ability to transform factor X into its activated form factor Xa.
The definition of the Hyperprolinemia is that An increased concentration of proline in the blood. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:gcarletti]
The definition of the Neonatal hypoproteinemia is that A neonatal decreased concentration of proteins in the blood. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:gcarletti]
The definition of the aplasia/Hypoplasia of the hallux is that Absence or underdevelopment of the big toe.
The definition of the aplasia/Hypoplasia of the tarsal bones is that Absence or underdevelopment of the tarsal bones.

The definition of the Abnormality of the calcaneus is that An abnormality of the calcaneus, also known as the heel bone, one of the or heel bone, one of the components of the tarsus of the foot which make up the heel.
The definition of the Abnormality of the talus is that An abnormality of the talus.
The definition of the Tarsal synostosis is that Synostosis (bony fusion) involving one or more bones of the tarsus (calcaneus, talus, cuboid, navicular, cuneiiform bones).

The definition of the Abnormal tarsal ossification is that An abnormality of the formation and mineralization of any of the tarsal bones, seven bones of the foot comprising the calcaneus, talus, cuboid, navicular, and the cuneiform bones.

The definition of the Abnormal metatarsal ossification is that Any abnormal process of ossification of the metatarsal bones, which normally are each ossified from two centers: one for the body, and one for the head (metatarsal II,III,IV, and V) and one for the body and one for the base (metatarsal I). The ossification process begins in the center of the body about the ninth week, and extends toward either extremity. The center for the base of the first metatarsal appears about the third year, and the centers for the heads of the other bones between the fifth and eighth years. They join the bodies between the eighteenth and twentieth years.
The definition of the Slow-growing nails is that Nails whose growth is slower than normal.
The definition of the aplasia/Hypoplasia of the nails is that Aplasia or developmental hypoplasia of the nail.
The definition of the Abnormality of the toenail is that An anomaly of the toenail.
The definition of the Recurrent loss of toenails and fingernails is that Repeated loss, or shedding, of the nails of the fingers and toes.

The definition of the Dystrophic fingernails is that The presence of misshapen or partially destroyed nail plates, often with accumulation of soft, yellow keratin between the dystrophic nail plate and nail bed, resulting in elevation of the nail plate.
The definition of the Subungual hyperkeratosis is that A thickening of the stratum corneum in the region beneath the nails.
The definition of the Chronic monilial nail infection is that Chronic infection of the nails by Candida species.
The definition of the Hypoplastic fifth fingernail is that A nail of the fifth finger that is diminished in length and width, i.e., underdeveloped nail of little finger.
The definition of the Circumungual hyperkeratosis is that A thickening of the stratum corneum, the outer layer of the skin, in the region surrounding the nails.
The definition of the Onycholysis of distal fingernails is that Detachment of the distal fingernails from the nail bed.
The definition of the Onychogryposis of toenails is that Thickened toenails.
The definition of the Ridged fingernail is that Longitudinal, linear prominences in the fingernail plate.

The definition of the Nail dystrophy is that Onychodystrophy (nail dystrophy) refers to nail changes apart from changes of the color (nail dyschromia) and involves partial or complete disruption of the various keratinous layers of the nail plate. [PMID:19675700]
The definition of the Vertebral hypoplasia is that Small, underdeveloped vertebral bodies.
The definition of the Intervertebral disc degeneration is that The presence of degenerative changes of intervertebral disk.
The definition of the Punctate vertebral calcifications is that The presence of punctiform calcification of the bone of the vertebral bodies.
The definition of the Vertebral wedging is that An abnormal shape of the vertebral bodies whereby the vertebral bodies are thick on one side and taper to a thin edge at the other.
The definition of the Spinal dysplasia is that The presence of developmental dysplasia of the vertebral column.
The definition of the Vertebral clefting is that Schisis (cleft or cleavage) of vertebral bodies.
The definition of the Anterior beaking of lumbar vertebrae is that Anterior tongue-like protrusions of the vertebral bodies of the lumbar spine.
The definition of the Anterior wedging of L1 is that An abnormality of the shape of the lumbar vertebra L1 such that it is wedge-shaped (narrow towards the front).
The definition of the Vertebral arch anomaly is that A morphological abnormality of the vertebral arch, i.e., of the posterior part of a vertebra.
The definition of the Lumbar hemivertebrae is that Absence of one half of the vertebral body in the lumbar spine.
The definition of the C1-C2 vertebral abnormality is that Any abnormality of the atlas and the axis.
The definition of the Herniation of intervertebral nuclei is that The presence of one or more herniated nucleus pulposus of intervertebral disk.
The definition of the Vertebral hyperostosis is that Excessive growth of the bones of the vertebral bodies.
The definition of the Posterior wedging of vertebral bodies is that An abnormality of the shape of vertebrae, such that they are wedge-shaped (narrow towards the back).
The definition of the Cervical spinal canal stenosis is that An abnormal narrowing of the cervical spinal canal.

The definition of the Narrow vertebral interpedicular distance is that A reduction of the distance between vertebral pedicles, which are the two short, thick processes, which project backward, one on either side, from the upper part of the vertebral body, at the junction of its posterior and lateral surfaces.
The definition of the Lumbar kyphosis is that Over curvature of the lumbar region.
The definition of the C2-C3 subluxation is that A partial dislocation of the intervertebral joint between the second and third cervical vertebrae.

The definition of the Caudal interpedicular narrowing is that Narrowing (becoming gradually narrower) of the distance between vertebral pedicles that gets progressively more severe towards to caudal (lower) end of the vertebral column. Note that normally, the interpedicular distances get progressively wider as one proceeds down the spine.
The definition of the Cervical vertebral agenesis is that Agenesis of one or more vertebrae of the cervical vertebral column.
The definition of the Thoracic hemivertebrae is that Absence of one half of the vertebral body in the thoracic spine.
The definition of the Abnormal sacral segmentation is that An abnormality related to a defect of vertebral separation of sacral vertebrae during development. []
The definition of the Cervical vertebral dysplasia is that Dysplasia of the cervical vertebral column.
The definition of the Lower thoracic interpediculate narrowness is that A reduction of the distance between the lower thoracic vertebral pedicles.
The definition of the Narrow anterio-posterior vertebral body diameter is that An abnormal reduction of the anterioposterior diameter of the vertebral body.
The definition of the Cervical spondylosis is that Arthrosis, i.e., of degenerative joint disease, affecting the cervical vertebral column.
The definition of the Thoracolumbar interpediculate narrowness is that A reduction of the distance between thoracolumbar vertebral pedicles.

The definition of the Lumbar interpedicular narrowing is that Narrowing (becoming gradually narrower) of the distance between lumbar vertebral pedicles that gets progressively more severe towards to caudal (lower) end of the vertebral column.

The definition of the Spondylolisthesis at L5-S1 is that Complete bilateral fractures of the pars interarticularis resulting in the anterior slippage of the fifth lumbar vertebral body (L5) onto the sacrum (level S1).
The definition of the Premature anterior fontanel closure is that Early closure (ossification) of the anterior fontanelle, which generally undergoes closure around the 18th month of life.
The definition of the Inferior lens subluxation is that Partial displacement of the lens in the inferior direction.
The definition of the High-grade hypermetropia is that A severe form of hypermetropia with over +5.00 diopters. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_ncarter, https://orcid.org/0000-0003-0986-4123]
The definition of the Median cleft lip and palate is that Cleft lip or palate affecting the midline region of the palate.
The definition of the Central posterior corneal opacity is that Reduced transparency of the central posterior portion of the corneal stroma.
The definition of the Bilateral conductive hearing impairment is that A bilateral type of conductive hearing impairment.
The definition of the aplasia/Hypoplasia of the sacrum is that Aplasia or developmental hypoplasia of the sacral bone.
The definition of the Abnormality of the coccyx is that Any structural abnormality of the coccyx.
The definition of the Posterior helix pit is that Permanent indentation on the posteromedial aspect of the helix that may be sharply or indistinctly delineated. [PMID:19152421]
The definition of the Congenital sensorineural hearing impairment is that A type of hearing impairment caused by an abnormal functionality of the cochlear nerve with congenital onset.
The definition of the Absence of acoustic reflex is that Absence of the acoustic reflex, an involuntary contraction of the stapedius muscle that occurs in response to high-intensity sound stimuli.
The definition of the Microtia is that Underdevelopment of the external ear.
The definition of the Cochlear malformation is that The presence of a malformed cochlea.
The definition of the Absent vestibular function is that Complete lack of functioning of the vestibular apparatus.
The definition of the Vestibular areflexia is that Vestibular areflexia can be measured as the absence of the caloric nystagmus response in electronystagmography.

The definition of the Microtia, second degree is that Median longitudinal length of the ear more than two standard deviations below the mean in the presence of some, but not all, parts of the normal ear. [eom:ae27d9699faef13a, PMID:19152421]
The definition of the External ear malformation is that A malformation of the auricle of the ear.
The definition of the Low-frequency sensorineural hearing impairment is that A form of sensorineural hearing impairment that affects primarily the lower frequencies.
The definition of the Underfolded helix is that Underdevelopment of the helix that either affects the entire helix, or is localized. [PMID:19152421]
The definition of the Underfolded superior helices is that A condition in which the superior portion of the helix is folded over to a lesser degree than normal.
The definition of the Hypoplasia of the cochlea is that Developmental hypoplasia of the cochlea.
The definition of the Mild neurosensory hearing impairment is that The presence of a mild form of sensorineural hearing impairment.

The definition of the Slit-like opening of the exterior auditory meatus is that A type of stenosis of the external auditory meatus in which the opening of the external auditory meatus appears as a vertical slit. [PMID:12843316]
The definition of the Hypoplastic helices is that Underdevelopment of the helix, i.e., of the outer rim of the pinna.
The definition of the Congenital conductive hearing impairment is that A type of conductive deafness with congenital onset.
The definition of the Prominent antitragus is that Increased anterosuperior prominence of the area between the bottom of the incisura and the inner margin of the antihelix.
The definition of the Postlingual sensorineural hearing impairment is that A form of sensorineural hearing impairment with onset after the acquisition of speech.
The definition of the Supraauricular pit is that Benign congenital lesion of the supraauricular soft tissue consisting of a blind-ending narrow tube or pit.
The definition of the Progressive conductive hearing impairment is that A progressive type of conductive deafness.
The definition of the Morphological abnormality of the middle ear is that An abnormality of the morphology or structure of the middle ear. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_mbitner-glidicz]
The definition of the Infantile sensorineural hearing impairment is that A form of sensorineural hearing impairment with infantile onset.
The definition of the Adult onset sensorineural hearing impairment is that The presence of sensorineural deafness with late onset.
The definition of the Bilateral sensorineural hearing impairment is that A bilateral form of sensorineural hearing impairment.
The definition of the Severe sensorineural hearing impairment is that A severe form of sensorineural hearing impairment.
The definition of the Abnormality of the stapes is that An abnormality of the stapes, a stirrup-shaped ossicle in the middle ear.

The definition of the Pulsatile tinnitus is that Pulsatile tinnitus is generally classified a kind of objective tinnitus, meaning that it is not only audible to the patient but also to the examiner on auscultation of the auditory canal and/or of surrounding structures with use of an auscultation tube or stethoscope. Usually, pulsatile tinnitus is heard as a lower pitched thumping or booming, a rougher blowing sound which is coincidental with respiration, or as a clicking, higher pitched rhythmic sensation. [PMID:23885280]
The definition of the Ureteral dysgenesis is that A developmental anomaly of the ureter.
The definition of the Hypertrophy of the urinary bladder is that Abnormal enlargement of the urinary bladder.

The definition of the Nephroblastomatosis is that Presence of persistent islands of renal blastema in the postnatal kidney. Nephroblastomatosis represents a complex abnormality of nephrogenesis and has been defined as the persistence of metanephricblastema into infancy and childhood.
The definition of the Autonomic erectile dysfunction is that Impotence (inability to develop or maintain an erection) resulting from abnormal functioning of the autonomic nervous system.

The definition of the Crescentic glomerulonephritis is that A type of extracapillary glomerulonephritis characterized by the formation of crescent-like cellular proliferation. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:Eurenomics_ewuehl]
The definition of the aplasia/Hypoplasia of the fallopian tube is that Aplasia or developmental hypoplasia of the fallopian tube.
The definition of the Multiple small medullary renal cysts is that The presence of many cysts in the medulla of the kidney. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:Eurenomics_ewuehl]
The definition of the Renotubular dysgenesis is that A developmental defect characterized by absence or poor development of proximal renal tubules.
The definition of the Urethral stenosis is that Abnormal narrowing of the urethra.
The definition of the Renal sarcoma is that A sarcoma of the kidney.
The definition of the Clitoral hypertrophy is that Hypertrophy of the clitoris.
The definition of the Gonadal dysgenesis, male is that Unusual gonadal development in a person with a 46,XY male karyotype, leading to an unassigned sex differentiation.
The definition of the Abnormal spermatogenesis is that Incomplete maturation or aberrant formation of the male gametes.
The definition of the Calcium oxalate nephrolithiasis is that The presence of calcium- and oxalate-containing calculi (stones) in the kidneys.
The definition of the Congenital megaureter is that A developmental disturbance with extreme ureteral dilatation.
The definition of the Congenital nephrotic syndrome is that Nephrotic syndrome with onset within the first three months of life. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:Eurenomics_fschaefer]
The definition of the Renal hypoplasia/aplasia is that Absence or underdevelopment of the kidney.

The definition of the Acute tubular necrosis is that Coagulative necrosis of tubular epithelial cells, defined as cells with increased cytoplasmic eosinophilia and nucleus that has a condensed chromatin pattern with fuzzy nuclear contour or has barely visible nuclear basophilic staining. The extent of cortical tubular necrosis is scoredsemiquantitatively as none, mild (less than 25% tubules with necrosis), moderate (25-50 percent), and severe (over 50%).
The definition of the Enlarged labia minora is that Increase in size of the folds of skin between the outer labia.
The definition of the aplasia/hypoplasia of the uterus is that Absence or developmental hypoplasia of the uterus.
The definition of the Bilateral cryptorchidism is that Absence of both testes from the scrotum owing to failure of the testis or testes to descend through the inguinal canal to the scrotum.
The definition of the Solitary bladder diverticulum is that Presence of a single diverticulum (sac or pouch) in the wall of the urinary bladder. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:Eurenomics_fschaefer]
The definition of the Renal hamartoma is that A disordered proliferation of mature tissues that are native to the kidneys.
The definition of the Hypoplasia of the fallopian tube is that Developmental hypoplasia of the fallopian tube.
The definition of the Gonadal calcification is that Deposition of calcium salts in gonadal tissue.
The definition of the Absent scrotum is that Congenital absence of the scrotum.
The definition of the Benign prostatic hyperplasia is that The presence of non-malignant hyperplasia of the prostate.
The definition of the Urethrovaginal fistula is that The presence of a fistula between the vagina and the urethra.
The definition of the Unilateral renal atrophy is that A unilateral form of atrophy of the kidney.
The definition of the Unilateral renal dysplasia is that A unilateral form of developmental dysplasia of the kidney.
The definition of the Urethral diverticulum is that The presence of a diverticulum (sac or pouch) in the wall of the urethra.
The definition of the Gonadal dysgenesis with female appearance, male is that Unusual gonadal development in a person with a 46,XY male karyotype, leading to a more female sex differentiation.
The definition of the Hypoplasia of the ovary is that Developmental hypoplasia of the ovary.
The definition of the Hypoplasia of the vagina is that Developmental hypoplasia of the vagina.
The definition of the Female external genitalia in individual with 46,XY karyotype is that The presence of female external genitalia in a person with a male karyotype.
The definition of the Decreased testicular size is that Reduced volume of the testicle (the male gonad).
The definition of the Partially duplicated kidney is that The presence of a partially duplicated kidney.
The definition of the Longitudinal vaginal septum is that The presence of a longitudinal vaginal septum, thereby creating a vaginal duplication.
The definition of the Coronal hypospadias is that A mild form of hypospadias in which the urethra opens just under the corona glandis.
The definition of the Abnormality of the aryepiglottic fold is that An abnormality of the aryepiglottic fold.
The definition of the Laryngeal hypoplasia is that Underdevelopment of the larynx.

The definition of the Laryngeal atresia is that Congenital absence of the lumen of the larynx. Laryngeal atresia is a rare condition. If the laryngeal opening fails to develop, fluid secreted by the lungs cannot be expelled. In a fetus with laryngeal atresia, the lungs are either normal or hyperplastic, not hypoplastic. Mortality is reported as 100%. At obstetric US examination, views of the fetal neck demonstrate a dilated trachea filled with trapped fluid. Views of the fetal chest show enlarged, hyperechoic lungs, with dilated fluid-filled bronchi. Fetal ascites is usually present.
The definition of the Laryngeal cleft is that Presence of a gap in the posterior laryngotracheal wall with a continuity between the larynx and the esophagus.
The definition of the Laryngeal cartilage malformation is that A malformation of the laryngeal cartilage.
The definition of the aplasia of the epiglottis is that Absence of the epiglottis.
The definition of the Laryngeal calcification is that Calcification (abnormal deposits of calcium) in the laryngeal tissues.
The definition of the Bowing of the vocal cords is that Bowing (abnormal curvature) of the vocal folds.
The definition of the Unilateral vocal cord paralysis is that A loss of the ability to move the vocal fold on one side.
The definition of the No social interaction is that Lack of intentional participation in interactions with another person. []
The definition of the Auditory hallucinations is that Perception of sounds without auditory stimulus. []
The definition of the Self-mutilation of tongue and lips due to involuntary movements is that Uncontrolled movements result in tissue damage to the tongue and lips. []

The definition of the Inappropriate sexual behavior is that An explicit or perceived action, demonstration, conduct, or language (verbal and written) of a sexual nature that goes against generally accepted norms, rules, and procedures. It is considered unacceptable within the context in which it occurs, or it may be both culturally acceptable and atypical/uncommon. []

The definition of the Obsessive-compulsive trait is that The presence of one or more obsessive-compulsive personality traits. Obsessions refer to persistent intrusive thoughts, and compulsions to intrusive behaviors, which the affected person experiences as involuntary, senseless, or repugnant.
The definition of the aplasia/Hypoplasia of the ear is that The presence of aplasia or developmental hypoplasia of the ear.
The definition of the aplasia/Hypoplasia of the external ear is that The presence of aplasia or developmental hypoplasia of all or part of the external ear.
The definition of the aplasia/Hypoplasia of the middle ear is that Aplasia or developmental hypoplasia of all or part of the middle ear.
The definition of the aplasia/Hypoplasia of the inner ear is that Aplasia or developmental hypoplasia of the inner ear.
The definition of the Abnormality of the prostate is that An abnormality of the prostate.
The definition of the Abnormality of the renal artery is that Any structural abnormality of the renal artery.
The definition of the Abnormality of the vocal cords is that An abnormality of the vocal cord.
The definition of the Wide proximal femoral metaphysis is that Increased width of the proximal part of the shaft (metaphysis) of the femur.
The definition of the Wide capital femoral epiphyses is that Abnormally wide morphology of the proximal epiphysis of the femur.
The definition of the Delayed ossification of pubic rami is that Delayed maturation and calcification of the rami (branches) of the pubic bone.
The definition of the Iliac crest serration is that Irregularities of the iliac crest that produce the appearance of a lace border around it.
The definition of the Delayed pubic bone ossification is that Delayed maturation and calcification of the pubic bone.
The definition of the Cone-shaped capital femoral epiphysis is that A cone-shaped deformity of the proximal epiphysis of the femur.
The definition of the Early ossification of capital femoral epiphyses is that Developmental acceleration of ossification of the proximal epiphysis of the femur.
The definition of the Limited hip movement is that A decreased ability to move the femur at the hip joint associated with a decreased range of motion of the hip.
The definition of the Hypoplasia of the lesser trochanter is that Underdevelopment of the lesser trochanter.
The definition of the Hypoplasia of the femoral head is that Underdevelopment of the femoral head.
The definition of the Broad femoral head is that Increased width of the femoral head.
The definition of the Acetabular dysplasia is that A smaller than normal acetabulum that has insufficient femoral head coverage leading to abnormal hip joint contact pressures, instability and pain.
The definition of the High iliac wings is that Increased height of the wing (or ala) of the ilium (which is the large expanded portion which bounds the greater pelvis laterally).
The definition of the Flattened femoral head is that An abnormally flattened femoral head.
The definition of the Large iliac wings is that Increased size of the ilium ala.
The definition of the Narrow femoral neck is that An abnormally reduced diameter of the femoral neck (which is the process of bone, connecting the femoral head with the femoral shaft).
The definition of the Absent ossification of capital femoral epiphysis is that Lack of ossification of the proximal epiphysis of the femur.
The definition of the Hypoplastic ischiopubic rami is that Underdevelopment of the ischiopubic ramus, which is comprised of the inferior pubic ramus and the inferior ramus of the ischium.
The definition of the Hypoplastic iliac body is that Underdevelopment of the body of ilium.
The definition of the Dislocation of the femoral head is that Joint dislocation of the femoral head.
The definition of the Delayed proximal femoral epiphyseal ossification is that Developmental delay of ossification of the proximal epiphysis of the femur.
The definition of the Delayed femoral head ossification is that Delayed ossification of the femoral head.
The definition of the Hypoplastic pelvis is that Underdevelopment of the bony pelvis.

The definition of the Mesomelic short stature is that A type of disproportionate short stature characterized by disproportionate shortening of the medial parts of the extremities (forearm or lower leg).
The definition of the Severe intrauterine growth retardation is that Intrauterine growth retardation that is 4 or more standard deviations below average, corrected for sex and gestational age.
The definition of the Moderately short stature is that A moderate degree of short stature, more than -3 SD but not more than -4 SD from mean corrected for age and sex.
The definition of the Severe postnatal growth retardation is that Severely slow or limited growth after birth, being four standard deviations or more below age- and sex-related norms.

The definition of the Moderate postnatal growth retardation is that A moderate degree of slow or limited growth after birth, being between three and four standard deviations below age- and sex-related norms.

The definition of the Neonatal short-trunk short stature is that A type of disproportionate short stature characterized by a short trunk but a average-sized limbs with congenital onset recognizable at birth.

The definition of the Feeding difficulties in infancy is that Impaired feeding performance of an infant as manifested by difficulties such as weak and ineffective sucking, brief bursts of sucking, and falling asleep during sucking. There may be difficulties with chewing or maintaining attention.
The definition of the Disproportionate short-limb short stature is that A type of disproportionate short stature characterized by a short limbs but an average-sized trunk.

The definition of the Mild intrauterine growth retardation is that Intrauterine growth retardation that is at least 2 standard deviations (SD) below average, but not as low as 3 SD, corrected for sex and gestational age.
The definition of the Adipose tissue loss is that A loss of adipose tissue.
The definition of the Postnatal growth retardation is that Slow or limited growth after birth.
The definition of the Rhizomelia is that Disproportionate shortening of the proximal segment of limbs (i.e. the femur and humerus).
The definition of the Childhood-onset truncal obesity is that Truncal obesity with onset during childhood, defined as between 2 and 10 years of age.
The definition of the Neonatal short-limb short stature is that A type of short-limbed dwarfism that is manifest beginning in the neonatal period.
The definition of the Childhood-onset short-trunk short stature is that A type of disproportionate short stature characterized by a short trunk but a average-sized limbs with onset in childhood.
The definition of the Generalized neonatal hypotonia is that Muscular hypotonia (abnormally low muscle tone) manifesting in the neonatal period and affecting the entire musculature.
The definition of the Muscular hypotonia of the trunk is that Muscular hypotonia (abnormally low muscle tone) affecting the musculature of the trunk.
The definition of the Generalized lymphadenopathy is that A generalized form of lymphadenopathy.
The definition of the Acute rhabdomyolysis is that An acute form of rhabdomyolysis.
The definition of the Distal lower limb amyotrophy is that Muscular atrophy of distal leg muscles.

The definition of the Pelvic girdle amyotrophy is that Atrophy of the muscles of the pelvic girdle (also known as hip girdle), i.e., the gluteal muscles, the lateral rotators, the adductors, the psoas major and the iliacus muscle.
The definition of the Infantile muscular hypotonia is that Muscular hypotonia (abnormally low muscle tone) manifesting in infancy.
The definition of the Proximal upper limb amyotrophy is that Muscular atrophy affecting proximally located muscles of the arms.
The definition of the Shoulder muscle hypoplasia is that Underdevelopment of muscles of the shoulder.
The definition of the Pectoralis major hypoplasia is that Underdevelopment of the pectoralis major.

The definition of the Intrinsic hand muscle atrophy is that Atrophy of the intrinsic muscle groups of the hand, comprising the thenar and hypothenar muscles; the interossei muscles; and the lumbrical muscles.
The definition of the Progressive distal muscular atrophy is that Progressive muscular atrophy affecting muscles in the distal portions of the extremities.
The definition of the Proximal lower limb amyotrophy is that Muscular atrophy affecting proximally located muscles of the legs, i.e., of the thigh.
The definition of the Distal upper limb muscle weakness is that Reduced strength of the distal musculature of the arms.
The definition of the Calf muscle hypoplasia is that Underdevelopment of the muscuklature of the calf.
The definition of the Tibialis muscle weakness is that Muscle weakness affecting the tibialis anterior muscle.
The definition of the Nonprogressive muscular atrophy is that Muscular atrophy that does not display a progression in severity with time.
The definition of the Exercise-induced muscle stiffness is that A type of muscle stiffness that occurs following physical exertion.
The definition of the Muscle hypertrophy of the lower extremities is that Muscle hypertrophy primarily affecting the legs.
The definition of the Decreased activity of mitochondrial respiratory chain is that Decreased activity of the mitochondrial respiratory chain.
The definition of the Calf muscle hypertrophy is that Muscle hypertrophy affecting the calf muscles.
The definition of the Neck muscle hypoplasia is that Underdevelopment of muscles of the neck.
The definition of the Increased intramuscular fat is that An abnormal increase in the amount of intramuscular fat tissue.
The definition of the Agenesis of the diaphragm is that Congenital lack, i.e., aplasia of the diaphragm.

The definition of the Pelvic girdle muscle atrophy is that Muscular atrophy affecting the muscles that attach to the pelvic girdle (the gluteal muscles, the lateral rotators, adductor magnus, adductor brevis, adductor longus, pectineus, and gracilis muscles).
The definition of the Exercise-induced leg cramps is that Sudden and involuntary contractions of one or more muscles of the leg brought on by physical exertion.
The definition of the Increased intraabdominal fat is that An abnormal increase in the amount of intraabdominal fat tissue.
The definition of the Proximal muscle weakness in lower limbs is that A lack of strength of the proximal muscles of the legs.
The definition of the Proximal muscle weakness in upper limbs is that A lack of strength of the proximal muscles of the arms.
The definition of the Pectoralis hypoplasia is that Underdevelopment of the pectoral muscle.
The definition of the Loss of truncal subcutaneous adipose tissue is that Loss (reduction of previously present) of subcutaneous adipose tissue in the region of the trunk.
