The definition of the Increased subcutaneous truncal adipose tissue is that The presence of an abnormally increased amount of subcutaneous adipose tissue in the trunk of the body.
The definition of the Hypoplasia of the musculature is that Underdevelopment of the musculature.
The definition of the Hypoplastic biceps is that Underdevelopment of the biceps muscle.
The definition of the Hypoplasia of serratus anterior muscle is that Underdevelopment of the serratus anterior muscle, which is involved in abduction, upward Rotation, and elevation of the scapula.
The definition of the Upper limb muscle hypoplasia is that Underdevelopment of muscles of the arm.
The definition of the Loss of gluteal subcutaneous adipose tissue is that Loss (reduction of previously present) of subcutaneous adipose tissue in the gluteal region.
The definition of the Exercise-induced muscle fatigue is that An abnormally increased tendency towards muscle fatigue induced by physical exercise.
The definition of the Abdominal wall muscle weakness is that Decreased strength of the abdominal musculature.
The definition of the Increased connective tissue is that The presence of an abnormally increased amount of connective tissue.

The definition of the Hypoplasia of latissimus dorsi muscle is that Underdevelopment of the latissimus dorsi muscle, which is involved in adduction, extension, internal rotation, and transverse extension of the shoulder and assists in movement of the scapula.

The definition of the Foot dorsiflexor weakness is that Weakness of the muscles responsible for dorsiflexion of the foot, that is, of the movement of the toes towards the shin. The foot dorsiflexors include the tibialis anterior, the extensor hallucis longus, the extensor digitorum longus, and the peroneus tertius muscles.
The definition of the Generalized weakness of limb muscles is that Generalized weakness of the muscles of the arms and legs.
The definition of the Exercise-induced rhabdomyolysis is that Rhabdomyolysis induced by exercise.
The definition of the Difficulty running is that Reduced ability to run.

The definition of the Peroneal muscle atrophy is that Atrophy of the peroneous muscles, peroneus longus (also known as Fibularis longus), Peroneus brevis (also known as fibularis brevis, and Peroneus tertius (also known as fibularis tertius).
The definition of the Quadriceps muscle atrophy is that Muscular atrophy involving the quadriceps muscle.
The definition of the Increased muscle glycogen content is that An increased amount of glycogen in muscle tissue.
The definition of the Distal lower limb muscle weakness is that Reduced strength of the distal musculature of the legs.
The definition of the Generalized limb muscle atrophy is that Generalized (unlocalized) atrophy affecting muscles of the limbs in both proximal and distal locations.
The definition of the Increased muscle lipid content is that An abnormal accumulation of lipids in skeletal muscle.

The definition of the Scapular muscle atrophy is that Atrophy of the muscles that are responsible for moving the scapula, which are the levator scapulae, the infraspinatus muscle, the teres major, the teres minor, and the supraspinatus muscle.
The definition of the Infantile axial hypotonia is that Muscular hypotonia (abnormally low muscle tone) affecting the musculature of the trunk and with onset in infancy.
The definition of the Progressive distal muscle weakness is that Progressively reduced strength of the distal musculature.
The definition of the Generalized lipodystrophy is that Generalized degenerative changes of the fat tissue.

The definition of the Progressive spinal muscular atrophy is that Progressive spinal muscular atrophy, i.e., muscular weakness and atrophy related to loss of the motor neurons of the spinal cord and brainstem.

The definition of the Decreased Achilles reflex is that Decreased intensity of the Achilles reflex (also known as the ankle jerk reflex), which can be elicited by tapping the tendon is tapped while the foot is dorsiflexed.
The definition of the Progressive proximal muscle weakness is that Lack of strength of the proximal muscles that becomes progressively more severe.
The definition of the Alveolar ridge overgrowth is that Increased width of the alveolar ridges. [PMID:19125428]
The definition of the Speech articulation difficulties is that Impairment in the physical production of speech sounds. []
The definition of the Median cleft palate is that Cleft palate of the midline of the palate.
The definition of the Submucous cleft lip is that A cleft of the lip with overlying mucous membrane.

The definition of the Anterior open-bite malocclusion is that Anterior open bite is a malocclusion characterized by a gap between the anterior teeth (incisors), that is, by a deficiency in the normal vertical overlap between antagonist incisal edges when the posterior teeth are in occlusion.
The definition of the aplasia/Hypoplasia of the pubic bone is that Absence or underdevelopment of the pubic bone.
The definition of the Abnormal ossification of the pubic bone is that Abnormal ossification (bone tissue formation) affecting the pubic bone, also known as the pubis.
The definition of the Abnormal pelvis bone ossification is that An abnormality of the formation and mineralization of any bone of the bony pelvis.
The definition of the Denervation of the diaphragm is that Interruption of the innervation of the diaphragm.

The definition of the Diaphragmatic eventration is that A congenital failure of muscular development of part or all of one or both hemidiaphragms, resulting in superior displacement of abdominal viscera and altered lung development.
The definition of the Absent left hemidiaphragm is that Congenital absence of the left half of the diaphragm.
The definition of the Diaphragmatic weakness is that A decrease in the strength of the diaphragm.
The definition of the aplasia/hypoplasia involving the skeleton is that Absence (due to failure to form) or underdevelopment of one or more components of the skeleton.
The definition of the aplasia/Hypoplasia of the maxilla is that Absence or underdevelopment of the maxilla.
The definition of the aplasia/Hypoplasia of the mandible is that Absence or underdevelopment of the mandible.
The definition of the aplasia/Hypoplasia of the frontal sinuses is that Absence or underdevelopment of frontal sinus.
The definition of the aplasia/Hypoplasia involving the sinuses is that Absence or underdevelopment of a cranial sinus or sinuses.
The definition of the Abnormal axial skeleton morphology is that An abnormality of the axial skeleton, which comprises the skull, the vertebral column, the ribs and the sternum.
The definition of the aplasia/hypoplasia affecting bones of the axial skeleton is that Absence (due to failure to form) or underdevelopment of bones of the axial skeleton.
The definition of the Abnormality of adipose tissue is that An abnormality of adipose tissue, which is loose connective tissue composed of adipocytes.
The definition of the Lipodystrophy is that Degenerative changes of the fat tissue.

The definition of the Increased adipose tissue is that An increase in adipose tissue mass by hyperplastic growth (increase in the number of adipocytes) or by hypertrophic growth (increase in the size of adipocytes occurring primarily by lipid accumulation within the cell).
The definition of the Upper limb amyotrophy is that Muscular atrophy involving the muscles of the upper limbs.
The definition of the Hand muscle atrophy is that Muscular atrophy involving the muscles of the hand.
The definition of the Abnormality of the musculature of the thorax is that A disease or lesion affecting the muscles of the thorax.

The definition of the Abnormal tarsal bone mineral density is that This term applies to all changes in bone mineral density of the tarsal bones, which (depending on severity) can be seen on x-rays as a change in density and or structure of the bone.
The definition of the Synostosis involving bones of the lower limbs is that An abnormal union between bones or parts of bones lower limbs.

The definition of the Abnormality of cerebral artery is that Any structural anomaly of a cerebral artery. The cerebral arteries comprise three main pairs of arteries and their branches, which supply the cerebrum of the brain. These are the anterior cerebral artery, the middle cerebral artery, and the posterior cerebral artery.

The definition of the Enlarged epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 5th finger is that Abnormally large size of the epiphysis located at the proximal end of the distal phalanx of the 5th finger with respect to age-dependent norms.

The definition of the Small epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 5th finger is that Abnormally small size of the epiphysis located at the proximal end of the distal phalanx of the 5th finger with respect to age-dependent norms.

The definition of the Triangular epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the 5th finger is that A triangular appearance of the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the little finger of the hand. This epiphysis is located at the proximal end of the phalanx and is normally nearly flat.
The definition of the Abnormality of the proximal phalanx of the 5th finger is that Abnormality of the proximal phalanx of the little (5th) finger.
The definition of the Abnormality of the epiphyses of the 5th finger is that Abnormality of one or all of the epiphyses of the proximal, middle, and distal phalanges of the 5th finger.

The definition of the Abnormality of the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 5th finger is that Abnormality of the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the fifth finger. This epiphysis is located on the proximal end of the phalanx.

The definition of the Triangular epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the 5th finger is that A triangular appearance of the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the little finger of the hand. This epiphysis is located at the proximal end of the phalanx and is normally nearly flat.

The definition of the Distal/middle symphalangism of 2nd finger is that Fusion of the terminal/distal and middle phalanges of the 2nd finger.

The definition of the Triangular shaped distal phalanx of the 2nd finger is that Triangular shaped distal phalanx of the 2nd finger. A triangular or so called delta shaped phalanx is a typical result after a bracket epiphysis of the affected phalanx.
The definition of the Short distal phalanx of the 2nd finger is that Hypoplasia (congenital reduction in size) of the distal phalanx of the second finger.
The definition of the Broad middle phalanx of the 2nd finger is that Increased width of the middle phalanx of the second finger.

The definition of the Bullet-shaped middle phalanx of the 2nd finger is that Bullet-shaped phalanx refers to a short and wide phalanx that tapers distally. Bullet-shaped phalanges lack the normal diaphyseal constriction. This term is used if the middle phalanx of the 2nd finger is affected.
The definition of the Curved middle phalanx of the 2nd finger is that Curved appearance of the middle phalanx of the 2nd finger.
The definition of the Osteolytic defects of the middle phalanx of the 2nd finger is that Dissolution or degeneration of bone tissue of the middle phalanx of the 2nd finger.
The definition of the Patchy sclerosis of the middle phalanx of the 2nd finger is that Uneven (irregular) increase in bone density of the middle phalanx of the second finger.
The definition of the Symphalangism of middle phalanx of 2nd finger is that Fusion of the middle phalanx of the 2nd finger with another bone.

The definition of the Triangular shaped middle phalanx of the 2nd finger is that Triangular shaped middle phalanx of the 2nd finger. A triangular or so called delta shaped phalanx is a typical result after a bracket epiphysis of the affected phalanx.
The definition of the Absent middle phalanx of 2nd finger is that Absence of the middle phalanx of the index (2nd) finger.
The definition of the Short middle phalanx of the 2nd finger is that Hypoplasia (congenital reduction in size) of the middle phalanx of the second finger, also known as the index finger.
The definition of the Proximal/middle symphalangism of the 2nd finger is that Fusion of the proximal and middle phalanges of the 2nd finger.
The definition of the Broad proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger is that Increased width of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger.

The definition of the Bullet-shaped proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger is that Bullet-shaped phalanx refers to a short and wide phalanx that tapers distally. Bullet-shaped phalanges lack the normal diaphyseal constriction. This term is used if the proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger is affected.
The definition of the Curved proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger is that Curved appearance of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger.
The definition of the Osteolytic defects of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger is that Dissolution or degeneration of bone tissue of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger.
The definition of the Patchy sclerosis of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger is that Uneven (irregular) increase in bone density of the proximal phalanx of the second finger.
The definition of the Symphalangism affecting the proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger is that Fusion of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger with another bone.

The definition of the Triangular shaped proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger is that Triangular shaped proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger. A triangular or so called delta shaped phalanx is a typical result after a bracket epiphysis of the affected phalanx.

The definition of the Vestibular Schwannoma is that A vestibular schwannoma (also known as acoustic neuroma, acoustic neurinoma, or acoustic neurilemoma) is a benign, usually slow-growing tumor that develops from the VIIIth cranial nerve supplying the inner ear.
The definition of the Bilateral vestibular Schwannoma is that A bilateral vestibular schwannoma (acoustic neurinoma).
The definition of the Unilateral vestibular Schwannoma is that A unilateral vestibular schwannoma (acoustic neurinoma).

The definition of the Abnormality of the vestibulocochlear nerve is that Any structural anomaly of the vestibulocochlear nerve. The vestibulocochlear nerve consists of the vestibular and cochlear nerves, also known as cranial nerve eight (CN VIII). Each nerve has distinct nuclei within the brainstem. The vestibular nerve is primarily responsible for maintaining body balance and eye movements, while the cochlear nerve is responsible for hearing.

The definition of the Astrocytoma is that Astrocytoma is a neoplasm of the central nervous system derived from astrocytes. Astrocytes are a type of glial cell, and thus astrocytoma is a subtype of glioma.
The definition of the Retinal hamartoma is that A hamartoma (a benign, focal malformation consisting of a disorganized mixture of cells and tissues) of the retina.
The definition of the Occasional neurofibromas is that Neurofibromas present in a smaller number than usually seen in neurofibromatosis type 1.
The definition of the aplasia of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger is that Absence of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger.
The definition of the Short proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger is that Hypoplasia (congenital reduction in size) of the proximal phalanx of the second finger.
The definition of the Symphalangism of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger with the 2nd metatcarpal Symphalangism is that Fusion of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger with the 2nd metacarpal.
The definition of the Abnormality of thumb epiphysis is that Abnormality of one or all of the epiphyses of the proximal, and distal phalanges of the thumb and/or the 1st metacarpal.

The definition of the Flexion contracture of thumb is that Lack of full passive range of motion (restrictions in flexion, extension, or other movements) of the thumb joint resulting from structural changes of non-bony tissues, such as muscles, tendons, ligaments, joint capsules and/or skin. The term camptodactyly is used if the distal and/or proximal interphalangeal joints are affected.
The definition of the aplasia/Hypoplasia of the thumb is that Hypoplastic/small or absent thumb.
The definition of the Abnormality of thumb phalanx is that A structural anomaly of one or more phalanges of the thumb.
The definition of the Deviation/Displacement of the thumb is that Displacement of the thumb from its normal position.
The definition of the Complete duplication of distal phalanx of the thumb is that Complete duplication of the distal phalanx of the thumb. On x-ray two separate bones appear side to side.

The definition of the Complete duplication of proximal phalanx of the thumb is that Complete duplication of the proximal phalanx of the thumb. On x-ray two separate bones appear side to side. In contrast to the proximal phalanges of the digits 2-5, the proximal phalanx of the thumb is embryologically equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits, whereas the first metacarpal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the other digits.
The definition of the Duplication of the 1st metacarpal is that Partail or complete duplication of the first metacarpal bone.

The definition of the Bifid distal phalanx of the thumb is that Partial duplication of the distal phalanx of the thumb. Depending on the severity, the appearance on x-ray can vary from a notched phalanx (the duplicated bone is almost completely fused with the phalanx) to a partially fused appearance of the two bones.

The definition of the Duplication of the distal phalanx of the thumb is that Complete or partial duplication of the distal phalanx of the thumb. Depending on the severity, the appearance on x-ray can vary from a notched phalanx (the duplicated bone is almost completely fused with the phalanx), a partially fused appearance of the two bones, or two separate bones appearing side to side.

The definition of the Duplication of the proximal phalanx of the thumb is that Complete or partial duplication of the proximal phalanx of the thumb. Depending on the severity, the appearance on x-ray can vary from a notched phalanx (the duplicated bone is almost completely fused with the phalanx), a partially fused appearance of the two bones, or two separate bones appearing side to side. In contrast to the proximal phalanges of the digits 2-5, the proximal phalanx of the thumb is embryologically equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits, whereas the first metacarpal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the other digits.

The definition of the Bifid proximal phalanx of the thumb is that This term applies if the proximal phalanx of the thumb is partially duplicated. Depending on the severity, the appearance on x-ray can vary from a notched phalanx (the duplicated bone is almost completely fused with the phalanx) to a partially fused appearance of the two bones. In contrast to the proximal phalanges of the digits 2-5, the proximal phalanx of the thumb is embryologically equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits, whereas the first metacarpal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the other digits.
The definition of the Complete duplication of the first metacarpal is that Complete duplication of the first metacarpal bone.
The definition of the Bifid first metacarpal is that Partial duplication of the first metacarpal bone.
The definition of the Abnormality of the distal phalanx of the thumb is that Any anomaly of the distal phalanx of thumb.
The definition of the Abnormality of the proximal phalanx of the thumb is that An anomaly of the shape or form of the proximal phalanx of the thumb.
The definition of the Distally placed thumb is that Insertion of thumb at a more distal location than normal.
The definition of the Proximal placement of thumb is that Proximal mislocalization of the thumb.

The definition of the Contractures of the carpometacarpal joint of the thumb is that Chronic loss of joint motion of the carpometacarpal joint of the thumb due to structural changes in non-bony tissue. This joint is formed by the first metacarpal and the trapezial bone and is also called Articulatio carpometacarpalis pollicis, carpometacarpal articulation of thumb, carpometacarpal joint of thumb or first carpometacarpal articulation. Seldom referred to as thumb saddle joint.

The definition of the Contractures of the metacarpophalangeal joint of the thumb is that Chronic loss of joint motion of the metacarpophalangeal joint of the thumb due to structural changes in non-bony tissue. This joint is also called Articulatio metacarpophalangealis pollicis.

The definition of the Contractures of the interphalangeal joint of the thumb is that Chronic loss of joint motion of the interphalangeal joint of the thumb due to structural changes in non-bony tissue. This joint is also called Articulatio interphalangealis pollicis.

The definition of the aplasia/Hypoplasia of the proximal phalanx of the thumb is that This term applies if the proximal phalanx of the thumb is either small/hypoplastic or absent. In contrast to the proximal phalanges of the digits 2-5, the proximal phalanx of the thumb is embryologically equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits, whereas the first metacarpal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the other digits.

The definition of the Broad proximal phalanx of the thumb is that Increased width of the proximal phalanx of the thumb. In contrast to the proximal phalanges of the digits 2-5, the proximal phalanx of the thumb is embryologically equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits, whereas the first metacarpal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the other digits.

The definition of the Bullet-shaped proximal phalanx of the thumb is that Bullet-shaped phalanx refers to a short and wide phalanx that tapers distally. Bullet-shaped phalanges lack the normal diaphyseal constriction. This term is used if the proximal phalanx of the thumb is affected.
The definition of the Curved proximal phalanx of the thumb is that A deviation from the normal straight shape of the proximal phalanx of the thumb.
The definition of the Osteolytic defect of the proximal phalanx of the thumb is that Dissolution or degeneration of bone tissue of the proximal phalanx of the thumb.
The definition of the Patchy sclerosis of the proximal phalanx of the thumb is that An uneven increase in bone density of the proximal phalanx of the thumb.
The definition of the Synostosis of thumb phalanx is that Fusion of a phalanx of the thumb with another bone.
The definition of the Triangular shaped proximal phalanx of the thumb is that Triangular shaped proximal phalanx of the thumb.

The definition of the Absent proximal phalanx of thumb is that Absence of the proximal phalanx of the thumb. In contrast to the proximal phalanges of the digits 2-5, the proximal phalanx of the thumb is embryologically equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits, whereas the first metacarpal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the other digits.

The definition of the Short proximal phalanx of thumb is that Hypoplastic (short) proximal phalanx of the thumb. In contrast to the proximal phalanges of the digits 2-5, the proximal phalanx of the thumb is embryologically equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits, whereas the first metacarpal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the other digits.
The definition of the Synostosis of the proximal phalanx of the thumb with the 1st metatcarpal is that Fusion of the proximal phalanx of the thumb with the 1st metacarpal.
The definition of the Broad distal phalanx of the thumb is that Increased width of the distal phalanx of thumb.

The definition of the Bullet-shaped distal phalanx of the thumb is that Bullet-shaped phalanx refers to a short and wide phalanx that tapers distally. Bullet-shaped phalanges lack the normal diaphyseal constriction. This term is used if the distal phalanx of the thumb is affected.
The definition of the Curved distal phalanx of the thumb is that A deviation from the normal straight shape of the distal phalanx of the thumb.
The definition of the Osteolytic defect of the distal phalanx of the thumb is that Dissolution or degeneration of bone tissue of the distal phalanx of the thumb.
The definition of the Patchy sclerosis of the distal phalanx of the thumb is that An uneven increase in bone density of the distal phalanx of the thumb.

The definition of the Triangular shaped distal phalanx of the thumb is that Triangular shaped distal phalanx of the thumb. A triangular or so called delta shaped phalanx is a typical result after a bracket epiphysis of the affected phalanx.
The definition of the aplasia of the distal phalanx of the thumb is that Absence of the distal/terminal phalanx of the thumb.
The definition of the Short distal phalanx of the thumb is that Hypoplastic (short) distal phalanx of the thumb.

The definition of the Bullet-shaped thumb phalanx is that An abnormal morphology of one or more phalanges of the thumb, with a short and wide phalanx that tapers distally. Bullet-shaped phalanges lack the normal diaphyseal constriction.
The definition of the Curved thumb phalanx is that A deviation from the normal straight shape of a thumb phalanx.
The definition of the Osteolytic defect of thumb phalanx is that Dissolution or degeneration of bone tissue of one or more phalanges of the thumb.
The definition of the Patchy sclerosis of thumb phalanx is that An uneven increase in bone density of one or more of the phalanges of the thumb.
The definition of the Symphalangism of the thumb is that Congenital fusion (ankylosis) of the interphalangeal joint of the thumb.
The definition of the Triangular shaped thumb phalanx is that Abnormal shape of one or more phalanges of the thumb such that affected phalanges resemble a triangle.
The definition of the Partial absence of thumb is that The absence of a phalangeal segment of a thumb. [PMID:probinson]
The definition of the Short phalanx of the thumb is that Hypoplastic (short) thumb phalanx.

The definition of the Abnormality of the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the thumb is that Abnormality of the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the thumb. This epiphysis is located on the proximal end of the phalanx.

The definition of the Abnormality of the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the thumb is that This term applies if the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the thumb, which is located at the proximal end of the phalanx, does not appear in concordance with gender and age dependant norms as seen on x-rays. In contrast to the proximal phalanges of the digits 2-5, the proximal phalanx of the thumb is embryologically equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits, whereas the first metacarpal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the other digits.

The definition of the Absent epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the thumb is that Absence of the epiphysis located at the proximal end of the proximal phalanx of the thumb. In contrast to the proximal phalanges of the digits 2-5, the proximal phalanx of the thumb is embryologically equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits, whereas the first metacarpal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the other digits.

The definition of the Bracket epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the thumb is that An abnormality of the proximal phalanx of the thumb in which the epiphysis surrounds a phalangeal bone, having a bracket-like form and reaching from the proximal side of a phalanx to the distal side.

The definition of the Cone-shaped epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the thumb is that A cone-shaped appearance of the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the thumb of the hand, producing a 'ball-in-a-socket' appearance. This epiphysis is located at the proximal end of the phalanx and is normally nearly flat. The related entity 'angel-shaped' epiphysis refers to a pronounced cone-shaped epiphysis in combination with a pseudoepiphysis at the distal end of the phalanx. In contrast to the proximal phalanges of the digits 2-5, the proximal phalanx of the thumb is embryologically equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits, whereas the first metacarpal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the other digits.

The definition of the Enlarged epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the thumb is that Abnormally large size of the epiphysis located at the proximal end of the proximal phalanx of the thumb with respect to age-dependent norms. In contrast to the proximal phalanges of the digits 2-5, the proximal phalanx of the thumb is embryologically equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits, whereas the first metacarpal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the other digits.
The definition of the Fragmentation of the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the thumb is that Epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the thumb having multiple bony fragments.

The definition of the Irregular epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the thumb is that Irregular radiographic opacity of the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the thumb. In contrast to the proximal phalanges of the digits 2-5, the proximal phalanx of the thumb is embryologically equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits, whereas the first metacarpal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the other digits.

The definition of the Ivory epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the thumb is that Sclerosis of the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the thumb, leading to an increased degree of radiopacity (white or ivory appearance) in X-rays.

The definition of the Pseudoepiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the thumb is that A pseudoepiphysis (which is a secondary ossification center distinct from the normal epiphysis) of the proximal phalanx of the thumb.

The definition of the Small epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the thumb is that Abnormally small size of the epiphysis located at the proximal end of the proximal phalanx of the thumb with respect to age-dependent norms.

The definition of the Stippling of the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the thumb is that The presence of abnormal punctate (speckled, dot-like) calcifications in the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the thumb. In contrast to the proximal phalanges of the digits 2-5, the proximal phalanx of the thumb is embryologically equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits, whereas the first metacarpal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the other digits.

The definition of the Triangular epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the thumb is that A triangular appearance of the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the thumb of the hand. This epiphysis is located at the proximal end of the phalanx and is normally nearly flat. In contrast to the proximal phalanges of the digits 2-5, the proximal phalanx of the thumb is embryologically equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits, whereas the first metacarpal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the other digits.
The definition of the Absent epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the thumb is that Absence of the epiphysis located at the proximal end of the distal phalanx of the thumb.

The definition of the Bracket epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the thumb is that An abnormality of the distal phalanx of the thumb in which the epiphysis surrounds a phalangeal bone, having a bracket-like form and reaching from the proximal side of a phalanx to the distal side.

The definition of the Cone-shaped epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the thumb is that A cone-shaped appearance of the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the thumb of the hand, producing a 'ball-in-a-socket' appearance. This epiphysis is located at the proximal end of the phalanx and is normally nearly flat. The related entity 'angel-shaped' epiphysis refers to a pronounced cone-shaped epiphysis in combination with a pseudoepiphysis at the distal end of the phalanx.

The definition of the Enlarged epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the thumb is that Abnormally large size of the epiphysis located at the proximal end of the distal phalanx of the thumb with respect to age-dependent norms.
The definition of the Fragmentation of the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the thumb is that Epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the thumb having multiple bony fragments.
The definition of the Irregular epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the thumb is that Uneven radiographic opacity of the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the thumb.

The definition of the Ivory epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the thumb is that Sclerosis of the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the thumb, leading to an increased degree of radiopacity (white or ivory appearance) in X-rays.

The definition of the Pseudoepiphysis of the distal phalanx of the thumb is that A pseudoepiphysis (which is a secondary ossification center distinct from the normal epiphysis) of the distal phalanx of the thumb.

The definition of the Small epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the thumb is that Abnormally small size of the epiphysis located at the proximal end of the distal phalanx of the thumb with respect to age-dependent norms.

The definition of the Stippling of the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the thumb is that The presence of abnormal punctate (speckled, dot-like) calcifications in the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the thumb.

The definition of the Triangular epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the thumb is that A triangular appearance of the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the thumb of the hand. This epiphysis is located at the proximal end of the phalanx and is normally nearly flat.
The definition of the Absent epiphyses of the thumb is that Absence of one or more epiphyses of the thumb.

The definition of the Bracket epiphyses of the thumb is that An abnormality of the thumb in which the epiphysis surrounds a phalangeal bone, having a bracket-like form and reaching from the proximal side of a phalanx to the distal side. [PMID:24432108]

The definition of the Cone-shaped epiphysis of the thumb is that A cone-shaped appearance of the epiphyses of the thumb, producing a 'ball-in-a-socket' appearance. The related entity 'angel-shaped' epiphysis refers to a pronounced cone-shaped epiphysis in combination with a pseudoepiphysis at the distal end of a phalanx.
The definition of the Enlarged thumb epiphysis is that Abnormally large size of the epiphyses of the thumb with respect to age-dependent norms.
The definition of the Fragmentation of thumb epiphysis is that Epiphysis of the thumb having multiple bony fragments.
The definition of the Irregular thumb epiphysis is that Uneven radiographic opacity of the one or more epiphyses of the thumb.
The definition of the Ivory epiphysis of the thumb is that Sclerosis of one or more of the epiphyses of the thumb, leading to an increased degree of radiopacity (white or ivory appearance) in X-rays.
The definition of the Pseudoepiphysis of the thumb is that A pseudoepiphysis (which is a secondary ossification center distinct from the normal epiphysis) of one or more phalanges of the thumb.
The definition of the Small thumb epiphysis is that Abnormally small size of one or more of the epiphyses of the thumb with respect to age-dependent norms.
The definition of the Stippling of thumb epiphysis is that The presence of abnormal punctate (speckled, dot-like) calcifications in one or more of the epiphyses of the thumb.
The definition of the Contracture of the distal interphalangeal joints of the fingers is that Chronic loss of joint motion in one or more distal interphalangeal joints of the fingers.

The definition of the Synostosis involving bones of the fingers is that An abnormal union between bones or parts of bones of the fingers. The synonymous term symphalangism of the hand" may be translated as fusions of bones of varying digree, that involve at least one phalangeal bone of the hand. If bony fusions are referred to as "Symphalangism" the fusion occurs in a proximo-distal axis. Fusions of bones of the fingers in a radio-ulnar axis are referred to as "bony" Syndactyly."

The definition of the Metacarpal synostosis is that Fusion involving two or more metacarpal bones (A synostosis of the first metacarpal and the proximal phalanx of the thumb can also be observed, note that the first metacarpal bone corresponds to a proximal phalanx).
The definition of the Carpal synostosis is that Synostosis (bony fusion) involving one or more bones of the carpus (scaphoid, lunate, triquetrum, trapezium, trapezoid, capitate, hamate, pisiform).

The definition of the Synostosis involving the 1st metacarpal is that Fusion of the 1st metacarpal with another bone. In contrast to the proximal phalanges of the digits 2 to 5, the proximal phalanx of the thumb is embryologically equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits, whereas the first metacarpal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the other digits.

The definition of the Chronic CSF lymphocytosis is that Chronic cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) lymphocytosis is defined as the finding, in at least two serial CSF examinations, of more than 5 cells per cubic millimeter.
The definition of the Increased CSF interferon alpha is that Increased concentration of interferon alpha in the cerebrospinal fluid (CSF).

The definition of the Chilblain lesions is that Chilblains, also called perniosis, are an inflammatory skin condition related to an abnormal vascular response to the cold. We are unaware of a reliable estimate of incidence. It typically presents as tender, pruritic red or bluish lesions located symmetrically on the dorsal aspect of the fingers, toes, ears and nose. Less commonly, reports describe involvement of the thighs and buttocks. The lesions present hours after exposure to cold and usually resolve spontaneously in one to three weeks.
The definition of the Retinal hemangioblastoma is that A benign vascular tumor of the retina without any neoplastic characteristics.
The definition of the Spinal hemangioblastoma is that A hemangioblastoma of the spinal cord.
The definition of the Abnormality of the epididymis is that An abnormality of the epididymis.
The definition of the Papillary cystadenoma of the epididymis is that A cystadenoma, an epithelial tumor, that originates within the head of the epididymis.

The definition of the Subependymal nodules is that Small nodular masses which originate in the subependymal region of the lateral ventricles and protrude into the ventricular cavity. They may represent subependymal hamartomas of tuberous sclerosis.

The definition of the Cortical tubers is that Cortical tubers in the brain are hamartomatous lesions typically located at the gray-white matter interface, commonly in the frontal and parietal lobes. Cortical tubers are composed of abnormal glial and neural cells, and the size, number, and location vary among patients.

The definition of the Subependymal giant-cell astrocytoma is that A demarcated, largely intraventricular tumor in the region of the foramen of Monro composed of spindle to large plump or ganglion-like cells with eosinophilic to amphophilic cytoplasm and somewhat pleomorphic nuclei with occasional prominent nucleoli. These tumors are almost always associated with tuberous sclerosis.

The definition of the Hypomelanotic macules is that Hypomelanotic macules (ash leaf spots") are white or lighter patches of skin that may appear anywhere on the body and are caused by a lack of melanin. White ash leaf-shaped macules are considered to be characteristic of tuberous sclerosis."
The definition of the Adenoma sebaceum is that The presence of a sebaceous adenoma with origin in the sebum secreting cells of the skin.

The definition of the Shagreen patch is that A plaque representing a connective-tissue nevus. Connective tissue naevi are uncommon skin lesions that occur when the deeper layers of the skin do not develop correctly or the components of these layers occur in the wrong proportion. Shagreen patches are oval-shaped and nevoid, skin-colored or occasionally pigmented, smooth or crinkled. The word shagreen refers to a type of roughened untanned leather.
The definition of the Dental enamel pits is that The presence of small depressions in the dental enamel.
The definition of the Abnormality of the subungual region is that A lesion located beneath a fingernail or toenail.
The definition of the Subungual fibromas is that The presence of fibromata beneath finger or toenails.
The definition of the Bladder neoplasm is that The presence of a neoplasm of the urinary bladder.
The definition of the Renal neoplasm is that The presence of a neoplasm of the kidney.

The definition of the Achromatic retinal patches is that Areas of the retina lacking pigmentation. Punched out areas of chorioretinal hypopigmentation less than 1 disc diameter in size and tending to be located in the midperiphery of the retina.
The definition of the Neoplasm of striated muscle is that A benign or malignant neoplasm (tumor) originating in striated muscle, either skeletal muscle or cardiac muscle.
The definition of the Cardiac rhabdomyoma is that A benign tumor of cardiac striated muscle.
The definition of the Rhabdomyoma is that A benign tumor of striated muscle.
The definition of the Cerebral hamartomata is that The presence of a hamartoma of the cerebrum.
The definition of the Glioma is that The presence of a glioma, which is a neoplasm of the central nervous system originating from a glial cell (astrocytes or oligodendrocytes).
The definition of the Optic glioma is that A glioma originating in the optic nerve or optic chiasm.
The definition of the Spinal neurofibromas is that A neurofibroma (benign peripheral nerve sheath tumor) localized in the spine.

The definition of the Tibial pseudoarthrosis is that Pseudarthrosis, or false joint" of the tibia is the result of a developmental failure in the tibia progressing to spontaneous fracture and subsequent fibrous nonunion. The fracture is rarely present at birth but commonly develops during the first 18 months of life."
The definition of the Lisch nodules is that The presence of pigmented, oval and dome-shaped raised hamartomatous nevi of the iris..
The definition of the Abnormality of the antihelix is that An abnormality of the antihelix.
The definition of the Hypoplasia of the antihelix is that Developmental hypoplasia of the antihelix.
The definition of the aplasia of the parotid gland is that Absence of the parotid gland.

The definition of the Nephrosclerosis is that Nephrosclerosis refers to thickening or scarring (sclerosis") resulting from damage to the renal arterioles, also referred to as arteriosclerosis of the kidney arteries."
The definition of the Stiff shoulders is that Shoulder joint stiffness is a perceived sensation of tightness in shoulders when attempting to move them after a period of inactivity.
The definition of the Distichiasis is that Double rows of eyelashes.
The definition of the Abnormality of the spinal dura mater is that An abnormality of the spinal dura mater, which is the outermost of the three layers of the meninges surrounding the spinal cord.
The definition of the Spinalarachnoid cyst is that Presence of arachnoid cysts of the spinal canal extradurally in the epidural space.
The definition of the Thick nasal septum is that Abnormally increased thickness of the nasal septum.
The definition of the Lumbosacral hirsutism is that Abnormally increased hair growth in the lumbosacral region.
The definition of the Large earlobe is that Increased volume of the earlobe, that is, abnormally prominent ear lobules.
The definition of the aplasia of the pectoralis major muscle is that Absence of the pectoralis major muscle.
The definition of the Cleft in skull base is that A bony defect in the skull base.
The definition of the Fibrous syngnathia is that Complete or nearly complete soft tissue fusion of the alveolar ridges. [PMID:19125428]
The definition of the Ankyloblepharon is that Partial fusion of the upper and lower eyelid margins by single or multiple bands of tissue. [PMID:18125427]
The definition of the Popliteal pterygium is that A pterygium (or pterygia) occurring in the popliteal region (the back of the knee).
The definition of the Intercrural pterygium is that A pterygium (or pterygia) in the intercrural (groin) region.

The definition of the Pyramidal skinfold extending from the base to the top of the nails is that Pyramidal skinfold extending from the base to the top of the nails is a rare and distinctive anomaly seen in popliteal pterygia syndrome.
The definition of the Neck pterygia is that Pterygia affecting the neck.

The definition of the Antecubital pterygium is that Pterygium affecting the elbow. This is a cutaneous web that can lead to severe flexion contracture of the elbow joint. Antecubital pterygium can be unilateral, bilateral, symmetric, or asysmmetric.
The definition of the Anterior clefting of vertebral bodies is that Anterior schisis (cleft or cleavage) of vertebral bodies.
The definition of the Facial wrinkling is that Excessive wrinkling of the skin of the face.
The definition of the Limb pain is that Chronic pain in the limbs with no clear focal etiology.
The definition of the Low hanging columella is that Columella extending inferior to the level of the nasal base, when viewed from the side. [PMID:19152422]
The definition of the aplasia/Hypoplasia of the phalanges of the hand is that Small or missing phalangeal bones of the fingers of the hand.
The definition of the Broad phalanges of the hand is that Increased width of the phalanges of the hand.
The definition of the Bullet-shaped phalanges of the hand is that The presence of short and wide phalanges which taper distally (bullet shaped")."
The definition of the Osteolytic defects of the phalanges of the hand is that Dissolution or degeneration of bone tissue of the phalanges of the hand.
The definition of the Patchy sclerosis of finger phalanx is that Uneven (irregular) increase in bone density of one or more of the phalanges of the hand.
The definition of the Symphalangism affecting the phalanges of the hand is that Fusion of two or more phalangeal bones of the hand.

The definition of the Amniotic constriction ring is that Annular constrictions around the digits, limbs, or trunk, occurring congenitally (sometimes causing intrauterine autoamputation) and also associated with a wide variety of disorders. Constrictive amniotic bands are the result of primary amniotic rupture, which can lead to entanglement of fetal tissue (especially limbs) in fibrous amniotic strands.
The definition of the Adactyly is that The absence of all phalanges of all the digits of a limb and the associated soft tissues. [PMID:19125433]
The definition of the Absent thumb is that Absent thumb, i.e., the absence of both phalanges of a thumb and the associated soft tissues.
The definition of the Short thumb is that Hypoplasia (congenital reduction in size) of the thumb.
The definition of the 3-4 toe syndactyly is that Syndactyly with fusion of toes three and four.

The definition of the Iliac horns is that Horn-like malformations of the iliac crests with symmetrical bilateral central posterior iliac processes. A characteristic finding in the Nail-Patella syndrome. Iliac horns are visible on X-ray and may be palpable, but are asymptomatic.
The definition of the Lester's sign is that A zone of darker pigmentation around the central part of the iris with a roughly cloverleaf or flower shape.
The definition of the aplasia/Hypoplasia of the biceps is that Absence or underdevelopment of the biceps muscle.
The definition of the Biceps aplasia is that Absence of the biceps muscle.
The definition of the aplasia/Hypoplasia of the triceps is that Absence or underdevelopment of the triceps muscle.
The definition of the Triceps aplasia is that Absence of the triceps muscle.
The definition of the aplasia/Hypoplasia of the musculature of the thigh is that Absence or underdevelopment involving the musculature of the thigh.
The definition of the aplasia/Hypoplasia of the quadriceps is that Absence or underdevelopment of the quadriceps muscle.
The definition of the Quadriceps aplasia is that Absence of the quadriceps muscle.
The definition of the Perianal abscess is that The presence of an abscess located around the anus.

The definition of the Hemisacrum (S2-S5) is that A hemisacral defect involving the sacral vertebrae S2 to S5. In hemisacrum, the first sacral vertebra is intact and there is agenesis involving only S2-S5.
The definition of the Bifid sacrum is that Presence of a bifid sacral bone.
The definition of the Teratoma is that The presence of a teratoma.
The definition of the Presacral teratoma is that A type of sacrococcygeal teratoma located anterior to the sacrum and entirely inside the body (Altman type IV).
The definition of the Branchial anomaly is that Congenital developmental defect arising from the primitive branchial apparatus.
The definition of the Branchial fistula is that A congenital fistula in the neck resulting from incomplete closure of a branchial cleft.

The definition of the Branchial cyst is that A branchial cyst is a remnant of embryonic development resulting from a failure of obliteration of a branchial cleft and consists of a subcutaneous cystic mass. Cysts are located anterior or posterior to the ear or in the submandibular region.

The definition of the Cholesteatoma is that Cholesteatoma is a benign but potentially destructive growth consisting of keratinizing epithelium located in the middle ear and/or mastoid process. In cholesteatoma, a skin cyst grows into the middle ear and mastoid. The cyst is not cancerous but can erode tissue and cause destruction of the ear.
The definition of the Euthyroid goiter is that A goiter that is not associated with functional thyroid abnormalities.
The definition of the Supernumerary spleens is that The presence of two or more accessory spleens.

The definition of the Maternal diabetes is that Maternal diabetes can either be a gestational, mostly type 2 diabetes, or a type 1 diabetes. Essential is the resulting maternal hyperglycemia as a non-specific teratogen, imposing the same risk of congenital malformations to pregnant women with both type 1 and type2 diabetes.
The definition of the aplasia of the phalanges of the hand is that Absence of one or more of the phalanges of the hand.
The definition of the Short phalanx of finger is that Short (hypoplastic) phalanx of finger, affecting one or more phalanges.
The definition of the Reduced number of teeth is that The absence of one or more teeth from the normal series by a failure to develop

The definition of the Low-output congestive heart failure is that A form of heart failure characterized by reduced cardiac output. This may be seen in patients with heart failure owing to ischemic heart disease, hypertension, cardiomyopathy, and other causes.
The definition of the Nephrogenic diabetes insipidus is that A form of diabetes insipidus caused by failure of the kidneys to respond to vasopressin (AVP).
The definition of the Anomaly of the upper limb diaphyses is that A structural abnormality of a diaphysis of the arm. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:UToronto_htrang]
The definition of the Abnormality of upper limb metaphysis is that An anomaly of one or more metaphyses of the arms.
The definition of the Amelia involving the upper limbs is that Amelia of one or both upper limbs.

The definition of the Upper limb phocomelia is that Missing or malformed long bones of the upper limbs with the distal parts (the hands) connected to the variably shortened or even absent upper extremity, leading to a flipper-like appearance, as opposed to other forms of limb malformations were either the whole limb is missing (such as amelia), or the distal part of a limb is absent (peromelia).
The definition of the Upper limb peromelia is that Peromelia affecting only the upper limbs. That is, the distal parts of the arm are missing leading to stump formation.
The definition of the aplasia/hypoplasia of the extremities is that Absence (due to failure to form) or underdevelopment of the extremities.
The definition of the Lower limb undergrowth is that Leg shortening because of underdevelopment of one or more bones of the lower extremity.
The definition of the Amelia involving the lower limbs is that Amelia of one or both legs.
The definition of the Lower limb phocomelia is that Phocomelia affecting only the lower limbs.
The definition of the Lower limb peromelia is that Peromelia affecting only the lower limbs. That is, the distal parts of the leg are missing leading to stump formation.
The definition of the Forearm undergrowth is that Forearm shortening because of underdevelopment of one or more bones of the forearm.
The definition of the Upper limb undergrowth is that Arm shortening because of underdevelopment of one or more bones of the upper extremity.
The definition of the Limb undergrowth is that Limb shortening because of underdevelopment of one or more bones of the extremities.
The definition of the Amelia is that Congenital absence (aplasia) of one or more limbs.
The definition of the Peromelia is that The distal parts of the limbs are missing leading to a stump formation.

The definition of the Phocomelia is that Missing or malformed long bones of the extremities with the distal parts (such as hands and/or feet) connected to the variably shortened or even absent extremity, leading to a flipper-like appearance, as opposed to other forms of limb malformations were either the hole limb is missing (such as amelia), or the distal part of a limb is absent (peromelia).

The definition of the Peripheral neuropathy is that Peripheral neuropathy is a general term for any disorder of the peripheral nervous system. The main clinical features used to classify peripheral neuropathy are distribution, type (mainly demyelinating versus mainly axonal), duration, and course.

The definition of the Mononeuropathy is that A focal lesion of a single peripheral nerve. Damage to a sensory nerve is accompanied by sensory impairment of all modalities in the affected anatomic distribution.
The definition of the Abnormality of the distal phalanx of finger is that Any anomaly of distal phalanx of finger.
The definition of the Abnormality of the middle phalanges of the hand is that An anomaly of middle phalanx of finger.
The definition of the aplasia/Hypoplasia of the distal phalanges of the hand is that Absence or underdevelopment of the distal phalanges.
The definition of the Broad distal phalanx of finger is that Abnormally wide (broad) distal phalanx of finger.
The definition of the Patchy sclerosis of distal phalanx of finger is that Uneven (irregular) increase in bone density of the distal phalanges of the hand.
The definition of the Broad middle phalanx of finger is that Increased width of the middle phalanx of finger.

The definition of the Bullet-shaped middle phalanges of the hand is that Any of the middle phalanges with short and wide phalanx that tapers distally. Bullet-shaped phalanges lack the normal diaphyseal constriction.
The definition of the Patchy sclerosis of middle phalanx of finger is that Uneven (irregular) increase in bone density of one or more of the middle phalanges of the hand.
The definition of the Symphalangism of middle phalanx of finger is that Fusion of a middle phalanx of a finger with another bone.
The definition of the Broad proximal phalanges of the hand is that Increased width of the proximal phalanges of the finger.
The definition of the Patchy sclerosis of proximal phalanx of finger is that Uneven increase in bone density of the proximal phalanges of the hand.

The definition of the Cerebellar ataxia associated with quadrupedal gait is that The presence of cerebellar signs and symptoms such as lack of balance associated with quadrupedal gait (locomotion on all four extremities with a 'bear-like' gait with the legs held straight).

The definition of the Cortical gyral simplification is that An abnormality of the cerebral cortex with fewer gyri but with normal cortical thickness. This pattern is usually often associated with congenital microcephaly.
The definition of the Broad distal phalanges of all fingers is that Abnormally wide (broad) distal phalanx of finger of all fingers.

The definition of the Short distal phalanx of finger is that Short distance from the end of the finger to the most distal interphalangeal crease or the distal interphalangeal joint flexion point. That is, hypoplasia of one or more of the distal phalanx of finger.

The definition of the Duplication of the distal phalanx of hand is that This term applies if one or more of the distal phalanges of the hand are either partially duplicated, depending on severity leading to a broad or bifid appearance of the phalanges, or completely duplicated.
The definition of the Tapered distal phalanges of finger is that A reduction in diameter of the distal phalanx of finger towards the distal end.

The definition of the Trichorrhexis nodosa is that Trichorrhexis nodosa is the formation of nodes along the hair shaft through which breakage readily occurs. It is thus a focal defect in the hair fiber that is characterized by thickening or weak points (nodes) that cause the hair to break off easily. The result is defective, abnormally fragile hair.
The definition of the Abnormality of hair pigmentation is that An abnormality of hair pigmentation (color).

The definition of the Abnormality of secondary sexual hair is that Abnormality of the growth of secondary sexual hair, which normally ensues during puberty. In males, secondary sexual hair usually comprises body hair, including underarm, abdominal, chest, and pubic hair. In females, secondary sexual hair usually comprises a lesser degree of body hair, most prominently underarm and pubic hair.
The definition of the Localized hirsutism is that Abnormally increased hair growth with a localized distribution.

The definition of the High anterior hairline is that Distance between the hairline (trichion) and the glabella (the most prominent point on the frontal bone above the root of the nose), in the midline, more than two SD above the mean. Alternatively, an apparently increased distance between the hairline and the glabella. [PMID:19125436]
The definition of the Underdeveloped supraorbital ridges is that Flatness of the supraorbital portion of the frontal bones.
The definition of the Anotia is that Complete absence of any auricular structures.
The definition of the Telangiectasia of the ear is that The presence of telangiectasia of the ear.

The definition of the Abnormality of the crus of the helix is that An abnormality of the crus of the helix, which is the horizontal piece of cartilage located outside the ear canal that divides the upper and lower parts of the ear.

The definition of the Abnormality of the antitragus is that An abnormality of the antitragus, which is a small tubercle opposite to the tragus of the ear. The antitragus and the tragus are separated by the intertragic notch.

The definition of the Horizontal crus of helix is that An abnormal horizontal axis orientation of the crus of the helix. That is, the main axis of the crus of the helix is perpendicular to the medial longitudinal axis of the ear, instead of sloping inferoposteriorly.
The definition of the Underdeveloped crus of the helix is that Developmental hypoplasia of the crus of the helix. That is, flatter and/or shorter crus helix than average.

The definition of the Prominent crus of helix is that The presence of an abnormally prominent of the crus of the helix. That is, development of the crus helix to the same degree as an average antihelix stem or helix.
The definition of the Unilateral deafness is that A unilateral absence of sensory perception of sound.
The definition of the Crumpled ear is that Distortion of the course of the normal folds of the ear and the appearance of supernumerary crura and folds. [PMID:19152421]
The definition of the Cleft helix is that A notched form of the helix of the ear. That is, a defect in the continuity of the helix, which may occur at any point along its length.
The definition of the Conjunctival nodule is that Presence of nodules in the conjunctiva of the eye.
The definition of the Prominent ear helix is that Abnormally prominent ear helix.
The definition of the Thin ear helix is that Decreased thickness of the helix of the ear.
The definition of the aplasia/Hypoplasia of the earlobes is that Absence or underdevelopment of the ear lobes.
The definition of the Attached earlobe is that Attachment of the lobe to the side of the face at the lowest point of the lobe without curving upward. [PMID:19152421]
The definition of the Anterior creases of earlobe is that Sharply demarcated, typically linear and approximately horizontal, indentations in the outer surface of the ear lobe. [PMID:19152421]
The definition of the Uplifted earlobe is that An abnormal orientation of the earlobes such that they point out- and upward. That is, the lateral surface of ear lobe faces superiorly.
The definition of the aplasia of the middle ear ossicles is that Absence of the middle ear ossicles, malleus, incus, and stapes.

The definition of the Abnormality of the temporal bone is that Abnormality of the temporal bone of the skull, which is situated at the sides and base of the skull roughly underlying the region of the face known as the temple.
The definition of the Abnormality of the tragus is that An abnormality of the tragus.
The definition of the aplasia/Hypoplasia of the tragus is that Aplasia or developmental hypoplasia of the tragus.

The definition of the Cyclopia is that Cyclopia is a congenital abnormality in which there is only one eye. That eye is centrally placed in the area normally occupied by the root of the nose. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_ncarter]
The definition of the Corneal asymmetry is that The presence of a size difference between the left and right cornea.
The definition of the Anisocoria is that Anisocoria, or unequal pupil size, may represent a benign physiologic variant or a manifestation of disease.
The definition of the Retinoblastoma is that A tumor of the eye originating from cells of the retina.

The definition of the Nevus of Ota is that A dermal melanocytic hamartoma that presents as bluish hyperpigmentation on the face along the first or second branches of the trigeminal nerve. Nevus of Ota may involve the sclera. [PMID:14673306]
The definition of the Duane anomaly is that A condition associated with a limitation of the horizontal ocular movement with retraction of the globe and narrowing of the palpebral fissure on adduction

The definition of the Persistence of the hyaloid artery is that Persistence of the hyaloid artery, which is the embryonic artery that runs from the optic disk to the posterior lens capsule may persist; the site of attachment may form an opacity. The hyaloid artery is a branch of the ophthalmic artery, and usually regresses completely before birth.
The definition of the aplasia/Hypoplasia involving the nose is that Underdevelopment or absence of the nose or parts thereof.

The definition of the Increased lacrimation is that Abnormally increased lacrimation, that is, excessive tearing (watering eye). [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_ncarter, https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199, https://orcid.org/0000-0003-0986-4123, PMID:28003974]
The definition of the aplasia of the nose is that Complete absence of all nasal structures.
The definition of the Thick nasal alae is that Increase in bulk of the ala nasi. [PMID:19152422]
The definition of the Abnormality of the columella is that A structural abnormality of the columella.
The definition of the Asymmetry of the nares is that Asymmetry or size difference between the left and right nostril.
The definition of the Enlarged naris is that Increased aperture of the nostril. [PMID:19152422]
The definition of the Single naris is that The presence of only a single nostril. [PMID:19152422]
The definition of the Narrow naris is that Slender, slit-like aperture of the nostril.
The definition of the Supernumerary naris is that The presence of more than two nostrils. [PMID:19152422]
The definition of the aplasia/Hypoplasia of the nasal septum is that Absence or underdevelopment of the nasal septum.
The definition of the Narrow nasal septum is that Abnormally narrow nasal septum.
The definition of the Facial hirsutism is that Excess facial hair.
The definition of the Sunken cheeks is that Lack or loss of the soft tissues between the zygomata and mandible. [PMID:19125436]
The definition of the Mandibular aplasia is that Absence of the mandible.
The definition of the Asymmetry of the mandible is that Lack of symmetry between the left and right mandible.
The definition of the Asymmetry of the mouth is that The presence of an asymmetric mouth.

The definition of the Duplication of thumb phalanx is that Complete or partial duplication of the phalanges of the thumb. Depending on the severity, the appearance on x-ray can vary from a notched phalanx (the duplicated bone is almost completely fused with the phalanx), a partially fused appearance of the two bones (bifid), two separate bones appearing side to side, or completely duplicated phalanges (proximal and distal phalanx of the thumb and/or 1st metacarpal). In contrast to the phalanges of the digits 2-5 (proximal, middle and distal), the proximal phalanx of the thumb is embryologically equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits, whereas the first metacarpal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the other digits.

The definition of the Complete duplication of thumb phalanx is that A complete duplication affecting one or more of the phalanges of the thumb. As opposed to a partial duplication were there is still a variable degree of fusion between the duplicated bones, a complete duplication leads to two separate bones appearing side to side (radio-ulnar axis) as seen on x-rays. A duplication leading to an accesory bone appearing in the proximo-distal axis on x-rays, this is actually a different entity called a Pseudoepiphyses (see according terms) sometimes also referred to as Hyperphalangism.

The definition of the Partial duplication of thumb phalanx is that A partial duplication, depending on severity leading to a broad or bifid appearance, affecting one or more of the phalanges of the thumb. As opposed to a complete duplication there is still a variable degree of fusion between the duplicated bones.

The definition of the Duplication of phalanx of 2nd finger is that This term applies if one or more of the phalanges of the 2nd finger are either partially duplicated, depending on severity leading to a broad or bifid appearance of the phalanges, or completely duplicated.
The definition of the Duplication of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger is that Partial or complete duplication of the second proximal phalanx of hand.
The definition of the Duplication of the distal phalanx of the 2nd finger is that Partial or complete duplication of the distal phalanx of index finger.
The definition of the Duplication of the middle phalanx of the 2nd finger is that Partial or complete duplication of the middle phalanx of index finger.
The definition of the Complete duplication of the distal phalanx of the 2nd finger is that Complete duplication of the distal phalanx of index finger.
The definition of the Partial duplication of the distal phalanx of the 2nd finger is that Partial duplication of the distal phalanx of index finger, seen on x-rays as a broad and/or bifid phalanx.
The definition of the Complete duplication of the middle phalanx of the 2nd finger is that Complete duplication of the middle phalanx of index finger.
The definition of the Partial duplication of the middle phalanx of the 2nd finger is that Partial duplication of the middle phalanx of index finger, seen on x-rays as a broad and/or bifid phalanx.
The definition of the Complete duplication of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger is that Complete duplication of the second proximal phalanx of hand.
The definition of the Partial duplication of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd finger is that Partial duplication of the second proximal phalanx of hand, seen on x-rays as a broad and/or bifid phalanx.

The definition of the Partial duplication of the phalanges of the 2nd finger is that A partial duplication, depending on severity leading to a broad or bifid appearance, affecting one or more of the phalanges of the 2nd finger. As opposed to a complete duplication there is still a variable degree of fusion between the duplicated bones.

The definition of the Complete duplication of the phalanges of the 2nd finger is that A complete duplication affecting one or more of the phalanges of the 2nd finger. As opposed to a partial duplication were there is still a variable degree of fusion between the duplicated bones, a complete duplication leads to two separate bones appearing side to side (radio-ulnar axis) as seen on x-rays. A duplication leading to an accesory bone appearing in the proximo-distal axis on x-rays, is a different entity called a Pseudoepiphyses (see according terms) sometimes also referred to as Hyperphalangism.

The definition of the Duplication of phalanx of 3rd finger is that This term applies if one or more of the phalanges of the 3rd finger are either partially duplicated, depending on severity leading to a broad or bifid appearance of the phalanges, or completely duplicated.

The definition of the Complete duplication of the phalanges of the 3rd finger is that A complete duplication affecting one or more of the phalanges of the 3rd finger. As opposed to a partial duplication were there is still a variable degree of fusion between the duplicated bones, a complete duplication leads to two separate bones appearing side to side (radio-ulnar axis) as seen on x-rays. A duplication leading to an accesory bone appearing in the proximo-distal axis on x-rays, this is actually a different entity called a Pseudoepiphyses (see according terms) sometimes also referred to as Hyperphalangism.

The definition of the Partial duplication of the phalanges of the 3rd finger is that A partial duplication, depending on severity leading to a broad or bifid appearance, affecting one or more of the phalanges of the 3rd finger. As opposed to a complete duplication there is still a variable degree of fusion between the duplicated bones.
The definition of the Duplication of the distal phalanx of the 3rd finger is that Partial or complete duplication of the distal phalanx of middle finger.
The definition of the Duplication of the middle phalanx of the 3rd finger is that Partial or complete duplication of the middle phalanx of middle finger.
The definition of the Duplication of the proximal phalanx of the 3rd finger is that Partial or complete duplication of the third proximal phalanx of hand.
The definition of the Complete duplication of the distal phalanx of the 3rd finger is that Complete duplication of the distal phalanx of middle finger
The definition of the Complete duplication of the middle phalanx of the 3rd finger is that Complete duplication of the middle phalanx of middle finger.
The definition of the Complete duplication of the proximal phalanx of the 3rd finger is that Complete duplication of the third proximal phalanx of hand.
The definition of the Partial duplication of the distal phalanx of the 3rd finger is that Partial duplication of the distal phalanx of middle finger, seen on x-rays as a broad and/or bifid phalanx.
The definition of the Partial duplication of the middle phalanx of the 3rd finger is that Partial duplication of the middle phalanx of middle finger, seen on x-rays as a broad and/or bifid phalanx.
The definition of the Partial duplication of the proximal phalanx of the 3rd finger is that Partial duplication of the third proximal phalanx of hand, seen on x-rays as a broad and/or bifid phalanx.

The definition of the Duplication of phalanx of 4th finger is that This term applies if one or more of the phalanges of the 4th finger are either partially duplicated, depending on severity leading to a broad or bifid appearance of the phalanges, or completely duplicated.

The definition of the Complete duplication of the phalanges of the 4th finger is that A complete duplication affecting one or more of the phalanges of the 4th finger. As opposed to a partial duplication were there is still a variable degree of fusion between the duplicated bones, a complete duplication leads to two separate bones appearing side to side (radio-ulnar axis) as seen on x-rays. A duplication leading to an accesory bone appearing in the proximo-distal axis on x-rays, this is actually a different entity called a Pseudoepiphyses (see according terms) sometimes also referred to as Hyperphalangism.

The definition of the Partial duplication of the phalanges of the 4th finger is that A partial duplication, depending on severity leading to a broad or bifid appearance, affecting one or more of the phalanges of the 4th finger. As opposed to a complete duplication there is still a variable degree of fusion between the duplicated bones.
The definition of the Duplication of the distal phalanx of the 4th finger is that Partial or complete duplication of the distal phalanx of ring finger.
The definition of the Duplication of the middle phalanx of the 4th finger is that Partial or complete duplication of the middle phalanx of ring finger.
The definition of the Duplication of the proximal phalanx of the 4th finger is that Partial or complete duplication of the fourth proximal phalanx of hand.
The definition of the Complete duplication of the distal phalanx of the 4th finger is that Complete duplication of the distal phalanx of ring finger.
The definition of the Complete duplication of the middle phalanx of the 4th finger is that Complete duplication of the middle phalanx of ring finger.
The definition of the Complete duplication of the proximal phalanx of the 4th finger is that Complete duplication of the fourth proximal phalanx of hand.
The definition of the Partial duplication of the distal phalanx of the 4th finger is that Partial duplication of the distal phalanx of ring finger, seen on x-rays as a broad and/or bifid phalanx.
The definition of the Partial duplication of the middle phalanx of the 4th finger is that Partial duplication of the middle phalanx of ring finger, seen on x-rays as a broad and/or bifid phalanx.
The definition of the Partial duplication of the proximal phalanx of the 4th finger is that Partial duplication of the fourth proximal phalanx of hand, seen on x-rays as a broad and/or bifid phalanx.

The definition of the Duplication of phalanx of 5th finger is that This term applies if one or more of the phalanges of the 5th finger are either partially duplicated, depending on severity leading to a broad or bifid appearance of the phalanges, or completely duplicated.

The definition of the Complete duplication of the phalanges of the 5th finger is that A complete duplication affecting one or more of the phalanges of the 5th finger. As opposed to a partial duplication were there is still a variable degree of fusion between the duplicated bones, a complete duplication leads to two separate bones appearing side to side (radio-ulnar axis) as seen on x-rays. A duplication leading to an accesory bone appearing in the proximo-distal axis on x-rays, this is actually a different entity called a Pseudoepiphyses (see according terms) sometimes also referred to as Hyperphalangism.

The definition of the Partial duplication of the phalanges of the 5th finger is that A partial duplication, depending on severity leading to a broad or bifid appearance, affecting one or more of the phalanges of the 5th finger. As opposed to a complete duplication there is still a variable degree of fusion between the duplicated bones.
The definition of the Duplication of the distal phalanx of the 5th finger is that Partial or complete duplication of the distal phalanx of little finger.
The definition of the Duplication of the middle phalanx of the 5th finger is that Partial or complete duplication of the fifth middle phalanx of hand.
The definition of the Duplication of the proximal phalanx of the 5th finger is that Partial or complete duplication of the fifth proximal phalanx of hand.
The definition of the Complete duplication of the distal phalanx of the 5th finger is that Complete duplication of the distal phalanx of little finger.
The definition of the Complete duplication of the middle phalanx of the 5th finger is that Complete duplication of the fifth middle phalanx of hand.
The definition of the Complete duplication of the proximal phalanx of the 5th finger is that Complete duplication of the fifth proximal phalanx of hand.
The definition of the Partial duplication of the distal phalanx of the 5th finger is that Partial duplication of the distal phalanx of little finger, seen on x-rays as a broad and/or bifid phalanx.
The definition of the Partial duplication of the middle phalanx of the 5th finger is that Partial duplication of the fifth middle phalanx of hand, seen on x-rays as a broad and/or bifid phalanx.

The definition of the Partial duplication of the proximal phalanx of the 5th finger is that Partial or complete duplication of the fifth proximal phalanx of hand, seen on x-rays as a broad and/or bifid phalanx.

The definition of the Duplication of phalanx of hand is that This term applies if one or more of the phalanges of the hand are either partially duplicated, depending on severity leading to a broad or bifid appearance of the phalanges, or completely duplicated.

The definition of the Complete duplication of phalanx of hand is that A complete duplication affecting one or more of the phalanges of the hand. As opposed to a partial duplication were there is still a variable degree of fusion between the duplicated bones, a complete duplication leads to two separate bones appearing side to side (radio-ulnar axis) as seen on x-rays. A duplication leading to an accesory bone appearing in the proximo-distal axis on x-rays, is a different entity called a Pseudoepiphyses (see according terms) sometimes also referred to as Hyperphalangism.

The definition of the Partial duplication of the phalanx of hand is that A partial duplication, depending on severity leading to a broad or bifid appearance, affecting one or more of the phalanges of the hand. As opposed to a complete duplication there is still a variable degree of fusion between the duplicated bones.

The definition of the Complete duplication of the proximal phalanges of the hand is that A complete duplication affecting one or more of the proximal phalanges of the hand.
