As opposed to a partial duplication were there is still a variable degree of fusion between the duplicated bones, a complete duplication leads to two separate bones appearing side to side (radio-ulnar axis) as seen on x-rays. A duplication leading to an accesory bone appearing in the proximo-distal axis on x-rays, this is actually a different entity called a Pseudoepiphyses (see according terms) sometimes also referred to as Hyperphalangism.
The definition of the Complete duplication of the distal phalanges of the hand is that A complete duplication affecting one or more of the distal phalanges of the hand.

The definition of the Complete duplication of the middle phalanges of the hand is that A complete duplication affecting one or more of the middle phalanges of the hand. As opposed to a partial duplication were there is still a variable degree of fusion between the duplicated bones, a complete duplication leads to two separate bones appearing side to side (radio-ulnar axis) as seen on x-rays. A duplication leading to an accessory bone appearing in the proximo-distal axis on x-rays, this is actually a different entity called a pseudoepiphysis (see corresponding terms) sometimes also referred to as hyperphalangism.

The definition of the Partial duplication of the proximal phalanges of the hand is that A partial duplication, depending on severity leading to a broad or bifid appearance, affecting one or more of the proximal phalanges of the hand. As opposed to a complete duplication there is still a variable degree of fusion between the duplicated bones.

The definition of the Partial duplication of the distal phalanges of the hand is that A partial duplication, depending on severity leading to a broad or bifid appearance, affecting one or more of the distal phalanges of the hand. As opposed to a complete duplication there is still a variable degree of fusion between the duplicated bones.

The definition of the Partial duplication of the middle phalanges of the hand is that A partial duplication, depending on severity leading to a broad or bifid appearance, affecting one or more of the middle phalanges of the hand. As opposed to a complete duplication there is still a variable degree of fusion between the duplicated bones.

The definition of the Duplication of the proximal phalanx of hand is that This term applies if one or more of the proximal phalanges of the hand are either partially duplicated, depending on severity leading to a broad or bifid appearance of the phalanges, or completely duplicated.

The definition of the Duplication of the middle phalanx of hand is that This term applies if one or more of the middle phalanges of the hand are either partially duplicated, depending on severity leading to a broad or bifid appearance of the phalanges, or completely duplicated.
The definition of the Abnormality of the 1st metacarpal is that A structural anomaly of the first metacarpal.
The definition of the Abnormality of the 2nd metacarpal is that Any abnormality of the second metacarpal bone.
The definition of the Abnormality of the 3rd metacarpal is that Any abnormality of the third metacarpal bone.
The definition of the Abnormality of the 4th metacarpal is that Any abnormality of the fourth metacarpal bone.
The definition of the Abnormality of the 5th metacarpal is that Any abnormality of the fifth metacarpal bone.

The definition of the Abnormality of the epiphysis of the 1st metacarpal is that In contrast to the metacarpals 2-5, the first metacarpal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the digits 2-5 (whereas the proximal phalanx of the thumb is equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits). The epiphysis of the first metacarpal is localized at the proximal end (as seen in the proximal phalanges of the other digits), whereas the epiphyses of the other metacarpal bones are located at the distal end. This term applies if the epiphysis of the 1st metacarpal is in any way abnormal, referring to age and gender depending norms, as seen on x-rays.

The definition of the Bracket epiphysis of the 1st metacarpal is that An epiphysis that curves around from its transverse orientation to a longitudinal one from proximal to distal along one side of the phalanx, thus resembling the letter 'C' and forming a bracket around the diaphysis. This results in a so called delta phalanx characterized by a triangular or trapezoidal shaped bone with a C-shaped epiphyseal plate.
The definition of the Cone-shaped epiphysis of the 1st metacarpal is that A cone-shaped appearance of the epiphysis of the 1st metacarpal, producing a 'ball-in-a-socket' appearance.
The definition of the Enlarged epiphysis of the 1st metacarpal is that Abnormally large size of the epiphyses of the 1st metacarpal with respect to age-dependent norms.
The definition of the Fragmentation of the epiphysis of the 1st metacarpal is that Epiphysis of the 1st metacarpal having multiple bony fragments.
The definition of the Irregular epiphysis of the 1st metacarpal is that Uneven radiographic opacity of the epiphysis of the 1st metacarpal.

The definition of the Ivory epiphysis of the 1st metacarpal is that The epiphysis of the 1st metacarpal appears hard and dense like ivory. An ivory epiphysis has a uniformly dense appearance on radiographs.

The definition of the Pseudoepiphysis of the 1st metacarpal is that The epiphysis of the first metacarpal is localized at the proximal end of the metacarpal bone although an accessory epiphysis may be located at the distal end of the metacarpal.
The definition of the Small epiphysis of the 1st metacarpal is that Abnormally small size of the epiphysis of the 1st metacarpal with respect to age-dependent norms.
The definition of the Epiphyseal stippling of the first metacarpal is that The presence of abnormal punctate (speckled, dot-like) calcifications in the epiphyses of the first metacarpal bone.

The definition of the aplasia/Hypoplasia of the 1st metacarpal is that Aplasia or Hypoplasia affecting the 1st metacarpal. In contrast to the metacarpals 2-5, the first metacarpal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the digits 2-5 (whereas the proximal phalanx of the thumb is equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits).

The definition of the Broad 1st metacarpal is that Increased width of the 1st metacarpal. In contrast to the proximal phalanges of the digits 2-5, the proximal phalanx of the thumb is embryologically equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits, whereas the first metacarpal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the other digits.
The definition of the Bullet-shaped 1st metacarpal is that The presence of short and wide 1st metacarpal which tapers distally (bullet shaped")."
The definition of the Curved 1st metacarpal is that A deviation from the normal straight shape of the first metacarpal.
The definition of the Osteolytic defects of the 1st metacarpal is that Dissolution or degeneration of bone tissue of the 1st metacarpal.
The definition of the Patchy sclerosis of the 1st metacarpal is that Uneven increase in bone density within the 1st metacarpal.
The definition of the Triangular shaped 1st metacarpal is that This term applies to a triangular shaped 1st metacarpal.
The definition of the Short 1st metacarpal is that A developmental defect characterized by reduced length of the first metacarpal (long bone) of the hand.
The definition of the aplasia of the 1st metacarpal is that Absent first metacarpal (long bone) of the hand.
The definition of the aplasia/Hypoplasia of the 2nd metacarpal is that Aplasia or Hypoplasia affecting the 2nd metacarpal.
The definition of the Short 2nd metacarpal is that Short second metacarpal bone because of developmental hypoplasia.
The definition of the aplasia/Hypoplasia of the 3rd metacarpal is that Aplasia or Hypoplasia affecting the 3rd metacarpal.
The definition of the Short 3rd metacarpal is that Short third metacarpal bone.
The definition of the aplasia/Hypoplasia of the 4th metacarpal is that Aplasia or Hypoplasia affecting the 4th metacarpal.
The definition of the Short 4th metacarpal is that Short fourth metacarpal bone.
The definition of the aplasia/Hypoplasia of the 5th metacarpal is that Aplasia or Hypoplasia affecting the 5th metacarpal.
The definition of the Short 5th metacarpal is that Short fifth metacarpal bone.
The definition of the aplasia of metacarpal bones is that Developmental defect associated with absence of one or more metacarpal bones.
The definition of the Short metacarpal is that Diminished length of one or more metacarpal bones in relation to the others of the same hand or to the contralateral metacarpal. [PMID:19125433]
The definition of the Deviation/Displacement of the hallux is that Displacement of the big toe from its normal position.
The definition of the Abnormality of the proximal phalanx of the hallux is that An abnormal shape or form of the proximal phalanx of the big toe.
The definition of the Abnormality of the first metatarsal is that An anomaly of the first metatarsal bone.
The definition of the Broad hallux is that Visible increase in width of the hallux without an increase in the dorso-ventral dimension. [PMID:19125433]
The definition of the Broad hallux phalanx is that An increase in width in one or more phalanges of the big toe.

The definition of the Bullet-shaped hallux phalanx is that An abnormal morphology of one or more phalanges of the big toe, with a short and wide phalanx that tapers distally. Bullet-shaped phalanges lack the normal diaphyseal constriction.
The definition of the Curved hallux phalanx is that A deviation from the normal straight form of one or more phalanges of the big toe.

The definition of the Patchy sclerosis of hallux phalanx is that Patchy (irregular) increase in bone density of one or more phalanges of the big toe. This can take on many forms depending on severity and distribution as can be seen on x-rays.
The definition of the Duplication of phalanx of hallux is that Partial or complete duplication of one or more phalanx of big toe.
The definition of the aplasia/hypoplasia of the 1st metatarsal is that Absence or underdevelopment of the first metatarsal bone.
The definition of the Broad first metatarsal is that Increased side-to-side width of the first metatarsal bone.

The definition of the Bullet-shaped 1st metatarsal is that An abnormal morphology of the firstmetatarsal bone, which is short and wide and tapers distally, and lacks the normal diaphyseal constriction.
The definition of the Curved 1st metatarsal is that A deviation from the normal straight shape of a proximal phalanx of the 1st metatarsal bone.
The definition of the Osteolytic defects of the 1st metatarsal is that Dissolution or degeneration of bone tissue of the first metatarsal.
The definition of the Duplication of the 1st metatarsal is that A developmental defect consisting in the duplication of the first metatarsal bone.
The definition of the Broad distal phalanx of the hallux is that An increase in width of the distal phalanx of the big toe.

The definition of the Bullet-shaped distal phalanx of the hallux is that An abnormal morphology of the distal phalanx of the big toe, with a short and wide phalanx that tapers distally. Bullet-shaped phalanges lack the normal diaphyseal constriction.
The definition of the Curved distal phalanx of the hallux is that A deviation from the normal straight form of the distal phalanx of the big toe.
The definition of the Broad proximal phalanx of the hallux is that Increased width of proximal phalanx of big toe.

The definition of the Bullet-shaped proximal phalanx of the hallux is that An abnormal morphology of the proximal phalanx of the big toe, with a short and wide phalanx that tapers distally. Bullet-shaped phalanges lack the normal diaphyseal constriction.
The definition of the Curved proximal phalanx of the hallux is that A deviation from the normal straight form of the proximal phalanx of the big toe.
The definition of the Duplication of the proximal phalanx of the hallux is that Partial or complete duplication of the proximal phalanx of big toe.
The definition of the Complete duplication of the proximal phalanx of the hallux is that Complete duplication of the proximal phalanx of big toe.
The definition of the Partial duplication of the proximal phalanx of the hallux is that Partial duplication of the proximal phalanx of big toe.
The definition of the Complete duplication of the 1st metatarsal is that A developmental defect consisting in the complete duplication of the first metatarsal bone.
The definition of the Partial duplication of the 1st metatarsal is that A developmental defect consisting in the duplication of part of the first metatarsal bone.
The definition of the Complete duplication of hallux phalanx is that Complete duplication of one or more phalanx of big toe.
The definition of the Short distal phalanx of hallux is that Underdevelopment (hypoplasia) of the distal phalanx of big toe.
The definition of the Absent first metatarsal is that A developmental defect characterized by the absence of the first metatarsal bone.
The definition of the Short first metatarsal is that Short first metatarsal bone.
The definition of the Short proximal phalanx of hallux is that Underdevelopment (hypoplasia) of the proximal phalanx of big toe.
The definition of the Short hallux is that Underdevelopment (hypoplasia) of the big toe.
The definition of the Short phalanx of hallux is that Underdevelopment (hypoplasia) of a phalanx of big toe.
The definition of the Mesoaxial foot polydactyly is that The presence of a supernumerary toe (not a hallux) involving the third or fourth metatarsal with associated osseous syndactyly.
The definition of the Absent hallux epiphysis is that Failure to form (agenesis) of one or more epiphyses of the big toe.

The definition of the Abnormality of the epiphysis of the 1st metatarsal is that In contrast to the metatarsals 2-5, the first metatarsal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the digits 2-5, whereas the proximal phalanx of the big toe is equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits. This term applies to abnormalities of the epiphysis of the first metatarsal bone.

The definition of the Abnormality of the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the hallux is that In contrast to the metatarsals 2-5, the first metatarsal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the digits 2-5, whereas the proximal phalanx of the big toe is equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits. This term applies to abnormalities affecting the proximal phalanx of the hallux.
The definition of the Absent epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the hallux is that Failure to form (agenesis) of the epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the hallux.
The definition of the Bracket epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the hallux is that The epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the hallux surrounds the diaphysis, having a bracket-like form.
The definition of the Absent epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the hallux is that Failure to form (agenesis) of the epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the hallux.
The definition of the Bracket epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the hallux is that The epiphysis of the distal phalanx of the hallux surrounds the diaphysis, having a bracket-like form.
The definition of the Absent epiphysis of the 1st metatarsal is that Failure to form (agenesis) of the epiphysis of the 1st metatarsal.
The definition of the Bracket epiphysis of the 1st metatarsal is that The epiphysis of the 1st metatarsal surrounds the diaphysis, having a bracket-like form.
The definition of the Cone-shaped epiphysis of the 1st metatarsal is that A conical (cone-shaped) appearance of the epiphysis of the first metatarsal of the foot.

The definition of the Ivory epiphysis of the 1st metatarsal is that The epiphysis of the 1st metatarsal appears hard and dense like ivory. An ivory epiphysis has a uniformly dense appearance on radiographs.
The definition of the Absent epiphyses of the toes is that Absence of the epiphyses of the phalanges of the toes.
The definition of the Epiphyseal stippling of toe phalanges is that The presence of abnormal punctate (speckled, dot-like) calcifications in the epiphyses of phalanges of the toes.
The definition of the Broad phalanx of the toes is that Increased width of phalanx of one or more toes.

The definition of the Bullet-shaped toe phalanx is that An abnormal morphology of one or more phalanges of the toes, with a short and wide phalanx that tapers distally. Bullet-shaped phalanges lack the normal diaphyseal constriction.
The definition of the Curved toe phalanx is that A deviation from the normal straight form of one or more toe phalanges.
The definition of the Patchy sclerosis of toe phalanx is that Uneven (irregular) increase in bone density of one or more of the phalanges of the foot.
The definition of the Duplication of phalanx of toe is that Partial/complete duplication of one or more phalanx of toe.
The definition of the Abnormality of toe proximal phalanx is that A morphological anomaly of one or more proximal phalanges of one or more toes.
The definition of the aplasia/Hypoplasia of the distal phalanges of the toes is that Absence or underdevelopment of the distal phalanges of the toes.
The definition of the Broad distal phalanx of the toes is that Increased width of the distal phalanx of toe of one or more toes.

The definition of the Bullet-shaped distal toe phalanx is that An abnormal morphology of one or more distal phalanges of the toes, with a short and wide phalanx that tapers distally. Bullet-shaped phalanges lack the normal diaphyseal constriction.
The definition of the Curved distal toe phalanx is that A deviation from the normal straight form of one or more distal toe phalanges.

The definition of the Patchy sclerosis of distal toe phalanx is that Patchy (irregular) increase in bone density of one or more of the distal phalanges of the toes. This can take on many forms depending on severity and distribution as can be seen on x-rays.
The definition of the Duplication of distal phalanx of toe is that A partial or complete duplication of one or more distal phalanx of toe.

The definition of the Bullet-shaped middle toe phalanx is that An abnormal morphology of one or more middle phalanges of the toes, with a short and wide phalanx that tapers distally. Bullet-shaped phalanges lack the normal diaphyseal constriction.
The definition of the Curved middle toe phalanx is that A deviation from the normal straight form of one or more middle toe phalanges.

The definition of the Patchy sclerosis of middle toe phalanx is that Patchy (irregular) increase in bone density of one or more of the middle phalanges of the toes. This can take on many forms depending on severity and distribution as can be seen on x-rays.
The definition of the Duplication of middle phalanx of toe is that Partial or complete duplication of a middle phalanx of toe.
The definition of the aplasia/hypoplasia of proximal toe phalanx is that Absence (agenesis) or underdevelopment of the proximal phalanx of the toe.
The definition of the Broad proximal phalanx of toe is that An increase in width of one ore more proximal toe phalanges.

The definition of the Bullet-shaped proximal toe phalanx is that An abnormal morphology of one or more of the proximal phalanges of the toes, with a short and wide phalanx that tapers distally. Bullet-shaped phalanges lack the normal diaphyseal constriction.
The definition of the Curved proximal toe phalanx is that A deviation from the normal straight shape of a proximal phalanx of one or more toes.
The definition of the Osteolytic defect of the proximal toe phalanx is that Dissolution or degeneration of bone tissue of the proximal toe phalanx.

The definition of the Patchy sclerosis of proximal toe phalanx is that Patchy (irregular) increase in bone density of one or more of the proximal phalanges of the toes. This can take on many forms depending on severity and distribution as can be seen on x-rays.
The definition of the Duplication of proximal phalanx of toe is that Partial/complete duplication of a proximal phalanx of toe.
The definition of the Flexion contracture of the hallux is that One or more bent (flexed) joints of the first (big) toe that cannot be straightened actively or passively.

The definition of the Contracture of the tarsometatarsal joint of the hallux is that Chronic loss of joint motion in the tarsometatarsal joint of the hallux due to structural changes in non-bony tissue. The tarsometatarsal joints of the feet are also called Lisfranc's joints.
The definition of the Contracture of the interphalangeal joint of the hallux is that The interphalangeal joint of the big toe cannot be straightened actively or passively.

The definition of the Contractures of the metatarsophalangeal joint of the hallux is that The joint between the first metatarsal and the proximal phalanx of the first (big) toe cannot be straightened actively or passively.

The definition of the Structural foot deformity is that A foot deformity resulting due to an abnormality affecting the bones of the foot (as well as muscle and soft tissue). In contrast if only the muscle and soft tissue are affected the term positional foot deformity applies.
The definition of the Abnormality of the epiphysis of the 2nd metacarpal is that Any abnormality of the epiphysis of the second metacarpal bone.
The definition of the Abnormality of the epiphysis of the 3rd metacarpal is that Any abnormality of the epiphysis of the third metacarpal bone.

The definition of the Pseudoepiphysis of the 3rd metacarpal is that The normal epiphysis of the third metacarpal is localised at the distal end of the metacarpal bone. This term aplies if an accesory epiphysis, located at the proximal end of the metacarpal bone, is present.
The definition of the Abnormality of the epiphysis of the 4th metacarpal is that Any abnormality of the epiphysis of the 4th metacarpal bone.

The definition of the Pseudoepiphysis of the 4th metacarpal is that The normal epiphysis of the fourth metacarpal is localised at the distal end of the metacarpal bone. This term aplies if an accesory epiphysis, located at the proximal end of the metacarpal bone, is present.
The definition of the Abnormality of the epiphysis of the 5th metacarpal is that Any abnormality of the epiphysis of the fifth metacarpal bone.

The definition of the Pseudoepiphysis of the 5th metacarpal is that The normal epiphysis of the fifth metacarpal is localised at the distal end of the metacarpal bone. This term aplies if an accesory epiphysis, located at the proximal end of the metacarpal bone, is present.
The definition of the Absent epiphyses of the phalanges of the hand is that Absence of one or more epiphyses of the phalanges of the fingers.

The definition of the Bracket epiphyses of the phalanges of the hand is that Bracket epiphysis refers to an abnormality in which the epiphysis surrounds a phalangeal bone, having a bracket-like form and reaching from the proximal side of a phalanx to the distal side.

The definition of the Cone-shaped epiphyses of the phalanges of the hand is that A cone-shaped appearance of the epiphyses of the fingers of the hand, producing a 'ball-in-a-socket' appearance. The related entity 'angel-shaped' epiphysis refers to a pronounced cone-shaped epiphysis in combination with a pseudoepiphysis at the distal end of a phalanx.
The definition of the Enlarged epiphyses of the phalanges of the hand is that Abnormally large size of the epiphyses of the phalanges of the fingers with respect to age-dependent norms.
The definition of the Fragmentation of the epiphyses of the phalanges of the hand is that Fragmented appearance of the epiphyses of the phalanges of the fingers.
The definition of the Irregular epiphyses of the phalanges of the hand is that Irregular radiographic opacity of the epiphyses of the phalanges of the fingers.

The definition of the Ivory epiphyses of the phalanges of the hand is that Sclerosis of the epiphyses of the phalanges of the fingers, leading to an increased degree of radiopacity (white or ivory appearance) in X-rays.

The definition of the Pseudoepiphyses of the phalanges of the hand is that A secondary ossification center in the phalanges of the hand that is distinct from the normal epiphysis that does not contribute to the longitudinal growth of a tubular bone.
The definition of the Small epiphyses of the phalanges of the hand is that Abnormally small size of the epiphyses of the phalanges of the fingers with respect to age-dependent norms.
The definition of the Epiphyseal stippling of finger phalanges is that The presence of abnormal punctate (speckled, dot-like) calcifications in the epiphyses of phalanges of the fingers.
The definition of the Triangular epiphyses of the phalanges of the hand is that A triangular appearance of the epiphyses of the phalanges of the fingers of the hand.
The definition of the aplasia of the middle phalanx of the hand is that Absence of one or more middle phalanx of a finger.
The definition of the Short proximal phalanx of finger is that Congenital hypoplasia of one or more proximal phalanx of finger.
The definition of the Abnormality of the epiphyses of the distal phalanx of finger is that Any anomaly of distal epiphysis of phalanx of finger.

The definition of the Ivory epiphyses of the distal phalanges of the hand is that Distal epiphyses of the hand are hard and dense like ivory. Such an epiphysis has a uniformly dense appearance on radiographs.
The definition of the Fragmentation of the epiphyses of the middle phalanges of the hand is that Fragmented appearance of the epiphyses of the middle phalanges of the hand.

The definition of the Ivory epiphyses of the middle phalanges of the hand is that Epiphyses of the middle phalanges of the hand are hard and dense like ivory. Such an epiphysis has a uniformly dense appearance on radiographs.
The definition of the Stomatitis is that Stomatitis is an inflammation of the mucous membranes of any of the structures in the mouth.
The definition of the Cleft lower lip is that A gap in the lower lip.

The definition of the Thin lower lip vermilion is that Height of the vermilion of the medial part of the lower lip more than 2 SD below the mean. Alternatively, an apparently reduced height of the vermilion of the lower lip in the frontal view (subjective). [PMID:19125428]
The definition of the Intra-oral hyperpigmentation is that Increased pigmentation, either focal or generalized, of the mucosa of the mouth. [PMID:19125428]
The definition of the Oral synechia is that Fibrous band between the mucosal surfaces of the upper and lower alveolar ridges. [PMID:19125428]
The definition of the Abnormality of the salivary glands is that Any abnormality of the salivary glands, the exocrine glands that produce saliva.

The definition of the Abnormality of the submandibular glands is that Any abnormality of the submandibular glands, which are the salivary glands that are located beneath the floor of the mouth, superior to the digastric muscles.

The definition of the Abnormality of the sublingual glands is that Any abnormality of the sublingual glands, which are the salivary glands that are located beneath the floor of the mouth anterior to the submandibular glands.

The definition of the Alveolar ridge cleft is that A gap (cleft) affecting one of the alveolar ridges, which are the protuberances in the mouth that contain the sockets (alveoli) of the teeth. An alveolar cleft can affect all structures of the alveolar ridge, including the gingiva, other mucosa, periosteum, alveolar bone, and teeth. Alveolar cleft occurs in response to divergence from normal development during frontonasal prominence growth, contact, and fusion. The most common alveolar portion of the cleft is located between the lateral incisor and the canine. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:mengelstad, https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199]

The definition of the Short hard palate is that Distance between the labial point of the incisive papilla to the midline junction of the hard and soft palate more than 2 SD below the mean (objective) or apparently decreased length of the hard palate (subjective). [PMID:19125428]
The definition of the Prominent palatine ridges is that Increased size and/or number of soft tissue folds on the palatal side of the maxillary alveolar ridge. [PMID:19125428]
The definition of the Absent uvula is that Lack of the uvula. [PMID:19125428]
The definition of the aplasia/Hypoplasia of the uvula is that Underdevelopment or absence of the uvula.
The definition of the Palate fistula is that A fistula which connects the oral cavity and the pharyngeal area via the aspects of the soft palate.
The definition of the aplasia/Hypoplasia of the tongue is that Absence or underdevelopment of the tongue.
The definition of the Ankyloglossia is that Short or anteriorly attached lingual frenulum, associated with limited mobility of the tongue. [PMID:19125428]
The definition of the Bifid tongue is that Tongue with a median apical indentation or fork. [PMID:19125428]
The definition of the Smooth tongue is that Glossy appearance of the entire tongue surface. [PMID:19125428]
The definition of the Abnormality of dentin is that Any abnormality of dentin.
The definition of the Abnormally low-pitched voice is that An abnormal decrease in the pitch of the voice. []
The definition of the Spinal dysraphism is that A heterogeneous group of congenital spinal anomalies that result from defective closure of the neural tube early in fetal life.
The definition of the Spinal cord tumor is that A neoplasm affecting the spinal cord.

The definition of the Abnormality of the spinal meninges is that Any abnormality of the spinal meninges, the system of membranes (dura mater, the arachnoid mater, and the pia mater) which envelops the spinal cord.
The definition of the Spinal meningeal diverticulum is that An outpouching of the spinal meninges.
The definition of the Absence of the sacrum is that Absence (aplasia) of the sacrum.
The definition of the Short thorax is that Reduced inferior to superior extent of the thorax.
The definition of the Stridor is that Stridor is a high pitched sound resulting from turbulent air flow in the upper airway.
The definition of the Asternia is that The congenital absence of the sternum.
The definition of the Bifid sternum is that The sternal cleft is a rare congenital anomaly resulting from a fusion failure of the sternum.
The definition of the Chylothorax is that Accumulation of excessive amounts of lymphatic fluid (chyle) in the pleural cavity.
The definition of the aplasia/Hypoplasia of the breasts is that Absence or underdevelopment of the breasts.
The definition of the Asymmetry of the breasts is that The presence of asymmetrical breasts.
The definition of the Breast hypertrophy is that The presence of hypertrophy of the breast.
The definition of the Premature thelarche is that Premature development of the breasts.
The definition of the aplasia/Hypoplasia of the diaphragm is that Absence or underdevelopment of the diaphragm.

The definition of the Ebstein's anomaly of the tricuspid valve is that Ebstein's anomaly refers to an abnormally placed and deformed tricuspid valve characterized by apical displacement of the septal and posterior tricuspid valve leaflets, leading to atrialization of the right ventricle with a variable degree of malformation and displacement of the anterior leaflet. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown, https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199]
The definition of the Scapular aplasia is that Absence of the scapulae.
The definition of the aplasia/Hypoplasia of the abdominal wall musculature is that Absence or underdevelopment of the abdominal musculature.
The definition of the Abnormality of the 2nd toe is that An anomaly of the second toe.
The definition of the Abnormality of the 3rd toe is that An anomaly of the third toe.
The definition of the Abnormality of the 4th toe is that An anomaly of the fourth toe.
The definition of the Abnormality of the 5th toe is that An anomaly of the little toe.
The definition of the Abnormality of phalanx of the 2nd toe is that An anomaly of a phalanx of second toe.
The definition of the Flexion contracture of the 2nd toe is that One or more bent (flexed) joints of the second toe that cannot be straightened actively or passively.
The definition of the Flexion contracture of 3rd toe is that One or more bent (flexed) joints of the third toe that cannot be straightened actively or passively.
The definition of the Flexion contracture of the 4th toe is that One or more bent (flexed) joints of the fourth toe that cannot be straightened actively or passively.
The definition of the Flexion contracture of the 5th toe is that One or more bent (flexed) joints of the fifth toe that cannot be straightened actively or passively.

The definition of the Bullet-shaped 2nd toe phalanx is that An abnormal morphology of one or more phalanges of the second toe, with a short and wide phalanx that tapers distally. Bullet-shaped phalanges lack the normal diaphyseal constriction.
The definition of the Curved 2nd toe phalanx is that A deviation from the normal straight form of one or more phalanges of the second toe.

The definition of the Patchy sclerosis of 2nd toe phalanx is that Patchy (irregular) increase in bone density of one or more of the phalanges of the second toe. This can take on many forms depending on severity and distribution as can be seen on x-rays.
The definition of the Symphalangism affecting the phalanges of the 2nd toe is that Fusion of the interphalangeal joints of the 2nd toe.
The definition of the Duplication of the phalanges of the 2nd toe is that Partial or complete duplication of a phalanx of second toe.

The definition of the Bullet-shaped 3rd toe phalanx is that An abnormal morphology of one or more phalanges of the third toe, with a short and wide phalanx that tapers distally. Bullet-shaped phalanges lack the normal diaphyseal constriction.
The definition of the Curved 3rd toe phalanx is that A deviation from the normal straight form of one or more phalanges of the third toe.

The definition of the Patchy sclerosis of 3rd toe phalanx is that Patchy (irregular) increase in bone density of one or more of the phalanges of the third toe. This can take on many forms depending on severity and distribution as can be seen on x-rays.
The definition of the Duplication of phalanx of the 3rd toe is that Partial or complete duplication of phalanx of third toe.
The definition of the Abnormality of the proximal phalanx of the 3rd toe is that An anomaly of the proximal phalanx of third toe.

The definition of the Bullet-shaped 4th toe phalanx is that An abnormal morphology of one or more phalanges of the fourth toe, with a short and wide phalanx that tapers distally. Bullet-shaped phalanges lack the normal diaphyseal constriction.
The definition of the Curved 4th toe phalanx is that A deviation from the normal straight form of one or more phalanges of the fourth toe.

The definition of the Patchy sclerosis of 4th toe phalanx is that Patchy (irregular) increase in bone density of one or more of the phalanges of the fourth toe. This can take on many forms depending on severity and distribution as can be seen on x-rays.
The definition of the Duplication of phalanx of the 4th toe is that Partial or complete duplication of phalanx of fourth toe.

The definition of the Bullet-shaped 5th toe phalanx is that An abnormal morphology of one or more phalanges of the fifth toe, with a short and wide phalanx that tapers distally. Bullet-shaped phalanges lack the normal diaphyseal constriction.
The definition of the Curved 5th toe phalanx is that A deviation from the normal straight form of one or more phalanges of the fifth toe.

The definition of the Patchy sclerosis of 5th toe phalanx is that Patchy (irregular) increase in bone density of one or more of the phalanges of the fifth toe. This can take on many forms depending on severity and distribution as can be seen on x-rays.
The definition of the Duplication of the phalanges of the 5th toe is that Partial or complete duplication of one or more phalanx of little toe.
The definition of the aplasia/hypoplasia of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd toe is that Absence (agenesis) or underdevelopment of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd toe.

The definition of the Bullet-shaped proximal phalanx of the 2nd toe is that An abnormal morphology of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd toe, with a short and wide phalanx that tapers distally. Bullet-shaped phalanges lack the normal diaphyseal constriction.
The definition of the Curved proximal phalanx of the 2nd toe is that A deviation from the normal straight form of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd toe.
The definition of the Duplication of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd toe is that Partial or complete duplication of proximal phalanx of second toe.

The definition of the Bullet-shaped middle phalanx of the 2nd toe is that An abnormal morphology of the middle phalanx of the second toe, with a short and wide phalanx that tapers distally. Bullet-shaped phalanges lack the normal diaphyseal constriction.
The definition of the Curved middle phalanx of the 2nd toe is that A deviation from the normal straight form of the middle phalanx of the 2nd toe.
The definition of the Duplication of the middle phalanx of the 2nd toe is that Partial or complete duplication of middle phalanx of second toe.

The definition of the Bullet-shaped distal phalanx of the 2nd toe is that An abnormal morphology of the distal phalanx of the second toe, with a short and wide phalanx that tapers distally. Bullet-shaped phalanges lack the normal diaphyseal constriction.
The definition of the Curved distal phalanx of the 2nd toe is that A deviation from the normal straight form of the distal phalanx of the 2nd toe.
The definition of the Duplication of the distal phalanx of the 2nd toe is that Partial or complete duplication of the distal phalanx of second toe.
The definition of the Complete duplication of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd toe is that Complete duplication of proximal phalanx of second toe.
The definition of the Partial duplication of the proximal phalanx of the 2nd toe is that Partial duplication of proximal phalanx of second toe.
The definition of the Complete duplication of the distal phalanx of the 2nd toe is that Complete duplication of the distal phalanx of second toe.
The definition of the Partial duplication of the distal phalanx of the 2nd toe is that Partial duplication of the distal phalanx of second toe.
The definition of the Complete duplication of the middle phalanx of the 2nd toe is that Complete duplication of middle phalanx of second toe.
The definition of the Partial duplication of the middle phalanx of the 2nd toe is that Partial duplication of middle phalanx of second toe.
The definition of the Partial duplication of phalanx of the 2nd toe is that Partial duplication of a phalanx of second toe.
The definition of the Complete duplication of the phalanges of the 2nd toe is that Complete duplication of a phalanx of second toe.
The definition of the Short phalanx of the 2nd toe is that Reduced length of one or more phalanx of second toe as a result of developmental hypoplasia.
The definition of the Absent distal phalanx of the 2nd toe is that Absence of distal phalanx of the second toe as a result of developmental aplasia.
The definition of the Short distal phalanx of the 2nd toe is that Reduced length of the distal phalanx of the second toe as a result of developmental hypoplasia.
The definition of the Short middle phalanx of the 2nd toe is that Reduced length of the middle phalanx of second toe as a result of developmental hypoplasia.
The definition of the Short proximal phalanx of the 2nd toe is that Reduced length of the proximal phalanx of second toe as a result of developmental hypoplasia.
The definition of the Abnormality of the ventricular septum is that A structural abnormality of the interventricular septum.

The definition of the Ectopic accesory toe-like appendage is that In contrast to forms of polydactyly where the supernumerary digit (this can either be a rudimentary or a completely 'normal' digit) is either located postaxial (on the fibular side of the foot, next top the little toe), preaxial (on the tibial side of the foot, next to the big toe) or mesoaxial (somewhere central, between big and little toe), a supernumerary digit may also be placed ectopically, meaning anywhere else except post-,meso- or preaxial. In the literature this is sometimes referred to as Disorganisation-like Syndrome (OMIM223200).

The definition of the Ectopic accesory finger-like appendage is that In contrast to forms of polydactyly where the supernumerary digit (this can either be a rudimentary or a completely 'normal' digit) is either located postaxial (on the ulnar side of the hand, next to the little finger), preaxial (on the radial side of the hand, next to the thumb) or mesoaxial (somewhere central, between thumb and little finger), a supernumerary digit may also be placed ectopically, meaning anywhere else except post-,meso- or preaxial. In the literature this is sometimes referred to as Disorganisation-like Syndrome (OMIM223200).
The definition of the Polydactyly is that A congenital anomaly characterized by the presence of supernumerary fingers or toes.

The definition of the Bifid femur is that A bifid or bifurcated appearance of the femur as seen on x-rays, possible appearing as a more or less severe bowing of the upper leg. Might be associated with hip dysplasia on the affected side.
The definition of the Pulmonary insufficiency is that The retrograde (backwards) flow of blood through the pulmonary valve into the right ventricle during diastole.

The definition of the Primum atrial septal defect is that An ostium primum atrial septal defect is located in the most anterior and inferior aspect of the atrial septum. The ostium primum refers to an anterior and inferior opening (ostium) within the septum primum, which divides the rudimentary atrium during fetal development. The ostium primum is normally sealed by fusion of the superior and inferior endocardial cushions around 5 weeks' gestation. Ostium primum defects result from a failure of the fusion of the embryologic endocardial cushion and septum primum. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown, https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199]
The definition of the Tricuspid stenosis is that A narrowing of the orifice of the tricuspid valve of the heart.
The definition of the Anal fistula is that An abnormal connection between the epithelialised surface of the anal canal and the perianal skin.

The definition of the Colonic atresia is that A developmental defect resulting in complete obliteration of the lumen of the colon. That is, there is an abnormal closure, or atresia of the tubular structure of the colon.
The definition of the Esophageal stenosis is that An abnormal narrowing of the lumen of the esophagus.
The definition of the aplasia/Hypoplasia of the spleen is that Absence or underdevelopment of the spleen.
The definition of the Ectopia of the spleen is that An abnormal (non-anatomic) location of the spleen.
The definition of the Pelvic asymmetry is that Pelvic asymmetry refers to asymmetric positioning of landmarks on the two sides of the pelvis and may have a structural or functional etiology.
The definition of the Acetabular spurs is that The presence of osteophytes (bone spurs), i.e., of bony projections originating from the acetabulum.

The definition of the Abnormality of the greater sacrosciatic notch is that An abnormality of the sacrosciatic notch, i.e., the deep indentation in the posterior border of the hip bone at the point of union of the ilium and ischium.

The definition of the Female pseudohermaphroditism is that Hermaphroditism refers to a discrepancy between the morphology of the gonads and that of the external genitalia. In female pseudohermaphroditism, the genotype is female (XX) and the gonads are ovaries, but the external genitalia are virilized.

The definition of the True hermaphroditism is that The presence of both ovarian and testicular tissues either in the same or in opposite gonads. Affected persons have ambiguous genitalia and may have 46,XX or 46,XY karyotypes or 46,XX/XY mosaicism.
The definition of the Abnormality of the female genitalia is that Abnormality of the female genital system.
The definition of the Abnormality of the male genitalia is that Abnormality of the male genital system.
The definition of the Aplasia/hypoplasia of the ovary is that Aplasia or developmental hypoplasia of the ovary.
The definition of the Aplasia of the ovary is that Aplasia, that is failure to develop, of the ovary.

The definition of the Streak ovary is that A developmental disorder characterized by the progressive loss of primordial germ cells in the developing ovaries of an embryo, leading to hypoplastic ovaries composed of wavy connective tissue with occasional clumps of granulosa cells, and frequently mesonephric or hilar cells.
The definition of the Precocious puberty in females is that The onset of puberty before the age of 8 years in girls.
The definition of the aplasia/Hypoplasia of the testes is that Absence or underdevelopment of the testes.
The definition of the aplasia of the testes is that Testis not palpable in the scrotum or inguinal canal.
The definition of the Supernumerary testes is that The presence of more than two testes.

The definition of the Oligosacchariduria is that Increased urinary excretion of oligosaccharides (low molecular weight carbohydrate chains composed of at least three monosaccharide subunits), derived from a partial degradation of glycoproteins.

The definition of the Abnormality of the heme biosynthetic pathway is that An abnormality in the synthesis or catabolism of heme. Heme is composed of ferrous iron and protoporphyrin IX and is an essential molecule as the prosthetic group of hemeproteins such as hemoglobin, myoglobin, mitochondrial and microsomal cytochromes.
The definition of the Porphyrinuria is that Abnormally increased excretion of porphyrins in the urine.
The definition of the Bladder stones is that Buildups of minerals that form in the urinary bladder.

The definition of the Cloacal exstrophy is that Cloacal exstrophy is a severe anterior abdominal wall defect in which the two hemibladders are visible and are separated by a midline intestinal plate, an omphalocele, and an imperforate anus.
The definition of the aplasia/Hypoplasia of the bladder is that Absence or underdevelopment of the urinary bladder.
The definition of the aplasia of the bladder is that Aplasia (absence) of the urinary bladder.
The definition of the Abnormality of the urachus is that Abnormality of the urachus.
The definition of the Patent urachus is that Persistence of the urachal canal resulting in a canal between the bladder and the umbilicus.
The definition of the Urethral fistula is that The presence of an abnormal connection between the urethra and another organ or the skin.
The definition of the Urethral valve is that The presence of an abnormal membrane obstructing the urethra.
The definition of the Acromelia of the upper limbs is that Shortening of the arms predominantly affecting terminal parts of the arm in relation to the upper and middle limb segments.
The definition of the Amniotic constriction rings of arms is that Amniotic constriction rings affecting the arms.
The definition of the Hypertrophy of the upper limb is that Abnormal increase in size of the upper limbs (due to an increase of the size of cells).
The definition of the Hyperextensibility at elbow is that The ability of the elbow joint to move beyond its normal range of motion.

The definition of the Abnormality of the hypothenar eminence is that An abnormality of the hypothenar eminence, i.e., of the muscles on the ulnar side of the palm of the hand (i.e., on the side of the little finger).
The definition of the Small hypothenar eminence is that Reduced muscle mass on the ulnar side of the palm, that is, reduction in size of the hypothenar eminence.
The definition of the aplasia/Hypoplasia of the palmar creases is that Absence or underdevelopment of the palmar creases.
The definition of the Absent palmar crease is that The absence of the major creases of the palm (distal transverse crease, proximal transverse crease, or thenar crease).
The definition of the Abnormality of the palmar creases is that An abnormality of the creases of the skin of palm of hand.
The definition of the Digital constriction ring is that A narrow segment of significantly reduced circumference of a digit. [PMID:19125433]

The definition of the Osseous finger syndactyly is that Webbing or fusion of the fingers, involving soft parts and including fusion of individual finger bones. Bony fusions are referred to as bony" Syndactyly if the fusion occurs in a radio-ulnar axis. Fusions of bones of the fingers in a proximo-distal axis are referred to as "Symphalangism"."
The definition of the Long metacarpals is that An abnormally increased length of the metacarpal bones.
The definition of the Acromelia of the lower limbs is that Shortening of the legs predominantly affecting terminal parts of the leg in relation to the upper and middle arm segments.
The definition of the Amniotic constriction rings of legs is that Amniotic constriction rings affecting the legs.
The definition of the Hypertrophy of the lower limb is that Abnormal increase in size of the lower limbs (due to an increase of the size of cells).
The definition of the Sirenomelia is that A developmental defect in which the legs are fused together.
The definition of the Bipartite patella is that A developmental defect that occurs if the two halves of the patella fail to fuse in early childhood.

The definition of the Patellar subluxation is that The kneecap normally is located within the groove termed trochlea on the distal femur and can slide up and down in it. Patellar subluxation refers to an unstable kneecap that does not slide centrally within its groove, i.e., a partial dislocation of the patella.

The definition of the Hyperextensibility of the knee is that The ability of the knee joint to extend beyond its normal range of motion (the lower leg is moved beyond a straight position with respect to the thigh).
The definition of the Limitation of knee mobility is that An abnormal limitation of knee joint mobility.
The definition of the Fibular bowing is that A bending or abnormal curvature of the fibula.

The definition of the Fibular duplication is that Duplication of the fibula. This may occur as a part of diplopodia (accessory tarsal or metatarsal bone). Diplopodia with double fibula is an extremely rare condition.
The definition of the Increased length of the tibia is that An abnormal increase in the length of the tibia.
The definition of the Limitation of movement at ankles is that An abnormal limitation of the mobility of the ankle joint.
The definition of the Abnormal plantar dermatoglyphics is that An abnormality of dermatoglyphs on the toes and soles, i.e., an abnormality of the patterns of ridges of the skin of sole of foot.
The definition of the Foot asymmetry is that A difference in size or shape between the left and right foot.
The definition of the Metatarsus valgus is that A condition in which the anterior part of the foot rotates outward away from the midline of the body and the heel remains straight.
The definition of the aplasia of the tarsal bones is that Absence of the tarsal bones.
The definition of the Hypermobility of toe joints is that An ability of the toe joints to move beyond their normal range of motion.
The definition of the Long toe is that Toes that appear disproportionately long compared to the foot.
The definition of the Adrenal calcification is that Calcification within the adrenal glands.
The definition of the Pituitary calcification is that Deposition of calcium salts in the pituitary gland.

The definition of the Hyperpituitarism is that Hypersecretion of one or more pituitary hormones. This can occur in conditions in which deficiency in the target organ leads to decreased hormonal feedback, or as a primary condition most usually in connection with a pituitary adenoma.
The definition of the Aplasia/hypoplasia of the thymus is that Absence or underdevelopment of the thymus.
The definition of the Thymus hyperplasia is that Enlargement of the thymus.
The definition of the Thyroglossal cyst is that An abnormality of the thyroid gland owing to the presence of a fibrous cyst resulting from the persistence of the thyroglossal duct.
The definition of the Increased fetal movement is that An abnormal increase in quantity or strength of fetal movements.
The definition of the Gait apraxia is that Gait apraxia affecting the ability to make walking movements with the legs.

The definition of the Dyslexia is that A learning disorder characterized primarily by difficulties in learning to read and spell. Dyslectic children also exhibit a tendency to read words from right to left and to confuse letters such as b and d whose orientation is important for their identification. Children with dyslexia appear to be impaired in phonemic skills (the ability to associate visual symbols with the sounds they represent).
The definition of the Alexia is that An acquired type of sensory aphasia where damage to the brain leads to the loss of the ability to read.
The definition of the Agnosia is that Alteration or impairment in the processing or interpretation of sensory information can lead to abnormal perceptions or experiences. []
The definition of the Finger agnosia is that The examiner identified the inability to name, move, or touch specific fingers. []

The definition of the Dysgraphia is that A writing disability in the absence of motor or sensory deficits of the upper extremities, resulting in an impairment in the ability to write regardless of the ability to read and not due to intellectual impairment.

The definition of the Astereognosia is that Tactile agnosia refers to the inability to recognize objects by touch, while the inability to discriminate shape and size by touch is also a related condition. []
The definition of the Prosopagnosia is that Inability to recognize faces of familiar persons. []
The definition of the Echolalia is that The repetition of words or phrases that are odd or used in a non-social manner. These can be words or phrases that the person has heard or invented. []

The definition of the Palatal myoclonus is that Palatal tremor (PT) is an involuntary, rhythmic and oscillatory movement of the soft palate. PT is a rare type of tremor involving the soft palate. It can be unilateral or bilateral.

The definition of the Spinal myoclonus is that Spinal myoclonus is generally due to a tumor, infection, injury, or degenerative process of the spinal cord, and is characterized by involuntary rhythmic muscle contractions, usually at a rate of more than one per second. Myoclonus occurs synchronously in several muscles and can be increased in severity and frequency by fatigue or stress, but is usually unaffected by sensory stimuli. Spinal myoclonus ceases during sleep or anesthesia.

The definition of the Transient global amnesia is that A paroxysmal, transient loss of memory function with preservation of immediate recall and remote memory but with a severe impairment of memory for recent events and ability to retain new information.

The definition of the Sleep apnea is that An intermittent cessation of airflow at the mouth and nose during sleep is known as sleep apnea. Apneas that last at least 10 seconds are considered significant, but individuals with sleep apnea may experience apneas lasting from 20 seconds up to 2 or 3 minutes. Patients may have up to 15 events per hour of sleep. []
The definition of the Central sleep apnea is that Sleep apnea results from a temporary loss of the central drive to the muscles responsible for breathing. [PMID:35551411,PMID:36031317]
The definition of the Wide cranial sutures is that An abnormally increased width of the cranial sutures for age-related norms (generally resulting from delayed closure).
The definition of the Small sella turcica is that An abnormally small sella turcica.
The definition of the Thin calvarium is that The presence of an abnormally thin calvarium.
The definition of the Advanced pneumatization of cranial sinuses is that A degree of pneumatization that is increased compared to age-related norms.

The definition of the Cutis gyrata of scalp is that The presence of convoluted folds and furrows formed from thickened skin of the scalp, resembling cerebriform pattern. The scalp has convoluted and elevated folds, 1 to 2 cm in thickness. The convolutions generally cannot be flattened by traction.
The definition of the Vestibular nystagmus is that Nystagmus due to disturbance of the vestibular system; eye movements are rhythmic, with slow and fast components.
The definition of the Opsoclonus is that Bursts of large-amplitude multidirectional saccades without intersaccadic interval

The definition of the Vertical nystagmus is that Vertical nystagmus may present with either up-beating or down-beating eye movements or both. When present in the straight-ahead position of gaze it is referred to as upbeat nystagmus or downbeat nystagmus.

The definition of the Downbeat nystagmus is that Downbeat nystagmus is a type of fixation nystagmus with the fast phase beating in a downward direction. It generally increases when looking to the side and down and when lying prone.

The definition of the Muscle fibrillation is that Fine, rapid twitching of individual muscle fibers with little or no movement of the muscle as a whole. If a motor neuron or its axon is destroyed, the muscle fibers it innervates undergo denervation atrophy. This leads to hypersensitivity of individual muscle fibers to acetyl choline so that they may contract spontaneously. Isolated activity of individual muscle fibers is generally so fine it cannot be seen through the intact skin, although it can be recorded as a short-duration spike in the EMG.

The definition of the Muscle flaccidity is that A type of paralysis in which a muscle becomes soft and yields to passive stretching, which results from loss of all or practically all peripheral motor nerves that innervated the muscle. Muscle tone is reduced and the affected muscles undergo extreme atrophy within months of the loss of innervation.

The definition of the Percussion myotonia is that A localized myotonic contraction in a muscle in reaction to percussion (tapping with the examiner's finger, a rubber percussion hammer, or a similar object).

The definition of the Weakness due to upper motor neuron dysfunction is that Paralysis of voluntary muscles means loss of contraction due to interruption of one or more motor pathways from the brain to the muscle fibers. Although the word paralysis is often used interchangeably to mean either complete or partial loss of muscle strength, it is preferable to use paralysis or plegia for complete or severe loss of muscle strength, and paresis for partial or slight loss. Paralysis due to lesions of the principle motor tracts is related to a lesion in the corticospinal, corticobulbar or brainstem descending (subcorticospinal) neurons.
The definition of the Paraplegia is that Severe or complete weakness of both lower extremities with sparing of the upper extremities.

The definition of the Paraplegia/paraparesis is that Weakness of both lower extremities with sparing of the upper extremities. Paraplegia refers to a severe or complete loss of strength, whereas paraparesis refers to a relatively mild loss of strength.

The definition of the Oculogyric crisis is that An acute dystonic reaction with blepharospasm, periorbital twitches, and protracted fixed staring episodes. There may be a maximal upward deviation of the eyes in the sustained fashion. Oculogyric crisis can be triggered by a number of factors including neuroleptic medications.

The definition of the Cutaneous finger syndactyly is that A soft tissue continuity in the A/P axis between two fingers that extends distally to at least the level of the proximal interphalangeal joints, or a soft tissue continuity in the A/P axis between two fingers that lies significantly distal to the flexion crease that overlies the metacarpophalangeal joint of the adjacent fingers. [PMID:19125433]
The definition of the Overlapping fingers is that A finger resting on the dorsal surface of an adjacent digit when the hand is at rest.

The definition of the Abnormality of the clivus is that An abnormality of the clivus, which is the inclined bony region of the posterior cranial fossa located between the sella turcica and the foramen magnum.
The definition of the Vertical clivus is that An abnormal vertical orientation of the clivus (which normally forms a kind of slope from the sella turcica down to the region of the foramen magnum).
The definition of the Undulate clavicles is that An abnormally wavy surface or edge of the clavicles.
The definition of the Undulate ribs is that An abnormally wavy surface or edge of the ribs.

The definition of the Bifid epiglottis is that A midline anterior-posterior cleft of the epiglottis that involves at least two-thirds of the epiglottic leaf. It is a useful feature for clinical diagnosis because it appears to be very rare in syndromes other than Pallister-Hall-Syndrome and is also rare as an isolated malformation.
The definition of the aplasia/Hypoplasia of the Epiglottis is that This term applies if the Epiglottis is absent or hypoplastic.

The definition of the Hamartoma is that A disordered proliferation of mature tissues that is native to the site of origin, e.g., exostoses, nevi and soft tissue hamartomas. Although most hamartomas are benign, some histologic subtypes, e.g., neuromuscular hamartoma, may proliferate aggressively such as mesenchymal cystic hamartoma, Sclerosing epithelial hamartoma, Sclerosing metanephric hamartoma.

The definition of the Y-shaped metatarsals is that Y-shaped metatarsals are the result of a partial fusion of two metatarsal bones, with the two arms of the Y pointing in the distal direction. Y-shaped metatarsals may be seen in combination with polydactyly.
The definition of the Hamartoma of the eye is that A hamartoma (disordered proliferation of mature tissues) which can originate from any tissue of the eye.
The definition of the Elevated 7-dehydrocholesterol is that Concentration of 7-dehydrocholesterol in the blood circulation above the upper limit of normal.
The definition of the Low maternal serum alpha-fetoprotein is that An abnormally low concentration of serum alpha-fetoprotein as compared to normal values for gestational-age.
The definition of the Elevated levels of phytanic acid is that An abnormal elevation of phytanic acid.
The definition of the Abnormality of the epiphysis of the femoral head is that Any abnormality of the proximal epiphysis of the femur.
The definition of the Dysplasia of the femoral head is that The presence of developmental dysplasia of the femoral head.
The definition of the Intracranial cystic lesion is that A cystic lesion originating within the brain.

The definition of the Cone-shaped epiphysis is that Cone-shaped epiphyses (also known as coned epiphyses) are epiphyses that invaginate into cupped metaphyses. That is, the epiphysis has a cone-shaped distal extension resulting from increased growth of the central portion of the epiphysis relative to its periphery.
The definition of the Enlarged epiphyses is that Increased size of epiphyses.
The definition of the Irregular epiphyses is that An alteration of the normally smooth contour of the epiphysis leading to an irregular appearance.
The definition of the Ivory epiphyses is that Sclerosis of the epiphyses, leading to an increased degree of radiopacity (white or ivory appearance) in X-rays.
The definition of the Small epiphyses is that Reduction in the size or volume of epiphyses.

The definition of the Premature epimetaphyseal fusion is that Stop of growth at the epiphyseal plate the hyaline cartilage plate in the metaphysis at each end of a long bone, at an earlier than normal age, resulting in growth arrest and shortening of the involved bone.
The definition of the Abnormality of the distal femoral epiphysis is that Any abnormality of the distal epiphysis of the femur.
The definition of the Abnormality of the proximal tibial epiphysis is that Any abnormality of the proximal epiphysis of the tibia.
The definition of the Abnormality of the proximal fibular epiphysis is that Any abnormality of the proximal epiphysis of the fibula.
The definition of the Abnormality of the distal fibular epiphysis is that Any abnormality of the distal epiphysis of the fibula.
The definition of the Abnormality of the proximal radial epiphysis is that Any abnormality of the proximal epiphysis of the radius.
The definition of the Abnormality of the distal radial epiphysis is that Any abnormality of the distal epiphysis of the radius.
The definition of the Abnormality of the proximal humeral epiphysis is that Any abnormality of the proximal epiphysis of the humerus.
The definition of the Abnormality of the distal humeral epiphysis is that Any abnormality of the distal epiphysis of the humerus.
The definition of the Abnormality of the distal ulnar epiphysis is that Any abnormality of the distal epiphysis of the ulna.
The definition of the Abnormality of the proximal ulnar epiphysis is that Any abnormality of the proximal epiphysis of the ulna.
The definition of the Type 2 muscle fiber predominance is that An abnormal predominance of type II muscle fibers (in general, this feature can only be observed on muscle biopsy).

The definition of the Keratocystic odontogenic tumor is that A benign uni- or multicystic, intraosseous tumor of odontogenic origin, with a characteristic lining of parakeratinized stratified squamous epithelium and potential for aggressive, infiltrative behaviour.

The definition of the Chalazion is that A chronic epithelioid cell granulomatous inflammation of the meibomian gland caused by inflammation of a blocked meibomian gland. A chalazion or meibomian cyst appears as a painless tuberous swelling in the upper lid without loss of eyelashes.

The definition of the Hordeolum is that An acute purulent infection of the sebaceous glands of Zeis at the base of the eyelashes, of the apocrine sweat glands of Moll or the meibomian sebacious glands often caused by staphylococcus infections. Hordeola can either occur as Hordeola externa affecting the sebaceous glands of Zeis or the apocrine sweat glands of Moll or as Hordeola interna affecting the meibomian sebacious glands. In contrast to chalazia, hordeola are extremely painful and can cause extreme local swelling.

The definition of the Hordeolum externum is that Hordeola externa are acute purulent infections affecting the sebaceous glands of Zeis or the apocrine sweat glands of Moll, often caused by staphylococcus infections. In contrast to chalazia, hordeola are extremely painfull and can cause extreme local swelling.

The definition of the Hordeolum internum is that Hordeola interna are acute purulent infections affecting the meibomian sebacious glands, often caused by staphylococcus infections. In contrast to chalazia (chronic epithelioid cell granulomatous inflammation of the meibomian gland caused by inflammation of a blocked meibomian gland), hordeola are extremely painfull and can cause extreme local swelling.

The definition of the Skin tags is that Cutaneous skin tags also known as acrochorda or fibroepithelial polyps are small benign tumors that may either form secondarily over time primarily in areas where the skin forms creases, such as the neck, armpit or groin or may also be present at birth, in which case they usually occur in the periauricular region.
The definition of the Plantar pits is that The presence of multiple pits (small, pinpoint-large indentations on the surface of the skin) located on the skin of sole of foot.

The definition of the Fibroma is that Benign tumors that are composed of fibrous or connective tissue. They can grow in all organs, arising from mesenchyme tissue. The term fibroblastic" or "fibromatous" is used to describe tumors of the fibrous connective tissue. When the term fibroma is used without modifier, it is usually considered benign, with the term fibrosarcoma reserved for malignant tumors."
The definition of the Angiofibromas is that Angiofibroma consist of many often dilated vessels.

The definition of the Lung fibroma is that The presence of a lung fibroma, a benign neoplasm that can present as a mass causing airway obstruction, cough, and hemoptysis, or present without symptoms as a solitary pulmonary nodule.
The definition of the Cardiac fibroma is that A fibroma of the heart.
The definition of the Ovarian fibroma is that The presence of a fibroma of the ovary.
The definition of the Fibroma of the breast is that A benign biphasic tumor of the breast with epithelial and stromal components.
The definition of the Malar prominence is that Prominence of the malar process of the maxilla and infraorbital area appreciated in profile and from in front of the face.

The definition of the Cutaneous syndactyly of toes is that A soft tissue continuity in the anteroposterior axis between adjacent foot digits that involves at least half of the proximodistal length of one of the two involved digits; or, a soft tissue continuity in the A/P axis between two digits of the foot that does not meet the prior objective criteria.
The definition of the Neoplasm of the skeletal system is that A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the skeleton.
The definition of the aplastic/hypoplastic toenail is that Absence or underdevelopment of the toenail.
The definition of the Anterior pituitary dysgenesis is that Absence or underdevelopment of the anterior pituitary gland, also known as the adenohypophysis.
The definition of the Anterior pituitary agenesis is that Absence of the anterior pituitary gland resulting from a developmental defect.
The definition of the Anterior pituitary hypoplasia is that Underdevelopment of the anterior pituitary gland.

The definition of the Facial palsy is that Facial nerve palsy is a dysfunction of cranial nerve VII (the facial nerve) that results in inability to control facial muscles on the affected side with weakness of the muscles of facial expression and eye closure. This can either be present in unilateral or bilateral form.
The definition of the Abnormality of the cortex of the humerus is that Any abnormality affecting the cortex of the humerus.
The definition of the Abnormality of metatarsal epiphysis is that Any abnormality of a metatarsal bone epiphysis.
The definition of the Abnormality of the epiphyses of the feet is that Any abnormality of the epiphyses of the feet.
The definition of the Total anosmia is that Inability to detect any qualitative olfactory sensation.
The definition of the Partial anosmia is that Inability to perceive certain odorants (implies that the sense of smell is maintained for other classes of odorants).
The definition of the Total hyposmia is that Reduced ability to detect any qualitative olfactory sensation.
The definition of the Partial hyposmia is that Reduced ability to perceive certain odorants (implies that the sense of smell is maintained for other classes of odorants).
The definition of the Schizencephaly is that The presence of a cleft in the cerebral cortex unilaterally or bilaterally, usually located in the frontal area.
The definition of the Conjunctival amyloidosis is that A form of amyloidosis that affects the conjunctiva.
The definition of the Elevated alkaline phosphatase of hepatic origin is that An abnormally increased level of liver isoforms of alkaline phosphatase, tissue-nonspecific isozyme in the blood.
The definition of the Elevated alkaline phosphatase of bone origin is that An abnormally increased level of bone isoforms of alkaline phosphatase, tissue-nonspecific isozyme in the blood.

The definition of the Abnormality of the nasal cavity is that Abnormality of the nasal cavity (the cavity includes and starts at the nares and reaches all the way through to the and includes the choanae, the posterior nasal apertures).
The definition of the Abnormality of the midnasal cavity is that Abnormality of the midnasal cavity which includes the cavity between the nares and the choanae.
The definition of the Midnasal atresia is that Absence or abnormal closure of the midnasal cavity.
The definition of the Midnasal stenosis is that Abnormal narrowing (stenosis) of the midnasal cavity, i.e., of the middle nasal meatus, which in neonates can cause respiratory distress.
The definition of the aplasia of the distal phalanges of the toes is that Absence of the distal phalanges of the toes.
The definition of the Cervical spine instability is that An abnormal lack of stability of the cervical spine.
The definition of the Abnormal elasticity of skin is that Any abnormal increase or reduction in skin elasticity.

The definition of the Dermal translucency is that An abnormally increased ability of the skin to permit light to pass through (translucency) such that subcutaneous structures such as veins display an increased degree of visibility.

The definition of the Flat nasal alae is that An abnormal degree of flatness of the Ala of nose, which can be defined as a reduced nasal elevation index (lateral depth of the nose from the tip of the nose to the insertion of the nasal ala in the cheek x 100 divided by the side-to-side breadth of the nasal alae).

The definition of the Premaxillary underdevelopment is that An abnormality of the premaxilla (the embryonic structure that forms the anterior part of the maxilla) causing it to appear relatively small in size compared to the other parts of the maxilla or other facial structures.
The definition of the Abnormality of the meninges is that An abnormality of the Meninges, including any abnormality of the Dura mater, the Arachnoid mater, and the Pia mater.
The definition of the Abnormality of the dura mater is that An abnormality of the Dura mater.
The definition of the Abnormality of the falx cerebri is that An abnormality of the Falx cerebri.
The definition of the aplasia of the falx cerebri is that A developmental defect characterized by aplasia of the Falx cerebri.
The definition of the Epiphyseal stippling is that The presence of abnormal punctate (speckled, dot-like) calcifications in one or more epiphyses.
The definition of the Abnormal epiphyseal ossification is that An abnormality of the formation and mineralization of an epiphysis.

The definition of the Patchy reduction of bone mineral density is that Patchy (irregular) reduction in bone density. This can take on many forms depending on severity and distribution as can be seen on x-rays.

The definition of the Patchy changes of bone mineral density is that Patchy (irregular) changes in bone mineral density. These changes can either be patchy reduction or increase of mineral density as seen on x-rays. Depending on the pathomechanism and the underlying disease, these changes can either appear solely as reduction or increase or as a combination of both (patches of bone showing an increased density while others are affected by reduction of mineral density).

The definition of the Patchy variation in bone mineral density is that Patchy (irregular) changes in bone mineral density with patches of bone showing an increased density side to side with patches that are affected by reduction of mineral density. This is sometimes referred to as a moth-eaten appearance on x-rays.
The definition of the Abnormal hand bone ossification is that An abnormality of the formation and mineralization of any bone of the skeleton of hand.
The definition of the Absence of the third cerebral ventricle is that A developmental defect characterized by the absence of the third ventricle.
The definition of the Abnormality of the diencephalon is that An abnormality of the Diencephalon, which together with the cerebrum (telencephalon) makes up the forebrain.
The definition of the Abnormality of thalamus morphology is that An abnormality of the thalamus.
The definition of the Fusion of the left and right thalami is that A developmental defect characterized by fusion of the left and right halves of the thalamus.
The definition of the Bilateral coxa valga is that The presence of bilateral coxa valga.
The definition of the Hypoplasia of the anterior nasal spine is that Underdevelopment of the anterior nasal spine of maxilla.
The definition of the aplasia of the maxilla is that A congenital defect characterized by absence of the Maxilla.
The definition of the Abnormality of the zygomatic bone is that An abnormality of the zygomatic bone.

The definition of the Cheekbone underdevelopment is that Underdevelopment of the zygomatic bone. That is, a reduction in size of the zygomatic bone, including the zygomatic process of the temporal bone of the skull, which forms part of the zygomatic arch.
The definition of the Abnormality of the third metatarsal bone is that An abnormality of the third metatarsal bone.
The definition of the Abnormality of the curvature of the vertebral column is that The presence of an abnormal curvature of the vertebral column.
The definition of the Abnormal foot bone ossification is that An abnormality of the formation and mineralization of any bone of the skeleton of foot.
The definition of the Enuresis nocturna is that Enuresis occurring during sleeping hours.
The definition of the Enuresis diurna is that Enuresis occurring during waking hours of the day.
The definition of the Elevated tissue non-specific alkaline phosphatase is that An abnormally increased level of alkaline phosphatase, tissue-nonspecific isozyme in the blood.
The definition of the Elevated alkaline phosphatase of renal origin is that An abnormally increased level of kidney isoforms of alkaline phosphatase, tissue-nonspecific isozyme in the blood.
The definition of the Elevated intestinal alkaline phosphatase is that An abnormally increased level of alkaline phosphatase, intestinal type in the blood.
The definition of the Elevated placental alkaline phosphatase is that An abnormally increased level of alkaline phosphatase, placental type in the blood.
The definition of the Low tissue non-specific alkaline phosphatase is that An abnormally reduced level of alkaline phosphatase, tissue-nonspecific isozyme in the blood.
The definition of the Low alkaline phosphatase of bone origin is that An abnormally reduced level of bone isoforms of alkaline phosphatase in the blood.
The definition of the Low alkaline phosphatase of renal origin is that An abnormally reduced level of kidney isoforms of alkaline phosphatase in the blood.
The definition of the Low alkaline phosphatase of hepatic origin is that An abnormally reduced level of liver isoforms of alkaline phosphatase in the blood.
The definition of the Low intestinal alkaline phosphatase is that An abnormally reduced level of alkaline phosphatase, intestinal type in the blood.
The definition of the Low placental alkaline phosphatase is that An abnormally reduced level of alkaline phosphatase, placental type in the blood.
