The definition of the Focal EEG discharges with propagation to ipsilateral hemisphere is that Focal epileptiform discharges with spreading to the hemisphere on the same side of the brain. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:jalbers]

The definition of the Focal EEG discharges with secondary generalization is that Focal EEG discharges that secondarily spread to both hemispheres and can then be recorded over the entire scalp. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:jalbers]
The definition of the Bilateral multifocal epileptiform discharges is that Epileptiform discharges being identified at multiple locations in both hemispheres. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:jalbers]

The definition of the Uni- and bilateral multifocal epileptiform discharges is that Epileptiform discharges identified at multiple locations temporarily in both hemispheres and temporarily in one hemisphere. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:jalbers]
The definition of the Unilateral multifocal epileptiform discharges is that Epileptiform discharges being identified at multiple locations in one hemisphere. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:jalbers]
The definition of the Polymorphic focal epileptiform discharges is that Focal epileptiform discharges of different shapes and frequencies. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:jalbers]
The definition of the EEG with focal spikes is that EEG with focal sharp transient waves of a duration less than 80 msec. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:jalbers]
The definition of the EEG with series of focal spikes is that Focal spikes occurring for several seconds. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:jalbers]
The definition of the EEG with focal sharp slow waves is that EEG with focal sharp transient waves of a duration between 80 and 200 msec followed by a slow wave. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:jalbers]
The definition of the EEG with focal sharp waves is that EEG with focal sharp transient waves of a duration between 80 and 200 msec. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:jalbers]
The definition of the EEG with focal spike waves is that EEG with focal sharp transient waves of a duration less than 80 msec followed by a slow wave. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:jalbers]
The definition of the EEG with generalized epileptiform discharges is that EEG discharges recorded on the entire scalp typically seen in persons with epilepsy. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:jalbers]
The definition of the EEG with generalized sharp slow waves is that EEG with generalized sharp transient waves of a duration between 80 and 200 msec followed by a slow wave. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:jalbers]
The definition of the EEG with generalized polymorphic epileptiform discharges is that Generalized epileptiform discharges of different shapes and frequencies. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:jalbers]
The definition of the EEG with changes in voltage is that EEG with abnormal amplitude. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:jalbers]
The definition of the EEG with diffuse acceleration is that EEG frequency is abnormally increased.
The definition of the EEG with abnormally slow frequencies is that EEG with abnormally slow frequencies. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:jalbers]
The definition of the EEG with continuous slow activity is that EEG showing diffuse slowing without interruption. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:jalbers]
The definition of the EEG with intermittent slow activity is that Non-continuous diffuse slowing of electroencephalographic patterns. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:jalbers]
The definition of the EEG with generalized slow activity grade 1 is that Slowing at frequencies between 7.5 and 8.5 Hz. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:jalbers]
The definition of the EEG with generalized slow activity grade 2 is that Generalized slowing of EEG activity at frequencies between 4-7 Hz. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:jalbers]
The definition of the EEG with generalized slow activity grade 3 is that Generalized slowing of EEG activity at frequencies between 0.5-3 Hz. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:jalbers]
The definition of the EEG with generalized slow activity grade 4 is that EEG without electrical activity. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:jalbers]
The definition of the EEG with occipital slowing is that Slowing in occipital areas of the scalp EEG. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:jalbers]
The definition of the EEG with photoparoxysmal response grade I is that Occurrence of epileptiform discharges in occipital regions during photic stimulation. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:jalbers]
The definition of the EEG with photoparoxysmal response grade II is that Occurence of epileptiform discharges in occipital and central regions during photic stimulation. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:jalbers]

The definition of the EEG with photoparoxysmal response grade III is that Occurrence of epileptiform discharges in occipital, central, temporal and parietal regions during photic stimulation. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:jalbers]
The definition of the EEG with photoparoxysmal response grade IV is that Occurrence of generalized epileptiform discharges during photic stimulation. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:jalbers]
The definition of the Hemihypsarrhythmia is that Hypsarrhythmia occurring in one hemisphere. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:jalbers]
The definition of the Abnormal shape of the occiput is that An abnormal shape of occiput.
The definition of the Abnormal shape of the frontal region is that An abnormal shape of the frontal part of the head.

The definition of the Short face is that Facial height (length) is more than two standard deviations below the mean (objective); or an apparent decrease in the height (length) of the face (subjective). [PMID:19125436]
The definition of the Prominent forehead is that Forward prominence of the entire forehead, due to protrusion of the frontal bone. [PMID:19125436]

The definition of the Vertical forehead creases is that Vertical soft tissue creases in the midline of the forehead, often extending from the hairline to the brow, and seen with facial expression or when the face is at rest. [PMID:19125436]
The definition of the Depressed glabella is that Posterior positioning of the glabella, i.e., of the midline forehead between the supraorbital ridges.
The definition of the Metopic depression is that Linear vertical groove in the midline of the forehead, extending from hairline to glabella. [PMID:19125436]
The definition of the Ablepharon is that Absent eyelids. [PMID:19125427]
The definition of the Epiblepharon is that Redundant eyelid skin pressing the eyelashes against the cornea and/or conjunctiva. [PMID:19125427]
The definition of the aplasia/Hypoplasia affecting the eyelid is that Absence or underdevelopment of the eyelid.
The definition of the Elevated C-reactive protein level is that An abnormal elevation of the C-reactive protein level in the blood circulation.
The definition of the Horizontal eyebrow is that An eyebrow that extends straight across the brow, without curve. [PMID:19125427]
The definition of the Broad eyebrow is that Regional increase in the width (height) of the eyebrow. [PMID:19125427]
The definition of the Laterally extended eyebrow is that An eyebrow that extends laterally beyond the orbital rim rather than turning gently downward at that location. [PMID:19125427]

The definition of the Prominent eyelashes is that Eyelashes that draw the attention of the viewer due to increased density and/or length and/or curl without meeting the criteria of trichomegaly. [PMID:19125427]

The definition of the Infra-orbital fold is that Elevated ridge(s) of skin starting well below the medial aspect of the lower lid that curves gradually upward toward and/or across the nasal bridge. [PMID:19125427]
The definition of the Antihelical shelf is that Antihelix protrusion directed more anteriorly than laterally, forming a shelf overlying the posterior concha. [PMID:19152421]
The definition of the Absent antihelix is that No discernible ridge between concha and triangular fossa and helix. []
The definition of the Additional crus of antihelix is that Supernumerary ridge or crus of the ear arising from the antihelix. [PMID:19152421]
The definition of the Angulated antihelix is that Antihelical ridge that forms an acute angle between the antitragus and its bifurcation (stem) instead of a gently curving arc. [PMID:19152421]
The definition of the Broad inferior crus of antihelix is that Increased width of the inferred cross-section of the inferior crus. [PMID:19152421]
The definition of the Prominent inferior crus of antihelix is that Increased protrusion of the inferior crus relative to the prominence of the antihelix stem. []
The definition of the Underdeveloped inferior crus of antihelix is that Decreased protrusion of the inferior crus relative to the prominence of the antihelix stem. [PMID:19152421]
The definition of the Prominent stem of antihelix is that Increased protrusion of the antihelical ridge, proximal to its bifurcation, relative to the prominence of the helix. [PMID:19152421]

The definition of the Serpiginous stem of antihelix is that Posterior curving of the antihelix from its origin at the antitragus, traveling initially almost perpendicular to the descending helix and obscuring some of the concha. [PMID:19152421]

The definition of the Underdeveloped stem of antihelix is that Decreased protrusion of the antihelical ridge, proximal to its bifurcation, relative to the prominence of a normal helix. [PMID:19152421]

The definition of the Abnormality of inferior crus of antihelix is that An abnormality of the inferior crus of the antihelix is the lower cartilaginous ridge arising at the bifurcation of the antihelix that ends beneath the fold of the ascending helix, and separates the concha from the triangular fossa.

The definition of the Abnormality of stem of antihelix is that An abnormality of the stem of the antihelix, which is the part below the bifurcation of the antihelix into the inferior and superior crura.

The definition of the Abnormality of superior crus of antihelix is that An abnormality of the superior crus of the antihelix is the upper cartilaginous ridge arising at the bifurcation of the antihelix that ends beneath the fold of the ascending helix, and separates the concha from the triangular fossa.
The definition of the Underdeveloped superior crus of antihelix is that Decreased protrusion of the superior crus relative to the prominence of a normal antihelix stem. [PMID:19152421]
The definition of the Prominent superior crus of antihelix is that Increased protrusion of the superior crus relative to the prominence of a normal antihelix stem. [PMID:19152421]
The definition of the Everted antitragus is that Positioning of the antitragus at an angle perpendicular to the plane of the ear (oriented away from the plane of the ear). [PMID:19152421]
The definition of the Absent antitragus is that Absence of the anterosuperior prominence of the area between the bottom of the incisura and the inner margin of the antihelix. [PMID:19152421]
The definition of the Bifid antitragus is that Double rather than single peak of the antitragus. [PMID:19152421]
The definition of the Underdeveloped antitragus is that Reduction in the anterosuperior prominence of the area between the bottom of the incisura and the inner margin of the antihelix.
The definition of the Cryptotia is that Invagination of the superior part of the auricle under a fold of temporal skin. [PMID:19152421]
The definition of the Type I cryptotia is that A type of cryptotia associated with reduction in size of the antihelix and superior crus.
The definition of the Type II cryptotia is that A type of cryptotia associated with reduction in size of the antihelix and inferior crus that are affected.
The definition of the Absent crus of helix is that Continuum between the tragus and ascending helix, without any evidence of a posterior extension (crus) towards the concha. [PMID:19152421]
The definition of the Crus of helix connected to antihelix is that Extension of the ridge of the crus helix across the ear and connection of the crus to the antihelix. [PMID:19152421]
The definition of the Serpiginous crus of helix is that Curving course of the crus of the helix, approaching or joining the antitragus. [PMID:19152421]

The definition of the Tragal bridge of crus of helix is that The anterior origin of the crus encompasses the superior margin of the tragus, the crus overrides the upper portion of the conchal cavum and ends at the antihelix. [PMID:19152421]
The definition of the Expanded terminal portion of crus of helix is that Widening, rather than tapering, of the crus at its posterior border near the antihelix. [PMID:19152421]
The definition of the Darwin notch of helix is that Small defect of the helical fold that lies at the junction of the superior and descending portions of the helix. [PMID:19152421]
The definition of the Darwin tubercle of helix is that Small expansion of the helical fold at the junction of the superior and descending portions of the helix. [PMID:19152421]
The definition of the Crimped helix is that Linear, circumferential indentation in the convexity of the outer surface of the helix. [PMID:19152421]
The definition of the Forward facing earlobe is that Positioning of the anterior surface of the ear lobe in a more coronal plane than the remainder of the ear.
The definition of the Cleft earlobe is that Discontinuity in the convexity of the inferior margin of the lobe. [PMID:19152421]
The definition of the Microtia, first degree is that Presence of all the normal ear components and the median longitudinal length more than two standard deviations below the mean. [PMID:19152421]
The definition of the Microtia, third degree is that Presence of some auricular structures, but none of these structures conform to recognized ear components. [PMID:19152421]

The definition of the Absent tragus is that Lack of convexity or prominence of the contour of the ridge between the bottom of the incisura and the confluence of the ascending helix and crus helix. [PMID:19152421]
The definition of the Bifid tragus is that Increased height of the tragal ridge with a shallow indentation at the apex, giving the appearance of a double peak. [PMID:19152421]
The definition of the Duplicated tragus is that A complete or partial duplication of the tragus; expected to lie anterior to the normal tragus. [PMID:19152421]
The definition of the Prominent tragus is that Increase posterolateral protrusion of the tragus. [PMID:19152421]
The definition of the Underdeveloped tragus is that Decreased posterolateral protrusion of the tragus. [PMID:19152421]
The definition of the Anisocytosis is that Abnormally increased variability in the size of erythrocytes.
The definition of the Recurrent mycobacterial infections is that Increased susceptibility to mycobacterial infections, as manifested by recurrent episodes of mycobacterial infection.

The definition of the Recurrent mycobacterium avium complex infections is that Increased susceptibility to mycobacterial avium complex infections, as manifested by recurrent episodes of mycobacterial infection.

The definition of the Intrapulmonary sequestration is that A type of pulmonary sequestration that occurs within the visceral pleura of normal lung tissue, usually without communication with the tracheobronchial tree.
The definition of the Abnormality of urine bicarbonate concentration is that An abnormal amount of hydrogencarbonate in the urine.
The definition of the Abnormality of urine calcium concentration is that An abnormality of calcium concentration in the urine.
The definition of the Abnormality of urine catecholamine concentration is that An abnormal amount of urinary catecholamine concentration.
The definition of the Abnormality of hindbrain morphology is that An abnormality of the hindbrain, also known as the rhombencephalon.
The definition of the Abnormality of the metencephalon is that An abnormality of the metencephalon. The metencephalon is the part of the hindbrain that consists of the pons and the cerebellum.
The definition of the Short-segment aganglionic megacolon is that A type of aganglionic megacolon in which the aganglionic segment does not extend beyond the upper sigmoid.
The definition of the Long-segment aganglionic megacolon is that A type of aganglionic megacolon in which the aganglionic segment extends proximal to the sigmoid.
The definition of the Total colonic aganglionosis is that A type of aganglionic megacolon in which the aganglionic segment comprises the entire colon.

The definition of the EEG with occipital sharp slow waves is that EEG with sharp slow waves in the occipital region. Sharp slow waves are focal sharp transient waves of a duration between 80 and 200 msec followed by a slow wave. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:jalbers]

The definition of the EEG with parietal sharp slow waves is that EEG with sharp slow waves in the parietal region. Sharp slow waves are focal sharp transient waves of a duration between 80 and 200 msec followed by a slow wave. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:jalbers]

The definition of the EEG with temporal sharp slow waves is that EEG with sharp slow waves in the temporal region. Sharp slow waves are focal sharp transient waves of a duration between 80 and 200 msec followed by a slow wave. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:jalbers]

The definition of the EEG with frontal sharp slow waves is that EEG with sharp slow waves in the frontal region. Sharp slow waves are focal sharp transient waves of a duration between 80 and 200 msec followed by a slow wave. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:jalbers]

The definition of the EEG with central sharp slow waves is that EEG with sharp slow waves in the central region. Sharp slow waves are focal sharp transient waves of a duration between 80 and 200 msec followed by a slow wave. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:jalbers]
The definition of the EEG with occipital sharp waves is that EEG with sharp waves in the occipital region, i.e., sharp transient waves of a duration between 80 and 200 msec. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:jalbers]
The definition of the EEG with central sharp waves is that EEG with sharp waves in the central region, i.e., sharp transient waves of a duration between 80 and 200 msec. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:jalbers]
The definition of the EEG with frontal sharp waves is that EEG with sharp waves in the frontal region, i.e., sharp transient waves of a duration between 80 and 200 msec. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:jalbers]
The definition of the EEG with parietal sharp waves is that EEG with sharp waves in the parietal region, i.e., sharp transient waves of a duration between 80 and 200 msec. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:jalbers]
The definition of the EEG with temporal sharp waves is that EEG with sharp waves in the temporal region, i.e., sharp transient waves of a duration between 80 and 200 msec. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:jalbers]
The definition of the Abnormality of digit is that A morphological abnormality of a digit, i.e., of a finger or toe.
The definition of the Prominent digit pad is that A soft tissue prominence of the ventral aspects of the fingertips or toe tips. [PMID:19125433]
The definition of the Partial absence of finger is that The absence of a phalangeal segment of a finger. [PMID:19125433]
The definition of the Broad fingertip is that Increased width of the distal segment of a finger. [PMID:19125433]
The definition of the Absent foot is that The total absence of the foot, with no bony elements distal to the tibia or fibula. [PMID:19125433]

The definition of the Long palm is that For children from birth to 16 years of age the length of the palm is more than the 97th centile; or, the length of the palm appears relatively long compared to the finger length or the limb length. [PMID:19125433]
The definition of the Convex contour of sole is that The contour of the foot in lateral profile has a convex shape. [PMID:19125433]
The definition of the Broad thumb is that Increased thumb width without increased dorso-ventral dimension. [PMID:19125433]
The definition of the Partial absence of toe is that The absence of a phalangeal segment of a toe or hallux. [PMID:19125433]
The definition of the Splayed toes is that Divergence of digits along the anteroposterior axis (in the plane of the sole). [PMID:19125433]
The definition of the Slender toe is that Toes that are disproportionately narrow (reduced girth) for the hand/foot size or build of the individual. [PMID:19125433]
The definition of the Tapered toe is that The gradual reduction in girth of the toe from proximal to distal. [PMID:19125433]
The definition of the Bridged palmar crease is that A crease that connects the proximal and distal transverse palmar creases. [PMID:19125433]
The definition of the Sydney crease is that Extension of the proximal transverse crease (five finger crease) to the ulnar edge of the palm. [PMID:19125433]
The definition of the Fused nails is that A nail plate that has a longitudinal separation with partially separated nails, each with a separate lateral radius of curvature. [PMID:19125433]
The definition of the Narrow nail is that Decreased width of nail. [PMID:19125433]
The definition of the Abnormality of long bone morphology is that An abnormality of size or shape of the long bones.
The definition of the Unicoronal synostosis is that Synostosis affecting only one of the coronal sutures.
The definition of the Left unicoronal synostosis is that Synostosis affecting only the left coronal suture.
The definition of the Right unicoronal synostosis is that Unicoronal synostosis affecting only the right coronal suture.
The definition of the Bicoronal synostosis is that Synostosis affecting the right and the left coronal suture.
The definition of the Bilambdoid synostosis is that Premature synostosis of both lambdoid sutures.
The definition of the Unilambdoid synostosis is that Premature synostosis of only one lambdoid suture.
The definition of the Left unilambdoid synostosis is that Premature synostosis of only the left lambdoid suture.
The definition of the Right unilambdoid synostosis is that Premature synostosis of only the right lambdoid suture.
The definition of the Cleft of chin is that Incomplete fusion of the chin, resulting from a developmental defect and manifesting as a midline cleft or fissure of the chin.
The definition of the Multiple suture craniosynostosis is that Craniosynostosis involving at least 2 cranial sutures, where the exact pattern of sutures fused has not been precisely specified.
The definition of the Pansynostosis is that Craniosynostosis of all calvarial sutures.
The definition of the Anterior plagiocephaly is that Asymmetry of the anterior part of the skull.
The definition of the Posterior plagiocephaly is that Asymmetry of the posterior part of the skull.
The definition of the Abnormality of fontanelles is that An abnormality of the fontanelle.

The definition of the Abnormality of cranial sutures is that Any anomaly of a cranial suture, that is one of the six membrane-covered openings in the incompletely ossified skull of the fetus or newborn infant.
The definition of the Metopic synostosis is that Premature fusion of the metopic suture.
The definition of the Hemifacial atrophy is that Unilateral atrophy of facial tissues, including muscles, bones and skin.
The definition of the Hemifacial hypoplasia is that Unilateral underdevelopment of the facial tissues, including muscles and bones.

The definition of the Asymmetric crying face is that Asymmetry observed in the face of a neonate or infant whose face appears symmetric at rest and asymmetric during crying as the mouth is pulled downward on one side while not moving on the other side.
The definition of the Frontal hirsutism is that Excessive amount of hair growth on forehead.
The definition of the Bitemporal forceps marks is that Bilateral temporal scarlike defects, which are said to resemble forceps marks.
The definition of the Abnormality of mouth shape is that An abnormality of the outline, configuration, or contour of the mouth. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_jhurst]
The definition of the Abnormality of upper lip vermillion is that An abnormality of the vermilion border, the sharp demarcation between the lip (red colored) and the adjacent normal skin.
The definition of the Incomplete cleft of the upper lip is that A subtle unilateral cleft of the upper lip, which may appear as a small indentation.
The definition of the Long upper lip is that Increased width of the upper lip. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_jhurst]
The definition of the Mild global developmental delay is that A mild delay in the achievement of motor or mental milestones in the domains of development of a child.
The definition of the Moderate global developmental delay is that A moderate delay in the achievement of motor or mental milestones in the domains of development of a child.
The definition of the Severe global developmental delay is that A severe delay in the achievement of motor or mental milestones in the domains of development of a child.
The definition of the Moderate expressive language delay is that A moderate delay in the acquisition of the ability to use language to communicate needs, wishes, or thoughts.
The definition of the Mild expressive language delay is that A mild delay in the acquisition of the ability to use language to communicate needs, wishes, or thoughts.
The definition of the Abnormality of ocular abduction is that An abnormality involving the movement of the eye outwards.
The definition of the Abnormality of the sixth cranial nerve is that Any structural abnormality of the abducens nerve.
The definition of the Mild receptive language delay is that A mild delay in the acquisition of the ability to understand the speech of others.
The definition of the Moderate receptive language delay is that A moderate delay in the acquisition of the ability to understand the speech of others.
The definition of the Severe receptive language delay is that A severe delay in the acquisition of the ability to understand the speech of others.
The definition of the Arterial intimal fibrosis is that Formation of excess fibrous connective tissue in the tunica intima (innermost layer) of arteries.
The definition of the Generalized abnormality of skin is that An abnormality of the skin that is not localized to any one particular region.
The definition of the Localized skin lesion is that A lesion of the skin that is located in a specific region rather than being generalized.
The definition of the Regional abnormality of skin is that An abnormality of the skin that is restricted to a particular body region.
The definition of the Generalized hypopigmentation of hair is that Reduced pigmentation of hair diffusely.
The definition of the Dry hair is that Hair that lacks the lustre (shine or gleam) of normal hair.
The definition of the Acquired abnormal hair pattern is that An abnormality of the distribution of hair growth that is acquired during the course of life.
The definition of the Congenital abnormal hair pattern is that A congenital abnormality of the distribution of hair growth.
The definition of the Abnormal hair quantity is that An abnormal amount of hair.
The definition of the Abnormality of hair growth rate is that Hair whose growth rate deviates from the norm.
The definition of the White hair is that Hypopigmented hair that appears white.
The definition of the Patchy hypopigmentation of hair is that Reduced pigmentation of hair in patches.
The definition of the Yellow nails is that Yellowish discoloration of the nails.
The definition of the Epidermal thickening is that Thickening of the epidermal layer of the skin.
The definition of the Mongolian blue spot is that Congenital deep dermal melanosis in the sacral area.
The definition of the aplasia of the inner ear is that Absence of the inner ear due to a developmental defect. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dfitzpatrick]

The definition of the Incomplete partition of the cochlea is that Incomplete formation of the cochlear partition. The scala vestibuli and scala tympani separated by the cochlear partition, except in the apical turn where the two scalae are in continuity via the helicotrema.

The definition of the Incomplete partition of the cochlea type I is that Incomplete partition I is also known as cystic cochleovestibular malformation, where the cochlea has no bony modiolus, resulting in an empty cystic cochlea. This is accompanied by a dilated cystic vestibule with developmental arrest at the fifth week of gestation. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_mbitner-glidicz, PMID:21849370]
The definition of the Cochlear aplasia is that Absence of the cochlea, a spiral shaped cavity in the inner ear, owing to a developmental defect. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:dfitzpatrick]

The definition of the Morphological abnormality of the vestibule of the inner ear is that A morphological abnormality of the vestibule, the central part of the osseous labyrinth that is situated medial to the tympanic cavity, behind the cochlea, and in front of the semicircular canals. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_mbitner-glidicz]
The definition of the aplasia of the vestibule is that Complete absence of the vestibule of the inner ear. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dfitzpatrick]
The definition of the Hypoplasia of the vestibule of the inner ear is that Underdevelopment of the vestibule of the inner ear. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_mbitner-glidicz]
The definition of the Dilated vestibule of the inner ear is that Dilatation of the vestibule of the inner ear. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_mbitner-glidicz]
The definition of the Morphological abnormality of the semicircular canal is that An abnormality of the morphology of the semicircular canal. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dfitzpatrick]
The definition of the aplasia of the semicircular canal is that Absence of the semicircular canal. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dfitzpatrick]
The definition of the Hypoplasia of the semicircular canal is that Underdevelopment of the semicircular canal. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dfitzpatrick]
The definition of the Enlarged semicircular canal is that Increased size of the semicircular canal. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dfitzpatrick]

The definition of the Abnormality of the internal auditory canal is that An abnormality of the Internal acoustic meatus, i.e., of the canal in the petrous part of the temporal bone through which the cranial nerve VII and cranial nerve VIII traverse. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_mbitner-glidicz]
The definition of the Absent internal auditory canal is that Aplasia of the internal auditory canal. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dfitzpatrick]
The definition of the Narrow internal auditory canal is that Reduction in diameter of the internal auditory canal. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dfitzpatrick]
The definition of the Enlarged vestibular aqueduct is that Increased size of the vestibular aqueduct. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_mbitner-glidicz]

The definition of the Enlarged cochlear aqueduct is that Increased size of the cochlear duct, i.e., of a duct that communicates between the perilymphatic space and the subarachnoid space, and transmits a vein from the cochlea to join the internal jugular. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dfitzpatrick]
The definition of the Functional abnormality of the inner ear is that An abnormality of the function of the inner ear. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dfitzpatrick]
The definition of the Morphological abnormality of the inner ear is that A structural anomaly of the internal part of the ear.
The definition of the aplasia of the vestibular nerve. is that Absence of the vestibular nerve [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_mbitner-glidicz]
The definition of the Hypoplasia of the vestibular nerve is that Underdevelopment of the vestibular nerve. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dfitzpatrick]
The definition of the aplasia/Hypoplasia of the cochlea is that Absence or underdevelopment of the cochlea, a spiral shaped cavity in the inner ear, owing to a developmental defect.

The definition of the Abnormality of the dorsal column of the spinal cord is that An abnormality of the dorsal columns, i.e., of the dorsal portion of the gray substance of the spinal cord. The dorsal column consists of the fasciculus gracilis and fasciculus cuneatus and itself is part of the dorsal funiculus.
The definition of the Tibialis atrophy is that Wasting of the tibialis anterior muscle.
The definition of the Abnormal CNS myelination is that An abnormality of myelination of nerves in the central nervous system.
The definition of the Delayed peripheral myelination is that Delayed myelination in the peripheral nervous system.
The definition of the Demyelinating sensory neuropathy is that Demyelination of peripheral sensory nerves.
The definition of the Lethal short-trunk short stature is that A type of disproportionate short stature characterized by a short trunk but a average-sized limbs that is lethal at birth.
The definition of the Infancy onset short-trunk short stature is that A type of disproportionate short stature characterized by a short trunk but a average-sized limbs with onset in infancy.

The definition of the Moderate intrauterine growth retardation is that Intrauterine growth retardation that is at least 3 standard deviations (SD) below average, but not as low as 4 SD, corrected for sex and gestational age.

The definition of the Ventouse delivery is that Delivery of newborn by means of a ventouse, a vacuum device used to assist the delivery of a baby when the second stage of labour has not progressed adequately.
The definition of the Shoulder dystocia is that Shoulder dystocia occurs when the fetal anterior shoulder impacts against the maternal symphysis following delivery of the vertex. [PMID:15086043]
The definition of the Hydropic placenta is that An abnormality of the placenta in which there are numerous cystic spaces within the placenta as well as placental enlargement.
The definition of the Long umbilical cord is that Increased length of the umbilical cord.
The definition of the Placental abruption is that Separation of the placenta from the uterus wall before delivery.
The definition of the Abnormality of chloride homeostasis is that An abnormality of chloride homeostasis or concentration in the body.
The definition of the Hyperchloremia is that An abnormally increased chloride concentration in the blood.
The definition of the Increased serum zinc is that An increased consentration of zinc in the blood.

The definition of the Fetal ultrasound soft marker is that An finding upon obstetric ultrasound examination performed at around 16 to 20 weeks of gestation that is abnormal but not clearly identifiable as a fetal anatomic malformation or growth restriction. Such findings are known as soft markers since they are associated with increased risk for fetal aneuploidy or other disorders. [PMID:16100637]

The definition of the Fetal choroid plexus cysts is that Fetal choroid plexus cysts (CPCs) are sonographically discrete, small cysts found in the choroid plexus within the lateral cerebral ventricles of the developing fetus at 14 to 24 weeks gestation. Imaging of the choroid plexus is performed in the transverse plane of the fetal head at the same level that the lateral cerebral ventricle is evaluated. The choroid plexus should be inspected bilaterally for the presence of cysts. The size of CPCs is not of clinical relevance (PMID:16100637).

The definition of the Enlarged fetal cisterna magna is that The cisterna magna is measured on a transaxial view of the fetal head angled 15 degrees caudal to the canthomeatal line. The anterior/posterior diameter is taken between the inferior/posterior surface of the vermis of the cerebellum to the inner surface of the cranium. An enlarged cisternal magna is defined by an anterior/posterior diameter of 10 mm or more (PMID:16100637).

The definition of the Short fetal femur length is that A short femur length is defined as either a measurement below the 2.5th percentile for gestational age or a measurement that is less than 0.9 of that predicted by the measured biparietal diameter. The femur should be measured with the bone perpendicular to the ultrasound beam and with epiphyseal cartilages visible but not included in the measurement (PMID:16100637).

The definition of the Short fetal humerus length is that A short humerus length is defined as a length below the 2.5th percentile for gestational age or as a measurement less than 0.9 of that predicted by the measured biparietal diameter. The humerus should be measured with the bone perpendicular to the ultrasound beam and with epiphyseal cartilages visible but not included in the measurement (PMID:16100637).

The definition of the Hypoplasia of fetal nasal bone is that On prenatal ultrasound, the nasal bone is a thin echogenic line within the bridge of the fetal nose. The fetus is imaged facing the transducer with the fetal face strictly in the midline. The angle of insonation is 90 degrees, with the longitudinal axis of the nasal bone as the reference line. Calibres are placed at each end of the nasal bone. Absence of the nasal bone or measurements below 2.5th percentile are considered significant (PMID:16100637).

The definition of the Fetal fifth finger clinodactyly is that Fifth finger clinodactyly is defined by a hypoplastic or absent mid-phalanx of the fifth digit. Ultrasound identification of the fetal hand must first be undertaken and then appropriate magnification accomplished. The evaluation requires stretching of the 5 fingers. The diagnosis is established when the middle phalanx of the fifth finger is markedly smaller than normal or absent, which often causes the finger to be curved inward (PMID:16100637).
The definition of the High maternal serum alpha-fetoprotein is that Increase in the levels of maternal serum alpha-fetoprotein levels during pregnancy. [PMID:32039804]

The definition of the High maternal serum chorionic gonadotropin is that An abnormally high concentration of maternal serum human chorionic gonadotropin as compared to normal values for gestational-age.

The definition of the Low maternal serum chorionic gonadotropin is that An abnormally low concentration of maternal serum human chorionic gonadotropin as compared to normal values for gestational-age.
The definition of the Low maternal serum PAPP-A is that An abnormally low concentration of serum PAPP-A (pregnancy associated plasma protein A), as compared to normal values for gestational-age.
The definition of the Abnormal maternal serum screening is that An abnormally elevated or decreased level of a maternal serum marker analytes used in screening for aneuploidy.
The definition of the Maternal autoimmune disease is that A medical history of a fetus or child born to a mother with an autoimmune disease.
The definition of the Maternal teratogenic exposure is that A medical history of exposure of the mother of a child or fetus to a teratogenic substance during pregnancy.
The definition of the Anesthetic-induced rhabdomylosis is that Rhabdomyolysis induced by anesthesia.
The definition of the Alcohol-induced rhabdomyolysis is that Rhabdomyolysis induced by intake of alcohol.
The definition of the Abnormality of the medulla oblongata is that An abnormality of the medulla oblongata, the lower half of the brainstem.
The definition of the Abnormality of central motor function is that An anomaly of the control or production of movement in the central nervous system.

The definition of the Decorticate rigidity is that A type of rigidity in which the arms are in flexion and adduction and the legs are extended. This signifies a lesion in the cerebral white matter, internal capsules, or thalamus.
The definition of the Athetoid cerebral palsy is that A type of cerebral palsy characterized by slow, involuntary muscle movement and mixed muscle tone.
The definition of the Abnormality of higher mental function is that Cognitive, psychiatric, or memory anomaly. []
The definition of the Hyposegmentation of neutrophil nuclei is that Hyposegmented (hypolobulated) or bilobed neutrophil nuclei.
The definition of the Ankle clonus is that Clonus is an involuntary tendon reflex that causes repeated flexion and extension of the foot. Ankle clonus is tested by rapidly flexing the foot upward.

The definition of the Knee clonus is that Clonus is an involuntary tendon reflex that causes repeated flexion and extension of the foot. Knee clonus can be tested by rapidly pushing the patella towards the toes.
The definition of the Congenital microcephaly is that Head circumference below 2 standard deviations below the mean for age and gender at birth.
The definition of the Functional abnormality of the middle ear is that An abnormality of the function of the middle ear.
The definition of the Abnormality of the incus is that An abnormality of the incus, an ossicle in the middle ear. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dfitzpatrick]
The definition of the Abnormality of the malleus is that An abnormality of the malleus, an ossicle in the middle ear. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dfitzpatrick]
The definition of the Absent malleus is that Aplasia of the malleus. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dfitzpatrick]
The definition of the Absent stapes is that Aplasia of the stapes. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dfitzpatrick]
The definition of the Loss of eyelashes is that This term refers to the loss of eyelashes that were previously present.
The definition of the Esophageal carcinoma is that The presence of a carcinoma of the esophagus.
The definition of the Aganglionosis of the small intestine is that A lack of intestinal ganglion cells (i.e., an aganglionic section of bowel) affecting the small intestine.
The definition of the Duodenal aganglionosis is that A lack of intestinal ganglion cells (i.e., an aganglionic section of bowel) affecting the duodenum.
The definition of the aplasia/Hypoplasia of the gallbladder is that Absence or underdevelopment of the gallbladder.
The definition of the Absent gallbladder is that A developmental defect in which the gallbladder fails to form.
The definition of the Facial tics is that Sudden, repetitive, nonrhythmic motor movements (spasms), involving the eyes and muscles of the face.
The definition of the Nasal regurgitation is that Regurgitation of milk through the nose. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_ncarter]
The definition of the Nasogastric tube feeding in infancy is that Feeding problem necessitating nasogastric tube feeding. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_ncarter]
The definition of the Gastrostomy tube feeding in infancy is that Feeding problem necessitating gastrostomy tube feeding. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_ncarter]
The definition of the Villous atrophy is that The enteric villi are atrophic or absent.
The definition of the Childhood onset sensorineural hearing impairment is that Sensorineural hearing impairment with childhood onset. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dfitzpatrick]
The definition of the Persistent stapedial artery is that Persistence of the stapedial artery, which normally regresses during embryonic life. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_mbitner-glidicz]
The definition of the Profound sensorineural hearing impairment is that Complete loss of hearing related to a sensorineural defect. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dfitzpatrick]

The definition of the Upbeat nystagmus is that In primary position, the eyes drift slowly downward and then spontaneously beat upward. Upward gaze accentuates the nystagmus. The associated oscillopsias are often very irritating, but the symptoms are usually transient.
The definition of the True anophthalmia is that Absence of globe, optic nerve, chiasm and optic tracts. No evidence of ocular tissue on MRI scan or examination. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_ncarter]

The definition of the Abnormality of the lacrimal punctum is that An abnormality of the lacrimal punctum, an opening on the eyelid close to the medial canthus that drains tears from the conjunctival sac into the lacrimal duct in the same eyelid.
The definition of the Unilateral microphthalmos is that A developmental anomaly characterized by abnormal smallness of one eye. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_ncarter]
The definition of the Abnormality of the lacrimal duct is that An abnormality of the lacrimal duct, a duct that drain tears from the conjunctiva, via the lacrimal puncta, into the lacrimal sac.
The definition of the Abnormality of the lacrimal gland is that Abnormality of the lacrimal gland, i.e., of the almond-shaped gland that secretes the aqueous layer of the tear film for each eye.
The definition of the Anterior synechiae of the anterior chamber is that Adhesions between the iris and the cornea. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_ncarter]
The definition of the Posterior synechiae of the anterior chamber is that Adhesions between the iris and the lens. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_ncarter]
The definition of the Corneolenticular adhesion is that Developmental abnormality in which the lens and cornea are not separated. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_ncarter]
The definition of the Abnormality of corneal thickness is that An abnormal anteroposterior thickness of the cornea.
The definition of the Increased corneal thickness is that A increased anteroposterior thickness of the cornea.
The definition of the Abnormality of corneal endothelium is that Abnormality of the corneal endothelium, that is, the single layer of cells on the inner surface of the cornea.
The definition of the Abnormal migration of corneal endothelium is that Abnormal migration of corneal endothelium. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_ncarter]
The definition of the Abnormality of Descemet's membrane is that Abnormality of Descemet's membrane, which is the basement membrane of the corneal endothelium.
The definition of the Reduced number of corneal endothelial cells is that A reduction in the number of corneal endothelial cells. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_ncarter]

The definition of the Abnormality of corneal stroma is that An abnormality of the stroma of cornea, also known as the substantia propria of cornea. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_ncarter, https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199]
The definition of the Central opacification of the cornea is that Reduced transparency of the central portion of the corneal stroma. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_ncarter]
The definition of the Generalized opacification of the cornea is that Generalized reduced transparency of the stroma of the cornea.
The definition of the Abnormality of corneal epithelium is that Abnormality of the corneal epithelium, that is of the epithelial tissue that covers the front of the cornea.
The definition of the Corneal neovascularization is that Ingrowth of new blood vessels into the cornea. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_ncarter, PMID:22898649]

The definition of the Iris neovascularization is that Formation of new blood vessels on the iris. The new vessels do not display the typical radially symmertic growth pattern of normal iris blood vessels, but rather appear disorganized. Rubeosis usually starts from the pupillary border with tiny tufts of dilated capillaries or red spots that can only be appreciated with high magnification. [PMID:27895936]
The definition of the Mydriasis is that Abnormal dilatation of the iris. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_ncarter]
The definition of the Polycoria is that Multiple pupils. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_ncarter]
The definition of the Anterior lenticonus is that A conical projection of the anterior surface of the lens, occurring as a developmental anomaly.
The definition of the Posterior lenticonus is that A conical projection of the posterior surface of the lens, occurring as a developmental anomaly.
The definition of the aplasia of the fovea is that Congenital absence of the fovea.
The definition of the Bull's eye maculopathy is that Progressive maculopathy characterized by concentric regions of hyper- and hypo-pigmentation.
The definition of the Cystoid macular edema is that Cystoid macular edema (CME) is any type of macular edema that involves cyst formation. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_ncarter]

The definition of the Choroidal neovascularization of the macula is that Choroidal neovascularization (CNV) is the creation of new blood vessels in the choroid layer of the eye. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_ncarter]
The definition of the Macular flecks is that Pale often indistinct lesions of the macula.
The definition of the Macular hole is that A macular hole is a small break in the macula, located in the center of the retina. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_ncarter]
The definition of the Macular hyperpigmentation is that Increased amount of pigmentation in the macula lutea. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_ncarter]
The definition of the Drusen is that Drusen (singular, 'druse') are tiny yellow or white accumulations of extracellular material (lipofuscin) that build up in Bruch's membrane of the eye.
The definition of the Macular schisis is that Splitting of the retina in the macular region.
The definition of the Hyperpigmentation of the fundus is that Increased pigmentation of the fundus [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_ncarter, https://orcid.org/0000-0003-0986-4123]

The definition of the Retinal cavernous angioma is that A benign tumor of the retina that appears as a grouping of blood-filled saccules within the inner retinal layers or on the surface of the optic disc. Retinal cavernous angioma are described as having a 'cluster of grapes' appearance.

The definition of the Abnormality of binocular vision is that An abnormality of binocular vision, that is of the ability to synthesize the visual inputs from both eyes to a single image with perception of depth. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_ncarter]
The definition of the Abnormal stereopsis is that Inability to make fine depth discriminations from parallax provided by the two eyes' different positions on the head.

The definition of the Rod monochromacy is that A condition where the retina contains no functional cone cells, so that in addition to the absence of color discrimination, vision in lights of normal intensity is difficult.

The definition of the Cone monochromacy is that The condition of having both rods and cones, but only a single kind of cone. Affected individuals have good pattern vision in daylight, but cannot distinguish between colors. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_ncarter]
The definition of the Dichromacy is that Individuals affected by dichromacy possess only two types of cones, instead of three.

The definition of the Anomalous trichromacy is that Individuals with anomalous trichromacy possess three types of cones, but one of the three types of cones has an abnormal spectral sensitivity compared to normal cones.

The definition of the Deuteranomoly is that A type of anomalous trichromacy associated with abnormal M photopigment, such that the absorption spectrum is shifted toward L wavelengths. Affected individuals have difficulties distinguishing between red and green.
The definition of the Deuteranopia is that Complete lack of the M photopigment, which is replaced with the L photopigment. Affected individuals tend to confuse red and green.
The definition of the Protanopia is that Blue and green cones only; no functional red cones.
The definition of the Iris cyst is that An iris cyst is composed of a single cell layer of epithelium and is filled with fluid.
The definition of the Iris melanoma is that Malignant tumor of melanocytes affecting the iris. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_ncarter]

The definition of the Iris nevus is that A benign brown pigmented area over the iris representing proliferation of melanocyte cells in the stromal layer of the iris. An iris nevus can be flat or occasionally slightly elevated. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_ncarter]
The definition of the Abnormality of lens shape is that An abnormal shape of the lens.
The definition of the Lentiglobus is that Exaggerated curvature of the lens of the eye, producing an anterior or posterior spherical bulging.

The definition of the Single isolated congenital hypertrophy of retinal pigment epithelium is that Sharply demarcated hyperpigmentation which is congenital found in around 3-5% of the population and of no functional significance.
The definition of the Multiple bilateral congenital hypertrophy of retinal pigment epithelium is that Sharply demarcated hyperpigmentation which is congenital.
The definition of the Retinal hole is that A small break in the retina.
The definition of the Vitreitis is that Inflammation of the vitreous body, characterized by the presence of inflammatory cells and protein exudate in the vitreous cavity.
The definition of the Subretinal exudate is that A type of retinal exudate located in the subretinal space between the sensory retina and the retinal pigment epithelium.

The definition of the Snowflake retinal degeneration is that The appearance of yellow/white crystalline-like (hence the name) spots in the retina and thickening of the peripheral part of the vitreous. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_ncarter, PMID:18179896]
The definition of the Abnormal spatial orientation of the cardiac segments is that Abnormality of the spatial relationship of the cardiac segments to other components of the heart. []
The definition of the Abnormal atrial arrangement is that Abnormality of the spatial relationship of the atria to other components of the heart. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown]

The definition of the Right atrial isomerism is that Right atrial isomerism is characterized by bilateral triangular, morphologically right atrial, appendages, both joining the atrial chamber along a broad front with internal terminal crest. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown, PMID:3408620]

The definition of the Left atrial isomerism is that In left atrial isomerism there is a bilateral small finger-shaped morphologically left atrial appendage joining the atrial chamber along a narrow front without an internal terminal crest. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown, PMID:3408620]

The definition of the Atrial situs inversus is that Mirror image atrial arrangement, with morphologic right atrium on the left hand side and morphologic left atrium on the right hand side. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown]
The definition of the Atrial situs ambiguous is that Common atrium without defining morphologic features. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown]

The definition of the Congenitally corrected transposition of the great arteries is that The essence of the lesion is the combination of discordant atrioventricular and ventriculo-arterial connections. Thus, the morphologically right atrium is connected to a morphologically left ventricle across the mitral valve, with the left ventricle then connected to the pulmonary trunk. The morphologically left atrium is connected to the morphologically right ventricle across the tricuspid valve, with the morphologically right ventricle connected to the aorta. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown, PMID:21569592]

The definition of the Criss-cross atrioventricular valves is that Crossing of the inflow streams of the two ventricles, due to an apparent twisting of the heart about its long axis. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown, https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199]

The definition of the Criss-cross atrioventricular valves with superior-inferior ventricles is that Criss-cross atrioventricular valves with a rare cardiac malformation characterized by the two ventricles lying one above the other instead of side by side. [PMID:11789809]
The definition of the Abnormal connection of the cardiac segments is that A deviance in the normal connections between two cardiac segements. [PMID:24876921]
The definition of the Abnormal atrioventricular connection is that An abnormality of the circulatory connection between atria and ventricles. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown]
The definition of the Absent left sided atrioventricular connection is that A defect where there is no connection between the left atrium and left ventricle. [PMID:7104116]
The definition of the Absent right sided atrioventricular connection is that A defect where there is no connection between the right atrium and right ventricle. [PMID:7104116]

The definition of the Ambiguous atrioventricular connection is that With left or right cardiac isomerism in a biventricular, the atrioventricular connections are perforce ambiguous, in that one of the connections is concordant (e.g., right-sided morphologic right atrium connected to a morphologic right ventricle) and one of the connections is discordant (e.g., left-sided morphologic right atrium connected to a morphologic left ventricle). [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown, https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199]

The definition of the Discordant atrioventricular connection is that Connection of the right atrium to the left ventricle and of the left atrium to the right ventricle in a biventricular heart. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown, https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199, PMID:23804932]

The definition of the Double inlet atrioventricular connection is that The condition in which both atria are joined to a single ventricle each by its own atrioventricular valve. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown, https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199]

The definition of the Double inlet left ventricle is that The condition in which both atria are joined to the left ventricle each by its own atrioventricular valve. Usually there is a hypoplastic right ventricle, which may be on the opposite side of the heart as usual. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown, https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199]

The definition of the Double inlet right ventricle is that The condition in which both atria are joined to the right ventricle each by its own atrioventricular valve. Usually, the left ventricle is hypoplastic. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown, https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199]
The definition of the Mitral atresia is that A congenital defect with failure to open of the mitral valve orifice. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown]

The definition of the Overriding atrioventricular valve is that An atrioventricular valve that empties into both ventricles. The valve overrides the interventricular septum above a ventricular septum defect. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown, https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199, PMID:7295418]

The definition of the Straddling atrioventricular valve is that Anomalous insertion of the chordae tendinae or papillary muscles into the contralateral ventricle in the presence of a ventricular septum defect. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown, https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199, PMID:7295418]

The definition of the Abnormal ventriculo-arterial connection is that An abnormality of the circulatory connection between the ventricles and the pulmonary artery and aorta. [PMID:15227248, PMID:18805185, PMID:24750982]

The definition of the Mitral valve arcade is that Anomalous mitral valve arcade is diagnosed based on the following features (1) An adequately sized mitral valve orifice; (2) short, thick, and poorly differentiated chordae with direct union of the papillary muscles to the anterior leaflet; (3) narrow or nearly nonexistent spaces between the abnormal chordae; and (4) greater differentiation of the chordae attached to the posterior papillary muscle. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown, PMID:20404264]

The definition of the Common atrium is that Complete absence of the interatrial septum with common atrioventricular valve and two atrioventricular connections. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown, https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199]

The definition of the Cor triatriatum dexter is that A congenital anomaly with partitioning of the right atrium to form a triatrial heart caused by persistence of the right valve of the sinus venosus. Typically, the right atrial partition is due to exaggerated fetal eustachian and thebesian valves, which together form an incomplete septum across the lower part of the atrium. This septum may range from a reticulum to a substantial sheet of tissue. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown, https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199, PMID:17948095]

The definition of the Sinus venosus atrial septal defect is that An interatrial communication caused by a deficiency of the common wall between the superior vena cava (SVC) and the right-sided pulmonary veins. SVASD is commonly associated with anomalous pulmonary venous connection (APVC) of some or all of the pulmonary veins, which produces additional left-to-right shunting. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown, https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199, PMID:16172274]

The definition of the Double orifice mitral valve is that The left atrio-ventricular connection consists of two anatomically distinct orifices separated by accessory fibrous tissue. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown, https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199, PMID:20851840]

The definition of the Cleft anterior mitral valve leaflet is that Cleft in the anterior mitral valve leaflet not associated with an atrioventricular canal defect. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown, PMID:6829465]
The definition of the Congenital mitral stenosis is that Mitral stenosis with congenital onset. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown]

The definition of the Parachute mitral valve is that Abnormality of the mitral valve apparatus, whereby chordae attach to a single papillary muscle or hypoplastic papillary muscles. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown]
The definition of the Supramitral ring is that A congenital stenotic mitral valvular anomaly with a ring of tissue above the mitral valve. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown]
The definition of the Hypoplastic tricuspid valve is that Congenital defect characterized by underdevelopment of the tricuspid valve. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown]
The definition of the Imperforate atrioventricular valve is that An atrioventricular valve that has failed to open (atretic). [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown]
The definition of the Imperforate tricuspid valve is that A tricuspid valve that has failed to open. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown, PMID:7066117]

The definition of the Intermediate atrioventricular canal defect is that A specific combination of heart defects with a primum atrial septal defect, cleft anterior mitral valve leaflet, and inlet ventricular defect. There is one valve annulus and two valve orifices. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown]

The definition of the Partial atrioventricular canal defect is that A specific combination of heart defects including a primum atrial septal defect and cleft anterior mitral valve leaflet. There is not an inlet ventricular septal defect present. There are two valve annuluses and two valve orifices. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown]

The definition of the Transitional atrioventricular canal defect is that A specific combination of heart defects with a primum atrial septal defect, cleft anterior mitral valve leaflet, and an inlet ventricular septal defect. There are two valve annuli and two valve orifices. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown]

The definition of the Unbalanced atrioventricular canal defect is that Anatomic features of unbalanced atrioventricular septal defect (AVSD) include varying amounts of ventricular hypoplasia, as well as malalignment of the atrioventricular junction. In complete AVSD, the common AV valve can be situated either equally over the right and left ventricles (balanced) or unequally over the ventricles (unbalanced). [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown, PMID:20837915]
The definition of the Short chordae tendineae of the mitral valve is that Abnormally short chordae tendineae of the mitral valve.
The definition of the Double outlet left ventricle is that A congenital defect of heart development characterized by origin of both pulmonary artery and aorta from the morphological left ventricle.
The definition of the Abdominal ectopia cordis is that Displacement of the heart outside the thoracic cavity and into the abdomen. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown]

The definition of the Cervical ectopia cordis is that A type of ectopia cordis with the heart partially in the cervical region and without a defect of the sternum. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown, https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199]

The definition of the Thoracocervical ectopia cordis is that A type of ectopia cordis with the heart partially in the cervical region with a defect of the superior portion of the sternum. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown, https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199]

The definition of the Thoracic ectopia cordis is that Congenital malformation of the thoracic wall with partial or total displacement of the heart outside the thoracic cavity. This feature is associated with sternal cleft or absence of the sternum. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown, https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199]

The definition of the Thoracoabdominal ectopia cordis is that Congenital malformation of the ventral wall with partial or total evisceration of the heart outside the thoracic cavity and displacement partially into the abdominal cavity. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown, https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199, PMID:19479716]

The definition of the Abnormal branching pattern of the aortic arch is that A deviance from the norm of the origin or course of the right brachiocephalic artery, the left common carotid artery, the left subclavian artery or the proximal vertebral arteries. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown]
The definition of the Cervical aortic arch is that The aortic arch extends into the soft tissues of the neck before turning down into to become the descending aorta. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown]

The definition of the Common origin of the right brachiocephalic artery and left common carotid artery is that The left common carotid artery has a common origin with the innominate artery. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown, https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199, PMID:17138027]

The definition of the Double aortic arch is that A conenital abnormality of the aortic arch in which the two embryonic aortc arches form a vascular ring that surrounds the trachea or esophagus and then join to form the descending aorta. Double aortic arch can cause symptoms because of compression of the esophagus (dysphagia, cyanosis while eating) or trachea (stridor). [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown, https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199, PMID:15148283, PMID:15564538]

The definition of the Left aortic arch with isolated subclavian artery is that The subclavian artery arises from ductus arteriosus. While the ductus arteriosus is patent its blood supply comes from the ductus, hence from the pulmonary artery. After it closes, the blood supply is retrogradely from the vertebral artery via the circle of Willis. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown]
The definition of the Left aortic arch with retroesophageal diverticulum of Kommerell is that A patent ductus arteriosus or ductal ligament completes the ring. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown]

The definition of the Right aortic arch with retroesophageal diverticulum of Kommerell is that Aortic arch crosses the right mainstem bronchus. The left carotid artery is the first branch, right carotid artery the second branch and right subclavian artery as the third branch. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown, PMID:12075866]

The definition of the Left aortic arch with retroesophageal right subclavian artery is that Aortic arch crosses the left mainstem bronchus. The first branch is the right carotid artery, the second branch is the left carotid artery, the third branch is the subclavian artery, the fourth branch is the right subclavian artery arising from the posteromedial aspect of the distal aortic arch and continuing posterior to the esophagus to the right hand side of the body. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown]
The definition of the Left aortic arch with right descending aorta and right ductus arteriosus is that The ring may be completed by the ductal ligament. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown]

The definition of the Mesocardia is that Mesocardia is an abnormal location of the heart in which the heart is in a midline position and the longitudinal axis of the heart lies in the mid-sagittal plane. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown, https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199]
The definition of the Abnormal direction of ventricular apex is that Abnormal plane of direction of the heart from the base to the apex. Left sided is normal. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown]

The definition of the Midline direction of ventricular apex is that Abnormal plane of direction of the heart from the base to the apex in the midline. Left sided is normal. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown]
The definition of the Congenital malformation of the great arteries is that Defect or defects of the morphogenesis of the aorta and pulmonary arteries. []

The definition of the Aortopulmonary window is that A congenital anomaly with an abnormal connection between the aorta and the main pulmonary artery resulting in an aortopulmonary shunt. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown, https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199]

The definition of the Congenitally corrected transposition of the great arteries with ventricular septal defect is that A congenitally corrected transposition of the great arteries with a ventricular septal defect: a hole between the two bottom chambers (ventricles) of the heart. The ventricular septal defect is centered around the most superior aspect of the ventricular septum. [PMID:21569592, PMID:27777298, PMID:32274202]

The definition of the Type II truncus arteriosus is that Truncus arteriosus (single great artery leaving the base of the heart, giving rise to the coronary, pulmonary, and systemic arteries) with each pulmonary artery arising separate from each other on the posterior or lateral aspect of the truncus. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown, https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199]

The definition of the Type III truncus arteriosus is that Truncus arteriosus (single great artery leaving the base of the heart, giving rise to the coronary, pulmonary, and systemic arteries) whereby one of the two pulmonary artery branched does not arise from the common pulmonary trunk, but instead from the ductus arteriosus or directly from the aorta. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown, https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199]

The definition of the Type IV truncus arteriosus is that Truncus arteriosus (single great artery leaving the base of the heart, giving rise to the coronary, pulmonary, and systemic arteries) whereby the aortic arch is hypoplastic or interrupted, and a large patent ductus arteriosus is present. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown, https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199]
The definition of the Interrupted aortic arch is that Non-continuity of the arch of aorta with an atretic point or absent segment. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown]
The definition of the Interrupted aortic arch type A is that Non-continuity of the aortic arch with an atretic point or absent segment at the level of the isthmus. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown]

The definition of the Interrupted aortic arch type B is that Non-continuity of the aortic arch with an atretic point or absent segment between the left carotid and subclavian arteries. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown]

The definition of the Interrupted aortic arch type C is that Non-continuity of the aortic arch with an atretic point or absent segment between the innominate and left carotid arteries. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown]

The definition of the Abnormality of pulmonary situs is that An abnormality of the pulmonary situs, i.e., of the sidedness of the morphological right and left lungs, which is defined by characteristics such as the number of lobes per lung and the relationship of the pulmonary arteries to their bronchi. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown]

The definition of the Pulmonary situs inversus is that Mirror image arrangement of the mainstem bronchi with the right pulmonary artery posterior to the right upper lobe bronchus and the left pulmonary artery anterior to the left upper lobe bronchus. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown]

The definition of the Pulmonary situs ambiguus is that An abnormality of the pulmonary situs, i.e., of the sidedness of the morphological right and left lungs, in which the morphology of both left and right lungs is the same. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown]

The definition of the Pulmonary situs ambiguus with bilateral morphologic right lungs is that An abnormality of the pulmonary situs, i.e., of the sidedness of the morphological right and left lungs, in which both lungs have the morphology of a right lung. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown, https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199]

The definition of the Pulmonary situs ambiguus with bilateral morphologic left lungs is that An abnormality of the pulmonary situs, i.e., of the sidedness of the morphological right and left lungs, in which both lungs have the morphology of a left lung. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown]
The definition of the Abnormality of abdominal situs is that An abnormality of the abdominal situs, i.e., of the sidedness of the abdomen and its organs. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown]

The definition of the Gerbode ventricular septal defect is that A type of ventricular septal defect communicating directly between the left ventricle and right atrium. This is anatomically possible because the normal tricuspid valve is more apically displaced than the mitral valve. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown, PMID:19561249]

The definition of the Inlet ventricular septal defect is that A ventricular septal defect that involves the inlet of the right ventricular septum immediately inferior to the AV valve apparatus. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown, PMID:17101870]

The definition of the Muscular ventricular septal defect is that The trabecular septum is the largest part of the interventricular septum. It extends from the membranous septum to the apex and superiorly to the infundibular septum. A defect in the trabecular septum is called muscular VSD if the defect is completely rimmed by muscle. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown, PMID:17101870]
The definition of the Apical muscular ventricular septal defect is that A muscular ventricular septal defect located at the apex of the heart. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown]

The definition of the Multiple muscular ventricular septal defects is that A type of muscular ventricular septal defect characterized by the presence of multiple small defects in the ventricular septum. [PMID:22718060]
The definition of the Scimitar anomaly is that Right pulmonary venous return to the inferior vena cava. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown, PMID:16638549]

The definition of the Aorto-ventricular tunnel is that Aorto-ventricular tunnel is a congenital, extracardiac channel which connects the ascending aorta above the sinotubular junction to the cavity of the left, or (less commonly) right ventricle. [PMID:17922908]
The definition of the Congenital defect of the pericardium is that A developmental defect of the pericardium with congenital onset. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown]

The definition of the Total absence of the pericardium is that No pericardium around the heart, occurring as a congenital defect, not the result of a surgical pericardectomy. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown]

The definition of the Complete diaphragmatic absence of pericardium is that No pericardium over the diaphragmatic surface of the heart. It is a congenital defect, not the result of a pericardectomy. Pericardium is present on other parts of the heart. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown]

The definition of the Complete right sided absence of pericardium is that No pericardium is present on the righthand side of the heart. It is a congenital absence of pericardium rather than the result of a pericardectomy. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown]
The definition of the Partial right sided absence of pericardium is that A congenital anomaly with lack of part of the pericardium on the righthand side of the heart. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown]
The definition of the Complete left sided absence of pericardium is that A congenital anomaly with complete lack of the pericardium on the lefthand side of the heart. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown]
The definition of the Partial left sided absence of pericardium is that A congenital anomaly with lack of part of the pericardium on the lefthand side of the heart. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown]

The definition of the Partial diaphragmatic absence of pericardium is that Lack of a part of the pericardium over the diaphragmatic surface of the heart. It is a congenital defect, not the result of a pericardectomy. Pericardium is present on other parts of the heart. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown]

The definition of the Abnormal origin of the coronary arteries is that Isolated abnormalities of the coronary artery origins. This may be in associated with other structural heart malformations but not the patterns of complex structural heart malformations which result in abnormal course of the coronary arteries. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown]

The definition of the Anomalous origin of coronary artery from the pulmonary artery is that A coronary artery begins (branches off from) the pulmonary artery rather than as normal from the root of the aorta. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown, https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199]

The definition of the Anomalous origin of left coronary artery from the pulmonary artery is that Left main coronary artery begins (branches off from) the pulmonary artery rather than as normal from the root of the aorta, above the left cusp of the aortic valve. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown, https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199, PMID:27358682]

The definition of the Anomalous origin of right coronary artery from the pulmonary artery is that Right coronary artery begins (branches off from) the pulmonary artery rather than as normal from the root of the aorta, above the right cusp of the aortic valve. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown, https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199]

The definition of the Single coronary artery origin is that The presence of a single coronary artery ostium from which both coronary arteries arise. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown, https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199, PMID:4547578]

The definition of the Coronary artery fistula is that A congenital malformation with abnormal connection between one of the coronary arteries and a heart chamber or another blood vessel. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown, https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199, PMID:20513726]

The definition of the Abnormality of the coronary sinus is that An abnormality of the coronary sinus, which is formed by the union of the great cardiac vein and the left marginal vein and terminates in the right atrium. The coronary sinus functions to o collect deoxygenated blood from the myocardium of the heart and drain it into the right atrium. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown, https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199]

The definition of the Coronary sinus atrial septal defect is that An atrial septal defect characterized by a deficiency in the tissue separating the coronary sinus from the left atrium (LA). This results in partial or complete unroofing of the coronary sinus leading to a predominantly left-to-right shunt through the coronary sinus (LA to coronary sinus to right atrium [RA]). The orifice of the ostium is frequently large because of the increased flow. From the RA side, the defect is located at the level of the coronary sinus ostium and may also include some deficiency in atrial tissue around the ostium. From the LA side, the size can be variable depending on the degree of unroofing of the coronary sinus. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown, https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199, PMID:18806021]
The definition of the Coronary sinus diverticulum is that A venous pouch within the left ventricular wall, with a neck opening into the coronary sinus. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown, PMID:3138904]

The definition of the Sinus of Valsalva aneurysm is that Abnormal outpouching or sac-like dilatation of one of the anatomic dilations of the ascending aorta, which occurs just above the aortic valve. []

The definition of the Juxtaductal coarctation of the aorta is that Narrowing or constriction of the aorta localized at the insertion of the ductus arteriosus, i.e., to the juxtaductal region of aortic arch. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown, https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199]

The definition of the Postductal coarctation of the aorta is that Narrowing or constriction of the aorta localized distal to the ductus arteriosus, i.e., to the postductal region of aortic arch. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown]

The definition of the Patent ductus arteriosus after birth at term is that Abnormal persistent patency of the ductus arteriosus in postnatal life when birth was at 37 completed weeks of gestation or greater. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown]

The definition of the Patent ductus arteriosus after premature birth is that Abnormal persistent patency of the ductus arteriosus when birth was at less than 37 weeks completed gestation. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown]
