The definition of the Bilateral ductus arteriosus is that The presence of both a left and a right ductus arteriosus. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown]

The definition of the Double outlet right ventricle with doubly committed ventricular septal defect and pulmonary stenosis is that A double outlet right ventricle with a subaortic ventricular septal defect (a hole between the two bottom chambers (ventricles) of the heart), that extends anterosuperiorly and are closely related to the pulmonary artery as well, are considered to be doubly committed. There is associated pulmonary stenosis, the abnormal narrowing or constriction of the pulmonary artery, in the main pulmonary artery and/or in the left or right pulmonary artery branches. [PMID:6193702]

The definition of the Double outlet right ventricle with doubly committed ventricular septal defect without pulmonary stenosis is that A double outlet right ventricle with a subaortic ventritricular septal defect (a hole between the two bottom chambers (ventricles) of the heart), that extends anterosuperiorly and are closely related to the pulmonary artery as well, are considered to be doubly committed. There is not associated pulmonary stenosis, the abnormal narrowing or constriction of the pulmonary artery, in the main pulmonary artery and/or in the left or right pulmonary artery branches. [PMID:6193702]

The definition of the Double outlet right ventricle with non-committed ventricular septal defect and pulmonary stenosis is that A double outlet right ventricle with a non-committed ventricular septal defect (VSD), which is a VSD that is anatomically related to, or close to, neither great vessel, being separated from both by considerable muscle, and also has a pulmonary stenosis; abnormal narrowing or constriction of the pulmonary artery, in the main pulmonary artery and/or in the left or right pulmonary artery branches. [PMID:10431853]

The definition of the Double outlet right ventricle with non-committed ventricular septal defect without pulmonary stenosis is that A double outlet right ventricle with a non-committed ventricular septal defect (VSD), which is a VSD that is anatomically related to, or close to, neither great vessel, being separated from both by considerable muscle, but there is not accompanying pulmonary stenosis; the abnormal narrowing or constriction of the pulmonary artery, in the main pulmonary artery and/or in the left or right pulmonary artery branches. [PMID:10431853]

The definition of the Double outlet right ventricle with subaortic ventricular septal defect and pulmonary stenosis is that A double outlet right ventricle with a ventricular spetal defect (a hole between the two bottom chambers (ventricles) of the heart), that is considered to be closely related to the aortic origin. There is associated pulmonary stenosis, the abnormal narrowing or constriction of the pulmonary artery, in the main pulmonary artery and/or in the left or right pulmonary artery branches. [PMID:6193702]

The definition of the Double outlet right ventricle with subaortic ventricular septal defect without pulmonary stenosis is that A double outlet right ventricle with a ventricular spetal defect (a hole between the two bottom chambers (ventricles) of the heart), that is considered to be closely related to the aortic origin. There is not associated pulmonary stenosis, the abnormal narrowing or constriction of the pulmonary artery, in the main pulmonary artery and/or in the left or right pulmonary artery branches. [PMID:6193702]

The definition of the Double outlet right ventricle with subpulmonary ventricular septal defect and pulmonary stenosis is that A double outlet right ventricle with a ventricular spetal defect (a hole between the two bottom chambers (ventricles) of the heart), that is considered to be closely related to the pulmonary origin. There is associated pulmonary stenosis, the abnormal narrowing or constriction of the pulmonary artery, in the main pulmonary artery and/or in the left or right pulmonary artery branches. [PMID:6193702]

The definition of the Double outlet right ventricle with subpulmonary ventricular septal defect without pulmonary stenosis is that A double outlet right ventricle with a ventricular spetal defect (a hole between the two bottom chambers (ventricles) of the heart), that is considered to be closely related to the pulmonary origin. There is not associated pulmonary stenosis, the abnormal narrowing or constriction of the pulmonary artery, in the main pulmonary artery and/or in the left or right pulmonary artery branches. [PMID:20069085, PMID:6193702]

The definition of the Tetralogy of Fallot with absent pulmonary valve is that Features of tetralogy of Fallot with either rudimentary ridges or the complete absence of pulmonic valve tissue. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown]

The definition of the Anomalous origin of one pulmonary artery from ascending aorta is that Anomalous origin of one pulmonary artery from the ascending aorta with the contralateral pulmonary artery arising from the right ventricle. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown, PMID:2590592]

The definition of the Anomalous origin of left pulmonary artery from ascending aorta is that The left pulmonary artery originates from the ascending aorta in the presence of a pulmonary valve and main pulmonary artery. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown]

The definition of the Tricuspid atresia is that Failure to develop of the tricuspid valve and thus lack of the normal connection between the right atrium and the right ventricle. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown, https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199]

The definition of the Right ventricular cardiomyopathy is that Right ventricular dysfunction (global or regional) with functional and morphological right ventricular abnormalities, with or without left ventricular disease.

The definition of the Left ventricular noncompaction cardiomyopathy is that Left ventricular non-compaction (LVNC) is characterized by prominent left ventricular trabeculae and deep inter-trabecular recesses. The myocardial wall is often thickened with a thin, compacted epicardial layer and a thickened endocardial layer. In some patients, LVNC is associated with left ventricular dilatation and systolic dysfunction, which can be transient in neonates. [PMID:17916581]

The definition of the Takotsubo cardiomyopathy is that Transient left ventricular apical ballooning syndrome or takotsubo cardiomyopathy is characterized by transient regional systolic dysfunction involving the left ventricular apex and/or mid-ventricle in the absence of obstructive coronary disease on coronary angiography. Patients present with an abrupt onset of angina-like chest pain, and have diffuse T-wave inversion, sometimes preceded by ST-segment elevation, and mild cardiac enzyme elevation. [PMID:17916581]

The definition of the Absent right superior vena cava is that Absence of the right superior vena cava (RSVC). An absent RSVC is always associated with a persistent left superior vena cava (PLSVC). During normal fetal development, the left-sided anterior venous cardinal system regresses, leaving the coronary sinus (CS) and the ligament of Marshall. Failure of the closure of the left anterior cardinal vein results in PLSVC. In general, PLSVC is associated with the right superior vena cava (RSVC) and drains into the RA via a dilated CS. When developmental arrest occurs at an earlier stage, the CS is absent and the PLSVC drains into the left atrium. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown, PMID:17578953, PMID:19808620, PMID:20532458]

The definition of the Left superior vena cava draining directly to the left atrium is that A persistent left superior vena cava (PLSVC) that drains into the left atrium instead of the right atrium via the coronary sinus, resulting in a right to left sided shunt. [PMID:18847480]

The definition of the Left superior vena cava draining to coronary sinus is that A persistent left superior vena cava (PLSVC) that drains into the right atrium via the coronary sinus. This is the case in 80-92% of cases of PLSVC and results in no hemodynamic consequence. [PMID:18847480]

The definition of the Interrupted inferior vena cava with azygous continuation is that Interrupted inferior vena cava with azygous continuation is the result of connection failure between the right subcardinal vein and the right vitelline vein. Consequently, venous blood from the caudal part of the body reaches the heart via the azygous vein and superior vena cava. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown, PMID:10550884]

The definition of the Cardiac myxoma is that A myxoma (tumor of primitive connective tissue) of the heart. Cardiac myxomas consist of stellate to plump, cytologically bland mesenchymal cells set in a myxoid stroma. Cardiac myxomas are of endocardial origin and general project from the endocardium into a cardiac chamber.
The definition of the Cardiac hemangioma is that Abnormal proliferation of blood vessels within the cardiac cavities attached to the endocardium. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown]

The definition of the Cardiac teratoma is that A teratoma within the heart. Most commonly, these tumors are detected in the pericardial cavity attached to the pulmonary artery and aorta. The tumor size within the heart varies from 2 to 9 cm in diameter, and intrapericardial tumors as large as 15 cm have been reported. Intracardiac tumors arise from the atrial or ventricular wall as nodular masses protruding into the cardiac chambers. Cardiac and pericardial teratomas are easily detected in the fetus and neonate by two-dimensional echocardiography as heterogeneous and encapsulated cystic masses. Histologically, cardiac teratomas contain multiple immature elements including epithelium, neuroglial tissue, thyroid, pancreas, smooth and skeletal muscle, cartilage and bone.

The definition of the Arrhythmia is that Any cardiac rhythm other than the normal sinus rhythm. Such a rhythm may be either of sinus or ectopic origin and either regular or irregular. An arrhythmia may be due to a disturbance in impulse formation or conduction or both. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown, PMID:19063792]

The definition of the Tetralogy of Fallot with pulmonary atresia and major aortopulmonary collateral arteries is that A type of tetralogy of Fallot with pulmonary atresia in which all pulmonary blood flow is derived from major aortopulmonary collateral arteries (MAPCA).

The definition of the Tetralogy of Fallot with pulmonary stenosis is that The commonest form of tetralogy of Fallot characterized by pulmonary stenosis, overriding aorta, ventricular septum defect, and right ventricular hypertrophy, without pulmonary atresia, absent pulmonary valve, atrioventricular canal defect or absent subarterial conus.

The definition of the Subarterial ventricular septal defect is that A ventricular septal defect that lies beneath the semilunar valve(s) in the conal or outlet septum. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown, PMID:10798413]

The definition of the Perimembranous ventricular septal defect is that A ventricular septal defect that is confluent with and involves the membranous septum and is bordered by an atrioventricular valve, not including the type 3 VSDs. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown, PMID:10798413]

The definition of the Restrictive ventricular septal defect is that Any ventricular septal defect (VSD) that is small enough to restrict flow across it such that a pressure gradient exists between the two sides of the VSD. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown, PMID:10798413]

The definition of the Non-restrictive ventricular septal defect is that Any ventricular septal defect (VSD) that does not restrict flow across it sufficiently to generate a pressure gradient between the two sides of the VSD. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown]
The definition of the Infra-aortic superior vena cava is that The superior vena cava passes below the aortic arch. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown]
The definition of the Abnormal coronary artery course is that An abnormal path of a coronary artery. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown]
The definition of the AV nodal tachycardia is that A type of supraventricular tachycardia that originates in the atrioventricular node. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown, PMID:20733110]

The definition of the Permanent junctional reciprocating tachycardia is that An incessant orthodromic tachycardia with anterograde conduction over the atrioventricular node and by retrograde conduction via an accessory pathway usually located in the posteroseptal region with slow and decremental conduction. [PMID:15831598]
The definition of the Cerebellar hemorrhage is that Hemorrhage into the parenchyma of the cerebellum.
The definition of the Automatic atrial tachycardia is that Chronic supraventricular tachycardia predominantly seen in childhood. [PMID:4019927]

The definition of the Multifocal atrial tachycardia is that Multifocal atrial tachycardia is a rare supraventricular arrhythmia in neonates and young infants that is characterized by multiple P waves with varying P wave morphology and is usually asymptomatic. [ORPHA:3282]
The definition of the Abnormal electrophysiology of sinoatrial node origin is that An abnormality of the sinoatrial (SA) node in the right atrium. THe SA node acts as the pacemaker of the heart.
The definition of the Sinus tachycardia is that Heart rate of greater than 100 beats per minute. []

The definition of the Sick sinus syndrome is that An abnormality involving the generation of the action potential by the sinus node and is characterized by an atrial rate inappropriate for physiological requirements. Manifestations include severe sinus bradycardia, sinus pauses or arrest, sinus node exit block, chronic atrial tachyarrhythmias, alternating periods of atrial bradyarrhythmias and tachyarrhythmias, and inappropriate responses of heart rate during exercise or stress. [PMID:17420362]

The definition of the First degree atrioventricular block is that Delay of conduction through the atrioventricular node, which is manifested as prolongation of the PR interval in the electrocardiogram (EKG). All atrial impulses reach the ventricles. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown, https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199]

The definition of the Second degree atrioventricular block is that An intermittent atrioventricular block with failure of some atrial impulses to conduct to the ventricles, i.e., some but not all atrial impulses are conducted through the atrioventricular node and trigger ventricular contraction. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown, https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199]

The definition of the Mobitz I atrioventricular block is that Progressive PR interval prolongation with the subsequent occurrence of a single nonconducted P wave that results in a pause. The pause that follows the nonconducted impulse is less than fully compensatory (less than the sum of two normal sinus intervals). [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown, https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199]

The definition of the Mobitz II atrioventricular block is that A type of second degree atrioventricular (AV) block characterized by sudden failure to conduct an impulse through the AV node without a preceding change in the PR interval. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown, https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199]

The definition of the Atrioventricular dissociation is that Atrioventricular (AV) dissociation is present if the atria and the ventricles are under the control of two separate pacemakers. AV dissociation can occur in the absence of a primary AV conduction disturbance.

The definition of the Bundle branch block is that Block of conduction of electrical impulses along the Bundle of His or along one of its bundle branches. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown, https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199]
The definition of the Left anterior fascicular block is that Conduction block in the anterior division of the left bundle branch of the bundle of His. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown]

The definition of the Right bundle branch block is that A conduction block of the right branch of the bundle of His. This manifests as a prolongation of the QRS complex (greater than 0.12 s) with delayed activation of the right ventricle and terminal delay on the EKG. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown, https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199]

The definition of the Left bundle branch block is that A conduction block of the left branch of the bundle of His. This manifests as a generalized disturbance of QRS morphology on EKG. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown, https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199]

The definition of the Libman-Sacks lesions is that Libman-Sacks valvular lesions are sterile fibrofibrinous vegetations that favor the left-sided heart valves and usually form on the ventricular surface of the mitral valve. [PMID:18421506]
The definition of the Trifascicular block is that Abnormal conduction in all three divisions of the intraventricular conducting tissue. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown]

The definition of the Junctional ectopic tachycardia is that Junctional ectopic tachycardia (JET) is a unique type of supraventricular arrhythmia defined by narrow QRS complex and atrioventricular (AV) dissociation or retrograde atrial conduction in a 1:1 pattern. [PMID:22826742]

The definition of the AV nodal reentry tachycardia is that Accessory pathway-related atrioventricular reentrant tachycardia (AVRT) involves an abnormal electrical conduction of the accessory pathway. The accessory pathway connecting impulses between the atrium and the ventricle can be seen at any site in the AV groove. []
The definition of the Abnormality of the pulmonary veins is that An abnormality of the pulmonary veins.
The definition of the Supracardiac total anomalous pulmonary venous connection is that Type 1 total anomalous pulmonary venous connection. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown]
The definition of the Cardiac total anomalous pulmonary venous connection is that Type 2 total anomalous pulmonary venous connection. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown]
The definition of the Infracardiac total anomalous pulmonary venous connection is that Type 3 total anomalous pulmonary venous connection. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown]
The definition of the Mixed total anomalous pulmonary venous connection is that Type 4 total anomalous pulmonary venous connection. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown]
The definition of the Congenital malformation of the right heart is that Defect or defects of the morphogenesis of the right heart identifiable at birth. []

The definition of the Uhl's anomaly is that Uhl anomaly of the right ventricle refers to the almost complete absence of right ventricular myocardium, normal tricuspid valve, and preserved septal and left ventricular myocardium. [PMID:10859296, PMID:16322929]

The definition of the Persistent fetal circulation is that Systemic desaturation of a liveborn baby resulting from persistent pulmonary hypertension with a patent ductus arteriosus and patent foramen ovale, such that the circulation in postnatal life follows the fetal course. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_dbrown]
The definition of the Peroneal muscle weakness is that Weakness of the peroneal muscles.

The definition of the Elbow clonus is that Clonus at the elbow joint, i.e., an exaggerated phasic stretch reflex characterized by repetitive, rhythmic contractions at the elbow, generated by rapid passive stretch at the elbow joint.
The definition of the Abnormality of joint mobility is that An abnormality in the range and ease of motion of joints across their normal range.

The definition of the Abnormality of central sensory function is that An abnormality of sensation related to CNS function. Assuming the primary sensory modalities are intact and the patient is alert and cooperative, the presence of an abnormality of sensory function may indicate a lesion of a parietal cortex, the thalamocortical projections to the parietal cortex, or the spinal cord.
The definition of the Abnormality of circulating cortisol level is that An abnormality of the concentration of cortisol in the blood.
The definition of the Abnormality of adrenal morphology is that Any structural anomaly of the adrenal glands.
The definition of the Abnormality of adrenal physiology is that A functional abnormality of the adrenal glands.

The definition of the Central adrenal insufficiency is that A form of adrenal insufficiency related to a lack of ACTH, which leads to a decrease in the production of cortisol by the adrenal glands. Aldosterone production is not usually affected.
The definition of the Adrenocorticotropin (ACTH) deficient adrenal insufficiency is that Adrenal insufficiency secondary to a defect in ACTH production.
The definition of the Primary hyperaldosteronism is that A form of hyperaldosteronism caused by a defect within the adrenal gland.
The definition of the Corticotropin-releasing hormone (CRH) deficient adrenal insufficiency is that Adrenal insufficiency secondary to a defect in corticotropin-releasing hormone production.
The definition of the Corticotropin-releasing hormone receptor (CRHR) defect is that Adrenal insufficiency secondary to a defect in the corticotropin-releasing hormone receptor.

The definition of the Dexamethasone-suppresible primary hyperaldosteronism is that A form of primary hyperaldosteronism in which the overproduction of aldosterone can be suppressed by the administration of dexamethasone.

The definition of the Glucocorticoid-insensitive primary hyperaldosteronism is that A form of primary hyperaldosteronism in which the overproduction of aldosterone cannot be suppressed by the administration of dexamethasone or similar glucocorticoids.
The definition of the Secondary hyperaldosteronism is that A form of hyperaldosteronism caused by abnormally increased renin levels.
The definition of the Ectopic adrenal gland is that Abnormal anatomical location of the adrenal gland.
The definition of the Adrenal gland agenesis is that Absent development of the adrenal gland.
The definition of the Secondary hypercorticolism is that Hypercortisolemia associated with a overproduction of ACTH (often from a tumor), leading secondarily to overproduction of cortisol.
The definition of the Non-secretory adrenocortical adenoma is that An hormonally inactive adrenocortical adenoma, that is, an adenoma that does not secrete excessive amounts of adrenal hormones.
The definition of the Secretory adrenocortical adenoma is that An hormonally active adrenocortical adenoma, that is, an adenoma that secretes excessive amounts of adrenal hormones.
The definition of the Abnormality of the anterior pituitary is that An abnormality of the adenohypophysis, which is also known as the anterior lobe of the pituitary gland.

The definition of the Adrenocorticotropic hormone deficiency is that A reduced ability to secrete adrenocorticotropic hormone (ACTH), a hormone that stimulates the adrenal cortex to secrete of glucocorticoids such as cortisol.

The definition of the Adrenocorticotropic hormone excess is that Overproduction of adrenocorticotropic hormone (ACTH), which generally leads secondarily to overproduction of cortisol by the adrenal cortex.
The definition of the Neoplasm of the anterior pituitary is that A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the adenohypophysis, which is also known as the anterior lobe of the pituitary gland.
The definition of the Abnormality of the posterior pituitary is that An abnormality of the neurohypophysis, which is also known as the posterior lobe of the hypophysis.
The definition of the Neoplasm of the posterior pituitary is that The presence of a neoplasm (tumor) in the neurohypophysis, which is also known as the posterior lobe of the hypophysis.
The definition of the Posterior pituitary dysgenesis is that Abnormal development of the neurohypophysis during embryonic growth and development.

The definition of the Pituicytoma is that A solid, low grade, spindle cell, glial neoplasm of adults that originates in the neurohypophysis or infundibulum. Clinical signs and symptoms include visual disturbance, headache and features of hypopituitarism. Pituicytomas are well-circumscribed, solid masses that can measure up to several centimeters. Histologically, they show a compact architecture consisting of elongate, bipolar spindle cells arranged in interlacing fascicles or assuming a storiform pattern.

The definition of the Ectopic posterior pituitary is that An abnormal anatomical location of the posterior lobe of the hypophysis, also known as the neurohypophysis. The posterior pituitary is normally present in the dorsal portion of the sella turcica, but when ectopic is usually near the median eminence. This defect is likely to be due to abnormal migration during embryogenesis.
The definition of the Posterior pituitary agenesis is that Absence of the neurohypophysis owing to a developmental defect.
The definition of the Posterior pituitary hypoplasia is that Underdevelopment of the neurohypophysis.
The definition of the Pituitary gonadotropic cell adenoma is that A type of pituitary adenoma that produces gonadotropins.
The definition of the Pituitary growth hormone cell adenoma is that A type of pituitary adenoma that produces growth hormone.

The definition of the Pituitary null cell adenoma is that A type of pituitary adenoma that is of unknown cellular origin and that lacks immunocytochemical or fine structural markers. Null cell adenomas are not associated with hormone excess.
The definition of the Pituitary thyrotropic cell adenoma is that A type of pituitary adenoma that produces thyroid stimulating hormone (TSH).

The definition of the Pituitary carcinoma is that A pituitary tumor with subarachnoid, brain, or systemic metastasis. The diagnosis of a pituitary carcinoma requires evidence of metastatic disease, either outside the central nervous system (CNS) or as separate noncontiguous foci within the CNS.

The definition of the Pituitary spindle cell oncocytoma is that A spindled-to-epithelioid, oncocytic, nonendocrine neoplasm of the anterior hypophysis that manifests in adults and follows a benign clinical course. Pituitary spindle cell oncocytomas are firm, fibrous, and adherent to surrounding structures and are highly vascular.
The definition of the Abnormality of the parathyroid morphology is that A structural abnormality of the parathyroid gland.
The definition of the Abnormality of the parathyroid physiology is that A functional abnormality of the parathyroid gland.
The definition of the Parathyroid dysgenesis is that Abnormal embryonic development of the parathyroid gland.
The definition of the Ectopic parathyroid is that An abnormal anatomical location of the parathyroid gland.

The definition of the Tertiary hyperparathyroidism is that A type of hyperparathyroidism that occurs following kidney transplantation, which is a treatment for secondary hyperparathyroidism. Although kidney transplantation leads to a normalization of serum calcium and parathyroid hormone in most patients. The state of persistent hypercalcemia and hyperparathyroidism is referred to as tertiary hyperparathyroidism.
The definition of the Autoimmune hypoparathyroidism is that A type of hypoparathyroidism with circulating antiparathyroid or anti-calcium sensing receptor antibodies indicative of autoimmunity.
The definition of the Abnormality of thyroid morphology is that A structural abnormality of the thyroid gland.
The definition of the Uninodular goiter is that Enlargement of the thyroid gland related to a singular nodule in the thyroid gland.
The definition of the Thyroid hemiagenesis is that Absence of a lobe of the thyroid gland related to a failure of its embryologic development.
The definition of the Thyroid C cell hyperplasia is that An abnormal growth of parafollicular (C-cells) cells.

The definition of the Central hypothyroidism is that A type of hypothyroidism due to an insufficient stimulation of an otherwise normal thyroid gland. Central hypothyroidism is caused by either pituitary (secondary hypothyroidism) or hypothalamic (tertiary hypothyroidism) defects.
The definition of the Increased serum free triiodothyronine (fT3) is that An elevated concentration of free 3,3',5-triiodo-L-thyronine in the blood circulation.
The definition of the Activating thyroid-stimulating hormone receptor (TSHR) defect is that Gain-of-function thyroid-stimulating hormone receptor (TSHR) defect.
The definition of the Inactivating thyroid-stimulating hormone receptor (TSHR) defect is that Loss-of-function thyroid-stimulating hormone receptor (TSHR) defect.
The definition of the Neoplasm by histology is that Neoplasm categorized according to type of histological abnormality.
The definition of the Neoplasm by anatomical site is that Neoplasm categorized according to the anatomical site of origin of the neoplasm.
The definition of the Embryonal renal neoplasm is that The presence of an embryonal neoplasm of the kidney that primarily affects children.

The definition of the Intralobar nephroblastomatosis is that Presence of persistent islands of renal blastema in the postnatal kidney, anywhere within a renal lobe (a portion of a kidney consisting of a renal pyramid and the renal cortex above it).
The definition of the Perilobar nephroblastomatosis is that Abnormally persistent foci of embryonal immature blastema located in the superficial cortical region (perilobar).

The definition of the Papillary renal cell carcinoma type 1 is that A type of papillary renal cell carcinoma that is characterized by small cuboidal cells covering thin papillae with a single line of uniform nuclei and small nucleoli.

The definition of the Renal oncocytoma is that A renal tumor originating from an oncocyte, which is an epithelial cell characterized by an excessive amount of mitochondria, resulting in an abundant acidophilic, granular cytoplasm.

The definition of the Midface retrusion is that Posterior positions and/or vertical shortening of the infraorbital and perialar regions, or increased concavity of the face and/or reduced nasolabial angle.
The definition of the Enlargement of parotid gland is that Increased size of the parotid gland.
The definition of the Bifid nose is that Visually assessable vertical indentation, cleft, or depression of the nasal bridge, ridge and tip. [PMID:19152422]
The definition of the Abnormality of muscle physiology is that A functional abnormality of a skeletal muscle.
The definition of the Abnormality of muscle morphology is that A structural abnormality of a skeletal muscle.
The definition of the Type 1 muscle fiber atrophy is that Atrophy (wasting) affecting primary type 1 muscle fibers. This feature in general can only be observed on muscle biopsy.
The definition of the Decreased patellar reflex is that Decreased intensity of the patellar reflex (also known as the knee jerk reflex).
The definition of the Paradoxical myotonia is that A type of myotonia that worsens with repeated muscle contractions.

The definition of the Impaired two-point discrimination is that A reduced ability to distinguish tactile sensations at points that are very close to one another. This can be tested by using special calipers whose points can be set from 2mm to several centimeters apart.

The definition of the Impaired touch localization is that A reduced ability to identify precisely the site of a touch. This test is usually carried out by asking a patient, whose eyes are closed or covered, to touch the same site with a fingertip.

The definition of the Agraphesthesia is that Impaired ability to recognize letters or numbers drawn by an examiner's fingertip on the patient's skin (the patients eyes are closed or covered throughout this examination).

The definition of the Increased cerebral lipofuscin is that Lipofuscin (age pigment) is a brown-yellow, electron-dense, autofluorescent material that accumulates progressively over time in lysosomes of postmitotic cells, such as neurons and cardiac myocytes. This term pertains if there is an increase in the accumulation of lipofuscin (also known as autofluorescent lipoprotein) more than expected for the age of the patient.
The definition of the Increased urinary hypoxanthine is that The concentration of hypoxanthine in the urine, normalized for urine concentration, is above the upper limit of normal.

The definition of the Cephalocele is that A congenital defect in the skull, whereby there is a protrusion of part of the cranial contents through a congenital defect in the cranium, usually covered with skin or mucous membrane. The term encephalocele refers to a subclass of these lesions in which brain tissue protrudes through the defect.
The definition of the Parietal encephalocele is that An encephalocele located between bregma and lambda.

The definition of the Basal encephalocele is that Basal encephalocele is an encephalocele that occurs along the cribriform plate or through the sphenoid bone. The mass may appear in the nasal cavity, nasopharynx, epipharynx, sphenoid sinus, posterior orbit, or pterygopalatine fossa. The important distinction from other types is that no external tumor is visible except in those rare instances of herniations so large that they protrude through the mouth or nares.

The definition of the Submucous cleft soft palate is that A cleft of the muscular (soft) portion of the palate that is covered by mucous membrane. Soft-palate submucous clefts are characterized by a midline deficiency or lack of muscle tissue.

The definition of the Membranous choanal atresia is that Absence of the normal opening of the choana (the posterior nasal aperture) as a result of an obstructing choanal membrane that may be thin and strandlike or thick and pluglike. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_jhurst]
The definition of the Abnormality of facial skeleton is that An abnormality of one or more of the set of bones that make up the facial skeleton.
The definition of the Broad chin is that Increased width of the midpoint of the mandible (mental protuberance) and overlying soft tissue. [PMID:19125436]

The definition of the Chin with horizontal crease is that Horizontal crease or fold situated below the vermilion border of the lower lip and above the fatty pad of the chin, with the face at rest. [PMID:19125436]
The definition of the Chin with H-shaped crease is that H-shaped crease in the fat pad of the chin. [PMID:19125436]
The definition of the Tented philtrum is that Prominence of a triangular soft tissue area of the philtrum with the apex to the columella. [PMID:19152422]
The definition of the Philtrum with midline raphe is that Narrow ridge in the midline of the philtral groove. [PMID:19152422]
The definition of the Malaligned philtral ridges is that Absence of the usual parallel position of philtral ridges. [PMID:19152422]
The definition of the Midline sinus of philtrum is that Pit in the midline of the philtral groove. [PMID:19152422]

The definition of the Narrow philtrum is that Distance between the philtral ridges, measured just above the vermilion border, more than 2 standard deviations below the mean. Alternatively, an apparently decreased distance between the ridges of the philtrum. [PMID:19152422]
The definition of the Abnormality of oral mucosa is that Abnormality of the oral mucosa.
The definition of the Deviated nasal tip is that Nasal tip positioned to one side of the midline. [PMID:19152422]
The definition of the Narrow nasal tip is that Decrease in width of the nasal tip. [PMID:19152422]
The definition of the Overhanging nasal tip is that Positioning of the nasal tip inferior to the nasal base. [PMID:19152422]

The definition of the Moyamoya phenomenon is that A noninflammatory, progressive occlusion of the intracranial carotid arteries owing to the formation of netlike collateral arteries arising from the circle of Willis.
The definition of the Absent scaphoid is that Congenital absence of the scaphoid.. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_jcampbell]
The definition of the Delayed talus ossification is that Delayed maturation and calcification of the talus.
The definition of the Partial IgA deficiency is that Detectable but decreased IgA levels that are more than 2 standard deviations below normal age-adjusted means.
The definition of the Sclerodactyly is that Localized thickening and tightness of the skin of the fingers or toes.
The definition of the Abnormality of T cell number is that A deviation from the normal count of T cells.
The definition of the Abnormality of T cell physiology is that A functional anomaly of T cells.

The definition of the Ventricular flutter is that A potentially lethal cardiac arrhythmia characterized by an extremely rapid, hemodynamically unstable ventricular tachycardia (150-300 beats/min) with a large oscillating sine-wave appearance.
The definition of the Abnormality of mor skeletal phology is that An abnormality of the form, structure, or size of the skeletal system.
The definition of the Abnormality of skeletal physiology is that An abnormality of the function of the skeletal system.
The definition of the Abnormal appendicular skeleton morphology is that An abnormality of the appendicular skeletal system, consisting of the of the limbs, shoulder and pelvic girdles.
The definition of the Short second metatarsal is that Short (hypoplastic) second metatarsal bone.
The definition of the Osteoblastoma is that A benign, painful, tumor of bone characterized by the formation of osteoid tissue, primitive bone and calcified tissue.
The definition of the Giant cell tumor of bone is that A bone tumor composed of cellular spindle-cell stroma containing scattered multinucleated giant cells resembling osteoclasts.

The definition of the Abnormal bone ossification is that Any anomaly in the formation of bone or of a bony substance, or the conversion of fibrous tissue or of cartilage into bone or a bony substance.
The definition of the Parotitis is that Inflammation of the parotid gland.
The definition of the Hemopericardium is that Accumulation of blood within the pericardial sac.

The definition of the Chylopericardium is that Accumulation of chyle (the whitish fluid taken up by the lacteals in the intestine, consisting of an emulsion of lymph and triglyceride fat thatpasses into the veins by the thoracic duct) in the pericardium. Chylopericardium is generally caused by obstruction of or trauma to the thoracic duct.
The definition of the Serous pericardial effusion is that Accumulation of serous fluid (pale yellow and transparent fluid) in the pericardial sac.
The definition of the Hemoperitoneum is that Accumulation of blood in the peritoneal cavity owing to internal hemorrhage.
The definition of the Pharyngeal edema is that Abnormal accumulation of fluid leading to swelling of the pharynx.

The definition of the Pica is that An appetite for and the persistent ingestion of non-food substances such as clay. In order to diagnose pica, this behavior must have persisted over a period of at least one month.
The definition of the Plasmacytoma is that A malignant plasma cell tumor growing within soft tissue or within the skeleton.
The definition of the Punctate keratitis is that A type of keratitis characterized by inflammation in pinpoint areas of the corneal epithelium.
The definition of the Metaphyseal dappling is that The presence of spots or rounded patches of abnormally increased density of metaphyseal bone.
The definition of the Bilateral trilobed lungs is that Both lungs have three lobes. Normally, the left lung has two lobes, whereas the right lung has three lobes.

The definition of the Abnormal bone collagen fibril morphology is that Any structural anomaly of the connective tissue bundles in the extracellular matrix of bone tissue that are composed of collagen, and play a role in tissue strength and elasticity.
The definition of the Abnormal sternal ossification is that Any anomaly in the formation of the bony substance of the sternum.

The definition of the Elevated plasma pyrophosphate is that An abnormally increased diphosphate(4-) concentration in the blood. Diphosphate(4-), as ester with two phosphate groups, is also known as pyrophosphate.
The definition of the Abnormality of the wing of the ilium is that An anomaly of the ilium ala. This is the large expanded portion of the ilum which bounds the greater pelvis laterally.
The definition of the Sciatica is that Pain in the lower back and hip radiating in the distribution of the sciatic nerve.
The definition of the Abnormal platelet function is that Any anomaly in the function of thrombocytes.

The definition of the Impaired arachidonic acid-induced platelet aggregation is that Abnormal response to arachidonic acid as manifested by reduced or lacking aggregation of platelets upon addition of arachidonic acid.

The definition of the Impaired ristocetin-induced platelet aggregation is that Abnormal response to ristocetin as manifested by reduced or lacking aggregation of platelets upon addition of ristocetin.

The definition of the Impaired thrombin-induced platelet aggregation is that Abnormal response to thrombin or thrombin mimetics as manifested by reduced or lacking aggregation of platelets upon addition of thrombin (or thrombin mimetics).

The definition of the Abnormal platelet count is that Abnormal number of platelets per volume of blood. In a healthy adult, a normal platelet count is between 150,000 and 450,000 per microliter of blood.
The definition of the Heparin-induced thrombocytopenia is that Low platelet count following administration of unfractionated or (less commonly) low-molecular weight heparin.
The definition of the Abnormal platelet morphology is that An anomaly in platelet form, ultrastructure, or intracellular organelles.

The definition of the Abnormal platelet volume is that Anomalous size of platelets. Most normal sized platelets are 1.5 to 3 micrometers in diameter. Large platelets are 4 to 7 micrometers. Giant platelets are larger than 7 micrometers and usually 10 to 20 micrometers.
The definition of the Increased mean platelet volume is that Average platelet volume above the upper limit of the normal reference interval.

The definition of the Abnormal platelet membrane protein expression is that Presence of reduced amount of a membrane protein on the cell membrane of platelets. This feature is typically measured by flow cytometry.
The definition of the Decreased platelet glycoprotein Ib-IX-V is that Decreased cell membrane concentration of the glycoprotein complex Ib-IX-V.

The definition of the Acute disseminated intravascular coagulation is that An acute form of disseminated intravascular coagulation. Acute DIC can occur following sudden exposure of blood to procoagulants, with the compensatory hemostatic mechanisms becoming overwhelmed.
The definition of the Decreased platelet glycoprotein VI is that Decreased cell membrane concentration of glycoprotein VI.
The definition of the Decreased platelet P2Y12 receptor is that Decreased cell membrane concentration of P2Y12 receptor.
The definition of the Abnormal platelet granules is that An anomaly of alpha or dense granules or platelet lysosomes.
The definition of the Abnormal umbilical stump bleeding is that Abnormal bleeding of the umbilical stump following separation of the cord at approximately 7-10 days after birth.
The definition of the Hemorrhage of the eye is that Bleeding from vessels of the various tissues of the eye.
The definition of the Hyphema is that Bleeding in the anterior chamber of the eye.
The definition of the Choroid hemorrhage is that Hemorrhage from the vessels of the choroid.
The definition of the Bleeding requiring red cell transfusion is that Bleeding sufficiently severe as to require red cell transfusion (WHO Grade 3 or 4).
The definition of the Bleeding with minor or no trauma is that Significant bleeding or hemorrhage without significant precipitating factor.
The definition of the Prolonged bleeding following procedure is that Prolonged or protracted bleeding following an invasive procedure or intervention.
The definition of the Post-partum hemorrhage is that Significant maternal haemorrhage/blood loss following deilvery of a child.
The definition of the Abnormal leukocyte count is that Number of leukocytes per volume of blood beyond normal limits.

The definition of the Impaired thromboxane A2 agonist-induced platelet aggregation is that Abnormal response to thromboxane as manifested by reduced or lacking aggregation of platelets upon addition of thromboxane A2 receptor agonists.

The definition of the Anemia due to reduced life span of red cells is that A type of anemia related to a reduction in the average life span of red blood cells in the peripheral circulation, which is normally around 120 days.
The definition of the Subconjunctival hemorrhage is that Bleeding beneath the mucous membrane that lines the inner surface of the eyelid.
The definition of the Neutrophillia is that Increased number of neutrophils circulating in blood.
The definition of the Abnormality of circulating fibrinogen is that An abnormality of the level of activity of circulating fibrinogen.
The definition of the Hyperfibrinogenemia is that Increased concentration of fibrinogen in the blood.
The definition of the Hypofibrinogenemia is that Decreased concentration of fibrinogen in the blood.
The definition of the Dysfibrinogenemia is that Qualitatively abnormal fibrinogen.
The definition of the Abnormal hemoglobin is that Anomaly in the level or the function of hemoglobin, the oxygen-carrying protein of erythrocytes.

The definition of the Hemoglobin H is that Hemoglobin H (HbH) contains four beta-globin chains. It is normally not present at all in blood, but may make up about 1-40 percent of all hemoglobin in HbH disease, a subform of alpha thalassemia.

The definition of the Persistence of hemoglobin F is that Hemoglobin F (HbF) contains two globin alpha chains and two globin gamma chains. It is the main form of hemoglobin in the fetus during the last seven months of intrauterine development and in the half year of postnatal life. In adults it normally makes up less than one percent of all hemoglobin. This term refers to an increase in HbF above this limit. In beta thalassemia major, it may represent over 90 percent of all hemoglobin, and in beta thalassemia minor it may make up between 0.5 to 4 percent.

The definition of the Reduced hemoglobin A is that Hemoglobin A (HbA) contains two globin alpha chains and two globin beta chains. HbA is normally the main adult hemoglobin, representing about 96-98 percent of all hemoglobin. This term represents a decreased in the proportion of HbA below this limit, and can be seen in various forms of thalassemia.

The definition of the Reduced beta/alpha synthesis ratio is that A reduction in the ratio of production of beta globin to that of alpha globin. This is the major abnormality in the various forms of beta thalassemia.

The definition of the Reduced alpha/beta synthesis ratio is that A reduction in the ratio of production of alpha globin to that of beta globin. This is the major abnormality in the various forms of alpha thalassemia.
The definition of the Unilateral radial aplasia is that Missing radius bone on one side only associated with congenital failure of development.
The definition of the Flattened metacarpal heads is that Abnormally flat shape of the heads of the metacarpal bones.
The definition of the Shortening of all phalanges of the finger is that Abnormal reduction in length affecting all phalanges.
The definition of the Abnormality of metacarpophalangeal joint is that An anomaly of a metacarpophalangeal joint.

The definition of the Abnormality of the glenoid fossa is that An anomaly of the glenoid fossa, also known as the glenoid cavity, which is the articular surface of the scapula that articulates with the head of the humerus.
The definition of the Lumbar hypertrichosis is that Excessive, increased hair growth located in the lumbar region.
The definition of the Thoracic hypertrichosis is that Excessive, increased hair growth located in the thoracic region.
The definition of the Cardiovascular calcification is that Abnormal calcification in the cardiovascular system.
The definition of the Toe extensor amyotrophy is that Atrophy of the extensor digitorum longus muscles, which mediate extension of the toes.
The definition of the Short 5th toe is that Underdevelopment (hypoplasia) of the fifth toe.
The definition of the Fourth toe clinodactyly is that Bending or curvature of a fourth toe in the tibial direction (i.e., towards the big toe).
The definition of the Pleural empyema is that Accumulation of pus in the pleural cavity.

The definition of the Transudative pleural effusion is that A type of pleural effusion with a transudate (extravascular fluid with low protein content and a low specific gravity). Pleural effusions can be classified as transudates or exudates based on Light's criteria, which classify an effusion as exudate if one or more of the following are present: (1) the ratio of pleural fluid protein to serum protein is greater than 0.5, (2) the ratio of pleural fluid lactate dehydrogenase (LDH) to serum LDH is greater than 0.6, or (3) the pleural fluid LDH level is greater than two thirds of the upper limit of normal for serum LDH. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_tkuijpers, https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199, PMID:16623208]

The definition of the Exudative pleural effusion is that A type of pleural effusion with a exudate (extravascular fluid that has exuded out of a tissue or its capillaries due to injury or inflammation). Pleural effusions can be classified as transudates or exudates based on Light's criteria, which classify an effusion as exudate if one or more of the following are present: (1) the ratio of pleural fluid protein to serum protein is greater than 0.5, (2) the ratio of pleural fluid lactate dehydrogenase (LDH) to serum LDH is greater than 0.6, or (3) the pleural fluid LDH level is greater than two thirds of the upper limit of normal for serum LDH. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_tkuijpers, https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199, PMID:16623208]
The definition of the Abnormal activity of mitochondrial respiratory chain is that An increased or decreased activity of the mitochondrial respiratory chain.

The definition of the Decreased activity of mitochondrial complex I is that A reduction in the activity of the mitochondrial respiratory chain complex I, which is part of the electron transport chain in mitochondria.

The definition of the Decreased activity of mitochondrial complex III is that A reduction in the activity of the mitochondrial respiratory chain complex III, which is part of the electron transport chain in mitochondria.

The definition of the Decreased activity of mitochondrial ATP synthase complex is that A reduction in the activity of the mitochondrial proton-transporting ATP synthase complex, which makes ATP via oxidative phosphorylation, and is sometimes described as Complex V of the electron transport chain.
The definition of the Proximal placement of hallux is that Proximal mislocalization of the big toe from its normal position.
The definition of the Short digit is that One or more digit that appears disproportionately short compared to the hand/foot, whereby either the entire digit or a specific phalanx is shortened.
The definition of the Short proximal phalanx of toe is that Developmental hypoplasia (shortening) of proximal phalanx of toe.

The definition of the Hypersegmentation of proximal phalanx of third finger is that Presence of an additional phalanx-like bone, producing an extra, wedge-shaped bone at the base of the proximal phalanx of the third finger.

The definition of the Abnormality of the cerebellar peduncle is that An anomaly of the cerebellar peduncles. The superior, middle, and inferior cerebellar peduncles emerge from the cerebellum. The superior cerebellar penduncles connect the cerebellum to the midbrain, the middle cerebellar peduncles connect the cerebellum to the pons, and the inferior cerebellar peduncle connects the medulla spinalis and medulla oblongata with the cerebellum.
The definition of the Abnormality of the superior cerebellar peduncle is that An anomaly of the superior cerebellar peduncle.
The definition of the Elongated superior cerebellar peduncle is that Increased length of the superior cerebellar peduncle.
The definition of the Mesenteric artery aneurysm is that Abnormal outpouching or sac-like dilatation in the wall of the inferior mesenteric artery or superior mesenteric artery .
The definition of the Decreased urinary urate is that Decreased concentration of urate in the urine.
The definition of the Decreased plasma total carnitine is that A decreased concentration of total carnitine in the blood.
The definition of the Hypoplastic fifth toenail is that Underdeveloped nails of the fifth toes.
The definition of the 3-4 finger cutaneous syndactyly is that A soft tissue continuity in the A/P axis between fingers 3 and 4.
The definition of the Anterior wedging of T12 is that An abnormality of the shape of the thoracic vertebra T12 such that it is wedge-shaped (narrow towards the front).
The definition of the Anterior wedging of L2 is that An abnormality of the shape of the lumbar vertebra L2 such that it is wedge-shaped (narrow towards the front).
The definition of the Increased urinary sulfite is that The concentration of SO3(2-), i.e., sulfite, in the urine, normalized for urine concentration, is above the upper limit of normal.
The definition of the Increased urinary thiosulfate is that Increased concentration of thiosulfate(2-) in the urine.

The definition of the Small vessel vasculitis is that A type of vasculitis (inflammation of blood vessel walls) that affects blood vessels that are smaller than arteries, i.e., arterioles, venules, and capilllaries.

The definition of the Bronchiolitis obliterans organizing pneumonia is that Bronchiolitis obliterans organizing pneumonia (BOOP) is and interstitial lung abnormalitiy characterized histopathologically by plugs of granulation tissue lying within small airways, alveolar ducts, and alveoli and by chronic inflammatory cell infiltration in alveolar walls. Patients with BOOP generally present with subacute illness, including shortness of breath, fever, malaise, and weight loss. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_tkuijpers, https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199, PMID:20858818]
The definition of the Bronchiolitis obliterans is that Inflammation and fibrosis of the bronchioles leading to partial or complete obstruction of these airways.
The definition of the Respiratory tract infection is that An infection of the upper or lower respiratory tract.
The definition of the Acute respiratory tract infection is that A history of repeated acute infections of the upper or lower respiratory tract. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_tkuijpers]
The definition of the Acute infectious pneumonia is that Acute inflammation of the lung due to an infection. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_tkuijpers]
The definition of the Bronchiolitis is that Inflammation of the bronchioles. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_tkuijpers]
The definition of the Aspiration pneumonia is that Pneumonia due to the aspiration (breathing in) of food, liquid, or gastric contents into the upper respiratory tract.
The definition of the Pulmonary lymphoma is that Lung parenchymal involvement with lymphoma. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:DDD_tkuijpers]

The definition of the Nodular regenerative hyperplasia of liver is that Diffuse benign transformation of the hepatic parenchyma into small regenerative nodules with minimal or no fibrosis. [PMID:21472097]

The definition of the Hepatic granulomatosis is that The presence of multiple granulomas in the liver as based on pathological examination. Granulomas are small 0.5 to 2 mm collections of modified macrophages called epithelioid cells usually surrounded by lymphocytes.

The definition of the Intestinal lymphoid nodular  hyperplasia is that A lymphoproliferative abnormality of the intestine characterized by numerous visible mucosal nodules measuring up to, and rarely exceeding, 0.5 cm in diameter Histologically, hyperplastic lymphoid follicles with large germinal centres are seen in the lamina propria and superficial submucosa. There is enlargement of the mucosal B cell follicles caused by hyperplasia of the follicle centres; surrounded by a normal appearing mantle zone. Disease may involve the stomach, the entire small intestine, and the large intestine.

The definition of the Abnormality of the pectoral muscle is that An abnormality of the pectoral muscle, comprising the pectoralis major, a thick, fan-shaped muscle of the anterior chest and the pectoralis minor, a thin, triangular muscle situated underneath the pectoralis major.
The definition of the Retinal perforation is that A small hole through the whole thickness of the retina.
The definition of the Unilateral hypoplasia of pectoralis major muscle is that Hypoplasia (underdevelopment) of the pectoralis minor on only one side of the chest.
The definition of the Substantia nigra gliosis is that Focal proliferation of glial cells in the substantia nigra.

The definition of the Non-obstructive azoospermia is that Absence of any measurable level of sperm in his semen, resulting from a defect in the production of spermatozoa in the testes. This can be differentiated from obstructive azoospermia on the basis of testicular biopsy.

The definition of the Obstructive azoospermia is that Absence of any measurable level of sperm in his semen, resulting from post-testicular obstruction or retrograde ejaculation. This can be differentiated from obstructive azoospermia on the basis of testicular biopsy.

The definition of the Pretesticular azoospermia is that Absence of any measurable level of sperm in his semen, due to a hypothalamic or pituitary abnormality diagnosed with hypo-gonadotropic-hypogonadism. The diagnosis is made on the basis of low LH and FSH levels and low or normal testosterone levels.
The definition of the Intermittent painful muscle spasms is that History of repeated intermittent involuntary muscle contractions that were painful.
The definition of the Abnormality of citrulline metabolism is that Any deviation from the normal concentration of citrulline in the blood circulation.
The definition of the Elevated plasma citrulline is that An increased concentration of citrulline in the blood.
The definition of the Hypocupremia is that A reduced concentration of copper in the blood.
The definition of the Feeding difficulties is that Impaired ability to eat related to problems gathering food and getting ready to suck, chew, or swallow it.
The definition of the Elevated luteinizing hormone is that An elevated concentration of luteinizing hormone in the blood.

The definition of the Cerebral amyloid angiopathy is that Amyloid deposition in the walls of leptomeningeal and cortical arteries, arterioles, and less often capillaries and veins of the central nervous system.

The definition of the Dermatographic urticaria is that An exaggerated whealing tendency when the skin is stroked, that is, formation of red, itchy bumps and lines on the skin as a result of pressure on the skin (for instance, stroking the skin with a pen or tongue depressor).
The definition of the Hypoglycorrhachia is that Abnormally low glucose concentration in the cerebrospinal fluid.
The definition of the Paroxysmal lethargy is that Repeated episodes of sudden-onset and transient lethargy. []
The definition of the Myelofibrosis is that Replacement of bone marrow by fibrous tissue.
The definition of the Aminoglycoside-induced hearing loss is that Partial or complete loss of hearing following ingestion of aminoglycoside antibiotics.
The definition of the Elevated urinary catecholamines is that The concentration of a catecholamine in the urine, normalized for urine concentration, is above the upper limit of normal.
The definition of the Elevated urinary homovanillic acid is that An increased concentration of homovanillic acid in the urine.
The definition of the Elevated urinary vanillylmandelic acid is that An increased concentration of vanillylmandelic acid in the urine.
The definition of the Elevated urinary dopamine is that The concentration of dopamine in the urine, normalized for urine concentration, is above the upper limit of normal.
The definition of the Cholesterol gallstones is that Gallstones composed primarily of cholesterol, usually about 2-3 cm in length with an oval form and a yellow or green/brown color.
The definition of the Pigment gallstones is that Gallstones composed primarily of bilirubin and calcium salts (calcium bilirubinate) with a low cholesterol concentration.
The definition of the Black pigment gallstones is that A type of pigment gallstone that is hard and black, containing calcium carbonate and calcium phosphates.
The definition of the Brown pigment gallstones is that A type of pigment gallstone that is brown, containing calcium fatty acids. These stones are softer than black pigment gallstones.
The definition of the Atretic gallbladder is that Failure of formation of the lumen of the gallbladder, often associated with gallbladder hypoplasia.
The definition of the Acholic stools is that Clay colored stools lacking bile pigment.
The definition of the Ectopic ossification is that Formation of abnormal, extraskeletal bony tissue, i.e., the presence of bone in soft tissue where bone normally does not exist.
The definition of the Ectopic ossification in muscle tissue is that Formation of abnormal bony tissue within muscle tissue.
The definition of the Ectopic ossification in tendon tissue is that Formation of abnormal bony tissue within tendon tissue.
The definition of the Ectopic ossification in ligament tissue is that Formation of abnormal bony tissue within ligament tissue.
The definition of the Abnormality of neutrophil physiology is that A functional abnormality of neutrophils.
The definition of the Abnormal neutrophil cell number is that A deviation from the normal range of neutrophil cell counts in the circulation.
The definition of the Abnormality of neutrophil morphology is that An abnormal form or size of neutrophils.
The definition of the Impaired neutrophil bactericidal activity is that A reduction in the ability of neutrophils to kill bacteria.
The definition of the Abnormality of the atrial septum is that An abnormality of the interatrial septum.

The definition of the Atrial septal aneurysm is that A bulging of the interatrial septum towards one side. In adults, atrial septal aneurysm can be defined as a protrusion of the aneurysm of >10 mm beyond the plane of the atrial septum as measured by transesophageal echocardiography.

The definition of the Elevated factor V activity is that Increased activity of coagulation factor V, Factor V, which is activated to factor Va by means of minute amounts of thrombin (and inactivated by larger amounts of thrombin). Activated factor V (fVa) is a cofactor in the formation of the prothrombinase complex.
The definition of the Postprandial hyperlactemia is that Abnormally increased level of blood lactate following a meal.
The definition of the Postprandial hyperglycemia is that An increased concentration of glucose in the blood following a meal.
The definition of the Paranoia is that An inappropriate feeling of being persecuted or being the subject of hostility from others. [PMID:34618805]
The definition of the EEG with generalized spikes is that EEG with generalized sharp transient waves of a duration less than 80 msec. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:jalbers]
The definition of the EEG with generalized polyspikes is that EEG with repetitive generalized sharp transient waves of a duration less than 80 msec. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:jalbers]

The definition of the Experiential auras is that Affective, mnemonic or composite perceptual auras with subjective qualities similar to those experienced in life but are recognized by the subject as occurring outside of actual context.
The definition of the Affective auras is that Affective auras with subjective qualities similar to those experienced in life but are recognized by the subject as occurring outside of actual context.

The definition of the Mnemonic auras is that A focal cognitive seizure characterized by memory phenomena such as feelings of familiarity (deja vu) and unfamiliarity (jamais vu) as the initial semiological manifestation.
The definition of the Deja vu is that A subjective feeling that an experience which is occurring for the first time has been experienced before.
The definition of the Jamais vu is that A subjective feeling that an experience which has occurred before is being experienced for the first time.
The definition of the Hallucinatory auras is that A focal cognitive seizure characterized by hallucination as the initial semiological manifestation.

The definition of the Illusory auras is that A focal cognitive seizure characterized by an alteration of actual perception involving visual, auditory, somatosensory, olfactory, and/or gustatory phenomena as the initial semiological manifestation.

The definition of the EEG with central focal spike waves is that EEG with focal sharp transient waves in the central region, i.e., focal sharp waves of a duration less than 80 msec followed by a slow wave. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:jalbers]

The definition of the EEG with frontal focal spike waves is that EEG with focal sharp transient waves in the frontal region, i.e., focal sharp waves of a duration less than 80 msec followed by a slow wave. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:jalbers]

The definition of the EEG with occipital focal spike waves is that EEG with focal sharp transient waves in the occipital region, i.e., focal sharp waves of a duration less than 80 msec followed by a slow wave. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:jalbers]

The definition of the EEG with parietal focal spike waves is that EEG with focal sharp transient waves in the parietal region, i.e., focal sharp waves of a duration less than 80 msec followed by a slow wave. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:jalbers]

The definition of the EEG with temporal focal spike waves is that EEG with focal sharp transient waves in the temporal region, i.e., focal sharp waves of a duration less than 80 msec followed by a slow wave. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:jalbers]
The definition of the EEG with central focal spikes is that EEG with focal sharp transient waves of a duration less than 80 msec in the central region. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:jalbers]
The definition of the EEG with frontal focal spikes is that EEG with focal sharp transient waves of a duration less than 80 msec in the frontal region. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:jalbers]
The definition of the EEG with occipital focal spikes is that EEG with focal sharp transient waves of a duration less than 80 msec in the occipital region. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:jalbers]
The definition of the EEG with parietal focal spikes is that EEG with focal sharp transient waves of a duration less than 80 msec in the parietal region. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:jalbers]
The definition of the EEG with temporal focal spikes is that EEG with focal sharp transient waves of a duration less than 80 msec in the temporal region. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:jalbers]

The definition of the Lens luxation is that Dislocation or malposition of the crystalline lens of the eye. A partial displacement (or dislocation) of the lens is described as a subluxation of the lens, while a complete displacement is termed luxation of the lens. A complete displacement occurs if the lens is completely outside the patellar fossa of the lens, either in the anterior chamber, in the vitreous, or directly on the retina. If the lens is partially displaced but still contained within the lens space, then it is termed subluxation.
The definition of the Right aortic arch is that Aorta descends on right instead of on the left.
The definition of the Persistent patent ductus venosus is that Persistence of blood flow through the ductus venosus for longer than the normal time after birth.

The definition of the Congenital portosystemic venous shunt is that A congenital defect of the vasculature such that there is a shunt (by-pass) of blood directly from the portal vein to the vena cava (i.e., the blood from the portal vein is not filtered through the liver).
The definition of the Galactosuria is that Elevated concentration of galactose in the urine.
The definition of the Hypergalactosemia is that Elevated concentration of galactose in the blood.
The definition of the Abnormality of ornithine metabolism is that Deviation from the normal concentration of ornithine in the blood circulation.
The definition of the Hyperornithinemia is that Increased concentration of ornithine in the blood.
The definition of the Laryngeal edema is that An abnormal accumulation of fluid and swelling in the tissues of the larynx.
The definition of the Hepatocellular adenoma is that A benign tumor of the liver of presumably epithelial origin.
The definition of the Abnormality of urine hormone level is that An abnormal concentration of a hormone in the urine.
The definition of the Increased urinary cortisol level is that Abnormally increased concentration of cortisol in the urine.
The definition of the Lipoma is that The presence of multiple lipomas (a type of benign tissue made of fatty tissue).
The definition of the Sacral lipoma is that Presence of a lipoma in the region of the sacrum.
The definition of the Liposarcoma is that Malignant neoplasms which probably originate in primitive mesenchymal stem cell populations differentiating down a lipomatous pathway. [MPATH:418]

The definition of the Steatocystoma multiplex is that Multiple, localized or widespread, asymptomatic or inflammatory dermal cysts involving the pilosebaceous units. Lesions can appear anywhere on the body, but steatocystoma multiplex is more commonly involved with those areas of the skin with a high density of developed pilosebaceous units (e.g., the axilla, groin, neck, and proximal extremities).
The definition of the Sternocleidomastoid amyotrophy is that Wasting of the sternocleidomastoid muscle, the muscle in the anterior part of the neck that acts to flex and rotate the head.
The definition of the Pectoralis amyotrophy is that Wasting of the pectoral muscles, i.e., of the pectoralis major and pectoralis minor.

The definition of the Corneal guttata is that Corneal guttata are droplet-like accumulations of non-banded collagen on the posterior surface of Descemet's membrane. The presence of focal thickenings of Descemet's membrane histologically named guttae. Cornea guttata can be easily diagnosed in vivo and ex vivo by means of specular microscopy as it gives dark areas where no endothelial cells are visible.

The definition of the Descemet Membrane Folds is that Presence of folds in the Descemet membrane, which is the basement membrane of the endothelial (inner) cell layer of the cornea. Descemet membrane folds are generally a manifestation of inflammation or edema of the cornea.
The definition of the Corneal stromal edema is that Abnormal accumulation of fluid and swelling of the stroma of cornea.

The definition of the Aspirin-induced asthma is that A type of asthma in which aspirin and other nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs) that inhibit cyclooxygen-ase 1 (COX-1) exacerbate bronchoconstriction. [PMID:12743549]
The definition of the Pendular nystagmus is that Rhythmic, involuntary sinusoidal oscillations of one or both eyes. The waveform of pendular nystagmus may occur in any direction.

The definition of the Seesaw nystagmus is that Seesaw nystagmus is a type of pendular nystagmus where a half cycle consists of the elevation and intorsion of one eye, concurrently with the depression and extortion of the fellow eye. In the other half cycle, there is an inversion of the ocular movements.
The definition of the Retinal flecks is that Presence of multiple yellowish-white lesions of various size and configuration on the retina not related to vascular lesions. [PMID:7952338]
The definition of the Areflexia of upper limbs is that Inability to elicit tendon reflexes in the upper limbs.
The definition of the Hemeralopia is that A visual defect characterized by the inability to see as clearly in bright light as in dim light. The word hemeralopia literally means day blindness.

The definition of the Oromandibular dystonia is that A kind of focal dystonia characterized by forceful contractions of the face, jaw, and/or tongue causing difficulty in opening and closing the mouth and often affecting chewing and speech.

The definition of the Laryngeal dystonia is that A form of focal dystonia that affects the vocal cords, associated with involuntary contractions of the vocal cords causing interruptions of speech and affecting the voice quality and often leading to patterned, repeated breaks in speech.
The definition of the Anasarca is that An extreme form of generalized edema with widespread and massive edema due to effusion of fluid into the extracellular space.
The definition of the Reactive hypoglycemia is that Hypoglycermia following a meal (or more generally, after intake of glucose).

The definition of the Low serum calcitriol (1,25-dihydroxycholecalciferol) is that A reduced concentration of calcitriol in the blood. Calcitriol is also known as 1,25-dihydroxycholecalciferol or 1,25-dihydroxyvitamin D3.

The definition of the Low serum calcifediol (25-hydroxycholecalciferol) is that A reduced concentration of calcifediol in the blood. Calcifediol is also known as calcidiol, 25-hydroxycholecalciferol and 25-Hydroxyvitamin D3.

The definition of the Choroidal melanoma is that Malignant tumor of melanocytes of the choroid. The classic appearance of choroidal melanoma is a pigmented dome-shaped or collar button-shaped tumor with an associated exudative retinal detachment. Choroidal melanoma is usually pigmented, but can be variably pigmented and even amelanotic (non-pigmented).
The definition of the Ciliary body melanoma is that Malignant tumor of melanocytes of the ciliary body.

The definition of the Cutaneous melanoma is that The presence of a melanoma, a malignant cancer originating from pigment producing melanocytes. Melanoma can originate from the skin or the pigmented layers of the eye (the uvea).
The definition of the Superficial spreading melanoma is that A type of melanoma that is flat and irregular in shape and color, with different shades of black and brown.
The definition of the Nodular melanoma is that A type of melanoma that starts as a raised area that is usually dark blackish-blue or bluish-red but may not have any color.

The definition of the Lentigo maligna melanoma is that A subtype of melanoma in situ that typically develops on sun-damaged skin. The lesion is typically a large, irregularly pigmented macule that has developed from an ordinary lentigo (a small pigmented spot on the skin with a clearly-defined edge). Change to a malignant lentigo typically takes place over 20 years or more, and many patients accept the change as a consequence of aging.

The definition of the Acral lentiginous melanoma is that A type of cutaneous melanoma localized to the palm, sole, or beneath the nail (subungual melanoma). Acral lentiginous melanoma starts as a slowly-enlarging flat patch of discoloured skin and usually displays a size above 6 mm and often several centimetres or more in diameter upon diagnosis and variable pigmentation with a mixutre of colors including brown, and blue-grey, black and red. The surface of the lesion is initially smooth but later in the course may become thicker and irregular, and may ulcerate or bleed.
The definition of the Urinary excretion of sialylated oligosaccharides is that Excretion of oligosaccharides conjugated to sialic acid in the urine.
The definition of the Bone cyst is that A fluid filled cavity that develops with a bone.

The definition of the Aneurysmal bone cyst is that Radiographic features include a dilated, radiolucent lesion typically located eccentrically within the metaphyseal portion of the bone, with fluid levels visible on magnetic resonance imaging.
The definition of the Unicameral bone cyst is that A benign fluid filled simple cyst of bone filled with serous fluid.
The definition of the Multiple bony cystic lesions is that Presence of multiple cystic changes in multiple areas or multiple bones.
The definition of the Increased urinary disaccharide excretion is that Increased concentration of disaccharide in the urine.

The definition of the Glycopeptiduria is that Increased excretion of glycopeptides in the urine. Glycopeptides are peptides with carbohydrate moieties covalently attached to the side chains of the amino acid residues.
The definition of the Aspartylglucosaminuria is that Excretion of excess amounts of aspartylglucosamine in the urine.
The definition of the Keratan sulfate excretion in urine is that An increased concentration of keratan sulfate in the urine.
The definition of the Chondroitin sulfate excretion in urine is that An increased concentration of chondroitin sulfate (CHEBI:37397) in the urine.

The definition of the Abnormality of acetylcarnitine metabolism is that Any deviation from the normal concentration in the blood circulation of an acylcarnitine, which is produced by reversible esterification of the 3-hydroxyl group of carnitine.
The definition of the Aciduria is that Excretion of urine with an acid pH, i.e., having an increased hydrogen ion concentration.

The definition of the Abnormal urinary acylglycine profile is that An abnormal distribution of N-acylglycines in the urine. There are numerous different N-acylglycines, and this term refers to pathological alterations in their level or distribution.

The definition of the Tonic pupil is that An abnormality of the pupillary light reaction characterized by a marked slowing of the light reaction of usually just one pupil. The pupil tends to be relatively dilated, and there is reduced accommodation.

The definition of the Personality disorder is that A personality disorder is a deeply ingrained pattern of behavior of a specified kind that deviates markedly from the norms of generally accepted behavior. It is typically apparent by the time of adolescence and causes long-term difficulties in personal relationships or functioning in society. []

The definition of the Borderline personality disorder is that A personality disorder characterized by impulsive behavior and unpredictable, capricious mood. Affected individuals show a tendency to have outbursts of emotion and an inability to control these behavioral explosions. They generally experience an intense fear of abandonment or instability and also struggle with feelings of emptiness. []

The definition of the Histrionic personality disorder is that A personality disorder characterized by shallow and labile affectivity, self-dramatization, theatricality, exaggerated expression of emotions, suggestibility, egocentricity, self-indulgence, lack of consideration for others, easily hurt feelings, and continuous seeking for appreciation, excitement and attention. [ICD-10:F60.4]
The definition of the Motor conduction block is that Blockade of impulses at a focal site along the course of a motor axon.
The definition of the Abnormality of central motor conduction is that Any anomaly of the conduction of motor nerve impulses in the central nervous system.
The definition of the Cerebellar granular layer atrophy is that Atrophy of the cerebellum affecting primarily the granular cell layer.
The definition of the Enlarged cerebellum is that An abnormally increased size of the cerebellum compared to other brain structures.
The definition of the Cerebellar Purkinje layer atrophy is that Atrophy of the cerebellum affecting primarily the Purkinje cell layer.
The definition of the Ubiquitin-positive cerebral inclusion bodies is that Nuclear or cytoplasmic aggregates that show positive staining with antibodies against ubiquitin within cells of the brain.
