The definition of the Steroid-resistant nephrotic syndrome is that A form of nephrotic syndrome that does not respond to treatment with steroid medication, defined as persistent proteinuria despite 60mg/m2 or 2mg/kg for 8 weeks, after insuring no infection or non-adherence to medication. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:Eurenomics_ewuehl, https://orcid.org/0000-0002-2234-4248, PMID:29910038]
The definition of the Multidrug-resistant nephrotic syndrome is that A form of nephrotic syndrome that does not respond to any immunosuppresive treatment. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:Eurenomics_ewuehl]
The definition of the Abnormal urine output is that An abnormal amount of urine production. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:Eurenomics_ewuehl]
The definition of the Albuminuria is that Increased concentration of albumin in the urine. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:Eurenomics_fschaefer]

The definition of the Nephrotic range proteinuria is that Severely increased amount of excretion of protein in the urine, defined as 3.5 grams per day or more in adults and 40 mg per meter-squared body surface area per hour in children. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:Eurenomics_ewuehl]

The definition of the Microalbuminuria is that The presence of moderately increased concentrations of albumin in the urine, defined as and albumin-creatinine ratio (ACR) of 30 to 299 mg/gm (3.4 to 34 mg/mmol). [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:Eurenomics_fschaefer, PMID:30571025]
The definition of the Mild proteinuria is that Mildly increased levels of protein in the urine (150-500 mg per day in adults). [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:Eurenomics_eweuehl]
The definition of the Moderate proteinuria is that Moderately increased levels of protein in the urine (500-1000 mg per day in adults). [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:Eurenomics_fschaefer]
The definition of the Heavy proteinuria is that Severely increased levels of protein in the urine (1000-3000 mg per day in adults). [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:Eurenomics_ewuehl]
The definition of the Abnormal urine potassium concentration is that An abnormal concentration of potassium(1+) in the urine. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:Eurenomics_fschaefer]
The definition of the Abnormal urine phosphate concentration is that An abnormal phosphate concentration in the urine. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:Eurenomics_ewuehl]
The definition of the Abnormal urine chloride concentration is that An abnormal concentration of chloride in the urine. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:Eurenomics_fschaefer]
The definition of the Hypochloriduria is that An decreased concentration of chloride in the urine.
The definition of the Renal chloride wasting is that High urine chloride in the presence of hypochloridemia. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:Eurenomics_ewuehl]
The definition of the Abnormal urine sodium concentration is that An abnormal concentration of sodium in the urine. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:Eurenomics_fschaefer]
The definition of the Hyponatriuria is that An abnormally decreased sodium concentration in the urine. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:Eurenomics_ewuehl]
The definition of the Hypernatriuria is that An increased concentration of sodium(1+) in the urine. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:Eurenomics_ewuehl]
The definition of the Renal sodium wasting is that An abnormally increased sodium concentration in the urine in the presence of hyponatremia. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:Eurenomics_ewuehl]
The definition of the Abnormal urine magnesium concentration is that An abnormal concentration of magnesium the urine. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:Eurenomics_ewuehl]
The definition of the Hypermagnesiuria is that An increased concentration of magnesium the urine. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:Eurenomics_fschaefer]
The definition of the Hypomagnesiuria is that An decreased concentration of magnesium the urine. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:Eurenomics_fschaefer]
The definition of the Abnormality of urinary uric acid concentration is that Abnormal amount of urate in the urine.
The definition of the Abnormal urinary sulfate concentration is that Abnormal concentration of sulfate in the urine.
The definition of the Increased urinary sulfate is that Elevated concentration of SO4(2-), i.e., sulfate, in the urine.
The definition of the Abnormal urine cytology is that An anomalous finding in the examination of the urine for cells. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:Eurenomics_ewuehl]

The definition of the Cylindruria is that The presence of renal casts (cylindrical, cigar-shaped structures produced by the kidney in certain disease states) in the urine. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:Eurenomics_ewuehl, PMID:26079824]

The definition of the Leukocyte cylindruria is that Presence of leukocyte casts (cylindrical structures produced by the kidney in certain disease states) in the urine. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:Eurenomics_fschaefer]

The definition of the Erythrocyte cylindruria is that Presence of erythrocyte casts (cylindrical structures produced by the kidney in certain disease states) in the urine. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:Eurenomics_fschaefer, PMID:8856231]
The definition of the Urachal cyst is that A cyst located along the allantois canal. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:Eurenomics_fschaefer]
The definition of the Multiple bladder diverticula is that Presence of a many diverticula (sac or pouch) in the wall of the urinary bladder. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:Eurenomics_fschaefer]
The definition of the Cloacal abnormality is that A developmental anomaly associated with the failure of rectum, vagina, and bladder to separate.
The definition of the Persistent cloaca is that Developmental anomaly in which the vagina, bladder, and rectum fuse resulting in a common channel.
The definition of the Chronic kidney disease is that Functional anomaly of the kidney persisting for at least three months. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:Eurenomics_ewuehl]

The definition of the Stage 1 chronic kidney disease is that A type of chronic kidney disease with normal or increased glomerular filtration rate (GFR at least 90 mL/min/1.73 m2). [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:Eurenomics_fschaefer]

The definition of the Stage 2 chronic kidney disease is that A type of chronic kidney disease with mildly reduced glomerular filtration rate (GFR 60-89 mL/min/1.73 m2). [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:Eurenomics_fschaefer]

The definition of the Stage 3 chronic kidney disease is that A type of chronic kidney disease with moderately reduced glomerular filtration rate (GFR 30-59 mL/min/1.73 m2). [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:Eurenomics_fschaefer]

The definition of the Stage 4 chronic kidney disease is that A type of chronic kidney disease with severely reduced glomerular filtration rate (GFR 15-29 mL/min/1.73 m2). [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:Eurenomics_fschaefer]
The definition of the Pseudoexfoliation is that Deposition of fibrillar material that can be found on all anterior segment structures bathed by aqueous humor.

The definition of the Abnormality of the suspensory ligament of lens is that An anomaly of the suspensory ligament of lens, also known as the ciliary zonule. These ligaments represent a series of fibers connecting the ciliary body and lens of the eye, holding the lens in place.
The definition of the Phacodonesis is that Tremulousness (trembling) of the lens of the eye.

The definition of the Abnormality of the trabecular meshwork is that An anomaly of the trabecular meshwork, which is the porelike structure surrounding the entire circumference of the anterior chamber at the base of the cornea and near the ciliary body. The trabecular mesh work is responsible for draining the aqueous humor into the canal of Schlemm.
The definition of the Pigment deposition in the trabecular meshwork is that Accumulation of abnormal amounts of pigment within the trabecular meshwork.
The definition of the Abnormal intraocular pressure is that An anomaly in the amount of force per unit area exerted by the intraocular fluid within the eye.
The definition of the Asymmetry of intraocular pressure is that A difference in the amount of intraocular pressure in the right and left eye.
The definition of the Iris pigment dispersion is that Shedding of the pigment granules that normally adhere to the back of the iris into the aqueous humor.
The definition of the Iris hypoperfusion is that Reduction in the amount of blood flow to the iris.
The definition of the Retinal vein occlusion is that Blockage of the retinal vein.
The definition of the Renal calcium wasting is that High urine calcium in the presence of hypocalcemia.
The definition of the Abnormality of nervous system physiology is that A functional anomaly of the nervous system.
The definition of the Abnormality of nervous system morphology is that A structural anomaly of the nervous system.
The definition of the Abnormality of intracranial pressure is that A deviation from the norm of the intracranial pressure.
The definition of the Decreased intracranial pressure is that A reduction of the pressure inside the cranium (skull) and thereby in the brain tissue and cerebrospinal fluid.

The definition of the Cerebellar agenesis is that Cerebellar agenesis is defined by the near complete absence of cerebellar tissue with only remnants of the anterior vermis, flocculus, and/or middle cerebellar peduncles.
The definition of the Foveal hypopigmentation is that Decreased amount of pigmentation in the fovea centralis.
The definition of the Increased caudate lactate level is that An elevated concentration of lactate in the caudate nucleus. This finding can be elicited by magnetic resonance spectroscopy imaging.
The definition of the Enlarged peripheral nerve is that Increase in size of a peripheral nerve. This finding can be appreciated by palpation along the axis of the nerve.

The definition of the Retractile testis is that A testis that is located at the upper scrotum or lower inguinal canal and that can be made to descend completely into the scrotum without resistance by manual reduction but returns to its original position by the cremasteric reflex.

The definition of the Abnormal inflammatory response is that Any anomaly of the inflammatory response, a response to injury or infection characterized by local vasodilation, extravasation of plasma into intercellular spaces and accumulation of white blood cells and macrophages.
The definition of the Decreased inflammatory response is that An abnormal reduction in the inflammatory response to injury or infection.
The definition of the Increased inflammatory response is that A abnormal increase in the inflammatory response to injury or infection.

The definition of the Perisylvian polymicrogyria is that Polymicrogyria (an excessive number of small gyri or convolutions) that is maximal in perisylvian regions (the regions that surround the Sylvian fissures), which may be symmetric or asymmetric and may extend beyond perisylvian regions. The Sylvian fissures often extend posteriorly and superiorly.
The definition of the Abasia is that A severe form of gait ataxia such that an affected person cannot walk at all.
The definition of the Exercise-induced asthma is that Asthma attacks following exercise.
The definition of the Status Asthmaticus is that Severe asthma unresponsive to repeated courses of beta-agonist therapy such as inhaled albuterol, levalbuterol, or subcutaneous epinephrine.
The definition of the Abnormal CSF dopamine level is that Abnormal concentration of dopamine in the cerebrospinal fluid (CSF).
The definition of the Elevated CSF dopamine level is that Increased concentration of dopamine in the cerebrospinal fluid (CSF).
The definition of the Reduced CSF dopamine level is that Decreased concentration of dopamine in the cerebrospinal fluid (CSF).

The definition of the Abnormal brain positron emission tomography is that A functional brain anomaly detectable by positron emission tomography (PET). PET scanning is a method for functional brain imaging, and its measurements reflect the amount of brain activity in the various regions of the brain.

The definition of the Abnormal brain FDG positron emission tomography is that An anomaly detectable in [18F]-fluorodeoxyglucose (FDG) positron emission tomography (PET) brain scans. Glucose uptake measured with FDG-PET is a marker of neuronal metabolic activity.

The definition of the Prefrontal hypometabolism in FDG PET is that Reduced uptake of [18F]-fluorodeoxyglucose (FDG) in the prefrontal cortex as measured by positron emission tomography (PET) brain scan.
The definition of the Thalamic hypometabolism in FDG PET is that Reduced uptake of [18F]-fluorodeoxyglucose (FDG) in the thalamus as measured by positron emission tomography (PET) brain scan.
The definition of the Hypothalamic hypometabolism in FDG PET is that Reduced uptake of [18F]-fluorodeoxyglucose (FDG) in the hypothalamus as measured by positron emission tomography (PET) brain scan.
The definition of the Parietal hypometabolism in FDG PET is that Reduced uptake of [18F]-fluorodeoxyglucose (FDG) in the parietal cortex as measured by positron emission tomography (PET) brain scan.

The definition of the Mildly reduced ejection fraction is that A small reduction in the fraction of blood pumped from the left ventricle with each cardiac cycle. The normal range in adults is at least 50 percent, and a mild reduction is defined as 40-49 percent.
The definition of the Reduced ejection fraction is that A diminution of the volumetric fraction of blood pumped out of the ventricle with each cardiac cycle.

The definition of the Moderately reduced ejection fraction is that A medium reduction in the fraction of blood pumped from the left ventricle with each cardiac cycle, defined as a left ventricular ejection fraction of 30-39 percent.

The definition of the Severely reduced ejection fraction is that A large reduction in the fraction of blood pumped from the left ventricle with each cardiac cycle. The normal range in adults is at over 50 percent, and a severe reduction is defined as less than 30 percent.
The definition of the Regional left ventricular wall motion abnormality is that An abnormal motion of a segment of the left ventricle during the cardiac cycle.
The definition of the Carotid sinus syncope is that An exaggerated response to carotid sinus baroreceptor stimulation resulting in syncope from transient diminished cerebral perfusion.
The definition of the Orthostatic syncope is that Syncope following a quick change in position from lying down to standing.

The definition of the Abulia is that Abulia is a severe form of apathy, characterized by difficulty in initiating and sustaining spontaneous movements, as well as reductions in emotional responsiveness, spontaneous speech, and social interaction. []

The definition of the Akinetic mutism is that Akinetic mutism is essentially characterized by a total absence of spontaneous behavior and speech occurring in the presence of preserved visual tracking.
The definition of the aplasia of the upper vagina is that A failure to develop of the upper vagina.
The definition of the aplasia of the lower vagina is that A failure to develop of the lower part of the vagina.
The definition of the Iron accumulation in brain is that An abnormal build up of iron (Fe) in brain tissue.
The definition of the Copper accumulation in brain is that An anomalous build up of copper (Cu) in the brain.
The definition of the Iron accumulation in substantia nigra is that An anomalous build up of iron (Fe) in the substantia nigra.

The definition of the Widened interpedicular distance is that An increase in the distance between vertebral pedicles, which are the two short, thick processes, which project backward, one on either side, from the upper part of the vertebral body, at the junction of its posterior and lateral surfaces. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:UToronto_htrang]
The definition of the Abnormality of the pineal gland is that An anomaly of the pineal gland,a small endocrine gland in the brain that produces melatonin.
The definition of the Abnormality of pineal morphology is that A structural abnormality of the pineal gland. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:UToronto_htrang]
The definition of the Pineal gland calcification is that Accumulation of calcium salts in the pineal gland.
The definition of the Pineal cyst is that A glial uniloculated or multiloculated fluid-filled sac that either reside within or completely replace the pineal gland.
The definition of the Abnormal pineal volume is that An abnormal increase or decrease in the quantity of three-dimensional space taken up by the pineal gland. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:UToronto_htrang]
The definition of the Decreased pineal volume is that An abnormal reduction in the quantity of three-dimensional space taken up by the pineal gland. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:UToronto_htrang, PMID:24456088]
The definition of the Increased pineal volume is that An abnormal elevation in the quantity of three-dimensional space taken up by the pineal gland. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:UToronto_htrang]

The definition of the Agenesis of pineal gland is that Failure to develop of the pineal gland, defined clinically as the absence of the pineal gland with no indication of the pineal gland even having been present. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:UToronto_htrang]
The definition of the Abnormality of pineal physiology is that A functional abnormality of the pineal gland. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:UToronto_htrang]

The definition of the Abnormal pineal melatonin secretion is that An anomaly in the amount or timing of melatonin secretion by the pineal gland. Note that melatonin is also synthesized by multiple tissues outside of the pineal gland. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:UToronto_htrang, PMID:22724080]

The definition of the T2 hypointense thalamus is that A darker than expected T2 signal on magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) of the thalamus. This term refers to a diffuse hypointensity affecting the entire thalamus.

The definition of the Focal T2 hypointense thalamic lesion is that A darker than expected T2 signal on magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) of the thalamus. This term refers to a localized hypointensity affecting a particular region of the thalamus.

The definition of the Focal T2 hyperintense thalamic lesion is that A lighter than expected T2 signal on magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) of the thalamus. This term refers to a localized hyperintensity affecting a particular region of the thalamus.
The definition of the Abnormal thalamic size is that Deviation from the normal range of size of the thalamus. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:UToronto_htrang]
The definition of the Enlarged thalamic volume is that An increase in the quantity of space occupied by the thalamus. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:UToronto_htrang]
The definition of the Decreased thalamic volume is that A reduction in the quantity of space occupied by the thalamus. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:UToronto_htrang]
The definition of the Abnormal thalamic MRI signal intensity is that A deviation from normal signal on magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) of the thalamus.
The definition of the Small basal ganglia is that Decreased size of the basal ganglia.
The definition of the Cerebellar gliosis is that Focal proliferation of glial cells in the cerebellum. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:UToronto_htrang]
The definition of the Anomaly of lower limb diaphyses is that A structural abnormality of a diaphysis of the leg. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:UToronto_htrang]
The definition of the Abnormal large intestine physiology is that A functional anomaly of the large intestine.
The definition of the Bowel urgency is that A sudden, irresistible need to have a bowel movement. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:UToronto_htrang]
The definition of the Tenesmus is that A repeated, painful urge to defecate without excreting stool.

The definition of the Abnormality of the subarachnoid space is that Abnormality in the space in the meninges beneath the arachnoid membrane and above the pia mater that contains the cerebrospinal fluid. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:UToronto_htrang]
The definition of the Widened subarachnoid space is that An increase in size of the anatomic space between the arachnoid membrane and pia mater.
The definition of the Abnormal metabolic brain imaging by MRS is that An anomaly of metabolism in the brain identified by magnetic resonance spectroscopy (MRS).

The definition of the Elevated brain choline level by MRS is that An increase in the level of choline-containing compounds in the brain identified by magnetic resonance spectroscopy (MRS). [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:UToronto_htrang]

The definition of the Elevated brain lactate level by MRS is that An increase in the level of lactate in the brain identified by magnetic resonance spectroscopy (MRS). [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:UToronto_htrang]

The definition of the Reduced brain N-acetyl aspartate level by MRS is that A decrease in the level of N-acetyl aspartate in the brain identified by magnetic resonance spectroscopy (MRS). [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:UToronto_htrang]

The definition of the Abnormal brain choline/creatine ratio by MRS is that A deviation from normal in the ratio of choline to creatine in the brain identified by magnetic resonance spectroscopy (MRS). [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:UToronto_htrang]
The definition of the Ingrown nail is that Excessive growth of a nail laterally into the nail fold.
The definition of the Delayed ossification of vertebral epiphysis is that A delay in the process of formation and maturation of the epiphysis of one or more vertebrae.
The definition of the Mild hearing impairment is that The presence of a mild form of hearing impairment.
The definition of the Moderate hearing impairment is that The presence of a moderate form of hearing impairment.
The definition of the Severe hearing impairment is that A severe form of hearing impairment.
The definition of the Profound hearing impairment is that A profound (essentially complete) form of hearing impairment.
The definition of the Moderate conductive hearing impairment is that The presence of a moderate form of conductive hearing impairment.
The definition of the Severe conductive hearing impairment is that A severe form of conductive hearing impairment.
The definition of the Morphological abnormality of the gastrointestinal tract is that Abnormal structure of the gastrointestinal tract.
The definition of the Functional abnormality of the gastrointestinal tract is that Abnormal functionality of the gastrointestinal tract.
The definition of the Neoplasm of the nose is that Tumor (An abnormal mass of tissue resulting from abnormally dividing cells) of the nasal cavity.

The definition of the Venous malformation is that A vascular malformation resulting from a developmental error of venous tissue composed of dysmorphic channels lined by flattened endothelium and exhibiting slow turnover. A venous malformation may present as a blue patch on the skin ranging to a soft blue mass. Venous malformations are easily compressible and usually swell in thewhen venous pressure increases (e.g., when held in a dependent position or when a child cries). They may be relatively localized or quite extensive within an anatomic region.
The definition of the Heart block is that Impaired conduction of cardiac impulse occurring anywhere along the conduction pathway.
The definition of the Sinoatrial block is that Disturbance in the atrial activation that is caused by transient failure of impulse conduction from the sinoatrial node to the cardiac atria.
The definition of the Upper eyelid edema is that Edema in the region of the upper eyelid.

The definition of the Cutaneous syndactyly is that A soft tissue continuity in the A/P axis between two digits that extends distally to at least the level of the proximal interphalangeal joints, or a soft tissue continuity in the A/P axis between two digits that lies significantly distal to the flexion crease that overlies the metacarpophalangeal or metatarsophalangeal joint of the adjacent digits.
The definition of the Episodic hypokalemia is that An abnormally decreased potassium concentration in the blood occurring periodically with a return to normal between the episodes.
The definition of the Thoracic aortic aneurysm is that An abnormal localized widening (dilatation) of the thoracic aorta.

The definition of the Fusiform descending thoracic aortic aneurysm is that A concentric abnormal localized widening (dilatation) of the descending thoracic aorta that involves the full circumference of the vessel wall

The definition of the Saccular descending thoracic aortic aneurysm is that An eccentric abnormal localized widening (dilatation) of the descending thoracic aorta that involves only a portion of the circumference of the vessel wall
The definition of the Aglossia is that Absence of the tongue owing to a developmental abnormality.
The definition of the Ectopic anterior pituitary gland is that Abnormal anatomic location of the anterior pituitary gland.
The definition of the Anorectal anomaly is that An abnormality of the anus or rectum.
The definition of the Macule is that A flat, distinct, discolored area of skin less than 1 cm wide that does not involve any change in the thickness or texture of the skin.
The definition of the Ketotic hypoglycemia is that Low blood glucose is accompanied by elevated levels of ketone bodies in the body.
The definition of the Cough is that A sudden, audible expulsion of air from the lungs through a partially closed glottis, preceded by inhalation.
The definition of the Profound global developmental delay is that A profound delay in the achievement of motor or mental milestones in the domains of development of a child.
The definition of the Small intestinal polyp is that A benign (noncancerous) tumorlike malformation made up of an abnormal mixture of cells and tissues that originates in the small intestine. []
The definition of the Agenesis of canine is that Agenesis of canine tooth.
The definition of the Agenesis of the small intestine is that Failure to develop of the small intestine.
The definition of the Papilloma is that A tumor of the skin or mucous membrane with finger-like projections.
The definition of the Unilateral cryptorchidism is that Absence of a testis from the scrotum on one side owing to failure of the testis or testes to descend through the inguinal canal to the scrotum.
The definition of the Thin fingernail is that Fingernail that appears thin when viewed on end.
The definition of the Abdominal obesity is that Excessive fat around the stomach and abdomen.
The definition of the Femoral aplasia is that Failure of the femur to develop.

The definition of the Short palpebral fissure is that Distance between the medial and lateral canthi is more than 2 SD below the mean for age (objective); or, apparently reduced length of the palpebral fissures. [PMID:19125427]
The definition of the Thin toenail is that Toenail that appears thin when viewed on end.
The definition of the Abnormal brainstem MRI signal intensity is that A deviation from normal signal on magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) of the brainstem. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:UToronto_htrang]

The definition of the Focal T2 hyperintense brainstem lesion is that A lighter than expected T2 signal on magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) of the brainstem. This term refers to a localized hyperintensity affecting a particular region of the brainstem. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:UToronto_htrang]

The definition of the Focal T2 hypointense brainstem lesion is that A darker than expected T2 signal on magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) of the brainstem. This term refers to a localized hypointensity affecting a particular region of the brainstem. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:UToronto_htrang]

The definition of the T2 hypointense brainstem is that A darker than expected T2 signal on magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) of the brainstem. This term refers to a diffuse hypointensity affecting the entire brainstem. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:UToronto_htrang]
The definition of the Abnormal basal ganglia MRI signal intensity is that A deviation from normal signal on magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) of the basal ganglia. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:UToronto_htrang]

The definition of the Focal T2 hypointense basal ganglia lesion is that A darker than expected T2 signal on magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) of the basal ganglia. This term refers to a localized hypointensity affecting a particular region of the basal ganglia.

The definition of the T2 hypointense basal ganglia is that A darker than expected T2 signal on magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) of the basal ganglia. This term refers to a diffuse hypointensity affecting all of the basal ganglia.
The definition of the CNS hypermyelination is that Increased amount of myelin in the central nervous system. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:UToronto_htrang]
The definition of the Enlarged brainstem is that Abnormal increase in size of the brainstem. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:UToronto_htrang]
The definition of the CSF polymorphonuclear pleocytosis is that An increased polymorphonuclear cell count in the cerebrospinal fluid. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:KI_phemming]

The definition of the Abnormal neuron morphology is that A structural anomaly of a neuron. Neurons are electrically excitable cells that transmit signals throughout the body. Neurons employ both electrical and chemical components in the transmission of information. Neurons are connected to other neurons at synapses and connected to effector organs or cells at neuroeffector junctions. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:KI_phemming, PMID:28723006]

The definition of the Neurodevelopmental abnormality is that A deviation from normal of the neurological development of a child, which may include any or all of the aspects of the development of personal, social, gross or fine motor, and cognitive abilities. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:KI_phemming]

The definition of the Impaired social reciprocity is that A reduced ability to participate in the back-and-forth flow of social interaction appropriate to culture and developmental level, which is normally characterized by an influence of the behavior of one person on the behavior of another person. []
The definition of the Absent mastoid is that A developmental anomaly in which the mastoid process fails to form and is thus found to be congenitally absent.
The definition of the Cerebral white matter atrophy is that The presence of atrophy (wasting) of the cerebral white matter. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:UToronto_htrang]
The definition of the Paroxysmal dyspnea is that A sudden attack of dyspnea that occurs while the affected person is at rest.
The definition of the Orthopnea is that A sensation of breathlessness in the recumbent position, relieved by sitting or standing. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:UToronto_htrang]

The definition of the Widened cerebellar subarachnoid space is that An increase in size of the anatomic space between the arachnoid membrane and pia mater in the region surrounding the cerebellum. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:UToronto_htrang]

The definition of the Widened cerebral subarachnoid space is that An increase in size of the anatomic space between the arachnoid membrane and pia mater in the region surrounding the cerebrum. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:UToronto_htrang]
The definition of the Abnormal placental size is that A deviation from normal size of the placenta.
The definition of the Neonatal asphyxia is that Respiratory failure in the newborn.

The definition of the Abnormal arm span is that A deviation from normal of the length of the arm span (length from one end of an individual's arms measured at the fingertips to the other when raised parallel to the ground at shoulder height at a one-hundred eighty degree angle)

The definition of the Reduced arm span is that Decreased length of the arm span (length from one end of an individual's arms measured at the fingertips to the other when raised parallel to the ground at shoulder height at a one-hundred eighty degree angle).

The definition of the Increased arm span is that Increased length of the arm span (length from one end of an individual's arms measured at the fingertips to the other when raised parallel to the ground at shoulder height at a one-hundred eighty degree angle).

The definition of the Abnormal upper to lower segment ratio is that A deviation from normal of the relation between the upper and the lower segment of the body, where the lower segment is defined as the length between the top of pubic symphysis to floor, and the upper segment is defined as the top of head to top of pubic symphysis.

The definition of the Reduced upper to lower segment ratio is that Decreased ratio between the upper and the lower segment of the body, where the lower segment is defined as the length between the top of pubic symphysis to floor, and the upper segment is defined as the top of head to top of pubic symphysis. Consider the term Disproportionate tall stature (HP:0001519) if tall stature is also present.

The definition of the Increased upper to lower segment ratio is that Elevated ratio between the upper and the lower segment of the body, where the lower segment is defined as the length between the top of pubic symphysis to floor, and the upper segment is defined as the top of head to top of pubic symphysis.
The definition of the Stellate iris is that A lacy pattern or iris pigmentation that resembles the spokes of a bicycle wheel. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:CINEAS_asollie]
The definition of the Abnormality of the ciliary body is that A structural anomaly of the ciliary body. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:CINEAS_asollie]
The definition of the Retinal neoplasm is that A tumor of the eye originating from cells of the retina.
The definition of the Retinal astrocytic hamartoma is that A glial tumor of the retinal nerve fiber layer arising from a retinal astrocyte. [PMID:20435268, PMID:23436975]
The definition of the Transient hearing impairment is that Hearing loss that occurs acutely and resolves completely. [PMID:21776317]
The definition of the Neoplasm of the ear is that A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the ear.
The definition of the Mid-frequency hearing loss is that A type of hearing impairment affecting primarily the middle frequencies of sound (1000 Hz to 3000 Hz).
The definition of the Perilobar nephrogenic rest is that A type of nephrogenic rest associated with multiple lesions in the periphery of the renal lobe.
The definition of the Intralobar nephrogenic rest is that A type of nephrogenic rest usually representing single lesions within the renal lobe, renal sinus, or calyceal walls.
The definition of the Perinephritis is that Inflammation of the connective and adipose tissues surrounding the kidney.
The definition of the Flexion contracture of finger is that Chronic loss of joint motion in a finger due to structural changes in non-bony tissue.
The definition of the Recurrent cystitis is that Repeated infections of the urinary bladder.
The definition of the Recurrent pyelonephritis is that Repeated episodes of pyelonephritis.
The definition of the Reticulate pigmentation of oral mucosa is that A net-like pattern of increased pigmentation of the oral cavity.
The definition of the Hypoplasia of the calcaneus is that Underdevelopment of the heel bone.

The definition of the Abnormal intramembranous ossification is that An anomaly in the process of intramembranous ossification by which flat bones (cranial bones of the skull, i.e., the frontal, parietal, occipital, and temporal bones, and the clavicles) are formed.
The definition of the Abnormal humeral ossification is that An anomaly of the process of formation of bone in the humerus.
The definition of the Absent ossification of thoracic vertebral bodies is that A lack of bone mineralization of one or more body of thoracic vertebra.
The definition of the Kinked brainstem is that A kinked appearance of the brainstem, i.e., an exaggerated flexure.

The definition of the Periventricular white matter hypodensities is that Multiple areas of darker than expected signal on magnetic resonance imaging emanating from the cerebral white matter that surrounds the cerebral ventricles.
The definition of the Abnormality of the optic disc is that A morphological abnormality of the optic disc, i.e., of the portion of the optic nerve clinically visible on fundoscopic examination.

The definition of the Increased cup-to-disc ratio is that An elevation in the ratio of the diameter of the cup of the optic disc to the total diameter of the disc. The optic disc has an orange-pink rim with a pale centre (the cup) that does not contain neuroretinal tissue. An increase in this ratio therefore may indicate a decrease in the quantity of healthy neuroretinal cells.
The definition of the Lymphatic vessel neoplasm is that A benign or malignant neoplasm arising from the lymphatic vessels. [NCIT:C3723]

The definition of the Pulmonary lymphangiomyomatosis is that Infiltration of smooth muscle-like cells in lymph vessels as well as the lung (pleura, alveolar septa, bronchi, pulmonary vessels and lymphatics as well as lymph nodes, especially in posterior mediastinum and retroperitoneum). Focal emphysema can develop because of airway narrowing, and the thoracic duct may be obliterated. Pulmonary lymphangiomyomatosis may lead to multiple small cysts with a hamartomatous proliferation of smooth muscle in their walls.
The definition of the Unilateral facial palsy is that One-sided weakness of the muscles of facial expression and eye closure.
The definition of the Accessory cranial suture is that A cranial suture that is in addition to canonical membrane-covered openings in the incompletely ossified skull of the fetus or newborn infant.

The definition of the Narrow jaw is that Bigonial distance (lower facial width) more than 2 standard deviations below the mean (objective); or an apparently decreased width of the lower jaw (mandible) when viewed from the front (subjective).

The definition of the Broad jaw is that Bigonial distance (lower facial width) more than 2 SD above the mean (objective); or an apparently increased width of the lower jaw (mandible) when viewed from the front (subjective).
The definition of the Anisometropia is that Inequality of refractive power of the two eyes.
The definition of the Corneal ulceration is that Disruption of the epithelial layer of the cornea with involvement of the underlying stroma.

The definition of the Iris transillumination defect is that Transmission of light through the iris as visualized upon slit lamp examination or infrared iris transillumination videography. The light passes through defects in the pigmentation of the iris.
The definition of the Proboscis is that A fleshy, tube-like structure usually located in the midline of the face or just to one side of the midline.
The definition of the High insertion of columella is that Insertion of the posterior columella superior to the nasal base. [PMID:19152422]

The definition of the Abnormal nasal base is that An anomaly of the nasal base, which can be conceived of as an imaginary line between the most lateral points of the external inferior attachments of the alae nasi to the face.
The definition of the Narrow nasal base is that Decreased distance between the attachments of the alae nasi to the face.
The definition of the Wide nasal base is that Increased distance between the attachments of the alae nasi to the face.
The definition of the Wide nasal ridge is that Increased width of the nasal ridge.
The definition of the Fullness of paranasal tissue is that Increased bulk of tissue alongside the nose. The fullness can be caused by both bony and soft tissues.
The definition of the Unilateral breast hypoplasia is that Underdevelopment of the breast on one side only.
The definition of the Bilateral breast hypoplasia is that Underdevelopment of the breast on both sides.

The definition of the Hypoplastic female external genitalia is that Underdevelopment of part or all of the female external reproductive organs (which include the mons pubis, labia majora, labia minora, Bartholin glands, and clitoris).
The definition of the Right ventricular noncompaction cardiomyopathy is that A predominantly right ventricular variant of isolated noncompaction cardiomyopathy.

The definition of the Noncompaction cardiomyopathy is that A type of cardiomyopathy characterized anatomically by deep trabeculations in the ventricular wall, which define recesses communicating with the main ventricular chamber.
The definition of the Biventricular noncompaction cardiomyopathy is that Noncompaction cardiomyopathy that affects both ventricles.
The definition of the Myocarditis is that Inflammation of the myocardium.
The definition of the Biilateral vocal cord paralysis is that A loss of the ability to move the vocal fold on both sides.
The definition of the Unilateral vocal cord paresis is that Decreased strength of the vocal fold on one side.
The definition of the Bilateral vocal cord paresis is that Decreased strength of the vocal fold on both sides.
The definition of the Retinal vascular tortuosity is that The presence of an increased number of twists and turns of the retinal blood vessels.

The definition of the Hair follicle neoplasm is that An uncontrolled autonomous cell-proliferation originating in a hair follicle, which is an epidermal adnexal structures responsible for hair growth.
The definition of the Trichilemmoma is that A benign tumor originating from the outer root sheath of the hair follicle. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:UToronto_htrang]
The definition of the Single trichilemmoma is that Presence of a unitary trichilemmoma, a benign tumor originating from the outer root sheath of the hair follicle.
The definition of the Multiple trichilemmomata is that Presence of multiple trichilemmomata, a benign tumor originating from the outer root sheath of the hair follicle.

The definition of the Epilepsia partialis continua is that Epilepsia partialis continua (also called Kojevnikov's or Kozhevnikov's epilepsia) is a type of focal motor status epilepticus characterized by repeated stereotyped simple motor manifestations such as jerks, typically of a limb or the face, recurring every few seconds or minutes for extended periods (days or years). [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:UToronto_htrang, https://orcid.org/0000-0002-1735-8178, PMID:26336950]
The definition of the Small intestinal stenosis is that The narrowing or partial blockage of a portion of the small intestine.
The definition of the Small intestinal bleeding is that Bleeding from the small intestine.

The definition of the Small intestinal dysmotility is that Abnormal small intestinal contractions, such as spasms and intestinal paralysis related to the loss of the ability of the gut to coordinate muscular activity because of endogenous or exogenous causes.
The definition of the Colonic stenosis is that A narrowing of a segment of colon whereby bowel continuity is maintained.
The definition of the Hepatic bridging fibrosis is that Hepatic fibrosis that reaches from a portal area to another portal area.
The definition of the Scrotal hypospadias is that Hypospadias with location of the urethral meatus in the scrotum.
The definition of the Midshaft hypospadias is that Hypospadias with location of the urethral meatus in the middle of the inferior shaft of the penis.
The definition of the Scrotal hyperpgimentation is that Increased pigmentation (skin color) of the scrotum.
The definition of the Abnormal scrotal rugation is that Anomaly of the folded ridges (wrinkles) of skin of the scrotum.
The definition of the Increased scrotal rugation is that Increased number or density of the folded ridges (wrinkles) of skin of the scrotum.
The definition of the Decreased scrotal rugation is that Decreased number or density of the folded ridges (wrinkles) of skin of the scrotum.

The definition of the Esophageal leukoplakia is that A white patch or plaque occurring on the surface of the esophageal mucous membranes that cannot be rubbed off and cannot be characterized clinically as any other disease. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:UToronto_htrang, PMID:23765246]
The definition of the Testicular fibrosis is that Formation of excess connective tissue in the testicle.
The definition of the Ovotestis is that A gonad that contains both ovarian follicles and testicular tubular elements.
The definition of the Abnormal germ cell morphology is that Any structural anomaly of a reproductive cell.
The definition of the Abnormal male germ cell morphology is that A structural anomaly of a male reproductive cell.
The definition of the Abnormal sperm morphology is that A structural anomaly of sperm.
The definition of the Sperm head anomaly is that A structural abnormality of the sperm head.
The definition of the Sperm neck anomaly is that A structural abnormality of the sperm neck.
The definition of the Sperm mid-piece anomaly is that A structural abnormality of the sperm mid-piece.
The definition of the Sperm tail anomaly is that A structural abnormality of the sperm tail.
The definition of the Acephalic spermatozoa is that Spermatozoa with very small cranial ends devoid of any nuclear material, that is, lacking a typical sperm head.

The definition of the Vanishing testis is that A condition which is considered to be due to the subsequent atrophy and disappearance in fetal life of an initially normal testis. In the presence of spermatic cord structures is evidence of the presence of the testis in early intrauterine life. When associated with a blind-ending spermatic cord, this entity is named as his absence of a testis in an otherwise normal 46XY male is usually unilateral and is assumed to be a consequence of intrauterine or perinatal torsion or infarction.

The definition of the Varicocele is that A varicocele is a widening of the veins along the spermatic cord, leading to enlarged, twisted veins in the scrotum, and manifested clinically by a painless testicle lump, scrotal swelling, or bulge in the scrotum.

The definition of the Abnormal vas deferens morphology is that A structural anomaly of the secretory duct of the testicle that carries spermatozoa from the epididymis to the prostatic urethra where it terminates to form ejaculatory duct.
The definition of the Absent vas deferens is that Aplasia (congenital absence) of the vas deferens.
The definition of the Abnormal male genital system physiology is that An abnormal functionality of the male genital system.
The definition of the Abnormal ejaculation is that Abnormality in the process of ejection of semen (usually carrying sperm) from the male reproductive tract.

The definition of the Premature ejaculation is that The emission of semen and seminal fluid during the act of preparation for sexual intercourse, i.e. before there is penetration, or shortly after penetration.
The definition of the Retrograde ejaculation is that The emission of semen and seminal fluid into the bladder instead of through the penis during orgasm.
The definition of the Retarded ejaculation is that Difficulty of a male in achieving orgasm.
The definition of the Anejaculation is that Inability to ejaculate.
The definition of the Abnormality of the labia minora is that An anomaly of the labia minora, the folds of skin between the outer labia.
The definition of the Abnormality of the labia majora is that An anomaly of the outer labia.
The definition of the Hyperplastic labia majora is that Overgrowth of the outer labia.
The definition of the Fallopian tube cyst is that A fluid filled sac located in the Fallopian tube.

The definition of the Fallopian tube torsion is that A twisting of the Fallopian tube. Sudden onset with sharp, colicky pelvic pain associated with nausea, vomiting, bowel, and bladder symptoms is the usual presentation.
The definition of the Fallopian tube duplication is that The presence of a supernumerary Fallopian tube.
The definition of the Hemorrhagic ovarian cyst is that An abdominal mass formed by bleeding into a follicular ovarian cyst or corpus luteum cyst.
The definition of the Ovarian serous cystadenoma is that A cystic tumor of the ovary, containing thin, clear, yellow serous fluid and varying amounts of solid tissue.
The definition of the Abnormality of the uterine cervix is that An anomaly of the neck of the uterus (lower part of the uterus), called the uterine cervix.
The definition of the Cervical endometriosis is that Abnormal growth of endometrial cells (which are normally limited to the uterus) within the cervix.
The definition of the Posteriorly placed anus is that Posterior malposition of the anus. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:UToronto_htrang]
The definition of the High posterior hairline is that Hair on the neck extends less inferiorly than usual. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:UToronto_htrang]
The definition of the Facial muscle hypertrophy is that Hypertrophy of one or more muscles innervated by the facial nerve (the seventh cranial nerve). [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:UToronto_htrang]
The definition of the Neck muscle hypertrophy is that Muscle hypertrophy affecting the muscles of the neck. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:UToronto_htrang]
The definition of the Paraspinal muscle hypertrophy is that Muscle hypertrophy affecting the paraspinal muscles. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:UToronto_htrang]
The definition of the Scapular muscle hypertrophy is that Muscle hypertrophy affecting the scapular muscles. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:UToronto_htrang]

The definition of the Abnormal motor evoked potentials is that An anomaly identified by motor evoked potentials (MEPs). MEPs are measured following single-pulse or repetitive transcranial magnetic stimulation and can be used for the assessment of the excitability of the motor cortex and the integrity of conduction along the central and peripheral motor pathways.
The definition of the Abnormal upper-limb motor evoked potentials is that An anomaly identified by motor evoked potentials (MEPs) in the arm. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:UToronto_htrang]
The definition of the Abnormal lower-limb motor evoked potentials is that An anomaly identified by motor evoked potentials (MEPs) in the leg. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:UToronto_htrang]
The definition of the Handgrip myotonia is that Difficulty releasing one's grip associated with prolonged first handgrip relaxation times. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:UToronto_htrang, PMID:22987687]
The definition of the Myotonia of the face is that Slowed relaxation of muscles in the face. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:UToronto_htrang]
The definition of the Myotonia of the jaw is that Slowed relaxation of muscles in the jaw. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:UToronto_htrang]
The definition of the Myotonia of the lower limb is that Slowed relaxation of muscles in the leg. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:UToronto_htrang]
The definition of the Myotonia of the upper limb is that Slowed relaxation of muscles in the arm. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:UToronto_htrang]

The definition of the Cold-sensitive myotonia is that An involuntary and painless delay in the relaxation of skeletal muscle following contraction or electrical stimulation that is induced by exposure to cold. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:UToronto_htrang, PMID:14617673]

The definition of the Euryblepharon is that Euryblepharon is a congenital eyelid anomaly characterized by horizontal enlargement of the palpebral fissure. The eyelid is shortened vertically compared with the horizontal dimension, with associated lateral canthal malpositioning and lateral ectropion abnormally wide lid opening.
The definition of the Ciliary body coloboma is that A coloboma of the ciliary body. []
The definition of the Lower limb dysmetria is that A lack of coordination of leg movement manifested by undershoot or overshoot of the intended position of the leg.
The definition of the Upper limb dysmetria is that A lack of coordination of arm movement manifested by undershoot or overshoot of the intended position of the arm.
The definition of the Astasia is that A postural abnormality characterized by the inability to stand without external support despite having sufficient muscle strength.

The definition of the Vertebrobasilar dolichoectasia is that Elongation, dilatation, and/or tortuosity of the vertebrobasilar segment. The definition of VBD includes: (i) diameter of basilar or vertebral artery over 4.5 mm; or (ii) deviation of any portion more than 10 mm from the shortest expected course; and (iii) length of basilar artery over 29.5 mm or length of intracranial vertebral artery over 23.5 mm. [PMID:24765483]

The definition of the Double elevator palsy is that A type of incomitant strabismus in which both elevator muscles (i.e., the inferior oblique and superior rectus muscles) of the same eye are weak leading to restricted elevation and hypotropia.
The definition of the Double depressor palsy is that An ocular movement abnormality characterised by simultaneous weakness of the inferior rectus muscle and superior oblique muscle of the same eye.
The definition of the Vertically incomitant strabismus is that A type of incomitant strabismus in which the angle of deviation varies as the patient's gaze shifts upwards and/or downwards.
The definition of the Esodeviation is that A manifest or latent ocular deviation in which one or both eyes tends to deviate nasally.
The definition of the Accommodative esotropia is that A form of esotropia (convergent deviation of the eyes) associated with activation of the accommodative reflex.
The definition of the Abnormal myeloid cell morphology is that Any structural anomaly of a cell of the monocyte, granulocyte, mast cell, megakaryocyte, or erythroid lineage. []

The definition of the Reduced bone-marrow pro-B cell count is that A reduction in the numbers of pro-B cells (defined by coexpression of CD34 and CD19). Earlier B-cell precursors are defined by expressing surface CD34 and cytoplasmic TdT in the absence of CD19. []
The definition of the Exodeviation is that A manifest or latent ocular deviation in which one or both eyes tends to deviate temporally.

The definition of the Anti-granocyte-macrophage colony stimulating factor antibody positivity is that The presence of autoantibodies in the serum that react against granulocyte-macrophage colony stimulating factor. [PMID:23509356]
The definition of the Hallux rigidus is that Osteoarthritis of the metatarsophalangeal joint of the first toe.

The definition of the Thickening of glomerular capillary wall is that Widening of the wall of capillary blood vessels in the glomerulus. This feature may be produced by deposits and other changes affecting either subepithelial and subendothelial regions or the glomerular basement membrane itself.
The definition of the Abnormal glomerular capillary morphology is that A structural anomaly of the capillary blood vessels in the renal glomerulus. []
The definition of the Ectopic fovea is that An abnormal anatomic position of the fovea, the small, central pit composed of closely packed cones that is located in the macula of the retina. []
The definition of the Tracheal tug on inspiration is that Downward movement of the trachea during inspiration due to downward traction on the tracheobronchial tree.
The definition of the Forward slanting upper incisors is that The upper incisors deviate from the normal angle of being roughly parallel to the surface of the face and instead slant outwards. []
The definition of the Foveal atrophy is that Partial or complete loss of foveal tissue that was once present.

The definition of the Pyriform aperture stenosis is that Narrowing of the anterior nasal aperture (piriform or pyriform aperture), which is a pear-shaped opening in the skull that forms the bony inlet of the nose.

The definition of the Status cribrosum is that Diffusely widened perivascular spaces in the basal ganglia, affecting especially the corpus striatum. Status cribrosum is usually symmetrical, with the perivascular spaces showing CSF signal and without diffusion restriction. The word cribriform means sievelike, with multiple perforations.
The definition of the Decerebrate rigidity is that A type of rigidity that is manifested by an exaggerated extensor posture of all extremities.

The definition of the Subcutaneous spheroids is that Small, hard cyst-like nodules, freely moveable in the subcutis over the bony prominences of the legs and arms, which have an outer calcified layer with a translucent core on x-ray. [PMID:20847697]

The definition of the Abnormal capillary morphology is that A structural anomaly of the tiny blood vessels that connect arterioles with venules and whose walls act as semipermeable membranes that mediate the diffusion of fluids and gases between the blood circulation and body tissues. []

The definition of the Capillary fragility is that Reduced resistance to rupture of capillary blood vessels. Capillary fragility may manifest as a bleeding diathesis with spontaneous ecchymoses (bruises). []

The definition of the Abnormal capillary physiology is that A functional anomaly of the tiny blood vessels that connect arterioles with venules and whose walls act as semipermeable membranes that mediate the diffusion of fluids and gases between the blood circulation and body tissues. []
The definition of the Arterial rupture is that Sudden breakage of an artery leading to leakage of blood from the circulation.

The definition of the Rectal atresia is that A developmental defect resulting in complete obliteration of the lumen of the rectum. That is, there is an abnormal closure, or atresia of the tubular structure of the rectum.

The definition of the Megarectum is that An abnormal dilation of the rectum. There is a large filled rectum as a result of underlying innervation or muscular abnormalities, which remains after disimpaction of the rectum.

The definition of the Rectovestibular fistula is that A congenital malformation characterized by an abnormal connection (fistula) between the rectum and the vulval vestibule, at the lower aspect of the vaginal opening.
The definition of the H-type rectovestibular fistula is that Rectovestibular fistula with a normal anus is known as H-type fistula or double termination of the alimentary tract. [PMID:20223314]

The definition of the Osteoma cutis is that The term osteoma refers to the anomalous presence of ossification (bone formation) in the interior of the dermis or epidermis. The dermal or subcutaneous bone formation presents as stony hard nodules. The osteomata appear as irregular, hardened small nodules that are well circumscribed and generally of the same color as the skin.
The definition of the Abnormality of enteric nervous system morphology is that A structural anomaly of nerves of the enteric nervous system. []

The definition of the Enteric neuronal degeneration is that Deterioration of enteric neurons with impairment of enteric neuronal structure. Typical neuropathological findings include qualitative (e.g., neuronal swelling, intranuclear inclusions, axonal degeneration) and quantitative (e.g., reduction in the number of neurons) abnormalities of the enteric neurons. []

The definition of the Abnormal proerythroblast morphology is that Anomalous form of the proerythroblast, i.e., the immature, nucleated erythrocyte occupying the stage of erythropoeisis that follows formation of erythroid progenitor cells. This cell is CD71-positive, has both a nucleus and a nucleolus, and lacks hematopoeitic lineage markers. []
The definition of the Hypothalamic gliosis is that Focal proliferation of glial cells in the hypothalamus.

The definition of the Intratesticular abscess is that A collection of pus within a testicle. Ultrasonographic features include shaggy, irregular walls, intratesticular location, low-level internal echoes, and occasionally, hypervascular margins. [PMID:11598263]
The definition of the Basal ganglia edema is that Swelling within the basal ganglia due to the accumulation of fluid. []
The definition of the Thalamic edema is that Swelling within the thalamus due to the accumulation of fluid. []
The definition of the Thalamic calcification is that Calcium deposition in the thalamus. []
The definition of the Abnormality of mesenteric lymph nodes is that A morphological anomaly of lymph nodes in the mesenteric root or throughout the mesentery. []
The definition of the Enlarged mesenteric lymph node is that Increase in size of one or more mesenteric lymph nodes. []

The definition of the Lung abscess is that A circumscribed area of pus or necrotic debris in lung parenchyma, which leads to a cavity, and after formation of bronchopulmonary fistula, can manifest as an air-fluid level inside the cavity. [PMID:26366400]
The definition of the Abnormal brain lactate level by MRS is that A deviation from normal of the level of lactate in the brain identified by magnetic resonance spectroscopy (MRS). []
The definition of the Reduced brain lactate level by MRS is that A decrease in the level of lactate in the brain identified by magnetic resonance spectroscopy (MRS). []

The definition of the Abnormal brain choline level by MRS is that A deviation from normal in the level of choline-containing compounds in the brain identified by magnetic resonance spectroscopy (MRS). []
The definition of the Reduced brain choline level by MRS is that An decrease in the level of choline-containing compounds in the brain identified by magnetic resonance spectroscopy (MRS). []
The definition of the Elevated brain creatine level by MRS is that An increase in the level of creatine in the brain identified by magnetic resonance spectroscopy (MRS). []
The definition of the Reduced brain creatine level by MRS is that A decrease in the level of creatine in the brain identified by magnetic resonance spectroscopy (MRS). [PMID:12557293, PMID:15625559]

The definition of the Abnormal brain N-acetyl aspartate level by MRS is that A deviation from normal in the level of N-acetyl aspartate in the brain identified by magnetic resonance spectroscopy (MRS). []
The definition of the Elevated brain N-acetyl aspartate level by MRS is that An increase in the level of N-acetyl aspartate in the brain identified by magnetic resonance spectroscopy (MRS). []

The definition of the Abnormality of olfactory lobe morphology is that A structural anomaly of the olfactory lobe, the structure within the brain that receives neural input from the nasal cavity and thereby processes the sense of smell. []
The definition of the Hypothalamic atrophy is that Partial or complete wasting (loss) of hypothalamus tissue that was once present. []
The definition of the Splenic abscess is that A circumscribed area of pus or necrotic debris in the parenchyma of the spleen. [PMID:21319348]
The definition of the Multifocal splenic abscess is that Multiple abscess lesions in the spleen. []
The definition of the Unifocal splenic abscess is that Single (solitary) abscess in the spleen. []
The definition of the Geophagia is that The practice of eating earth or soil-like substrates such as clay or chalk. [PMID:23816735]
The definition of the Scaphoid abdomen is that The anterior abdominal wall is sunken and presents a concave rather than a convex contour. []
The definition of the Thalamic hemorrhage is that Bleeding in the thalamus. []

The definition of the Abnormal erythrocyte volume is that A deviation from normal of the mean corpuscular volume, or mean cell volume (MCV) of red blood cells, usually taken to be 80 to 100 femtoliters. []

The definition of the Decreased mean corpuscular volume is that A reduction from normal of the mean corpuscular volume, or mean cell volume (MCV) of red blood cells (usually defined as an MCV below 80 femtoliters). []

The definition of the Incomitant strabismus is that Strabismus in which the angle of deviation differs depending upon the direction of gaze or according to which eye is fixing, associated with: (i) defective movement of the eye, (ii) asymmetrical accommodative effort.

The definition of the Concomitant strabismus is that Strabismus in which the angle of deviation of the squiting eye remains the same in relation to the other eye, in all directions of gaze, and whichever eye is fixing. []

The definition of the Abnormal U wave is that An anomaly of the U wave of the electrocardiogram (EKG). The U wave is a small (0.5 mm) deflection immediately following the T wave, usually in the same direction as the T wave. It is best seen in leads V2 and V3. [PMID:22665396]
The definition of the U wave inversion is that Direction of the U wave opposite to the T wave (i.e., below baseline) in leads with upright T waves. []
The definition of the Prominent U wave is that Increased amplitude of the U wave, defined as an amplitude grerater than 1-2mm or 25 percent of the height of the T wave. []
The definition of the Exercise-induced U wave inversion is that U wave inversion that is induced by exercise stress testing. [PMID:22665396]
The definition of the Abnormal QRS complex is that An anomaly of the complex formed by the Q, R, and S waves, which occur in rapid succession on the electrocardiogram. []

The definition of the Increased QRS voltage is that Elevation of the voltage (height) of the QRS complex. There are several criteria in use, but the most common is the Sokolov-Lyon criterion (S wave depth in V1 + tallest R wave height in V5-V6 greater than 35 mm). []
The definition of the Abnormal QRS voltage is that Abnormal amplitude of the QRS complex of the electrocardiogram (EKG). []

The definition of the Decreased QRS voltage is that Reduced amplitude (height) of the QRS complex of the electrocardiogram (EKG), defined as amplitudes of all the QRS complexes in the limb leads are less than 5 mm or amplitudes of all the QRS complexes in the precordial leads less than 10 mm. []
The definition of the Electrical alternans is that The QRS complexes of the electrocardiogram alternate in height. [PMID:8222799]
The definition of the Pancreatic abscess is that A circumscribed area of pus or necrotic debris in the parenchyma of the pancreas. []
The definition of the Orthokeratotic hyperkeratosis is that A form of hyperkeratosis characterized by thickening of the cornified layer without retained nuclei. []

The definition of the Darier's sign is that A skin change elicited by briskly rubbing the skin lesion in urticaria pigmentosa (UP), whereby the area begins to itch and becomes raised and surrounded by erythema. Unlike other forms of dermatographism, Darier's sign refers to urtication that is limited to the UP involved areas and, as in this case, spares the skin unaffected by UP. [PMID:24701633]

The definition of the Abnormal cutaneous elastic fiber morphology is that Any structural anomaly of the elastic fibers of the skin. Elastic fibers are the essential extracellular matrix macromolecules comprising an elastin core surrounded by a mantle of fibrillin-rich microfibrils. [PMID:12082143, PMID:21738362]

The definition of the Elevated dermal desmosine content is that An increased amount of desmosine measure in the skin. Desmosine is a cross-linking amino acid formed from lysyl residues in elastin. [PMID:2307214]
The definition of the Folliculitis is that Inflammatory cells within the wall and ostia of the hair follicle, creating a follicular-based pustule. []
The definition of the Bloody diarrhea is that Passage of many stools containing blood. []
The definition of the Bloody mucoid diarrhea is that Passage of many stools containing blood and mucus. []
The definition of the Delayed recoil upon stretching of skin is that Area of skin requiring an increased amount of time to return to its original shape after being stretched. []

The definition of the Onychomadesis is that Complete shedding (separation) of the nail from the proximal matrix. Onychomadesis is the proximal separation of the nail plate from the nail matrix due to a temporary cessation of nail growth. [PMID:24882996, PMID:25473242, PMID:28207011]
The definition of the Feculent vomiting is that Vomiting of material that is of fecal origin. []
The definition of the Abnormal large intestinal mucosa morphology is that A structural anomaly of the mucous lining of the large intestine. []
The definition of the Epidermal acanthosis is that Diffuse hypertrophy or thickening of the stratum spinosum of the epidermis (prickle cell layer of the skin). []
The definition of the Peripapillary exudate is that A retinal exudate in the area surrounding the optic nerve head. []
The definition of the Disciform macular scar is that A subretinal scar with a disc-like shape in the region of the macula. []
The definition of the Sneeze is that A sudden violent, spasmodic, audible expiration of breath through the nose and mouth. []
The definition of the Paroxysmal sneezing is that Unprovoked explosive pathological sneezing. [PMID:17388999]
The definition of the Eyelid myoclonus is that Marked, involuntary jerking of the eyelids. []
The definition of the Dysgenesis of the hypothalamus is that Structural abnormality of the hypothalamus related to defective development. []
The definition of the Dysgenesis of the thalamus is that Structural abnormality of the thalamus related to defective development. []
The definition of the Abnormal morphology of the hippocampus is that Any structural anomaly of the hippocampus, []
The definition of the Dysgenesis of the hippocampus is that Structural abnormality of the hippocampus related to defective development. []
The definition of the Dysgenesis of the basal ganglia is that Structural abnormality of the basal ganglia related to defective development. []
The definition of the Umbilicated nodule is that A type of skin nodule that has a small depression that resembles a navel (i.e., is umbilicated). [PMID:24050295]

The definition of the Capillary malformation is that A capillary malformation is a flat, sharply defined vascular stain of the skin. It may cover a large surface area or it may be scattered and appear as little islands of color. In a capillary maformation, the predominant vessels are small, slow-flow vessels (i.e., arterioles and postcapillary venules). [PMID:22483320, PMID:25864701]

The definition of the Nevus anemicus is that A congenital skin lesion characterized by irregular hypopigmented macules that coalesce to form plaques and occur particularly on the chest. It is generally present at birth or develops in the first days of life. It is more common in females. Diagnosis is confirmed by applying gentle friction to the lesion and the surrounding skin and checking that the erythema produced in the healthy skin does not appear in the hypopigmented lesion. This pale macule becomes more conspicuous when the lesion and its surroundings are rubbed. The margin of the naevus is ill-defined and consists of an archipelago of small anaemic spots. [PMID:22483320, PMID:25864701]

The definition of the Nevus roseus is that A variant of port-wine stain characterized by a pale red or even pink tone, in contrast to the darker hue of the port-wine stain. By analogy with the term port-wine stain, this variant rose-wine stain, or nevus roseus. Nevus roseus, however, cannot be definitely diagnosed until adulthood as port-wine stains are sometimes pink in children. While the natural history of port-wine stains includes hypertrophy, darkening, and nodularity, nevus roseus remains unchanged for life. [PMID:22483320, PMID:25864701]

The definition of the Cutis marmorata telangiectatica congenita is that A congenital vascular malformation that presents as localized or generalized erythematous-telangiectatic lesions with a reticular pattern; the lesions are almost always present at birth or develop in the first days of life. Cutis marmorata telangiectatica congenita (CMTC) appears as marble-like pattern (mottling) on the surface of the skin. In contrast to cutis marmorata, the marbling is more severe and always visible. [PMID:22483320, PMID:25864701]

The definition of the Angioma serpentinum is that Angioma serpiginosum consists of punctate, tightly packed telangiectatic lesions. Characteristic histopathological features are dilated and tortuous capillaries involving the uppermost part of the dermis. [PMID:25864701]

The definition of the Reduced red cell pyruvate kinase activity is that Decrease in the level of pyruvate kinase (PK) within erythrocytes. PK catalyzes the reaction: ATP + pyruvate = ADP + phosphoenolpyruvate. [PMID:7949104]
The definition of the Placoid macular lesion is that Yellow/white, sharply delineated lesion, typically of inflammatory nature, involving the macula. []
The definition of the Sound sensitivity is that Decreased tolerance to sound. []

The definition of the Misophonia is that An adverse response (dislike) to sound no matter what volume the sound is, characterized by a strong negative reaction to soft sounds that can sometimes be further triggered by seeing the source of the offending sound. []
The definition of the Hypergranulosis is that Hypergranulosis is an increased thickness of the stratum granulosum. []

The definition of the Civatte bodies is that Eosinophilic hyaline ovoid bodies which are often found in the subepidermal papillary regions or sometimes in the epidermis. Civatte bodies (CBs) are seen as rounded, homogenous, eosinophilic masses on routine H and E staining lying in the deeper parts of epidermis/epithelium and more frequently in dermis/connective tissue. They are known as CBs (in epithelium/epidermis), colloid bodies, or hyaline bodies (in connective tissue). They are 10-25 micrometers in diameter and situated mostly within or above the inflammatory cell infiltrate. In lichen planus, the number of necrotic keratinocytes may be so large that they are seen lying in clusters in the uppermost dermis. These bodies show a positive periodic acid Schiff reaction and are diastase resistant [PMID:23919028]

The definition of the Fetal distress is that An intrauterine state characterized by suboptimal values in the fetal heart rate, oxygenation of fetal blood, or other parameters indicative of compromise of the fetus. Signs of fetal distress include repetitive variable decelerations, fetal tachycardia or bradycardia, late decelerations, or low biophysical profile. []

The definition of the Rete ridge flattening is that Rete pegs (or ridges) are the epithelial extensions that project into the underlying connective tissue in both skin and mucous membranes. Rete ridge flattening refers to the loss of these projections so that the skin epithelium acquires a relatively flat appearance. [PMID:20548894]
The definition of the Lip discoloration is that Lightening or darkening of the lips from their usual coloring. []
The definition of the Violet lip discoloration is that An alteration of the color of the lip to take on a violet color. This term does not include cyanosis. [PMID:24346922]
The definition of the Sawtooth acanthosis is that A type of epidermal acanthosis characterized by a jagged (sawtooth) appearance of the rete ridges of the epidermis. [PMID:19061615]
The definition of the White streaks/specks on enamel. is that Areas of white discoloration visible on the surface of the teeth (enamel) in the form of streaks or specks. []
The definition of the Fragile teeth is that A tendency of teeth to fracture as manifested by a history of repeated fracture of the dental enamel without adequate trauma. []

The definition of the White lesion of the oral mucosa is that White lesions of the oral mucosa are generally caused by a condition that increases the thickness of the epithelium. This increases the distance to the vascular bed and thereby tends to change the usual reddish color of the oral mucosa to white. Common causes include hyperkeratosis (thickening of the keratin layer), acanthosis (thickening of the spinous cell layer), increased edema in the epithelium (leukoedema), and reduced vascularity of the underlying lamina propria. Additionally, fibrin caps or surface ulcerations and collapsed bullae can appear white. []

The definition of the Oral hairy leukoplakia is that A corrugated white lesion of the oral mucosa that usually occurs on the lateral or ventral surfaces of the tongue and may have a shaggy or frayed appearance. []

The definition of the Actinic keratosis is that A scaly, crusty lesion caused by damage from the ultraviolet radiation of the sun, with typical location on sun-exposed areas of the skin. Actinic keratosis lesions are often elevated, rough, and wartlike, and may be red, or occasionally tan, pink, or flesh-toned in color. []
The definition of the Reduced intraabdominal adipose tissue is that An abnormally reduced amount of adipose tissue in the abdominal cavity. []
The definition of the Abnormal small intestinal mucosa morphology is that A structural anomaly of the mucous lining of the small intestine. []

The definition of the Decreased small intestinal mucosa lactase activity is that Lactase is produced in the small intestine in humans, Lactase is a member of the beta-galactosidase family of enzymes, and hydrolyzes D-lactose to form D-galactose and D-glucose, which can be absorbed by the small intestine. There are many ways of assessing lactase activity. In one test, an endoscopic biopsy from the postbulbar duodenum is incubated with lactose on a test plate, and a color reaction develops within 20 min as a result of hydrolyzed lactose (a positive result) in patients with normolactasia, whereas no reaction (a negative result) develops in patients with severe hypolactasia. Other, less direct, tests include the hydrogen breath test, and blood tests following lactose challenges. []
The definition of the Finger swelling is that Enlargement of the soft tissues of one or more fingers. [PMID:16269085, PMID:19946526, PMID:24758199, PMID:9715244]
The definition of the Abnormal circulating estrogen level is that A deviation from normal concentration of the hormone estrogen in the blood circulation. []
The definition of the Abnormal serum estradiol is that A deviation from normal concentrations of estradiol in the circulation. []
The definition of the Increased serum estradiol is that An elevation above normal limits of the concentration of estradiol in the circulation. []
The definition of the Abnormal serum estriol is that A deviation from normal concentration of estriol in the circulation. []
The definition of the Increased serum estriol is that An elevation above normal limits of estriol concentration in the circulation. []
The definition of the Decreased serum estriol is that A reduction below normal limits of estriol in the circulation. []
The definition of the Abnormal serum estrone is that A deviation from the normal concentration of circulating estrone. []
The definition of the Increased serum estrone is that An elevation above normal limits of the concentration of estrone in the circulation. []
The definition of the Decreased serum estrone is that A reduction below normal limits of the concentration of estrone in the circulation. []
The definition of the Gingival calcification is that Ectopic deposition of calcium salts found in the gingiva. [PMID:25928877]
The definition of the Foveal degeneration is that Deterioration of the tissue of the fovea, i.e.,the region of sharpest vision within the macula of the retina. []
The definition of the Beaten bronze macular sheen is that A shiny appearance of the macula, which is often called a beaten bronze appearance. []
The definition of the Dark choroid is that A fluorescein angiographic finding of absence of the normal background fluorescence (a dark choroid). [PMID:27739528, PMID:7248243]

The definition of the Atrophic muscularis propria is that Partial or complete wasting (loss) of muscularois propria tissue that was once present. The atrophy may involve a marked vacuolar degeneration of myocytes, loss of muscle fibers and some cases a highly characteristic honeycomb fibrosis. [PMID:18329691]
The definition of the Hypoganglionosis is that Sparse and small myenteric ganglia []
The definition of the Ganglioneuromatosis is that Hyperplastic submucosal and myenteric plexus containing an increased number of ganglion cells, glial cells and nerve fibers. [PMID:26361414]

The definition of the Poor visual behavior for age is that Lack of visual responsiveness or decrease in visual capabilities suggesting a lack of visual responsiveness or decrease in visual capabilities in an infant or young child in which visual behavior fails to meet normal developmental milestones. []
