The definition of the Portosystemic collateral veins is that Presence of biliary veins that serve as a collateral channel to the systemic circulation []
The definition of the Abnormality of hepatobiliary system physiology is that A functional anomaly of the hepatobiliary system []

The definition of the Dependency on intravenous nutrition is that Inability to be weaned from intravenous (parenteral) nutrition, as judged by the hydration status (urine output, blood urea nitrogen, creatinine, urine sodium concentration), ability to maintain weight, stool output, and serum electrolyte status. [PMID:16770168]

The definition of the Increased urinary sedoheptulose is that An increased concentration of sedoheptulose in the urine. Sedoheptulose is a monosaccharide with seven carbon atoms and a ketone functional group. []
The definition of the Hyperautofluorescent retinal lesion is that Increased amount of autofluorescence in the retina as ascertained by fundus autofluorescence imaging. []
The definition of the Hypoautofluorescent retinal lesion is that Decreased amount of autofluorescence in the retina as ascertained by fundus autofluorescence imaging. []

The definition of the Abnormal temper tantrums is that Temper tantrums are brief episodes of extreme, unpleasant, and sometimes aggressive behaviors in response to frustration or anger, which are a normal part of development in toddlers. Temper tantrums that occur more frequently in a given time and/or are more severe in symptomatology and/or longer in duration and/or inappropriate for the given age compared to a temper tantrum that naturally occurs as a part of the developmental process are classified as abnormal temper tantrums. []
The definition of the Frequent temper tantrums is that Temper tantrums that occur more frequently compared to the temper tantrums that are a part of the normal developmental process. []

The definition of the Severe temper tantrums is that Temper tantrums, which occur with more severe symptomatology compared to a temper tantrum that occurs as a part of normal developmental process. []

The definition of the Abnormality of optic chiasm morphology is that A structural abnormality of the optic chiasm.The optic chiasm, located below the hypothalamus, is a partial crossing of the optic nerves. []

The definition of the Increased number of elastic fibers in the dermis is that An elevated number of elastic fibers, that is of bundles of proteins and glycoproteins in the extracellular matrix in the reticular dermis. Elastic fibers can stretch and recoil back to their original length. This feature can be appreciated on histology with hematoxylin and eosin or other staining methods. [PMID:25072684]

The definition of the Clumping of elastic fibers in the dermis is that Formation of clumps or aggregates that make up small protuberances from elastic fibers within the dermis (especially the reticular dermis). [PMID:25072684]
The definition of the Thickened elastic fibers in the dermis is that An increase of the diameter of elastic fibers in the dermis. []

The definition of the Fragmented elastic fibers in the dermis is that Elastic fibers in the dermis exhibit an increased number of breaks associated with disorganization of the structure of the elastic fibers. []
The definition of the Left ventricular diastolic dysfunction is that Abnormal function of the left ventricule during left ventricular relaxation and filling. [PMID:12527689, PMID:14594874]
The definition of the Left ventricular systolic dysfunction is that Abnormality of left ventricular contraction, often defined operationally as an ejection fraction of less than 40 percent. []
The definition of the Neuronal/glioneuronal neoplasm of the central nervous system is that A central nervous system neoplasm with neuronal and, less consistently, glial differentiation. []

The definition of the Rosette-forming glioneuronal tumor is that A tumor of the central nervous system that has components of both neurocytic and glial areas, whereby usually the glial component of the tumor predominates. Rossette-forming glioneuronal tumors (RGNT) have biphasic cytoarchitecture with two elements; neurocytic rosettes resembling Homer-Wright rosettes, and astrocytic component resembling a pilocytic astrocytoma. RGNTs are low-grade tumors that lack histopathological signs of malignancy. [PMID:27179225]

The definition of the Smooth septal thickening on pulmonary HRCT is that Thickening of the interlobular septa of the lungs as seen on a high-resolution computed tomography scan with a smooth appearance of the interlobular septa. []

The definition of the Nodular septal thickening on pulmonary HRCT is that Thickening of the interlobular septa of the lungs as seen on a high-resolution computed tomography scan with a nodular or beaded appearance of the interlobular septa. []

The definition of the Irregular septal thickening on pulmonary HRCT is that Thickening of the interlobular septa of the lungs as seen on a high-resolution computed tomography scan with an irregular appearance of the interlobular septa. THis feature is often associated with distortion of lung architecture. []

The definition of the Honeycomb lung is that Honeycombing represents destroyed and fibrotic lung tissue containing numerous cystic airspaces with thick fibrous walls, representing the late stage of various lung diseases, with complete loss of acinar architecture. The cysts range in size from a few millimeters to several centimeters in diameter, have variable wall thickness, and are lined by metaplastic bronchiolar epithelium. On chest radiographs, honeycombing appears as closely approximated ring shadows, typically 3-10 mm in diameter with walls 1-3 mm in thickness, that resemble a honeycomb; the finding implies end-stage lung disease. On CT scans, the appearance is of clustered cystic air spaces, typically of comparable diameters on the order of 3-10 mm but occasionally as large as 2.5 cm. Honeycombing is usually subpleural and is characterized by well-defined walls. It is a CT feature of established pulmonary fibrosis. Because honeycombing is often considered specific for pulmonary fibrosis and is an important criterion in the diagnosis of usual interstitial pneumonia, the term should be used with care, as it may directly impact patient care. [PMID:18195376]

The definition of the Intralobular interstitial thickening is that A fine reticular pattern on high-resolution computed tomography, with the visible lines separated by a few millimeters. Regions of the lung with intralobular interstitial thickening characteristically show a fine lacelike or netlike appearance. []

The definition of the Peribronchovascular interstitial thickening is that Thickening of the peribronchovascular interstitium, a connective tissue sheath that surrounds the central bronchi and pulmonary arteries. The peribronchovascular interstitium extends from the level of the pulmonary hila into the peripheral lung. This feature may be ascertained on high-resolution computer tomography. []
The definition of the Subpleural interstitial thickening is that Increase in thickness of the subpleural interstitium. []

The definition of the Ground-glass opacification on pulmonary HRCT is that On chest radiographs, ground-glass opacity appears as an area of hazy increased lung opacity, usually extensive, within which margins of pulmonary vessels may be indistinct. On CT scans, it appears as hazy increased opacity of lung, with preservation of bronchial and vascular margins. It is caused by partial filling of airspaces, interstitial thickening (due to fluid, cells, and/or fibrosis), partial collapse of alveoli, increased capillary blood volume, or a combination of these, the common factor being the partial displacement of air. Ground-glass opacity is less opaque than consolidation, in which bronchovascular margins are obscured. [PMID:18195376, PMID:23247773]

The definition of the Centrilobular ground-glass opacification on pulmonary HRCT is that A hazy area of increased attenuation in centrilobular areas of the lung with preserved bronchial and vascular markings seen on a computer tomography scan. Centrilobular refers to a location that is central within secondary pulmonary lobules. []

The definition of the Abdominal aseptic abscess is that An abscess-like lesion located within the abdomen. The lesions are localized in the spleen, liver, abdominal lymph nodes. The lesions represent visceral sterile collections of mature neutrophils that do not respond to antibiotics but regress quickly when treated with corticosteroids, but relapses occur frequently. [PMID:22526827]

The definition of the Localized area of pendulous skin is that A confined region of lax skin that hangs below the level of the surrounding skin. Histopatholigically, there is a loss of elastic fibers in the dermis of the affected region. []

The definition of the Marcus Gunn jaw winking synkinesis is that Unilateral ptosis with associated upper eyelid contraction and contraction of either the external or the internal pterygoid muscle. It is thought to occur because of congenital miswiring of a branch of the fifth cranial nerve into the branch of the third cranial nerve supplying the levator muscle. In Marcus Gunn jaw winking synkinesis, elevation and even retraction of the affected eyelid is triggered by chewing, suction, lateral mandible movement, smiling, sternocleidomastoid contraction, protruding tongue, Valsalva manoeuvre and even by breathing. [PMID:23345532, PMID:25754805]
The definition of the Retinal vasculitis is that Inflammation of retinal blood vessels as manifested by perivascular sheathing or cuffing, vascular leakage and/or occlusion. []

The definition of the Generalized tonic-clonic seizures without focal onset is that A bilateral tonic-clonic seizure with generalized onset is a type of bilateral tonic-clonic seizure characterised by generalized onset; these seizures rapidly engage networks in both hemispheres at the start of the seizure. [PMID:20196795, PMID:28276060, PMID:28276064, PMID:6790275]

The definition of the Subtentorial periventricular white matter hyperdensity is that Areas of brighter than expected signal on magnetic resonance imaging emanating from the cerebral white matter that surrounds the fourth cerebral ventricle (which is located beneath the tentorium of the cerebellum). []

The definition of the Posterolateral diaphragmatic hernia is that A posterolateral defect in the diaphragm, commonly referred to as a Bochdalek hernia, which is often accompanied by herniation of the stomach, intestines, liver, and/or spleen into the chest cavity. []
The definition of the Morgagni diaphragmatic hernia is that An anterior retrosternal or parasternal hernia that can result in the herniation of liver or intestines into the chest cavity. []

The definition of the Central diaphragmatic hernia is that A congenital diaphragm defect involving the central tendinous (e.g., amuscular) portion of the diaphragm, whereby the entire rim of diaphragmatic musculature is present. []

The definition of the Increased total iron binding capacity is that An elevation in the total-iron binding capacity, which measures how much serum iron is bound if an excess of radioactive iron is added. A high TIBC corresponds to a high transferrin concentration. The latent (or free) iron binding capacity is the difference between the TIBC and the measured serum iron, corresponding to the transferrin not bound to iron, i.e., free iron binding capacity. [PMID:3542299]

The definition of the Inclusion body fibromatosis is that A benign tumor made up of mostly myofibroblasts that appears almost exclusively on the digits of the hands and feet, rarely involving the thumb or big toe. The lesion displays a proliferation of bland intradermal spindle cells arranged in whorls, fascicles, or a storiform pattern in a collagenous background of varying degrees. Also usually present are perpendicular tumor cell fascicles that extend to the epidermis. The small intracytoplasmic inclusions are said to appear similar to red blood cells. The inclusion bodies have been shown to be made up of densely packed vimentin and actin filaments. The tumor often causes a dome-shaped elevation of the overlying structures, forming a protuberant or polypoid nodule. The overlying epidermis can display a host of changes, including acanthosis, hyperkeratosis, parakeratosis, rete ridge flattening, entrapment of adnexal structures, and, rarely, ulceration. [NCIT:C3456, PMID:27684985]

The definition of the Inflammatory cap polyp is that A non-malignant sessile or pedunculated polyp in the colon and rectum that displays a cap of inflammatory granulation tissue with fibrinopurulent exudate that covers the polyp. []
The definition of the Muscle fiber actin filament accumulation is that Accumulation in muscle cells of filaments composed of actin. []

The definition of the Abnormal apolipoprotein level is that A deviation from the normal concentration in blood of an apolipoprotein, i.e., of a protein that binds lipids to form lipoprotein and is thereby responsible for the transport of lipids in the blood and lymph circulation. []

The definition of the Elevated apolipoprotein A-IV level is that An increased concentration in blood of apolipoprotein A-IV, a major component of HDL and chylomicrons that has a role in VLDL secretion and catabolism and is required for efficient activation of lipoprotein lipase by ApoC-II. []
The definition of the Caput medusae is that Distended and engorged umbilical veins which are seen radiating from the umbilicus across the abdomen to join systemic veins. [PMID:26112857]

The definition of the Triggered by is that A trigger is defined as an external factor that leads to the manifestation of a sign or symptom in a person with a susceptibility to developing that manifestation. []
The definition of the Triggered by breast feeding is that Applies to a sign or symptom that is provoked or brought about by breast feeding in an infant. []
The definition of the Triggered by cold is that Applies to a sign or symptom that is provoked or brought about by exposure to cold surroundings. []
The definition of the Triggered by dehydration is that Applies to a sign or symptom that is provoked or brought about by being dehydrated, i.e., by a deficit in total body water. []
The definition of the Triggered by carbohydrate ingestion is that Applies to a sign or symptom that is provoked or brought about by eating or drinking carbohydrates. []
The definition of the Triggered by fructose ingestion is that Applies to a sign or symptom that is provoked or brought about by eating or drinking fructose. []
The definition of the Triggered by glucose ingestion is that Applies to a sign or symptom that is provoked or brought about by eating or drinking glucose. []
The definition of the Triggered by ethanol ingestion is that Applies to a sign or symptom that is provoked or brought about by drinking or otherwise ingesting ethanol. []
The definition of the Triggered by fasting is that Applies to a sign or symptom that is provoked or brought about by abstaining from eating food (fasting). []

The definition of the Triggered by galactose ingestion is that Applies to a sign or symptom that is provoked or brought about by eating or drinking galactose. Galactose usually is ingested as lactose, which is composed of equimolar amounts of glucose and galactose. []
The definition of the Triggered by heat is that Applies to a sign or symptom that is provoked or brought about by exposure to heat. []
The definition of the Triggered by febrile illness is that Applies to a sign or symptom that is provoked or brought about by febrile illness. []
The definition of the Triggered by heavy meal is that Applies to a sign or symptom that is provoked or brought about by eating large quantities of food, for instance, by a heavy meal. []
The definition of the Triggered by high-fat diet is that Applies to a sign or symptom that is provoked or brought about by eating a diet high in lipids. []
The definition of the Triggered by hyperventilation is that Applies to a sign or symptom that is provoked or brought about by excessively rapid and deep breathing. []
The definition of the Triggered by vaccination is that Applies to a sign or symptom that is provoked or brought about by a vaccination. [PMID:26633955]
The definition of the Triggered by menstruation is that Applies to a sign or symptom that is provoked or brought about by menstruation in a female. []
The definition of the Triggered by pregnancy is that Applies to a sign or symptom that is provoked or brought about by pregnancy in a female. []
The definition of the Triggered by sleep deprivation is that Applies to a sign or symptom that is provoked or brought about by a lack of sufficient sleep. []
The definition of the Triggered by smoking is that Applies to a sign or symptom that is provoked or brought about by smoking. []
The definition of the Triggered by sodium ingestion is that Applies to a sign or symptom that is provoked or brought about by eating or drinking sodium. []
The definition of the Triggered by sound is that Applies to a sign or symptom that is provoked or brought about by exposure to sound or noise. []

The definition of the Triggered by stress is that Applies to a sign or symptom that is provoked or brought about by a physical, mental, or emotional factor associated with bodily or mental tension. []
The definition of the Triggered by excitement is that Applies to a sign or symptom that is provoked or brought about by a a state of excitement or by being startled. []
The definition of the Triggered by sudden movement is that Applies to a sign or symptom that is provoked or brought about by a sudden movement. []

The definition of the Triggered by vestibular stimulation is that Applies to a sign or symptom that is provoked or brought about by vestibular stimulation, including head turning, cold calorics, postural changes, or rotating chair. []
The definition of the Tendonitis is that Inflammation of a tendon. []
The definition of the Abnormality of synovial bursa morphology is that A structural anomaly of a synovial bursa. []
The definition of the Bursitis is that Inflammation of a synovial bursa. []
The definition of the Sleep paralysis is that An inability to move the body at the onset of sleep or upon awakening from sleep, lasting for seconds to a few minutes. [PMID:32965993]
The definition of the Parasomnia is that An undesirable physical event or experience that occurs during the process of falling asleep, while asleep, or when waking up from sleep. [PMID:35956054]
The definition of the Non-rapid eye movement parasomnia is that A parasomnia that occurs during non-rapid eye movement (NREM) sleep. [PMID:31375204]

The definition of the Somnambulism is that Ambulation or other complex motor behaviors may occur after getting out of bed in a sleep-like state. During sleepwalking episodes, the individual who is somnambulating appears confused or dazed, with their eyes usually open. They may mumble or give inappropriate answers to questions, and occasionally appear agitated. [PMID:32644427,PMID:30458142]

The definition of the Confusional arousal is that A nocturnal episode is characterized by disorientation, grogginess, and, at times, significant agitation upon awakening from slow-wave sleep or following forced awakenings. [PMID:35985125]

The definition of the Subhyaloid hemorrhage is that A localized detachment of the vitreous from the retina due to the accumulation of blood. When localized in the macular area, it results in sudden profound loss of vision. Subhyaloid premacular hemorrhage is typically characterized by a circumscribed, round or dumb-bell shaped, bright red mound of blood beneath the internal limiting membrane (ILM) or between the ILM and hyaloid face, in or near to the central macular area. [PMID:27090882]

The definition of the Preretinal hemorrhage is that An accumulation of blood between the neurosensory retina and the retinal pigment epithelium (RPE) arising from the choroidal or retinal circulation.

The definition of the Flame-shaped retinal hemorrhage is that A type of retinal hemorrhage that is located within the nerve fiber layer (NFL) of the retina and that exhibits a characteristic flame shape which results from constraints by the structure of the NFL (axons of the ganglion cells). []

The definition of the Dot-and-blot retinal hemorrhage is that Accumulation of blood located in the retina's inner nuclear and outer plexiform layers, and having a dot-like or blot-like shape. THe shape results from intraretinal compression, restricting the hemorrhages within a specific location. []
The definition of the Subretinal hemorrhage is that Accumulation of blood located beneath the neurosensory retina in the space between the neurosensory retina and the retinal pigment epithelium. []
The definition of the Subretinal pigment epithelium hemorrhage is that An accumulation of blood located between the retinal pigment epithelium (RPE) and Bruch's membrane. []

The definition of the Cutaneous cyst is that A hollow mass located in the skin that is surrounded by an epithelium-lined wall and is well demarcated from the adjacent tissue. Cysts are often said to be sac-like and may contain serous liquid or semisolid material. []

The definition of the Trichilemmal cyst is that Nontender, round and firm, but slightly compressible, intradermal or subcutaneous cyst measuring 0.5-5 cm in diameter. Trichilemmal cysts are acquired rather than congenital, and tend to appear on the scalp rather than the face, and to be intradermal rather than subcutaneous. []

The definition of the Dermoid cyst is that A congenital subcutaneous cyst that arises from entrapment of skin along the lines of embryonic fusion. In contrast to epidermal cysts, dermoid cysts tend to contain various adnexal structures such as hair, sebaceous, eccrine or apocrine glands. Dermoid cysts are present at birth, and are indolent, firm, deep, subcutaneous nodules. They are often located on the head and neck, and rarely in the anogenital area. Dermoid cysts are slowly progressive and can grow to a size of 1 to 4 cm. []

The definition of the Eruptive vellus hair cyst is that A cutaneous cyst that is small (one or two millimeters in diameter) and painless, presenting as a follicular papule that usually is skin colored but may have a reddish or brownish tinge. []
The definition of the Comedo is that A clogged cutaneous sebaceous follicle, which is a cutaneous gland that secretes sebum (usually into a hair follicle). []

The definition of the Closed comedo is that A comedo in which the top of the pore is not stretched open and thus does not expose the clogged portion (which would appear black), hence the name whitehead. []
The definition of the Open comedo is that A comedo in which the part of the pore at the surface of the skin is stretched and open, exposing the contents of the comedo, which appear black. []

The definition of the Geographic tongue is that An anomaly of the tongue characterized by loss (atrophy) of filiform papillae of the tongue, leaving areas of erythema (redness), surrounded by a serpiginous, white, hyperkeratotic border. The name geographic tongue refers to an appearance that is said to be similar to a map. [PMID:32119353]
The definition of the Claustrophobia is that An abnormal fear of being in a closed or narrow space with no escape is called claustrophobia. []
The definition of the Ameliorated by is that An ameliorating factor is defined as an external factor that leads to a sign or symptom that is already present improving or becoming more bearable []
The definition of the Ameliorated by pregnancy is that Applies to a sign or symptom that is improved or made more bearable by pregnancy in a female. []
The definition of the Ameliorated by heat is that Applies to a sign or symptom that is improved or made more bearable by heat (including fever). []

The definition of the Ameliorated by carbohydrate ingestion is that Applies to a sign or symptom that is improved or made more bearable by eating or drinking carbohydrates including glucose (sugar). []

The definition of the Stiff neck is that A sensation of tightness in the neck when attempting to move it, especially after a period of inactivity. Neck stiffness often involves soreness and difficulty moving the neck, especially when trying to turn the head to the side. []
The definition of the Stiff elbow is that A sensation of tightness in the elbow joint when attempting to move it, especially after a period of inactivity. []
The definition of the Stiff wrist is that A sensation of tightness in the wrist joint when attempting to move it, especially after a period of inactivity. []
The definition of the Stiff finger is that A sensation of tightness in a finger joint when attempting to move it, especially after a period of inactivity. []
The definition of the Stiff hip is that A sensation of tightness in the hip joint when attempting to move it, especially after a period of inactivity. []
The definition of the Stiff knee is that A sensation of tightness in the knee joint when attempting to move it, especially after a period of inactivity. []
The definition of the Stiff ankle is that A sensation of tightness in the ankle joint when attempting to move it, especially after a period of inactivity. []
The definition of the Stiff toe is that A sensation of tightness in a toe joint when attempting to move it, especially after a period of inactivity. []

The definition of the Snoring is that Deep, noisy breathing during sleep, accompanied by hoarse or harsh sounds, is caused by the vibration of respiratory structures, especially the soft palate. This vibration results in sound due to obstructed air movement during breathing while sleeping. [PMID:35216759]

The definition of the Stuttering is that Disruptions in the production of speech sounds, with involuntary repetitions of words or parts of words, prolongations of speech sounds, or complete blockage of speech production for several seconds. []
The definition of the Panic attack is that A sudden episode of intense fear in a situation where there is no danger or apparent cause. []
The definition of the Abnormality of esophagus physiology is that Any physiological abnormality of the esophagus. []
The definition of the Esophageal spasms is that Involuntary contractions of the esophagus that are irregular, uncoordinated, and painful. []
The definition of the Melasma is that Symmetrical, blotchy, brownish facial pigmentation. []
The definition of the Achilles tendonitis is that Inflammation of the Achilles tendon. []

The definition of the Ovarian dermoid cyst is that An cystic ovarian teratoma composed of dermal and epidermal elements and containing tissue components including hair, teeth, bone, thyroid, and others. []
The definition of the Lateral is that Applies to an abnormality that is located farther from the median plane or midline of the body or of the referenced structure. []

The definition of the Abnormality of skin adnexa physiology is that Any functional anomaly of the skin adnexa (skin appendages), which are specialized skin structures located within the dermis and focally within the subcutaneous fatty tissue, comprising three histologically distinct structures: (1) the pilosebaceous unit (hair follicle and sebaceous glands); (2) the eccrine sweat glands; and (3) the apocrine glands. []
The definition of the Gustatory sweating is that Hyperhidrosis that occurs with gustatory stimulation (e.g., moisture on face from sweating that occurs after eating). [PMID:22798976]
The definition of the Cold-induced sweating is that Sweating provoked by cold temperature rather than by heat. []
The definition of the Pain characteristic is that A pain characteristic is defined as a subjective category or type of pain. []
The definition of the Sharp is that Applied to pain that is described as sharp, i.e., sudden and severe. []
The definition of the Dull is that Applied to pain that is dull, i.e., not severe but that continues over a long period of time. []
The definition of the Tender is that Applied to pain that is tender, i.e., elicited by touching the affected body part. []
The definition of the Sleep-interrupting is that Applied to pain that wakes the affecting individual from sleep. []
The definition of the Aggravated by is that An aggravating factor is defined as an external factor that leads to a sign or symptom that is already present getting worse or becoming more severe. []
The definition of the Aggravated by activity is that Applied to a sign or symptom that is aggravated by activity, exertion, or exercise. []
The definition of the Axial is that Applies to an abnormality that is situated in the central part of the body, in the head and trunk as distinguished from the limbs. []
The definition of the Cervical lymphadenopathy is that Enlarged lymph nodes in the neck. []
The definition of the Upper-body predominance is that Applies to an abnormality that affects the arms, trunk, head more than the legs. []
The definition of the Lower-body predominance is that Applies to an abnormality that affects the legs more than the arms, trunk, head. []
The definition of the Acral is that Applies to an abnormality that affects the distal portions of limbs (hand, foot) and head (ears, nose). []

The definition of the Distributed along Blashko lines is that Applies to an abnormality whose localization corresponds to the lines of Blaschko, which correspond to the lineage of epithelia cells. Blaschko lines are normally invisible but may become apparent with certain skin diseases and then can be seen to be distributed in lines horizontal to the body. [PMID:17061271]
The definition of the Dermatomal is that Applies to an abnormality whose localization corresponds to the dermatomes, i.e., the nerve root distribution. [PMID:19772560]

The definition of the Herpetiform is that Applies to an abnormality whose distribution and appearance resembles that of the grouped umbilicated vesicles seen in herpes simplex and herpes zoster infections. []

The definition of the Morbilliform is that Applies to an abnormality whose distribution and appearance resembles that of measles, i.e., maculopapular lesions that are red and roughly 2 to 10 mm in diameter and may be partially confluent. []
The definition of the Malar rash is that An erythematous (red), flat facial rash that affects the skin in the malar area (over the cheekbones) and extends over the bridge of the nose. []
The definition of the Abnormal pupil shape is that A deviation from the normal circular shape of the pupil []
The definition of the Oval pupil is that An abnormal pupil shape that is elliptical, i.e., egg-like. []

The definition of the Anterior chamber cyst is that A closed sac, having a distinct membrane and division compared to the nearby tissue located within the anterior chamber. The sac that may contain air, fluids, or semi-solid material. []
The definition of the Esophoria is that A form of strabismus with both eyes turned inward to a relatively mild degree, usually defined as less than 10 prism diopters. []
The definition of the Exophoria is that A form of strabismus with one or both eyes deviated outward to a milder degree than with exotropia. []

The definition of the Choroidal nevus is that A benign, flat or slightly elevated melanocytic lesions of the posterior uveawith clearly defined margins. Choroidal nevi tend they remain stable in size, and to display features such as overlying drusen as well as retinal pigment epithelial atrophy, hyperplasia or fibrous metaplasia. []
The definition of the Exacerbated by head trauma is that Applies to a sign or symptom that is worsened, aggravated, or exacerbated by head trauma. []
The definition of the Cubitus varus is that A deformity of the elbow in which there is a deviation of the forearm toward the midline of the body. []
The definition of the Ovarian carcinoma is that A malignant neoplasm originating from the surface ovarian epithelium. []

The definition of the Rubeosis iridis is that Formation of new blood vessels on the iris. The new vessels do not display the typical radially symmertic growth pattern of normal iris blood vessels, but rather appear disorganized. Rubeosis usually starts from the pupillary border with tiny tufts of dilated capillaries or red spots that can only be appreciated with high magnification. [PMID:27895936]

The definition of the Leakage of dye on fundus fluorescein angiography is that Leakage of fluorescein dye observed upon retinal fluorescein angiography. Areas of leakage can be appreciated as showing gradual enlargement with blurring of margins. []
The definition of the Copper accumulation in liver is that An anomalous build up of copper (Cu) in the liver. []
The definition of the Venous occlusion is that Blockage of venous return (flow of blood from the periphery back towards the right atrium) in a vein. []
The definition of the Abnormal arterial physiology is that An anomaly of arterial function. []
The definition of the Arterial occlusion is that Blockage of blood flow through an artery. []
The definition of the Sparse medial eyebrow is that Decreased density/number and/or decreased diameter of medial eyebrow hairs. []
The definition of the Retinal arterial occlusion is that Blockage of the retinal artery, generally associated with interruption of blood flow and oxygen delivery to the retina. []

The definition of the Decreased renal parenchymal thickness is that Reduced dimension of the solid part of the kidney (parenchyma, the renal cortex and medulla) as measured from the collecting system (renal calyces and pelvis) to the border of the kidney. This measurement can be performed by measuring the thickness of the parenchyma in computed tomography scans. [PMID:19254392, PMID:2117353]
The definition of the Antepartum hemorrhage is that Significant maternal hemorrhage/bleed in the second half of pregnancy and prior to the birth of the baby. []

The definition of the Anti-glutamic acid decarboxylase antibody positivity is that The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the serum that react against glutamic acid decarboxylase. [PMID:27356651]
The definition of the Downgaze palsy is that A limitation of the ability to direct one's gaze below the horizontal meridian. [PMID:8913186]
The definition of the Upgaze palsy is that A limitation of the ability to direct one's gaze above the horizontal meridian. []
The definition of the Abnormality of foot cortical bone is that An anomaly of the outer shell (cortex) of a foot bone. []
The definition of the Cortical thinning of foot bones is that A reduction in the thickness of the outer shell (cortex) of foot bones. [PMID:24055421]
The definition of the Triggered by emotion is that Applies to a sign or symptom that is provoked or brought about by a strong spontaneously arising mental state, reaction or feeling (emotion). []

The definition of the Delayed ability to stand is that A failure to achieve the ability to stand up at an appropriate developmental stage. Most children begin to walk alone at 11 to 15 months of age. On average, children can stand while holding on at the age of 9 to 10 months, can pull up to stand and walk with one hand being held at 12 months, and can stand alone and walk well at 18 months. [PMID:23321410, PMID:27354457]

The definition of the Delayed ability to sit is that A failure to achieve the ability to sit at an appropriate developmental stage. Most children sit with support at 6 months of age and sit steadily without support at 9 months of age. [PMID:23321410, PMID:27354457]

The definition of the Red eye is that A reddish appearance over the white part (sclera) of the eye ranging from a few enlarged blood vessels appearing as wiggly lines over the sclera to a bright red color completely covering to sclera. []
The definition of the Circumlimbal hyperemia is that A ring of redness at the limbus of the eye, the border between the cornea and the sclera. []
The definition of the Superficial episcleral hyperemia is that Prominence of blood vessels of the superficial episcleral tissues. []
The definition of the Deep episcleral hyperemia is that Prominence of blood vessels of the deep episcleral tissues. []
The definition of the Corneal keratic precipitates is that An inflammatory cellular deposit deposited on the corneal endothelium and visible as spots on the cornea. []
The definition of the Central retinal artery occlusion is that Blockage of the main artery in the retina. The typical presentation is one of profound monocular visual loss. [PMID:23470793]

The definition of the Lupus anticoagulant is that Presence of lupus anticoagulant (LA) autoantibodies. LA represent a heterogeneous group of autoantibodies, IgG, IgM, or a mixture of both classes, that interfere with standard phospholipid-based coagulant tests (this is only an in vitro phenomenon, LA do not cause reduction of coagulation in vivo). The antibodies are directed against plasma proteins which also bind to phospholipid surfaces. [PMID:27331311]

The definition of the Interlobular bile duct destruction is that Damage to and obliteration of intrahepatic bile ducts (bile ducts that transport bile between the Canals of Hering and the interlobar bile ducts). [PMID:16177252]
The definition of the Abnormality of circulating beta-2-microglobulin level is that A deviation from the normal concentration of beta-2-microglobulin in the blood. [PMID:16166103]
The definition of the Increased circulating beta-2-microglobulin level is that Elevated concentration of beta-2-microglobulin in the blood. []
The definition of the Decreased circulating beta-2-microglobulin level is that Reduced concentration of beta-2-microglobulin in the blood. []
The definition of the Abnormality of the corneal limbus is that An anomaly of the margin of the cornea overlapped by the sclera. []
The definition of the Limbal edema is that Swelling of the margin of the cornea overlapped by the sclera. []

The definition of the Giant conjunctival papillae is that Conjunctival papillae with a diameter greater than 1 millimeter. They characteristically have flattened tops which sometimes demonstrate staining with fluorescein. [PMID:26278858]

The definition of the Recurrent interdigital mycosis is that A history of repeated fungal infections located between the fingers or toes, usually manifested by scaling, maceration, and itching. The toes are more commonly affected than the fingers. []

The definition of the Autosomal dominant germline de novo mutation is that Description of conditions that are exclusively or predominantly observed to display de novo variants. In some cases, this may be due to the limited reproductive fitness of affected individuals. [PMID:22805709]

The definition of the Anti-multiple nuclear dots antibody positivity is that A type of antinuclear antibody (ANA) positivity revealed by indirect immunofluorescence (IFL). The multiple nuclear dots (MND) pattern is immunomorphologically characterized by the staining of 3-20 dots of variable size distributed all over the cell nucleus, but sparing the nucleoli, and, in contrast to the anticentromere pattern, MND reactivity does not stain the chromosomes in mitotic cells. [PMID:11882049, PMID:12848948]

The definition of the Retinal arterial macroaneurysms is that Acquired focal dilatations of branches of the retinal artery, usually second-order retinal arterioles, that range in size from 100 to 200 micrometers in diameter. Macroaneurysms are generally located at the termporal retina and may be hemorrhagic or exudative. []

The definition of the Erratic myoclonus is that A type of myoclonus in which the myoclonias shift from body region to another in a random and asynchronous fashion. Erratic myoclonus can affect the face or limbs, are brief, single or repetitive, very frequent and nearly continuous. []
The definition of the Uveal ectropion is that Presence of iris pigment epithelium on the anterior surface of the iris. []
The definition of the Polygonal renal calices is that An abnormal polygonal shape of the calices of the kidney (which normally have a rounded or cup-shaped appearance). []
The definition of the Polycalycosis is that Increased number of calices of the kidney. [PMID:19002724]

The definition of the Abnormality of medullary pyramid morphology is that A structural anomaly of the pyramid of the adult kidney, cone-shaped structures with a broad base adjacent to the renal cortex and the narrow apex that is termed papilla. []

The definition of the Renal medullary pyramid hypoplasia is that Undergrowth of the pyramid of the adult kidney, cone-shaped structures with a broad base adjacent to the renal cortex and the narrow apex that is termed papilla. [PMID:16293636]

The definition of the Endocapillary hypercellularity is that Hypercellularity due to increased number of cells within glomerular capillary lumina, causing narrowing of the lumina. [PMID:19571790, PMID:32866505]

The definition of the Extracapillary hypercellularity is that Hypercellularity (increased number of cells) in the renal glomerulus but external to the glomerular capillaries, i.e., in the Bowman space or more than one layer of parietal or visceral epithelial cells. []

The definition of the Trichoepithelioma is that A benign hair follicle tumor whose tumor cells form rudimentary hair follicles but not actual hair shafts. A trichoepithelioma is usually less than one centimeter, firm, round, and shihy with yellow, pink, brown, or bluish color. They may occur multiply, usually on the face, and may gradually increase in number with age. []

The definition of the Abnormality of growth plate morphology is that A structural anomaly of the growth plates (epiphyseal plates), areas of cartilage located near the ends of long bones that are located between the metaphysis (widened part of the shaft of the bone) and the epiphysis (end of the bone) and in which growth occurs in the developing bone. After conclusion of bone growth, the growth plates ossify (harden into solid bone). []
The definition of the Thick growth plates is that Increased thickness (dimension along the axis of the bone) of the growth plate. []
The definition of the Abnormal ossification of the sacrum is that Abnormal bone tissue formation (ossification) affecting the sacrum. []
The definition of the Delayed ossification of the sacrum is that Formation of the sacrum bone tissue occurs later than age-adjusted norms. []
The definition of the Loud snoring is that Snoring at a particularly loud or abnormally high volume. [PMID:36592569]

The definition of the Interictal EEG abnormality is that Interictal refers to a period of time between epileptic seizures. Electroencephalographic (EEG) patterns are important in the differential diagnosis of epilepsy, and the EEG is almost always abnormal during a seizure. Some persons with seizures may show EEG abnormalities between seizures, while others do not. In some cases, multiple interictal EEGs must be recorded before an abnormality is observed. In most cases the electrographic pattern of seizure onset is completely different from the activity recorded during interictal discharge. [PMID:15961864, PMID:25012363]

The definition of the Duplicated odontoid process is that The presence of two distinct odontoid processes. The odontoid process, also known as the dens of the axis, is a protuberance of the C2 vertebral body around which the first vertebra rotates. []

The definition of the Orthotopic os odontoideum is that Os odontoideum is classified into two anatomic types (orthotopic and dystopic). Os odontoideum is defined as an ossicle that consists of smooth and separate caudal portions of the odontoid process.With dystopic os odontoideum, the ossicle is located near the basion or is fused with the clivus. []
The definition of the Hyperglutaminuria is that An increased concentration of glutamine in the urine. [PMID:11283793]
The definition of the Triggered by exertion is that Applies to a sign or symptom that is provoked or brought about by exertion or physical exercise. []
The definition of the Anti-thyroid peroxidase antibody positivity is that The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the serum that react against thyroid peroxidase.
The definition of the Increased serum androstenedione is that Increased concentration of androstenedione in the blood circulation. []

The definition of the Anti-pituitary antibody positivity is that Circulating antipituitary antibodies (APA) are markers of autoimmune hypophysitis, which may cause deficient pituitary function. [PMID:17341554]

The definition of the Hypodipsia is that Reduced fluid intake (drinking) in a clinical situation where the plasma molarity or sodium concentration normally would induce greater fluid intake. [PMID:25949488]
The definition of the Dorsocervical fat pad is that An area of fat accumulation at the back of the neck in the form of a hump. [PMID:22301856]

The definition of the Diet-resistant subcutaneous adipose tissue is that Areas of subcutanous fat tissue that are resistant to (do not respond as expected to) diet, life-style alteration, or bariatric surgery. [PMID:22301856]

The definition of the Diet-resistant subcutaneous adipose tissue below waist is that Areas of subcutanous fat tissue below the waist that are resistant to (do not respond as expected to) diet, life-style alteration, or bariatric surgery. []
The definition of the Bitemporal hollowing is that Depression of profile in both temporal regions. []
The definition of the Pill-rolling tremor is that A type of resting tremor characterized by simultaneous rubbing movements of thumb and index fingers against each other. []
The definition of the Thyroid nodule is that A nodular lesion that develops in the thyroid gland. The term thyroid nodule" refers to any abnormal growth that forms a lump in the thyroid gland." []

The definition of the Pulmonary interstitial high-resolution computed tomography abnormality is that High-resolution computed tomography (HRCT) can distinguish findings that characterize characterise interstitial lung diseases in a way not possible with other modalities. [PMID:23247773]

The definition of the Reticular pattern on pulmonary HRCT is that On pulmonary high-resolution computed tomography, reticular pattern is characterised by innumerable interlacing shadows suggesting a mesh. [PMID:23247773]

The definition of the Crazy paving pattern on pulmonary HRCT is that The so-called crazy paving pattern appears as thickened interlobular septa and intralobular lines superimposed on a background of ground-glass opacity, resembling irregularly shaped paving stones. The crazy-paving pattern is often sharply demarcated from more normal lung and may have a geographic outline. It was originally reported in patients with alveolar proteinosis and is also encountered in other diffuse lung diseases that affect both the interstitial and airspace compartments, such as lipoid pneumonia. [PMID:18195376, PMID:23247773]

The definition of the Nodular pattern on pulmonary HRCT is that A nodular pattern is characterised on pulmonary high-resolution computed tomography by the presence of numerous rounded opacities that range from 2 mm to 1 cm in diameter, with micronodules defined as smaller than 3 mm in diameter. [PMID:23247773]
The definition of the Reticulonodular pattern on pulmonary HRCT is that Co-occurrence of reticular and micronodular patterns on pulmonary high-resolution computed tomography. [PMID:23247773]

The definition of the Cystic pattern on pulmonary HRCT is that On pulmonary high-resolution computed tomography, the cystic pattern is composed by well-defined, round and circumscribed air-containing parenchymal spaces with a well-defined wall and interface with normal lung. The wall of the cysts may be uniform or varied in thickness, but usually is thin (less than 2 mm) and occurs without associated emphysema. [PMID:23247773]

The definition of the Combined cystic and ground-glass pattern on pulmonary HRCT is that Co-occurrence of the cystic pattern and the ground-glass pattern on pulmonary high-resolution computed tomography, [PMID:23247773]

The definition of the Decreased attenuation pattern on pulmonary HRCT is that Areas of low density corresponding to parenchymal destruction and reduced perfusion, and attenuation of the pulmonary vasculature, as visualized on pulmonary high-resolution computed tomography. [PMID:23247773]

The definition of the Mosaic attenuation pattern on pulmonary HRCT is that A patchwork of intermingled areas of increased and decreased attenuation visualized on pulmonary high-resolution computed tomography. [PMID:23247773]
The definition of the Nodular-perilymphatic pattern on pulmonary HRCT is that A nodular pattern on pulmonary high-resolution computed tomography that has a perilymphatic distribution. [PMID:23247773]

The definition of the Nodular-centrilobular with tree-in-bud pattern on pulmonary HRCT is that A nodular pattern on pulmonary high-resolution computed tomography that displays a tree-in-bud pattern, representing centrilobular branching structures that resemble a budding tree. [PMID:23247773]
The definition of the Nodular-random pattern on pulmonary HRCT is that A nodular pattern on pulmonary high-resolution computed tomography that has an apparently random pattern. [PMID:23247773]
The definition of the Staring gaze is that An abnormality in which the eyes are held permanently wide open. [PMID:22675666]

The definition of the Square-wave jerks is that Square wave jerks are saccadic eye movements which, when recorded with open eyes are considered to be a pathological sign, caused by fixation instability, and pointing to a central neurological lesion. [PMID:6443573]
The definition of the Stooped posture is that A habitual positioning of the body with the head and upper back bent forward. []
The definition of the Abnormal visual fixation is that Any anomaly in the process of ocular fixation, which is the maintaining of the visual gaze on a single location. []
The definition of the Visual fixation instability is that A deficit in the ability to fixate eye movements in order to stabilize images on the retina [PMID:28242738]
The definition of the Rectourethral fistula is that An abnormal connection (fistula) between the rectum and the urethra. []
The definition of the Abnormal spleen morphology is that Any anomaly of the structure of the spleen. []
The definition of the Abnormal spleen physiology is that Any anomaly of the function of the spleen. []
The definition of the Splenogonadal fusion is that Joining of the spleen and a gonad during embryological development. [PMID:24137272]

The definition of the Fossa navicularis urethral stricture is that A type of urethral stricture affecting the fossa navicularis, which is the spongy part of the male urethra located at the glans penis. [PMID:22022062]
The definition of the Pendulous urethral stricture is that A type of urethral stricture affecting the pendulous urethra, which is straight and fixed to the corpora cavernosa. [PMID:22022062]
The definition of the Bulbar urethral stricture is that A type of urethral stricture affecting the bulbar urethra, which is the part of the urethra that traverses the root of the penis. []
The definition of the Vaginal stricture is that A narrowing of the vagina owing to scar formation. []
The definition of the Patulous urethra is that Urethra more open or expanded than normal. []

The definition of the Renal cortical necrosis is that Patchy or diffuse ischemic destruction of all the elements of renal cortex resulting from significantly diminished renal arterial perfusion. Coagulative necrosis may be present, involving all tubular segments and glomeruli. Nuclei may be pale and pyknotic, or may no longer be apparent. Thrombi may be present in vessels at the edge of the infarct. [PMID:26558184, PMID:27091021]

The definition of the Pulmonary pneumatocele is that A pneumatocele is a thin walled, gas-filled space in the lung. It is most frequently caused by acute pneumonia, trauma, or aspiration of hydrocarbon fluid and is usually transient. The mechanism is believed to be a combination of parenchymal necrosis and check-valve airway obstruction. A pneumatocele appears as an approximately round, thin-walled airspace in the lung. [PMID:18195376]

The definition of the Diffuse alveolar hemorrhage is that A type of of pulmonary hemorrhage that originates from the pulmonary microcirculation, including the alveolar capillaries, arterioles, and venules. It presents with hemoptysis, anemia, diffuse lung infiltration, and acute respiratory failure. The diagnosis is confirmed by the observation of the accumulation of red blood cells, fibrin, or hemosiderin-laden macrophage in the alveolar space on pathologic biopsy. Hemosiderin, a product of hemoglobin degradation, appears at least 48-72 hours after bleeding and is helpful in distinguishing diffuse alveolar hemorrhage from surgical trauma. Mild interstitial thickening, organizing pneumonia, or diffuse alveolar damage can also be seen. [PMID:23678356]
The definition of the Pneumomediastinum is that The presence of free air in the mediastinum. [PMID:28217437]
The definition of the Pleural cyst is that A closed sac-like structure originating from the pleura that contains a liquid, gaseous, or semisolid substance. [PMID:12162234, PMID:18493546]
The definition of the Abnormal larynx morphology is that Any anomaly of the structure of the larynx. []
The definition of the Abnormal larynx physiology is that Any anomaly of the function of the larynx. []
The definition of the Laryngospasm is that A spasm (involuntary contraction) of the vocal cords that can make it difficult to speak or breathe. []
The definition of the Abnormal bronchus morphology is that Any structural anomaly of the bronchi, i.e., of the airways leading from the trachea to the lungs. []
The definition of the Abnormal bronchus physiology is that Any anomaly of the function of the bronchi. []
The definition of the Bronchospasm is that A spasm (sudden, involuntary constriction) of the bronchioles. []
The definition of the Abnormal cry is that Any anomaly of the vocalizing of an infant's crying, i.e.,the typically loud voice production that is accompanied by tears and agitation. []
The definition of the High-pitched cry is that A type of crying in an abnormally high-pitched voice. []
The definition of the Staccato cry is that A type of cry that is abnormal because it is consists of unusually shortened and detached vocalizations. []
The definition of the Acanthoma is that A benign epithelial skin tumor manifesting as a slightly elevated circular plaque or nodule with a red, pink or brown color and a diameter up to 22 mm. []
The definition of the Decreased lecithin cholesterol acyl transferase activity is that Reduced level of the enzyme lecithin cholesterol acyl transferase. [PMID:25172171]

The definition of the Reduced hemolytic complement activity is that A diminished activity of the classical complement pathway as measured by the assay for 50% haemolytic complement (CH50) activity of serum. [PMID:20351687]
The definition of the Increased lactate dehydrogenase activity is that An elevated level of the enzyme lactate dehydrogenase in the blood circulation. []

The definition of the Elevated serum 11-deoxycortisol is that Increased concentration of 11-deoxycortisol in the circulation. 11-deoxycorticosterone, which is also known as simply deoxycorticosterone and 21-hydroxyprogesterone, is a steroid hormore that is produces in the adrenals and is a precursor to aldosterone. []
The definition of the Macrocephalic sperm head is that Increased size of the head of sperm. [PMID:16500351]
The definition of the Pharyngitis is that Inflammation (due to infection or irritation) of the pharynx. []
The definition of the Warm reactive autoantibody positivity is that Warm reactive autoantibodies are RBC-directed immune responses that are maximally reactive at 37 degrees C. [PMID:15491963]
The definition of the Achilles tendon calcification is that Ectopic deposition of calcium salts in the Achilles tendon. []
The definition of the Abnormal cardiac atrial physiology is that An abnormality of the function of the cardiac atria. []
The definition of the Reduced amygdala volume is that A decrease in the volume (size) of the amygdyla. []
The definition of the Morphological abnormality of the papillary muscles is that Any structural anomaly of the papillary muscles of the left ventricle. [PMID:9034636]

The definition of the Anomalous insertion of papillary muscle directly into anterior mitral leaflet is that A congenital malformation in which one or both of the papillary muscles (posteromedial or anterolateral) insert directly (that is, without interpositioned chordae tendineae) into the anterior mitral leaflet. [PMID:1884449]
The definition of the Displacement of the papillary muscles is that Abnormal location of the insertion of a papillary muscle into the left ventricular wall. []
The definition of the Anterior displacement of the papillary muscles is that Abnormally anterior location of the papillary muscles of the left ventricle. [PMID:7850958]

The definition of the Apically displaced anterolateral papillary muscle is that Abnormal location of the insertion of the anterolateral papillary muscle near to the apex of the left ventricle. This feature may be appreciated by noting that this muscle is usually not seen in the apical level of the parasternal short-axis echocardiographic view, []

The definition of the Testicular adrenal rest tumor is that Testicular adrenal rest tumor (TART) is a abenign tumor of the testis. TART generally occurs multiply and bilaterally within the rete testis. Histologically, TART resemble adrenocortical tissue, which led to the name. The tumous are not encapsulated and consist of sheets or confluent cords of large polygonal cells with abundant eosinophilic cytoplasm. [PMID:19956703]

The definition of the Pyoderma gangrenosum is that A deep skin ulcer with a well defined border, which is usually violet or blue. The ulcer edge is often undermined (worn and damaged) and the surrounding skin is erythematous and indurated. The ulcer often starts as a small papule or collection of papules, which break down to form small ulcers with a so called cat's paw appearance. These coalesce and the central area then undergoes necrosis to form a single ulcer. [PMID:16858047]

The definition of the Delayed adrenarche is that Occurence of adrenarche at a later than normal age. Adrenarche normally occurs between six and eight years of age with increased adrenal androgen secretion; its exact biologic role is not well understood. It is accompanied by changes in pilosebaceous units, a transient growth spurt and the appearance of axillary and pubic hair in some children, but no sexual development. [PMID:10414639]
The definition of the Abnormal CSF metabolite level is that Any deviation from the normal range of concentration of a metabolite in the cerebrospinal fluid. []
The definition of the Decreased CSF 5-hydroxyindolacetic acid is that 5-HIAA (5-hydroxyindolacetic acid) concentration in the cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) is below the lower limit of normal.
The definition of the Abnormal CSF protein level is that Any deviation from the normal range of a protein concentration in the cerebrospinal fluid. []
The definition of the Decreased CSF total protein is that CSF total protein level is below the lower limit of normal.
The definition of the Decreased CSF albumin is that CSF albumin level is below the lower limit of normal.
The definition of the Increased CSF/serum albumin ratio is that An increase above normal limits of the ratio of the cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) albumin concentration to serum albumin concentration. []
The definition of the High myoinositol in brain by MRS is that An elevated level of myoinositol in the brain identified by magnetic resonance spectroscopy (MRS).

The definition of the Abnormal circulating beta globulin level is that A deviation from the normal concentration of beta globulin. The beta globulins are a group of globular (globe-shaped) proteins in blood. []
The definition of the Beta 2-microglobulinuria is that Increased level of beta 2-microglobulins in the urine. []
The definition of the Anagen effluvium is that An abnormal loss of anagen (growth phase) hairs. [PMID:28332382]
The definition of the Telogen effluvium is that A type of hair loss characterized by an abnormal increase in dormant, telogen stage hair follicles. []

The definition of the Congenital panfollicular nevus is that A hamartomatous proliferation containing malformed hair follicles in various stages of development. Panfolliculomas are well-circumscribed lesions demonstrating all stages of follicular differentiation. [PMID:26822169]
The definition of the Recurrent plantar mycosis is that A history of repeated fungal infections located on the sole of the foot, usually manifested by scaling, maceration, and itching. []

The definition of the Hyperpigmented papule is that A papule (circumscribed, solid elevation of skin with no visible fluid, varying in size from a pinhead to less than 10mm in diameter at the widest point) that exhibits increased pigmentation (is darker) compared to the surrounding skin. []

The definition of the Erythematous plaque is that A plaque (a solid, raised, plateau-like (flat-topped) lesion greater than 1 cm in diameter) with a red or reddish color often associated with inflammation or irritation. []

The definition of the Erythematous macule is that A macule (flat, distinct, discolored area of skin less than 1 cm wide that does not involve any change in the thickness or texture of the skin) with a red or reddish color often associated with inflammation or irritation. []

The definition of the Testicular lipomatosis is that Multiple foci of adipocytes within the testicular interstitium, usually presenting as multiple bilateral ill-defined hyperechoic intratesticular lesions of different sizes but generally with maximum diameter of 4 mm. []
The definition of the Periarticular calcification is that Calcified deposits in soft tissue structures outside a joint. []

The definition of the Atrial standstill is that Atrial standstill or silent atrium is a rare condition presenting with the absence of electrical and mechanical activity in the atria. It presents with the absence of P waves, bradycardia, and wide QRS complex in the electrocardiogram. [PMID:23074623]
The definition of the Self-neglect is that Neglecting one's own needs and well-being. []

The definition of the Lipomyelomeningocele is that A type of spinal dysraphism presenting as a subcutaneous fatty mass, that is, a spinal defect associated with lipomatous tissue, and covered by skin. The most usual location for lipomyelomeningocele is at the gluteal cleft. []
The definition of the Cervical hemivertebrae is that Absence of one half of the vertebral body in the cervical spine. []

The definition of the Positive perchlorate discharge test is that An abnormal result of the perchlorate discharge test. In this test, first radioactive iodine is administered, sufficient time is allowed to pass so that the radioactive iodine is captured by the thyroid,and then, perchlorate is administered orally. The perchlorate displaces non-organified iodide from the thyroid. The perchlorate discharge test is considered positive (abnormal) if there is an abnormally rapid loss of radioactive iodine from the thyroid. [PMID:25394566]

The definition of the Abnormal circulating thyroglobulin level is that A deviation from the normal concentration of thyroglobulin, a protein produced in the thyroid gland that acts as a precursor to thyrroid hormones. []

The definition of the Increased circulating thyroglobulin level is that An abnormal elevation of the concentration of thyroglobulin, a protein produced in the thyroid gland that acts as a precursor to thyrroid hormones. []

The definition of the Vaginal adenosis is that Vaginal adenosis is defined by the presence of metaplastic cervical or endometrial epithelium within the vaginal wall, thought to be derived from persistent Müllerian (synonymous with paramesonephric) epithelium islets in postembryonic life. [PMID:9764164]
The definition of the Fused labia majora is that The outer labia are sealed together. []
The definition of the Abnormality of bladder morphology is that Any structural anomaly of the bladder. []

The definition of the Detrusor sphincter dyssynergia is that A urodynamic anomaly characterized by bladder outlet obstruction from detrusor muscle contraction with concomitant involuntary urethral sphincter activation. [PMID:26904418]
The definition of the Bladder duplication is that A congenital anomaly characterized by the presence of two bladders. [PMID:25657554]

The definition of the Myocardial bridging is that A congenital variant of a coronary artery in which a portion of an epicardial coronary artery (most frequently the middle segment of the left anterior descending artery) takes an intramuscular course. [PMID:25999138]
The definition of the Venous stenosis is that Narrowing of a vein due to intimal hyperplasia and fibrosis. []
The definition of the Microcoria is that A small pupil (typically diameter less than 2 mm) that dilates poorly or not at all in response to topically administered mydriatic drugs. [PMID:25772937]
The definition of the Palmoplantar erythema is that Redness of the skin of the palm of the hand and the sole of the foot caused by hyperemia of the capillaries in the lower layers of the skin. []
The definition of the Coated aorta is that Regular circumferential periaortic fibrosis involving the whole aorta and leading to a coated aorta appearance on computed tomography scans [PMID:25017251]
The definition of the Hypoplastic aorta is that Significant luminal narrowing of a long segment of the descending aorta. [PMID:12368748, PMID:24516866]
The definition of the Abnormal coronary artery physiology is that Any anomaly of the function of a coronary artery. []
The definition of the Coronary artery spasm is that A brief and sudden narrowing of a coronary artery. [PMID:19433770]
The definition of the Aceruloplasminemia is that Absence of ceruloplasmin in the blood. []
The definition of the Class I obesity is that Obesity with a body mass index of 30 to 34.9 kg per square meter. []
The definition of the Class II obesity is that Obesity with a body mass index of 35 to 39.9 kg per square meter. []
The definition of the Class III obesity is that Obesity with a body mass index of 40 kg per square meter or higher. []
The definition of the Overweight is that Increased body weight with a body mass index of 25-29.9 kg per square meter. []

The definition of the Anomalous coronary artery arising from the opposite sinus is that Origin of the right coronary artery (RCA) from the left sinus of Valsalva or of the left main (LM) or left anterior descending (LAD) coronary artery from the right sinus of Valsalva. [PMID:27358682, PMID:28374180]

The definition of the Anomalous origin of the circumflex artery from the right sinus of Valsalva is that The circumflex coronary artery originates from the right aortic sinus of Valsalva. [PMID:25104986]

The definition of the Coronary artery sandwich anomaly is that Origin of the right coronary artery (RCA) from the left sinus of Valsalva or of the left main (LM) or left anterior descending (LAD) coronary artery from the right sinus of Valsalva, with the additional feature that the artery passes between the two great arteries. This carries a risk of the artery being compressed by these two vessels, [PMID:24424336]
The definition of the Yellow papule is that A papule with yellow color. []
The definition of the Gottron's papules is that Violaceous papules overlying the dorsal and lateral aspects of the metacarpophalangeal and proximal interphalangeal joints. [PMID:28058540]

The definition of the Piezogenic pedal papules is that Flesh-colored or yellowish papules, 2 mm or larger, that are responses to internal mechanical pressure and weakness in the connective tissue in the dermis, appear commonly over the medial aspect of the heel, but in some cases on the wrists. They are thought to represent herniations of adipose tissue through the plantar fascia retinaculum. []
The definition of the Nevus spillus is that A tan, regularly bordered patch with darker macules within the lesion. []

The definition of the Nevus sebaceus is that A solitary yellow-orange slightly raised plaque typically on scalp or face. The plaque typically thickens and becomes more verrucous or pebbly during childhood. []
The definition of the Skin-colored papule is that A papule with the same color as the surrounding skin. [PMID:15686304]
The definition of the Scleral rupture is that Breakage of the sclera. []

The definition of the Morning glory anomaly is that An abnormality of the optic nerve in which the optic nerve is large and funneled and displays a conical excavation of the optic disc. The optic disc appears dysplastic. []
The definition of the Delayed thelarche is that Later than normal development of the breasts. []
The definition of the Coronary-pulmonary artery fistula is that A congenital malformation with abnormal connection between one of the coronary arteries and the pulmonary artery. [PMID:24605242]
The definition of the Hypoplastic hippocampus is that Underdevelopment of the hippocampus. []

The definition of the Visual gaze preference is that An abnormality of gaze that can be observed following an acute supranuclear cerebral lesion (e.g., stroke) that is characterized by an acute inability to direct gaze contralateral to the side of the lesion and is accompanied by a tendency for tonic deviation of the eyes toward the side of the lesion. []

The definition of the Multiple biliary hamartomas is that Multiple biliary hamartomas are a rare clinicopathologic entity, consisting of small (less than 1.5cm), usually multiple and nodular cystic lesions in the liver. [PMID:22110302]
The definition of the Calcinosis cutis is that Deposition of calcium in the skin. []
The definition of the Increased body fat percentage is that The percentage of fat as a part of total body weight above the norm, usually defined as 32% for females and 25% for males. []
The definition of the Elongated chordae tendinae of the mitral valve is that Abnormal increased in length of the chordae tendinae of the mitral valve. []

The definition of the Abnormal morphology of the chordae tendinae of the mitral valve is that A structural anomaly of the chordae tendinae of the mitral valve, whose main function is to transmit the contraction and relaxation of the papillary muscles during the cardiac cycle, thus ensuring the closing of the leaflets of the mitral valve. [PMID:23304176]
The definition of the Palmoplantar scaling skin is that Loss of the outer layer of the epidermis in large, scale-like flakes localized to the palm of the hand and the sole of the foot. []
The definition of the Scaling skin on fingertip is that Loss of the outer layer of the epidermis in large, scale-like flakes localized to one or more fingertips. []

The definition of the Psoriasiform lesion is that A skin lesions that resembles the lesions observed in psoriasis, viz., an erythematous plaque covered by fine silvery scales. Psoriasiform lesions can be observed in psoriasis as well as in other conditions including allergic contact dermatitis, seborrhoeic dermatitis, Atopic dermatitis, pityriasis rubra, and lichen simplex chronicus. []
The definition of the Serpiginous cutaneous lesion is that A skin lesion with a snake- or serpent-like distribution. []
The definition of the Annular cutaneous lesion is that A lesion of the skin with a ring-like distribution. []
The definition of the Hyperpigmented nodule is that A nodule of the skin that exhibits an increased amount of pigmentation. []

The definition of the Xanthomas of the palmar creases is that The presence of multiple xanthomas (xanthomata) in the skin distributed in the creases of the palm of the hand. Xanthomas are yellowish, firm, lipid-laden nodules in the skin. []

The definition of the Harlequin phenomenon is that The Harlequin phenomenon consists of a sudden change in skin colour, resulting in two different body colours, one on each half of the body. [PMID:21575077]

The definition of the Positive pathergy test is that With the pathergy test, a small, sterile needle is inserted into the skin of the forearm. The site of injectionis circuled and observed after one and two days. If a small red bump or pustule at the site of needle insertion occurs, the pathergy test is considered to have a positive (abnormal) result. []

The definition of the Ocular melanocytosis is that A congenital lesion of the sclera characterized by unilateral patchy but extensive slate-gray or bluish discoloration of the sclera . The conjunctiva are spared. []
The definition of the Shawl sign is that Erythematous, poikilodermatous macules distributed in a shawl pattern over the shoulders, arms and upper back. [PMID:11730311]
The definition of the V-sign is that Erythematous, poikilodermatous macules distributed in a V-shaped distribution over the anterior neck and chest. [PMID:11730311]
The definition of the Plantar edema is that An abnormal accumulation of fluid beneath the skin on sole of the foot. []
The definition of the Palmar edema is that An abnormal accumulation of fluid beneath the skin on the palm of the hand. []
The definition of the Abnormal T cell subset distribution is that Any abnormality in the proportion T cells subsets relative to the total number of T cells. []

The definition of the Abnormal mean corpuscular hemoglobin is that A deviation from the normal range of the average amount of hemoglobin per red blood cell (27 to 31 picograms/cell). A reduced mean corpuscular hemoglobin (MCH) may indicate a hypochromic anemia, but the MCH may be normal if both the total hemoglobin and the red blood cell count are reduced. []

The definition of the Decreased mean corpuscular hemoglobin is that A reduction from the normal range of the average amount of hemoglobin per red blood cell (27 to 31 picograms/cell). A reduced mean corpuscular hemoglobin (MCH) may indicate a hypochromic anemia, but the MCH may be normal if both the total hemoglobin and the red blood cell count are reduced. []
The definition of the Increased mean corpuscular hemoglobin is that An elevation over the normal range of the average amount of hemoglobin per red blood cell (27 to 31 picograms/cell). []

The definition of the Eccentric visual fixation is that A uniocular condition in which there is fixation of an object by a point other than the fovea. This point adopts the principal visual direction. The degree of the eccentric fixation is defined by its distance from the fovea in degrees.
The definition of the Elevated circulating ribitol concentration is that An increase above the normal concentration of ribitol in the blood. []

The definition of the Optic nerve misrouting is that Abnormal decussation of the visual pathways, typically identified using visual evoked potentials (VEP) (asymmetrical distribution of the VEP over the posterior scalp). []

The definition of the Periorbital purpura is that Multiple red/purple spots on the skin that surrounds the eyes that do not blanch (whiten) upon pressure. Purpura is caused by subcutaneous bleeding. []

The definition of the Periorbital ecchymosis with tarsal plate sparing is that Subcutaneous bleeding with a diameter greater than 1 cm (ecchymosis). The bleeding does not extend into the tarsal plate (the comparatively thick, elongated plates of dense connective tissue within the eyelid) due to an anatomic structure called the orbital septum, which limits extravasation of blood beyond the tarsal plate. [PMID:20411091]

The definition of the Yellow nodule is that A type of skin nodule (a lesions that is greater than either 10mm in both width and depth, and most frequently centered in the dermis or subcutaneous fat) with a yellowish coloration (that reflects a high lipid content of the lesion). [PMID:22223978]
The definition of the Periungual teleangiectasia is that Telangiectasia (small dilated blood vessels) located near to the fingernails or toenails. []
The definition of the Lamellar cataract with riders is that Lamellar cataracts with associated linear lens opacities radially extending towards the periphery of the lens.

The definition of the Coronary cataract is that A type of cataract characterised by club-shaped and dot opacities distributed radially in the deep cortex. These lens opacities surround the nucleus in an appearance that is though to resemble a crown.

The definition of the Anterior chamber cells is that Tiny deposits corresponding to cells floating in the anterior chamber of the eye. This appearance is typically associated with intraocular inflammation leading to breakdown of the blood-aqueous barrier and resulting in an increase in the number of cells and in the aqueous humor. Grading (SUN Working Group) is performed by estimating the number of cells in a 1 mm by 1 mm slit beam field, employing adequate light intensity and magnification on a slit lamp.

The definition of the Anterior chamber cells grade 1+ is that Anterior chamber cells with 6-15 cells in a 1 mm by 1 mm slit beam field, employing adequate light intensity and magnification on a slit lamp. [PMID:16196117]

The definition of the Anterior chamber cells grade 0.5+ is that Anterior chamber cells with 1-5 cells in a 1 mm by 1 mm slit beam field, employing adequate light intensity and magnification on a slit lamp. [PMID:16196117]

The definition of the Anterior chamber cells grade 0 is that Anterior chamber cells with less than one cell in a 1 mm by 1 mm slit beam field, employing adequate light intensity and magnification on a slit lamp. [PMID:16196117]

The definition of the Anterior chamber cells grade 2+ is that Anterior chamber cells with 16-25 cells in a 1 mm by 1 mm slit beam field, employing adequate light intensity and magnification on a slit lamp. [PMID:16196117]

The definition of the Anterior chamber cells grade 3+ is that Anterior chamber cells with 26-50 cells in a 1 mm by 1 mm slit beam field, employing adequate light intensity and magnification on a slit lamp. []

The definition of the Anterior chamber cells grade 4+ is that Anterior chamber cells with more than 50 cells in a 1 mm by 1 mm slit beam field, employing adequate light intensity and magnification on a slit lamp. [PMID:16196117]

The definition of the Central serous chorioretinopathy is that An anomaly of the retina with serous detachment of the neurosensory retina secondary to one or more focal lesions of the retinal pigment epithelium (RPE), and associated with blurred vision, usually in one eye only and perceived typically by the patient as a dark spot in the centre of the visual field with associated micropsia and metamorphopsia. Normal vision often recurs spontaneously within a few months. [PMID:17662099]

The definition of the Polypoidal choroidal vasculopathy is that The presence of aneurysmal polypoidal lesions in the choroidal vasculature. The aneurysmal dilatations, also known as polyps, may be found at subfoveal, juxtafoveal, extrafoveal, peripapillary or even peripheral regions. These polypoidal dilatations may be visible as reddish-orange subretinal nodules during ophthalmoscopic examination.
