The polypoidal lesions are best detected on indocyanine green angiography (ICGA) and might be associated with a branching vascular network (BVN) of neovascularization. [PMID:24653824]

The definition of the Choroidal vascular hyperpermeability is that Increased tendency of choiroidal blood vessels to allow fluids to leak characterized by multifocal choroidal hyperfluorescence on indocyanine green angiography (ICGA). [PMID:25709392]

The definition of the Christman tree cataract is that A type of cataract that shows a spectacular display of multiple colours that glitters with the change of incident light like an illuminated Christmas tree. [PMID:27190856]
The definition of the Punctal stenosis is that Punctal stenosis is a condition in which the external opening of the lacrimal canaliculus is narrowed or occluded. [PMID:22848141]
The definition of the Mild myopia is that A mild form of myopia with up to -3.00 diopters.
The definition of the Macular hemmorrhage is that Bleeding occurring within the macula lutea of the retina. []

The definition of the Abnormal superior vena cava morphology is that Any structural anomaly of the principal vein draining blood from the upper portion of the body and delivering it to the right ventricle of the heart. [MP:0006064]
The definition of the Abnormal inferior vena cava morphology is that Any structural anomaly of the principal vein draining blood from the lower portion of the body. [MP:0006063]

The definition of the Aortic valve prolapse is that Aortic valve prolapse can be diagnosed when either or both of the right or non-coronary aortic valve cusps (seen in the cross sectional echocardiographic long axis view) show backward bowing towards the left ventricle beyond a line joining the points of attachment of the aortic valve leaflets to the annulus. [PMID:4015927]
The definition of the Abnormal left atrium morphology is that Any structural abnormality of the left atrium. []
The definition of the Abnormal right atrium morphology is that Any structural abnormality of the right atrium. []
The definition of the Foveal hemorrhage is that Bleeding occurring within the fovea.
The definition of the Submacular hemorrhage is that Bleeding between the neurosensory retina and the retinal pigment epithelium (RPE) arising from the choroidal or retinal circulation.

The definition of the Tapetal-like fundal reflex is that Golden, scintillating, particulate reflection noted on fundus examination (typically in the macula and sparing the fovea). The term tapetal is used to describe this 'metallic' sheen appearance as it is thought to be similar to the 'tapetal' reflex seen in the eyes of certain animals. []
The definition of the Hypotropia is that A form of manifest strabismus (heterotropia) in which one eye is deviated downwards when both eyes are open.
The definition of the Hyperphoria is that Tendency for the visual axis of one eye to be higher than that of the other.
The definition of the Hypertropia is that A type of strabismus characterized by permanent upward deviation of the visual axis of one eye.
The definition of the Hyperdeviation is that A type of strabismus in which the visual axis of one eye is higher than that of the other.
The definition of the Hypodeviation is that A type of strabismus in which the visual axis of one eye is lower than that of the other.

The definition of the Cyclodeviation is that Cyclodeviation is defined as the rotation of an eyeball along the anteroposterior axis and cyclotropia as a misalignment of cyclodeviation between the two eyes.
The definition of the Abnormal extraocular muscle physiology is that A functional anomaly of the muscles of the eye. []

The definition of the Abnormal superior oblique muscle physiology is that A functional anomaly of the superior oblique muscle, a fusiform muscle that originates in the upper, medial side of the orbit. The superior oblique muscle abducts, depresses and internally rotates the eye, and is the only extraocular muscle innervated by the fourth cranial nerve.
The definition of the Superior oblique muscle weakness is that Decreased strength of the superior oblique muscle. []
The definition of the Superior oblique muscle restriction is that Mechanical limitation of the range of movement of the superior oblique muscle.

The definition of the Superior oblique muscle overaction is that An ocular motility abnormality characterized by an overacting superior oblique muscle resulting to vertical incomitance of the eyes in lateral gaze. On examination, this is commonly seen as a downshoot of the adducting eye occuring when gaze is directed into the field of action of the inferior oblique muscle, producing a greater downward excursion of the adducted eye than of the abducted eye.

The definition of the Superior oblique muscle underaction is that Reduced ocular movement of the superior oblique muscle which improves on testing ductions, typically associated with neurogenic palsy.

The definition of the Abnormal inferior oblique muscle physiology is that A functional anomaly of the inferior oblique muscle, an extraocular muscle that has its origin on the maxillary bone just posterior to the inferior medial orbital rim and lateral to the nasolacrimal canal and that is innervated by the inferior branch of the oculomotor nerve.
The definition of the Inferior oblique muscle restriction is that Mechanical limitation of the range of movement of the inferior oblique muscle.
The definition of the Inferior oblique muscle weakness is that Decreased strength of the inferior oblique muscle.

The definition of the Inferior oblique muscle overaction is that A common ocular motility disorder characterized by vertical incomitance of the eyes in lateral gaze. In primary inferior oblique muscle overaction, an upshoot of the adducting eye occurs when gaze is directed into the field of action of the inferior oblique muscle, producing a greater upward excursion of the adducted eye than of the abducted eye.

The definition of the Abnormal inferior rectus muscle physiology is that A functional anomaly of the inferior rectus muscle, which is innervated by the inferior division of oculomotor nerve and functions in the depression, adduction, and lateral rotation (extortion) of the eye.
The definition of the Inferior rectus muscle weakness is that Decreased strength of the inferior rectus muscle.
The definition of the Inferior rectus muscle restriction is that Mechanical limitation of the range of movement of the inferior rectus muscle.

The definition of the Abnormal superior rectus muscle physiology is that A functional anomaly of the superior rectus muscle, an extraocular muscle that is innervated by the superior division of the oculomotor nerve, and whose primary function is the elevation of the globe.
The definition of the Orbital schwannoma is that A schwannoma (benign, usually encapsulated slow growing tumor composed of Schwann cells) located in the orbit. []
The definition of the Lid lag on downgaze is that Delayed descent of the upper eyelid on downgaze. Also described by some authors as von Graefe sign.

The definition of the Abnormal medial rectus muscle physiology is that A functional anomaly of the medial rectus muscle, an extraocular muscle that is innervated by the inferior division of the oculomotor nerve and whose sole action is the adduction of the eyeball.
The definition of the Upper eyelid entropion is that An inward turning (inversion) of the margin of the upper eyelid.

The definition of the Cicatricial ectropion is that An outward turning (eversion) or rotation of the eyelid margin (i.e., ectropion) caused by shortening or contraction of the anterior or middle lamellae related to scarring.
The definition of the Anterior blepharitis is that A type of blepharitis that affects the eyelid skin, base of the eyelashes, and the eyelash follicles.

The definition of the Posterior blepharitis is that A type of blepharitis that affects the meibomian glands and meibomian gland orifices. This abnormality can be associated with a spectrum of appearances ranging from meibomian seborrhoea (foaming meibomian gland secretions) and meibomianitis (inflamed meibomian glands), to chalazia.

The definition of the Epicanthus superciliaris is that A type of epicanthus in which more extensive epicanthal folds with their origins in the eyebrow cover, pass in front of and lateral to the medial canthus (middle corner of the eye).
The definition of the Corneal astigmatism is that A type of refractive error related abnormal curvatures on the anterior or posterior surface of the cornea.

The definition of the EMG: Repetitive nerve stimulation abnormality is that Abnormality observed upon electromyography when nerve studied is electrically stimulated six to ten times at 2 or 3 Hertz. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:UToronto_htrang]
The definition of the Lagopthalmos is that A condition in which the eyelids do not close to cover the eye completely. [PMID:20590416]
The definition of the Nocturnal lagophthalmos is that The inability to close the eyelids during sleep. [PMID:16671223]
The definition of the Paralytic lagophthalmos is that A type of lagophthalmos that occurs in association with facial nerve palsy. [PMID:24618488]
The definition of the Cicatricial lagophthalmos is that A type of lagophthalmos that occurs following trauma or surgery. []

The definition of the Capillary leak is that An acute phenomenon characterized by hypotension and anasarca due to the loss of plasma volume into peripheral tissues, with evidence of decreased plasma volume (hemoconcentration) and protein loss from the intravascular space (hypoalbuminemia) during acute episodes. [PMID:24467750, PMID:24808988]
The definition of the Single fiber EMG abnormality is that Abnormality in single fiber EMG recording, a technique that allows identification of action potentials (APs) from individual muscle fibers.

The definition of the EMG: Positive sharp waves is that These are spontaneous firing action potentials stimulated by needle movement of an injured muscle fiber. There is propagation to, but not past, the needle tip. This inhibits the display of the negative deflection of the waveform. [PMID:15961866]
The definition of the Cervical agenesis is that Congenital absence of the cervix. []

The definition of the Cervical insufficiency is that A cervix that shows a painless dilation and shortening during the second trimester of pregnancy with resultant recurrent pregnancy loss or delivery is considered incompetent [PMID:17490914, PMID:20643692]
The definition of the Hydrometrocolpos is that Hydrometrocolpos is an accumulation of uterine and vaginal secretions as well as menstrual blood in the uterus and vagina. [PMID:24046799]

The definition of the Imperforate hymen is that A congenital disorder where the hymen (a membrane that surrounds or partially covers the external vaginal opening) does not have an opening and completely obstructs the vagina. [PMID:24822139]
The definition of the Female anorgasmia is that The persistent of recurrent difficulty, delay in, or absence of attaining orgasm following sufficient sexual stimulation and arousal. [PMID:16391543]
The definition of the Dyspareunia is that Recurrent or persistent genital pain associated with sexual intercourse. [PMID:16391543]

The definition of the Vaginismus is that Recurrent or persistent involuntary spasms of the musculature of the outer third of the vagina that interferes with vaginal penetration, and which causes personal distress. [PMID:16391543]
The definition of the Decreased female libido is that Dminished sexual desire in female. []
The definition of the Increased female libido is that Elevated sexual desire in female []
The definition of the Auricular tag is that Small protrusion within the pinna. [eom:1b6d89bad30b8f18, PMID:19152421]
The definition of the Question mark ear is that Cleft between the helix and the lobe. [eom:cffbc3de49dbb172, PMID:19152421]
The definition of the Quelprud Nodule is that Small cartilaginous prominence on the posterior concha. [eom:193d1645eb4eced8, PMID:19152421]
The definition of the Pretragal ectopia is that Variably shaped, cartilage-containing tissue anterior to the external auditory meatus. [eom:095679c21044c851]
The definition of the Auricular pit is that Small indentation in the lower part of the ascending helix, concha, or in the crus helix. [eom:1fe5d46deac24493, PMID:19152421]

The definition of the Squared superior portion of helix is that Flattening instead of curving or rounded superior helix, allowing the superior helix to run more horizontally than usual. [eom:ddce48fcd9ee46f4, PMID:19152421]
The definition of the Abnormality of the nasal cartilage is that A morphological anomaly of the nasal cartilage. []
The definition of the Absent nasal cartilage is that Lack of a palpable nasal cartilage. [eom:73e4e8bb2eec316d, PMID:19152422]
The definition of the Splayed fingers is that Divergence of digits along the A/P axis (in the plane of the palm). [eom:ebc67f029da3caac, PMID:19125433]
The definition of the Absent ray is that The absence of all phalanges of a digit and the associated metacarpal /metatarsal. [eom:603438e0616f4f69, PMID:19125433]

The definition of the Small toe is that Significant reduction in both length and girth of the toe compared to the contralateral toe, or alternatively, compared to a typical toe size for an age-matched individual. [eom:4d06c726e63758c5, PMID:19125433]

The definition of the Partial absence of foot is that An incomplete absence of the foot, with no bony elements distal to the tarsals, but with preservation of some or all of the tarsals. [eom:6a2c173d3d7e3219, PMID:19125433]

The definition of the Small finger is that Significant reduction in both length and girth of the finger compared to the contralateral finger, or alternatively, compared to a typical finger size for an age-matched individual. [eom:5b823be1388221a1, PMID:19125433]
The definition of the Diffuse glomerular basement membrane lamellation is that Presence of abnormal additional layers of the basement membrane of the glomerulus.
The definition of the Struvite nephrolithiasis is that Presence of struvite (magnesium ammonium phosphate) containing calculi (kidney stones). []
The definition of the Isothenuria is that Inability of the kidneys to produce either concentrated or dilute urine. []
The definition of the Bifid ureter is that Incomplete duplication of the ureter. [PMID:23513084]
The definition of the Hip Subluxation is that A partial dislocation of the hip joint, whereby the head of the femur is partially displaced from the socket. []
The definition of the Serpentine fibula is that Elongated curved (S-shaped) fibulae. [PMID:21712856, PMID:3409932]
The definition of the Hypoglycosylation of alpha-dystroglycan is that A reduction in the degree of glycosylation of alpha-dystroglycan in muscle tissue. [PMID:18691338]
The definition of the Abnormality of lateral ventricle is that A morphological anomaly of the lateral ventricle. []

The definition of the Colpocephaly is that Colpocephaly is an anatomic finding in the brain manifested by occipital horns that are disproportionately enlarged in comparison with other parts of the lateral ventricles. [PMID:4058748]
The definition of the Brain abscess is that A collection of pus, immune cells, and other material in the brain. []

The definition of the Narcolepsy is that An abnormal phenomenon characterized by a classic tetrad of excessive daytime sleepiness with irresistible sleep attacks, cataplexy (sudden bilateral loss of muscle tone), hypnagogic hallucinations, and sleep paralysis. [PMID:30228690,PMID:35624073]

The definition of the Tip-toe gait is that Toe walking is a pattern of walking in which a person walks on balls of his or her feet, with no contact between the heels and ground. Toe-walking is common in children who are learning to walk, but most children outgrow it around the age of two years. This term refers to the persistance of toe-walking beyond the usual age. [PMID:26709689]

The definition of the Inguinal freckling is that The presence in the inguinal region (groin) of an increased number of freckles, small circular spots on the skin that are darker than the surrounding skin because of deposits of melanin. []
The definition of the Stiff skin is that An induration (hardening) of the skin []
The definition of the Perifollicular fibrosis is that Presence of excess fibrous connective tissue surrounding hair follicules. []
The definition of the Hyperconvex toenail is that When viewed on end (with the tip of the toe pointing toward the examiner's eye) the curve of the toenail forms a tighter curve of convexity. []
The definition of the Uncombable hair is that Hair that is disorderly, stands out from the scalp, and cannot be combed flat. []
The definition of the Autoimmune antibody positivity is that The presence of an antibody in the blood circulation that is directed against the organism's own cells or tissues. []

The definition of the Sickled erythrocytes is that An irreversible distortion of the morphology of an erythrocyte such that the cells are elongated and curved, resembling the blade of a sickle (the hand-held agricultural tool traditionally used to harvest grains). []
The definition of the Nervous tissue neoplasm is that A neoplasm derived from nervous tissue (not necessarily a neoplasm located in the nervous system). []

The definition of the Neuroectodermal neoplasm is that A neoplasm arising in the neuroectoderm, the portion of the ectoderm of the early embryo that gives rise to the central and peripheral nervous systems, including some glial cells. []

The definition of the Craniopharyngioma is that A benign pituitary-region neoplasm that originates from Rathke's pouch. Craniopharyngiomas are benign slow growing tumors that are located within the sellar and para sellar region of the central nervous system. [PMID:17425791]
The definition of the Neuroepithelial neoplasm is that A neoplasm composed of neural epithelium, not necessarily a neoplasm located in the neural epithelium or neuroepithelium. []
The definition of the Neurocytoma is that A benign brain tumor composed of neural elements which most often arise from the septum pellucidum and the walls of the lateral ventricles. []

The definition of the Primitive neuroectodermal tumor is that A tumor that originates in cells from the primitive neural crest. This group of tumors is characteirzed by the presence of primitive cells with elements of neuronal and/or glial differentiation. []

The definition of the Ependymoblastoma is that A highly malignant embryonal tumor of infancy and young childhood characterized by neuroectodermal elements organized in distinctive multilayered rosettes. Ependymoblastomas are large lesions that occur in the supratentorial compartment, typically displaying a physical connection to the ventricular system. []
The definition of the Peripheral primitive neuroectodermal neoplasm is that A primitive neuroectodermal neoplasm that occurs extracranially in soft tissue and bone. []
The definition of the Olfactory esthesioneuroblastoma is that A malignant olfactory neuroblastoma arising from the olfactory epithelium of the superior nasal cavity and cribriform plate. []

The definition of the Primary central nervous system lymphoma is that A form of extranodal, high-grade non-Hodgkin B-cell neoplasm, usually large cell or immunoblastic type that originates in the brain, leptomeninges, spinal cord, or eyes and typically remains confined to the CNS. [PMID:23696924]
The definition of the Central primitive neuroectodermal tumor is that A primitive neuroectodermal neoplasm that occurs in the central nervous system. []
The definition of the Medulloepithelioma is that A primitive neuroectodermal tumor that originates from the cells of the embryonic medullary canal. [PMID:17566306]

The definition of the Chemodectoma is that A carotid body tumor (also called paraganglionoma or chemodectoma) is a tumor found in the upper neck at the branching of the carotid artery. They arise from the chemoreceptor organ (paraganglion) located in the adventitia of the carotid artery bifurcation.

The definition of the Ductal carcinoma in situ is that Presence of abnormal cells inside a milk duct, that is, non-invasive breast cancer. Ductal carcinoma in situ is considered to be a precursor lesion to invasive breast cancer. [PMID:24415964]
The definition of the Bronchial neoplasm is that A tumor originating in a bronchus. []
The definition of the Cervix cancer is that A tumor of the uterine cervix. []
The definition of the Burkitt lymphoma is that A form of undifferentiated malignant lymphoma commonly manifested as a large osteolytic lesion in the jaw or as an abdominal mass. []

The definition of the Punctate periventricular T2 hyperintense foci is that Multiple pointlike areas of high T2 signal observed upon magnetic resonance imaging of the periventricular cerebral white matter. []
The definition of the Abnormal drinking behavior is that Abnormal consumption of fluids with excessive or insufficient consumption of fluid or any other abnormal pattern of fluid consumption. []
The definition of the Salt craving is that Hypersalivation, also known as salt craving, refers to an excessive desire to consume salt (sodium chloride) or salty foods. []
The definition of the Clinodactyly is that An angulation of a digit at an interphalangeal joint in the plane of the palm (finger) or sole (toe). [PMID:16252026]
The definition of the Abnormal CSF lactate level is that Abnormal concentration of lactate in the cerebrospinal fluid.
The definition of the Reduced CSF lactate is that Decreased concentration of lactate in the cerebrospinal fluid. []
The definition of the Abnormal serum testosterone level is that An anomalous concentration of testosterone in the blood. []

The definition of the Abnormal muscle fiber protein expression is that An anomalous amount of protein present in or on the surface of muscle fibers. This feature may be appreciate upon immunohistochemical investigation of muscle biopsy tissue. []

The definition of the Abnormal muscle fiber merosin expression is that An anomalous amount of merosin in muscle fibers. Merosin is a basement membrane-associated protein found in placenta, striated muscle, and peripheral nerve.
The definition of the Absent muscle fiber merosin is that Lack of merosin protein in the muscle biopsy. []
The definition of the Reduced muscle fiber merosin is that A reduced amount of merosin in muscle fibers. This feature is usually assessed by immunohistochemical examination of muscle biopsy tissue.

The definition of the Abnormal muscle fiber laminin beta 1 is that A deviation from normal of the amount of laminin beta 1 in muscle fiber tissue. Laminin 2 is a major component of the basal lamina of skeletal muscle cells. It is a heterotrimer composed of 3 chains: merosin (laminin alpha 2 chain), beta 1, and gamma 1. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:UToronto_htrang, https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199, PMID:9400354]

The definition of the Reduced muscle fiber laminin beta 1 is that A reduced amount of laminin beta 1 in muscle fiber tissue. Laminin 2 is a major component of the basal lamina of skeletal muscle cells. It is a heterotrimer composed of 3 chains: merosin (laminin alpha 2 chain), beta 1, and gamma 1. []

The definition of the Reduced muscle collagen VI is that A decreased amount of collagen VI in muscle tissue. Collagen VI is a primarily associated with the extracellular matrix of skeletal muscle. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:UToronto_htrang]

The definition of the Abnormal muscle fiber dystrophin expression is that A deviation from normal in the amount of dystrophin in muscle fiber tissue. Dystrophin is located at the muscle sarcolemma in a membrane-spanning protein complex that connects the cytoskeleton to the basal lamina. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:UToronto_htrang, PMID:11917091]

The definition of the Absent muscle dystrophin expression is that Lack of dystrophin in muscle tissue. Immunohistochemistry reveals absent dystrophin protein in the muscle biopsy. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:UToronto_htrang, PMID:11917091]
The definition of the Reduced muscle dystrophin expression is that A decreased amount of dystrophin in muscle fiber tissue. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:UToronto_htrang]

The definition of the Reduced muscle fiber alpha dystroglycan is that Immunohistochemistry reveals reduced alpha dystroglycan protein in the muscle biopsy. Alpha-dystroglycan is a heavily glycosylated peripheral-membrane component of the dystrophin-associated glycoprotein complex (DAPC), which, in addition to laminin alpha2, binds perlecan and agrin in the extracellular matrix, whereas beta-dystroglycan, derived from the same gene, is a transmembrane protein that links to dystrophin intracellularly. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:UToronto_htrang, https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199, PMID:11592034]

The definition of the Abnormal muscle fiber alpha sarcoglycan is that Deviation from normal in the amount of alpha sarcoglycan in muscle. The alpha, beta, gamma, and delta sarcoglycans are components of the dystrophin-complex. They are all N-glycosylated transmembrane proteins with a short intra-cellular domain, a single transmembrane region and a large extra-cellular domain containing a cluster of conserved cysteines. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:UToronto_htrang, https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199, PMID:24843229]

The definition of the Absent muscle fiber alpha sarcoglycan is that Lack of alpha sarcoglycan in muscle. Immunohistochemistry reveals absent alpha sarcoglycan protein in the muscle biopsy. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:UToronto_htrang]

The definition of the Reduced muscle fiber alpha sarcoglycan is that A decreased amount of alpha sarcoglycan in muscle. Immunohistochemistry reveals reduced alpha sarcoglycan protein in the muscle biopsy. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:UToronto_htrang]

The definition of the Abnormal muscle fiber beta sarcoglycan is that Deviation from normal in the amount of beta sarcoglycan in muscle. The alpha, beta, gamma, and delta sarcoglycans are components of the dystrophin-complex. They are all N-glycosylated transmembrane proteins with a short intra-cellular domain, a single transmembrane region and a large extra-cellular domain containing a cluster of conserved cysteines. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:UToronto_htrang, https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199, PMID:24843229]

The definition of the Abnormal muscle fiber gamma sarcoglycan is that Deviation from normal in the amount of gamma sarcoglycan in muscle. The alpha, beta, gamma, and delta sarcoglycans are components of the dystrophin-complex. They are all N-glycosylated transmembrane proteins with a short intra-cellular domain, a single transmembrane region and a large extra-cellular domain containing a cluster of conserved cysteines. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:UToronto_htrang, https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199, PMID:24843229]

The definition of the Abnormal muscle fiber delta sarcoglycan is that Deviation from normal in the amount of delta sarcoglycan in muscle. The alpha, beta, gamma, and delta sarcoglycans are components of the dystrophin-complex. They are all N-glycosylated transmembrane proteins with a short intra-cellular domain, a single transmembrane region and a large extra-cellular domain containing a cluster of conserved cysteines. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:UToronto_htrang, https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199, PMID:24843229]
The definition of the Absent muscle fiber beta sarcoglyan is that Immunohistochemistry shows complete lack of beta sarcoglycan protein in the muscle biopsy. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:UToronto_htrang]
The definition of the Reduced muscle fiber beta sarcoglycan is that Immunohistochemistry reveals reduced beta sarcoglycan protein in the muscle biopsy. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:UToronto_htrang]
The definition of the Reduced muscle fiber gamma sarcoglycan is that Immunohistochemistry reveals reduced gamma sarcoglycan protein in the muscle biopsy. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:UToronto_htrang]
The definition of the Absent muscle fiber gamma sarcoglycan is that Immunohistochemistry shows complete lack of gamma sarcoglycan protein in the muscle biopsy. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:UToronto_htrang]

The definition of the Absent muscle fiber delta sarcoglycan is that Immunohistochemistry shows complete lack of delta sarcoglycan protein in the muscle biopsy. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:UToronto_htrang, PMID:26709803]

The definition of the Abnormal muscle fiber alpha dystroglycan is that A deviation from normal of muscle alpha-dystroglcan expression. Alpha-dystroglycan is a heavily glycosylated peripheral-membrane component of the dystrophin-associated glycoprotein complex (DAPC), which, in addition to laminin alpha2, binds perlecan and agrin in the extracellular matrix, whereas beta-dystroglycan, derived from the same gene, is a transmembrane protein that links to dystrophin intracellularly. []

The definition of the Abnormal muscle fiber dysferlin is that A deviation from normal in the expression of dysferlin in muscle tissue. Dysferlin is an ubiquitous 230-kDa transmembrane protein involved in calcium-mediated sarcolemma resealing.
The definition of the Absent muscle fiber dysferlin is that Immunohistochemistry shows complete lack of dysferlin protein in the muscle biopsy. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:UToronto_htrang]
The definition of the Reduced muscle fiber dysferlin is that Immunohistochemistry reveals reduced dysferlin protein in the muscle biopsy. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:UToronto_htrang]
The definition of the Abnormal muscle fiber emerin is that A deviation from normal of the amount of the inner nuclear membrane protein emerin in muscle tissue.
The definition of the Absent muscle fiber emerin is that Immunohistochemistry shows complete lack of emerin protein in the muscle biopsy. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:UToronto_htrang]
The definition of the Reduced muscle fiber emerin is that Immunohistochemistry reveals reduced emerin protein in the muscle biopsy. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:UToronto_htrang]

The definition of the Abnormal muscle fiber calpain-3 is that A deviation from normal in the amount of calpain-3 in muscle tissue. Calpains are intracellular nonlysosomal cysteine proteases modulated by calcium ions. A typical calpain is a heterodimer composed of two distinct subunits, one large (over 80 kDa) and the other small (30 kDa). While only one gene encoding the small subunit has been demonstrated, there are many genes for the large one. CAPN3 is similar to ubiquitous Calpain 1 and 2 (m-calpain and micro-calpain), but contains specific insertion sequences (NS, IS1 and IS2). Calpains cleave target proteins to modify their properties, rather than breaking down the substrates.
The definition of the Absent muscle fiber calpain-3 is that Western blot shows complete lack of calpain-3 protein in the muscle biopsy tissue. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:UToronto_htrang]
The definition of the Reduced muscle fiber calpain-3 is that Western blot reveals reduced calpain-3 protein in the muscle biopsy tissue. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:UToronto_htrang]

The definition of the Reduced muscle fiber perlecan is that Immunohistochemistry reveals reduced perlecan protein in the muscle biopsy. Perlecan is a basement membrane-specific heparan sulfate proteoglycan core protein (HSPG) also known as heparan sulfate proteoglycan 2 (HSPG2). [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:UToronto_htrang, https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199]

The definition of the Abnormal muscle fiber lamin A/C is that A deviation from the normal amount of lamin A/C in muscle tissue. The LMNA gene gives rise to at least three splicing isoforms including the two main isoforms, lamin A and lamin C. These are constitutive components of the fibrous nuclear lamina and have different roles, ranging from mechanical nuclear membrane maintenance to gene regulation.

The definition of the Reduced muscle fiber lamin A/C is that A decreased amount of lamin A/C in muscle tissue. This feature can be shown by immunohistochemistry or Western blotting of muscle tissue. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:UToronto_htrang, https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199]

The definition of the Sacralization of the fifth lumbar vertebra is that A congenital anomaly, in which the transverse process of the last lumbar vertebra (L5) fuses to the sacrum on one side or both, or to ilium, or both. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:UToronto_bgallinger]
The definition of the Abnormality of the endometrium is that An anomaly of the inner mucous membrane of the uterus.
The definition of the Endometriosis is that The growth of endometrial tissue outside the uterus.

The definition of the Impaired ristocetin cofactor assay activity is that Abnormal response to ristocetin as manifested by reduced or lacking aggregation of platelets upon addition of ristocetin to platelet-poor plasma. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:cmiller]

The definition of the Impaired von Willibrand factor collagen binding activity is that Reduced ability of von Willebrand factor (vWF) to bind collagen. Abnormal response to collagen as manifested by reduced or lacking ability of plasma von WIllebrand Factor to bind collagen. An ELISA-based assay is typically used; the test is sensitive to loss of von Willebrand Factor high molecular weight multimers. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:cmiller, PMID:18809794]
The definition of the Abnormal von Willebrand Factor multimer distribution is that Deviation from the normal von Willebrand factor multimer pattern. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:cmiller]
The definition of the Absence of large von Willibrand factor multimers is that Absence of large von Willebrand Factor multimers on gel electrophoresis. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:cmiller]

The definition of the Abnormal presence of ultra-large von Willebrand Factor multimers is that Detection of abnormal ultra-large von Willebrand factor multimers. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:cmiller, PMID:11756169, PMID:25983111]
The definition of the Total absence von Willebrand Factor multimers is that Complete absence of all von Willebrand factor multimers. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:cmiller]
The definition of the Absence of intermediate von Willibrand factor multimers is that Lack of intermediate von Willebrand Factor multimers on gel electrophoresis. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:cmiller]

The definition of the Enhanced ristocetin cofactor assay activity is that Abnormal response to ristocetin as manifested by increased aggregation of platelets upon addition of low-dose ristocetin to platelet-rich plasma. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:cmiller]
The definition of the Prolonged bleeding following circumcision is that Bleeding that persists for a longer than usual time following circumcision. []
The definition of the Excessive bleeding from superficial cuts is that An abnormally increased degree of bleeding following a superfical injury to the surface of the skin. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:cmiller]
The definition of the Excessive bleeding after a venipuncture is that An abnormal high amount of bleeding following the procedure of taking a blood sample. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:cmiller]
The definition of the Oral cavity bleeding is that Recurrent or excessive bleeding from the mouth. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:cmiller]

The definition of the Abnormality of the posterior hairline is that An anomaly in the placement or shape of the hairline (trichion) on the back of the head (neck), that is, the border between skin on the back of the head that has head hair.

The definition of the Abnormal bowel sounds is that An anomaly of the amount or nature of abdominal sounds. Abdominal sounds (bowel sounds) are made by the movement of the intestines as they promote passage of abdominal contents by peristalsis. []
The definition of the Hyperactive bowel sounds is that Abnormally increased gurgling/rumbling sounds made by the movement of fluid and gas in the intestines.
The definition of the Lack of bowel sounds is that Complete lack of abdominal sounds as assayed by examination of the abdomen with a stethoscope.
The definition of the Truncal titubation is that Tremor of the trunk in an anterior-posterior plane at 3-4 Hz.
The definition of the Heart murmur is that An extra or unusual sound heard during a heartbeat caused vibrations resulting from the flow of blood through the heart.

The definition of the Cardiogenic shock is that Severely decreased cardiac output with evidence of inadequate end-organ perfusion (i.e., tissue hypoxia) in the presence of adequate intravascular volume. [PMID:24188221]
The definition of the Plasmacytosis is that An abnormally increased number of plasma cells in tissues, exudates, or blood []
The definition of the Cholangitis is that Inflammation of the biliary ductal system, affecting the intrahepatic or extrahepatic portions, or both.

The definition of the Cholangiocarcinoma is that Cholangiocarcinoma is a primary cancer originating in the biliary epithelium i.e., the cholangiocytes, of the extrahepatic and intrahepatic biliary ducts. It is extremely invasive, develops rapidly, often metastasizes, and has a very poor prognosis. They are slow growing tumors which spread longitudinally along the bile ducts with neural, perineural and subepithelial extension.
The definition of the Gallbladder perforation is that Rupture of the wall of the gallbladder.
The definition of the Scrotal pain is that An unpleasant sensation characterized by physical discomfort (such as pricking, throbbing, or aching) localized to the scrotum. []
The definition of the Flank pain is that An unpleasant sensation characterized by physical discomfort (such as pricking, throbbing, or aching) and perceived to originate in the flank. []
The definition of the Cervical ectropion is that Cervical ectropion occurs when eversion of the endocervix exposes columnar epithelium to the vaginal milieu
The definition of the Cervical polyp is that Abnormal growth of tissue projecting from a mucous membrane of the endocervix.
The definition of the Cervicitis is that Inflammation of the uterine cervix.
The definition of the Vaginal pruritus is that A sensation of itching in the vagina. []
The definition of the Glomerulomegaly is that Abnormally large size of glomeruli.
The definition of the Abnormal vascular physiology is that Abnormality of vascular function.
The definition of the Jaw claudication is that Pain in the jaw or ear induced by chewing or otherwise moving the jaw.
The definition of the Temporal artery tortuosity is that The presence of an increased number of twists and turns of the temporal artery.
The definition of the Night sweats is that Occurrence of excessive sweating during sleep.
The definition of the Antimitochondrial antibody positivity is that The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the serum that react against mitochondria.
The definition of the Dilated superficial abdominal veins is that Increase in diameter of the veins located underneath the skin of the abdomen. [PMID:5897968]
The definition of the Gastric varix is that Extreme dilation of the submucusoal veins in the stomach.

The definition of the Cystic artery pseudoaneurysm is that Presence of a pseudoaneurysm in the artery that supplies the gallbladder and cystic duct with blood. A pseudoaneurysm, also known as a false aneurysm, forms when blood leaks through a breach of the arterial wall but is contained by the adventitia or surrounding perivascular soft tissue.
The definition of the Perirenal hematoma is that A collection of clotted blood surrounding the kidney.
The definition of the Peripheral amyelination is that Congenital absence of the myelin sheath on a nerve. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:jbeats, PMID:22246888]
The definition of the Peripheral hypermyelination is that Increased amount of peripheral myelination.
The definition of the Increased peripheral myelin thickness is that Elevated thickness of the myelin sheath of peripheral nerves, in a regular and concentric fashion. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:jbeats]
The definition of the Myelin tomacula is that The presence of multiple sausage-shaped swellings of the myelin sheath (The Latin tomaculum means sausage). [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:jbeats, PMID:10727485]
The definition of the Asymmetric peripheral demyelination is that Loss of myelin from peripheral nerves in a pattern that differs between right and left. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:jbaets]

The definition of the Abnormality of peripheral nervous system electrophysiology is that An abnormality of the function of the electrical signals with which peripheral nerve cells communicate with each other or with muscles. []

The definition of the Abnormal peripheral action potential amplitude is that An anomaly in the magnitude of the action potential along a peripheral nerve, that is, of the rapid rise and fall of the electrical membrane potential of the nerve. []

The definition of the Oppenheim reflex is that Dorsiflexion of the big toe, sometimes accompanied by fanning of the other toes, elicited by stroking along the medial side of the tibia (the normal response would be no movement of the big toe). [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:UKB_tklockgether]

The definition of the Tetraplegia/tetraparesis is that Loss of strength in all four limbs. Tetraplegia refers to a complete loss of strength, whereas Tetraparesis refers to an incomplete loss of strength. []

The definition of the Impaired visually enhanced vestibulo-ocular reflex is that The vestibulo-ocular reflex is responsible for the stabilization of the retinal image during movement. The visual vestibular ocular reflex (VVOR) or visual enhanced VOR, maintains ocular stability during head motion by generating compensatory eye movement opposite to head movement, and is a major component of visual vestibular interaction. This feature is an impairment of this reflex, manifested as the combined impairment of the three compensatory eye movement reflexes, namely the vestibulo-ocular reflex (VOR), smooth pursuit (SP) and optokinetic reflex (OKR).
The definition of the Isometric tremor is that An isometric tremor occurs with muscle contraction against a rigid stationary object (e.g., when making a fist).

The definition of the Kinetic tremor is that Tremor that occurs during any voluntary movement. It may include visually or non-visually guided movements. Tremor during target directed movement is called intention tremor. []
The definition of the Titubation is that Nodding movement of the head or body.
The definition of the Tremor by anatomical site is that Tremor classified by the affected body part.

The definition of the Oral motor hypotonia is that Reduced muscle tone of oral musculature. In infants, this feature may be associated with difficulties in breast feeding, and may affect the latch, jaw motions, tongue placement, lip seal, suck/swallow/breathe pattern and overall feeding behavior. []
The definition of the Abnormal peripheral nervous system synaptic transmission is that An anomaly in the communication from a neuron to a target across a synapse in the peripheral nervous system. []

The definition of the Fatigable weakness of bulbar muscles is that A type of weakness of the bulbar muscles (muscles of the mouth and throat responsible for speech and swallowing) that occurs after a muscle group is used and lessens if the muscle group has some rest. That is, there is diminution of strength with repetitive muscle actions. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:UNCL_mbertoli, https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0736-9199, PMID:17986328]

The definition of the Fatigable weakness of chewing muscles is that A type of weakness of the muscles involved in chewing that occurs after a muscle group is used and lessens if the muscle group has some rest. That is, there is diminution of strength with repetitive muscle actions. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:UNCL_tevangelista, PMID:17986328]

The definition of the Fatigable weakness of speech muscles is that A type of weakness of the muscles involved in speech that occurs after a muscle group is used and lessens if the muscle group has some rest. That is, there is diminution of strength with repetitive muscle actions.

The definition of the Fatigable weakness of swallowing muscles is that A type of weakness of the muscles involved in swallowing that occurs after a muscle group is used and lessens if the muscle group has some rest. That is, there is diminution of strength with repetitive muscle actions. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:UK_rheller, PMID:17986328]

The definition of the Fatigable weakness of respiratory muscles is that A type of weakness of the muscles involved in breathing (respiration) that occurs after a muscle group is used and lessens if the muscle group has some rest. That is, there is diminution of strength with repetitive muscle actions. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:UNCL_mbertoli]

The definition of the Fatigable weakness of skeletal muscles is that A type of weakness of skeletal muscle that occurs after a muscle group is used and lessens if the muscle group has some rest. That is, there is diminution of strength with repetitive muscle actions. []

The definition of the Fatigable weakness of distal limb muscles is that A type of weakness of a skeletal muscle of distal part of a limb that occurs after a muscle group is used and lessens if the muscle group has some rest. That is, there is diminution of strength with repetitive muscle actions. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:UK_rheller]

The definition of the Fatigable weakness of neck muscles is that A type of weakness of a skeletal muscle in the neck that occurs after a muscle group is used and lessens if the muscle group has some rest. That is, there is diminution of strength with repetitive muscle actions. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:UK_rheller]

The definition of the Fatiguable weakness of proximal limb muscles is that A type of weakness of a skeletal muscle of proximal part of a limb that occurs after a muscle group is used and lessens if the muscle group has some rest. That is, there is diminution of strength with repetitive muscle actions. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:UK_rheller]

The definition of the Response to drugs acting on neuromuscular transmission is that Specific drugs interfere selectively with the different cellular mechanisms involved in neuromuscular transmission (synthesis, storage, release, action and inactivation of transmitter). The response of a patient to a specific drug can therefore be useful information for the differential diagnosis. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:UK_rheller]

The definition of the Favorable response of weakness to acetylcholine esterase inhibitors is that Improvement of muscle strength in response to administration of an acetylcholine esterase inhibitor. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:UK_rheller]

The definition of the Unfavorable response of muscle weakness to acetylcholine esterase inhibitors is that Lack of improvement of muscle strength in response to administration of an acetylcholine esterase inhibitor. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:UK_rheller]

The definition of the Increased jitter at single fibre EMG is that The variation in the time interval between the two action potentials of the same motor unit is called jitter. This term therefore applies to increased variability in the interval between successive action potentials of the same motor unit, which is measured by electromyography (EMG). [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:UK_rheller, PMID:21654930]

The definition of the EMG: incremental response of compound muscle action potential to repetitive nerve stimulation is that A compound muscle action potential (CMAP) is a type of electromyography (EMG). CMAP refers to a group of almost simultaneous action potentials from several muscle fibers in the same area evoked by stimulation of the supplying motor nerve and are recorded as one multipeaked summated action potential. This abnormality refers to an abnormal increase in the amplitude during the course of the investigation. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:UK_rheller, PMID:23970984]

The definition of the Paradoxical respiration is that Breathing movements in which the chest wall moves in on inspiration and out on expiration, in reverse of the normal movements. It may be seen in children with respiratory distress of any cause, which leads to indrawing of the intercostal spaces during inspiration. Patients with chronic airways obstruction also show indrawing of the lower ribs during inspiration, due to the distorted action of a depressed and flattened diaphragm. Crush injuries of the chest, with fractured ribs and sternum, can lead to a severe degree of paradoxical breathing. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:tevangelista]

The definition of the Acetylcholine receptor antibody positivity is that The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against Ganglioside-monosialic acid (GM1), which is a type of glycosphingolipid with one sialic acid. GM1 is located on the outer layer of the plasma membrane, and plays a vital role in neurogenesis, nerve development, differentiation and repair after injury. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:UK_rheller]

The definition of the Calcium channel antibody positivity is that The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the serum that react against voltage-gated calcium channels. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:UNCL_mbertoli, PMID:7739683]
The definition of the Muscle specific kinase antibody positivity is that The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the serum that react against muscle specific kinase (anti-MuSK Ab).
The definition of the Slow pupillary light response is that Reduced velocity and acceleration in the pupillary light response. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:UNCL_tevangelista, PMID:974056]
The definition of the Collectionism is that Excessive or pathological tendency to save and collect possessions. []
The definition of the Emotional blunting is that Inability to feel positive or negative emotions, feelings of detachment, or reduced emotional responsiveness. []
The definition of the Hypersexuality is that Pathological persistent sexual disinhibiting behavior, directed towards oneself or others. []
The definition of the Inappropriate crying is that Uncontrolled episodes of crying occur without any apparent motivating stimuli. []
The definition of the Inertia is that Reduction of goal-directed behaviors linked to the impairment in frontal executive functions (planning of an action for example). [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:ICM_PCaroppo]
The definition of the Limb apraxia is that Difficulty in performing the correct execution of limbs movements in absence of motor impairment. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:ICM_PCaroppo]

The definition of the Punding is that Punding is a stereotypical motor behavior characterized by an intense fascination with repetitive, excessive and non-goal oriented handling, and examining of objects. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:ICM_PCaroppo, PMID:15077237, PMID:25452726]
The definition of the Semantic dementia is that A progressive loss of the ability to remember the meaning of words, faces and objects. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:ICM_PCaroppo, PMID:24966676]
The definition of the Socially inappropriate behavior is that Behavior that is not in line with social norms. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:ICM_PCaroppo]
The definition of the Sweet craving is that Excessive desire to eat sweet foods. []

The definition of the Visual agnosia is that The condition is known as visual agnosia, which refers to the inability to recognize objects that are visually presented, even though the individual may have normal visual field, acuity, color vision, brightness discrimination, language, and memory. []

The definition of the Perseveration is that Manifestations of perseverative thoughts are behaviors that do not meet the demands of the situation, are not the product of deliberation, and may unfold despite counter intention. []
The definition of the Abnormal muscle fiber desmin is that A deviation from normal in the expression of desmin in muscle tissue. Desmin is an 53-kDa protein.
The definition of the Accumulation of muscle fiber desmin is that Immunohistochemistry shows accumulation of desmin protein in the muscle biopsy.
The definition of the Abnormal muscle fiber myotilin is that A deviation from normal in the expression of myotilin in muscle tissue. Myotilin is a 57kDa cytoskeletal protein.
The definition of the Accumulation of muscle fiber myotilin is that Immunohistochemistry shows accumulation of myotilin protein in the muscle biopsy.

The definition of the Abnormal muscle fiber valosin-containing protein is that A deviation from normal in the expression of valosin-containing protein in muscle tissue. Valosin-containing protein is an ubiquitously expressed multifunctional 100-kD protein that is a member of the AAA+ (ATPase associated with various activities) protein family.
The definition of the Accumulation of muscle fiber valosin-containing protein is that Immunohistochemistry shows accumulation of valosin-containing protein in the muscle biopsy.

The definition of the Central core regions in muscle fibers is that The presence of disorganized areas called cores in the center of muscle fibers. There is a typical appearance of the biopsy on light microscopy, where the muscle cells have cores that are devoid of mitochondria and specific enzymes. Cores are typically well demarcated and centrally located, but may occasionally be multiple and of eccentric.
The definition of the Glycogen accumulation in muscle fiber lysosomes is that An increased amount of glycogen in muscle tissue found specifically in lysosomes.
The definition of the Increased sarcoplasmic glycogen is that Elevated glycogen content in the sarcoplasm (cytoplasm) of muscle fibers.
The definition of the Bethlem sign is that Limitation of wrist and finger extension on asking patient to form a prayer sign. This is a result of progressive wrist and finger flexion contractures.
The definition of the Abnormality of muscle size is that Abnormalities of the overall muscle bulk based on clinical observation.
The definition of the Hand muscle weakness is that Reduced strength of the musculature of the hand.

The definition of the Hypoplasia of the upper arm musculature is that Underdevelopment of the musculature of the upper arm, which may include the deltoid, the triceps, the biceps, and the brachioradialis.
The definition of the Hypoplasia of deltoid muscle is that Underdevelopment of the deltoid muscle.
The definition of the Portal vein thrombosis is that Thrombosis of the portal vein and/or its tributaries, which include the splenic vein and the superior and inferior mesenteric veins.
The definition of the Hepatic vein thrombosis is that An obstruction in the veins of the liver caused by a blood clot (thrombosis).

The definition of the Splanchnic vein thrombosis is that The term splanchnic vein thrombosis encompasses Budd-Chiari syndrome (hepatic vein thrombosis), extrahepatic portal vein obstruction (EHPVO), and mesenteric vein thrombosis; the word splanchnic is used to refer to the visceral organs (of the abdominal cavity).

The definition of the Mesenteric venous thrombosis is that A clot that obstructs blood flow in a mesenteric vein (the superior and the inferior mesenteric vein drain blood from the small and large intestine). []
The definition of the Enanthema is that A sudden eruption (rash) of the surface of a mucous membrane of the mouth or pharynx.
The definition of the Pulmonary granulomatosis is that The presence of multiple granulomata (small nodular inflammatory lesions containing grouped mononuclear phagocytes) in the lung. []

The definition of the Absence of memory B cells is that Complete lack of memory B cells, that is, of mature B cell type that is long-lived, readily activated upon re-encounter of its antigenic determinant, and has been selected for expression of higher affinity immunoglobulin.
The definition of the Absence of mature B cells is that Complete lack of mature B cells, that is, of B cells that have left the bone marrow.
The definition of the Defective T cell proliferation is that A reduced ability of a T cell population to expand by cell division following T cell activation.
The definition of the Nail bed hemorrhage is that Small areas of bleeding (hemorrhage) under the fingernail or toenail.
The definition of the Large intestinal polyposis is that The presence of multiple polyps in the large intestine.
The definition of the Small intestinal polyposis is that The presence of multiple polyps in the small intestine.
The definition of the Freckled genitalia is that One or more brown punctate macules on the skin of the genitalia.
The definition of the Hyperpigmented genitalia is that Localized or generalized increased genital pigmentation. []
The definition of the Hypopigmented genitalia is that Localized or generalized decreased genital pigmentation.
The definition of the Microphallus is that Length of penis more than 2 SD below the mean for age accompanied by hypospadias.
The definition of the Absent penis is that Lack of recognizable penile structures.

The definition of the Narrow penis is that Penile width more than 2 standard deviations (SD) below the mean for age. Alternatively circumference of the flaccid penis more than 2 SD below the mean for age. Alternatively, apparently decreased penile width for age.
The definition of the Torsion of the penis is that Rotated position of the glans, with or without the penile shaft, of 30 degrees or more.
The definition of the Webbed penis is that Ventral skinfold extending from penis to scrotum. [PMID:23650202]

The definition of the Wide penis is that Distance between left and right side of the flaccid penis at the attachment to the skin above the pubic symphysis more than 2 standard deviations above the mean for age. [PMID:23650202]
The definition of the Calcification of the interosseus membrane of the forearm is that Deposition of calcium salts in the fibrous sheet that connects the radius and the ulna.
The definition of the ARRAY(0x50ef8d8) is that An elevated level of insulin-like growth factor 1 (IGF1) in the blood circulation.

The definition of the Elevated red cell adenosine deaminase activity is that Increase in the level of adenosine deaminase (ADA), an enzyme involved in purine metabolism, within erythrocytes. ADA is involved in the catabolism of adenosine.

The definition of the Reduced erythrocyte 2,3-diphosphoglycerate concentration is that This term refers to an inappropriate low 2,3-DPG concentration in erythrocytes. 2,3-diphosphoglycerate (2,3-DPG) controls the movement of oxygen from red blood cells to tissues. Anemia is usually accompanied by an increased level of 2,3-DPG in order to promote tissue oxygenation.

The definition of the Abnormal erythrocyte enzyme activity is that An altered level of any enzyme to act as catalysts within erythrocytes. This term includes changes due to altered activity of an enzyme. []

The definition of the Reduced red cell adenosine deaminase activity is that Decrease in the level of adenosine deaminase (ADA), an enzyme involved in purine metabolism, within erythrocytes. ADA is involved in the catabolism of adenosine.
The definition of the Accessory scrotum is that Additional scrotum, or part of a scrotum in an abnormal location. [PMID:23650202]
The definition of the Ectopic scrotum is that Scrotum in a position other than the usual position inferior to the base of the penis. [PMID:23650202]

The definition of the Partial absence of the septum pellucidum is that Only part of the septum pellucidum (a thin, triangular, vertical membrane separating the lateral ventricles of the brain) is present. This feature can be appreciated on magnetic resonance tomography or computed tomography of the brain. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:UToronto_bgallinger]

The definition of the Triangular tongue is that A form of macrogloassia (increased size of the tongue) characterized by a broad based root of the tongue but a small tongue tip, giving the appearance of a triangle. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:UToronto_bgallinger]
The definition of the Splayed superior cerebellar peduncle is that Abnormal splayed configuration (spreading out) of the superior cerebellar peduncle.
The definition of the Atrophic superior cerebellar peduncle is that Atrophy of the superior cerebellar peduncle.
The definition of the Lower-limb metaphyseal irregularity is that Irregularity of the normally smooth surface of one or more metaphyses of a bone of the leg.
The definition of the Tibial metaphyseal irregularity is that Irregularity of the normally smooth surface of a metaphysis of a tibia.
The definition of the Fibular metaphyseal irregularity is that Irregularity of the normally smooth surface of a metaphysis of a fibula.
The definition of the Distal femoral metaphyseal abnormality is that An anomaly of the metaphysis of the distal femur (close to the knee).
The definition of the 10 pairs of ribs is that Presence of only 10 (instead of the usual 12) pairs of ribs. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:UToronto_bgallinger]

The definition of the Abnormality of the anterior commissure is that An anomaly of the anterior commissure, a bundle of nerve fibers that connect the two cerebral hemispheres across the midline. The anterior commissure plays a role in pain sensation and contains decussating fibers from the olfactory tracts. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:UToronto_bgallinger]
The definition of the Agenesis of the anterior commissure is that Absence of the anterior commissure. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:UToronto_bgallinger]
The definition of the Hypoplastic anterior commissure is that Underdevelopment of the anterior commissure. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:UToronto_bgallinger]
The definition of the Abnormal number of vertebrae is that A deviation from the normal number of vertebrae in the spinal column.
The definition of the 11 thoracic vertebrae is that The presence of 11 instead of the normal 12 thoracic vertebrae. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:UToronto_bgallinger]
The definition of the Flared lower limb metaphysis is that The presence of a splayed (i.e.,flared) metaphyseal segment of one or more long bones of the leg.
The definition of the Flared distal tibial metaphysis is that The presence of a splayed (i.e.,flared) metaphyseal segment of the distal tibia.
The definition of the Flared distal fibular metaphysis is that The presence of a splayed (i.e.,flared) metaphyseal segment of the distal fibula.
The definition of the Upper extremity joint dislocation is that Displacement or malalignment of one or more joints in the upper extremity (arm).
The definition of the Lower extremity joint dislocation is that Displacement or malalignment of one or more joints in the lower extremity (leg).
The definition of the Obliteration of the calvarial diploe is that Absence of the spongy bone structure (or tissue) of the internal part of the skull cap (i.e., of the calvarial diploe).
The definition of the Abnormal periosteum morphology is that An anomalous structure of the periosteum, i.e., of the membrane that covers the outer surface of bones.
The definition of the Periostosis is that Abnormal deposition of periosteal bone. []
The definition of the Angular cheilitis is that A type of inflammation of the lips involving one or both of the corners of the mouth.
The definition of the Weakness of facial musculature is that Complete loss of ability to move facial muscles innervated by the facial nerve (i.e., the seventh cranial nerve).
The definition of the Increased intervertebral space is that An increase in the vertical distance between adjacent vertebral bodies, observed as an increase in the intervertebral disc space.

The definition of the Abnormality of the vertebral artery is that An anomaly of the vertebral artery, the major artery of the neck that originates from the subclavian artery and merges to form the single midline basilar artery in a complex called the vertebrobasilar system.
The definition of the Vertebral artery hypoplasia is that Underdevelopment of the vertebral artery. []
The definition of the Unilateral vertebral artery hypoplasia is that Underdevelopment of the vertebral artery on one side.
The definition of the Bilateral vertebral artery hypoplasia is that Underdevelopment of the vertebral artery on both sides.
The definition of the Cervicomedullary schisis is that Fissure within the spinal cord of the neck.
The definition of the Abnormal macrophage count is that An anomaly in the number of macrophages.

The definition of the Abnormal osteoclast count is that An anomaly in the number of osteoclasts in bone tissue, bone-resorbing cells that develop from macrophages. This finding can be observed by histological examination of bone tissue. []
The definition of the Decreased osteoclast count is that Decreased number of osteoclasts in bone tissue.
The definition of the Retinal thinning is that Reduced anteroposterior thickness of the retina. This phenotype can be appreciated by retinal optical coherence tomography (OCT).

The definition of the Multinucleated giant chondrocytes in epiphyseal cartilage is that The presence of cartilage cells (chondrocytes) that are substantially increased in size and contain more than one nucleus and are located within the resting zone of the epiphyseal cartilage.

The definition of the Impaired stimulus-induced skin wrinkling is that A reduced ability of the skin of the fingertips to wrinkle when exposed to stimuli such as soaking in water or application of EMLA cream (the fingertip remains smooth). [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:UToronto_bgallinger, PMID:19375384]
The definition of the Abnormal alpha-beta T cell morphology is that A structuraly anomaly of T cells that express an alpha-beta T cell receptor. []

The definition of the Abnormal CD4-positive, CD25-positive, alpha-beta regulatory T cell morphology is that A structural anomaly of a CD4-positive, CD25-positive, alpha-beta T cell. These cells are regulatory T cells.
The definition of the Abnormal CD4-positive, CD25-positive, alpha-beta regulatory T cell count is that A deviation from the normal count of CD4-positive, CD25-positive, alpha-beta regulatory T cells.
The definition of the Absence of CD4-positive, CD25-positive regulatory T cells is that Lack of CD4+CD25+ T regulatory cells.
The definition of the Elevated CD4-positive, CD25-positive regulatory T cell count is that An increased number of CD4-positive, CD25-positive regulatory T cells.

The definition of the Abnormal circulating gonadotropin level is that An anomaly of the circulating level of a gonadotropin, that is, of a protein hormone secreted by gonadotrope cells of the anterior pituitary of vertebrates. The primary gonadotropins are luteinizing hormone (LH) and follicle-stimulating hormone (FSH).

The definition of the Decreased circulating gonadotropin level is that A reduction of the circulating level of a gonadotropin, that is, of a protein hormone secreted by gonadotrope cells of the anterior pituitary of vertebrates. The primary gonadotropins are luteinizing hormone (LH) and follicle-stimulating hormone (FSH).
The definition of the Decreased circulating follicle stimulating hormone level is that A reduction of the circulating level of follicle-stimulating hormone (FSH).
The definition of the Decreased circulating luteinizing hormone level is that A reduction in the circulating level of luteinizing hormone (LH).
The definition of the Abnormal circulating luteinizing hormone level is that An anomaly of the circulating level of luteinizing hormone (LH). []
The definition of the Abnormal circulating follicle-stimulating hormone level is that An anomaly of the circulating level of follicle-stimulating hormone (FSH).

The definition of the Abnormal circulating androgen level is that An anomaly in the blood concentration of an androgen, that is, of a steroid hormone that controls development and maintenance of masculine characteristics. The androgens include testosterone and Dehydroepiandrosterone.

The definition of the Increased circulating androgen level is that An elevation of the blood concentration of an androgen, that is, of a steroid hormone that controls development and maintenance of masculine characteristics. The androgens include testosterone and Dehydroepiandrosterone.

The definition of the Decreased circulating androgen level is that A reduction in the blood concentration of an androgen, that is, of a steroid hormone that controls development and maintenance of masculine characteristics. The androgens include testosterone and Dehydroepiandrosterone.
The definition of the Erythematous papule is that A circumscribed, solid elevation of skin with no visible fluid that is reddish (erythematous) in color.
The definition of the Urticarial plaque is that A well-circumscribed, intensely pruritic, raised wheal (edema of the superficial skin) typically 1 to 2 cm in diameter. []
The definition of the Abnormal serum insulin-like growth factor 1 level is that An anomalous level of insulin-like growth factor 1 (IGF1) in the blood circulation.
The definition of the Decreased serum insulin-like growth factor 1 is that A reduced level of insulin-like growth factor 1 (IGF1) in the blood circulation.
The definition of the Increased serum interferon-gamma level is that An elevation in the concentration of interferon gamma measured in the blood circulation.

The definition of the Small cell lung carcinoma is that Small cell lung cancer (SCLC) is a type of highly malignant lung cancer that is composed of small ovoid cells. In the past, SCLC was called oat cell carcinoma because the microscopic appearance of the cells was felt to resemble oats. SLCLC usually originates near the bronchi and in many cases may grow and metastasize quickly.
The definition of the Squamous cell lung carcinoma is that A type of non-small cell lung carcinoma that is derived from stratified squamous epithelial cells.

The definition of the Large cell lung carcinoma is that A type of non-small cell lung carcinoma that is derived from undifferentiated malignant neoplasms originating from transformed epithelial cells in the lung, and which is differentiate from small-cell lung carcinoma by the larger size of the anaplastic cells, a higher cytoplasmic-to-nuclear size ratio, and a lack of salt-and-pepper appearance of the chromatin.
The definition of the Reduced muscle carnitine level is that A reduction in the level of carnitine in muscle tissue.

The definition of the Finger hyperphalangy is that Hyperphalangy is a digit morphology in which increased numbers of phalanges are arranged linearly within a digit. That is, there is an accessory phalanx that is arranged linearly with the other phalanges. []

The definition of the Hyperphalangy of the 2nd finger is that An accessory phalanx of the index (second) finger that is arranged linearly with the other phalanges. Hyperphalangy of the index finger results from an accessory ossification center at the metacarpophalangeal joint, resulting in radial deviation of the index finger. Note that this term refers only to this type of hyperphalangy.

The definition of the Abnormal naive B cell count is that A deviation in the normal proportion of naive B cells (CD19+/CD27-/IgD+/IgM+) relative to the total number of B cells. Naive B cells represent one of the subtypes of B cells in the peripheral blood, and are B cells that have not been exposed to antigen.

The definition of the Increased naive B cell count is that An elevation above the normal proportion of naive B cells (CD19+/CD27-/IgD+/IgM+) relative to total number of B cells. Naive B cells represent one of the subtypes of B cells in the peripheral blood, and are B cells that have not been exposed to antigen.

The definition of the Decreased naive B cell count is that A reduction below normal proportion of naive B cells (CD19+/CD27-/IgD+/IgM+) relative to total number of B cells. Naive B cells represent one of the subtypes of B cells in the peripheral blood, and are B cells that have not been exposed to antigen.

The definition of the Abnormal memory B cell count is that A deviation of the normal proportion of memory B cells in circulation relative to total number of B cells. Memory B cells develop from naive B cells. Upon antigen rechallenge, memory B cells rapidly expand and differentiate into plasma cells under the cognate control of memory Th cells (Phase IV).

The definition of the Decreased memory B cell count is that A reduction in the normal proportion of memory B cells (CD19+/CD27+) in circulation relative to the total number of B cells. Memory B cells develop from naive B cells. Upon antigen rechallenge, memory B cells rapidly expand and differentiate into plasma cells under the cognate control of memory Th cells (Phase IV).

The definition of the Increased memory B cell count is that An elevation in the proportion of memory B cells (CD19+/CD27+) in circulation relative to the total number of B cells. Memory B cells develop from naive B cells. Upon antigen rechallenge, memory B cells rapidly expand and differentiate into plasma cells under the cognate control of memory Th cells (Phase IV).

The definition of the Abnormal immature B cell count is that A deviation from normal proportion of immature B cells (CD19+/ CD21low) in circulation relative to total number of B cells. Immature B cells (IgM+) are still in final stages of development within the bone marrow. Naive B cells are those which have left the bone marrow, before they bind to the antigen for which they're specific (IgM+/IgD+).

The definition of the Increased immature B cell count is that An elevation in the proportion above normal of immature B cells (CD19+/ CD21low) in circulation relative to total number of B cells. Immature B cells (IgM+) are still in final stages of development within the bone marrow. Naive B cells are those which have left the bone marrow, before they bind to the antigen for which they're specific (IgM+/IgD+).

The definition of the Decreased immature B cell count is that A reduction in normal proportion of immature B cells (CD19+/ CD21low)in circulation relative to total number of B cells. Immature B cells (IgM+) are still in final stages of development within the bone marrow. Naive B cells are those which have left the bone marrow, before they bind to the antigen for which they're specific (IgM+/IgD+).

The definition of the Abnormal transitional B cell count is that A deviation in the normal proportion of transitional B cells (CD19+/CD38high/IgMhigh) in circulation relative to the total number of B cells. B cells originate from precursors in the bone marrow, and the first cells which migrate to the peripheral blood have been classified as transitional B cells.

The definition of the Decreased transitional B cell count is that A reduction in the normal proportion of transitional B cells (CD19+/CD38high/IgMhigh) in circulation relative to the total number of B cells. B cells originate from precursors in the bone marrow, and the first cells which migrate to the peripheral blood have been classified as transitional B cells.

The definition of the Increased transitional B cell count is that An elevation in the normal proportion of transitional B cells (CD19+/CD38high/IgMhigh) in circulation relative to the total number of B cells. B cells originate from precursors in the bone marrow, and the first cells which migrate to the peripheral blood have been classified as transitional B cells.

The definition of the Abnormal marginal zone B cell count is that A deviation of the normal proportion of marginal zone B cells (CD19+/CD27+/IgM+/IgD+) in circulation relative to the total number of B cells.

The definition of the Decreased marginal zone B cell count is that A reduction in the normal proportion of marginal zone B cells (CD19+/CD27+/IgM+/IgD+) in circulation relative to the total number of B cells. [PMID:9802980]

The definition of the Increased marginal zone B cell count is that An elevation in the normal proportion of marginal zone B cells (CD19+/CD27+/IgM+/IgD+) in circulation relative to the total number of B cells.

The definition of the Abnormal class-switched memory B cell count is that A deviation of the normal proportion of class-switched memory B cells (CD19+/CD27+/IgM-/IgD-) in circulation relative to the total number of B cells. Marginal zone B cells undergo limited somatic hypermutation and produce high-affinity IgM and some IgG, whereas class-switched memory B cells synthetize IgG, IgM, and IgA.

The definition of the Increased class-switched memory B cell count is that An increase in the normal proportion of class-switched memory B cells (CD19+/CD27+/IgM+/IgD+) relative to the total number of B cells. Marginal zone B cells undergo limited somatic hypermutation and produce high-affinity IgM and some IgG, whereas class-switched memory B cells synthetize IgG, IgM, and IgA.

The definition of the Decreased class-switched memory B cell count is that A reduction in the normal proportion of class-switched memory B cells (CD19+/CD27+/IgM+/IgD+) relative to the total number of B cells. Marginal zone B cells undergo limited somatic hypermutation and produce high-affinity IgM and some IgG, whereas class-switched memory B cells synthetize IgG, IgM, and IgA.

The definition of the Spoken Word Recognition Deficit is that Reduced ability of lexical discrimination, which refers to the process of distinguishing a stimulus word from other phonologically similar words. Lexical discrimination can be defined as the process of correctly identifying words in the mental lexicon to match the phonological input of a stimulus.

The definition of the Choroid plexus carcinoma is that Intraventricular papillary neoplasm derived from choroid plexus epithelium. Plexus tumors are most common in the lateral and fourth ventricles; while 80% of lateral ventricle tumors present in children, fourth ventricle tumors are evenly distributed in all age groups. Clinically, choroid plexus tumors tend to cause hydrocephalus and increased intracranial pressure. Histologically, choroid plexus papillomas correspond to WHO grade I, choroid plexus carcinomas to WHO grade III.

The definition of the Endolymphatic sac tumor is that A low-grade papillary epithelial neoplasm (adenocarcinoma) with a slow growth pattern. The endolymphatic duct emerges from the posterior wall of the saccule (of the inner ear) and ends in a blind pouch, the endolymphatic sac. Endolymphatic sac tumors (ELSTs) are known under different names in the literature (Heffner tumor, aggressive papillary middle ear tumor, and low-grade adenocarcinoma of endolymphatic sac origin). [PMID:24966979]
The definition of the Fallopian tube carcinoma is that Carcinoma that originates in the Fallopian tube. It may be located in the wall or within the lumen as a growth attached to the wall by a stalk.

The definition of the Abnormal platelet granule secretion is that Platelets are replete with secretory granules, which are critical to normal platelet function. Among the three types of platelet secretory granules - alpha-granules, dense granules, and lysosomes - the alpha-granule is the most abundant. Granule contents must be released from their intracellular repository in order to achieve their physiologic function, and this term refers to a functional defect in granule secretion.
The definition of the Abnormal platelet dense granule secretion is that Abnormal release of dense granules from platelets.
The definition of the Abnormal platelet ATP dense granule secretion is that Abnormal secretion of the platelet dense-granule content adenosine triphosphate (ATP). []
The definition of the Abnormal platelet alpha granule secretion is that Abnormal release of alpha granule contents from platelets.
The definition of the Abnormal platelet lysosome secretion is that Abnormal release of lysosome contents from platelets.
The definition of the Abnormal platelet dense granule ATP/ADP ratio is that Deviation from normal of the ratio of adenosine triphosphate (ATP) to adenosine diphosphate (ADP) within platelets.

The definition of the Abnormal platelet aggregation is that An abnormality in the rate and degree to which platelets aggregate after the addition of an agonist that stimulates platelet clumping.
