Platelet aggregation is measured using aggregometer to measure the optical density of platelet-rich plasma, whereby platelet aggregation causes the plasma to become more transparent.

The definition of the Spontaneous platelet aggregation is that Clumping together of platelets in the blood in a platelet aggregation test without addition of agents normally used to induce aggregation.
The definition of the Glucagonoma is that An endocrine tumor of the pancreas that secretes excessive amounts of glucagon.
The definition of the Pancreatic endocrine tumor is that A neuroendocrine tumor originating in a hormone-producing cell (islet cell) of the pancreas.

The definition of the Primary peritoneal carcinoma is that A type of cancer that originates in the peritoneum. It is to be distinguished from metastatic cancer of the peritoneum. Peritoneal cancer can occur anywhere in the abdominal space, and affects the surface of organs contained inside the peritoneum.
The definition of the Pineocytoma is that A type of pineal parenchymal cell neoplasm that is a mature well-differentiated tumor (WHO grade I). []

The definition of the Pineoblastoma is that Pineoblastoma is a rare primitive neuroectodermal tumor (PNET) arising in the pineal gland. Pineoblastomas are classified as a WHO grade IV tumor and comprise one-fourth to one-half of pineal parenchymal tumors. Pineoblastoma is a highly cellular tumor originating in the pineal gland and containing small, poorly differentiated cells.

The definition of the Renal transitional cell carcinoma is that A malignant tumor that arises from the transitional (urothelial) epithelial cells lining the urinary tract from the renal calyces to the ureteral orifice.
The definition of the Sebaceous gland carcinoma is that A carcinoma that arises in a sebaseous gland (an exocrine gland of the skin that secretes sebum, a waxy substance)
The definition of the Jejunal adenocarcinoma is that A malignant epithelial tumor with a glandular organization that originates in the jejunum.
The definition of the Ileal adenocarcinoma is that A malignant epithelial tumor with a glandular organization that originates in the ileum.
The definition of the Squamous cell carcinoma of the tongue is that A carcinoma derived from a squamous epithelial cell of the tongue.
The definition of the Verrucous cell carcinoma of the tongue is that A low-grade variant of squamous cell carcinoma of the tongue with a warty (verrucous) appearance. []

The definition of the Sarcomatoid carcinoma of the tongue is that Sarcomatoid (spindle cell) carcinomas of the tongue is a variant of squamous carcinoma of tongue that is monoclonal, having evolved from a conventional squamous carcinoma with dedifferentiation associated with sarcomatoid transformation.
The definition of the Vulvar neoplasm is that A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the female external genital tract (vulva).
The definition of the Squamous cell carcinoma of the vulva is that A cancer that originates in the squamous cells that line the surface of the vulva.
The definition of the Vulvar melanoma is that A type of vulvar cancer that originates from melanocytes of the vulva.
The definition of the Bartholin gland carcinoma is that A cancer arising in a cell of the Bartholin gland, a racemose gland located slightly posterior to the opening of the vagina.
The definition of the Vulvar adenocarcinoma is that An adenocarcinoma arising in the vulva.
The definition of the Epididymal neoplasm is that A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the epididymis, an duct that transports spermatozoa from the testis to the vas deferens.
The definition of the Splenic cyst is that A closed sac located in the spleen.
The definition of the Epididymal cyst is that A smooth, extratesticular, spherical cyst in the head of the epididymis.
The definition of the Calcified ovarian cyst is that A cyst of the ovary that exhibits deposition of calcium salts.
The definition of the Ossifying fibroma is that A benign central bone tumor composed of fibrous connective tissue within which bone is formed.
The definition of the Ossifying fibroma of the jaw is that A benign central bone tumor of the jaw composed of fibrous connective tissue within which bone is formed.
The definition of the Cutaneous myxoma is that A myxoma originating in the skin.

The definition of the Juvenile nasopharyngeal angiofibroma is that A benign but highly vascular nasopharyngeal neoplasm. The tumor originates from the sphenopalatine foramen and involves both the pterygopalatine fossa and the posterior nasal cavity.
The definition of the Neuroma is that A tumor made up of nerve cells and nerve fibers.
The definition of the Chondroblastoma is that A usually benign tumor composed of cells which arise from chondroblasts or their precursors and which tend to differentiate into cartilage cells.

The definition of the Osteoid osteoma is that A bening tumor of bone composed of a central zone named nidus which is an atypical bone completely enclosed within a well vascularized stroma and a peripheral sclerotic reaction zone.

The definition of the Pilomatrixoma is that Pilomatricoma is an asymptomatic slowly growing benign cutaneous tumor, differentiating towards the hair matrix of the hair follicle. It is covered by normal or hyperemic skin, and usually varies in size from 0.5 to 3 cm.

The definition of the Fibrofolliculoma is that Fibrofolliculoma is a clinically asymptomatic, 2-4 mm, skin-colored, dome-shaped smooth papule. It usually arises in the form of multiple lesions in adults in different areas such as the scalp, forehead, face, and neck. According to histology, the lesion is a fibrotic hamartoma characterized by infundibular epithelial proliferation and perifollicular fibrous proliferation.
The definition of the Anal canal squamous cell carcinoma is that A squamous cell carcinoma that originates in the anal canal.
The definition of the Anal canal adenocarcinoma is that An adenoma carcinoma that originates in the anal canal.
The definition of the Anal margin neoplasm is that A tumor of the anal margin.

The definition of the Anal margin Paget's disease is that An intraepithelial adenocarcinoma originating in the anal margin and characterized by presence of typical Paget's cells, appearing as large rounded vacuolated cells.
The definition of the Anal margin squamous cell carcinoma is that A squamous cell carcinoma that originates in the skin of the anal margin.
The definition of the Anal margin basal cell carcinoma is that A basal cell carcinoma that originates in the anal margin.
The definition of the Anal margin melanoma is that A melanoma that originates in the anal margin.

The definition of the Pulmonary carcinoid tumor is that A malignant neuroendocrine tumor of the lung. According to histopathologic criteria (WHO 2004), carcinoids are divided into four groups i.e. typical and atypical carcinoids, large cell neuroendocrine carcinoma and small cell lung carcinoma.

The definition of the Merkel cell skin cancer is that A malignant cutaneous tumor of the elderly that is characterized by an aggressive course with regional nodal involvement, distant metastases and a high rate of recurrence. Most patients present with rapidly growing, painless, firm, non-tender, dome-shaped red, occasionally ulcerated skin nodules, which have a red or bluish color, measuring up to several centimeters, on predominantly sun-exposed areas of the body. The overlying skin is smooth and shiny, sometimes exhibiting ulcerative, acneiform or telangiectatic features.

The definition of the Soft tissue sarcoma is that A type of sarcoma (A connective tissue neoplasm formed by proliferation of mesodermal cells) that develops from soft tissues like fat, muscle, nerves, fibrous tissues, blood vessels, or deep skin tissues.
The definition of the Neuroplasm of the autonomic nervous system is that A tumor that arises from an element of the autonomic nervous system. []
The definition of the Mesenteric cyst is that A closed fluid filled sac originating from the mesentary.
The definition of the Chylolymphatic mesenteric cyst is that A type of mesenteric cyst that is lined with a thin endothelium or mesothelium and filled with chylous and lymphatic fluid.

The definition of the Abnormal electrooculogram is that The clinical electro-oculogram (EOG) is an electrophysiological test of function of the outer retina and retinal pigment epithelium (RPE) in which changes in electrical potential across the RPE are recorded during successive periods of dark and light adaptation. [PMID:21298321]

The definition of the Undetectable light-adapted electroretinogram is that No detectable response to the light-adapted 3.0 ERG (single-flash cone response). This type of ERG measures responses of the cone system; a-waves arise from cone photoreceptors and cone off-bipolar cells; the b-wave comes from On- and Off-cone bipolar cells. [PMID:25502644]

The definition of the Abnormal pattern electroretinogram is that An anomalous response to a pattern electroretinogram (PERG), a particular kind of ERG obtained in response to contrast modulation of patterned visual stimuli at constant mean luminance-typically contrast-reversing gratings or checkerboards-whose characteristics are fundamentally different from those of the traditional ERG in response to diffuse flashes of light.
The definition of the Reduced amplitude of dark-adapted bright flash electroretinogram a-wave is that An abnormal reduction in the amplitude of the a-wave. []
The definition of the Choriocapillaris atrophy is that Atrophy of the capillary lamina of choroid.
The definition of the Abnormality of foveal pigmentation is that An anomaly of the pigmentation in the fovea centralis. []
The definition of the Macular microaneurysm/hemorrhage is that Small, red dots in the superficial retinal layers (it is difficult to distinguish between small hemorrhages and microaneurysms). []
The definition of the Abnormality of macular vasculature is that Any structural anomaly of the blood vessels of the macula. []

The definition of the Macular exudation is that Yellow-white intraretinal deposits in the macula typically associated with damaged outer blood-retina barrier and exudation of serous fluid and lipids from the retinal microvasculature.

The definition of the Macular cotton wool spots is that Fluffy white patch on the macula, representing localized areas of dense white swelling of the retinal nerve fibre layer. They often have a zigzag internal structure, a feathered edge but an otherwise well-delineated form and an approximately 1 mm dimension; they project slightly into the vitreous and sometimes deflect retinal vessels. [PMID:6169833]
The definition of the Macular thickening is that Abnormal increase in retinal thickness in the macular area observed on fundoscopy or fundus imaging.

The definition of the Macular drusen is that Drusen (singular, 'druse') are tiny yellow or white accumulations of extracellular material (lipofuscin) that build up in Bruch's membrane of the eye. This class refers to the presence of Drusen in the macula.
The definition of the Macular crystals is that Crystalline deposits in the macula. []
The definition of the Retinoschisis is that Splitting of the neuroretinal layers of the retina.
The definition of the Bradyopsia is that Difficulty in seeing moving objects. [PMID:25770143]

The definition of the Peripheral visual field constriction with >50 degrees central field preserved is that A diminution of the peripheral visual field whereby at least 50 degrees of central field are preserved in all meridians.

The definition of the Peripheral visual field constriction with 20-30 degrees central field preserved is that Peripheral visual field constriction with 20-49 degrees binocular visual field preserved. []
The definition of the Peripheral visual field constriction with 10-20 degrees central field preserved is that Peripheral visual field constriction with 10-19 degrees central field preserved. []
The definition of the Peripheral visual field constriction with <10 degrees central field preserved is that Peripheral visual field constriction with <10 degrees central field preserved. []
The definition of the Ring scotoma is that An annular field defect centered on fixation. [PMID:30581310]

The definition of the Abnormal visual field test is that Abnormal result of a test designed to test an individual's central and peripheral vision by determining the ability of the individual to perceive objects at differing locations of the visual field. []

The definition of the Abnormal Estermann grid perimetry test is that The Esterman grid test assays scores visual acuity. The grid consists of 100 units whose unequal size and distribution reflect the unequal functional value of different parts of the field-in effect a weighted or relative-value scale. Because each unit equals 1 percent, a simple count of units yields the functional score in percent. [PMID:5694282]

The definition of the Abnormal fundus autofluorescence imaging is that Fundus autofluorescence (FAF) is a non-invasive retinal imaging modality used in clinical practice to provide a density map of lipofuscin, the predominant ocular fluorophore, in the retinal pigment epithelium. Autofluorescent patterns result from the complex interaction of fluorophores such a lipofuscin, which release an autofluorescent signal, and elements such as melanin and rhodopsin, which absorb the excitation beam and attenuate autofluorescence. Other structures such as retinal vessels and the crystalline lens may also influence autofluorescence through blocking and interference. [PMID:27847630]

The definition of the Abnormal fundus fluorescein angiography is that An abnormality observed by retinal fluorescein angiography, which involves the intravenous injection of fluorescein dye followed by fluorescent imaging of the fundus immediately after injection and for up to ten minutes thereafter. It can be used to study various retinal abnormalities including especially anomalies of the choroidal and retinal circulation. []
The definition of the Photoreceptor layer loss on macular OCT is that Loss of the outer nuclear layer (photoreceptor layer) as assessed by ocular coherence tomography.
The definition of the Hyperautofluorescent macular lesions is that Increased amount of autofluorescence in the macula as ascertained by fundus autofluorescence imaging. [PMID:27847630]
The definition of the Hypoautofluorescent macular lesions is that Decreased amount of autofluorescence in the macula as ascertained by fundus autofluorescence imaging. [PMID:27847630]

The definition of the Occult macular dystrophy is that Occult macular dystrophy is a, typically hereditary, abnormality of the macula associated with progressive foveal cone dysfunction and no apparent fundoscopic, full-field electroretinogram (ERG), or fluorescein angiogram abnormalities.

The definition of the Cone dysfunction is that Retinal phenotype characterised by cone photoreceptor dysfunction and preserved rod system. The abnormality is typically stationary or very slowly progressive and findings may include reduced central vision, colour vision abnormalities, nystagmus and photophobia.
The definition of the Complete congenital stationary night blindness is that A nonprogressive (i.e., stationary) form of difficulties with night blindness with congenital onset.
The definition of the Vitreous haze is that Vitreous haze is the obscuration of fundus details by vitreous cells and protein exudation.
The definition of the Vitreous snowballs is that Yellow-white inflammatory aggregates in the vitreous that are found in the midvitreous and inferior periphery. [PMID:20029143]
The definition of the Vitreous inflammatory cells is that The presence of inflammatory cells such as lymphocytes and macrophages in the vitreous. []

The definition of the Optically empty vitreous is that Vestigial vitreous gel occupying the immediate retrolental space and minimal to no discernable gel in the central vitreous cavity, giving the appearance of an empty vitreous cavity. [PMID:15557460, PMID:7867814]

The definition of the Beevor's sign is that Weakness of the inferior portion of the rectus abdominal muscle, which is ascertained clinically as follows. When a patient sits up or raises the head from a recumbent position, the umbilicus is displaced toward the head. This is the result of paralysis of the inferior portion of the rectus abdominal muscle, so that the upper fibres predominate pulling upwards the umbilicus. [PMID:2146943]

The definition of the Rubral tremor is that Rubral tremor is characterized by a slow coarse tremor at rest that is exacerbated by postural adjustments and by guided voluntary movements. [PMID:6568936]

The definition of the Retinal neovascularization is that In wound repair, neovascularization (NV) involves the sprouting of new vessels from pre-existent vessels to repair or replace damaged vessels. In the retina, NV is a response to ischemia. The NV adheres to the inner surface of the retina and outer surface of the vitreous. NV are deficient in tight junctions and hence leak plasma into surrounding tissue including the vitreous. Plasma causes the vitreous gel to degenerate, contract, and eventually collapse which pulls on the retina. Since retinal NV is adherent to both retina and vitreous, as the vitreous contracts the NV may be sheared resulting in vitreous hemorrhage or the NV may remain intact and pull the retina with the vitreous resulting in retinal elevation referred to as traction retinal detachment. [PMID:23329331]
The definition of the Peripheral retinal neovascularization is that A type of retinal neovascularization that affects the periphery of the retina.

The definition of the Periorbital dermoid cyst is that A cyst that is localized in the region of the orbit and exhibits an epithelial lining with a keratin-filled lumen. Hair follicles are one of the adnexal structures that are commonly found in walls of dermoid cysts. []

The definition of the Abnormal morphology of the ocular adnexa is that A structural anomaly of the adjacent structures (i.e., adnexa) of the eye, defined as the lacrimal apparatus, the extraocular muscles and the eyelids, eyelashes, eyebrows and the conjunctiva. []
The definition of the Hamartoma of the orbital region is that A hamartoma (disordered proliferation of mature tissues) which can originate from any tissue of the orbital region. []

The definition of the Abnormality of the common tendinous ring is that Any anomaly of the ring of fibrous tissue that surrounds the optic nerve at its entrance at the apex of the orbit. The common tendinous ring, also known as the annulus of Zinn or annular tendon, is the origin for five of the seven extraocular muscles.
The definition of the Asteroid hyalosis is that The presence of small, white vitreous opacities consisting of calcium phosphate and complex, layered lipid deposits. []

The definition of the Erosive vitreoretinopathy is that A form of vitreoretinopathy characterized by thinning (erosion) of the retinal pigment epithelium that permits increased visualization of the choroidal vessels. [PMID:8152765]

The definition of the Contracture of proximal interphalangeal joints of 2nd-5th fingers is that Chronic loss of joint motion of the proximal interphalangeal joint of the 2nd, 3rd, 4th, and 5th fingers due to structural changes in non-bony tissue. []
The definition of the Satyr ear is that Sharp pointed superior portion of the ear, with variable overfolding of the helix. [PMID:19152421]

The definition of the Mozart ear is that A congenital auricular deformity, which is mainly characterized by a bulging appearance of the anterosuperior portion of the auricle, a convexly protruded cavum conchae, and a slit-like narrowing of the orifice of the external auditory meatus. [PMID:21587051]
The definition of the Ash-leaf spot is that A hypopigmented spot in the shape of a leaf from the mountain ash tree.
The definition of the Abnormality of cardiovascular system morphology is that Any structural anomaly of the heart and great vessels. []

The definition of the Abnormal morphology of myocardial trabeculae is that Any structural anomaly of the muscular columns which project from the inner surface of the right and left ventricles of the heart (cardiac trabeculae, trabeculae carneae). []

The definition of the Left ventricular noncompaction is that Left ventricular noncompaction (LVNC) is defined by 3 markers: prominent left ventricular (LV) trabeculae, deep intertrabecular recesses, and the thin compacted layer. [PMID:16670098, PMID:25443708]

The definition of the Vaginitis is that Inflammation of the vagina that can result from a spectrum of conditions that cause vaginal and sometimes vulvar symptoms, such as itching, burning, irritation, odor, and vaginal discharge. []

The definition of the Abnormal adiponectin level is that A deviation from the normal circulating concentration of adiponectin, a 30-kDa complement C1-related protein that is the most abundant secreted protein expressed in adipose tissue, and that plays a crucial role in the regulation of insulin sensitivity and glucose metabolism.

The definition of the Decreased adiponectin level is that A reduced circulating concentration of adiponectin, a 30-kDa complement C1-related protein that is the most abundant secreted protein expressed in adipose tissue.

The definition of the Increased adiponectin level is that An elevated circulating concentration of adiponectin, a 30-kDa complement C1-related protein that is the most abundant secreted protein expressed in adipose tissue. []
The definition of the Abnormal glucagon level is that A deviation from the normal concentration of glucagon in the blood circulation.
The definition of the Increased glucagon level is that An elevated concentration of glucagon in the blood circulation. []
The definition of the Decreased glucagon level is that A reduced concentration of glucagon in the blood circulation. []
The definition of the Gingival cleft is that A fissure in the gingiva (gums), i.e., the mucosal tissue that lies over the mandible and maxilla. []
The definition of the Divergence nystagmus is that A condition in which both eyes beat outward simultaneously. []
The definition of the Brain neoplasm is that A benign or malignant neoplasm that arises from or metastasizes to the brain. []
The definition of the Supratentorial neoplasm is that A benign or malignant neoplasm that occurs within the intracranial cavity above the tentorium cerebelli. []

The definition of the Ranula is that A ranula is a mucocele that occurs in the floor of the mouth and usually involve the major salivary glands. Specifically, the ranula originates in the body of the sublingual gland, in the ducts of the sublingual gland, in the Wharton's duct of the submandibular gland or infrequently from the minor salivary glands at this location.
The definition of the Unilateral lung agenesis is that Lack of development of one lung. []
The definition of the Myeloschisis is that The severe form of a neural tube defect where the open neural tube appears as a flattened, plate-like mass of nervous tissue with no overlying membrane.

The definition of the Myelocystocele is that Myelocystocele is characterized by a large, ependyma-lined, cystic dilation of the caudal end of the central canal of the spinal cord; it projects dorsally through a lamina defect, with overlying varying amounts of lipomatous subcutaneous tissue. Myelocystoceles are associated with a tethered cord and meningocele, which communicates with the spinal subarachnoid space, but not with the central canal cyst.

The definition of the Lipomeningocele is that A form of closed neural tube defect in which the spinal tissue lies within the spinal cord having a junction between the spinal cord and the lipoma. Intact skin covers the defect. Neurologic findings first appear during the second year of life.
The definition of the Hydrocolpos is that Distention of the vagina caused by accumulation of fluid due to congenital vaginal obstruction.
The definition of the Uterine synechiae is that Adhesions or scar tissue that form inside the cavity of the uterus.

The definition of the Vein of Galen aneurysmal malformation is that Vein of Galen aneurysmal malformation is a choroidal type of arteriovenous malformation that develops between 6 and 11 weeks of gestation. It results from 1 or more arteriovenous fistulas shunting blood toward the prosencephalic vein of Markowski, the embryonic precursor of the vein of Galen. This abnormal shunt leads to progressive dilation of the vein and prevents its involution and subsequent development into the vein of Galen.

The definition of the Bronchial atresia is that A developmental anomaly characterised by focal obliteration of the proximal segment of a bronchus. The bronchial pattern is entirely normal distal to the site of stenosis.
The definition of the Acrania is that Partial or complete absence of the flat bones of the cranial vault. The condition is frequently, though not always, associated with anencephaly.

The definition of the Meconium peritonitis is that Peritonitis caused by intrauterine intestinal rupture and spillage of fetal meconium into the fetal peritoneal cavity. Intra-peritoneal meconium usually calcifies, sometimes within 24 hours. Ultrasound findings may include intraabdominal calcifications.
The definition of the Right atrial enlargement is that Increase in size of the right atrium.

The definition of the Unguarded tricuspid valve is that A form of agenesis of the tricuspid valve in which (although the normal orifice between the right atrium and right ventricle exists) there is no tricuspid valvular tissue.
The definition of the Tetraphocomelia is that Phocomelia involving all four extremities.

The definition of the Ectopic liver is that Ectopic liver is a rare developmental anomaly in which liver tissue is situated outside the liver. Thus, ectopic liver refers to autonomous islands of normal liver parenchyma located outside the liver. The term ectopic liver is also used, to include liver appendices attached to the native liver by a thin stalk although being fully separated from the latter.
The definition of the Congenital megalourethra is that Dilation and elongation of the penile urethra associated with absence or hypoplasia of the corpora spongiosa and cavernosa.
The definition of the Central nervous system cyst is that A fluid-filled sac (cyst) located within the central nervous system.

The definition of the Neurenteric cyst is that The neurenteric cyst is a rare lesion composed of heterotopic endodermal tissue. During the third week of human embryogenesis, the neurenteric canal unites the yolk sac and the amniotic cavity as it traverses the primitive notochordal plate. Persistence of the normally transient neurenteric canal prevents appropriate separation of endoderm and notochord. This results in a variable degree of communication between neural and enteric epithelium.
The definition of the Spinal neurenteric cyst is that A neurenteric cyst located in the spine.
The definition of the Intracranial neurenteric cyst is that A neurenteric cyst located within the skull.

The definition of the Meromelia is that Partial absence of a free limb (excluding girdle). It can refer to the proximal, middle or distal segment of the upper or lower limb. The deficiency may be transverse or longitudinal. Thus, meromelia is a lack of a part, but not all, of one or more limbs with the presence of a hand or foot.
The definition of the Frontoethmoidal meningocele is that A herniation of meninges through a congenital bone defect in the skull at the junction of the frontal and ethmoidal bones.
The definition of the Parietal meningocele is that A herniation of meninges through a congenital bone defect in the skull in the parietal region.

The definition of the Carcinoma is that A malignant tumor arising from epithelial cells. Carcinomas that arise from glandular epithelium are called adenocarcinomas, those that arise from squamous epithelium are called squamous cell carcinomas, and those that arise from transitional epithelium are called transitional cell carcinomas (NCI Thesaurus).
The definition of the Dysplastic tricuspid valve is that A congenital malformation of the tricuspid valve characterized by leaflet deformation.

The definition of the Vesicoallantoic abdominal wall defect is that An abdominal wall defected related to a developmental anomaly of the allantois, which is an embryonic structure that develops as a diverticulum off the yolk sac at about 16 days post fertilization. During further development, the allantois becomes incorporated into the body of the embryo, connecting the ventral aspect of the urogenital sinus (which will develop into the upper pole of the urinary bladder) to the external portion of the umbilicus. Upon further development, the lumen of the allantois becomes obliterated and forms a thick fibrous cord called the urachus, which connects the apex of the bladder to the umbilicus. In adults, the urachus is known as the median umbilical ligament. Failure of the allantoic cavity to obliterate can result of one of four conditions: 1) congenital patent urachus (a completely open connection between bladder and umbilicus); 2) vesicourachal diverticulum (a diverticulum off the bladder but not communicating with the umbilicus); umbilical cyst and sinus (not communicating with the bladder); and 4) alternating urachal sinus. An abdominal wall defect can be associated with a urachal cyst.

The definition of the Ureterovesical junction obstruction is that Blockage at the level of the bladder and the ureter caused by stenosis of the ureteral valves or failure of a narrow juxtavesical ureteral segment to dilate due to segmented fibrosis or localized absence of muscle.
The definition of the Sacrococcygeal teratoma is that A teratoma arising in the sacro-coccygeal region.

The definition of the Altman type I sacrococcygeal teratoma is that A type of sacrococcygeal teratoma that is predominantly external and projects from the sacrococcygeal region and presents with distortion of the buttocks.
The definition of the Altman type II sacrococcygeal teratoma is that A type of sacrococcygeal teratoma that is predominantly external but has a large intrapelvic component.
The definition of the Altman type III sacrococcygeal teratoma is that A type of sacrococcygeal teratoma that is predominantly intrapelvic with a small external, buttock mass.

The definition of the Anomalous muscle bundle of the right ventricle is that An accessory (not normally present) muscle bundle in the right ventricle which obstructs the right ventricular outflow tract.

The definition of the Mediastinal teratoma is that A teratoma located within the mediastinum (the cavity between the pleural sacs that contains the heart and all of the thoracic viscera except the lungs).

The definition of the Glial remnants posterior to lens is that This anomaly, also known as Mittendorf dot, is a benign, nonprogressive recognizable lesion that does not cause visual impairment. However, it can resemble a pathological congenital or acquired cataract lesion which may enlarge and cause visual impairment. The dot appears as a black speck that ranges in size from the dot made by a sharp pencil point to the size of a poppy seed. It is usually well defined, although occasionally there may be irregular, fine lines radiating outward from the dot. []
The definition of the Glial remnants anterior to the optic disc is that Persistance of a posterior remnant of the hyaloid artery located at the optic disc.
The definition of the Hyaloid vascular remnant and retrolental mass is that A type of persistance of the hyaloid vascular system associated with a retrolental mass that may lead to fetal cataract.

The definition of the Ductus arteriosus aneurysm is that Ductus arteriosus aneurysm (DAA) is a saccular dilatation of the ductus arteriosus. DAA can be either congenital or acquired (e.g. as a complication of surgical closure of a patent ductus arteriosus). Although the majority of patients with congenital DAA are asymptomatic and have a benign course, severe complications, such as rupture or thromboembolism, can occur. DAA is likely to emerge in the third trimester from the aortic junction of the DA, extending towards its pulmonary end.
The definition of the Intraventricular hemorrhage is that Bleeding into the ventricles of the brain.
The definition of the Preterm intraventricular hemorrhage is that Intraventricular hemorrhage that occurs in a premature infant.

The definition of the Grade I preterm intraventricular hemorrhage is that Intraventricular hemorrhage that occurs in a preterm infant and that is restricted to subependymal region/germline matrix which is seen in the caudothalamic groove.

The definition of the Grade II preterm intraventricular hemorrhage is that Intraventricular hemorrhage that occurs in a preterm infant and that has extension into normal-sized ventricles and typically fills less than 50% of the volume of the ventricle.
The definition of the Grade III preterm intraventricular hemorrhage is that Intraventricular hemorrhage that occurs in a preterm infant and that has extension into dilated ventricles.
The definition of the Grade IV preterm intraventricular hemorrhage is that Intraventricular hemorrhage that occurs in a preterm infant and that shows parenchymal extension.

The definition of the Dacryocystocele is that A nasolacrimal duct obstruction presenting as a grey-blue cystic swelling just below the medial canthus. Believed to be a result of concomitant upper obstruction of the Rosenmuller valve and lower obstruction of the Hasner valve.

The definition of the Allantoic cyst is that A swelling formed at the base of umbilicus associated with a patent urachus which results from an allantoic remnant. The urachus is a fibrous remnant of the allantois which communicates from the apex of the urinary bladder to the umbilicus. Failed obliteration of the urachus can lead to various abnormalities: urachal cyst, urachal diverticulum, sinus or patent urachus - the most common type. Allantoic cysts in infants with patent urachus can be formed due to the drainage of urine into the umbilical cord, or in uncommon situations, after leakage of hypo-osmotic urine into the Wharton's jelly.
The definition of the Craniofacial teratoma is that A teratoma located in the craniofacial region.
The definition of the Erythrodontia is that Reddish, brown opalescent discoloration of teeth in normal light. [PMID:21731282]
The definition of the Tooth abscess is that A pocket of pus located within a region of a tooth.
The definition of the Periapical tooth abscess is that A tooth abscess that occurs at the tip of the root (apex) of a tooth. []

The definition of the Adipocyte hypertrophy is that An increase in mean adipocyte cell size. This feature can be measured by determining the average cell diameter of adipocytes microscopically using abdominal subcutaneous adipose tissue obtained by biopsy.
The definition of the Renal fibrosis is that Renal fibrosis is the consequence of an excessive accumulation of extracellular matrix that occurs in virtually every type of chronic kidney disease.
The definition of the Mesangiolysis is that Partial or complete dissolution of the mesangial matrix, identified by reduced staining on a periodic acid-Schiff (PAS) or silver stain.

The definition of the Ochronosis is that Brown or blue-gray discoloration of the skin that can present on the axillary and inguinal areas, face, palms or soles. In addition, blue-black discoloration can be apparent on skin overlying cartilage in which the pigment is deposited, such as the ears. This is a characteristic manifestation of alkaptonuria, which is an autosomal recessively inherited deficiency of homogentisic acid oxidase that results in accumulation of homogentisic acid in collagenous structures. The sclerae are also typically involved.
The definition of the Sleep terror is that Episodes of intense fear, screaming, and flailing occur even though the affected individuals are still asleep. [PMID:31612833]
The definition of the Epignathus is that Epignathus is a teratoma originating from the upper jaw, usually connected with the sphenoid bone or hard palate.
The definition of the Exencephaly is that A malformation of the neural tube with a large amount of protruding brain tissue and absence of calvarium.
The definition of the Craniorachischisis is that A neural tube defect in which both the brain and spinal cord remain open to varying degrees.

The definition of the Mallet finger is that Mallet finger refers to a condition in which the end joint of a finger bends but will not straighten by itself. In this situation, the joint can be pushed straight but will not hold that position on its own.

The definition of the Proximal femoral focal deficiency is that Proximal femoral focal deficiency is a deformity manifested by hypoplasia of a variable portion of the femur with shortening of the entire limb.

The definition of the Internuclear ophthalmoplegia is that An abnormality of conjugate lateral gaze in which the affected eye shows impairment of adduction. The pathognomonic clinical sign of internuclear ophthalmoplegia is an impaired adduction while testing horizontal saccades on the side of the lesion in the ipsilateral medial longitudinal fascicule.

The definition of the Modic type vertebral endplate changes is that An abnormal magnetic resonance tomography signal from a vertebral endplate according to a widely used classification published by Dr. Michael Modic.

The definition of the Modic type I vertebral endplate changes is that An abnormal magnetic resonance tomography signal from a vertebral endplate with a low signal on T1-weighted sequences and high signal on T2-weighted sequences. Modic type I changes are thought to represent bone marrow edema and inflammation.

The definition of the Modic type II vertebral endplate changes is that An abnormal magnetic resonance tomography signal from a vertebral endplate with a high signal on T1-weighted sequences and high- or isointense signal on T2 sequences. Modic type II signals are thought to indicate fatty replacement in the bone marrow.

The definition of the Modic type III vertebral endplate changes is that An abnormal magnetic resonance tomography signal from a vertebral endplate with a low signal on T1 and T2-weighted sequences. Modic type III signals are thought to correspond to subchondral sclerosis seen on plain radiographs.

The definition of the Ethmocephaly is that Ethmocephaly is the rarest form of holoprosencephaly, which occurs due to an incomplete cleavage of the forebrain. Clinically, the disease presents with a proboscis, hypotelorism, microphthalmos and malformed ears.

The definition of the Abnormality of the protein C anticoagulant pathway is that An anomaly of the protein C anticoagulant pathway, which serves as a major system for controlling thrombosis, limiting inflammatory responses, and potentially decreasing endothelial cell apoptosis in response to inflammatory cytokines and ischemia. A natural anticoagulant system denoted the protein C pathway exerts its anticoagulant effect by regulating the activity of FVIIIa and FVa. The vitamin K-dependent protein C is the key component of the pathway. Activated protein C (APC) cleaves and inhibits coagulation cofactors FVIIIa and FVa, which result in downregulation of the activity of the coagulation system. The endothelial protein C receptor stimulates the T-TM-mediated activation of protein C on the endothelial cell surface. The two cofactors, protein S and the intact form of FV, enhance the anticoagulant activity of APC.
The definition of the Abnormal serum interleukin level is that An abnormal amount of any of the interleukins, a class of cytokines, in the circulation.
The definition of the Increased serum interleukin-6 is that An increased concentration of interleukin-6 in the blood circulation.
The definition of the Anomia is that An inability to name people and objects that are correctly perceived. The individual is able to describe the object in question, but cannot provide the name.

The definition of the Mediastinal cystic lymphangioma is that A lymphangioma (congenital malformation consisting of focal proliferations of well-differentiated lymphatic tissue in multi cystic or sponge like structures) located within the mediastinum, i.e., the central compartment of the thoracic cavity that is surrounded by loose connective tissue. Mediastinal lymphangioma is a slow growing mass with benign features, and accounts for 1% of all mediastinal tumors.
The definition of the Photopsia is that Perceived flashes of light.
The definition of the Cerumen abnormality is that Any anomaly of the cerumen (ear wax), the yellowish waxy substance secreted in the ear canal.
The definition of the Impacted cerumen is that Blockage of the external auditory canal by a buildup of earwax.
The definition of the Excessive cerumen is that An increased quantity of earwax. [PMID:probinson]
The definition of the Abnormal cerumen color is that An anomolous earwax color. Earwax (cerumen) is usually light to dark brown or orange in color.
The definition of the Abnormal jaw morphology is that A structural anomaly of the jaw, the bony structure of the mouth that consists of the mandible and the maxilla.
The definition of the Jaw neoplasm is that A tumor originating in the jaw (mandible or maxilla).
The definition of the Jaw swelling is that Abnormal enlargement in the upper jaw (maxilla) or in the lower jaw (mandible).
The definition of the Reduced volume of central subdivision of bed nucleus of stria terminalis is that A diminished volume of the central part of the bed nucleus of the stria terminalis.

The definition of the Abnormality of the bed nucleus of stria terminalis is that The stria terminalis is a slender, compact fiber bundle that connects the amygdala (amygdaloid body) with the hypothalamus and other basal forebrain regions. The bed nucleus of the stria terminalis is a limbic forebrain structure that receives heavy projections from, among other areas, the basolateral amygdala, and projects in turn to hypothalamic and brainstem target areas that mediate many of the autonomic and behavioral responses to aversive or threatening stimuli. This term refers to an anomaly of the bed nucleus.

The definition of the Scaphocephaly is that Scaphocephaly is a subtype of dolichocephaly where the anterior and posterior aspects of the cranial vault are pointed (boat-shaped). Scaphocephaly is caused by a precocious fusion of sagittal suture without other associated synostosis.

The definition of the Abnormal visual accommodation is that An anomaly in the process of visual accommodation, which is the process of adjustment of the eye to enable sharp vision of objects at different distances. Accommodation is mediated by contraction of the ciliary muscles, which alter the convexity of the lens and, consequently, its refractive power.
The definition of the Reduced visual accommodation is that A decreased ability of the eye to adjust and thereby enable sharp vision of objects at different distances.
The definition of the Lower eyelid retraction is that Inferior malposition of the lower eyelid margin without eyelid eversion.
The definition of the Platonychia is that Abnormal flat nail.

The definition of the Trachyonychia is that Excessive longitudinal ridging that gives the surface of the nail plate a rough appearance. It results from multiple foci of defective keratinization of the proximal nail matrix.
The definition of the Absent lunula is that Lack of the lunula at the base of a nail. The lunula is the crescent-shaped whitish area of the bed of a fingernail or toenail.
The definition of the Fast-growing nails is that Nails whose growth is quicker than normal.
The definition of the Abnormal nail growth is that Nail whose growth pattern or speed deviates from normal.

The definition of the Ragged cuticle is that The cuticle (properly known as the eponychium, or the medial nail fold or the proximal nail fold), is the thickened layer of skin surrounding fingernails and toenails. Its function is to protect the area between the nail and epidermis from exposure to bacteria. This term refers to the presence of and irregular edge or outline of the cuticle.
The definition of the Abnormal tongue morphology is that Any structural anomaly of the tongue. []
The definition of the Abnormal tongue physiology is that Any functional anomaly of the tongue. []
The definition of the Tongue pain is that An unpleasant sensation characterized by physical discomfort (such as pricking, throbbing, or aching) localized to the tongue.
The definition of the Enlarged tonsils is that Increase in size of the tonsils, small collections of lymphoid tissue facing into the aerodigestive tract on either side of the back part of the throat.
The definition of the Absent tonsils is that Lack of observable tonsillar tissue.

The definition of the Orange discoloured tonsils is that A phenomenon of orange colored oral tonsils. This feature is characteristic of Tangier disease and illustrated will by Figure 1 of PMID:19470903.
The definition of the Lipoma of the tongue is that A lipoma localized to the tongue. May present as a nontender, soft, spherical mass of the tongue.

The definition of the Beaked nails is that Severe nail curvature, causing the tip of the nail to point downwards with respect to the axis of the finger. Beaked nails are caused by resorption of the distal digit.
The definition of the Central nail canal is that The presence of a depressed line (canal") in the center of the nail." []
The definition of the Ski jump nail is that Nails that slope upward at the free edge.
The definition of the Hooded eyelid is that Loss of elasticity of the upper and lower eyelids causing the skin to sag and bulge.
The definition of the Hooded lower eyelid is that Lower eyelid partly covered by skin when eyes are open. []
The definition of the Hooded upper eyelid is that Upper eyelid partly covered by skin when eyes are open. []
The definition of the Scleral thickening is that Increased dimension of the sclera in the anterior-posterior axis.

The definition of the Mizuo phenomenon is that Change in the color of the fundus from red in the dark-adapted state to golden immediately or shortly after the onset of the light. The color of the fundus reflex in the light adapted state has also been described as golden-yellow, gray-white, and yellow-white. This reflex can appear either homogeneous or in streaks in the fundus. The retinal vessels appear to be protruding in contrast to the radiant background. Dark adaptation leads to disappearance of the unusual fundus coloration [Digital Journal of Ophthalmology 2008; Volume 14, Number 14].

The definition of the Absent foveal reflex is that Lack of the foveal reflex, which normally occurs as a result of the reflection of light from the ophthalmoscope in the foveal pit upon examination. The foveal reflex is a bright pinpoint of light that is observed to move sideways or up and down in response to movement of the opthalmoscope.
The definition of the Eyelid fasciculation is that Tiny, repetitive muscle contractions in the eyelids, causing the appearance of twitching.
The definition of the Wheezing is that A high-pitched whistling sound associated with labored breathing.
The definition of the Abnormal breath sound is that An anomalous (adventitious) sound produced by the breathing process.

The definition of the Rales is that Crackles are discontinuous, explosive, and nonmusical adventitious lung sounds normally heard in inspiration and sometimes during expiration. Crackles are usually classified as fine and coarse crackles based on their duration, loudness, pitch, timing in the respiratory cycle, and relationship to coughing and changing body position.
The definition of the Rhonchi is that Abnormal breath sounds characterized by low-pitched, snoring or rattle-like sounds.
The definition of the Vitreous strands is that Fiber- or rope-like opacities located within the vitreous humor. []
The definition of the Neck pain is that An unpleasant sensation characterized by physical discomfort (such as pricking, throbbing, or aching) localized to the neck.
The definition of the Shoulder pain is that An unpleasant sensation characterized by physical discomfort (such as pricking, throbbing, or aching) localized to the shoulder.
The definition of the Elbow pain is that An unpleasant sensation characterized by physical discomfort (such as pricking, throbbing, or aching) localized to the elbow.
The definition of the Wrist pain is that An unpleasant sensation characterized by physical discomfort (such as pricking, throbbing, or aching) localized to the wrist.
The definition of the Finger pain is that An unpleasant sensation characterized by physical discomfort (such as pricking, throbbing, or aching) localized to the finger.
The definition of the Hip pain is that An unpleasant sensation characterized by physical discomfort (such as pricking, throbbing, or aching) localized to the hip.
The definition of the Knee pain is that An unpleasant sensation characterized by physical discomfort (such as pricking, throbbing, or aching) localized to the knee.
The definition of the Ankle pain is that An unpleasant sensation characterized by physical discomfort (such as pricking, throbbing, or aching) localized to the ankle. []
The definition of the Toe pain is that An unpleasant sensation characterized by physical discomfort (such as pricking, throbbing, or aching) localized to the toe.

The definition of the Choking episodes is that Incidents in which a piece of food or other objects get stuck in the upper airway and provoke coughing, gagging, inability to talk, and difficulty breathing.
The definition of the Undetectable pattern electroretinogram is that Absent response to a pattern electroretinogram (PERG).
The definition of the Heliotrope rash of eyelid is that Heliotrope rash is a violaceous discoloration of the eyelids associated with periorbital edema.
The definition of the Abnormality of venous physiology is that An anomaly of venous function.

The definition of the Abnormal jugular venous pressure is that An anomaly of the jugular venous pressure. The internal jugular veins, being continuous with the superior vena cava, provide a visible measure of the degree to which the systemic venous reservoir is filled. The vertical height above the right atrium to which they are distended and above which they are in a collapsed state provides an imperfect reflection of the right atrial pressure.
The definition of the Elevated jugular venous pressure is that Increased jugular venous pressure. []

The definition of the Hepatojugular reflux is that The examiner applies firm but persistent pressure over the liver for 10 seconds while observing the mean jugular venous pressure. Normally there is either no rise or only a transient (i.e., 2 to 3 sec) rise in mean jugular venous pressure. A sustained increase in the mean venous pressure until abdominal compression is released is abnormal and indicates impaired right heart function. This abnormal response is called hepatojugular reflux.
The definition of the Abnormal pulse pressure is that An anomaly of the pulse pressure, which is defined as the systolic pressured minus the diastolic pressure.
The definition of the Low pulse pressure is that Reduced amplitude of the pulse pressure (systolic blood pressure minus diastolic blood pressure).
The definition of the High pulse pressure is that Increased amplitude of the pulse pressure (systolic blood pressure minus diastolic blood pressure).
The definition of the Heterotaxy is that An abnormality in which the internal thoraco-abdominal organs demonstrate abnormal arrangement across the left-right axis of the body.
The definition of the Scleral staphyloma is that A staphyloma is a localized defect in the eye wall with protrusion of uveal tissue due to alterations in scleral thickness and structure.
The definition of the Posterior staphyloma is that A localized defect in the posterior eye wall with protrusion of uveal tissue due to alterations in scleral thickness and structure.

The definition of the Eye movement-induced pain is that An unpleasant sensation characterized by physical discomfort (such as pricking, throbbing, or aching) localized to the eye that is worse in certain directions of gaze and during prolonged gaze holding.

The definition of the Addictive behavior is that When an activity, substance, object, or behavior becomes a major focus of a person's life, excluding other activities, or has begun to harm the individual or others physically, mentally, or socially, it can be considered addictive behavior. A person can become addicted or compulsively engaged with anything. []
The definition of the Topoisomerase I antibody positivity is that The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the serum that react against topoisomerase I.
The definition of the Abnormal CSF amyloid level is that Abnormal concentration of amyloid in the cerebrospinal fluid (CSF). []
The definition of the Decreased CSF amyloid level is that Reduced concentration of amyloid in the cerebrospinal fluid (CSF). []
The definition of the Elevated CSF amyloid level is that Increased concentration of amyloid in the cerebrospinal fluid (CSF). []
The definition of the Nasal flaring is that Widening of the nostrils upon inhalation as a manifestation of respiratory distress.

The definition of the Intercostal retractions is that A pulling inward of the soft tissues between the ribs upon inhalation. This is a sign of increased use of the chest muscles for breathing and is a manifestation of respiratory distress. [PMID:25274969]
The definition of the Large elbow is that Abnormal increased size of the elbow joint.
The definition of the Large knee is that Abnormally increased size of the knee joint.
The definition of the Vertical orbital dystopia is that The orbits do not lie on the same horizontal plane, that is, one eye is lower than the other.
The definition of the Monorchism is that Having only one testis in the scrotum.
The definition of the Anorchism is that An abnormality of XY sexual development characterized by the absence of both testes at birth.
The definition of the Abnormality of spinal facet joint is that An anomaly of the small joints located between and behind adjacent vertebrae.

The definition of the Facet joint arthrosis is that Osteoarthritis of facet joints in the spine. Degeneration of cartilage in the facet joints results in bone rubbing on bone and reactive new bone formation visible on X-ray.
The definition of the Abnormal cardiac ventricular function is that An abnormality of the cardiac ventricular function.
The definition of the Anticentromere antibody positivity is that The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the serum that react against the centromeres or centromere components.
The definition of the Oxygen desaturation on exertion is that Oxygen saturation less than 95% on exertion or arterial partial pressure of oxygen falling by more than 1kPa.

The definition of the Abnormality of pulmonary circulation is that A functional anomaly of that portion of the cardiosvascular system that carries deoxygenated blood from the heart to the lungs and returns oxygenated blood back to the heart.
The definition of the Increased pulmonary capillary wedge pressure is that Pulmonary capillary wedge pressure (PCWP) above 15mmHg.
The definition of the Obstructive deficit on pulmonary function testing is that Abnormally low FEV1/FVC (FEV1 - forced expiratory volume in 1 second; FVC forced vital capacity).

The definition of the Abnormality on pulmonary function testing is that Any anomaly measure by pulmonary function testing, which includes spirometry, measures of diffusing capacity, and plethysmography.
The definition of the Interlobular septal thickening is that Presence of thickening of the interlobular septa of the lungs as seen on a CT scan.
The definition of the Shoulder impingement is that Trapping and compression of the rotator cuff tendons during shoulder movements.

The definition of the Femoroacetabular Impingement is that Femoroacetabular impingement (FAI) results from one or more bony abnormalities that lead to abnormal contact between the acetabulum and the femoral head or neck. The femoral abnormality is proposed to cause compression and shear stresses in the region between the labrum and cartilage, anterosuperiorly. These stresses cause a separation between the labrum and cartilage as the labrum is pushed outwards and the cartilage is pushed centrally. This eventually leads to articular degeneration and eventually global hip osteoarthritis. [PMID:22108232]
The definition of the Gastrojejunal tube feeding in infancy is that Feeding problem necessitating gastrojejunal tube feeding. [PMID:11827911]
The definition of the Abnormal lymphocyte apoptosis is that A anomaly in the rate of programmed cell death (apoptosis) in lymphocytes.
The definition of the Increased lymphocyte apoptosis is that A elevation in the rate of apoptosis in lymphocytes. []
The definition of the C3 nephritic factor positivity is that The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the serum that react against C3 convertase (C3bBb). []
The definition of the Congenital shortened small intestine is that Substantially shortened length of the small intestine as a result of a developmental defect. [PMID:18209785]
The definition of the Hyperintensity of cerebral white matter on MRI is that A brighter than expected signal on magnetic resonance imaging emanating from the cerebral white matter. [PMID:15576652]

The definition of the Periventricular white matter hyperdensities is that Areas of brighter than expected signal on magnetic resonance imaging emanating from the cerebral white matter that surrounds the cerebral ventricles. [PMID:15576652]

The definition of the Deep cerebral white matter hyperdensities is that Areas of brighter than expected signal on magnetic resonance imaging emanating from locations distant from the ventricular system. [PMID:15576652]

The definition of the Abnormal response to short acting pulmonary vasodilator is that Pulmonary vasodilator testing is performed during right-heart catheterization and involves a short-acting vasoactive agent such as adenosine, epoprostenol, or inhaled nitric oxide. The current definition of a normal (positive) response is a drop in mean pulmonary artery pressure of at least 10 mm Hg (or 20 percent) to below 40 mm Hg.

The definition of the Insufficient response to short acting pulmonary vasodilator is that No fall in mean pulmonary arterial pressure (mPAP) falls by at least 10 mmHg to an absolute value less than 40 mmHg without a degradation in cardiac output (CO) in response to a short-acting vasoactive agent such as adenosine, epoprostenol, or inhaled nitric oxide.
The definition of the Abnormal gastrointestinal motility is that An anomaly of the muscular contractions that propel food though the gastrointestinal tract.
The definition of the Decreased intestinal transit time is that A reduction in the length of time required for food to pass through the intestines. [PMID:22206545]

The definition of the Pruritis on abdomen is that Pruritus is an itch or a sensation that makes a person want to scratch. This term refers to an abnormally increased sensation of itching over the skin of the abdomen. []

The definition of the Pruritis on hand is that Pruritus is an itch or a sensation that makes a person want to scratch. This term refers to an abnormally increased sensation of itching over the skin of the hand. []

The definition of the Pruritus on foot is that Pruritus is an itch or a sensation that makes a person want to scratch. This term refers to an abnormally increased sensation of itching over the skin of the foot. []

The definition of the Pruritis on breast is that Pruritus is an itch or a sensation that makes a person want to scratch. This term refers to an abnormally increased sensation of itching over the skin of the breast. []

The definition of the Palmomental reflex is that A type of primitive reflex characterized by an involuntary contraction of the mentalis muscle of the chin caused by stimulation of the thenar eminence of the palm.

The definition of the Grasp reflex is that A type of primitive reflex that can be elicated when the hand of the examiner is gently inserted into the palm of the patient's hand. The palmar surface is stroked or simply touched. The flexor surfaces of the fingers may be stimulated also by the examiner's fingers. The stimulus should be in a distal direction. With a positive response, the patient grasps the examiner's hand with variable strength and continues to grasp as the examiner's hand is moved. Ability to release the grip voluntarily depends on the activity of the reflex; some patients can do so readily, while others can even be lifted off the bed, since the grasp has such power [NCBI Books:NBK395].

The definition of the Glabellar reflex is that A type of primitive reflex that is elicited by repetitive tapping on the forehead. Normal subjects usually blink in response to the first several taps, but if blinking persists, the response is abnormal and considered to be a sign of frontal release. Persistent blinking is also known as Myerson's sign.

The definition of the Snout reflex is that A type of primitive reflex that is elicited by tapping the upper lip lightly. The contraction of the muscles causes the mouth to resemble a snout. [PMID:21250236]

The definition of the Suck reflex is that A type of primitive reflex that is elicited by lightly touching or tapping on the lips with an object such as a tongue blade, reflex hammer, or the examiner's finger. At times the reflex is obtained merely by approaching the lips with an object. A positive suck reflex consists of sucking movements by the lips when they are stroked or touched. [PMID:21250236]
The definition of the Thunderclap headache is that Severe head pain with sudden onset, reaching its maximum intensity in less than one minute and lasting from one hour to ten days. []

The definition of the Liver kidney microsome type 1 antibody positivity is that The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the serum that react against P450 2D6, a cytochrome P450 mono-oxygenase. Anti-LKM-1 antibodies are considered to be a diagnostic marker of autoimmune hepatitis type 2 (AIH2). [PMID:29554146]

The definition of the Anti-liver cytosolic antigen type 1 antibody positivity is that The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the serum that react against a 60-kd peptide contained in the liver cytosolic fraction. [PMID:7806169]
The definition of the Bifid clitoris is that Two clitorides located side by side. [PMID:23650202]
The definition of the Duplicated clitoris is that Supernumerary clitoris. []
The definition of the Exaggerated rugosity of the labia majora is that Marked rugae formation of the skin of the labia majora. [PMID:23650202]
The definition of the Abnormal peristalsis is that An anomaly of the wave-like muscle contractions of the digestive tract.
The definition of the Cerebellar edema is that Swelling from fluid accumulation (serous fluid infiltration into the interstitial space) in the cerebellum. []
The definition of the Oral erythroplakia is that A velvety red but not ulcerated lesion of the oral mucosa. The texture may be roughened or normal, and the lesion is neither raised nor depressed. []
The definition of the Abnormality of intestinal smooth muscle morphology is that A structural anomaly of the nonstriated, involuntary muscle tissue of the intestine. []

The definition of the Abnormal layering of muscularis propria is that Abnormal layering of the intestinal muscularis propria into three layers; (1) inner circular; (2) additional oblique; and (3) outer longitudinal layer. [PMID:18788889, PMID:26078585]

The definition of the Fibrotic muscularis propria is that The presence of excessive fibrous connective tissue in the muscularis propria of the intestine. Fibrosis is a reparative or reactive process. []
The definition of the Enteric intraneuronal nuclear inclusion bodies is that Aggregates of stainable substances (proteins) in the nuclei of enteric neurons. []
The definition of the Palpebral thickening is that An increased thickness of the eyelid not related to acute inflammation. []

The definition of the Conjunctival papillae is that Raised tissue masses located on the palpebral conjunctiva with a central vessel. Papillae are created by a focal infiltration of inflammatory cells. []

The definition of the Conjunctival follicles is that Small, dome-shaped nodules without a prominent central vessel located on the conjunctiva. The lymphoid follicles are located in the subendothelial region of the conjunctiva. They consist of a germinal center that contains immature, proliferating lymphocytes, as well as a corona that contains mature lymphocytes and plasma cells. []

The definition of the Elevated gamma-glutamyltransferase activity is that Increased level of the enzyme gamma-glutamyltransferase (GGT). GGT is mainly present in kidney, liver, and pancreatic cells, but small amounts are present in other tissues. [PMID:26543300]
The definition of the Glomerular deposits is that An abnormal accumulation of protein in the glomerulus. []
The definition of the Pulmonary venous hypertension is that An abnormal increase in pressure in the pulmonary veins, usually as a result of left atrial hypertension. []
The definition of the Skeletal muscle fibrosis is that Excessive formation of fibrous bands of scar tissue in between muscle fibers. [PMID:21798099]

The definition of the Birdshot choroidal lesions is that Multiple cream-yellow colored hypopigmented lesions typically located at the level of the choroid or retinal pigment epithelium; ovoid, cream-colored with indistinct borders. They are between 50 and 1,500 micrometers in size with a characteristic nasal, radial distribution in the postequatorial fundus.
The definition of the Conjunctival hyperemia is that Dilatation of the blood vessels of the conjunctiva leading to a red appearance of the sclera. []

The definition of the Alcoholism is that An addictive behavior is defined as drinking excessive amounts of alcohol over a prolonged period of time, having difficulty in reducing the amount of alcohol consumed, strongly desiring alcohol, and experiencing withdrawal symptoms when not drinking alcohol. []
The definition of the Abnormality of cardiovascular system electrophysiology is that An anomaly of the electrical conduction physiology of the heart. []

The definition of the Ventricular septal aneurysm is that A bowing (bulging to one side) of the interventricular septum of more than 15 mm on either side in adults and 5 mm in children during normal cardiac motion. []

The definition of the Membranous ventricular septal aneurysm is that Bowing (bulging out) of the membranous part of the interventricular septum of more than 10-15 mm into the cavity of an adjacent ventricle (usually into the right ventricle). [PMID:5846101, PMID:6018320]

The definition of the Muscular ventricular septal aneurysm is that Bowing (bulging out) of the muscular part of the interventricular septum of more than 10-15 mm into the cavity of an adjacent ventricle (usually into the right ventricle). [PMID:5846101]
The definition of the Microspherophakia is that Lens of the eye is smaller than normal and spherically shaped. []

The definition of the Abnormal morphology of the great vessels is that A structural anomaly affecting a blood vessel involved in the circulation of the heart, i.e., the superior or inferior vena cava, the pulmonary arteries, the pulmonary veins, and the aorta. []

The definition of the Aortic stiffness is that The elastic properties of the aorta allow the aorta to store half of the cardiac ejected blood volume per beat, whereby aortic recoil during diastole pushes the remaining stored volume forward into the peripheral circulation, a phenomenon known as the Windkessel function. Aortic stiffness occurs as the elastic fibers within the arterial wall become disrupted due to mechanical stress (with age or due to other factors). Aortic stiffness refers to a reduction in the elasticity of the aorta, which is associated with an elevated pulse pressure, increased wave reflection, and often hypertension. [PMID:28540066]
The definition of the Abnormal pulmonary artery morphology is that An abnormality of the structure of the pulmonary artery. []
The definition of the Abnormal pulmonary artery physiology is that An abnormality of the function of the pulmonary artery. []
The definition of the Abnormal pulmonary vein morphology is that An abnormality of the structure of the pulmonary veins. []
The definition of the Abnormal pulmonary vein physiology is that An abnormality of the function of the pulmonary veins. []

The definition of the Abnormal vena cava physiology is that An abnormality of the function of the veins that return deoxygenated blood from the body into the heart, i.e., the superior vena cava and the inferior vena cava. []
The definition of the Abnormal systemic blood pressure is that A chronic deviation from normal pressure in the systemic arterial system. []
The definition of the Cryptozoospermia is that A type of oligozoospermia in which spermatozoa can be detected in an ejaculate only after centrifugation and inspection of the pellet. [PMID:25780588]

The definition of the Pontine tegmental cap is that An abnormal curved or vaulted (capped) structure covering the middle third of the dorsal pontine tegmentum and projecting into the fourth ventricle. [PMID:17690130, PMID:18842761, PMID:25691269]

The definition of the Abnormal factor VIII activity is that A deviation from the normal activity of coagulation factor VIII. Factor VIII (fVIII) is a cofactor in the intrinsic clotting cascade that is activated to fVIIIa in the presence of minute quantities of thrombin. fVIIIa acts as a receptor, for factors IXa and X. []

The definition of the Increased factor VIII activity is that Increased activity of the coagulation factor VIII. Factor VIII (fVIII) is a cofactor in the intrinsic clotting cascade that is activated to fVIIIa in the presence of minute quantities of thrombin. fVIIIa acts as a receptor, for factors IXa and X.
The definition of the Decreased CSF/serum albumin ratio is that A reduction below normal limits of the ratio of the cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) albumin concentration to serum albumin concentration.
The definition of the Dilatation of large choroidal vessels is that Enlargement of the large blood vessels in the choroid. [PMID:26026923]
The definition of the Reduced brain glutamine level by MRS is that An decrease in the level of glutamine in the brain identified by magnetic resonance spectroscopy (MRS).

The definition of the Abnormal CSF/serum albumin ratio is that A deviation from the normal range of the ratio of the albumin concentration in the cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) to the concentration in serum (which may be defined as 3.2-9.0). This is an index of blood-brain barrier (BBB) integrity, adjusted for the serum albumin concentration, and an increased ratio is taken as a sign of a loss of integrity of the BBB with leakage of albumin into the CSF. [PMID:27388694]

The definition of the Ovarian thecoma is that A sex cord-stromal tumor of the ovary. Thecomas range from small tumors to large solid or solid-cystic masses of up to 15 cm. They are unilateral in over 90 percent of cases and are rarely malignant. Thecomas are stromal tumors made up of cells that resemble theca cells, lutein cells and fibroblasts. They are traditionally classified within the sex cord-stromal tumor category of ovarian tumor types. [NCIT:C1882229, PMID:27284435]
The definition of the Abnormal serum bile acid concentration is that A deviation from the normal concentration of serum bile acid concentration. []
The definition of the Decreased serum bile concentration is that A reduction in the concentration of bile acid in the blood. []

The definition of the Biliary epithelial hyperplasia is that Hyperplasia of lining epithelia of the septal and large bile ducts manifesting as micropapillary projections or as a stratification of the epithelium with or without dilatation of the duct lumen. [PMID:21994886]

The definition of the Suppurative cholangitis is that Cholangitis characterized by the presence of numerous polymorphonuclear cells around and within the wall as well as within the lumen of the ducts. This may involve ducts of any size and is occasionally associated with abscess formation (cholangitic abscess). [PMID:21994886]

The definition of the Granulomatous cholangitis is that Cholangitis characterized by the accumulation of granulomas. Granulomas are aggregates of modified macrophages (epithelioid cells) and other inflammatory cells that accumulate after chronic exposure to antigens. The underlying trigger may be exposure to noxious agents that cannot be biochemically degraded or to immune dysfunction. The ultimate result is a release of a variety cytokines that stimulate mononuclear cells that fuse to form multinucleated giant cells with a surrounding rim of lymphocytes and fibroblasts. [PMID:22333006]

The definition of the Lymphoid cholangitis is that Cholangitis characterized by a close association between duct branches, usually interlobular bile ducts, and lymphocytic aggregates, which may show a follicular arrangement. [PMID:21994886]
The definition of the Pleomorphic cholangitis is that Cholangitis associated with mixed inflammatory infiltrates and the presence of fibrosis or sclerosis of the biliary tree. []

The definition of the Sclerosing cholangitis is that Cholangitis associated with evident ductal fibrosis that develops as a consequence of long-standing bile duct inflammatory, obstruction, or ischemic injury; it can be obliterative or nonobliterative. []

The definition of the Abnormal pancreatic duct morphology is that Any structural anomaly of the pancreatic duct, which is the tubular structure that collects exocrine pancreatic secretions and transports them to the duodenum. [PMID:24265565]
The definition of the Duplication of pancreatic duct is that A congenital anomaly characterized by the presence of two separate pancreatic ducts. []

The definition of the Pancreas divisum is that A congenital anomaly of the pancreas that results from failed fusion of the dorsal and ventral ducts during embyological development. Three variants have been described: type 1 or classical divisum in which there is total failure of fusion; type 2 in which dorsal drainage is dominant in the absence of the duct of Wirsung; and type 3 or incomplete divisum where a small communicating branch is present. [PMID:24265565]
The definition of the Peritoneal effusion is that An increase in the amount of fluid present in the peritoneal cavity (between the layers of the peritoneum that lines the abdomen). []
The definition of the Megaduodenum is that Dilation and elongation of the duodenum with hypertrophy of all layers of the duodenum. []
The definition of the Atretic vas deferens is that Abnormal closure or blockage of the vas deferens. []

The definition of the Cerebrospinal fluid rhinorrhoea is that Drainage of cerebrospinal fluid through the nose. This can occur when there is a fistula between the dura and the skull base and discharge of cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) from the nose. [PMID:17767107]

The definition of the Abnormal vestibular saccule morphology is that Any structural anomaly of the saccule of the vestibule. The saccule is the otolith organ that senses motions in the sagittal plane (i.e., up-down movement). []
The definition of the Vestibular saccular degeneration is that Deterioration or loss of the tissues of the saccule of the vestibule. []

The definition of the Minifascicle formation is that A nerve fascicle or fasciculus is a small bundle of axons, enclosed by the perineurium. A minifascule refers to a group of thinly myelinated and unmyelinated axons surrounded by a delicate perineurium, and with a smaller diameter than a normal nerve fascicle. []
The definition of the Neuritis is that Inflammation of a nerve. []
The definition of the Polyneuritis is that Simulataneous inflammation of multiple nerves. []
The definition of the Hemiareflexia is that Areflexia that is limited to one side of the body. [PMID:6722516]

The definition of the Acroparesthesia is that A type of paresthesia (tingling, pins-and-needles, burning or numbness or stiffness) that occurs in the hands and feet and particularly in the fingers and toes. []
The definition of the Lingual dystonia is that Involuntary protrusions, movements, spams and contortions of the tongue. [PMID:24808861]

The definition of the Ainhum is that Development of a fibrotic constriction ring involving the base of one or more toes, conditioning eversion and absorption of distal structures, possibly progressing to spontaneous amputation. [PMID:26379327]

The definition of the Hyperphalangy of the 3rd finger is that An accessory phalanx of the third (middle) finger that is arranged linearly with the other phalanges. Hyperphalangy results from an accessory ossification center at the metacarpophalangeal joint. [PMID:27738187, PMID:30728880]
The definition of the Fatty streak is that Yellow-colored streaks, patches, or spots on the intimal surface of arteries. Fatty streaks stain red with Sudan III or Sudan IV. [PMID:8181179]

The definition of the Thin-cap fibroatheroma is that Thin-cap fibroatheroma is characterized by a relatively large necrotic core with an overlying thin fibrous cap measuring less than 65 micrometers and typically containing numerous macrophages, and is considered to be the precursor lesion of plaque rupture which is the most common cause of coronary thrombosis. [PMID:27500096]
The definition of the Ankylosis is that A reduction of joint mobility resulting from changes involving the articular surfaces. []

The definition of the Arteria lusoria is that Usually, three large arteries arise from the arch of the aorta: the brachiocephalic trunk (divided into the right common carotid artery and the right subclavian artery), the left common carotid artery, and the left subclavian artery. However, when aberrant right subclavian artery variant is present, the brachiocephalic trunk is absent and four large arteries arise from the arch of the aorta: the right common carotid artery, the left common carotid artery, the left subclavian artery, and the final one with the most distal left sided origin, the right subclavian artery, also called the arteria lusoria. [PMID:25105156]

The definition of the Intrahepatic portal vein sclerosis is that Sclerosis of the intrahepatic portal veins of the liver and generally accompanied by non-cirrhotic portal hypertension, features of which may include splenomegaly and varices. [PMID:25796481]

The definition of the Alternating radiolucent and radiodense metaphyseal lines is that Areas of radio-opaque sclerotic bands alternating with those of normal lucency give rise to stripes akin to a zebra. [PMID:28384951]
The definition of the Swiss cheese atrial septal defect is that Multiple defects in the atrial septum. [PMID:18559707]
