The definition of the Eccrine syringofibroadenoma is that Eccrine syringofibroadenoma (ESFA) is a benign adnexal tumor arising most often on the extremities of elderly individuals characterized by anastomosing cords of cuboidal epithelial cells surrounded by a fibrovascular stroma containing plasma cells and ductal structures. ESFA stains positively with epithelial membrane antigen (EMA) and carcinoembryonic antigen (CEA). [NCIT:CL017969, PMID:26937300]

The definition of the Pyknotic bone marrow neutrophils is that Nuclear lobes of neutrophils in the bone marrow are thickened and condensed, and individual lobes are connected by unusually long chromatin filaments. []
The definition of the Bone marrow hypercellularity is that A larger than normal amount or percentage of hematopoietic cells relative to marrow fat. []

The definition of the Squamous Papilloma is that A benign epithelial neoplasm characterized by a papillary growth pattern and a proliferation of neoplastic squamous cells without morphologic evidence of malignancy [NCI thesaurus]. []

The definition of the Oropharyngeal squamous papilloma is that A benign exophytic neoplasm that arises from the oropharynx. It is characterized by the presence of a connective tissue core covered by stratified squamous epithelium [NCI thesaurus]. []

The definition of the Multiple mucosal neuromas is that Multiple painful, dome-shaped, translucent pink to skin-colored papules on oral mucosa. Histologically, the lesions may demonstrate dermal proliferation of well-demarcated nerve bundles associated with abundant mucin and surrounded by a distinct perineural sheath. [PMID:16702501]
The definition of the Cylindroma is that A benign skin adnexal tumor of eccrine differentiation. [NCIT:C27094, PMID:27294061]

The definition of the Gastric leiomyosarcoma is that A malignant neoplasm of the stomach that grows submucosally in the gastric wall. Necrosis and hemorrhage may be visible radiologically. Histologically, spindle cells with abnormal mitotic activity may be visible. [NCIT:C27200, PMID:25069607]

The definition of the Snail-like ilia is that The ilia is round and hypoplastic with a very flat acetabular roof and a very unusual medial projection of bone that is said to resemble the head of a snail. Figure 4 of PMID:3799723 illustrates this feature. [PMID:3799723]

The definition of the Internal notch of the femoral head is that A small V-shaped indentation on the internal aspect of the femoral head. This feature is well illustrated in Figure 5 of PMID:11694546. [PMID:11694546, PMID:24339047]

The definition of the Lactescent serum is that Serum sample with a grossly white (milk-like, i.e., lactescent) appearance. This feature is indicative of an extremely elevated serum triglyceride level. [PMID:15368719]

The definition of the Elevated carcinoembryonic antigen level is that An increased blood concentration of the carcinoembryonic antigen (CEA). CEA is a member of the immunoglobulin supergene family. The human CEA gene family is clustered on chromosome 19q and comprises 29 genes. CEA is highly expressed in embryonic tissue and in some cancers, and is a widely used tumor marker. [PMID:11274010]

The definition of the Elevated carcinoma antigen 125 level is that An increased blood concentration of carcinoma antigen 125 (CA-125). CA-125, also known as mucin 16, can exhibit increased blood levels in certain types of cancer. [PMID:16343244]

The definition of the Abnormal retinol-binding protein level is that A deviation from normal blood concentration of retinol-binding protein (RBP). The most commonly used indicator of vitamin A status is the serum retinol concentration (retinol is one of the several compounds known as vitamin A). The serum RBP concentration is used as a surrogate measure for serum retinol. [PMID:14749226]

The definition of the Decreased retinol-binding protein level is that A reduced blood concentration of retinol-binding protein. This finding predicts vitamin A deficiency with high sensitivity and specificity. [PMID:14749226]

The definition of the Impaired urinary acidification is that The kidney contributes towards acid-base homeostasis by excreting H+ ions and retaining bicarbonate. This process is known as acidification of the urine. The pH of urine ranges normally from 4.5 to 8. The inability to reduce the pH of the urine in a situation where it would be otherwise expected is known as an acidification defect. [PMID:6876936]

The definition of the Abnormal insulin like growth factor binding protein acid labile subunit level is that A deviation from the normal blood concentration of the insulin like growth factor binding protein acid labile subunit (IGFALS; Entrez Gene ID 3483). The acid-labile subunit (IGFALS) acts in the insulin-like growth (IGF) system by binding circulating IGF1 in a ternary complex with binding protein (IGFBP)-3 to prevent IGF1 from crossing the endothelial barrier. [PMID:20142246]

The definition of the Chronic infection is that Presence of a protracted or persistent infection by a pathogen potentially related to an underlying abnormality of the immune system that is not able to clear the infection. []
The definition of the Reduced growth-hormone binding protein level is that A decreased blood concentration of growth hormone binding protein. []
The definition of the Reduced insulin-like factor 3 level is that Blood concentration of insulin-like factor 3 (ILF3) is below normal limits. [PMID:24640568]

The definition of the Spermatogenesis maturation arrest is that Maturation arrest (MA) is defined as germ cells that fail to complete maturation. Uniform MA is characterized by spermatogenic arrest at the same stage of spermatogenesis throughout the seminiferous tubules. MA is subcategorized into early MA, in which only spermatogonia or spermatocytes are found, and late MA, in which spermatids are detected without spermatozoa. [PMID:21684558]

The definition of the Early spermatogenesis maturation arrest is that A type of spermatogenesis maturation arrest in which the block of developmental occurs in the spermatocyte stage. Testicular histology shows seminiferous tubules with Sertoli cells, spermatogonial cells and spermatocytes but no further differentiated cells like round spermatids. [PMID:21684558]

The definition of the Late spermatogenesis maturation arrest is that A failure of spermatogenesis to progress beyond the round spermatid stage. The round spermatid is the first haploid cells produced during spermatogenesis and normally further develop into mature spermatozoa. This abnormality can be visualized with testicular biopsy and is characterized seminiferous tubules with increased numbers of round spermatids with few or no mature spermatozoa. [PMID:21684558, PMID:9510006]

The definition of the Obstruction of the superior vena cava is that Blockage of blood flow through the superior vena cava (SVC). Because the venous drainage from the upper extremities, upper thorax and head is obstructed, SVC obstruction presents with symptoms related to engorgement of these areas. Both the degree of SVC compromise and the extent of collateral veins determine the varied clinical presentation, which can be as mild as slight facial and upper extremity edema or as dire as intracranial swelling, seizures, hemodynamic instability and tracheal obstruction. []
The definition of the Strawberry tongue is that Inflammed tongue with hyperplastic (enlarged) fungiform papillae that is said to resemble a strawberry or raspberry. [PMID:26222562]
The definition of the Type A4 brachydactyly is that A type of brachydactyly characterized by brachymesophalangy affecting mainly the 2nd and 5th digits. [PMID:8387724]
The definition of the Type A5 brachydactyly is that A type of brachydactyly characterized by absent middle phalanges of digits 2 to 5. [PMID:18554391]

The definition of the Acral blistering is that Bullae (defined as fluid-filled blisters more than 5 mm in diameter with thin walls) of the skin with an acral distribution (affecting peripheral regions such as hands and feet). []
The definition of the Absent soft palate is that A developmental defect characterized by lack of a soft palate. [PMID:11420024]

The definition of the Paraproteinemia is that An abnormal immunoglobulin or part of an Ig (light chain) in the circulation. Paraproteins are typically produced by a clonal population of B-cell derived plasma cells. [PMID:17403946]
The definition of the Light-chain paraproteinemia is that An abnormal immunoglobulin light chain in the circulation and typically produced by a clonal population of B-cell derived plasma cells. []

The definition of the Heavy-chain paraproteinemia is that An abnormal immunoglobulin heavy chain in the circulation and typically produced by a clonal population of B-cell derived plasma cells. [PMID:12057070]

The definition of the Whole-immunoglobulin paraproteinemia is that An abnormal immunoglobulin (heavy and light chain) in the circulation and typically produced by a clonal population of B-cell derived plasma cells. []
The definition of the Tarsal sclerosis is that An elevation in bone density in one or more tarsal bones of the foot. Sclerosis is normally detected on a radiograph as an area of increased opacity. []
The definition of the Elevated vascular endothelial growth factor level is that Increased blood concentration of vascular endothelial growth factor (VEGF). []
The definition of the Coarctation in the transverse aortic arch is that Narrowing or constriction of the aorta localized to the region of the transverse aortic arch. []
The definition of the Long segment coarctation of the aorta is that Coarctation of the aorta is a narrowing or constriction of a long segment of the arch of the aorta. [PMID:23909637]

The definition of the Abnormal branching pattern of left aortic arch is that A deviance from the norm of the origin or course of the right brachiocephalic artery, the left common carotid artery, the left subclavian artery or the proximal vertebral arteries, whereby the aortic arch descends on the left as normal (as opposed to right aortic arch). []
The definition of the Fusiform cerebral aneurysm is that A localized circumferential (i.e., bulges on all sides) dilatation or ballooning of a cerebral artery. []
The definition of the Skin fissure is that A clearly-defined and roughly linear cleavage in the skin that usually extends to the dermis. []
The definition of the Abnormal ovarian physiology is that Any anomaly of ovarian function. []
The definition of the Empty ovarian follicle is that A failure to collect oocytes after an apparently normal controlled ovarian hyperstimulation cycle for in vitro fertilization. [PMID:19562053]

The definition of the Abnormal femoral torsion is that Femoral torsion, also known as femoral rotation or femoral version, refers to the twist between the proximal and distal parts of the femur on the transverse plane. Femoral anteversion averages between 30-40 degress at birth, and between 8-14 degrees in adults. This term applies if the amount of femoral torsion deviates from this range. []
The definition of the Abnormal endocrine morphology is that Any anomaly of the structure of an organ ofthe endocrine system. []
The definition of the Abnormal endocrine physiology is that Any anomaly of the function of the endocrine system. []
The definition of the Abnormal response to endocrine stimulation test is that An anomalous response to a test that is designed to probe the function of the endocrine system. []

The definition of the Abnormal response to ACTH stimulation test is that An anomolous response to stimulation by adminstration of the adrenocorticotropic hormone (ACTH). ACTH stimulation normally stimulates the adrenal glands to release cortisol and adrenaline. []

The definition of the Abnormal response to insulin tolerance test is that An anomalous response to the insulin tolerance test (ITT), in which insulin is administered intravenously and blood glucose and potentially other compounds are measured at intervals. Insulin administration is intended to induce extreme hypoglycemia (bloodgluoce below 40 mg/dl), which in turn induces release of adrenocorticotropic hormone (ACTH) and growth hormone (GH). ACTH induces the adrenal gland to release cortisol, which together with GH opposes the action of insulin on the blood glucose level. []
The definition of the Impaired cortisol response to insulin stimulation test is that Failure of cortisol levels to respond adequately (by increasing) to the insulin tolerance test (ITT). []

The definition of the Abnormal response to corticotropin releasing hormone stimulation test is that An anomalous response to the corticotropin releasing hormone (CRH) stimulation test. Normally,CRH is released by the hypothalamus to induce adrenocorticotropic hormone (ACTH) release by the anterior pituitary. In the stimulation test, CRH is administered intravenously and ACTH and cortisol are measured at intervals. []

The definition of the Impaired cortisol response to corticotropin releasing hormone stimulation test is that Failure of cortisol levels to respond adequately (by increasing) to the corticotropin releasing hormone stimulation test. []

The definition of the Impaired growth-hormone response to insulin stimulation test is that Failure of growth hormone levels to respond adequately (by increasing) to the insulin tolerance test (ITT). []

The definition of the Abnormal response to glucagon stimulation test is that An anomalous response to the glucagon stimulation test, which like the insulin tolerance test (ITT) stimulates the release of both adrenocorticotropic hormone (ACTH) and growth hormone (GH). []
The definition of the Impaired cortisol response to glucagon stimulation test is that Failure of cortisol levels to respond adequately (by increasing) to the glucagon stimulation test. []
The definition of the Impaired growth-hormone response to glucagon stimulation test is that Failure of growth hormone levels to respond adequately (by increasing) to the glucagon stimulation test. []

The definition of the Abnormal response to human chorionic gonadotrophin stimulation test is that An anomalous response to intravenous stimulation by human chorionic gonadotrophin. Stimulation with hCG stimulates testicular Leydig cells to secrete androgens via the Leydig hormone receptors. []
The definition of the Excessive insulin response to glucagon test is that An abnormally high increase in insulin levels following a glucagon stimulation test. [PMID:21791970]

The definition of the Decreased prealbumin level is that A reduced concentration of prealbumin in the blood. Prealbumin, also known as transthyretin, has a half-life in plasma of about 2 days, much shorter than that of albumin. Prealbumin is therefore more sensitive to changes in protein-energy status than albumin, and its concentration closely reflects recent dietary intake rather than overall nutritional status. [PMID:17138848]

The definition of the Ectopic ovary is that Undescended or ectopic ovaries are characterized by the attachment of the upper pole of the ovary to an area above the level of the common iliac vessels. [PMID:12584384]
The definition of the Absent pubertal growth spurt is that The abrupt and transient increase in the annual growth rate normally observed in adolescent individuals does not occur. []
The definition of the Vaginal dryness is that Persistent vaginal dryness. [PMID:21702402]
The definition of the Palatal edema is that Swelling related to fluid accumulation within the palate. []
The definition of the Finger dactylitis is that Fingers appear swollen and plump owing to inflammation of the complete finger. []
The definition of the Toe dactylitis is that Toes appear swollen and plump owing to inflammation of the complete toe. []
The definition of the Spindle-shaped finger is that Swelling of the hand at the knuckles, that gives the fingers a spindle shape (i.e., a round stick with tapered end and a broader base). []
The definition of the Abnormal breast morphology is that Any anomaly of the structure of the breast. []
The definition of the Abnormal breast physiology is that Any anomaly of the function of the breast. []
The definition of the Abnormal humerus morphology is that Any anomaly of the structure of the humerus. []
The definition of the Delayed vertebral ossification is that A decrease in the amount of mineralized bone in one or more vertebrae compared with that expected for a given developmental age. []

The definition of the Abnormal thyroid-stimulating hormone level is that Any deviation from the normal amount of the thyroid-stimulating hormone (TSH), which is produced by the anterior pituitary gland and stimulates the function of the thyroid gland. []

The definition of the Decreased thyroid-stimulating hormone level is that Reduced amount of the thyroid-stimulating hormone (TSH), which is produced by the anterior pituitary gland and stimulates the function of the thyroid gland. []

The definition of the Abnormal circulating inhibin level is that Any deviation from the normal concentration of inhibins, which are heterodimeric protein hormones secreted by granulosa cells of the ovary in females and Sertoli cells of the testis in males. Inhibins suppress the secretion of pituitary follicle-stimulating hormone. [PMID:12790766]
The definition of the Decreased inhibin B level is that A reduced concentration of inhibin B in the blood. [PMID:11720872]

The definition of the Abnormal antimullerian hormone level is that Any deviation from the normal range of the antimullerian hormone, a peptide produced by the granulosa cells of follicles. Anti-Mullerian hormone (AMH), also known as Mullerian inhibiting substance, is produced by the granulosa cells of small antral follicles of the ovary. AMH has an inhibiting role in the ovary, contributing to follicular arrest. AMH levels in women are low until the age of 8, rise rapidly until puberty and decline steadily from the age of 25 until menopause, when AMH production ceases. [PMID:22693172]
The definition of the Increased antimullerian hormone level is that An elevation above the normal range of the antimullerian hormone in the circulation. []
The definition of the Decreased antimullerian hormone level is that A reduction below the normal range of the antimullerian hormone in the circulation. []
The definition of the Insulin receptor antibody positivity is that The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the serum that react against the insulin receptor. [PMID:3280181]
The definition of the Abnormal uterus morphology is that Any anomaly of the structure of the uterus []

The definition of the T-shaped uterus is that An abnormality of the uterus characterized by a normal uterine outline but with an abnormal T-shaped uterine cavity with narrowing cavity due to thickened lateral walls with a correlation 2/3 uterine corpus and 1/3 cervix. The abnormlaity is said to resemble the letter T in hysterosalpingographic imaging. [PMID:23771171]
The definition of the Decreased fibular diameter is that Reduced width of the cross sectional diameter of the fibula. []

The definition of the Triceps weakness is that A lack of strength in the triceps muscle, which normally is responsible for extending (straightening) the elbow and mediating certain shoulder movements. []
The definition of the Agalactia is that Failure of secretion of milk following childbirth associated with an inability to breastfeed an infant. []

The definition of the Twin-to-twin transfusion is that As a result of sharing a single placenta, the blood supplies of monochorionic twin fetuses can become connected, so that they share blood circulation: although each fetus uses its own portion of the placenta, the connecting blood vessels within the placenta allow blood to pass from one twin to the other.Depending on the number, type and direction of the interconnecting blood vessels (anastomoses), blood can be transferred disproportionately from one twin (the donor) to the other (the recipient). This state of transfusion causes the donor twin to have decreased blood volume, retarding the donor's development and growth. The blood volume of the recipient twin is increased, which can strain the fetus's heart and eventually lead to heart failure. [PMID:19283655]
The definition of the Cutaneous hamartoma is that A hamartoma (tissue malformation consisting of an abnormal mixture of constitutive components) originating in the skin. []

The definition of the Purely bicuspid aortic valve is that A type of bicuspid aortic valve (BAV) characterized by two equal-sized cusps, with no raphe and only two commissures. There is a lateral arrangement of the free edge of the cusps. Note that this differs from some other forms of BAV in which there are three commissures and two of the three cusps are joined by a raphe forming two functional leaflets. This type of BAV often is associated with aortic stenosis. [PMID:17467434]

The definition of the Single raphe bicuspid aortic valve is that A type of bicuspid aortic valvue (BAV) characterized by the presence of a single raphe that extends from the commissure to the free edge of the two underdeveloped, conjoint cusps, resulting in two leaflets of unequal size. [PMID:17467434, PMID:24827036]

The definition of the Bicuspid aortic valve with right-left cusp fusion is that A type of bicuspid aortic valve (BAV) characterized by a single raphe between the right and left cusps (RL fusion pattern). This results in two leaflefts with an anterior-posterior leaflet orientation (also called the typical pattern). There is thus one completely developed noncoronary cusp, two completely developed commissures, and one raphe between the underdeveloped left and right coronary cusps extending to the corresponding malformed commissure. [PMID:17467434, PMID:24827036]

The definition of the Bicuspid aortic valve with right-noncoronary cusp fusion is that A type of bicuspid aortic valve (BAV) characterized by a single raphe between the right and noncoronary cusps (RN fusion pattern). This results in two leaflets with right-left leaflet orientation (also called the atypical pattern). There is thus one completely developed left cusp, two completely developed commissures, and one raphe between the underdeveloped right and noncoronary coronary cusps extending to the corresponding malformed commissure. []

The definition of the Bicuspid aortic valve with left-noncoronary cusp fusion is that A type of bicuspid aortic valve (BAV) characterized by a single raphe between the left and noncoronary cusps (LN fusion pattern). There is thus one completely developed right cusp, two completely developed commissures, and one raphe between the underdeveloped left and noncoronary coronary cusps extending to the corresponding malformed commissure. []

The definition of the Two-raphe bicuspid aortic valve is that A type of bicuspid aortic valvue (BAV) characterized by the presence of two raphes that each extend from the commissure to the free edge of the two underdeveloped, conjoint cusps. This type of BAV has developmental anlagen of three cusps, commissures, and sinuses, but two commissures are more or less malformed and obliterated, giving rise to a raphe, a fibrous ridge, which extends from the commissure to the free edge of the two underdeveloped, conjoint cusps. This type of BAV is typically associated with a high degree of aortic stenosis. [PMID:17467434]

The definition of the Recurrent gastroenteritis is that Increased susceptibility to gastroenteritis, an infectious inflammationof the stomach and small intestines manifested by signs and symptoms such as diarheas and abdominal pain, as manifested by recurrent episodes of gastroenteritis. []
The definition of the Decreased platelet thromboxane A2 receptor is that Decreased cell membrane concentration of thromboxane A2 receptor that is stimulated by thromboxane A2 (TBXA2). []
The definition of the Decreased platelet alpha-2A-adrenergic receptor is that Decreased cell membrane concentration of alpha-2A adrenergic receptor that is stimulated by epinephrine. []

The definition of the Impaired clot retraction is that Platelets contain contractile proteins (actin and myosin) that induce clot retraction. As the platelets contract, they pull on the surrounding fibrin strands, squeezing serum form the mass, compacting the clot and drawing the ruptured edges of the blood vessel more closely together. Clot retraction is directly proportional to the platelet count and inversely proportional to the fibrinogen concentration. []

The definition of the Impaired convulxin-induced platelet aggregation is that Abnormal response to convulxin as manifested by reduced or lacking aggregation of platelets upon addition of convulxin. []

The definition of the Impaired collagen-related peptide-induced platelet aggregation is that Abnormal response to collagen-related peptide (CRP) as manifested by reduced or lacking aggregation of platelets upon addition of CRP. []

The definition of the Impaired phorbol myristate acetate-induced platelet aggregation is that Abnormal response to phorbol myristate acetate (PMA) as manifested by reduced or lacking aggregation of platelets upon addition of PMA. []

The definition of the Impaired calcium ionophore-induced platelet aggregation is that Abnormal response to calcium Ionophore (such as A23187) as manifested by reduced or lacking aggregation of platelets upon addition of the ionophore. []

The definition of the Abnormal plaleletphosphatidyl serine exposure is that An abnormality of phosphatidylserine (PS) on activated platelets. PS is normally located on the cytoplasmic face of the resting platelet membrane but appears on the plasma-oriented surface of discrete membrane vesicles that derive from activated platelets. Thrombin, the central molecule of coagulation, is produced from prothrombin by a complex (prothrombinase) between factor Xa and its protein cofactor (factor V(a)) that forms on platelet-derived membranes. This complex enhances the rate of activation of prothrombin to thrombin by roughly 150,000 fold relative to factor X(a) in solution. The negatively charged surface of PS-containing platelet-derived membranes is at least partly responsible for this rate enhancement. [PMID:12814644]

The definition of the Impaired annexin V binding to platelet phosphatidylserine is that Reduced binding of annexin V to platelet membrane, which is mediated by exposed phosphatidylserine. This can be measured by flow cytometry. []

The definition of the Increased annexin V binding to platelet phosphatidylserine is that Elevated binding of annexin V to platelet membrane, which is mediated by exposed phosphatidylserine. This can be measured by flow cytometry. []

The definition of the Cor triatrium sinister is that A developmental anomaly of the heart characterized by the presence of three atria because the left atrium is divided by an abnormal septum. [PMID:22379596]
The definition of the Triggered by physical trauma is that Applies to a sign or symptom that is provoked or brought about by exposure to a trauma (injury to tissue). []

The definition of the Decreased acrosin in sperm head is that A reduced amount of the enzyme acrosin in the sperm head acrosome. The acrosome is an organelle in the anterior half of the head of spermatozoa, and acrosin is a protease that contributes to the digestation of the zona pellucida in the fertilization process. []
The definition of the Storage in hepatocytes is that Hepatocytes (liver parenchymal cells) exhibit a bloated appearance because of expansion of the cytoplasm by accumulated material. []
The definition of the Abnormal B-type natriuretic peptide level is that A deviation from the normal circulating concentration of B-type natriuretic peptide (BNP). [PMID:22145138]

The definition of the Frog-leg posture is that A type of rest posture in an infant that indicated a generalized reduction in muscle tone. The hips are flexed and the legs are abducted to an extent that causes the lateral thigh to rest upon the supporting surface. This posture is said to resemble the legs of a frog. []
The definition of the Abnormal liver sonography is that An abnormal appearance of the liver or any of its components on sonography (ultrasound). []

The definition of the Increased hepatic echogenicity is that Increased echogenicity of liver tissue on sonography, manifested as an increased amount of white on the screen of the sonography device. [PMID:21472065]

The definition of the Abnormal hepatic echogenicity is that Any deviation from the normal degree of echogenicity of the liver on sonography. Echogenicity refers to the ability of a tissue to reflect or transmit ultrasound waves in the context of surrounding tissues. Whenever there is an interface of structures with different echogenicities, a visible difference in contrast will be apparent on the screen. Based on echogenicity, a structure can be characterized as hyperechoic (white on the screen), hypoechoic (gray on the screen) and anechoic (black on the screen). [PMID:21472065]

The definition of the Decreased hepatic echogenicity is that Reduced echogenicity of liver tissue on sonography, manifested as an increased amount of black on the screen of the sonography device. [PMID:21472065]

The definition of the Coarsened hepatic echotexture is that The appearance of the liver in sonographic images is normally uniform. This term applies when there is an irregular or non-uniform appearance of the liver parenchyma in liver sonography. []

The definition of the Starry sky appearance on hepatic sonography is that An abnormal echotexture visible in liver ultrasound manifesting as a diffuse hyperechoic liver echotexture with multiple, small hypoechoic lesions. The appearance is said to resemble a starry sky (multiple white spots on a dark background). [PMID:26157918]

The definition of the Impaired oral bolus formation is that An abnormality of swallowing characterized by reduced tongue coordination to form bolus after chewing. Food material spreads over the oral cavity instead of being concentrated into a bolus that is easily swallowed. [PMID:16776766]

The definition of the Vitreomacular adhesion is that Perifoveal vitreous separation with remaining vitreomacular attachment and unperturbed foveal morphologic features. It is an OCT finding that is almost always the result of normal vitreous aging, which may lead to pathologic conditions. [PMID:24053995]

The definition of the Vitreomacular traction is that Vitreomacular traction is characterized by anomalous posterior vitreous detachment accompanied by anatomic distortion of the fovea, which may include pseudocysts, macular schisis, cystoid macular edema, and subretinal fluid. Vitreomacular traction can be subclassified by the diameter of vitreous attachment to the macular surface as measured by OCT, with attachment of 1500 micrometers or less defined as focal and attachment of more than 1500 micrometers as broad. [PMID:24053995]

The definition of the Full-thickness macular hole is that Full-thickness macular hole (FTMH) is defined as a foveal lesion with interruption of all retinal layers from the internal limiting membrane to the retinal pigment epithelium. Full-thickness macular hole is primary if caused by vitreous traction or secondary if directly the result of pathologic characteristics other than vitreomacular traction. Full-thickness macular hole is subclassified by size of the hole as determined by OCT and the presence or absence of vitreomacular traction. [PMID:24053995]

The definition of the Membranous vitreous appearance is that Vitreous humor of the eye displaying consisting of a vestigial gel in the retrolental space bounded by a convoluted membrane. [PMID:20513134, PMID:21921955]
The definition of the Beaded vitreous appearance is that Vitreous humor of the eye displaying beaded bundles of irregular diameters. [PMID:20513134, PMID:21921955]

The definition of the Increased Arden ratio of electrooculogram is that An abnormal increase in the Arden ratio, which is the ratio between the light peak and the dark trough of the smoothed (physiologic) EOG record. []
The definition of the Decreased platelet glycoprotein Ib is that Decreased platelet cell membrane concentration of glycoprotein Ib. [PMID:11157507]
The definition of the Carotid cavernous fistula is that An abnormal connection between a carotid artery and the cavernous sinus. [PMID:23571267]

The definition of the Widened atrophic scar is that An atrophic scar (fibrous connective tissue resulting from incomplete healing of a wound) that has stretched (gotten wider), a manifestation of tissue fragility. [PMID:22353005]
The definition of the Thinning of Descemet membrane is that A reduction in the thickness of Descemet's membrane. []
The definition of the Myelokathexis is that Impaired egress of mature neutrophils from bone marrow causing neutropenia. [PMID:10607719, PMID:25662009]
The definition of the Reduced brain glutamate level by MRS is that An decrease in the level of glutamate (Glu) in the brain identified by magnetic resonance spectroscopy (MRS). [PMID:24123328]

The definition of the Impaired oropharyngeal swallow response is that Delay or absence of the swallow response, reflexes triggered by the contact the food bolus makes with the anterior faucial pillars. [PMID:27785002]
The definition of the Low femoral bone density is that Reduced bone mineral density of the femur. [PMID:19580459]
The definition of the Growth arrest lines is that Growth arrest lines are alternating transverse rings of sclerosis at the metaphysis of a long bone.
The definition of the Multifocal seizures is that Seizures that start from several different areas of the brain (i.e., with multiple ictal onset locations). [PMID:27091239]
The definition of the Eyelid myokymia is that Involuntary, fine, continuous, undulating contractions of the eyelid. []

The definition of the Triggered by ingestion of potassium-rich food is that Applies to a sign or symptom that is provoked or brought about by eating or drinking foods rich in potassium. [PMID:19472919]
The definition of the Postterm pregnancy is that A pregnancy that extends to 42 weeks of gestation or beyond. [PMID:24753906]
The definition of the Female fetal virilization is that Fetal masculinization of female external genitalia. []
The definition of the Femoral spur is that A bony projection (spur, osteophyte) originating from the femur, often in the medial femoral neck. []
The definition of the Sectoral retinitis pigmentosa is that A variant of retinitis pigmentosa in which there is a regional distribution of the retinal degeneration. []
The definition of the Tibial spur is that A bony projection (spur, osteophyte) originating from the tibia. []

The definition of the Double-layered patella is that An anomaly of the patella characterized by two layers visible on lateral knee X-ray such that one layer is in front of the other in the sagittal orientation (See Figure 2A and 3B of PMID:12966518). This finding persists into adulthood. [PMID:12525546, PMID:12966518]
The definition of the Absent cervical vertebra is that A developmental defect characterized by agenesis of one or more vertebral bodies of the cervical spine. []
The definition of the Absent thoracic vertebra is that A developmental defect characterized by agenesis of one or more vertebral bodies of the thoracic spine. []
The definition of the Finger flexor weakness is that Reduced ability to flex (bend) the fingers. This can manifest as incomplete closure of the hand due to weakness in finger flexion. [PMID:15668452]
The definition of the Fixed head retroflexion is that Head is bent in the posterior direction in a permanent fashion. [PMID:25288843]

The definition of the Nuchal rigidity is that Resistance of the extensor muscles of the neck to being bent forwards (i.e., impaired neck flexion) as a result of muscle spasm of the extensor muscles of the neck. Nuchal rigidity is not a fixed rigidity. Nuchal rigidity has been used as a bedside test for meningism, although its sensitivity for this purpose has been debated. [PMID:12060874]
The definition of the Erythema migrans is that An expanding erythematous (red) skin lesion, usually round or oval, by definition at least 5 cm in size (in largest diameter). [PMID:18452799]
The definition of the Necrolytic migratory erythema is that Acral or periorificial lesions that evolve in recurrent crops, with an annular and migratory distribution. [PMID:20054043]
The definition of the Increased NT-proBNP level is that An elevated level of circulating N-terminal part of the prohormone of B-type natriuretic peptide (BNP). []

The definition of the Abnormal circulating deoxycorticosterone level is that An abnormality of the concentration of deoxycorticosterone in the blood. Deoxycorticosterone comprises 11-deoxycorticosterone and 21-deoxycorticosterone. []
The definition of the Abnormality of circulating pregnenolone level is that An abnormality of the concentration of pregnenolone in the blood. [PMID:24849255]
The definition of the Genital edema is that A buildup of fluid that causes swelling in the soft tissues of the genital area. []
The definition of the Wrist drop is that A condition in which the affected individual cannot extend the wrist, which hangs flaccidly. []
The definition of the Superficial dermal perivascular inflammatory infiltrate is that Numerous lymphocytes surrounding blood vessels in the superfical part of the dermis. []
The definition of the Deep dermal perivascular inflammatory infiltrate is that Numerous lymphocytes surrounding blood vessels in the deep part of the dermis. []

The definition of the Abnormal morphology of left ventricular trabeculae is that Any structural anomaly of the muscular columns which project from the inner surface of the left ventricle of the heart (cardiac trabeculae, trabeculae carneae). []

The definition of the Abnormal morphology of right ventricular trabeculae is that Any structural anomaly of the muscular columns which project from the inner surface of the right ventricle of the heart (cardiac trabeculae, trabeculae carneae). []

The definition of the Increased density of left ventricular trabeculae is that An increased density (number and tightness) of the muscular columns which project from the inner surface of the left ventricles of the heart (cardiac trabeculae, trabeculae carneae). []
The definition of the Apical hypertrabeculation of the left ventricle is that An increased number and density of the trabeculae in the apex (tip) of the left ventricle. []
The definition of the Thin myocardium compact layer is that Reduced thickness of the outer, dense layer of the myocardium. []

The definition of the Cellular urinary casts is that A type of urinary cast composed of cells incorporated in a protein matrix. The cells can be those found in the urinary sediment (erythrocytes, leuklocytes, renal tubular epithelial cells). []
The definition of the Renal tubular epithelial cell casts is that A type of cellular urinary cast composed of renal tubular epithelial cells. []
The definition of the Acellular urinary casts is that A type of urinary cast composed of a proteinaceous matrix without a substantial number of cells. []

The definition of the Hyaline casts is that A type of acellular urinary cast that are composed only of Tamm-Horsfall glycoprotein, a fact which explains their low refractive index. Hyaline casts may display a spectrum of morphologies, which includes fluffy, compact, convoluted or wrinkled casts. Hyaline casts have a smooth texture and usually have parallel sides with clear margins and blunted ends. [PMID:26079824]

The definition of the Granular casts is that A type of acelluar casts that have a surface composed of granules, which can vary in size. The granules can be rather heterogeneous, ranging from fine (finely granular cast) up to coarse (coarsely granular cast), dark, clear, and pigmented. [PMID:26079824]

The definition of the Waxy casts is that A type of acellular urinary casts that display a melted wax (waxy) appearance, which gives them a high refractive index. They are frequently dark, with blunt extremities, indented and cracked edges and a large size, which is often several times that of other types of casts. [PMID:26079824]

The definition of the Fatty casts is that A type of acellular urinary casts that contain lipid droplets, oval fat bodies or cholesterol crystals, and are often associated with the free forms of these elements. Their identification may require the use of polarised light microscopy, under which fatty particles embedded into the cast matrix appear as Maltese crosses. [PMID:26079824]

The definition of the Bacterial cell casts is that A type of urinary cast that contain bacteria. Bacterial casts can be difficult to identify and can be distinguished from other types of casts using phase contrast microscopy. Bacterial casts are diagnostic of acute pyelonephritis or intrinsic renal infection. [PMID:26079824]

The definition of the Reduced lysosomal acid lipase activity is that Reduction in the activity of lysosomal acid lipase (LAL) in the blood. Lysosomal lipase activity is measured. LAL hydrolyzes cholesteryl esters derived from cell internalization of plasma lipoproteins. [PMID:22227072]
The definition of the Striatal T2 hyperintensity is that Abnormally bright T2 signal from the striatum on brain magnetic resonance imaging. [PMID:27058447]

The definition of the Hepatic hemangioma is that A congenital vascular malformation in the liver composed of masses of blood vessels that are atypical or irregular in arrangement and size. [NCIT:C3869, PMID:21191518]

The definition of the Increased pituitary glycoprotein alpha subunit level is that An increased concentration of circulating alpha polypeptide of glycoprotein hormones (NCBI Gene 1081). This alpha subunit is common to luteinizing hormone (LH) , follicle stimulating hormone (FSH) , thyroid stimulating hormone (TSH) and human chorionic gonadotropin (hCG), which are glycoprotein hormones composed of an identical alpha subunit together with a beta subunit that confers biological specificity. The alpha subunit is used as a marker for tumors that produce these hormones. []
The definition of the Decreased lipoprotein lipase activity is that Reduction in the level of lipoprotein lipase in the blood. [PMID:18194851, PMID:30725725]
The definition of the Abnormal circulating hyaluronic acid concentration is that A deviation from the normal concentration of hyaluronic acid in the blood. [PMID:11861239]

The definition of the Elevated cholesterol ester level is that An elevated concentration of circulating cholesterol esters, which are fatty acid esters of cholesterol and make up about two-thirds of total plasma cholesterol. []

The definition of the Elevated circulating 17-hydroxyprogesterone is that An increased level of 17-hydroxyprogesterone in the blood. 17-hydroxyprogesterone is an intermediate steroid in the adrenal biosynthetic pathway from cholesterol to cortisol and is the substrate for steroid 21-hydroxylase. []
The definition of the Decreased circulating dehydroepiandrosterone-sulfate level is that A reduced concentration of dehydroepiandrosterone-sulfate in the blood. []
The definition of the Increased circulating progesterone is that An elevated concentration of progesterone in the blood. []

The definition of the Inappropriate antidiuretic hormone secretion is that A state of increased circulating antidiuretic hormone despite hyponatremia and hypo-osmolality with normal or increased plasma volume. []

The definition of the Reduced radioactive iodine uptake is that A decreased amount of uptake on the radioactive iodine uptake (RAIU) test, which utilizes a radioisotope of iodine to measure how much iodine the thyroid gland absorbs from the blood. The radioactive marker is measured 4-6 hours and in some cases also 24 hours after administration of the radioactive marker. []

The definition of the Increased radioactive iodine uptake is that An elevated amount of uptake on the radioactive iodine uptake (RAIU) test, which utilizes a radioisotope of iodine to measure how much iodine the thyroid gland absorbs from the blood. The radioactive marker is measured 4-6 hours and in some cases also 24 hours after administration of the radioactive marker. []

The definition of the Abnormal radioactive iodine uptake test result is that Any deviation from normal in the amount of uptake on the radioactive iodine uptake (RAIU) test, which utilizes a radioisotope of iodine to measure how much iodine the thyroid gland absorbs from the blood. The radioactive marker is measured 4-6 hours and in some cases also 24 hours after administration of the radioactive marker. []
The definition of the Increased circulating thyroxine-binding globulin level is that An elevated concentration of thyroxine-binding globulin (TBG) in the blood. []
The definition of the Focal pancreatic islet hyperplasia is that Hyperplasia of the islets of Langerhans that affects only certain regions of the pancreas and not others. []
The definition of the Diffuse pancreatic islet hyperplasia is that Hyperplasia of the islets of Langerhans with a generalized distribution. []

The definition of the Intrapulmonary shunt is that Blood flow through a region of the lung in which little or no ventilation takes place, resulting in reduced oxygenation of the blood leaving the lungs. []

The definition of the Perinephric fluid collection is that An accumulation of fluid in one or more of the perinephric spaces, which consist of the subcapsular, perirenal, anterior and posterior pararenal spaces. This abnormality can be demonstrated by cross-sectional imaging, particularly computed tomography. [PMID:12014928]
The definition of the Nasopharyngeal teratoma is that A teratoma arising in the nasopharyngeal region. [PMID:23056797]

The definition of the Abnormal incisura morphology is that An abnormal shape of the incisura, defined as the narrowed downward continuation of the conchal space bounded anteriorly by the borders of the tragus, posteriorly by the antitragus, and along its lower lateral margins and inferior boundary by the connection between the first two. The upper boundary is a somewhat arbitrary line crossing from the apices of the antitragus and the tragus. [PMID:20082456]
The definition of the Increased incisura length is that The length of the incisura from the upper to lower border is greater than that observed in the average population. [PMID:20082456]
The definition of the Decreased incisura length is that The length of the incisura from the upper to lower border is less than that observed in the average population. [PMID:20082456]
The definition of the Narrow incisura width is that Width of the incisura from the anterior to posterior border less than that observed in the average population. [PMID:20082456]
The definition of the Increased incisura width is that Breadth of the incisura from the anterior to posterior border greater than that observed in the average population. [PMID:20082456]

The definition of the Horizontal inferior border of scapula is that A morphological abnormality of the scapula in which there is a flat (horizontal) inferior edge of the scapula. The entire scapula is said to resemble a square, leading to the designation sqaring of the scapula (in Figure 1 of PMID:24706940 the scapulae have a roughly rectangular shape). [PMID:24706940]

The definition of the Neutrophilic infiltration of the skin is that A predominantly neutrophilic infiltrate of the dermis and or epidermis (i.e., a large number of neutrophils inferred to have migrated into the skin). []
The definition of the Predominantly epidermal neutrophilic infiltrate is that Collection of neutrophils in the epidermis. [PMID:17675728]
The definition of the Predominantly dermal neutrophilic infiltrate is that Collection of neutrophils in the dermis. [PMID:17675728]

The definition of the Internally nucleated skeletal muscle fibers is that An abnormally increased proportion of nuclei of sarcomeres with an internal localization. Individual muscle fibers are syncytia, formed by embryonic fusion of many myoblasts or later, myosatellite cells. Each muscle fiber contains many nuclei, peripherally positioned immediately adjacent to the sarcolemmal membrane. In healthy muscle only 3-5% of fibers contain nuclei that are located internally, within the cell, but many disease processes lead to internal nuclei. [PMID:22938878]

The definition of the Necklace skeletal muscle fibers is that A histological alteration of muscle fibers that resembles a necklace (necklace fibers). A substantial proportion of fibers (4-20% in PMID:19084976) show internalized nuclei aligned in a basophilic ring (necklace) at 3 micrometers beneath the sarcolemma. Ultrastructurally, such necklaces consist of myofibrils of smaller diameter, in oblique orientation, surrounded by mitochondria, sarcoplasmic reticulum and glycogen granules. [PMID:19084976]

The definition of the Extrafoveal choroidal neovascularization is that A type of choroidal neovascularization in which the nearest edge of the area of neovascularization is located 200 to 1500 micrometers from the center of the fovea. []

The definition of the Juxtafoveal choroidal neovascularization is that A type of choroidal neovascularization in which the nearest edge of the area of neovascularization is located 1 to 199 micrometers from the center of the fovea. []
The definition of the Subfoveal choroidal neovascularization is that A type of choroidal neovascularization in which the area of neovascularization overlaps with the center of the fovea. []

The definition of the Decreased circulating chylomicron levels is that Reduced plasma concentrations of chylomicrons, the large lipid droplet (up to 100 mm in diameter) of reprocessed lipid synthesized in epithelial cells of the small intestine and containing triacylglycerols, cholesterol esters, and several apolipoproteins. []
The definition of the Decreased circulating very-low-density lipoprotein levels is that A reduction in the amount of very-low-density lipoprotein cholesterol in the blood. []
The definition of the Swollen lip is that Enlargement of the lip typically due to fluid buildup or inflammation.
The definition of the Productive cough is that A cough that produces phlegm or mucus. []
The definition of the Nonproductive cough is that A cough that does not produce phlegm or mucus. []

The definition of the Whooping cough is that A type of cough characterized by a burst of numerous and rapid coughs followed by a long inhaling effort that is accompanied by a high-pitched whooping sound produced by the inhalation of air. [PMID:24219484]

The definition of the Palmar pruritus is that Pruritus is an itch or a sensation that makes a person want to scratch. This term refers to an abnormally increased sensation of itching over the palm(s) of the hand.
The definition of the Parageusia is that A distortion of the sense of taste, often characterized by the sensation of a metallic taste. [PMID:21075995]
The definition of the Lip fissure is that A severe crack in a lip. A lip fissure may be painful, may bleed and often is a recurring manifestation. []
The definition of the Abnormal subclavian artery morphology is that Any anomaly of a subclavian artery. []
The definition of the Dilated left subclavian artery is that Abnormally increased caliber of the left subclavian artery. []
The definition of the Anomalous origin of left subclavian artery is that Origin of the left subclavian artery from an anomalous anatomical location. []

The definition of the Thalamic arteriovenous malformation is that An arteriovenous malformation is a disruption of the normal vascular pattern in which arteries or arterioles connect directly to the venous collection system, bypassing any capillary bed. This term refers to an arteriovenous malformation located in the thalamus. [PMID:23125071]

The definition of the Hypothalamic arteriovenous malformation is that An arteriovenous malformation is a disruption of the normal vascular pattern in which arteries or arterioles connect directly to the venous collection system, bypassing any capillary bed. This term refers to an arteriovenous malformation located in the hypothalamus. [PMID:23125071]

The definition of the Optic nerve arteriovenous malformation is that An arteriovenous malformation is a disruption of the normal vascular pattern in which arteries or arterioles connect directly to the venous collection system, bypassing any capillary bed. This term refers to an arteriovenous malformation located in the optic nerve. [PMID:23125071]

The definition of the Arteriovenous malformation of the maxilla is that An arteriovenous malformation is a disruption of the normal vascular pattern in which arteries or arterioles connect directly to the venous collection system, bypassing any capillary bed. This term refers to an arteriovenous malformation located in the maxilla. [PMID:17082338, PMID:23125071]
The definition of the Delirium is that A state of sudden and severe confusion. []
The definition of the Oophoritis is that An inflammation of the ovary or ovaries. []

The definition of the Triangular tibia is that A short, dysplastic tibia with a triangular shape. Instead of the normal shaft configuration of the tibia, the tibia forms a triangle with the longest side corresponding to the proximal-distal dimension, and the apex of the triangle directed laterally. [PMID:18616733]
The definition of the Bladder polyp is that An abnormal growth that projects from the mucous membrane of the urinary bladder. []

The definition of the Abnormal renal corpuscle morphology is that Any anomolous structure of the renal corpuscle, which is the initial component of the nephron that filters blood. The renal corpuscle consists of a knot of capillaries (glomerulus) that is surrounded by a double-walled capsule (Bowman capsule) that opens into a renal tubule. []
The definition of the Abnormal morphology of Bowman capsule is that A structural anomaly of the double-walled capsule (Bowman capsule) that opens into a renal tubule. []

The definition of the Abnormal podocyte morphology is that Any structural anomaly of the podocyte, which is a highly specialized cell of the Bowman capsule and which forms multiple interdigitating foot processes. Podocytes are interconnected by slit diaphragms and cover the exterior basement membrane surface of the glomerular capillary. [PMID:10662721, PMID:26918173]

The definition of the Podocyte foot process effacement is that An anomaly of podocyte morphology characterized by the loss of the interdigitating foot process pattern (generally called foot process effacement; FPE). The term FPE designates the loss of the usual interdigitating pattern of foot processes of neighboring podocytes, leading to relatively broad expanses of podocyte processes covering the glomerular basement membrane (GBM). It is widely viewed as a pathological derangement that is associated with leakage of macromolecules such as albumin through the glomerular filtration barrier. [PMID:23235479]

The definition of the Abnormal CD69 upregulation upon TCR activation is that Any abnormality in the upregulation of CD69 on T cells after activation via the T cell receptor (TCR). Upregulation of CD69 is one of the earliest and most sensitive measures of antigen recognition in the periphery, and transient expression of CD69 is associated with positive selection in the thymus.
The definition of the Decreased CD69 upregulation upon TCR activation is that Reduced or impaired upregulation of CD69 on T cells after activation via the T cell receptor (TCR).

The definition of the Abnormal CD25 upregulation upon TCR activation is that Any abnormality in the upregulation of CD25 on T cells after activation via the T cell receptor (TCR). CD25 is the alpha chain of the IL2 receptor. Ligation of the T cell antigen receptor leads to the induction of CD25 expression.
The definition of the Decreased CD25 upregulation upon TCR activation is that Decreased or impaired upregulation of CD25 on T cells after activation via the T cell receptor (TCR).

The definition of the Absent ankle pulse is that The pulsation of the posterior tibial artery behind the internal malleolus, or of the dorsalis pedis artery, cannot be detected on physical examination. []
The definition of the Pulmonary arterial atherosclerosis is that Accumulation of lipids and inflammatory cells along the inner walls of the pulmonary artery. []

The definition of the Shock is that The state in which profound and widespread reduction of effective tissue perfusion leads first to reversible, and then if prolonged, to irreversible cellular injury. []

The definition of the Hypovolemic shock is that A state of shock characterized by decreased circulating blood volume in relation to total vascular capacity. This type of shock is characterized by a reduction of diastolic filling pressures. []

The definition of the Distributive shock is that A hyperdynamic process resulting from excessive vasodilatation. Impaired blood flow causes inadequate tissue perfusion, which can lead to end-organ damage [PMID:28238385]

The definition of the Obstructive shock is that A type of shock characterized by inadequate cardiac preload due to obstructed venous return (e.g. pericardial tamponade, tension pneumothorax, abdominal compartment) or obstruction of arterial blood flow (e.g. pulmonary embolism). [PMID:28785436]
The definition of the Abnormal thoracic duct morphology is that Any structural anomaly of the thoracic duct. []

The definition of the Abnormal response to gonadotropin-releasing hormone stimulation test is that An abnormal response to the gonadotropin-releasing hormone (GnRH) stimulation test. This test typically involves intravenous administration of GnRH followed by repeated blood sampling at various time points to measure the levels of luteinizing hormone (LH) and follicle-stimulating hormone (FSH). [PMID:22016677]

The definition of the Increased LH response to gonadotropin-releasing hormone stimulation test is that An abnormally high amount of luteinizing hormone (LH) is released upon gonadotropin-releasing hormone stimulation test. [PMID:22016677]
The definition of the Sialadenitis is that Inflammation of a salivary gland. []

The definition of the Malalignment of the great toenail is that A lateral deviation of the nail plate of the great toe along the longitudinal axis due to the lateral rotation of the nail matrix. The nail plate grows out in ridges. [PMID:27171597]
The definition of the Tufted hairs is that The presence of tufts of 8-15 hairs that appear to emerge from a single follicular orifice. []
The definition of the Flushing is that Recurrent episodes of redness of the skin together with a sensation of warmth or burning of the affected areas of skin. []
The definition of the Abnormal perifollicular morphology is that Any structural anomaly in the areas surrounding the hair follicles. []
The definition of the Perifollicular erythema is that Redness surrounding the hair follicles. [PMID:24574696]

The definition of the Seborrheic keratosis is that A raised growth on the skin of older individuals. The lesion usually is initially light tan and may darken to dark brown or nearly black. The consistent feature of seborrheic keratoses is their waxy, pasted-on or stuck-on look. []

The definition of the Cobblestone-like hyperkeratosis is that The presence of verrucous, cobblestone-like papules and nodules in a region of skin that is said to have an appearance like that of cobblestones. [PMID:18809899]
The definition of the White papule is that A papule with white color. []

The definition of the Tuberous xanthoma is that A type of xanthoma characterized by a nodular form. Tuberous xanthomas are firm subcutaneous nodules,whereby the overlying skin can have red or red-yellow color changes. []

The definition of the Ichthyosis follicularis is that Ichthyosis follicularis is characterized by widespread non inflammatory thorn-like follicular projections. Dyskeratotic papules are most pronounced over the extensor extremities and scalp and are symmetrically distributed. [PMID:14708109, PMID:21600032]
The definition of the Cutaneous abscess is that A circumscribed area of pus or necrotic debris in the skin. []
The definition of the Digital pitting scar is that Pinhole-sized concave depressions with hyperkeratosis in the skin of a finger or toe. [PMID:8358096]
The definition of the Hypoplastic right atrium is that Underdeveloped, small right heart atrium. []
The definition of the Left atrial enlargement is that Increase in size of the left atrium. []
The definition of the Atrial septal hypertrophy is that An abnormal increase in the thickness of the atrial septum. [PMID:12664819]

The definition of the Unroofed coronary sinus is that Unroofed coronary sinus (CS) is a rare congenital cardiac anomaly in which there is partial (either focal or fenestrated) or complete absence of the roof of the CS, which results in a communication between the CS and the LA. Unroofed CS is the rarest type of atrial septal defect. It is often associated with persistent left superior vena cava (LSVC) and other forms of complex congenital heart disease, usually heterotaxia syndromes. The morphological types have been classified into 4 groups: Type I, completely unroofed with persistent LSVC; type II, completely unroofed without persistent LSVC; type III, partially unroofed mid portion; and type IV, partially unroofed terminal portion. [PMID:19398672]
The definition of the Coronary sinus enlargement is that Abnormal increase in size of the coronary sinus. []
The definition of the Elevated left atrial pressure is that An abnormal increase in magnitude of the pressure in the left atrium. []
The definition of the Abnormal circulating properdin level is that A deviation from the normal concentration of properdin in the blood. [PMID:16301317]

The definition of the Peripheral arterial calcification is that An accumulation of calcium and phosphate in arteries with mineral deposits in the intimal or medial layer of the vessel wall. [PMID:24402839, PMID:26811161]

The definition of the Lower extremity peripheral arterial calcification is that An accumulation of calcium and phosphate in arteries with mineral deposits in the intimal or medial layer of the vessel wall of the leg. []

The definition of the Femoral arterial calcification is that An accumulation of calcium and phosphate in arteries with mineral deposits in the intimal or medial layer of the vessel wall of the femoral artery. []

The definition of the Iliac arterial calcification is that An accumulation of calcium and phosphate in arteries with mineral deposits in the intimal or medial layer of the vessel wall of the iliac artery. []

The definition of the Tibial arterial calcification is that An accumulation of calcium and phosphate in arteries with mineral deposits in the intimal or medial layer of the vessel wall of the tibial artery. []

The definition of the Intracranial arterial calcification is that An accumulation of calcium and phosphate in arteries with mineral deposits in the intimal or medial layer of the vessel wall in an artery that is located within the skull (intracranial). []

The definition of the Internal carotid artery calcification is that An accumulation of calcium and phosphate in arteries with mineral deposits in the intimal or medial layer of the vessel wall in the internal carotid artery. []

The definition of the Vertebral artery calcification is that An accumulation of calcium and phosphate in arteries with mineral deposits in the intimal or medial layer of the vessel wall in the vertebral artery. []

The definition of the Cerebral artery calcification is that An accumulation of calcium and phosphate in arteries with mineral deposits in the intimal or medial layer of the vessel wall in a cerebral artery. []

The definition of the Basilar artery calcification is that An accumulation of calcium and phosphate in arteries with mineral deposits in the intimal or medial layer of the vessel wall in the basilar artery. []

The definition of the Middle cerebral artery calcification is that An accumulation of calcium and phosphate in arteries with mineral deposits in the intimal or medial layer of the vessel wall in the middle cerebral artery. []

The definition of the Abdominal aortic calcification is that An accumulation of calcium and phosphate in arteries with mineral deposits in the intimal or medial layer of the vessel wall in abdominal aorta. []

The definition of the Carotid artery calcification is that An accumulation of calcium and phosphate in arteries with mineral deposits in the intimal or medial layer of the vessel wall in a carotid artery. []

The definition of the External carotid artery calcification is that An accumulation of calcium and phosphate in arteries with mineral deposits in the intimal or medial layer of the vessel wall in the external carotid artery. []
The definition of the Abnormal ventricular myocardium morphology is that A structural anomaly of the muscle layer of the heart wall of a cardiac ventricle. []

The definition of the Fatty replacement of ventricular myocardial tissue is that Presence of an increased amount of fat tissue within a cardiac ventricle with corresponding reduction of muscle tissue. []
The definition of the Myofiber disarray is that A nonparallel arrangement of cardiac myocytes. [PMID:7890275]

The definition of the Cardiomyocyte hypertrophy is that An increase in cell size, enhanced protein synthesis, and heightened organization of the sarcomere within cardiac myocytes. [PMID:15066961, PMID:7626345]
The definition of the Cardiomyocyte mitochondrial proliferation is that An abnormal increase in the number of mitochondria per cardiac myocyte. []
The definition of the Myocardial immune cell infiltration is that An increase in the number of immune cells in myocardial tissue (which can be assumed to have migrated into the myocardium). []
The definition of the Myocardial lymphocytic infiltration is that An increase in the number of lymphocytes in myocardial tissue. []
The definition of the Myocardial eosinophilic infiltration is that An increase in the number of eosinophils in myocardial tissue. []

The definition of the Myocardial multinucleated giant cells is that The presence of extremely large cells with multiple nuclei. The so-called giant cells are thought to be of macrophage origin. [PMID:26140040]

The definition of the Myocardial granulomatous infiltrates is that The presence of multiple granulomata (small nodular inflammatory lesions containing grouped mononuclear phagocytes) in the myocardium. []

The definition of the Monoclonal light chain cardiac amyloidosis is that A type of cardiac amyloidosis related to deposition of an immunoglobulin light chain. The current gold standard of amyloid typing is to determine the precursor protein using laser microdissection mass spectrometry. [PMID:28456755]

The definition of the Transthyretin cardiac amyloidosis is that A type of cardiac amyloidosis related to deposition of transthyretin (TTR), which is identified by immunohistochemical staining. [PMID:22949539]
The definition of the Perivascular cardiac fibrosis is that A type of myocardial fibrosis characterized by excessive diffuse collagen accumulation concentrated in perivascular spaces. [PMID:10435025]
The definition of the Interstitial cardiac fibrosis is that A type of myocardial fibrosis characterized by excessive diffuse collagen accumulation concentrated in interstitial spaces. [PMID:10435025]
The definition of the Perivascular myocardial immune cell infiltration is that An increase in the number of immune cells in myocardial tissue concentrated in the spaces surrounding blood vessels. []

The definition of the Abnormal cardiomyocyte morphology is that Any structural anomaly of cardiomyocytes, which are terminally differentiated muscle cells in the heart that are interconnected end to end by gap junctions, which allows coordinated contraction of heart tissue. []

The definition of the Cardiomyocyte degeneration is that Deterioration of cardiomyocyte characterized by abnormal features such as loss of myofilaments, occurrence of cellular sequestration, decreased mitochondrial sizes and cellular debris. []

The definition of the Myocardial sarcomeric disarray is that A disruption of the structure of the sarcomeres of cardiomyocytes. The sarcomere is the repeating unit between two Z lines comprised largely of myosin and actin that mediates contractility, and normally sarcomeres are aligned with the long axis of cells, with the Z bands being in register throughout the length of the cardiac myocytes. [PMID:22311886, PMID:7788887]
The definition of the Cardiomyocyte inclusion bodies is that Nuclear or cytoplasmic aggregates of stainable substances within cardiomyocytes. []
The definition of the Abnormal cardiomyocyte mitochondrial morphology is that An anomaly of the structure of mitochondria within cardiomyocytes. []
The definition of the Intranuclear cardiomyocyte mitochondria is that Abnormal localization of mitochondria within the nuclei of cardiomyocytes. [PMID:22948484]

The definition of the Abnormal cardiomyocyte connexin43 staining is that Anomalous staining of Connexin43 in cardiomyocytes. Connexin43 (Cx43) is the primary gap junction protein in the working myocardium. Cx43 exhibits increased localization at the lateral membranes of cardiomyocytes in a variety of heart diseases. [PMID:20167932]

The definition of the Abnormal cardiomyocyte plakoglobin staining is that Anomalous staining of plakoglobin in cardiomyocytes. Plakoglobin is a component of desmosomes in cardiomyocytes. [PMID:25196244]
The definition of the Abnormal cadiomyocyte dystrophin staining is that Anomalous staining of dystrophin in cardiomyocytes. [PMID:23330010]

The definition of the Gastric arteriovenous malformation is that An anomalous configuration of blood vessels that shunts arterial blood directly into veins without passing through the capillaries and that is located in the stomach. []

The definition of the Duodenal arteriovenous malformation is that An anomalous configuration of blood vessels that shunts arterial blood directly into veins without passing through the capillaries and that is located in the duodenum. []

The definition of the Jejunal arteriovenous malformation is that An anomalous configuration of blood vessels that shunts arterial blood directly into veins without passing through the capillaries and that is located in the jejunum. []

The definition of the Pelvic arteriovenous malformation is that An anomalous configuration of blood vessels that shunts arterial blood directly into veins without passing through the capillaries and that is located in the pelvis. [PMID:11292918]

The definition of the Colonic arteriovenous malformation is that An anomalous configuration of blood vessels that shunts arterial blood directly into veins without passing through the capillaries and that is located in the colon. []

The definition of the Rectal arteriovenous malformation is that An anomalous configuration of blood vessels that shunts arterial blood directly into veins without passing through the capillaries and that is located in the rectum. []

The definition of the Uterine arteriovenous malformation is that An anomalous configuration of blood vessels that shunts arterial blood directly into veins without passing through the capillaries and that is located in the uterus. []

The definition of the Dextrotransposition of the great arteries is that A type of transposition of the great arteries (TGA) in which aorta is in front of and primarily to the right of the pulmonary artery. This is the most common kind of TGA. [PMID:25082585]

The definition of the Levotransposition of the great arteries is that A type of transposition of the great arteries (TGA) in which aorta is in front of and primarily to the left of the pulmonary artery. []
The definition of the Cardiac sarcoma is that A malignant soft tissue neoplasm that arises from the heart. [NCIT:C7723]

The definition of the Calcified amorphous tumor of the heart is that A non-neoplastic cardiac tumor characterized by calcification and eosinophilic amorphous material in the background of dense collagenous fibrous tissue. [PMID:24932362]
The definition of the Otitis media with effusion is that Otitis media characterized by thick or sticky fluid behind the tympanic membrane.

The definition of the Sleep onset Insomnia is that Difficulty initiating sleep, that is, increased sleep onset latency, refers to the condition where it takes 30 minutes or more to fall asleep. [PMID:35460140]

The definition of the Maintenance insomnia is that Individuals affected by abnormal difficulty in staying asleep tend to wake up at night and struggle to return to sleep. This condition typically involves spending more than 30 minutes awake during the night. [PMID:35460140]

The definition of the Terminal insomnia is that A type of insomnia characterized by waking up too early in the morning is known as early morning awakening. The termination of sleep must occur at least 30 minutes before the desired time. [PMID:35460140]

The definition of the Glomeruloid hemangioma is that A histologically distinctive, cutaneous, benign vascular tumor that is characterized by a solitary or multiple blue-red papules and histologically resembles renal glomeruli. [PMID:23716835]

The definition of the Vegetative state is that The absence of wakefulness and consciousness, but in contrast to a coma, there is involuntary opening of the eyes and movements such as teeth grinding, yawning, or thrashing of the extremities. [PMID:18771395]

The definition of the Cutaneous sclerotic plaque is that A solid, raised, plateau-like (flat-topped) lesion greater than 1 cm in diameter that is characterized by hardening (sclerosis) of the affected skin area (related to collagen thickening). []
The definition of the Yellow skin plaque is that A solid, raised, plateau-like (flat-topped) lesion greater than 1 cm in diameter and that has a yellow color. []
The definition of the Palpable purpura is that A type of purpura in which the lesions are raised (and can therefore be appreciated upon palpation). []
The definition of the Ecchymosis is that A purpuric lesion that is larger than 1 cm in diameter. []
The definition of the Macular purpura is that Purpura that is flat (non-palpable, not raised). []
The definition of the Palate neoplasm is that A neoplasm that affects the hard palate, soft palate, or uvula. [NCIT:C4402]

The definition of the Metaphyseal striations is that Longitudinal densities on radiographs located in a metaphysis (the narrow region of a long bone between the epiphysis and the diaphysis). [PMID:18203204]
The definition of the Intestinal perforation is that A hole (perforation) in the wall of the intestine. []
The definition of the Colon perforation is that A hole (perforation) in the wall of the colon. [PMID:22334860]
The definition of the Small intestinal perforation is that A hole (perforation) in the wall of the small intestine. []
The definition of the Rectal perforation is that A hole (perforation) in the wall of the rectum. [PMID:28290145]
The definition of the Cold paresis is that Increased muscle weakness upon exposure to cold temperatures. [PMID:20803025]
The definition of the Stiff tongue is that Increased rigidity and reduced mobility of the tongue. []
The definition of the Ankle weakness is that Reduced strength of the muscles that lift or otherwise move the foot at the ankle. []
The definition of the Refractory is that Applies to a sign or symptom that is difficult to treat or cure. []
The definition of the Abnormal lymphocyte proliferation is that Any abnormality in the multiplication or reproduction of lymphocytes, which results in the expansion of a cell population. []
The definition of the Abnormal T cell proliferation is that Any abnormality in the multiplication or reproduction of T cells, which results in the expansion of a cell population. []
The definition of the Abnormal B cell proliferation is that Any abnormality in the multiplication or reproduction of B cells, which results in the expansion of a cell population. []

The definition of the Decreased lymphocyte proliferation in response to mitogen is that A decreased proliferative response of lymphocytes in vitro or in vivo, when stimulated with mitogens, such as phytohemagglutinin (PHA). []

The definition of the Decreased lymphocyte proliferation in response to anti-CD3 is that A decreased proliferative response of lymphocytes in vitro or in vivo, when stimulated with an anti-CD3 antibody against the T-cell co-receptor, CD3. []
The definition of the Abnormal lymphocyte surface marker expression is that Abnormal amount of a protein that is normally present on the cell surface of lymphocytes. []
The definition of the Reduced T cell CD40 expression is that A deficiency in the expression of the CD40 ligand on the surface of activated T-lymphocytes. []

The definition of the Megakaryocyte nucleus hypolobulation is that The presence of megakaryocytes in the bone marrow whose nuclei are less lobulated than expected for the size of the nucleus. [PMID:27107657]

The definition of the Increased micromegakaryocyte count is that The presence of abnormally high numbers of micromegakaryocytes in the bone marrow. Micromegakaryocytes are mononuclear diploid cells, with a nucleus similar in size to that of a myeloblast or promyelocyte with the cell being less than 30 micrometers in diameter. [PMID:27107657]
The definition of the Increased multinucleated megakaryocyte count is that The presence of abnormally high numbers of multinucleated megakaryocytes in the bone marrow. [PMID:27107657]

The definition of the Megakaryocyte nucleus hyperlobulation is that The presence of megakaryocytes in the bone marrow whose nuclei are more lobulated than expected for the size of the nucleus. [PMID:27107657]
The definition of the Abnormal MHC II surface expression is that A deviation from the normal level of major histocompatibility complex class II molecules expressed at the cell surface. []
The definition of the Reduced MHC II surface expression is that A reduction from the normal level of major histocompatibility complex class II molecules expressed at the cell surface. []
The definition of the Elevated MHC II surface expression is that An increase above the normal level of major histocompatibility complex class II molecules expressed at the cell surface. []
The definition of the Abnormal proportion of CD4 T cells is that Any abnormality in the proportion of CD4-positive T cells relative to the total number of T cells. []
The definition of the Abnormal proportion of CD8 T cells is that Any abnormality in the proportion of CD8 T cells relative to the total number of T cells. []
The definition of the Abnormal CD4:CD8 ratio is that Any abnormality in the relative amount of CD4+ and CD8+ T lymphocytes. [PMID:29095912]
The definition of the Abnormal proportion of naive T cells is that Any abnormality in the proportion of naive T cells relative to the total number of T cells. [PMID:12133935]
The definition of the Reduced proportion of naive T cells is that An abnormally decreased proportion of naive T cells relative to the total number of T cells.
The definition of the Elevated proportion of naive T cells is that An abnormally increased proportion of naive T cells relative to the total number of T cells. [PMID:12133935]
