Clinical imaging of lesions may be expected to contribute greatly to the understanding of type VI lesions and the associated clinical syndromes. [PMID:7648691]
The definition of the Renal artery atherosclerosis is that An atherosclerotic lesion located in the renal artery. []
The definition of the Abnormal stool composition is that Abnormal level of metabolite or other abnormal analyte result in a stool test. []
The definition of the Increased stool alpha1-antitrypsin concentration is that An abnormally elevated amount of alpha1-antitrypsin in the feces. []

The definition of the Erythroid dysplasia is that Dysplasia in the erythroid lineage, which presents with a variety of morphological changes in the bone marrow, including nuclear budding or irregular nuclear contour in erythroblasts. [PMID:26791933]

The definition of the Megakaryocyte dysplasia is that The presence of micro-megakaryocytes, hypo-lobed, or non-lobed nuclei in megakaryocytes of all sizes and multiple, widely-separated nuclei. [PMID:27127725]

The definition of the Opportunistic infection is that An infection that is caused by a pathogen that would generally not be able to cause an infection in a host with a normal immune system. Such pathogens take advantage of the opportunity, so to speak, that is provided by a weakened immune system.
The definition of the Severe viral infection is that An unusually severe viral infection. [PMID:21960712]
The definition of the Severe cytomegalovirus infection is that An unusually severe infection by cytomegalovirus. [PMID:12588074]
The definition of the Severe Epstein Barr virus infection is that An unusually severe Epstein Barr virus (EBV) infection. []
The definition of the Severe adenovirus infection is that An unusually severe adenovirus infection. [PMID:24678403]
The definition of the Severe parainfluenza infection is that An unusually severe infection by a parainfluenza virus. []
The definition of the Disseminated viral infection is that A viral infection that fails to be contained by the immune sytem and spreads throughout the body. [PMID:28476145]
The definition of the Disseminated infection with live vaccine virus is that A dissemination viral infection caused by a live attenuated vaccine virus. [PMID:25452596]
The definition of the Disseminated cryptosporidium infection is that Failure to contain infection by a protozoan of the genus Cryptosporidium, leading to spread to many parts of the body. []
The definition of the Invasive parasitic infection is that A parasitic infection whereby the parasite invades (migrates through) tissues of the infected host. []
The definition of the Anterior chamber inflammatory cells is that The presence of inflammatory cells in the aqueous humor of the anterior chamber of the eye. []
The definition of the Anterior chamber red blood cells is that The presence of erythrocyte in the aqueous humor of the anterior chamber of the eye. []
The definition of the Abnormal ear morphology is that Any structural anomaly of the ear. []
The definition of the Abnormal ear physiology is that Any functional anomaly of the ear. []

The definition of the Compensatory head posture is that A compensatory head posture occurs when the head is deviated out of the normal primary straight head position in order to compensate for an ocular problem. []
The definition of the Compensatory chin depression is that A tendency to hold the chin depressed (lowered) to compensate for a limitation of eye movement. []
The definition of the Compensatory face turn to the right is that A tendency to turn the face to the right to compensate for a limitation of eye movement. []
The definition of the Compensatory face turn to the left is that A tendency to turn the face to the left to compensate for a limitation of eye movement. []
The definition of the Compensatory head tilt to the right shoulder is that A tendency to tilt the head towards the right shoulder to compensate for a limitation of eye movement. []
The definition of the Compensatory head tilt to the left shoulder is that A tendency to tilt the head towards the left shoulder to compensate for a limitation of eye movement. []
The definition of the Asymmetric abdominal aortic aneurysm is that An abdominal aortic aneurysm that is not symmetric around its axis (not axisymmetric). [PMID:12751282]
The definition of the Constant exotropia is that A form of divergent strabismus (exotropia) in which the eye turns outward at all distances and at all times.

The definition of the Distance exotropia is that A type of divergent strabismus (exotropia) in which an eye tends to turn outwards (i.e., the eye squints) mainly when looking at distant objects. The eyes tend to remain straight when they look at near objects. Distance exotropia may be constant or intermittent.
The definition of the Near exotropia is that An intermittent exotropia where there is binocular single vision on distance fixation and exotropia at near (intermittent or constant).
The definition of the Cyclic exotropia is that A type of exotropia (divergent strabismus) in which binocular single vision alternates with large angle exotropia in rhythmic cycle.
The definition of the Alternating exotropia is that A type of exotropia in which either eye may be used for fixation.
The definition of the Consecutive exotropia is that Exotropia in an individual who has previously had esotropia or esophoria.

The definition of the True distance exotropia is that Exotropia (intermittent or constant) on distance fixation with binocular single vision on near fixation under all testing conditions. The accommodative convergence/accommodation (AC:A) ratio is within normal limits.

The definition of the Simulated distance exotropia is that Exotropia (intermittent or constant) worse for distance fixation in which the near angle of deviation increases (or near exophoria becomes exotropia) with: (1) prolonged disruption of fusion and/or (2) elimination of accommodation. []
The definition of the Sensory exotropia is that A type of divergent strabismus (exotropia) that develops in a poorly seeing eye.
The definition of the Near esotropia is that An intermittent esotropia where there is binocular single vision on distance fixation and esotropia at near even when the accommodation is relieved.
The definition of the Secondary esotropia is that Convergent squint which follows loss or impairment of vision.
The definition of the Microtropia is that A small angle heterotropia (usually of 10 diopters or less) in which a form of binocular single vision occurs.
The definition of the Hypophoria is that A form of latent strabismus (heterophoria) in which, on dissociation, the occluded eye deviates downwards.

The definition of the Incyclotropia is that A type of cyclotropia (torsion of one or both eye around the visual axis of the eyes) in which the upper poles of the globes are rotated inward (medially) to each other.

The definition of the Excyclotropia is that A type of cyclotropia (torsion of one or both eye around the visual axis of the eyes) in which the upper poles of the globes are rotated outward (laterally) to each other.
The definition of the Mild hypermetropia is that A form of hypermetropia with not more than +2.00 diopters.
The definition of the Moderate hypermetropia is that A form of hypermetropia with more than +2.00 diopters but not more than +5.00 diopters.
The definition of the Axial myopia is that A form of myopia related to an axial length above the norm and too long for the refractive power of the whole optical system of the eye.
The definition of the Increased tear production is that Increased lacrimation owing to overproduction of tears.

The definition of the Increased basal tear production is that A form of watery eye associated with overproduction of tears due to an increased parasympathetic drive to the secretory component of the lacrimal system (lacrimal gland); this could be due to pro-secretory drug use (e.g. pilocarpine) or autonomic disturbance.

The definition of the Reflex tearing is that A form of watery eye associated with overproduction of tears due to reflex tearing in response to a local irritant (e.g. trichiasis or foreign body), chronic ocular surface disease (e.g. blepharitis) or systemic disease (e.g. thyroid eye disease).

The definition of the Lacrimal pump failure is that A form of watery eye associated with abnormal lid tone and/or lid position. The former is due to lid laxity (common involutional change in the elderly) or a weak orbicularis muscle (e.g. due to VII cranial nerve palsy). The latter is typically associated with ectropion causing punctal eversion.

The definition of the Involutional entropion is that An abnormal inversion of the eyelid towards the globe resulting from inferior retractor muscle dysfunction with tissue laxity and, possibly, overriding of the preseptal orbicularis muscle over the pretarsal orbicularis muscle.

The definition of the Cicatricial entropion is that Abnormal inversion (turning inward) of the eyelid towards the globe associated with scarring that vertically shortens the posterior lamella of the eyelid.

The definition of the Mechanical entropion is that A type of entropion (abnormal inversion of the eyelid towards the globe) that is related to a mass effect of a lesion (e.g., a tumor) that pulls the eyelid margin away from the globe.
The definition of the Abnormal oblique muscle physiology is that A functional anomaly of the inferior or superior oblique muscle.
The definition of the Abnormal horizontal rectus muscle physiology is that A functional anomaly of the medial rectus muscle or lateral rectus muscle. []

The definition of the Inferior oblique muscle underaction is that Reduced ocular movement by the inferior oblique muscle which improves on testing ductions, typically associated with neurogenic palsy.
The definition of the Inferior rectus muscle underaction is that Reduced movement by the inferior rectus muscle which improves on testing ductions, typically associated with neurogenic palsy.

The definition of the Inferior rectus muscle overaction is that Excessive action of the inferior rectus muscle caused by increased innervation typically as a consequence of palsy or limitation to the ipsilateral antagonist or contralateral synergist.
The definition of the Superior rectus muscle weakness is that Decreased strength of the superior rectus muscle. []

The definition of the Superior rectus muscle overaction is that Excessive action of the superior rectus muscle caused by increased innervation typically as a consequence of palsy or limitation to the ipsilateral antagonist or contralateral synergist.
The definition of the Superior rectus muscle rescriction is that Mechanical limitation of the range of movement of the superior rectus muscle.
The definition of the Superior rectus muscle underaction is that Reduced movement of the superior rectus muscle which improves on testing ductions, typically associated with neurogenic palsy.
The definition of the Abnormal vertical rectus muscle physiology is that A functional anomaly of the superior or inferior rectus muscle.
The definition of the Abnormal lateral rectus muscle physiology is that A functional anomaly of the lateral rectus muscle. []
The definition of the Lateral rectus muscle weakness is that Decreased strength (ability to move) of the lateral rectus muscle.
The definition of the Lateral rectus muscle underaction is that Reduced movement of the lateral rectus muscle which improves on testing ductions, typically associated with neurogenic palsy.

The definition of the Lateral rectus muscle overaction is that Excessive action of the lateral rectus muscle caused by increased innervation typically as a consequence of palsy or limitation to the ipsilateral antagonist or contralateral synergist. []
The definition of the Medial rectus muscle weakness is that Decreased strength of the medial rectus muscle.

The definition of the Medial rectus muscle overaction is that Excessive action of the medial rectus muscle caused by increased innervation typically as a consequence of palsy or limitation to the ipsilateral antagonist or contralateral synergist. []
The definition of the Abnormal rectus muscle physiology is that A functional anomaly of a vertical or horizontal rectus muscle.
The definition of the Medial rectus muscle underaction is that Reduced movement of the medial rectus muscle which improves on testing ductions, typically associated with neurogenic palsy.
The definition of the Medial rectus muscle restriction is that Mechanical limitation of the range of movement of the medial rectus muscle.
The definition of the Lateral rectus muscle restriction is that Mechanical limitation of the range of movement of the lateral rectus muscle. []
The definition of the Basic (constant) esotropia is that A form of convergent strabismus (esotropia) in which the deviation is present under all conditions (ie at all distances and at all times).
The definition of the Non-accomodative esotropia is that A form of esotropia in which the angle of deviation is not affected by accommodative effort.

The definition of the Infantile (constant) esotropia is that Constant esotropia occurring before 6 months of age. It is typically associated with a large angle of deviation, alternating fixation (therefore low risk of amblyopia) and poor potential for binocular single vision. Other features that might be present in individuals with infantile (constant) esotropia include latent nystagmus or manifest latent nystagmus, dissociated vertical divergence, cyclotropia, abnormal head posture, limited abduction.

The definition of the Distance esotropia is that An intermittent esotropia where binocular single vision is present on near fixation and an esotropia on distance fixation. Often associated with myopia and aging.
The definition of the Cyclic esotropia is that Convergent strabismus in which normal binocular single vision is alternating with large angle esotropia in rhythmic cycle.

The definition of the Fully accomodative esotropia is that Esotropia in which normal binocular single vision is present for all distances when the hypermetropic refractive error is corrected. Esotropia is present for near and distance on accommodation without correction.

The definition of the Partially accomodative esotropia is that A form of constant esotropia in which the angle of deviation is partially affected by accommodative effort. Typically there is esotropia at near and distance with hypermetropic correction and the angle of deviation increases without glasses.

The definition of the Convergence excess esotropia is that An intermittent esotropia with binocular single vision present at distance fixation but esotropia on accommodation for near fixation. Usually associated with hypermetropia but patients can be emmetropic and rarely myopic. Associated with a high accommodative convergence/accommodation (AC/A) ratio.
The definition of the Consecutive esotropia is that Esotropia in a patient who has previously had exotropia or exophoria; may be constant or intermittent and usually follows surgical overcorrection.
The definition of the Parafoveal fixation is that Fixation of an object in the area adjacent to the fovea.
The definition of the Peripheral fixation is that Fixation of an object in a peripheral area of the retina.
The definition of the Epicanthus palpebralis is that A type of epicanthus in which a medial vertical fold is present between upper and lower lids.
The definition of the Epicanthus tarsalis is that A type of epicanthus in which a primarily upper lid fold is present.
The definition of the Abnormal posterior circulating artery morphology is that Any structural anomaly of the posterior circulating artery (PCOM). []
The definition of the Posterior communicating artery aneurysm is that A widening (ballooning) localized in the wall of the posterior communicating artery. []

The definition of the Posterior communicating artery infundibulum is that A funnel-shaped symmetrical enlargement of the origin of the posterior communicating artery at its junction with the internal carotid artery. [PMID:9848859]
The definition of the Neurogenic strabismus is that An ocular deviation caused by a palsy to one or more of the extraocular muscles or nerves supplying them.

The definition of the Cyclotropia is that A form of manifest strabismus (heterotropia) in which the one eye is wheel rotated so that the upper end of its vertical axis is nasal (incyclotropia) or temporal (excyclotropia).
The definition of the Cyclophoria is that A form of latent strabismus (heterophoria) in which the occluded eye wheel-rotates on dissociation.

The definition of the Incyclophoria is that A type of cyclophoria (latent strabismus in which the occluded eye wheel-rotates on dissociation.) in which the upper poles of the globes are rotated inward (medially) to each other.

The definition of the Excyclophoria is that A type of cyclophoria (latent strabismus in which the occluded eye wheel-rotates on dissociation.) in which the upper poles of the globes are rotated outward (laterally) to each other. []
The definition of the Eosinophilic ascites is that A type of ascites in which there are large numbers of eosinophils in the ascitis fluid. [PMID:27721930]
The definition of the Microtropia with identity is that A type of microtropia with no manifest movement on cover test, the eccentric fixation point coinciding with the angle of ARC.
The definition of the Microtropia without identity is that A type of microtropia in which the manifest movement is demonstrated on the cover-uncover test.
The definition of the Absent coronary sinus is that A developmental defect in which the coronary sinus fails to form.

The definition of the Abnormal ascending aorta morphology is that Any structural anomaly of the portion of the aorta that arises from the base of the left ventricle and extends upward to the aortic arch and from which the coronary arteries arise. [MP:0009867]
The definition of the Abnormal eyelid movement is that An abnormality in voluntary or involuntary eyelid movements or their control. []
The definition of the Cogan lid twitch is that Transient eyelid retraction during refixation from down to straight ahead.
The definition of the Oblique astigmatism is that Astigmatism in which the refractive power of the vertical meridian is the greatest.

The definition of the With the rule astigmatism is that Refractive error in which the vertical meridian is relatively hypermetropic and the horizontal meridian is relatively myopic (or ocular astigmatism in which the refractive power of the horizontal meridian is the greatest).
The definition of the Against the rule astigmatism is that Astigmatism with more plus power on the horizontal meridian. []

The definition of the Mixed astigmatism is that A type of astigmatism in which an unequal curvature of the cornea and some cases additionally of the lens causes one meridian of the eye to be hyperopic (farsighted) and a second meridian that is perpendicular to the first to be myopic (nearsighted).
The definition of the Lenticular astigmatism is that A type of astigmatism related to an irregular shape of the lens. []
The definition of the Irregular astigmatism is that A type of astigmatism in which the principle meridians are not 90 degrees apart and which is associated with loss of vision. []
The definition of the Increased serum leptin is that An increased concentration of leptin in the blood. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:RGD_sjwang]
The definition of the Decreased circulating glycerol level is that A decrease below the normal concentration of glycerol in the blood. []
The definition of the Abnormal circulating glycerol level is that Any deviation from the normal concentration of glycerol in the blood. []

The definition of the Elevated apolipoprotein B level is that Increased circulating level of apolipoprotein B, which is the main apolipoprotein of chylomicrons and low density lipoproteins. It occurs in plasma as two main isoforms, apoB-48 and apoB-100.

The definition of the Decreased apolipoprotein AI level is that Concentration of apolipoprotein A-I below the lower limit of normal. Apolipoprotein A-I is the major protein component of high density lipoprotein (HDL) in plasma. Defects in this gene are associated with HDL deficiencies, including Tangier disease.

The definition of the Elevated apolipoprotein A-II level is that An increased concentration in blood of apolipoprotein A-II, a major component of HDL particles, associated with triglyceride and glucose metabolism.
The definition of the Vocal cord dysfunction is that Any functional anomaly of the vocal cord. []
The definition of the Fundus hemorrhage is that Bleeding within the fundus of the eye. []

The definition of the Intraretinal hemorrhage is that A subtype of fundus hemorrhage occurring within the neurosensory retina. Intraretinal haemorrhages may be 'dot' or' blot' shaped or flame shaped depending upon their depth within the retina.
The definition of the Absent pigmentation of chest is that Lack of skin pigmentation (coloring) of the chest.
The definition of the Onychogryposis of fingernail is that Thickened fingernails. []
The definition of the Abnormality of the tympanic membrane is that An abnormality of the tympanic membrane []
The definition of the Neoplasm of the outer ear is that A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the outer ear.
The definition of the Neoplasm of the inner ear is that A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the inner ear.
The definition of the Neoplasm of the ceruminal gland is that A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the ceruminal gland.
The definition of the Lipogranulomatosis is that Yellow nodules of lipoid material are deposited in the skin and mucosae. This gives rise to granulomatous reactions. []
The definition of the Orthokeratosis is that Formation of an anuclear keratin layer []
The definition of the Chapped lip is that Cracking, fissuring, and peeling of the skin of the lips. []

The definition of the Inappropriate sinus tachycardia is that Inappropriate sinus tachycardia is a nonparoxysmal tachyarrhythmia characterized by an increased resting heart rate (HR) and/or an exaggerated HR response to minimal exertion or a change in body posture. HR is constantly above the physiological range with no appropriate relation to metabolic or physiological demands.
The definition of the Scaling skin is that Refers to the loss of the outer layer of the epidermis in large, scale-like flakes. []
The definition of the APUdoma is that An endocrine tumor arising from an APUD cell. []

The definition of the Mild microcephaly is that Decreased occipito-frontal (head) circumference (OFC). For the microcephaly OFC must be between -3 SD and -2 SD compared to appropriate, age matched, normal standards (i.e. -3 SD <= OFC < -2 SD). []

The definition of the Encephalomalacia is that Encephalomalacia is the softening or loss of brain tissue after cerebral infarction, cerebral ischemia, infection, craniocerebral trauma, or other injury.

The definition of the Motor impersistence is that The inability to maintain postures or positions (such as keeping eyes closed, protruding the tongue, maintaining conjugate gaze steadily in a fixed direction, or making a prolonged 'ah' sound) without repeated prompts. [DOI:10.1007/978-0-387-79948-3_2046, https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0003-6754]

The definition of the Simultanapraxia is that A subset of motor impersistence, defined as the inability to perform more than two of the simple voluntary acts simultaneously, such as closing the eyes and protruding the tongue. [DOI:10.1007/978-0-387-79948-3_2046, https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0003-6754]
The definition of the Abnormal CSF neopterin level is that Abnormal concentration of neopterin in the cerebrospinal fluid (CSF). []
The definition of the Elevated CSF neopterin level is that Increased concentration of neopterin in the cerebrospinal fluid (CSF). []
The definition of the Decreased CSF neopterin level is that Decreased concentration of neopterin in the cerebrospinal fluid (CSF). []
The definition of the Abnormal CSF biopterin level is that Abnormal concentration of biopterin in the cerebrospinal fluid (CSF). []
The definition of the Elevated CSF biopterin level is that Concentration of biopterin in the cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) above the upper limit of normal. []
The definition of the Decreased CSF biopterin level is that Concentration of biopterin in the cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) below the lower limit of normal. []
The definition of the Abnormality of the skin of the palm is that An abnormality of the skin of the palm, that is, the skin of the front of the hand. []
The definition of the Risus sardonicus is that Fixed sarcastic grimace and anxious expression. Caused by spasms of the masseter and other facial muscles. []
The definition of the Hypopnea is that Hypopnea is referring to breathing that is abnormally shallow. []
The definition of the Abnormal insulin level is that An abnormal concentration of insulin in the body. []
The definition of the Hypoinsulinemia is that A decreased concentration of insulin in the blood. []

The definition of the Reduced natural killer cell number is that Less than normal number of natural killer cells, a type of lymphocyte in the innate immune system with an ability to mediate cytotoxicity and produce cytokines after the ligation of a germline-encoded activation receptor.

The definition of the Absent natural killer cells is that Lack of natural killer cells, a type of lymphocyte in the innate immune system that contains cytoplasmic granzymes, i.e., small granules with perforin and proteases that allow natural killer cells to form pores in the cell membrane of the target cell through which the granzymes and associated molecules can enter, inducing apoptosis.

The definition of the Intrapulmonary hemorrhage is that Pulmonary hemorrhage is a bleeding within the lungs. Older children and adults may spit blood or bloody sputum. Neonates, infants and young children usually do not spit up blood. Anemia, pulmonary infiltrates, increasingling bloody return on BAL and the presence of hemosiderin-laden macrophages in broncho-alveolar lavage (BAL) fluid or lung biopsy can diagnose lung bleeding. Alveolar macrophages contain phagocytosed red blood cells and stain positive for hemosiderin, a product of hemoglobin degradation, after about 48-72 hours following pulmonary hemorraghe. Previous or recurrent bleeding can thus be distinguished from fresh events. A differentiation into local or diffuse is of importance. Also differentiate if pulmonary hemorrhage is due to a primary lung disorder or a manifestation of a systemic disease. [PMID:16473816]
The definition of the Abnormality of fibrinolysis is that Clincial phenotype characterized by delayed bleeding accelerated break down of blood clot (fibrinolysis) []
The definition of the Decrease in High molecular weight von Willebrand Factor Multimers is that A decrease in high molecular weight von Willebrand factor multimers. []
The definition of the Decreased level of heparin co-factor II is that An abnormality of coagulation related to a decreased concentration of heparin co-factor II []
The definition of the Decreased level of histidine-rich glycoprotein is that Decrease of these levels result in increased inhibition of fibrinolysis and reduced inhibition of coagulation []
The definition of the Decreased level of plasminogen is that A decreased level of Plasminogen []

The definition of the Decreased level of thrombomodulin is that Thrombomodulin is a cofactor in the thrombin induced activation of Protein C. In the case of deficiency there will be less Protein C and tendency to clot []

The definition of the Decreased level of tissue plasminogen activator is that The tPA protein catalyzes the conversion of plasiminogen to plasmin, and thus break down of clots. When there is a deficiency there will be an increase of thrombosis []

The definition of the Delayed onset bleeding is that Abnormal bleeding related to a procedure or trauma which does not start at the time of the initial insult, but after delay by at least 24 hours. []

The definition of the Factor XIII subunit A deficiency is that Deficiency of factor XIII subunit A, leading to a reduced factor XIII activity. Activated Factor XIII cross-links fibrin polymers solidifying the clot. []

The definition of the Factor XIII subunit B deficiency is that Deficiency of factor XIII subunit B, leading to a reduced factor XIII activity. Activated Factor XIII cross-links fibrin polymers solidifying the clot. []
The definition of the Leukocyte inclusion bodies is that The presence of intraceullar inclusion bodies (aggregates of stainable substances, usually proteins) in leukocytes. []
The definition of the Hyperfibrinolysis is that Increased degradation of fibrin, associated with clot instability and bleeding []
The definition of the Impaired neutrophil chemotaxis is that An impairment of the migration of neutrophils towards chemoattractants as part of the innate immune response []

The definition of the Increased plasma vitamin K epoxide after vitamin K supplementation is that Increased plasma vitamin K epoxide after vitamin K supplementation is present in VKCFD (vitamin K-dependent clotting factor deficiency) type 2, but not in VKCFD type 1. []

The definition of the Increased ratio of VWF propeptide to VWF antigen is that An increased VWF propeptide to VWF antigen indicates that deficiency of VWF is not due to impaired synthesis but due to rapid clearance. The VWF propeptide is measured by ELISA. []
The definition of the Increased RIPA is that Increased platelet agglutination in response to low-dose ristocetin []
The definition of the Muscle haemorrhage is that Bleeding occuring within a muscle [PMID:27231694]

The definition of the Prolonged euglobulin clot lysis time is that Abnormally increased length of time required for an in vitro clot to dissolve in the absence of the normal plasmin inhibitors. This test is a clinical assay used to measure fibrinolysis. The euglobulin fraction of plasma is precipitated and used to form clot by addition of thrombin; after clot forms the rate of clot breakdown (fibrinolysis) can be monitored. []
The definition of the Prolonged Russell's viper venom time is that Increased time to coagulation in the Russell's viper venom assay []
The definition of the Reduced alpha-2-antiplasmin activity is that Reduced activity of alpha-2-antiplasmin. This protein inactivates the protease plasmin that drives fibrinolysis. []
The definition of the Reduced antithrombin antigen is that Reduced antithrombin antigen. A reduced level of antithrombin may lead to an increased risk of thrombus formation. []

The definition of the Reduced euglobulin clot lysis time is that Abnormally decreased length of time required for an in vitro clot to dissolve in the absence of the normal plasmin inhibitors. This test is a clinical assay used to measure fibrinolysis. The euglobulin fraction of plasma is precipitated and used to form clot by addition of thrombin; after clot forms the rate of clot breakdown (fibrinolysis) can be monitored. []

The definition of the Reduced plasminogen activator inhibitor 1 activity is that Reduced activity of plasminogen activator inhibitor 1. This protein down-regulates fibrinolysis in the circulation by inhibiting the two major plasminogen activators: tissue-plasminogen activator and urokinase-plasminogen activator. []
The definition of the Reduced plasminogen activator inhibitor 1 antigen is that Reduced level of plasminogen activator inhibitor 1 antigen. []

The definition of the Reduced prothrombin antigen is that Reduced prothrombin antigen as measured by ELISA assay. Prothrombin is a vitamin K-dependent coagulation factor that is proteolytically cleaved to form thrombin. []
The definition of the Hand dimples is that A cutaneous indentation resulting from tethering of the skin to underlying structures (bone) of the hand.
The definition of the Glue ear is that Otitis media characterized by thick or sticky fluid behind the tympanic membrane.
The definition of the Hyperintensity of MRI T2 signal of the spinal cord is that A region of high intensity (brightness) observed upon magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) scans of the spinal cord.
The definition of the Adenocarcinoma of the intestines is that A malignant epithelial tumor with a glandular organization that originates in the intestines. []
The definition of the Adenocarcinoma of the small intestine is that A malignant epithelial tumor with a glandular organization that originates in the small intestine. []
The definition of the Adenocarcinoma of the large intestine is that A malignant epithelial tumor with a glandular organization that originates in the large intestine. []

The definition of the Prolactinoma is that A type of pituitary adenoma originating in prolactin secreting cells. This kind of adenoma is characterized by overproduction of prolactin, and may cause loss of menstrual periods and breast milk production in women.
The definition of the Abnormality of axial muscles is that A structural anomaly of the muscles of the trunk and head. []

The definition of the Nasogastric tube feeding is that The condition of inability to eat normally treated by placement of a thin tube through the nose into the stomach that is then used to carry food. [PMID:25874832]
The definition of the Cyclic neutropenia is that Recurrent episodes of abnormally low levels of neutrophils in the body (neutropenia).
The definition of the Abnormal location of the eyebrow is that Anomalous anatomical placement of the eyebrow. []

The definition of the Preauricular cyst is that Preauricular sinus is an occasional finding and most frequently appears as a small pit close to the anterior margin of the ascending portion of the helix. The opening has also been reported along the postero superior margin of the helix, the tragus or the lobule. Preauricular sinus may lead to the formation of a subcutaneous cyst that is intimately related to the tragal cartilage and the anterior crus of the helix. [PMID:24427573]
The definition of the Abnormal circulating free fatty acid level is that Any deviation from the normal concentration of a free fatty acid in the blood circulation. []
The definition of the Increased urinary glycerol is that An increased concentration of glycerol in the urine. []
The definition of the Hyperglycerolemia is that Increased concentration of glycerol in the blood. [PMID:23415440]
The definition of the Increased male libido is that Increased desire for sexual activity on the part of a male. []
The definition of the Decreased male libido is that Reduced desire for sexual activity on the part of a male. []

The definition of the Male sexual dysfunction is that A problem occurring during any phase of the male sexual response cycle that prevents the individual from experiencing satisfaction from the sexual activity [PMID:29532805]
The definition of the Male anorgasmia is that Inability of a male to reach orgasm. []
The definition of the Increased size of the mandible is that Abnormal prominence of the chin related to increased length of the mandible.
The definition of the Sterile arthritis is that An inflammatory arthritis characterized by purulent synovial fluid with neutrophil accumulation, but with negative cultures. []

The definition of the Symetrical distal arthritis is that Polyarthritis refers to a joint disease that involves at least five joints. One or more signs of inflammation, including pain, movement restriction, swelling, warmth, and redness, are seen in the joints involved. Polyarthritis is defined as symmetric if at least half of the joints involved are affected in a symmetric (i.e., both right and the left) fashion. [PMID:31657698]
The definition of the Oligoarthritis is that A type of arthritis that affects up to four joints in the first six months of disease. [PMID:14760812]
The definition of the Blind vagina is that The vagina ends in a blind pouch or sac rather than being connected to the internal genitalia.
The definition of the Tongue edema is that An abnormal accumulation of fluid and swelling in the tongue. []
The definition of the Blue urine is that An abnormal blue color of the urine. []
The definition of the Red urine is that An abnormal red color of the urine. []
The definition of the Dark urine is that An abnormal dark color of the urine. []
The definition of the Red-brown urine is that An abnormal red-brown color of the urine. []
The definition of the Dark yellow urine is that An abnormal dark-yellow color of the urine. []
The definition of the Purple urine is that An abnormal purple color of the urine. []
The definition of the Erythema of the eyelids is that Redness of the skin of the eyelids, caused by hyperemia of the capillaries in the lower layers of the skin. []
The definition of the Heliotrope rash is that In a heliotrope rash, the color of the skin turns to violet, which is the color of the heliotrope flower. []
The definition of the Bull's eye rash is that A cutaneous eruption that consists of multiple (at least two) concentric erythematous rings. []
The definition of the Hypoplasia of the olfactory bulb is that Underdevelopment of the olfactory bulb.
The definition of the Abnormal morphology of the olfactory bulb is that An abnormal morphology of the olfactory bulb (bulbus olfactorius), which is involved in olfaction, i.e. the sense of smell.
The definition of the Focal hyperintensity of cerebral white matter on MRI is that An abnormal area of increased brightness (hyperintensity) that is limited to one particular area. []
The definition of the Multifocal hyperintensity of cerebral white matter on MRI is that An abnormal area of increased brightness (hyperintensity) that occurs in several distinct areas. []

The definition of the Confluent hyperintensity of cerebral white matter on MRI is that Areas of brighter than expected MRI signal in the white matter of the brain whereby individual patches run together. [PMID:25636970]

The definition of the Neural tube defect is that A neural tube defect arises when the neural tube, the embryonic precursor of the brain and spinal cord, fails to close during neurulation. The cranial region (anencephaly) or the low spine (open spina bifida; myelomeningocele) are most commonly affected although, in the severe NTD craniorachischisis, almost the entire neural tube remains open, from midbrain to low spine.
The definition of the Gastric lymphoma is that Lymphoma that originates in the stomach itself. []

The definition of the HbS hemoglobin is that Presence of an abnormal type of hemoglobin characterized by the subsitution of a glutamic acid residue at position 7 following the initial methionine residue by a valine (the mutation causative of sickle cell disease). The mutation promotes the polymerization of the HbS under conditions of low oxygen concentration. HbS can be identified by multiple methodologies including hemoglobin electrophoresis and high-performance liquid chromatography.

The definition of the Increased HbA2 hemoglobin is that An elevated concentration in the blood of hemoglobin A2 (HbA2), which is a normal variant of hemoglobin A that consists of two alpha and two delta chains and is normally present at low levels in adults but may be increased in beta thalassemia.

The definition of the Abnormal DLCO is that An abnormal amount of oxygen passes into the blood from the lungs and/or an abnormal amount of carbon dioxide passes from the blood into the lungs. [PMID:32310609]
The definition of the Abnormality of the brachial nerve plexus is that Any abnormality of the brachial nerve plexus. []
The definition of the Abnormality of the lumbosacral nerve plexus is that Any abnormality of the lumbosacral nerve plexus. []

The definition of the Tiger tail banding is that An abnormal appearance of hair under polarizing microscopy (using crossed polarizers), whereby hair shafts show striking alternating bright and dark bands, often referred to as tiger tail banding. [PMID:15692466]
The definition of the Abnormality of the testis size is that An anomaly of the size of the testicle (the male gonad). []

The definition of the Hyperkeratotic papule is that A circumscribed, solid elevation of skin with no visible fluid, varying in size from a pinhead to less than 10mm in diameter at the widest point that is composed of localized hyperkeratosis (the latter may be demonstrated histopathologically). [PMID:3632007]
The definition of the Thin eyebrow is that Decreased diameter of eyebrow hairs. []
The definition of the Sparse eyebrow is that Decreased density/number of eyebrow hairs.
The definition of the Distal femoral metaphyseal irregularity is that Irregularity of the normally smooth surface of the distal metaphysis of the femur. []
The definition of the Decreased proportion of CD3-positive T cells is that Any abnormality in the proportion of CD3-positive T cells relative to the total number of T cells. []

The definition of the Abnormality of body mass index is that Anomaly in the weight-to-height squared ratio, calculated by dividing the individual's weight in kilograms by the square of the individual's height in meters and used as an indicator of obesity and underweight compared to averages. []

The definition of the Decreased body mass index is that Abnormally decreased weight-to-height squared ratio, calculated by dividing the individual's weight in kilograms by the square of the individual's height in meters and used as an indicator of underweight compared to averages. []
The definition of the Knee joint hypermobility is that The ability of the knee to move past its normal range of motion, (knee hyperextension is greater than 10 degrees).
The definition of the Early onset of sexual maturation is that An early onset of puberty, in this case early does not refer to precocious.

The definition of the Malignant mesothelioma is that Malignant mesothelioma is a form of cancer that originates from the cells of the mesothelium, a thin tissue layer surrounding the body's internal organs. Malignant mesothelioma is almost exclusively caused by asbestos exposure, pleural mesothelioma beeing the most common form, affecting the lining of the lungs called the pleura. Other forms such as perioneal-, percardial- or testicular- mesothelioma are much rarer.

The definition of the Pleural mesothelioma is that A malignant mesothelioma originating from cells of the pleura (the thin layer of mesothelium lining the lungs). Pleural mesothelioma is the most common form of mesothelioma.

The definition of the Peritoneal mesothelioma is that A Malignant mesothelioma originating from cells of the peritoneum (the thin layer of mesothelium lining the abdomen). Peritoneal mesothelioma is the second most common form of mesothelioma after pleural mesothelioma.
The definition of the Pericardial mesothelioma is that A Malignant mesothelioma originating from cells of the pericardium (the thin layer of mesothelium lining the heart).
The definition of the Testicular mesothelioma is that A Malignant mesothelioma of the testis.
The definition of the Neoplasm of the central nervous system is that A neoplasm of the central nervous system.
The definition of the Neoplasm of the peripheral nervous system is that A benign or malignant neoplasm (tumor) of the peripheral nervous system.
The definition of the Schwannoma is that A benign nerve sheath tumor composed of Schwann cells.
The definition of the Neoplasm of the eye is that A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the eye.
The definition of the Neoplasm of the breast is that A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the breast.

The definition of the Epiretinal membrane is that An epiretinal membrane is a thin sheet of fibrous tissue that can develop on the surface of the macular area of the retina and cause a disturbance in vision. An epiretinal membrane area can develop on the thin macular area of the retin. An epiretinal membrane is also sometimes called a macular pucker, premacular fibrosis, surface wrinkling retinopathy or cellophane maculopathy.
The definition of the Stahl ear is that The presence of a supernumerary, i.e. third, crus of the helix in the helix, arising at or above the normal bifurcation of the antihelix.

The definition of the Abnormality of the mesentery is that Folds of membranous tissue (peritoneum, mesothelium) attached to the wall of the abdomen and enclosing viscera. Examples include the mesentery for the small intestine; the transverse mesocolon, which attaches the transverse portion of the colon to the back wall of the abdomen; and the mesosigmoid, which enfolds the sigmoid portion of the colon. Cells of the same embryologic origin also surround the other organs of the body such as the lungs (pleura) or the heart (pericardium).
The definition of the Capsular cataract is that A cataract that affects the capsule of the lens.

The definition of the Nuclear cataract is that A nuclear cataract is an opacity or clouding that develops in the lens nucleus. That is, a nuclear cataract is one that is located in the center of the lens. The nucleus tends to darken changing from clear to yellow and sometimes brown.

The definition of the Cortical cataract is that A cataract which affects the layer of the lens surrounding the nucleus, i.e., the lens cortex. It is identified by its unique wedge or spoke appearance.
The definition of the Posterior capsular cataract is that A cataract which is found in the back outer layer of the lens. This type often develops more rapidly.

The definition of the Cerebral palsy is that Cerebral palsy describes a group of permanent disorders of the development of movement and posture, causing activity limitation, that are attributed to nonprogressive disturbances that occurred in the developing fetal or infant brain. The motor disorders of cerebral palsy are often accompanied by disturbances of sensation, perception, cognition, communication, and behaviour, by epilepsy, and by secondary musculoskeletal problems.
The definition of the Abnormality of movement is that An abnormality of movement with a neurological basis characterized by changes in coordination and speed of voluntary movements.
The definition of the Recurrent hand flapping is that A type of repetitive behavior in which the affected individual repeatedly waves the hands and/or arms rhythmically. []

The definition of the Conspicuously happy disposition is that An unusually happy demeanor over time, which can also be observed during inappropriate situations that should, for example, cause distress, fear, or anger. []

The definition of the Overfriendliness is that A form of hypersociability that presents as mostly inappropriate people-orientation and friendliness towards others on an inadequate level which might go as far as being dangerous considering for example young children following strangers without restriction. []
The definition of the Arteriovenous malformation is that An anomalous configuration of blood vessels that shunts arterial blood directly into veins without passing through the capillaries.
The definition of the Recurrent pancreatitis is that A recurrent form of pancreatitis.
The definition of the Ectopic thyroid is that Mislocalised thyroid gland.

The definition of the Lingual thyroid is that An aberrant thyroid gland or Ectopic thyroid located at the base of the tongue, just posterior to the foramen cecum as a result of a failure of the thyroid to descend.
The definition of the Accessory ectopic thyroid tissue is that Accessory ectopic thyroid tissue arising from remnants of the thyroglossal duct anywhere along the path of the thyroglossal duct tract.
The definition of the Neoplasm of the thyroid gland is that A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the thyroid gland.

The definition of the Tics is that Repeated, individually recognizable, intermittent movements or movement fragments that are almost always briefly suppressible and are usually associated with awareness of an urge to perform the movement. [PMID:20589866]
The definition of the Motor tics is that Movement-based tics affecting discrete muscle groups. []
The definition of the Phonic tics is that Involuntary sounds produced by moving air through the nose, mouth, or throat. The vocal cords are not involved in all tics that produce sound. []

The definition of the Pseudo-fractures is that A band of bone material of decreased density forming alongside the surface of the cortical bone with thickening of the periosteum. Callus formation in the affected area is common and gives the appearance of a false fracture.
The definition of the Abnormality of the scalp hair is that An abnormality of the hair of head.
The definition of the Slow-growing scalp hair is that Scalp hair whose growth is slower than normal.
The definition of the Thickened cortex of bones is that An Abnormality of cortical bone leading to an abnormal thickness of the cortex of affected bones.
The definition of the Broad 2nd toe is that A broad appearance of the second toe.
The definition of the Broad 3rd toe is that A broad appearance of the third toe.
The definition of the Broad 4th toe is that A broad appearance of the fourth toe.
The definition of the Broad 5th toe is that A broad appearance of the fifth toe.
The definition of the Ivory epiphyses of the 2nd toe is that Epiphyses of the 2nd toe are hard and dense like ivory. Such an epiphysis has a uniformly dense appearance on radiographs.
The definition of the Ivory epiphyses of the 3rd toe is that Epiphyses of the 3rd toe are hard and dense like ivory. Such an epiphysis has a uniformly dense appearance on radiographs.
The definition of the Ivory epiphyses of the 4th toe is that Epiphyses of the 4th toe are hard and dense like ivory. Such an epiphysis has a uniformly dense appearance on radiographs.
The definition of the Ivory epiphyses of the 5th toe is that Epiphyses of the 5th toe are hard and dense like ivory. Such an epiphysis has a uniformly dense appearance on radiographs.
The definition of the Abnormality of the pubic hair is that Abnormality of the growth of the pubic hair. Pubic hair is part of the secondary sexual hair, which normally ensues during puberty.

The definition of the Abnormality of the axillary hair is that Abnormality of the growth of the axillary hair. Axillary hair is part of the secondary sexual hair, which normally ensues during puberty.
The definition of the Fragmented epiphyses is that Fragmented appearance of the epiphyses.
The definition of the Synostosis involving bones of the upper limbs is that An abnormal union between bones or parts of bones of the upper limbs.
The definition of the Synostosis of joints is that The abnormal fusion of neighboring bones across a joint.

The definition of the Ectopic respiratory mucosa is that Ectopic respiratory epithelium presenting as a superficial lesion in the skin usually localised unilateral in the skin of the forearm and associated with ipsilateral hand malformations.

The definition of the Sarcoma is that A connective tissue neoplasm formed by proliferation of mesodermal cells. Bone and soft tissue sarcomas are the main types of sarcoma. Sarcoma is usually highly malignant.

The definition of the Leiomyosarcoma is that A smooth muscle connective tissue tumor, which is rare type of cancer that is a malignant neoplasm of smooth muscle. When such a neoplasm is benign, it is called a leiomyoma.

The definition of the Fibrosarcoma is that A fibroblastic sarcoma is a malignant tumor derived from fibrous connective tissue and characterized by immature proliferating fibroblasts or undifferentiated anaplastic spindle cells.

The definition of the Desmoid tumors is that Benign, slow-growing tumors without any metastatic potential. Despite their benign nature, they can damage nearby structures causing organ dysfunction. Histologically they resemble low-grade fibrosarcomas, but they are very locally aggressive and tend to recur even after complete resection. There is a tendency for recurrence in the setting of prior surgery and the most common localisation of these tumors is intraabdominal from smooth muscle cells of the instestine.

The definition of the Osteoma is that Osteomas are bony growths found most commonly on the skull and mandible; however, they may occur in any bone of the body. Osteomas do not usually cause clinical problems and do not become malignant.

The definition of the Recurrent singultus is that A contraction of the diaphragm that repeats several times per minute. In humans, the abrupt rush of air into the lungs causes the epiglottis to close, creating a hic sound. Also known as synchronous diaphragmatic flutter (SDF), or singultus, from the Latin singult, the act of catching one's breath while sobbing. The hiccup is an involuntary action involving a reflex arc.

The definition of the Hemiballismus is that Hemiballismus is a rare movement disorder that is caused primarily by damage to various areas in the basal ganglia. Hemiballismus is usually characterized by involuntary flinging motions of the extremities. The movements are often violent and have wide amplitudes of motion. They are continuous and random and can involve proximal and/or distal muscles on one side of the body, while some cases even include the facial muscles. The more a patient is active, the more the movements increase. With relaxation comes a decrease in movements.
The definition of the Calcification of muscles is that Deposition of calcium salts in muscle tissue.
The definition of the Meningeal calcification is that Calcium deposition affecting the Meninges.

The definition of the Abnormality of the medullary cavity of the long bones is that An abnormality of the medullary cavity (medulla, innermost part), which is the central cavity of bone shafts where red bone marrow and/or yellow bone marrow (adipose tissue) is stored.
The definition of the Metaphyseal dysplasia is that The presence of dysplastic regions in metaphyseal regions.
The definition of the Senile plaques is that Senile plaques are extracellular deposits of amyloid in the gray matter of the brain.

The definition of the Ectrodactyly is that A condition in which middle parts of the hands and/or feet (digits and meta-carpals and -tarsals) are missing giving a cleft appearance. The severity is very variable ranging from slightly hypoplastic 3rd toe/fingers over absent 2nd or 3rd toes/fingers as far as oligo- or monodactyl hands and/or feet.
The definition of the Preaxial polydactyly is that A form of polydactyly in which the extra digit or digits are localized on the side of the thumb or great toe.
The definition of the Postaxial polydactyly is that A form of polydactyly in which the extra digit or digits are localized on the side of the fifth finger or fifth toe.

The definition of the Mesoaxial polydactyly is that The presence of a supernumerary finger or toe (not a thumb or hallux) involving the third or fourth metacarpal/tarsal with associated osseous syndactyly. [PMID:19125433]
The definition of the Abnormal tendon morphology is that An abnormality of the structure or form of the tendons, also often called sinews.

The definition of the Synostosis of carpals/tarsals is that The carpus consists of the scaphoid, lunate, triquetal, pisiform, captitate, hamate, trapezoid, and trapezium bones. The tarsus consists of the talus, calcaneus, cuboid, cuneiform, and navicular bones. This term applies if there is any fusion among the bones of the carpus or tarsus.
The definition of the Lip pit is that A depression located on a lip.
The definition of the Upper lip pit is that Depression located on the vermilion of the upper lip, usually paramedian.
The definition of the Paramedian lip pit is that Depression located paramedially on the vermilion of a lip.

The definition of the Abnormality of dorsoventral patterning of the limbs is that An abnormality resulting from a defect or disruption of dorsoventral patterning that normally happens during early development of the limbs. A disruption of the normal development of the dorsoventral axis may lead to a variable spectrum of different phenotypic abnormalities that may affect the nails and or palmar and dorsal side of the hands and/or feet, ultimately changing the normal dorsoventral appearance of the affected limbs.
The definition of the Hyponasal speech is that Hyponasal speech is when there is an abnormally reduced nasal airflow during speech often in a setting of nasal obstruction or congestion.

The definition of the Branchial sinus is that A congenital branchial sinus is a remnant of the embryonic branchial arches and their intervening clefts and pouches that has failed to regress completely. Sinuses typically have their external orifice inferior to the ramus of the mandible. They may traverse the parotid gland, and run in close vicinity to the facial nerve in the external auditory canal.

The definition of the Gustatory lacrimation is that Gustatory lacrimation results from an aberrant innervation of fibres from the seventh cranial nerve to the pterygopalatine ganglion which are destined originally for the submandibular ganglion. This aberrant innervation leads to uncontrollable tearing while eating or in anticipation of a meal.
The definition of the Diffuse cerebellar atrophy is that Diffuse unlocalised atrophy affecting the cerebellum.
The definition of the Periauricular skin pits is that Benign congenital lesions of the periauricular soft tissue consisting of a blind-ending narrow tube or pit.

The definition of the Ulcerative colitis is that A chronic inflammatory bowel disease that includes characteristic ulcers, or open sores, in the colon. The main symptom of active disease is usually constant diarrhea mixed with blood, of gradual onset and intermittent periods of exacerbated symptoms contrasting with periods that are relatively symptom-free. In contrast to Crohn's disease this special form of colitis begins in the distal parts of the rectum, spreads continually upwards and affects only mucose and submucose tissue of the colon.

The definition of the Crohn's disease is that A chronic granulomatous inflammatory disease of the intestines that may affect any part of the gastrointestinal tract from mouth to anus, causing a wide variety of symptoms. It primarily causes abdominal pain, diarrhea which may be bloody, vomiting, or weight loss, but may also cause complications outside of the gastrointestinal tract such as skin rashes, arthritis, inflammation of the eye, tiredness, and lack of concentration. Crohn's disease is thought to be an autoimmune disease, in which the body's immune system attacks the gastrointestinal tract, causing inflammation.
The definition of the Chronic colitis is that A chronic inflammatory disease of the large intestine (colon, cecum and rectum).
The definition of the Acute colitis is that An acute and self-limited inflammatory disease of the large intestine (colon, cecum and rectum).
The definition of the EMG: continuous motor unit activity at rest is that Continuous electromyographic activity of motor units at rest, i.e., without voluntary movement of the muscles.

The definition of the EMG: myotonic discharges is that High frequency discharges in electromyography (EMG) that vary in amplitude and frequency, waxing and waning continuously with firing frequencies ranging from 150/second down to 20/second and producing a sound that has been referred to as a dive bomber sound.

The definition of the EMG: impaired neuromuscular transmission is that An electromyographic finding associated with erratic or absent neuromuscular transmission with erratic, moment-to-moment changes in the shape of the motor unit potential (MUP).
The definition of the EMG: slow motor conduction is that The presence of reduced conduction velocity of motor nerves on electromyography.

The definition of the EMG: myokymic discharges is that The presence of spontaneous bursts of rapidly firing potentials that recur at regular intervals of 2-10 per second and are unaffected by voluntary effort. This is an electromyographic (EMG) finding.
The definition of the Amyloidosis of peripheral nerves is that The presence of amyloid deposition in the nerves of the peripheral nervous system.

The definition of the Muscle fiber tubular inclusions is that Unusual regions of densely packed membranous tubules known as tubular aggregates which present as membranous inclusions, derived from membranes of sarcoplasmic reticulum and mitochondria, containing miscellaneous proteins with a variety of enzymatic activities.

The definition of the Muscle fiber cytoplasmatic inclusion bodies is that The presence of inclusion bodies within the cytoplasm of muscle cells. Inclusion bodies are aggregates (deposits) or stainable material, usually misfolded proteins.

The definition of the Muscle fiber intranuclear inclusion bodies is that The presence of inclusion bodies within the nucleus of muscle cells. Inclusion bodies are aggregates (deposits) or stainable material, usually misfolded proteins.

The definition of the Ring fibers is that Ring fibers are formed by a bundle of peripheral myofibrils which are circumferentially oriented such that they encircle the internal portion of the sarcoplasm which is normal in structure and orientation.

The definition of the Cerebral cortical hemiatrophy is that Atrophy of one side of the brain, characterized by findings including thinning of the cerebral cortex, reduced volume of the cerebral white matter with abnormal myelination, and enlargement of the ispilateral fourth ventricle.
The definition of the Subdural hemorrhage is that Hemorrhage occurring between the dura mater and the arachnoid mater.
The definition of the Epidural hemorrhage is that Hemorrhage occurring between the dura mater and the skull.
The definition of the Cerebral germinoma is that The presence of a germ cell tumor of the cerebrum.

The definition of the Cerebral granulomatosis is that Cerebral inflammation involving a granulomatous response, i.e., a non-specific inflammatory response involving granulomas, defined as a compact organized collection of mature mononuclear phagocytes including epithelioid and giant cells.
The definition of the Cerebral inclusion bodies is that Nuclear or cytoplasmic aggregates of stainable substances within cells of the brain.
The definition of the Hirano bodies is that Intracellular aggregates of actin and actin-associated proteins within nerve cells.
The definition of the Agyrophilic inclusion bodies is that Presence of abundant argyrophilic grains and coiled bodies on microscopic examination of brain tissue.
The definition of the Lafora bodies is that An intraneuronal inclusion body composed of acid mucopolysaccharides.
The definition of the Cerebral hyaline bodies is that Cerebral eosinophilic, discrete, intracytoplasmatic inclusions of unknown significance.

The definition of the Rosenthal fibres is that Thick, elongated, worm-like or corkscrew eosinophilic bundle that are found on H&E staining of the brain in the presence of long standing gliosis, occasional tumors, and some metabolic disorders.
The definition of the Abnormality of the dentate nucleus is that An abnormality of the dentate nucleus.

The definition of the Juvenile aseptic necrosis is that Juvenile aseptic necrosis comprises a group of orthopedic diseases characterized by interruption of the blood supply of a bone, followed by localized bony necrosis most often of the epiphyses of bones of children or teenagers.
The definition of the Scleroderma is that A chronic autoimmune phenomenon characterized by fibrosis (or hardening) and vascular alterations of the skin.
The definition of the Cow milk allergy is that Hypersensitivity in form of an adverse immune reaction against cow milk protein.
The definition of the Carpometacarpal synostosis is that Fusion involving carpal and metacarpal bones.
The definition of the Unilateral cleft lip is that A non-midline cleft of the upper lip on one side only.
The definition of the Non-midline cleft lip is that Clefting of the upper lip affecting the lateral portions of the upper lip rather than the midline/median region.
The definition of the Bilateral cleft lip is that A non-midline cleft of the upper lip on the left and right sides.
The definition of the Bilateral cleft palate is that Nonmidline cleft palate on the left and right sides.
The definition of the Contracture of the proximal interphalangeal joint of the 2nd toe is that The proximal interphalangeal joint of the 2nd toe cannot be straightened actively or passively.

The definition of the Contracture of the proximal interphalangeal joint of the 3rd toe is that The proximal interphalangeal joint of the 3rd toe cannot be straightened actively or passively. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:UToronto_htrang]
The definition of the Contracture of the proximal interphalangeal joint of the 4th toe is that The proximal interphalangeal joint of the 4th toe cannot be straightened actively or passively.
The definition of the Contractures of the proximal interphalangeal joint of the 5th toe is that The proximal interphalangeal joint of the fifth toe cannot be straightened actively or passively.
The definition of the Contracture of the distal interphalangeal joint of the 2nd toe is that The distal interphalangeal joint of the 2nd toe cannot be straightened actively or passively.
The definition of the Contracture of the distal interphalangeal joint of the 3rd toe is that The distal interphalangeal joint of the 3rd toe cannot be straightened actively or passively.
The definition of the Contracture of the distal interphalangeal joint of the 4th toe is that The distal interphalangeal joint of the 4th toe cannot be straightened actively or passively.
The definition of the Contractures of the distal interphalangeal joint of the 5th toe is that The distal interphalangeal joint of the 5th toe cannot be straightened actively or passively.

The definition of the Contracture of the metatarsophalangeal joint of the 2nd toe is that The joint between the second metatarsal and the proximal phalanx of the 2nd toe cannot be straightened actively or passively.

The definition of the Contracture of the metatarsophalangeal joint of the 3rd toe is that The joint between the third metatarsal and the proximal phalanx of the third toe cannot be straightened actively or passively.

The definition of the Contracture of the metatarsophalangeal joint of the 4th toe is that The joint between the fourth metatarsal and the proximal phalanx of the fourth toe cannot be straightened actively or passively.

The definition of the Contracture of the metatarsophalangeal joint of the 5th toe is that The joint between the fifth metatarsal and the proximal phalanx of the fifth toe cannot be straightened actively or passively.
The definition of the Short phalanx of the 3rd toe is that Developmental hypoplasia of the phalanx of third toe.
The definition of the Short phalanx of the 4th toe is that Developmental hypoplasia of one or more phalanx of fourth toe.
The definition of the Short phalanx of the 5th toe is that Developmental hypoplasia of one or more phalanx of little toe.
The definition of the aplasia/hypoplasia of the proximal phalanx of the 3rd toe is that Absence (agenesis) or underdevelopment of the proximal phalanx of the 3rd toe.
The definition of the aplasia/hypoplasia of the proximal phalanx of the 4th toe is that Absence (agenesis) or underdevelopment of the proximal phalanx of the 4th toe.
The definition of the aplasia/hypoplasia of the proximal phalanx of the 5th toe is that Absence (agenesis) or underdevelopment of the proximal phalanx of the 5th toe.
The definition of the Absent distal phalanx of the 3rd toe is that Developmental aplasia of the distal phalanx of third toe.
The definition of the Absent middle phalanx of the 3rd toe is that Developmental aplasia of the middle phalanx of third toe.
The definition of the Absent proximal phalanx of the 3rd toe is that Absence of proximal phalanx of third toe, owing to a congenital defect of development.
The definition of the Short distal phalanx of the 3rd toe is that Developmental hypoplasia of the distal phalanx of third toe.
The definition of the Short distal phalanx of the 4th toe is that Developmental hypoplasia of the distal phalanx of fourth toe.
The definition of the Short distal phalanx of the 5th toe is that Developmental hypoplasia of the distal phalanx of little toe.
The definition of the Short middle phalanx of the 3rd toe is that Developmental hypoplasia of the middle phalanx of third toe.
The definition of the Short middle phalanx of the 4th toe is that Developmental hypoplasia of the middle phalanx of fourth toe.
The definition of the Short middle phalanx of the 5th toe is that Developmental hypoplasia of the middle phalanx of the 5th toe.
The definition of the Short proximal phalanx of the 3rd toe is that Abnormal reduction in length of proximal phalanx of third toe.
The definition of the Short proximal phalanx of the 4th toe is that Developmental hypoplasia of the proximal phalanx of fourth toe.
The definition of the Short proximal phalanx of the 5th toe is that Developmental hypoplasia of the proximal phalanx of fifth toe.
The definition of the Duplication of the distal phalanx of the 3rd toe is that Partial or complete duplication of distal phalanx of third toe.
The definition of the Duplication of the distal phalanx of the 4th toe is that Partial or complete duplication of the distal phalanx of fourth toe.
The definition of the Duplication of the distal phalanx of the 5th toe is that Partial or complete duplication of the distal phalanx of little toe.
The definition of the Duplication of the middle phalanx of the 3rd toe is that Partial or complete duplication of middle phalanx of third toe.
The definition of the Duplication of the middle phalanx of the 4th toe is that Partial or complete duplication of middle phalanx of fourth toe.
The definition of the Duplication of the middle phalanx of the 5th toe is that Partial or complete duplication of the middle phalanx of the 5th toe.

The definition of the Duplication of the proximal phalanx of the 4th toe is that Partial or complete duplication of the proximal phalanx of fourth toe.
The definition of the Duplication of the proximal phalanx of the 5th toe is that Partial or complete duplication of the proximal phalanx of fifth toe.
The definition of the Complete duplication of the distal phalanx of the 3rd toe is that Complete duplication of distal phalanx of third toe.
The definition of the Complete duplication of the distal phalanx of the 4th toe is that Complete duplication of the distal phalanx of fourth toe.
The definition of the Complete duplication of the distal phalanx of the 5th toe is that Complete duplication of the distal phalanx of little toe.

The definition of the Complete duplication of the proximal phalanx of the 5th toe is that Complete duplication of the proximal phalanx of fifth toe.

The definition of the Partial duplication of the middle phalanx of the 5th toe is that Partial duplication of the middle phalanx of the 5th toe.
The definition of the Partial duplication of the proximal phalanx of the 3rd toe is that Partial duplication of proximal phalanx of third toe.
The definition of the Partial duplication of the proximal phalanx of the 5th toe is that Partial duplication of the proximal phalanx of fifth toe.

The definition of the Bullet-shaped middle phalanx of the 3rd toe is that An abnormal morphology of the middle phalanx of the third toe, with a short and wide phalanx that tapers distally. Bullet-shaped phalanges lack the normal diaphyseal constriction.

The definition of the Bullet-shaped middle phalanx of the 4th toe is that An abnormal morphology of the middle phalanx of the fourth toe, with a short and wide phalanx that tapers distally. Bullet-shaped phalanges lack the normal diaphyseal constriction.

The definition of the Bullet-shaped middle phalanx of the 5th toe is that An abnormal morphology of the middle phalanx of the fifth toe, with a short and wide phalanx that tapers distally. Bullet-shaped phalanges lack the normal diaphyseal constriction.

The definition of the Bullet-shaped proximal phalanx of the 3rd toe is that An abnormal morphology of the proximal phalanx of the third toe, with a short and wide phalanx that tapers distally. Bullet-shaped phalanges lack the normal diaphyseal constriction.

The definition of the Bullet-shaped proximal phalanx of the 4th toe is that An abnormal morphology of the proximal phalanx of the fourth toe, with a short and wide phalanx that tapers distally. Bullet-shaped phalanges lack the normal diaphyseal constriction.

The definition of the Bullet-shaped proximal phalanx of the 5th toe is that An abnormal morphology of the proximal phalanx of the fifth toe, with a short and wide phalanx that tapers distally. Bullet-shaped phalanges lack the normal diaphyseal constriction.

The definition of the Bullet-shaped distal phalanx of the 3rd toe is that An abnormal morphology of the distal phalanx of the third toe, with a short and wide phalanx that tapers distally. Bullet-shaped phalanges lack the normal diaphyseal constriction.

The definition of the Bullet-shaped distal phalanx of the 4th toe is that An abnormal morphology of the distal phalanx of the fourth toe, with a short and wide phalanx that tapers distally. Bullet-shaped phalanges lack the normal diaphyseal constriction.

The definition of the Bullet-shaped distal phalanx of the 5th toe is that An abnormal morphology of the distal phalanx of the fifth toe, with a short and wide phalanx that tapers distally. Bullet-shaped phalanges lack the normal diaphyseal constriction.
The definition of the Curved middle phalanx of the 3rd toe is that A deviation from the normal straight form of the middle phalanx of the third toe.
The definition of the Curved middle phalanx of the 4th toe is that A deviation from the normal straight form of the middle phalanx of the fourth toe.
The definition of the Curved middle phalanx of the 5th toe is that A deviation from the normal straight form of the middle phalanx of the fifth toe.
The definition of the Curved proximal phalanx of the 3rd toe is that A deviation from the normal straight form of the proximal phalanx of the third toe.
The definition of the Curved proximal phalanx of the 4th toe is that A deviation from the normal straight form of the proximal phalanx of the fourth toe.
The definition of the Curved proximal phalanx of the 5th toe is that A deviation from the normal straight form of the proximal phalanx of the fifth toe.
The definition of the Curved distal phalanx of the 3rd toe is that A deviation from the normal straight form of the distal phalanx of the third toe.
The definition of the Curved distal phalanx of the 4th toe is that A deviation from the normal straight form of the distal phalanx of the fourth toe.
The definition of the Curved distal phalanx of the 5th toe is that A deviation from the normal straight form of the distal phalanx of the fifth toe.

The definition of the Patchy sclerosis of the middle phalanx of the 4th toe is that Uneven increase in bone density of the middle phalanx of the fourth toe. This can take on many forms depending on severity and distribution as can be seen on x-rays.

The definition of the Patchy sclerosis of the middle phalanx of the 5th toe is that Uneven increase in bone density of the middle phalanx of the fifth toe. This can take on many forms depending on severity and distribution as can be seen on x-rays.

The definition of the Patchy sclerosis of the proximal phalanx of the 4th toe is that Uneven increase in bone density of the proximal phalanx of the fourth toe. This can take on many forms depending on severity and distribution as can be seen on x-rays.

The definition of the Patchy sclerosis of the proximal phalanx of the 5th toe is that Uneven increase in bone density of the proximal phalanx of the fifth toe. This can take on many forms depending on severity and distribution as can be seen on x-rays.

The definition of the Patchy sclerosis of the distal phalanx of the 4th toe is that Uneven increase in bone density of the distal phalanx of the fourth toe. This can take on many forms depending on severity and distribution as can be seen on x-rays.

The definition of the Patchy sclerosis of the distal phalanx of the 5th toe is that Patchy (irregular) increase in bone density of the distal phalanx of the fifth toe. This can take on many forms depending on severity and distribution as can be seen on x-rays.
The definition of the Proximal/middle symphalangism of 3rd toe is that Bony fusion of the middle and proximal phalanges of the 3rd toe.
The definition of the Proximal/middle symphalangism of 4th toe is that Bony fusion of the middle and proximal phalanges of the 4th toe.
The definition of the Proximal/middle symphalangism of 5th toe is that Bony fusion of the middle and proximal phalanges of the 5th toe.
The definition of the Proximal/middle symphalangism of 2nd toe is that Bony fusion of the middle and proximal phalanges of the 2nd toe.

The definition of the Camptodactyly of finger is that The distal interphalangeal joint and/or the proximal interphalangeal joint of the fingers cannot be extended to 180 degrees by either active or passive extension.
The definition of the Hypoammonemia is that A decreased concentration of ammonia in the blood. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:gcarletti]

The definition of the Abnormality of mast cells is that Any structural anomaly of mast cells, which are found in almost all tissues and contain numerous basophilic granules and are capable of releasing large amounts of histamine and heparin upon activation.
The definition of the Mastocytosis is that The presence of an increased number of mast cells and CD34+ mast cell precursors in the body.
The definition of the Recurrent bronchiolitis is that An increased susceptibility to bronchiolitis as manifested by a history of recurrent bronchiolitis.
The definition of the Folate deficiency is that A reduced circulating concentration of folic acid, which is also known as vitamin B9.
The definition of the Pollakisuria is that Increased frequency of urination.
The definition of the Neoplasm of the ureter is that The presence of a neoplasm of the ureter.
The definition of the Neoplasm of the urethra is that The presence of a neoplasm of the urethra.
The definition of the Dysuria is that Painful or difficult urination.
The definition of the Anuria is that Absence of urine, clinically classified as below 50ml/day.
The definition of the Oliguria is that Low output of urine, clinically classified as an output below 300-500ml/day.
The definition of the Neoplasm of the thymus is that A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the thymus.
The definition of the Thymoma is that A tumor originating from the epithelial cells of the thymus.
The definition of the Liver abscess is that A circumscribed area of pus or necrotic debris in the liver.

The definition of the Urachus fistula is that Persistence of the urachal canal with drainage of urine from the bladder through the persistent allantois canal to the umbilicus. [HPO_CONTRIBUTOR:Eurenomics_ewuehl]
The definition of the Neoplasm of the lungs is that Tumor of the lung.

The definition of the Pleuropulmonary blastoma is that A rare cancer originating in the lung or pleural cavity that occurs most often in infants and young children but also has been reported in adults. Pleuropulmonary blastoma is regarded as malignant.
The definition of the Abnormality of phosphate homeostasis is that An abnormality of phosphate homeostasis or concentration in the body.
